text: We went last night finally after craving some barbeque for weeks.  Overall, our experience was awesome.  We had an awesome server, Cliff, who gave us his suggestions and was pretty entertaining.  We took Cliff's suggestion and got the Combo platter since we were newbs.  We ordered the brisket, ribs and doubled up on the pork bbq.  For our sides we got mac n cheese and fries.  Everything was really great.  The ribs were probably our least favorite, but they still tasted great.. just not as tender as we were hoping!  Pretty good beer selection and great service.  We'll be back!

best bbq in charlotte..... bacon wrapped jalepenos were just alright though. bacon seemed a little on the chewy side, possibly just a preference. hushpuppies awesome. baked beans awesome. also, they have great ice.   service was wonderful, friendly, energetic

Great bbq just outside the city.  Great atmosphere but they have very limited table seating and parties of 5 or more can only sit at the high top tables. (at least that's what we were told) I've dined at countless bbq restaurants and have made great bbq for 15 years and every place is different.  I will tell you this about Midwood:  it is true SMOKEY bbq.  If you like your bbq on the sweeter side and not as smokey, this place is NOT for you.  Personally, I appreciate most styles and tend to make my own this same way so I found it pretty tasty.  The Cuban sandwich was great also as were the sides.

My favorite barbeque in Charlotte.  If you had asked me a few months ago, I would have only rated it a 3...because they had removed the smoked, creamed corn from the menu for a while.  It is back and I love it!  My favorite time is to swing by after church (Calvary Church...shameless plug) when the Panthers are playing.  I enjoy the first half of the game with my family and then head home at half time!    My favorite dish is their smoked brisket with collard greens.  Get their pepper sauce!  If the color is bright...it is new and not too hot, but if you want good flavor, look for the more muted colors.  They have at least 3 types of hot pepper in the sauce, which makes for a yummy taste.  The brisket is tender and smoky, and really does not need sauce, but the sauce is tasty too.    The bacon wrapped jalapenos vary in heat...be warned...sometimes you will get a tasty one that seems mild, and then sometimes you will get a heat bite...still tasty, but be aware.  Oh, and the pecan "cobbler" is rich and yummy...plan on rolling out of there if you get that.  It is football season, see you there.

To be frank I am in love with Midwood smokehouse.  My wife and I went on our first date here, it's the first restaurant I bring family/friends to when visiting, and it's the first words out of my mouth when somebody asks where to go for BBQ.    I always get the giant platter with a nice portion of everything on it.  I kid you not I can usually feed a couple of people with the leftovers.  The Brisket and the ribs are the stars of the show but everything else is fantastic as well.  The sides are great and I don't think I can ever get my fill of bacon wrapped jalapenos and hushpuppies. Thinking of the warm evenings I've spent eating in the outdoor section with a bourbon, giant plate of bbq, watching the sun go down is keeping me warm this winter! Are you still reading this?  Get your butt over to midwood!

I had the Pimento Cheese Fries, Burnt Ends and fries. The pimento cheese was bland and didn't add anything to the fries. I honestly could've done without it. Burnt Ends were a different experience. I liked the idea of crispy brisket, but half of the cubes were partially fat and there didn't seem to be enough flavor in the BBQ Sauce. They were alright, but i don't think i would order them again. The beer specials were good and the service was excellent. No complaints there.

OMG the brisket is so good. Midwood has somehow figured out how to smoke. The food we had was very good and the brisket was a highlight for sure. The mac n cheese was also incredible. Local craft beers on tap and all in all a great place for some meat and sides that were very well done.

Just now getting to doing a review! Was in Charlotte for the day of meetings and managed to grab lunch. What a treat!!! Food and service were spot on. We had the bacon wrapped jalapeños ... Delicious! Followed by chicken/rib combo... So good. Will definitely be back when in Charlotte!

I ordered takeout from Midwood and was so disappointed. It was awful. The pork tasted like someone had poured liquid smoke over it and it was dry. The sides were not good either! I actually threw away the entire meal and ate a pb&j at home. I was so disappointed because I had heard great things!

So far the best we have found in Charlotte.  Pulled pork is cooked and seasoned just right!  Don't miss the fried pickles and save room for the pecan cobbler.  Warm pecan cobbler is amazing and worth every calorie!!  Atmosphere is fun, great outdoor seating for when the weather is warm.
So much food!!!! OMG.. we went for my sister's b-day and I don't think any of us could move after. Great service, fun staff.. tons of food and yumm-o desserts!
this has got to be the greatest bbq in charlotte nc. from the food to the staff, this place is the best..... been here several times and never disappointed.  a must try
AMAZING BBQ! Glad my friend recommended this place. Got a few "pig outs" for our group and was not disappointed.  Better than a Chase Utley Home run in September. It's Cadillac time!

This place is the bomb!! I love their food! I've gotten take out during the holidays, and I ate in yesterday. Service was excellent! Tom was very knowledgeable and patient, explaining sauces & flavors easily from food to drinks. He was very thoughtful and I can't wait to go back. Even though they were busy, the food came not and timely. The 1/2 roasted chicken, brisket, chopped salad, Mac & cheese, greens, and hushpuppies were fantastic! I just enjoyed it all. However, the banana pudding although tasty didnt seem fresh. The bananas were already gray/brown and slightly slimey...um, yall need to fix that ASAP lol- That's the only reason its not 5 stars. I will absolutely be back!

We decided to check this place, after the reviews .  Hubby and I shared the combination  pick 4 items and 2 sides.  St Louis ribs, pulled pork, brisket and smoked sausage with mac and cheese and bacon  jalapenos.  The ribs was delish ! I could not believe how much meat was on them.  Everything was very tasty.  Our server was very good in helping us decide.  Nice place !.

A great neighborhood option for barbecue. They offer a little bit of everything for everyone--no matter where you fall on the great NC sauce debate (red or vinegar) or SC mustard-style. The pulled pork and the pork ribs are my favorites here. There are good beer options. Standout sides are hushpuppies and mac and cheese. The slaw is only OK, but to me, slaw is essential for barbecue. This is why I wish the small plates came with two sides. The sweet pickled onions are a nice touch. There is a reason it sometimes gets crowded.
The burn ends looks very ugly,like black rocks on a plate. But it tastes very good! Crispy outter layer and juicy inside. Worth to try! The side of creamy corn is also very good!

5 stars for the food. 1 star for the service. Multiple tables that arrived and ordered after us got their food 10 minutes before us. The server ignored us and kept going to other tables. The managers excuses were annoying too. She said because we ordered grilled items they take longer but how did it take my medium burger 10 minutes longer than the 3 well done burgers ordered by the ladies sitting next to us that came in 10 minutes after us.Then the manager offered us desserts and said she had already let the server know. He never asked us what desserts we wanted and I had to flag down the manager to take care of us.

Pretty good! We were on the prowl for quality 'cue and chose to visit Midwood Smokehouse. Our server was friendly and prompt and made good recommendations. We got half price local beers--the Bad Penny is a Tasty Deal--and split the "Choose 4" platter between the two of us with a few bites to spare. With three beers and lunch for two, it was $30 (not incl. tip). A fair deal!  I'm not always a sausage fan, but their version is packed with flavor and nice and moist. I also can't stand mustard, but I swear this version with the sausage tasted like tangy cream sauce. The beef brisket was one of the more tender, flavorful versions I've had, and paired with their brown sugary house sauce, all I can compare it to is Christmas.  Mac n' cheese was just dandy, and the fries were hot and crispy.   Hush puppies were well done, but would have been phenomenal with a side of honey.  All in all, a good barbecue place we will visit again.
Excellent bbq especially the brisket burnt ends and don't forget the pecan cobbler.  Food and service were great.  A very good dinner

This was our first stop of our BBQ weekend in the Carolinas and it didn't disappoint us.  We ordered the well-fed BBQ combo and was worried we might not have enough food, but by the time when we leave, we're indeed very much well-fed. We ordered ribs, brisket, pulled chicken and chopped pork. In one word, delicious! or in two words, not disappointed! We even ordered some extra meats to take with us. It's a long drive from home, but we will visit the place again.

I have been to Midwood a few times now and have never been disappointed. Service is always nice, atmosphere is pleasant. But the ribs! Om nom nom. We always share the big combo that has a variety of meats and two sides. My favorite is the ribs, tasty without any sauce and falling off the bone. Macaroni and cheese is always perfect as well.  For dessert, the banana pudding is a good option.   Overall, always a good choice for barbeque.
Love the decor. The service was excellent and all the good was great! Prices were reasonable also. Have gone before and will come back often.
Went tonight for the pre-opening. Wait staff very professional and eager to please. Food delicious.

Been here 5 or 6 times since I moved to Charlotte last year. As a lover of 'cue who has traveled all over the south in search of the choice stuff, I've actually been kinda disappointed with the clt bbq scene overall.  But midwood smokehouse holds its own.  I mean, it's no 12-Bones (outta Asheville), but you'll leave happy enough.  The ribs are quite good, as is the pulled pork and brisket (I like a mix of lean and fatty).  Sausage was only alright, and I'd steer clear of the KC burnt ends, normally one of my favorites, but which were too tough and bland for my liking (lacking that sharp bark-y zing). Sides are solid: mac and cheese, beans, Carolina slaw, and bacon-wrapped cheesy jalapeños for the m'fin WIN!  Also has pretty good beer list, especially if you like NC and Southeastern craft brews.

Amazing!!!  Just want to start off and say this was an amazing experience and BBQ.  In Charlotte one night, I had to pick right or I risked having a bad foodie experience in Charlotte.  I did it!  Sydney was our waitress and she was awesome!  Super friendly and took the time to educate my coworker and myself on North Carolina BBQ.  We even met Jenn, one of the managers there who was kind enough to show us the Smoker and explained how all the magic works.  That was awesome!   Lastly, I ordered the following: Carolina Shredded Pork & BBQ Chicken, Brisket, and St. Louis Style ribs, ALL were fantastic and my coworker and I would definitely order ALL of them again.  A must have, is there creamed corn, so good!  Midwood Smokehouse is right up there with ALL the GREAT BBQ smokehouses in the country!! I recommend making Midwood Smokehouse a destination when you are in Charlotte!

I was never a huge fan of barbecue before coming here. Now I am. The sweet potato fries were forgettable but the small bbq plate I had was a generous portion, reasonable price, and the most tender, flavorful barbecue I have ever had. I Will most definitely be coming back here. Parking was an issue at lunch so maybe try to come at a less busy time,

This is another totally overrated BBQ place.  How is it that few in this town have experienced really succulent ribs with a dry rub?  I had a brisket sandwich...barely passable.  Maybe customers at Midwood should eat first, to really taste the food, then drink their spirits to help them forget they just overpaid for mediocre BBQ.  In case you think I'm wrong-take a drive up to Saluda, NC It just 90 minutes west of here-there's a place called Green River BBQ   Their brisket sandwich is as good as great sex!  It's a hole in the wall, been there for years, owned and operated by a woman who cares about the food, the service, the customer.

Enjoyed it very much! One of my favorite bbqs in town!  I had been meaning to eat at this place sooner, but every time I would drive by, there was a ton of people outside waiting to get in or no place to park. Then I saw on TV that Obama and Hilary Clinton had stopped in so I knew then I had to check it out! So we headed there at about 5pm on a Saturday.   I had the dry rub ribs with sweet potato fries and a side of sliced brisket. He had the pulled pork with a side of burned ends. We specifically asked for side of just meat because we didn't want to make another full plate that came with more side items like fries, etc. So this is the easiest way if you want to sample the different types of meats they offer. Also, it wasn't expensive to add this on (something like $5 each).   I thought the price was excellent for what you got. The dry rub ribs were some of the meatiest and tastiest I ever had in Charlotte. I am giving this place 4 stars and not 5 because of the crowds, limited parking, and mediocre decor.

From out of state visiting for the weekend and was craving some good ole' BBQ. Stumbled upon this place and what a great find!  The food was DELISH and I loved the atmosphere.  Sat and ate at bar.  Bartender was super nice and very attentive.  Will most definitely go back next time I travel to Charlotte.
BBQ HEAVEN!!!! with a side of Mac and their amazing hush puppies and my belly is so happy.
Great NC pulled pork with warm vinegar sauce. Great BBQ coleslaw. Pimento cheese fries were very good. Good service. Highly recommended
I have eaten here 3 times and have enjoyed it everytime. The place is usually packed and the food has been great. The only issue I have with the place is it is a heck of a time to find parking!

My parents were in town last night and I live on the east side so I wanted to keep it local and chose Midwood Smokehouse !  Boy am I glad I did...  We had a wonderful dinner !!  Everything was just delicious !!  I dont have time for a long review but I would recommend this place to anyone !  I want to go back for lunch today !  I love east side Charlotte....
Great Barbecue spot! Fantastic BBQ chicken sandwich. The Midwood sauce is a nice spicy rich sauce. Good local craft beer options. Service was fast and friendly!
Great BBQ at fair prices.  Serivice is quick and staff is helpful and friendly.
Wow. This place has great food and good service. Pulled pork was delicious! You have to try the pickled onions they had a nice sweetness to them.

I'm a sucker for good BBQ. Of course I am - I'm a Southerner by birth and the grace of God! So I am always excited by the prospect of some good 'cue.   I'm sad to say, I gotta give it 3*s 'cos it's a crazy mixed bag. Some things are incredible (this is some of the best pulled pork and mustard sauce I've had in the Queen City, and no mistake about that; the bacon-wrapped jalapenos are delicious; and the collards are downright tasty), but other things kinda... Suck, frankly (as noted by others, the service, for one - why did I have to ask MULTIPLE TIMES to have my water replenished, for example? I don't know - they weren't that crowded). And some of the menu items kinda just didn't get it done for me - the ribs, for example, were well-prepared, but I couldn't taste the ribs for the flavour of the wood in which they were smoked; the mac 'n cheese is merely middlin', and Mac's brisket is far superior. And since when does a server not offer dessert, anyhow?   So, it gets a solid three: what it gets right, it gets CRAZY right. What it gets wrong, though, really puts a damper on things.

Wow, guess we caught the new Midwood location at a bad time. I've seen and read many favorable reviews, sadly, our experience was such that I told the manager on duty their products were average, at best. We arrived at 9:30, probably not the best time, but if the lights are on and the doors are open, the food should be as good as Noon or 7:00 PM. It was not, not even close. When we opened the car door the smell of wood smoke was a wonderful welcome, that was the highlight. We went in and waited and when no staff came to seat us I went to the bar to ask if they were still serving. She said yes and seated us. It was obvious folks were working to close, it appeared the kitchen had closed down early too. We got four portions of meat -- chicken, pork, brisket and ribs. Without exception they were all overcooked. The ribs were not hot (barely warm) but they were tough and dry. If I had been blindfolded, except for the texture of the meats, I could not tell the difference in taste between the pork and chicken. The chicken was overly moist, as though it had been in a holding tray being warmed and water condensation had dripped on the meat making it too soft. The brisket had a nice smoke ring but like the pork seemed to have been cooked much earlier and dried out. As a result it was tough like the ribs. I have eaten and judged BBQ throughout the southeast, as I told the manager, this would not have made my top ten. In fact if I was judging, under the rules I would have had to write individual notes on each sample as the score would have been so low. Hopefully it was a bad day, the review have been good but on this night it was average, at best. I will go back, it has to be better...
We had brisket, chicken and pulled pork, they were all equally delicious. Great sauces and sides. Cute, nice and clean place with friendly service.
Probably the best BBQ we've ever had, especially the queso dip.

This place is just AMAZING. The atmosphere is loud and seating is limited. However the food is just great. If you're from NC or SC or even GA you can find some southern cuisine here to put a smile on your face. It's a little pricey in my opinion for this type of food but the portions are large and the flavors impressive.

As a fan of all things BBQ and a resident of the Elizabeth neighborhood, I was thrilled with Midwood opened. I wish my enthusiasm for the the place could have been maintained following my 3 meals there.  The food is on point over all. My only real beef is with the BBQ beans which lack the sweetness and bacony flavor that I expect with BBQ beans. There's are mushy and taste too much of green and red pepper for me. The 'cue is solid from the sandwich to the brisket, to the chicken.   Why only 2 stars then? Well, the easiest answer is the service is borderline terrible. While generally friendly enough, they tend to disappear for unacceptably long periods of time and when they do return to grace you with their presence they have usually forgotten something you requested, like a drink refill, or have delivered the wrong food. If you are gonna charge $8.00 for a chopped sandwich I don't think its unreasonable on my part to expect a consistent service to go along with it.   If you ask me, they seem all too aware of their owner and his other success and are resting on their laurels a little bit too soon.

God bless the South! Had the bbq sandwich with bbq slaw and mac'n'cheese, unsweet tea. Everything tasted just how you would want it to taste right down to the freshly made bun and the eastern NC sauce. The portion was just right for me so it might be on the small side for some. Other members of my party had the pulled chicken, crinkle cut fries which were fresh made, hush puppies, brisket and from scratch banana pudding. All were good. One person in my group enjoyed the Monday special of $3 pints of NC beer - he swears by OMB Copper Ale. Service was good - had Matt as our server - but we did go at 2:30 in the afternoon on a Monday.

Decent bbq, either we came on an off-night or this place is a tad over-rated on here. "Texas Toast" is essentially just toast, beans are good, smoked meats were tasty enough. Will likely stick with Mac's Speed Shop for bbq when we visit Charlotte.

Just ate at the new Midwood Smokehouse in Ballantyne.  (I have always heard how great Midwood Smokehouse is, but never had a chance to check it out all the way on Central Avenue.)  The Ballantyne location is soooo convenient for me!  I have already had lunch there twice and dinner once.  Try the brisket and pulled pork!  Honestly, the best brisket I have ever had!  Service and management were very friendly and attentive.   I do a lot of business in the Ballantyne area and feel that I can trust these guys to take care of me.  Keep on doing it right, Midwood!

Ok so I heard about this place, saw the high score with a lot of reviews and I was super excited to visit. Arrived on a Saturday afternoon and they were really busy. Place my order at the bar. Service was good for takeout. Although I wasn't staying, the atmosphere seemed cool. I ordered the ribs (sauced) with mac and cheese and baked beans. Oh yeah, I also got an extra side of creamed corn. On my first visit to places, I like to get several options. My hope is that at least one is a winner that gives me that gotta go back feeling. Well this one was a bust. The creamed corn was awful. It seemed to be fresh whole kernel corn with some sort of cream base added to it. I'm a southern girl. Fresh corn cut off the cob there is a natural milk that can be scraped off the cob to get a cream base if you are somewhat of a cook. Lol. The Mac and cheese was baked but it was just a step above that kiddy cheesy Mac that are in the commercials. The only reason I know it was baked it because it had that brown baked cheese topped crust which can be sooo good. This one had a charred tasted. The baked beans were the best of the sides but just ok. I could taste a tomato base. I'm just not a fan of tomato based baked beans. And finally the ribs. They are definitely smoked and seem to be slow cooked since they had no problem coming off the bone. Not the best ribs that I've tasted but I did enjoy them. All in all it didn't leave me with the feeling that I had to get back there and get back there soon. 2.5 stars would have been better but not so good that I was willing to round up to 3, so I'm leaving it at 2 stars.

Frank Scibelli extends his master restaurant skills to the realm of BBQ, with his newest creation, Midwood Smokehouse.  When the weather is good, the (two) patios expand the limited amount of tables to be decently acomodating; otherwise, expect a fairly significant wait.  Once seated, prepare to stuff your face, because the food is good and the portions are plentiful.  Surprisingly, there are a fair amount of veggie options on the menu - vegetarians aren't restricted to just a veggie plate of sides, but can also order a grilled cheese or black bean burger.  Unfortunately, the macaroni & cheese scores only about a B... bummer.  But the carnivore in all of us will be pleased by the pork, chicken, brisket, ribs, or smoked turkey, and three BBQ sauces (vinegar, Texas tomato-based, and SC mustard) satisfy even the most picky eater.  Don't fill up too much though, because the pecan cobbler is not to be missed... and yes, add the ice cream.  You're welcome.
The food was incredible (pork sandwich, and the caramelized brisket called "burnt ends") and our waiter was fantastic.  We will definitely visit every time we are in Charlotte.

Midwood Smokehouse is unbelievable! I've been here a few times when I was absolutely craving some nice NC bbq. I usually get the BBQ pork sandwich and add cheddar cheese--unusual but makes the sandwich so good. Their bbq baked beans are also incredible! Looking for great southern bbq in Noda? This is the place to go!
Definitely one of the best BBQ restaurants I have been to! The brisket burnt ends are amazing. All of the sides are delicious too.

Service here has gone down hill in a big way.  They have started nickel and diming customers for items that were previously free.   Came in for dinner with my daughter, and the waitress got upset that I was sharing her drink - very strange. Seems she wanted to charge me for that too, but generously opted not to.   Good quality is still fine, but customer service is lacking.   Too many other great barbecue restaurants in Charlotte than to come back to this place.

Midwood tops my list of BBQ spots in Charlotte. Macs, Queen City Q and City Smoke are great, but Midwood is my favorite.  Huge portions and a very diverse menu. Believe it or not, they have very healthy options and amazing salads. Granted, I prefer jalepeno poppers, burnt ends and mac & cheese.  Parking can be tight, but there's usually at least space on the street around the block.  Beer selection is fairly strong too.

Good BBQ but thought the prices we're too high for the portions. Also craft/import beers start of at $5 and up which is too expensive. Too many choices in Midwood with great value on food and drinks and don't see that at Midwood Smokehouse.
Better than most...  But not among the best BBQ in the city.  Good to above average service.  Visited for lunch.

Stopped in for dinner while traveling from Hilton Head.  Great choice for BBQ. We ordered the burnt ends and the pulled pork with collards and coleslaw as sides.  Everything was delicious.  Nice selection of local craft beers on tap.  They also have wine by the bottle.  Service great as well.  Seemed to be loved by the locals. We were near the bar and saw several customers picking up take out.  Recommend if you can enjoy BBQ.

Love the food but need MUCH improvement in customer service! Arrived at 7:41 pm to order takeout. Left at 8:27 with food! No "I'm sorry" or anything from servers at takeout counter (which is where I stood ignored for most of my wait). If there was anyone "in charge" at the bar/takeout counter, they must have been on break the entire time I was there.
Might be my favorite bbq place in town. Great food and great service at both the mid-wood and Ballantyne locations. Definitely have the brisket, ribs or the beer can chicken. And try the poppers

Even though it was a Friday night when my friend and I went yesterday, we only had to wait about 10 minutes.  They have parking too, which is a huge plus for me!  I had the sausage, macaroni and cheese, and sweet potato fries.  It was a large portion for the price.  The sausage wasn't listed as a combo plate, just as a meat for the 4 meat combo, but I was able to order it anyway.  She had the macaroni and cheese, with added brisket, and ate every bite.  The bacon wrapped jalapeños had seeds removed, which I liked, since spicy food is not my favorite.

Believe the HYPE!  The hardest thing about eating here is deciding what to get.  There are so many options on the menu and everything looked tasty (looking around at other's plates).  I got the brisket and it was out of this world delicious.   The service could have been a bit better, but it wasn't bad.  My drinks were refilled and an occasional stop by was made.  They just didn't make me feel welcomed.  But, I'm not a needy person so that's alright with me.  The food won me over and I will be back time and again.

Went to the Ballantyne location. Was disappointed there were very few healthy choices.  Only two salad options to pick from!  Seriously?  That's what is wrong with our country and why so many people are just plain fat! I asked for the side of veggies and received a greasy oily mess.  Not going back unless you re-think your menu. Not everyone wants to be 20 lbs overweight!!

Great BBQ not far from downtown Charlotte. Restored my faith in Charlotte area BBQ.   Ribs: perfect amount of bite through and not dry at all. Rub was well balanced and no sauce needed.  Brisket: very moist with good flavor. Carolina chopped pork: excellent, moist, and just enough bark for a slight crunch. No extra sauce needed. Sausage: Very good. Seemed to be made in house or at least fresh from local supplier.   Sides: Mac n cheese was good but not stand out. The bbq baked beans were good with the right amount of sweetness and kick.   Overall, this is a great spot for bbq and the prices are reasonable.

My sister and hubby were visiting from out of town and were dying to try this place out.  We went on a Sunday evening and it was beyond packed.  We were a party of 9 and they told us it would be about 1 hour wait.  We decided to wait and about 15-20 mintues later my sister went up there and god knows what she said to them but we were seated right away.  To start of the smell of the BBQ was absolutely mouth watering.    Once we ordered and waited about 10 mintues then the waitress comes out to say they ran out of ribs.  HUH??? but ok, we decided to go with the saugage and brisket. Then we asked them for a complimentary appetizer to make up for running out of ribs.  Guess what?? They all of a sudden had ribs left, so we ended up getting what we originally ordered.  Now to the food part.  The ribs and brisket were very tender, tasty and of good quality.  Definitely better than alot of other restaurants.  The baked beans we didn't care for.  They are very reasonably priced, actually cheaper than I expected.  For the 9 of us the bill came to $110.00  For the food 4 stars, price 5 stars and  the service, hhmm 3.  I would definitely try them again.
Food is amazing But bring back the fried pickles... PLEASE

This place was busy!!! Even at 5pm on a Tuesday!   Came with a small group, was taken care of fairly quickly. We had a great waiter, can't recall his name :( but he was helpful. He really described each dish along with drink choices. He was awesome.   My group settled on the brisket, BBQ pork sandwich, and the chicken. We also had the bacon wrapped jalapeños. Along with sides of fries and hush puppies.   The meat was tender! The brisket was to die for. It was seriously so good. Especially when paired with their BBQ sauce. The pork was also nice and tender and packed full of great flavors. Loved the jalapeños, they weren't too spicy due to the bacon. Even the fries were cooked perfect. The boyfriend loves the hushpuppies (I'm not a fan of them in generally but he said they were great).   Nothing was left. Seriously. Every crumb was eaten.   Throughly enjoyed will be back.

Yum!  The best:  BBQ pork, chicken, beef brisket - they smoke it all!  THIS is the place we take friends and family who are visiting Charlotte for the first time.   Midwood lives up to the South's reputation for great barbecue.  In addition to sweet, sweet meats, they've got delicious sides (hush puppies & collards!), a great beer selection, and very reasonable prices.  Go!  Today!
LOVE this place. Midwood Smokehouse is definitely the best BBQ restaurant in Charlotte. The pulled pork and the brisket are a must try. They have excellent cocktails as well. Try a Beehive!

We went to Midwood Smokehouse tonight for dinner! It was great as usual. We arrived at about 6:15, which was perfect because we got to sit down right away. There was hardly anybody there. By the time we left (about 45 minutes later), there was definitely a wait.

My husband and I stopped here on a cross-country drive that took us through Charlotte.  It was recommended by a friend, and neither of us were disappointed, but I've had better NC BBQ in my day.  The pulled pork was a little too saucy for my taste (not vinegary enough), but the burnt tips were delicious.    The mac 'n cheese gets 5 stars.  I would go back just for that.  The queso with brisket was a little disappointing--tasted like fake cheese.  The service was great--they even allowed us to eat outside with our dog.     Overall, very satisfied with this stop.
Restaurant closed tonight for a corporate event for Met Life.  #lame

Great BBQ and Service We went here on a very busy Saturday afternoon. Got seated very quickly. We ordered one of the combo plates. It was just enough for the 3 of us. Turkey was a little dry,but the pulled pork and ribs were great. Good sweet tea as well. Everyone was polite and attentive. Parking can be challenging.

Don't tell my grandmother, but the banana pudding is phenomenal.  The best I have ever had.  The take out service is slow every time we order, but the food is great.  The chopped salad with meat  is almost too big to eat, but it is delicious and the dressing choices are unique.  The burnt ends are good, as are the ribs, but surprisingly my favorite meal is a burger, Mac and cheese, and banana pudding.
Food is ok...not great. The service is inconsistent at best. Management is nowhere in sight. There are better options in Charlotte.
Melt in your mouth barbecue and brisket. The mac & cheese and creamed corn are also delicious. Try everything!  Also, if you like Cheerwine they serve it in glass bottles. Delicious!

Barbecue was great.  We had burnt ends, brisket, chicken and salmon.  Loved all of it, except for the chicken.   The hush puppies, sweet potato fries and mac and cheese were all great.  Coleslaw is so so.  Food prices seem mostly reasonable, with some  priced under $10.     Mixed drinks a little high.  Lots of beer choices.  Server was friendly, but not overly attentive.  The five stars is for the barbecue
Stopped here on our way through town headed north.....great food, nice sized portions, super sides ......definately a great find!!!

After getting mixed reviews of this restaurant we decided to give it a try. After a 30 minute wait, we were seated and service was prompt and satisfactory. My wife ordered the ribs, I ordered pulled pork. The food arrived promptly, but, unfortunately it was not particularly outstanding. The portions were generous, but my fries were limp and greasy, pulled pork was good. My wife's ribs were dry and not very "meaty". We found out later that if you want the "meaty" ribs you have to pay double! Really? The couple next to us found this out the hard way when they received their bill, which was over $30.00 for a rib dinner. While our dinner was ok, I doubt we will return, there are better choices available. I don't know, maybe it's the building they are in. Sticky Fingers closed because it went downhill in quality, hope Midwood Barbecue has better luck. They will have to improve greatly to ever get me to return.

I haven't reviewed the New Smokehouse yet? What a bad yelper I have become. I originally went open weekend and was blown out of the water. Solid BBQ here! Go for the Brisket and Beer Specials!   So I've been twice, and if I cared not about my waste line it would probably be more. First of all you gotta start with the pimento cheese fries, why? two words: pulled pork. Yes they hook it up. I am actually really embarrassed that I ordered them because I am not a fry person. The roommate wanted them so I ordered them. A Must have!  As far as BBQ goes it is all smoked to perfection, unlike the other "M" place. Brisket is the best hands down, then ribs, chicken, pulled pork. It really is all good and the sauces aren't something you really need. The meat has such good flavor without it, but you know the mustard sauce is bang'n. Midwood has solid sides as well, tried them all.  I have never had a bad server and that bartender that looks like an all-growned-up Bobby Hill is so sweet! Great people all around. See you soon!

Ballantyne location: Best BBQ we had in years! Excellent service when ordering takeout. The menu has something for everyone. We ordered Carolina BBQ, ribs, Cuban and burger. Not one negative thing to say.

Just moved to Charlotte and have been enjoying dining my way around the city. Midwood Smokehouse was on my list from the get go, and my husband and I finally made it there on a recent Friday for dinner. I am noticing a trend in my reviews that when you can smell the restaurant from down the street, it's usually a great sign. We parked in the gravel lot off the side street, and could smell the smoker as we walked toward the restaurant. We arrived a little after 5:30 and were surprised that we pretty much had our pick of tables. The Yuengling draft special made this PA girl happy - we've spen the lastt 4 years in Texas without access to Yuengling - so we're thrilled that so many restaurants in Charlotte stock it. We split the Well-Fed Combo Platter - with Carolina pulled pork, St. Louis style ribs, brisket, and chopped chicken barbecue.  The "smaller" Well-Fed combo platter was plenty of food for the two of us, I appreciated that our waitress did not try to convince us to go with the larger Pig-Out platter.The platter came with pickled onions, hush puppies, and choice of two sides - we picked barbecue baked beans and mac & cheese. The food came out pretty quickly and looked great! The ribs and pork were our favorite; after spending so much time in Texas, we should probably know better than to order brisket anywhere else - it was decent, but reminded me more of a pot roast than the brisket we've come to know and love. The mac & cheese was delicious - most barbecue joints in Texas don't offer it as a side, so I've been getting mac & cheese everywhere it's offered. We finished the meal with the peach cobbler ala mode, which was fantastic as well, love that it's only 75 cents to add ice cream. The only downside of the whole meal was that there was a piece of glass in my beer - but luckily I found it before it made it into my mouth! By the time we finished, almost all of the tables inside and many outside had filled, so we just arrived a little early that night. We'll be back!

I love the "fatty brisket". Is it a chain??? I really don't know. I don't usually love chains, but the brisket is perfect every time! I used to go to the one in plaza before this one opened-always good! It's a place I go OCCASIONALLY bc the food all kinda has the same smokey smell and taste. But it's a place I  can depend on for yummy brisket.

A few months ago I posted a review complaining about the ridiculously high salt content of the meat.  (I enjoy high levels of salt, so you should know that when I complain about something being to salty, it's reached a level of ridiculousness).  Anyway, I'm pleased to say that they seem to have toned down the saltiness somewhat.  I'm giving them an extra star.  I highly recommend the smoked half-chicken, the brisket, and the ribs.  The hush puppies are the best I've ever had, though I'm not a fan of the hush-puppy genre.  For sides I recommend baked beans and slaw (or bbq slaw).  I also enjoy the pickled onions that come with every meal.  The bacon-wrapped jalapenos are pretty boring, sadly.   They are just globs of fat without much flavor.  Staff is super friendly and owner is very nice.

I used their catering to host a Birthday party and I was thoroughly impressed how good it was. It was a crowd pleaser and made my hosting job a breeze. They were really good on having it fresh and ready at the time you need. We choose to pick it up 30 minutes before party started. It worked out perfect. Their side items such as baked beans and mac and cheese are pretty typical so I made my own very easily. So if your looking to host a big BBQ they will hook you up with some good BBQ. Thanks Midwood BBQ

Lowcountry as sweet tea I know my own taste I shove mustard-based BBQ Into my face  Ambling into this split level  Church of smoked pork I ordered a plate of pulled ..and a fork  The sauce, so tangy I said, "Wait a sec... This vinegar base Defies my red neck."  And the puppies So crispy, the insides so sweet Extra sauce on the side Complimenting the meat  No Bush's Best, no sir! No salty slime douse The baked beans they bake here, They bake them in house  If I had a thtomach of much wider girth I'd have thtuck around longer And had thome desserth.    Instead I played corn hole On the patio out front And finished my beer 'Cause I do what I want  One day I'll return For vinegar suits Those weeks that I drift From my mustard base roots.

I've been in the Carolinas for almost 10 years now and just finally found my favorite BBQ place! Love the quality of the food here. The ribs are cooked perfectly, all the bbq sauces are not overpowering and I LOVE the cheese fries! This is the only place I will go now.

We got the combo platter with Carolina Chopped Pork, Beef Brisket, Saint Louis Ribs, and Smoked Sausage. All of the meats were good, with the brisket being the best and the ribs being only ok. The pickled onions were delicious as was the sweet creamed corn. I would also recommend their drinks I got a Jack's Beehive (Tennessee Honey, Lemonade and Ginger Ale) which was great, but all of their drinks looked awesome.

One of the best BBQ we've experienced so far in the Charlotte area.  We lived in the Sanford NC area before moving to FT. Mill SC and had eaten at the Pik & Pig in Carthage NC and their pulled pork and Brisket is phenomenal.   This place is very good and I would definitely recommend it.

Amazing BBQ.   My wife and I had moved from Memphis, TN and considered ourselves fairly good judges of BBQ from not only living in one of the towns known for great BBQ but also competing in competitions for many years.  It is hard to find a place that actually uses a smoker on site, most either cook off site an then reheat or steam their meat.  Smoke flavor is amazing, only knock is that the menu is a little limited and they don't have a "sampler" platter where you can get the brisket, pulled pork etc all on one plate.  Great addition to plaza midwood and will be going back for more!  Oh yea and a great beer selection.

DEFINITELY the place to go.  Was recommended by close friends, and it did not disappoint.  It has become my favorite place to go. The brisket was awesome.  Staff is very attentive, but the best servers have been Matt and Brian.   Always good service and food.   Small plate seems to always be enough for a good meal, but the large plate is plenty to take  away for a meal later.     Everything on the menu is GREAT.  ONLY draw back is.... Parking can be a challenge at times. Make sure to check it out.

Extremely good barbecue, particularly the pulled pork and the brisket. The smokiness of the meat was perfect - not overwhelming, but dominating the flavor at the same time. These people know what they are doing. Also highly recommended: the dry wings with sauce on the side. WOW. Some of the best wings I've ever had, served sizzling on a cast iron plate, amazing flavor and you can enjoy the meat separate from the sauce.   Also worth checking out: the bacon wrapped jalapeños (not at all spicy, my fiancé through they were green peppers), the mac, and the collard greens
The food was wonderful will take all my friends and family there. The beef brisket is so tender it just melts in your mouth and don't get me started on the hush puppies...wow

Really some of the best pork I've had. Very moist, flavorful, and juicy. The taste without the sauce was excellent. I honestly thought the BBQ sauce took away from the pork flavor.   Cole slaw was not good, and the Mac and cheese was very so-so, but based on the excellent quality pork sandwich I will give it five stars.
It was pretty dope. Get the ribs. Get the burnt ends. Disclaimer: if you don't like fatty meat then don't get the burnt ends.

This place was legit.  The burnt ends required no additional sauce, and the side options were so impressive that I ordered a third.  The sweet tea was good, and we ended the meal with some banana pudding.  I also found the staff to be quite friendly.  I'll be back!

This place has some of the best Bar B Q!!  Love the brisket and the slaw is amazing!  I have only been there 3 times but every time is great!  Sometimes it's very busy on the weekend but worth the wait!  Great to sit outside and enjoy the view while enjoying great food.  All the sides are tasty!  I especially like the bacon wrapped jalapenos!  Yum!

First, let me say that I am a 20 year restaurant veteran and somewhat of a BBQ afficianado.  After my second visit to Midwood, I am sad to say that I will not return. Evidently success has ruined the effort given and the portion sizes seem to be shrinking.   My entree last night was $40...a large sampler platter with double ribs so that I could sample both preparation styles, with both cuts of brisket (props for offering lean or fatty) and the sausage (which I had enjoyed on my first visit.  Beans and corn for sides.    Neither style of ribs was edible...tried as I might.  The waitress was friendly and fairly prompt with beverage refills prior to food being delivered, but no check back for quality.  When the waitress finally asked, she didn't believe me that the ribs were terrible- didn't send a manager, and disappeared after processing checks for our party of 6.  Sorry- neither value nor good ribs to be found here....

For lunch the food was great...not a discounted lunch menu though.  Got the "well-fed" portion consisting of chicken, sausage, ribs and fatty brisket (vs lean...in TX we called this moist vs dry). Also creamed corn (meh, a little underdone but the cream was good) and cole slaw (phenomenal). Hush puppies are like savory onion donuts. 22 bucks for all that is not a bad deal. It fed both of us until we were bursting.   Atmosphere is new American bar and grill. Lots of televisions. Saw a few business lunches going on.  Would easily recommend.

Food was good but didn't understand their upgrade menu choices.  They ask you to pay more to get more of a certain item (on the 4 Protein entrée) but then you have to drop one of the other proteins.  Then I bumped it up to the "extra" amount and they made me drop another item.  Doesn't make sense and I certainly did not get 45 dollars worth of Q.

Midwood Smokehouse did some catering for a Southern Christmas Party I hosted - and I have been meaning to post a review.  They were great to work with, offered great advice about how much food to get - rather than having me get way more than I needed.  The BBQ and smoked wings were the favorite items on my buffet!  The wing are fantastic, and the pork BBQ tender and delicious, made even better with their collection of sauces.  This place is legit.  Eating there is great, but consider them for some local, delicious catering for your next party as well!

I was sad the day we moved to the suburbs. I've lived uptown for years and moving to south Charlotte made me feel like I was barrel aging and buying strollers. But that all changed when Midwood opened here. As good as ever and all the charm and culture is here too. The meats are all fantastic and they have great craft drinks too! We get takeout from here on late work nights.

I recommend the nachos with brisket and burnt ends! The hushpuppies, slaw & beans were in point as well. The service was friendly & helpful. Great beer selection too. Went 2x within 24hrs it was so good! I don't recommend their bloody marys or the pimento cheese fries, we has them plain & my daughter (who LOVES cheese) hated them too.

Our 12 hrs layover at Charlotte: Midwood was our second lunch. The meal consist of brisket, spareribs, sausage, pulled pork, hush puppies, baked beans and Mac n cheese!  All that food for only $22!!!!!  All the meat was deliciously smokey flavored.  My favorite was probably the spare ribs.  Hush puppies were not too greasy, just wish that there was jalepeno in it.  The baked bean was just perfect, great tangy smokey taste.  The Mac n cheese was sooo good, especially the top crispy crust.  Our waiter Andra was very friendly and attentive.
Their homemade barbecue sauce is amazing and loved all of the sides.  You can order take out and it's just as good. I'm really glad I finally made it to Midwood and I'll definitely be coming back.

Was there a few days ago and was really looking forward to trying this place but ended up disappointed. Had the brisket sandwich.  Menu said it was chopped but the texture was more like they threw it in a blender and pureed it.  They also served it with bleu cheese on it, which sounded strange but I figured it must be good or they wouldn't serve it.  I was wrong.  It was not a good combination at all and I found myself looking for mints after my meal to get rid of the aftertaste.  In addition there was hardly any brisket in the sandwich.  In fact I think there may have been as much bleu cheese as meat.  My friend had something else and simply said their meal  was okay.  Was expecting more for the price. In addition the meat tasted strangely like it wasn't really smoked but just had some artificial smoke flavoring added.   Wanted to love this place but that isn't what happened.  Went back about a year later - Was better.  Got the burnt ends and they were pretty good, along with some collard greens.   Nothing amazing but pretty good.

Atmosphere: B Food: A- Service: B+  Low key/casual, very good food, and good service pretty much captures the Midwood Smokehouse.    Both the setting and service were good, in fact, they complement each other well.  This is not an in-your-face place, which would be antithetical to what bbq is all about.  It takes time to smoke the meat, it should take time to savor and enjoy.  The hickory smokes wings were very good; no sauce and they didn't need them at all. The brisket was very good and the collard greens-likewise.  I appreciated that one of the staff had a pepper infused vinegar and promptly put that in front of me--definitely good flavor there without overpowering the greens.  I like pickled onions....a lot and seeing them on the menu and then on the plate was a pleasant contrast to the rich brisket.  Midwood offers well balanced plate between the meat, greens, onions and hush puppies.  I don't trust a bbq place that finds the need to smother everything in sauce, the true flavor is in the meat.  Yes, I know styles differ, but for me it is about the unadulterated flavor of the smoked meat.  Midwood does a very nice job.  I would come back and try more on the menu.  If the other offerings are as good as the first, I could see going to five stars; however, with only one visit under my belt four stars are the maximum.
Awesome food!  Great BBQ near uptown Charlotte on Central Ave.
Passing through and wanted good barbecue. Found the place!! Had the 22 sampler with extra ribs and Mac & cheese bacon wrapped jalapeño !! Really really great and great service to boot.

Drove 30 minutes for ribs on Father's Day.  Arrived at 5:30, sat at 6:00.  Put order for apps in.  Then ordered dinner.  Five minutes later were told that there were no ribs.  Brisket was good, but I wouldn't drive for brisket.  Feel like they should've offered free dessert or apps. free.  Won't be back.

Visiting Charlotte we were looking for good bbq.  Visited thus restaurant and we're not disappointed.  Best briscuit and chicken.  Appetizer of pimento fries with briscuit and bacon wrapped jalapeños.  Dessert was also very good...pecan cobbler.  Service was the best ever in a restaurant from the second we walked in the door until we left

Visiting Charlotte for the National Parks and Rec Convention. Our hotel the Westin, suggested Midwood Smokehouse. Great recommendation, friendly service, great atmosphere and excellent food. Loved the creamed corn, BBQ beans and banana pudding and sweet potato fries. And of course great, BBQ meats.

Always love everything I have ordered from here from the burnt ends, dinner specials and pulled pork! The cream of corn side is delicious and I love their salads. This place has not disappointed me yet!
Very good food. Very slow service. You would think they were cooking the bbq to order

Stopped here as we were driving thru town and it was fantastic!  Drew, our server, was extremely knowledgeable and friendly.  They have an extensive bar menu - and showcase local as well.  They are a true smokehouse and the food was delicious!

At a workshop around the corner and knew I had to have lunch here!  Got the brisket (mixed, both lean & fat), sweet potato fries, mac & cheese and finished with might the best banana pudding I have ever had!!  This is a cornerstone for BBQ in the Charlotte region!!

This place is good. The longer you live in NC the more of a bbq snob you become. Once you have convinced yourself that "'y'all" is an acceptable thing to say you have entered full on bbq snobbery. This place is good for the city life, its a comfortable setting, it was pretty good food but compared with all the other amazing bbq in NC, its just a pit stop between other bbq destinations outside of the city.

I have a hard time picking between this and Mac's Speed Shop for best BBQ in the city. Midwood is really close to my condo so I usually go here.   Oddly enough their pulled pork is my least favorite thing here. But literally everything else I've had on the menu is out of this world. Bacon wrapped jalapeños... umm YES. Brisket is phenomenal, BBQ chicken isn't run of the mill chicken at all, extremely flavorful and different. Just thinking about the smell of this place makes me hungry.  Tip: if you get the BBQ chicken instead of the mustard based BBQ sauce ask to get a few different ones on the side so you can taste them all.
Yummy food and friendly service. Good value. For your first time, bbq sampler is a good option, but the ribs are the best.
This place is the best BBQ I've had yet! The waiter was friendly, attentive and informative. The food was awesome and the atmosphere was enjoyable.

This place has some of the best brisket in town.  I started off with the bacon wrapped jalapenos today and the bacon tasted a bit old, which is not normal for what I am used to at Midwood.  I also order the TX Brisket sandwich with the Philly-style Mac and Cheese, which also happened to be the day's special.  The Brisket sandwich was spectacular, but the Mac and cheese was basically a few peppers and a couple pieces of brisket slapped on top of Mac and Cheese... definitely not worth the $5 upgrade to the premium side.  The service was excellent and I will continue to go to Midwood as my 'goto' for BBQ in the Ballantyne area.
Yummy. Sweet sauce is excellent. Ribs meaty and succulent. Mac & cheese is great as well. Go now!
Parking is tricky and be prepared to wait.  It's worth it. Service is superb and the food won't disappoint. If you aren't a big eater there will be enough for a second round the next day.

I ate here last Friday. Got in right at 12 and they were already packed! We were able to sit at the bar and the food was terrific. I ate the pulled chicken with mustard sauce, it was very messy but very very good. I will defiantly come again!

We had our rehearsal dinner at Midwood a few weeks ago and it turned out absolutely fabulously. Midwood is one of our favorite spots and we both knew we wanted to have our rehearsal here b/c the food is so Carolina and southern to us. I want to be clear that the success of this dinner is a testament to the staff at Midwood Ballantyne rather than the Midwood private events coordinator. I hate leaving negative reviews for 1 person but I felt Mark, in comparison to all of our other wedding vendors we worked with, was an office oriented person and regurgitated our contract when asked about things. It seemed like he was quick to say no or put restrictions on simple requests. An example of this is when asked if his staff could hang up 1 small banner and light a few LED votives in paper lanterns, he said no and told us we could get there 30 minutes before our scheduled dinner to set up decor but added that he couldn't guarantee our room would even be available 30 minutes prior. As a rehearsal dinner, of course we were going to be rehearsing right beforehand. Fortunately, I stopped by a few hours before our dinner on a whim (was getting manicure at Apple Nails across the street) and the staff on site was SO HELPFUL and didn't hesitate to say "yes, we can easily take 5 minutes to hang a banner & turn on 10 LED votives!". Anyway, with that rant out of the way, I want to make sure that I give credit to not only the awesome wait staff (wish I remembered their names!) but also the kitchen team b/c the food was wonderful. As always! We had about 30 people, so we chose to do 2 meat buffet with several sides, wings as appetizers, banana pudding dessert and beer and wine. Now on their private events menu they don't offer fries as a side and they actually forgot them initially but when I mentioned that we were supposed to have fries, they served a bunch of baskets of fries on all our tables! Which turned out great and I think people enjoyed having them to snack on (especially since french fries don't really translate well to heating dishes, right?). We stayed late and almost closed the place down, they were so nice and even brought out takeout boxes so that our guests could take leftovers! I would probably hesitate to book another Private Event with them b/c I like a more receptive Events Manager.  I have booked private events at The Capital Grill and Dressler's (both locations) and their Events Team were more customer service oriented, flexible and understanding with small requests. They are willing to go around their "rules" to make your event a success... and while the staff at Midwood Ballantyne were awesome, I shouldn't have to show up in person and request things on site and hope they are willing to do it for me, it's not fair to me or the team working that night. Love Midwood as always and I think it's the best BBQ in Charlotte so I will definitely be back :)

They serve pretty tasty Southern BBQ. Our party had ribs, brisket, pulled pork, and various items from the children's menu.   There was not a complaint amongst us. The service was excellent and timely.

Midwood has a good thing going for itself: great food and drink in a comfortable yet casually upscale setting. I came with a group of four, and we happily dined on some crazy good pimento cheese fries and bacon wrapped jalapeños. Another major plus is $2 National Bohemian beers, which goes great with salty and smoky meat by the way. Delivering the knockout punch was my full rack of ribs, which was nothing short of phenomenal. Great stuff comes from the kitchen here and I'd love to come back!

Solid BBQ with multiple sauces - check.  Good service - check.  Fair market prices - check.  Generous portion size - check.  Fairly crowded (so you know it's good) on a weekday for lunch, but not too crowded for a long wait - check.  Parking adequate - check.  Eyes bigger than my stomach - check.  What's not to like?  Pimento cheese fries.  Bacon wrapped jalepenos.  Huge salads you can fix up with BBQ chicken/pork/etc.  I still love Mac's Speed Shop, as well, but Midwood Smokehouse provides an alternative closer to Dilworth (location of my employer).  I'm not sure a city can have too much high-end BBQ.  Not only is it in the rotation, I'm putting it near the top.
One of the best BBQ sandwiches I've had in town. Their drinks are meh but appetizers are green light as well. Service was fast and our server was very friendly

I got the pulled pork east carolina style bbq sandwich.....the vinegar based sauce was a little sweet which was nice to off set the saltiness of the sandwich.  I also tried the fried pickles which came out very fast even after the server informed me it takes a very long time.  When I got them they were so salty and soggy i threw the rest away.  The mac and cheese was good, but for 16.00 no drink included it was a rip off.   The location is cool for happy hour but the food was mediocre at best.

I moved to Charlotte 3 months ago. I did the usual google searches for Carolina's best bbq, and i even told my friends, "yeah its overrated i havent had anything worth writing hom about" until today. I stumbled onto midwood smokehouse by accident.  The BBQ , sauce (not even needed the meat is so good), and sides were AWESOME!  Definitely going back!

It is very Yummy BBQ. Consitently good. Good Service. Great beer selection.  The first time I went in, the waiter 'got mad at me' for getting a light beer and 'made me' "get a real beer fit for a man who works everyday". That was some good banter you wont get at a lot of places. It stays packed so be ready. Good people watching, great beer. pretty good BBQ. It isn't hardcore BBQ but this is Charlotte and good luck to you if you are looking for the holy grail. This is a great weekend place, with good food, nice people, great beer. Really can't go wrong for the money, quality of food, and atmosphere.
Very good BBQ our waiter Tyler was super nice!!  The best beef brisket I have had so far.  Very tender and the BBQ sauce on the table is so good.  I will be back soon!

I'm sad today. What was once my mainstay for BBQ in Charlotte is no more. Perhaps it's the challenge of repeating on a larger scale that which is successful on a smaller scale. Who knows. But it seems like the flavor of the food has taken a back seat to having it served quickly.   The ribs were simply bland. Same for the chicken. This from the one place where you could always order anything dry knowing that the flavor of the rub and smoke would shine through. Not so today.   On top of that, there aren't any bottles of BBQ sauce on the table to sample from. You have to ask for it and they basically have only three sauces (regular, vinegar and mustard).   Maybe I'll need to go back to the original location on Central. I'm hoping that they bring back the flavor. Even if it means a longer wait.

go to mac's or lancasters! i had very high hopes for this place... couldent wait for it to open and try it out. ordered it to go. got home and half the order was missing, and very small portions. high priced for what it is. they were out of a few items also, so before  you get your heart set on something call! they do have an awesome beer menu. cant comment on the ambience because i got it to go.

In town for one night and wanted BBQ.  Found Midwood and gave it a try.  It was nice to get out of the rain.  Atmosphere is very nice, clean and relaxing.  Waiter was friendly and beer and food selection were good.  Decided on the small sampler plate to try a few bbq items.  Brisket, turkey, pulled pork were all very good.  Vinegar and bbq sauce was average to good.  The sausage link was not to my taste but overall food, drink and staff were really good.

I love this place. The pimento cheese fries are a definite must try as are the smoked wings. I always order the BBQ sandwich and macaroni and cheese. I have yet to even try anything else due to the sheer perfection of these two items. The hubby usually gets a trio of ribs, sausage and burnt ends, its a huge plate with plenty to take home. The baked beans are kind of spicy, but we'll worth the heat. This has quickly become my favorite BBQ place in Charlotte. If you love good BBQ, midwood is a don't miss.

This is my first review and I was so impressed I had to.. I travel for a living and that travel takes me to all of the BBQ regions in our country. My company home office is in Kansas City, I have been all over Texas, travel to Memphis a good bit, and Lexington is right up the road... so I have been to the best all these areas have to offer. Milwood is different than all of those in a really good way! Prob borrow a little from those regions, and the result is their own thing going on.   I will just say you can tell someone has smoked a LOT of meats to get it this right. Most other BBQ places has something over-powering going on.. Either the smoke, the rub, the bbq sauce, but here it is such a good mix. That's why I say someone has smoked a lot of meats because no one gets that lucky lol. The ribs and chicken I tried were both smoked perfectly. The BBQ slaw was the best I have ever had! I do my own sauce at home and I will say one of the hardest things to do is to get the sweet vs sour just right, but they do here! I just appreciate something done right and they do smoking right hereI will be back!    Curt

Great BBQ meal! We arrived at 11 pm for a late dinner after picking up friends from the airport.  We started with the bacon wrapped jalapeños which were tasty. Spicy jalapeños and smokey bacon, a win win! I ordered the Cuban which was delicious, juicy and perfectly pressed. The flavors of the pulled pork, ham, and the melted Swiss are a perfect combo. My friend ordered a chopped salad with the chicken and said the chicken was cooked perfectly with a great smoky flavor. And lastly, my other friend ordered the burger. Not much to say about a burger piled high with pulled pork and bacon with side of cole slaw. Delicious. Great selection of local beers on tap as well.  As I said, we arrived late and the kitchen closes at midnight. We were the only people left in the restaurant at around 11:45 pm and the staff didn't make us feel rushed to leave or approach us to move on.  Great food and great service.
Yep!  This place is awesome! !!  Best meat in town.  It's that brisket.   I dream about it!!

We usually always go on weekends for lunch right when they open, thus we have no trouble being sat in a spacious, comfy, quiet booth.  The service is prompt, polite and never too "in your face" . The smoked wings or the jalapeños are a home run for an appetizer. Then again, everything on the menu is pretty much a home run depending on your taste. The food and drinks are consistently good. The atmosphere is welcoming, not overkill for a BBQ restaurant. All around an A+
Have had the ribs at this location twice. The first time they were good; last night they were bad. I may return, but not anytime soon.  Service was very good on both visits.

That Sunday special need rib is so ridiculously good. The house salad is awesome and so is that avocado dressing. Sides are pretty good. I don't even care what the rest of the menu taste like I want to go just for that rib every time.

One of my favorite BBQ places in the city. Great beers on tap, bacon wrapped jalapeños are delish, and friendly servers. One time I came with my family and they were closed for renovations but gave us two $5 gift cards so that we would come back.
Amazing wings!  One of the best wings I've had.  Service is great!  Food was all good including the salad.  The ribs were very good and moist.

Visited this past weekend.  The food was really good.  We started off with the smoked wings,  pretty good nice flavor, but not as good as Sticky Fingers smoked wings.  We had burnt ends plate and the the combo platter with brisket, ribs, turkey and pulled pork  Burnt ends-  Good but nothing special  Brisket-  Juicy and flavorful (portions on the combo werent that big)  Turkey-  surprisingly the best thing on the plate,  good flavor and was very moist  Ribs-  A little too fall off the bone for me, but were still very tasty  Pulled Pork-  Not bad  very juicy the flavor wasnt to my liking though  Sides we had Mac and Cheese -  Nothing special here but still good  BBQ Baked Beans-  were  the best beans I have had EVER!  So good I had to order some to go ( kinda disappointed though because for $5.00 the container I got was on the small side and not even full)  So far this is the best BBQ I have had in Charlotte

I came here recently with a large group during a 3 day conference being held downtown.  Despite being told by multiple cab drivers that Charlotte is not known for its BBQ, this place was surprisingly good (and I say this after a recent visit to Austin where all we did was eat BBQ the entire time).   We came with a party of 12 on a Friday night at 7:15 p.m. with no reservation.  The host was very friendly and kept us updated as to our remaining wait time.  We ended up waiting about 45 minutes - 1 hour; luckily we had drinks at the bar to entertain us.    I ordered the smoked half chicken Midwood style.  This dish was only $10 and came with hush puppies and two sides!!!  I got the baked beans, vinegar coleslaw, and collard greens.  The chicken was juicy and tender and the BBQ sauce had a nice spiciness to it without being to vinegary.  The baked beans were delicious and had a good amount of meat.  The collard greens and coleslaw were also solid.  I attempted to eat only half of the massive portion of food but somehow ended up finishing the entire plate.  Others in my group had the burnt ends, mac and cheese, ribs, etc. and all said they enjoyed their food.  One thing that could make this place better is if they offered biscuits or cornbread...all they have currently is Texas toast.   Our server was extremely attentive and friendly.  She didn't bat an eye when we requested separate checks even though I'm sure this was a supreme hassle.  Good atmosphere and food - I recommend coming here if you are in the mood for BBQ!

This is where I get my barbecue in Charlotte, hands down. I am a fanatical fan of pulled pork and have suffered through a lot of poor excuses for barbecue - which is inexcusable in NC. Midwood does pulled pork right and their N Carolina sauce and S Carolina sauces are spot on.   I could speak extensively about the hushpuppies, mac 'n' cheese, or fries, but instead I will say that I am most pleased by the pickled onion. Genius.  Their barbecue chicken is great too, and as much as I philosophically disagree with Texas brisket, they do that well too.   If you like barbecue, you can't do better in Charlotte than Midwood.

The BBQ pork was incredible! I tasted my fiancé's chicken, it was amazing too! We also enjoyed the bacon wrapped jalapeños! This is, by far, the best BBQ place in town! Plus, friendly staff and comfy atmosphere! Good beer selection! Definitely highly recommend this place, it's delicious food at a great price!

Edited: thank you Kathy K (Midwood BBQ Bartender) for sharing - made the Watermelon Fresca last night and they were a hit! Still a fan.... Customer service thing. Food is fantastic. I was at Midwood a couple weekends ago and they had a specialty drink cocktail - a Watermelon Fresca. I went back a few days later when family was in town, wanting to share one of our favorite places, and they didn't  have it anymore. I bought a watermelon hoping to make it at home but it just wasn't as good. Called Midwood and a very abrupt person on the phone said they don't give out recipes. Seriously?! It's a specialty cocktail you don't make all the time - it's not like I can come get one if I have the hankering - and you're not going to share? If you gave me the recipe, every time I make it for company, I'd likely say "I got it at midwood smokehouse and they were so awesome they shared the recipe."... like... "go there and eat... it's one of our favorite places." Poor showing, Midwood.

This is just the worst place ever, if your lookin for a bad time and bad food. Because this restarsunt is literally my new favorite thing out of everything in everything. ILL SEE YOU AT MIDWOOD SMOKEHOUSE!!!!! So excited

Very cool place to eat just outside of main Charlotte downtown area. I has the burnt ends and baked beans. Baked beans are AMAZING! 30 bucks for 2 people including an app. And you can smell it from the parking lot and shops nearby. My wife said the turkey sandwich is the best she ever had.
Amazing BBQ. I'm from Chicago and I'm always looking for some good ribs and pulled pork. This place has it!! Great service and a good time :) I will definitely come here again for BBQ!

Very good! We'll be regulars and bring more friends. Wait staff- even the boys-  are friendly and Professional. Music was great tonight -80's. If one of those 5 tv's played something out of their box, like TCM, or comedy channel. Plaza midwood is overloaded with sports bars, they have no personal identity. Plaza middwood is a mixed community! That's the beauty of it. So the culture should follow. Makes it much more interesting. I could offer other suggestions to bring in plentiful sub-groups. I'd like to see it stay around for a while.

I have just eaten one of THE BEST BBQ plates in the 25 years I have lived in this area. Grateful I live in Plaza Midwood but this was at the Ballantyne location. Smokey, flavorful, moist Eastern BBQ. Excellent mac and cheese side. The baked beans were spicy, which I loved. This was a to go order that I was told would be ready in 20 minutes. I got there in 10 and the order was waiting for me. I have also eaten at the P-M location but this was my first BBQ plate. It certainly will not be my last.

Totally legit Q! Great location, though parking can be a pain during peak hours  I recommend the fatty brisket or the pulled chicken BBQ.  Tell them to double you up on the pickled onions. They're like candy. Sweet, earthy candy!  Burnt ends plate is awesome, too. But I recommend you telling them to do the extra sauce on the side.  Their best house sauce (they're all house made, btw) is the sweet habañero sauce. Don't be scared of the habañero part. They did an awesome job of making it where the heat is just right.  Round it all out with the bacon-wrapped jalapeños and the mac&cheez, and you'll be set!  Wait staff is super chill, so that's always a plus.
Good BBQ, but portions are small for prices and the parking is an absolute nightmare. Its a "meh".

We had such a delightful lunch as we were driving through Charlotte on our road trip. The staff were all so unbelievably friendly and accommodating (we were travelling with a dog). They kept bringing him bowls of water and treats, and he loved the attention. The human food was just as delicious as his treats! We got two barbecue plates- one with burnt ends, and one with ribs. We got macaroni and cheese, baked beans, and collard greens for sides. Each of the meals came with hush puppies as well. Literally, everything was just divine. Both the collards and the beans were loaded up with bits of meat, which seems so rare when restaurants usually want to skimp on the good stuff! The hushpuppies were just the slightest bit sweet and were perfect. Our waitress also brought us a variety of BBQ sauces and vinegars to try, and all of them were wonderful. Our waitress was particularly kind when my boyfriend couldn't make up his mind about what kind of beer to get- she brought him samples of a bunch of different types, and gave him recommendations and descriptions of each. We just had the best time ever here. It's a shame we won't be driving through Charlotte again any time soon, because this restaurant was just top notch.
Midwood Smokehouse is great!  Enjoyed everything from the loaded potato appetizer and the half fatty/half lean brisket, all the way to the banana pudding.  Definitely recommend

Went here for an early dinner today with my wife and kids and really had a nice time and a great meal!!  When we got there, parking was a little tricky..... There was none available in their lot but I was able to park on the street right outside the place.  We were quickly greeted at the door and seated right away.  Our waiter was Matt and he was simply great!!  My wife had the chicken with veggies, we got a pork sandwich for the little one and I got 1/2 rack of ribs with the hush puppies, which were delicious!!  The ribs were top notch with great BBQ sauce!!  The only drawback for me was the men's room.... It had a very strong stench of urine and just wasn't very clean.  But I feel like bathrooms should be both the staff and patron's responsibility to keep clean..... That's just my opinion.  The price was very fair I thought.  The food was very good!!  I would go back!!

I've eaten here for lunch twice and even though I wanted to love the place, I can only say that it's okay.  I had the brisket the first time (when they initially opened) and it was dry and hard.  I had the mac and cheese and some other side but they weren't good either.  While I normally find it blasphemous to eat subpar mac and cheese; I figured they were new and needed to adjust so I tried them again. The second time was better.  I had a burger and fries that were good (but they aren't to get right(.  I would eat there again, but they wouldn't be one of my choices as when looking for great food.

My significant other and I have been here three times so far and this past time was the best. The ribs and the hushpuppies are delicious! Also having grown up in the south, I must say their sweet tea is one of the best I've  ever tasted. Service is always great and quick.
The best barbecue in Charlotte. You can't go wrong with the pulled pork, sweet potato fries and bacon-wrapped jalapeños.

Poor service, extremely slow. Our waitress didn't show up until about 15 minutes in, then it took forever for her to bring the food (despite the fact the table of 4 next to us ordered from her about 10 seconds before we did, we didn't get ours (a table of 2) until a good 10 minutes after them). She even said she saw it, but then didn't bring it for another 5 minutes. Before we had gotten our entree she came by and asked if we'd like any desert. Totally clueless.  Now the food. It was just ok. They got the order wrong and messed up the sauces completely. We both had the pulled pork, but neither was very pulled, more like chunked. I shouldn't need a knife to eat pulled pork, but I certainly did. It was also extremely fatty. I had huge pieces of fat and gristle. It was also way oversalted, and this is from two people who like their salt. The fried pickles were just ok, we've had better. They were too soggy. The jalapeno bacon poppers were good, but not outrageous as I was led to believe. The texture was a bit off, and the bacon wasn't crispy. The potato salad was good, as were the hushpuppies. The smoked vegetables were a bit soggy as well, not crispy as you'd expect, but they were ok.  We won't be going back.
Amazing service, amazing food! I love the mac and cheese, and they have some amazing cocktails.  I'm from Kentucky, and I know my bourbon, and I was impressed by their selection.
This place is great.  Delicious food.  Affordable.  I like the smoked chicken (a half chicken!) with two sides for $10.  Lots of fun.  Highly recommend.
Very good bbq! Nice hickory smoked sausage and ribs were.fantastic. We had the combo platter with 4 meats, the small one is plenty for two people.

I'm going to get soooo fat with this place only a few miles from my house!  It's no wonder this place is multi-award winning.  I want everything in my belly!! Service was outstanding, TVs everywhere (there was a Thursday night football game on and I did not miss out!) and the food is fantastic!! Their sauces are not just the normal Carolina vinegar and alternative ketchup based, but they have 4 options, my favorite being the smoked jalapeño awesomeness.  Wings are big and meaty and grilled, so you can pick your bbq.  I had a monster sized salad with shredded pork that lasted for the next day's meal too.   I will be back to make sure I have one of everything on the menu....twice!

EDIT: So I've been back since my first review. I didn't edit it, because it still wasn't all that great to me.  I got a call from some friends to come out for lunch. "Sure, where to?" I asked. "Midwood," they said. "Ugh. Well, ok," I replied. I went back begrudgingly, but with an open mind to try something new. This time I got the Red Neck Cobb. It was lunch, and I didn't want a sandwich or anything too heavy. The salad was a good portion, with plenty of smoked turkey, bacon, and other goodies on top.
