Much to my surprise, I really liked the turkey! Just enough smoke flavor, a bit dry, but very tasty nonetheless.  One friend had the special of "Burnt Edges" with a Dr. Pepper barbecue sauce. This was very good, too. I could tell it might get to be a bit rich, but again another pleasant surprise.  I will go back again and be more open to trying other items on the menu. --------------------------------------   Hmmm, I wonder if I ate at the same place as the other reviewers?  Took the fam there to try it out. Right away I was excited because the service is great!  I ordered the small bbq plate, with mac & cheese as my side. Well, for $9.95 I expected more. I got a very small portion of bbq, 3 very tiny drops of hush puppies, and an appropriate size of mac & cheese. (Is this the americanization of large portions in me to expect a bit more? Perhaps...) But truly I don't think it mattered. I was unimpressed with the bbq.  Hubs ordered the appetizer wings as his dinner. And he was unimpressed, too. The wings were dry (both in texture and no sauce). I gave him my eastern style bbq sauce to dip them in, and that helped.  However, the surprise dinner we both thought was really good was for the kid - the sloppy joe was really good. (Made with the brisket.)  All in all, I might give it another shot. But only until I see some more yelpers out there saying that the food cost is more reasonable to the portion. And that the bbq has gotten better. Will probably go back for night beers with friends, and maybe some apps (I heard the bacon wrapped jalapenos are good...).  I give the food 2 stars and the service 5 stars.

First time at this location. I've been to the Original location a lot. We walk in the server was in over her head and there was nobody there. She sat the bigger group that was behind us entering the building before sh sat us... A smaller group. The table she sat us at was avail when we walked in, it took about 7 minutes to get our table. The water they served us had a bad taste. Our meals were not as good as the original location. Burnt Ends & BBQ Plate.

I was in the area for work and had stopped by to try the bbq. Had the combo platter with corn, bacon jalepenos and hush puppies. Very nice atmosphere with outdoor seating and a very friendly staff. I'll be the first to admit that I'm not a big fan of the vinegar based Carolina style bbq. With that said, I thought the bbq here was really good. The brisket and porks ribs were the best. The ribs had a touch of sweetness and all the meats had a decent smoke flavor. The pulled pork was too tangy for me and seemed a bit mushy. Overall worth a stop if you're in town.

I came here because of a recommendation from my boyfriend. Excellent food, excellent service. As soon as we walked in we were politely greeted by the hostess. Although we were told the wait would be 20 minutes, it only ended up being 10! Our waitress was attentive and was helpful in menu decisions. I settled with the Carolina Pork BBQ small plate. It was delicious! The portion was a lot larger than I would have expected. I will definitely come here again.

Disappointed. I have tried this place twice....hoping the second time would be better, but it wasn't.  Both times, servers were less than friendly, were upset if you just felt like drinking iced tea with your lunch, and whatever you do, don't ask for extra bbq sauce - it might not be part of her job description that day.   Ordered tacos - brisket tacos might as well have bee called beef jerky tacos because the meat was dry and there was a sliver of avocado so the bite I took stuck to the roof of my mouth. The Chicken taco was GREAT! The jalepeno in the middle was still very crunchy, but the taco overall was good!  Nachos - not good. The server said it was homemade queso - which apparently translates to melted shredded cheese.  The Chili was good. Good flavor and texture. I like the other restaurants within this group, but this one really let me down.   For good BBQ go to Mac's on South Blvd.

This is only to do with the food not the service - ribs were garbage. Bones breaking off in meat. Lots of fat not a lot of meat. Hard to eat because of bones and fat. From the BBQ I've tried in Nashville, Kansas City, Chicago, Houston / Austin / Dallas and other cities this was not a good showing for Charlotte.

I used to love coming to this location but something seems to have changed in the past few months. First the food is always good here. Their burnt ends are my favorite.  The first bad experience the waitress charged my card for more than what was specified and did who knows what with the cash we gave her to go towards the bill. It took 3-4 calls to get a manager to assist me they refunded me the difference but didn't seem that concerned. I just recently visited this past Sunday and was so disappointed. When i ordered my drink it was watered down from where the tea was still warm. This caused it also to be unsweet. My waiter didnt come to check on me as I had just received my meal but couldnt eat it without a beverage. I had to ask the person bringing out drinks to help me. Because of this my food was cold. The waiter had 3-4 tables at the most so I wouldnt expect such horrible service. When i was ready to leave and asked to take my leftover meal home I was given random containers to pack it up on my own. Then when I gave the waiter cash for the bill and told him I would need change. He didnt come back with it and was trying to send me on my way. I had to let him know about the miscommunication which he didnt seem so happy about. I've taken many people out to dinner at this location but really not sure if I want to go back. I left disappointed.
So disappointed!  The burnt ends were dry and tough. The side of Mac and cheese was barely warm.

Two words....burnt.ends. Cubed pieces of tender brisket vines eat like a luscious piece of braised short ribs. Perfect combination of texture from the crust, softer meat, fat and sauce.   Food: 8.75/10 Atmosphere: 8 Service 7.5  Overall 8/10
Love midwood smokehouse. We eat there at least once a week, and it is always consistently delicious. The smoked wings are some of the best, and the service is always good.

Tried the smoked wings, pimento cheese fries, moist brisket, ribs, and burnt ends.   The smoked wings have some amazing flavor and goes really well with their bbq sauce. No complaints about the cheese fries.  Moist brisket was the meat I liked best. Ribs and burnt ends were decent but the brisket was the star of the meal. If you've ever had moist brisket from Rudy's in Texas, you'll have no issues devouring the brisket at Midwood.  Service here was great.

Excellent meal, excellent service. GREAT FLAVORS! The Mac n cheese is great as was the bacon wrapped jalapeño.  Probably not cardiologist approved.... If you like BBQ this is a must! The Pecan cobbler was a great way to finish off the meal.  Parking is scarce though.
I hate bbq everything. except mcd's bbq sauce on my fries. Midwood blew me away, I tried things I never thought I would and loved them. Our waitress was super friendly. Definitely check it out!

Excellent barbecue! I love the ribs and the brisket! If your undecided it's best to get the variety " pig out " choice on the menu. It gives you four choices of meats and two sides. It a fantastic introduction! Make sure you order dessert too!

Midwood Smokehouse has almost become a weekly experience for me.  Best BBQ in Charlotte and I would have given it 5 HUGE stars up until a month or so ago. Menu changed but unfortunately so did the portions, consistency and, to a lesser extent, the service. (on one visit... me: "excuse me the roll for this sandwich is stale." server: " oh, i'm sorry" *smiling and staring* me: *picking at the insides of my sandwich* "you might want to tell the kitchen." server "ok." *walks away*  aaaand scene.)  For now i'll blame the change and continued growing pains but c'mon MSH let's step it up!

This is my first Yelp and I felt after eating here I needed to warn people about this Sub par bbq place because there are so many better options for NC BBQ in the area. Felt like i consumed a salt shaker with sub par service.  Had to stop at a gas station to get water after our meal, i was so thirsty.  Sides were good.  Mac and Cheese, BBQ Baked Beans, Fries, Hushpuppies (although on the small side).  Ribs were meaty but oversalted so there were hard to finish.  Same with the Chopped Pork.  The brisket was fatty.  The only thing that was worthwhile was the sausage.  Don't know why people would wait here to eat because you are better off going somewhere else for BBQ.

I can die happy now. Probably the best BBQ place I've been to so far. A great menu with the most flavorful pork I've ever had. I started with the pimento cheese fries and fell in love. Just make sure you have at least 3 other people with you because this plate is huge. I'm definitely going back to try the rest of the menu here. Whatever you get, I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

I have been to Midwood Smokehouse a couple times but I felt my last experience deserved to be reviewed.  To start, the food as always was delicious.  I usually go for the ribs but our server had suggested the burnt ends and they were phenomenal.  Will definitely be ordering them again in the future.  The banana pudding is the best I've ever had.  My only complaint is the music- needs a lot of improvement. They had also ran out of a beer that I wanted but our server, Jennifer, gave me similar options and I ended up picking one I liked even better than my first choice.  She was very friendly and knowledgeable- excellent service and good at her job.  I also appreciate the manager checking in on us to see how we were doing.  Great food and service, just work on the music (type and volume).

The hostess was horrible. She didn't pay attention to us and seemed like we were disturbing her by requesting a table. She took our phone number down wrong so we never received our text when our table was ready. Other than the initial poor experience, the food was good. We had a little bit of everything. The ribs and chicken were better than the pulled pork, in my opinion. The pork had a plastic after taste. The neighborhood and atmosphere was nice. I'd probably go back, hut the service was a huge turn off for me.

I LOVE Midwood Smokehouse. Everything I have tried has been prepared wonderfully.The salads are fresh and all of their dressings are homemade. I love the Salmon Sammie, grilled cheese,(be sure to add the beef brisket) and of course the sweet potato fries..they are to die for!!!  You can split a half rack of ribs easily with another person, the portion is that big! We come at least once a week and have never left disappointed!!

I ordered the Cuban sandwich which was very good. The pork that was on the sandwich was smoked well and very tasty! There were a few things I was disappointed in, however, one of which being the habanero barbeque sauce they had. I am a fan of all things spicy, and I was expecting a pretty big kick from the sauce. I was disappointed that the sauce was actually extremely mild with hardly any spice at all. Also, the smoked vegetables were not really that flavorful and had kind of an odd taste to it. All in all, I will definitely come back because I had very few complaints about the place. The jalepenos were also delicious :)
Fantastic brisket and burnt ends. Love the bacon wrapped jalapeños poppers.  Baked beans very good and nice selection of draft beer.
The brisket at Midwood Smokehouse is the best in Charlotte hands down.  I never had the Q because everytime I come back, I get the brisket!
This is one of my favorite bbq places in Charlotte. You must get the beef brisket - it is so tender. And I have not had a bad side there yet - really loved the creamed corn and the baked beans!!!
Of course, the Cuban sandwich and the cheese stuffed, bacon wrapped, jalapenos are a must.
The burnt ends and ribs are always delicious.  The sampler platter is more than enough for sharing and has something for everyone.
Best BBQ in Charlotte -- and I've had it all! The mac and cheese is incredible, too. I love this place!

Gotta say, good stuff. Yes indeed the jalapeño bacon poppers are insanely good. My first bite I thought good then I started thinking about the tastes in my mouth and are most if the appetizer plate. Must have.   I tried the BBQ sandwich and it was delicious. Much smokier than typical eastern vinegar based. Loved it with cole slaw. (The creamy version not the BBQ slaw) yummy.  I has to sample my tables choices as will and the Mac and Cheese is worthy of every 8 year old, the baked beans had a great twist with some tomatoes and a tiny bit of pork and the sweetness was perfect. The curly fries were Fab too.  Add to that a great selection if on tap beer, friendly staff? Quick service and I will be back. Nice job Smokehouse.

I was here recently and not in the mood for meat, so I ordered several of their side items. You can order 4 sides for the cost of $9.  Order was as follows:  Sweet potato fries-cut approximately the size of shoestrings. Lightly salted and a nice mixture of crispy and softly cooked pieces. (I prefer the softly cooked.) There were several in my party, and everyone who sampled them enjoyed them.  Baked beans-flavorful with the tangy sweetness of bbq sauce, and small amounts of meat added in. Not sure what type of meat it was, but it was very tender.   Sweet creamed corn-corn had a nice smoky, peppery flavor, but the cream sauce seemed a little greasy, and the corn was undercooked.  Mac and Cheese-No flavor, just pasta with some cheddar cheese added in. Also had several overcooked bites.  Texas toast-Cost $1.00 extra, and they serve you 4 pieces. It was overcooked, almost to the point of being burnt.  I also received hush puppies with my order, and they were soft, chewy, with a little bit of sweetness, and very good.  Banana pudding-very good, and they serve you a fair amount. I would definitely return just for this!

Great Carolina BBQ place! First time having Carolina style BBQ and this place was awesome.  Pulled pork - awesome.  Brisket - awesome. St. Louis ribs - awesome.  Hush puppies - F'in awesome! Actually the first time I had them and were so good I ordered an additional side order for dessert.  Definitely look for this place if you are in Charlotte.

Fantastic food and service.  We tried the Mac and cheese, baked beans, collard greens, bacon wrapped jalapeños, fat and lean beef brisket and the hush puppies. Good food almighty it was all great.  The collard greens had big chunks of ham hock, the beans were spicy and the Mac & cheese was cooked to perfection. I would recommend going with the lean brisket and not mixed. We will be back!

Great service, fast and delicious food. Hush puppies and 4 meat combo, nothing was dry, highlights were ribs and fatty brisket.  Baked beans were fantastic too. Rarely fully impressed with BBQ joint but everything here was a winner!
Not much to say. Great barbecue and great atmosphere. The ribs and burnt ends are highly recommended but I haven't tried anything I don't like. I always walk out satisfied.
The best brisket in Charlotte. Mac & cheese is good as well. The pulled pork is a tad over seasoned but still tasty.   The beer and bourbon selection is very good.
I like their stuff. They have ribs and chop barbeque that I like. I know I will have a great meal whenever I go there. And neatless to say I go there about ones a week.
I have eaten a lot off BBQ in a lot of places and this is amazing.  Nice smoke to it, seasoned perfect, now drowned out in sauce...you add the amount you want.

We are longtime fans of Midwood Smokehouse. Consistently good food and great cocktails. But I have to give a special compliment to the current waitstaff. Last night we had a great server- funny, efficient, and had some great ordering suggestions (plus, she knew the beer list so well!)- but the server at the table next to us should win some kind of medal. An older, disabled lady was dining alone and had a large number of take out boxes. Her server offered to help by taking the lady's boxes out to her car for her and met her at the door with the car keys. I was really moved. Nice job, Midwood Smokehouse!

This used to be my favorite bbq place in Charlotte, but the last several times the pork has been very fatty. Sorry Midwood, Mac's and Queen City Q have you beat. P.S. 3-stars because the beef brisket is very tasty.

So me and my friend are BBQ lovers and we wanted to try out this place.    First off, finding the place was a little tricky and the parking can be a hassle as well. We went on a Friday night and it was not too crowded. We sat at the bar area because we did not want to wait for a table and the aroma was making me hungry!  We ordered the fried pickles and the smoked wings for an appetizer. The fried pickles were good. Not the best in Charlotte, but good. The smoked wings however were great and had some flavor to them. We got a combo platter to share because we wanted to try everything. We got the smoked turkey, pork ribs, pulled pork, and the brisket with 2 sides. The sides we got were the mac n cheese and fries. OMG!!! Everything on that plate was fantastic and we had no complaints at all.   I can't speak for her, but I know I will be coming back here again. Especially for those yummy flavorful ribs!!!

Awesome.  This place has awesome BBQ.  It's really busy all the time so I recommend getting there early.  The portions are way to big but you get to try everything.  The pimento cheese fries rock and you don't need the meat on them unless you want to into a food coma before dinner.  I was surprised that the brisket was so well cooked.  They obviously take their time making it because it's really tender.  They have a large beer selection supporting the local Charlotte breweries among others.    Service was fast and they have a knowledgeable wait staff.  I also have ordered their bulk to-go food for parties and was not disappointed except for the kitchen manager who was kind of a jerk on the phone.

This is the best brisket I've had in Charlotte.  I got a lean portion and it was juicy and flavorful and cooked to perfection.  My family was with me and said the pulled pork BBQ was the best they've ever had.  My Dad wanted to go there every night they were in town.  The sides were decent - I had potato salad and cole slaw.  The mac and cheese was supposedly pretty good.  The hush puppies were pretty awesome.  Table service was great.  We sat at a booth, which was comfortable.  They also had some high tops.  Four stars only because parking sucks.  The lot is way too small and you have to find another place to park if the lot is full.

Yummers.  This place was recommended by a few people I know who have been to Charlotte so we decided to check it out during our visit and it did not disappoint.  Hubs got a pork BBQ sandwich with fries and BBQ beans. I got the pulled chicken sandwich with sweet fries. The chicken had a mustard BBQ sauce which went well with the chicken and the fries were perfectly crisp and warm.  Overall a solid BBQ joint with excellent prices and very personable staff and service.

Had the brisket for lunch.  I was told it smoked for 16 hours and I believe it! The meat had great flavor and melted in my mouth, no need to saturate it with sauce.  Inside or patio seating available, nice atmosphere and good service.
Love the food. This is my new barbecue place- sorry Mac's. Usually the side items at any place are ok, but the beans, bacon wrapped jalepenos are awesome.

The BBQ here is the bomb!  No sauce required, it's moist tender and just plain delicious.  I still put sauce on though, just because sauce is the boss!   Beer specials on Friday or Saturday would be good, but I understand why they don't have them.   It's not exactly a budget friendly place with $12 plates and $4 beers, but it's totally worth it!  From burnt ends to BBQ to bacon wrapped jalapeños, it's all good here! Make sure to check in early or you'll get stuck with quite a wait...but hey if you do, just drink awesome beer. +1 to the music too, just my style with all the classic rock!
One of the best bbq joints in Charlotte. I had the bbq sandwich...simply amazing. Fries and fried pickles were good too. Definitely will return.

Great 'Cue + Ambiance + Killer Service = Feeling REAAAL Good. (Bloated, but real good bloated!)  After spending 3 years living in the Kansas City, eating some of the BEST BBQ in the country, it's pretty hard to stack up to a Gates or Jack Stack's (5 Stars IMO) but the service and ambiance really bump this place up to 5 stars for me.   My husband and I went here for lunch on a Saturday, when it was packed. Even so, we were seated quickly, and had our unsweetened iced teas on the table within 2 minutes.  Our server gave us some recommendations-- but I would have liked if she "sold" some of her favorites better.  (The chicken salad is good...the chili is our special of the day...I like the mustard sauce.)   What our server did do, was offer us options.  My husband wanted a pork and brisket sandwich, but since it wasn't on the menu, our server said he could get the brisket, and add a $3 side of pulled pork, and she'd give us a buttered bun.    Our server recommended the chicken salad so I got that on lettuce leaves, roasted corn, tomatoes, red onion, cheese and orange honey mustard on the side.  The chicken salad is good, no doubt, but didn't have the smoky flavor I was hoping for.  If this wasn't at a BBQ joint, it would be A+.   When our server learned we were 1st timers, she brought us samples of each of the house sauces.  A mustard based one (sweet and thick, really nice), a hot and spicy tomato-based, a regular tomato-base and a Carolina vinegar based.) Alongside were 4 hushpuppies for dipping.  We appreciated this and were able to decide which one we wanted with our meats.   The real star...  Frank, the owner came over to us, and we started chatting.  When he learned we were first timers at his restaurant, and that we were from KC, immediately offered to bring us two of his ribs to try.  He explained how he smokes his meats everyday, (unlike Mac's Speedshop, where the meat is smoked somewhere else and then brought in...I was not surprised) and only used hickory wood to smoke.    The ribs were tender and fell off the bone.  The outside is extra seasoned and some would say salty, but to me, it was perfect.  All that spice and salt permeated the outside and helped seal in the juices of the meat.  Tender, moist...didn't need sauce.   My macaroni and cheese side was good-- as were the sweet potato fries.   The BRISKET was unreal.  You can pick lean, fatty, or both, and I recommend getting the "both" option. Tender, juicy, nice browned bits from the outside. LOVE.   Note: They have crushed ice here-- bonus!  $2 small banana pudding super creamy-- wafer cookies IN the pudding and on top.  NOT YELLOW. Delish.   Overall, the casual, but rich, warm interior and mirrored bar area really made us feel welcome.  Nice patio area too. Lots of drink specials daily.   Looking forward to going back!

Visited here around dinner hours and it wasn't too busy.  Ordered the fried pickles and they were actually the best that I had eaten in quite some time.  Wife wanted a mix drink and she ordered a Mai Tai.  Big mistake, the bartender wasn't at all experienced.  The waiter brought a small shaker glass full of this blue mess.  It tasted as if they just poured the two rums in a glass and sent it on its way.  I asked the waiter to take it back and put it in a bigger glass with some pineapple and orange juice.  When it came back it was sour and did not taste at all like a drink should be.  Told the waiter it wasn't good at all and he did nothing about it. My wife ordered the BBQ sandwich with slaw and hush puppies.  I ordered the small chopped plate with fries and the plate had some kind of onions soaked in vinegar and hush puppies.  This place had to have the worst BBQ that I have ever eaten.  The BBQ was mushy and just didn't taste right at all.  The hush puppies seemed doughy and the fries and slaw were actually good. The atmosphere of the place was cheerful and upbeat.  The staff was super nice.  Too bad the food wasn't all that good.

We came here based on the reviews and I must say I agree with the ratings.   I had the traditional pulled pork and was very pleased. Very little fat and the taste was great. The sweet potato fries were the perfect side.   Service was great. Our waitress was very attentive and our meals came out really fast, especially considering that we were here at 12 noon.

What a refreshing modern take on barbecue!  The decor, music and drinks were fabulous. The premium sides could use some special attention, but overall the food was satisfying.  I would definitely return for round 2:).
Mmmmmmmmmmm good! Edges out Macs (also a fav). We've been here 3 times now and each time was fan-tas-tic!

After having been to city smoke, mckoys, mac's and saucepan's, this place is by far the best. The grilled veggies are delicious and I love the combo plates you can get with different meats and sides. The bar area with high top tables are a nice edition because you can catch a game during dinner. No complaints about service or quality of the food! Only downside is parking is a little scarce during peak hours.

I am a pescatarian and also have a weird wheat allergy so basically I'm an extremely difficult person to eat with. My husband eats all the things and especially adores ribs and any BBQ. I was initially very hesitant to eat here as the only thing I can get is the salmon with a side of veggies and that can get boring. I was wrong. We eat here all the time, I'd probably eat their salmon every night if I could. It's alarmingly good. I mean possibly the best salmon I've ever had good. And according to my husband every other thing on the menu is also amazing.  The service is consistently great. Once we had an obviously new and overwhelmed server on a busy night, she kept forgetting things and we felt bad for her, and instead of getting angry the manager and other servers just pitched in and were extra friendly. It's always great to see supportive coworkers and customers who are so thrilled with their food that they don't get all rude and complain-y about some occasional mishaps. 10/10 would recommend.

Midwood smokehouse is a welcomed new addition to the neighborhood.  They have awesome beer specials every day during the week that go great with whatever 'cue you order.  I had the Texas style brisket yesterday and it was to die for.  No knife necessary, most tender brisket I've ever eaten at a barbecue joint.  The bacon wrapped jalepenos are delicious.  The first time I had them they were very spicy ad second time not as much. (I preferred the spicier version).  Smoked vegetable special was divine--portabellas, squash, onion, and more cooked in their custom made smoker to perfection.  The smoke flavor brought out the meatiness in the fresh veggies without overwhelming them.  Will definitely be visiting Midwood Smokehouse regularly.  Brisket is a must.

I have been to Midwood 4 times so far and the previous three experiences have been excellent.  Unfortunately, I went  last night with a table of four and the service was not up to par.    We elected to sit outside instead of wait on a table inside.  We ended up waiting anyway because no one greeted us for 15 minutes.  As a server I understand sometimes when its busy you may be unaware that you have been sat so I went inside to inform the hostess we had yet to be greeted.  Our server (Jessica, I believe) then showed up and took drink orders.  I asked if there were any specials and she said no.  (I found out as I left that there were $5 vodka drinks on special.)  After she tried to push appetizers we ordered our meals.  A food runner brought them out to us and my order was wrong.  He walked away while another runner brought out the second two orders which were correct.  My order was brought back out and the runner claimed the correct side item would follow.  Another side was brought but it too was wrong and he left so quickly I was unable to tell him so.  The entire time our server did not check on us once.  My boyfriend had to leave the table, track her down and ask again for the correct side along with some extra sauce (she did not ask what sauce he wanted with his pulled pork to begin with.)   When she finally returned with the correct items (without a single apology) I was nearly done with my main dish.  Don't get me wrong; I don't expect a barbecue place to be fine dining.  However I do expect prompt, courteous service in any restaurant and unfortunately, this time around I did not get either.  I will return though;  that pulled pork is too good to pass up!  Hopefully next time the service will match their food.

Just an update to my previous review:  I'm not certain if they changed the brisket sandwich for good...but it's now on a toasted bread with much less blue cheese.  Very good!  I also feel the need to mention the Cuban.  I imagine that many people overlook something like a Cuban sandwich while at a barbecue joint.  I too, tend to be one of those people...until now.  I am truly thankful, that I can so easily step outside of my box. But...now I feel like I'm going to be stuck for a while.  The Cuban sandwich is SO good.  I mean...really, really good!  P.S.  Did I mention how good the Cuban is?   Try:  Really??  Avoid:  Not trying some sweet potato fries for your side...very nice

I had the combination platter so I can say it with confidence: everything is good! The brisket is insanely juicy and the sausage has just the right spice. Everything has a strong, distinctive hickory flavor, just the way it's supposed to be. On top of that, they have a nice selection of local beer and Chad the barman knows his stuff. Will come back for sure!

Another reviewer claimed this is not AUTHENTIC NC BBQ, he's right. Real hickory smoked pork BBQ is almost impossible to find, both in NC and SC! I've made trips to nationally rated BBQ joints in both states, Sweatman's, Scott's, BBQ King and Lexington, among others. None are close to Midwood to me. If you don't like smoked meats then this is not the place for you. But if you do, you won't find any better. Moist and tasty, don't ruin this by putting sauce on it. Kudos to Hayley, an excellent waitress on two occasions I have been. To management, make a trip to Pit BBQ in Griffin Ga for some outstanding Brunswick Stew. You would make a killing as a side here in Charlotte. And gluten free, please.

Over-rated . Noisy. Mediocre service.  The chicken and ribs were dried out and not hot enough. My wife's burger was over cooked and tasteless. But the smoked veggies were excellent.  Won't be going back.

Fantastic BBQ and service! We were in from out of town and looking for a good place to eat. We chose Midwood based upon other reviews and were not disappointed. The smoked salmon was cooked to perfection and the smoked meats were extra smoky - deliciously infused with hickory. The collard greens are a must too!  Be sure to say hi to EC too!

Excellent pulled pork tacos, brisket and ribs. Collards and mac n cheese were great as well. Service was excellent. We were in town from TN doing some shopping and stopped here because of the excellent reviews. We were not disappointed.

I was impressed with Midwood before I even arrived, their wide ranging menu features lots of options, including some unique items like pimento cheese fries and bacon wrapped jalapenos. The experience did not disappoint. Patrons are seated by the hostess and it's a full service dining experience. I was really hungry - I ordered the large Carolina pork plate and a pound of smoked wings. The plate was a good deal with generous portion size for $13+tax. The smoked wings didn't seem like quite as good of a value at $8+tax, but still an ok deal. Everything was served piping hot. The hushpuppies were a bit tough. The mac and cheese was spectacular, great flavor. I tried their smoked vegetables (squash, zucchini, peppers) which had good flavor/seasoning, and are a nice option to offer. The pulled pork was juicy with very little fat. The vinegar based sauce did not add much flavor to the meat, but I don't think it needed sauce to dress it up, seemed good as is. The wings were ok, the BBQ sauce on them seemed to be different from the sauce on the table, more tomato based and did have a slight bit of a peppery kick. I'd like to try them again with the ranch instead. I topped it off with the pecan cobbler with ice cream, which is probably a little overpriced at $5.50+tax. The pecans were a little over-cooked for my taste, it seemed like too much of a burnt flavor.   This place was hopping during the middle of dinner time on a weekday night. Their outdoor seating was comfortable given the pleasant temperature during my visit. I definitely want to come back and try out some of their other menu options.

We had family night here Monday night. Our waiter Andrew was awesome. He recommended pull pork, and tacos. Which was delicious.  All the food we tasted was good. Thank you Andrew!  The manager recommend "banana pudding " yo this is soooooo good. If u come here please try their banana pudding and their pull pork.    This is my family new spot when we are in Charlotte nc.

So, finally made it here to eat their famous barbeque.  There are limited choices for me because I have celiac disease. I wish they would work on their menu  for those of us. I did try the barbeque , and it was delicious. Great atmosphere and definitely go for the drinks !!

I definitely recommend visiting this restaurant. I came here on a friend's recommendation and I was not disappointed! The staff was friendly and helpful, and the food was great!  We started off with the Queso cheese appetizer and we added brisket to it. This was the first time I had meat with Queso and it was great! I ordered the large sized BBQ Pulled Chicken with BBQ coleslaw, and sweet potato fries, the meal comes with hush puppies and sweet onions on the side. The meal ready by the time we were through with our appetizers. I was definitely full by the time was done!  They have tv's throughout with ESPN on, so I'll definitely be back here for the games.

1st time here today. OUTSTANDING. The food and service was some of the absolute best since moving here a year ago.  Paul S. our friend for the night was nothing short of amazing. Attentive and so polite, I never felt hovered over or uncomfortable. He was genuinely happy to help.  We had pulled pork nachos, pulled chicken sandwich with slaw and hushpuppies, and a chicken bacon sandwich. I could have eaten it all with my eyes alone. So glad to have used my mouth instead!   Hushpuppies were hot and crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. We had freshly cooked tortilla chips with that DELICIOUS dip of nacho sauce and tender pulled pork. The slaw and mustard sauce that came with my sandwich were seriously good enough to eat on their own.   I will ABSOLUTELY come back with my friends and family when they visit. The service and choice of drink specials kept me intrigued enough to do so. Thanks so much to the hostess and Paul today!

Midwood Smokehouse was good! I went there with two friends a few Fridays ago. We ordered fried pickles and a wing special for appetizer. We also ordered bourbon slush (not quite sure of the name) drinks. OMG drinks were so delicious! I didn't try the wings, but the fried pickles were good.  For dinner I had the brisket (I ordered 'both' - fatty and lean). Brisket was SO good. My friends ordered the BBQ chicken and the pulled pork. The pork was a bit disappointing, not sure if it was the sauce we didn't like but it just tasted a little off. The chicken was good, but the real standout was the brisket - I'd definitely recommend that. We wanted to try to the banana pudding but we were so full after all of the food. So, we will have to return for some pudding and ribs!
Dinner was delicious, service was prompt and friendly, and portions were enormous. Highly recommend.

I was in town visiting my brother.  They really wanted to take us for Carolina BBQ, so Midwood was the place.  Great atmosphere.  Before we even opened up our menus, our waitress told usbtheyvwere out of ribs.  For me, no big deal, I don't like them.  But a BBQ place with no ribs,  at 7pm on a weekend evening?  I ordered the brisket dinner.  It came with hush puppies and I got mac and cheese and the bacon wrapped jalapenos.   The food was amazing.  My brother who was disappointed there were no ribs, got tacos.  One of each type, brisket, pork and chicken I think, and he loved them all. Also ordered was the BBQ Burnt Ends and the Pulled Pork sandwich both of which were enjoyed.  Food was served quickly, but we never felt rushed.  We will be back next time I'm in town.  4 stars just because of the ribs.

This place serves it right when its gone its gone for the day.  This bbq comes straight from that days smoke as real as it can be.  You want ribs better be there before 7:00 they had 73 slabs when I ordered they were down to 18 for the day.  Now about the food ribs have a great bite, burnt ends tossed in a beer bbq sauce ununbelievably delicious. Jalapeno bacon wrapped poppers rock and the pecan cobler with vanilla is a sweet sensation.  Great selection of local and national crafted brew.  Come with family or friends the staff is great as much as the atmosphere.  Thanks Richie, Midwood will be a must and a goto landmark for Charlotte.
Great bbq and the sides are incredible!  There's something for everyone and a fun place to go.

Best BBQ place in Charlotte hands down. The portions are huge and the service is usually pretty quick. I wish they had a sweet BBQ sauce but I can go to Sonny's to get my fix for that. Never had anything I didn't enjoy here!

I went there with my husband and son, after my husband was at the original Midwood Smokehouse in Plaza Midwood and thought it was great.  To be honest the meal was OK nothing over the moon.  My husband told me I have to try their other location.
Awesome! Delicious, best barbecue in the south! Amanda, best waitress You will love all the meats but the hush puppies, Cole slaw are fantastic. Please open one in Greensboro!

Had beef brisket and Burnt ends very very good for both. Save room for the pecan  cobbler a must! We have never had poor service here all servers are friendly and know the menu well.  Only suggestion is they should give a basket of hushpuppies to you when you sit down that is the sign of a true Bar B que joint.
Best brisket in Charlotte - no sauce require....  but the Midwood sauce is great. And I love that the baked beans are more like chili than anything else.

Just moved to Charlotte and had my second try at NC BBQ. Turns out Midwood smokehouse is in my backyard, which in turn happens to be extremely dangerous for a BBQ nut like myself. The food was incredible. The chili was smoky and not overpoweringly spicy. The wings (both the menu ones and a garlic buffalo special) were incredible. 2 very different flavors and textures, but 2 very successful, meaty sets of wings. Finally, the pulled pork was delicious. I'm from up north so the whole vinegar style sauce is new to me. This place made me a real fan of it!  On top of the food, the vibe and decor is fantastic. Everyone was extremely friendly and thanked us for stopping in. They made you feel like a part of the neighborhood and that we were doing them a favor...when in fact they did me and my stomach a huge favor! Can't wait to go back.

I'd heard mixed reviews about this place, but being a huge fan of BBQ, I figured I'd try it myself. The first thing that jumped out at me was the Bacon-wrapped Jalapenos. The same company does this app at Paco's Tacos and Tequila in South Park, the difference being that at Midwood, they remove the seeds, so that you may actually enjoy the flavor. The bacon was on the chewy side, but the flavor was right. Then again, it seems hard to mess up anything w/ Bacon, Cheese, and Jalapenos. Being of small frame, I thought it best to jump right into their "North Carolina BBQ" before I filled up on apps. I must say, it was very,very good. I opted for the vinegar based sauce, but there are other options. Honestly, it didn't need sauce, it was done properly. That is to say, it really is authentic, slow smoked BBQ. As far as ambiance, service, and all the other fixins, I'll just say, It's a BBQ joint, I didn't expect much, and was not disappointed. I have been back, and will go again.

I had the baked chicken and it was okay. The food was alright but I truly didn't understand the hype. I would definitely try it again but this time I would try a different meal. Again the baked chicken was okay, a little dry and not flavorful. For sides I had the hush puppies, collard greens and mac and cheese. The sweet tea was alright. They didn't have enough variety in sauces. I like more sweet sauces and I didn't find anything that I liked.

Brisket here is amazeballs. Love their pickled onions and the bacon wrapped jalapenos. They used to have this brisket chili that was the best chili I've ever had and they took that off the menu. WHY?!  It really made me sad. I'm still sad about it actually.

Dare I say it? Midwood Smokehouse has the best barbecue I've had inside Charlotte's city limits.  I know, I know, that's not a bold claim to make, but the barbecue here is seriously good. This is four-star barbecue, my friends. The pulled pork is tender and juicy, although I think a lot of that juice comes from the vinegar sauce it's dunked in. In addition to a vinegar-based sauce, there's also a mustard-based sauce and a more traditional KC-style sauce, which are all pretty solid.  But as good as the barbecue is (and, trust me, it's pretty damn good), the real stars here are in the other parts of the menu. The smokehouse veggies are as good as veggies cooked for hours in a smoker should be. The macaroni and cheese is the real stuff with the crust on top and lots of cheesy goodness. And the chopped salad? Could be one of my favorite salads in Charlotte. Tons of fresh veggies including smoked corn cut off the cob. Let me say that again. SMOKED CORN CUT OFF THE COB.  But there are two things that bump this up from a four-star, solid barbecue joint review, into OH-EM-GEE, THIS IS WHAT DREAMS ARE MADE OF: The pimento cheese fries and the Kentucky Slush Puppy.  The pimento cheese fries are just what you'd expect -- crinkle-cut fries smothered with melted pimento cheese, a mound of pulled pork and just enough green onion for some bite. Yes, this will give me a heart attack, but it will be worth it.  And the Kentucky Slush Puppy is a grownup slurpee made with lemonade and bourbon. Yes, that's right. A bourbon slurpee. Thank you, Midwood Smokehouse.
Best bbq I have ever had. Been searching for something comparable ever since I've been here with no luck.
Excellent brisket, sides and love the hush puppies that come with the dinner as well. I have been to this location twice visiting in the area and brought 2 sets of families and they both loved it!

I was going to go with 4 stars for this place, because the food is really good, but the wait staff is also spectacular, so that pushed it over the top.  I first tried this place on a whim, and took my whole family for my Dad's birthday. That's seven adults who went, plus a baby and a four year old that can't sit still. Our waitress was patient and prompt, and light-hearted about the whole thing (sometimes the people I love can be difficult customers :) )  I got the whole mix of tacos, and every one was mouthwatering. The coleslaw and hush puppies were divine.   This is my go-to place for BBQ in Charlotte!

I've been to this restaurant three times now.... the first two were very good. However my last visit was not so good.   The waiter Brian was anything but attentive. The large version of the burnt ends arrived cold. I  finally was able to grab a manager to send it back to be heated as Brian was no where in site. I ordered coffee with cream and he never asked if I wanted a refill... nor did he ever bring the cream I asked him for three times. And he never checked on us or asked if everything was alright until the end of the meal.   The bottom line.... the food is always tasty (when hot) but the service on this trip was simply horrid. I'm not sure if I will go back.

Visited the new Ballantyne location of Midwood Smokehouse yesterday for lunch. I was by myself and figured the location would be insanely crowded, but decided to walk in to see.  I've tried to talk my husband into going, but he's always adamant that he likes to give new restaurants "a month or so" to work out any kinks before he tries them. Since he was off doing something else for the afternoon, it was my chance to try it without him.  The restaurant was busy, but there was no wait and there were seats available at the bar. I grabbed a chair and ordered a PBR ($2.50 drafts!) and after a brief review of the menu, figured I'd try the side dishes/veggie combination plate instead of going for actual barbecue on this visit. I figure this way my husband can't get TOO upset that I went without him for my first visit!   I ordered the creamed corn, cole slaw and stuffed jalapenos. I was originally going to get hushpuppies as one of the items but Chad, the bartender, assured me my dish would come with a few since the platter of sides was considered a "plate". When it came out devoid of hushpuppies he noticed instantly and said to the foodrunner,  "We're going to need a side of hushpuppies and pickled onions for that." They were delivered right away. Thanks for having my back, Chad!  The creamed corn was delicious. I chose to believe it was "healthy" in spite of the clear abundance of well, cream, in the dish. I was least enthusiastic for the coleslaw, but it ended up being my favorite item on the plate! The 3 jalapenos were delicious, but a little small. I'm used to a friend's bacon-wrapped jalapenos which are not halved, and are enormous.   Some people have written that they find the hush puppies too sweet. I find them to be just perfect, no ketchup needed to enjoy! I also loved the pickled onions. I devoured everything on my plate quickly, and found it to be just the right amount of food. I've never had a chance to try all the delicious sides I've wanted, so this was a great opportunity.  Chad made me feel welcome and was very attentive, getting me a second PBR just before mine went empty. We shared some Words with Friends strategy during a moment of downtime, as he saw I was playing on my phone.  I was very impressed just watching Chad work. He handled a few carry out orders, and as each one showed up, he opened up all the containers to quality check them, and went back for a few items with each one. This restaurant, being so new, probably still has a little confusion going on, but he made sure every order was right, whether it was mine or the carryout orders.  All told, my bill was $12.99 for a delicious meal and 2 PBR's. The value for what I received can't be beat!  I was originally thinking I might be uncomfortable eating solo at what is so clearly a sit down family restaurant, but the bartenders were all very friendly, and it was such an enjoyable lunch I definitely see swinging by for more solo lunches in the future!

This place does not feel special. The Bloody Mary was not that good it was missing flavor and it came out of a bottle. The burnt ends were inconsistent. The bacon wrapped jalapeños were good. The baba sauce on the burnt ends was was solid throughout I would buy just the sauce. I don't think I need to come back here though to many other places to try.
I'm a native Texan and I have to say these Carolina boys know their way around a brisket I'm impressed.

I've been trying to find a go-to BBQ place in Charlotte for a while, but no more.  Everything here is fantastic, but I loved the pulled chicken with their mustard BBQ sauce.  I could take a bath in that stuff.  So good.  Go get yourself some.

One of the better places for BBQ in town. I always try to visit when in town and take many a business associate to try the local offerings. The food is plenty, the service fast and attentive, the prices reasonable, and the BBQ is good. Even off BBQ items like Salmon, and Salads are very tasty.

this is on my top 5 bbq joints in charlotte. I like the rubs and sauce they provide. I haven't tried everything on the menu but enough to fall in love with it. pulled pork sandwich with slaw is my fav so far. Parking can be a hassle but thats plaza/midwood for yah.
The nachos libre and Cuban sandwich were both great! The Spiced Boody Mary was perfect! Our service was great! Wish I had gone sooner.

YUM. So glad we stopped by while we were in town. I had the Texas style brisket sandwich with cheddar  and Mac and cheese and my PIC had the burnt ends with sweet potato fries. Both were delicious, great flavor, cooked perfectly, awesomeness. Great atmosphere too. Highly recommend.
Best BBq I have had. I've been to other states but NC was where I found mid wood smokehouse . Had the brisket, ribs and pulled pork and all were amazing. they even give you fat option on the brisket.

This place is GREAT!!!! The brisket melted in your mouth!!! The burnt ends was fabulous!!! So much flavor and the staff was so friendly! Would definitely recommend this place to friends!!! The portions were a good size too!
Stick to the PM location. Here you'll get lower quality service and food with noticeably smaller portions

Excellent ribs, B-B-Q pork, Mac-n-cheese and hush puppies.  Picked up all those things for some visiting "Northeners" and everyone went home very happy.  I even got to enjoy some leftovers the next day and things.  Great location, food and service.  Will go back after I burn off all those carbs.
When I want really good ribs close by, these are my go to. Fall off the bone tender and seasoned perfectly.

This is a fantastic restaurant with terrific staff, wonderful food, and a great atmosphere, all for the right price.  I took my family here (small kids included) and everyone came away stuffed to the rafters and eagerly wanting to not only come back, but recommend it to everyone else we know.  If you like barbecue, it's a must visit!
Love Midwood! All of the food is great, the environment rocks and the staff is excellent.
100% better than Mac's Speedshop. The best option for two people or more are the feast platters. I would suggest the collard greens as well.
AMAZING! We had the combo platter with 2 sides (Pig Out size). Split between 3 people and it was perfect! I dont live in NC, but if I'm ever back, I will definitely return!

Was looking for a place that served brisket in the area that had good reviews.  This place was a HOMERUN!!!!  Doc, the bartender was very kind, along with the rest of the staff working.  And the Brisket was right on point!!!  They even give you a choice of lean or fatty style! (you can go half and half too!).  Looking forward to going back with friends.  Well done Midwood!  Well done!

Ate lunch here yesterday, KILLER Q!!!! Is it as good as Lexington # 1, the world capital of bar b q? Well, i wouldn't go that far however, if you are looking for high quality Q in the city, this is THE PLACE, no doubt.
Food was delicious and the service was great as well. Turns out that I got a little food poisoning later in the night however. May have just been an unlucky batch of the Carolina pork.

The beef brisket is the best I've had in Charlotte.  You can order fatty, lean or both.  I ordered a combination of the two but next time it's 'diet be damned' as I'm ordering all fatty. Oh my goodness - very tender and flavorful with a large enough portion that you'll be all but begging for a doggie bag.  Service was on point.  I'll be back!

Outstanding! Great service, great food. I had the brisket (fatty, not lean!), sausage, sweet potato fries, baked beans. Brisket was awesome, but everything was good.  Waitress (Erin) was excellent.  Recommended!

Great restaurant, quality food and friendly staff. I highly recommend their food! Consistently delicious food that will not let you down. If you're wanting something specific call to make sure they have not run out because that does happen from time to time.

A great addition to South Charlotte.  Excellent food.  The pork is eastern NC style, which is not my preference, but everything else is so good. There are not many places that serve burnt ends, and it's worth going to Midwood just for that. Their smoked wings are really good, and the banana pudding is delicious.  The only problem is that it gets crowded and there is a wait during peak hours, but what else would you expect?

Went to the new location last week which was their first week open. For only being open a few days, the food was INCREDIBLE and the service was wonderful! The prices are very reasonable and the portions are very generous. Diverse menu with plenty of options to choose from. Huge selection of craft beers!    I ordered the pulled pork, which came with hush puppies (delicious) and a side item, I chose the delicious macaroni and cheese (seriously some of the best I've ever had). The people I went with ordered the salmon sammie with a side of greens, and the brisket with a side of sweet potato fries. For dessert we ordered the banana pudding which was the best I've ever had!! Everyone was more than happy with the quality of the food, the portion size, price, and great service. Definitely make a point to go here!!

The food was as good as the original restaurant on Central. I had the BBQ (burnt ends) with hush puppies, collard greens, and sweet potato fries. Our waitress was helpful to explain the different BBQ sauces. My wife had a salad, and macaroni and cheese (and shared some of my sides). There was also a good selection of draft beer. There was an issue with the taste of her salad, and our waitress changed it out to a regular salad. The manager came over twice to ask if we needed anything, and he wanted to make sure we were okay. Great service; makes you feel taken cared of! We enjoyed our visit, and will return.

Decided to add this place to our have tried list for BBQ  I personally think there flavor is a little to smokey for my liking ...the smokiest tasting anything I've ever tried ..I will say that they do have the BBQ nachos that are awesome ...cool divey  decor kinda biker bar ish cool place I thought ....

First time in Charlotte and found this place on Yelp.  I'm glad we did!  The food was great and our server Ashley was very helpful explaining what options we had.  My wife and I split the combo plate which included (moo, cluck and oink) brisket, pulled chicken, ribs and chopped pork.  We chose bbq beans and coleslaw for our sides.  We had plenty to eat and took the rest home for another meal all for $21!  The chicken with the mustard sauce was my favorite.

My first experience wasn't a very positive one. Meals were cold, service was slow. We ordered the popular bacon wrapped jalapeños and they were extremely cold and soggy, not good at all. The only upside to our visit was the manager on duty was very understanding and took off the plates that were cold. We were very excited to try this as we saw many positive reviews, sadly we will not be returning. Def not the best BBQ.

We started with the palmetto fries which were great. The beef brisket is the best I've had. We ordered a combination of the two both the pulled pork and brisket was very tender and flavorful with a large portion .  We'll be back! We need to try everything.
So good..you really can't go wrong with the brisket or the pulled pork.  Also, bacon wrapped Jalapenos..awesome. Nice beer selection too, which you can't be mad at.

Tonight was our first visit to Midwood Smokehouse, and we will definitely be back. In addition to the menu items and specials, they were offering "add-ons" so we were able to try additional meats with our meals. The crispy St Louis ribs were our favorite, but the stockyard tacos, burnt brisket ends, burnt pork ends, sausage, mac & cheese, and creamy coleslaw were all delicious. Our server, Bridgett, was wonderful, and all the staff were attentive and helpful. My only regret is that none of the food was actually HOT when it was served, but it was still very tasty. That's the reason for only 4 stars; otherwise, it would be 5.
Nothing special... Side items were good, but ribs were blah! I wouldn't make this a regular place..

We come to this place often and we enjoy there Bbq. My wife and I always order the hush puppies and they are great. I had the chopped pork which is good and the BBQ beans are great. My wife order the chopped salad with BBQ chicken on it. She enjoys that salad but says it was just ok this time. The large salad is very big so be ready to eat a lot if you order it.

Super yummy!!! I had the combo - ribs, brisket, pulled pork and sausage - ALL super flavorful and juicy meats. Sweet potato fries and smoked veggies are pretty on point too.  I love the outside seating & the street art on the back.

This place is hit or miss but I am giving it 4 stars solely based off the bacon wrapped jalepenos.  These bad boys are probably one of my favorite things to eat ever.  Wings are hit or miss and often cold (are very good when they are actually warm because of the unique smokiness).   The tacos are surprisingly good (especially the one with the bacon wrapped jalepeno!).  They usually have good beer specials and service is good.  Parking can be a pain because of all the construction.

I was pleasantly surprised by the BBQ here - so smoky and delicious! My dad and I agreed that it was great. My grandfather was a fan of the baked beans and I liked the flavor of the smoked vegetables. The fries and hushpuppies were pretty standard and the unsweet tea was a bit weak. The server was kind and patient and struck a good balance between not checking on us every minute and not ignoring us completely. In short: very pleasant experience and yummy BBQ. If you want to avoid the crowd, Thursday at 5 pm was pretty quiet!
Amazing bbq our waiter Matt was one of the best waiters I've ever had.  Can't wait to come back

Disclaimer: I was born and bred on pure Kansas City BBQ, so I'm trying not to let that bias me. Too much, at least.  With that being said, I'm a huge fan of BBQ either way and HAD to try some Carolina 'cue while I was out here. After some debate, we went Midwood since neither Kenzie K. or I had been here. Burnt ends were a little dry, and I had much higher expectations for the Fat Tire sauce (which I could barely taste). The Carolina Pork sandwich wasn't bad, and I'm glad that we at least were able to get samples of all of their sauces to try with it. Echoing what Kenzie said, the sides were a bit disappointing, especially the dry mac and cheese, and bottles of sauce would have been nice/preferred.  I wish I'd been visiting longer so I could have had some more meals to really develop an opinion on Carolina BBQ beyond Midwood. I'm optimistic for my next trip back and subsequent BBQ trials...
This place had great food and a plentiful supply of local craft beer- how can you go wrong?!  I had a special turkey sandwich.  Service was nice and friendly!

First off if anyone thinks that Mac's speed shop is good BBQ, you don't know BBQ!!  The food was amazing, Ive been looking for some good BBQ in Charlotte for a while now. Tried a whole bunch of different places and this is by far the best! The only reason it only gets 4 out of 5 stars is strictly because I have only been here once and I need to try some more of their food.   I ordered the "Super Bird" let me just say one word, AMAZING!! It was so so good, I also had some brisket which again was AMAZING, fall off the bone just like it should be! You can never go wrong with fried pickles and they do it right. It is not pickles chips like most places have but actual pickle slices. What this does is make it have more pickle flavor without all of the breading which is very good.The waitstaff is friendly and very inviting. That in itself is hard to find. We had the waiter Zach and he was great. Made a bunch of good recommendations on the menu and even other restaurants in the area.   A whole lotta people try BBQ and not many people can succeed and let me tell you, they go it right!

My wife and I were craving some southern bbq/ brisket type food, so we picked this place. We had small sizes of "briskets" and "burnt ends". They were awesome! The briskets were really tender, almost melting away in my mouth. The burnt ends are really burnt ends of the briskets - chunks of meet that are crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. Both items came with nice hush puppies. We had bacon-wrapped jalapenos and crinkle-cut fries for sides. The jalapenos were really good. But we didn't like the fries. They were overcooked. Their spicy habanero sauce is awesome!
Since moving to Charlotte, I've eaten here on a regular basis. I always leave happy. If you have time to eat at one and only one restaurant in Charlotte, this is it.

Really delicious BBQ.  I would highly recommend the burnt ends and the mac and cheese.  I also got the fries as a side but would not recommend those.  Try some of their other sides instead.  Still a solid BBQ place and I would happily go back again!

Bought a large banana pudding for 5.50 and the container was half full, aside from the fact that their banana pudding is basically just cool whip with 3 nilla wafers on top, barely any bananas in there. Very unremarkable desert experience, but their food is good. If you've got a sweet tooth, go to Lupie's on Monroe road for your banana pudding fix.

Midwood was close to my hotel and I wanted to see what Carolina Barbeque is all about. Let's just say that I took a few bites of the ribs and decided it best that I just leave them alone and chuck it up to a loss...I'll stick with the "q" in L.A.  Disappointed.
Smack yo momma in the mouth, come back for more then punch yo daddy in the mouth, delicious!!!
Very good food and great staff, our waitress, Harmonie, made some excellent recommendations. The brisket was good and you must try the whipped banana pudding.
Super food and even better service! Cortes was our main server but it truly a team effort! The grilled cheese with brisket or smoked veggies --- yumlish.
I went in for Lunch on Sunday with my daughter and both of us were happy. She praised the service and enjoyed the food and I too felt the same.

Pork plate is always on point. The mac and cheese is waaaaay better than Mac's Speed Shop, probably my favorite in CLT. Smoked veggies are a treat, but I wish the portion were a little bigger. You have to ask for a sauce sampler plate if you want to try anything other than the basic vinegar sauce (which I find a little weak for my taste), but the hot, mustard and sweet are all solid.
This place is ridiculously good.  Best que I've ever had & especially the brisket.  I think they make their own sauces on site--just an assumption.  Even the side items were awesome.

So I went here today for my Anniversary and 1st let me state the waitress Molly C was rude. The tried to sit us a little table but my husband is 6"5 and the chairs are to small. We requested a booth and the hosted said they keep the booths open for guest with a party of 8. But when we look over at the booths,  there is guest of 2 sitting in several of the booths. The hostess walks up back up front and tell us we would have to wait until someone get up from the booths closest to the door to be seated, but than changed her mind and seat us in the same booths she told us we could not sit in. After we was seated, I notice the waiter Molly walk over and asked why she put us there and the hostess said I just sat them there, I'm sorry,  "I am still looking for you a big party." So this immediately mad me mad and I knew it was all about the tip. The waitress Molly came and was at 1st rude, it was written all over her face. Later she tried to relax, but kept running to the hostess station, to complain and the hostess kept assuring her that she is sure I big party was going to come in. Molly kept coming to our table to check if we were anything, hoping we were done for she want miss out on a big party if they came in. I asked for a to go box and left her an $11 tip, when our food was only $24, to make her aware that you have to watch how you treat people,  your actions and what you say could have affected your tip and the restaurants business. But I will never go back here again the baked beans was spicy hot, who in they mind serve hot baked beans, I suffer from a medical condition and cannot have spicy food. The cream corn was the only thing edible. The mac and cheese had a cheap taste, and why bring out a handful of onions with hush puppies?  Who in their right mind just going to eat raw sliced onions? The smoked chicken was dry and you could not pull it apart. I was expected garlic bread, but got sour dough toasted bread. Word for the owners please reconsider your ingredients for dishes, you don't know who could have a health condition or could be allergic to something and the waitress is not warning the food is spicy or have onions in it. They can never get my business again, besides feeling discriminated against the food was nasty.
This place has excellent bbq. Everything I've had there is delicious and good. It tends to get crowded at times so be prepared to wait a bit

I am such a happy camper! Great food and even better service. The icing on the cake is the fact the mac & cheese is some of the best I've ever tasted. Compliments to the bartender as well. I'll definitely keep coming back.
Second time here and tried the app smoked wings and pimento fries with brisket really good! Service is always great, staff is friendly. Will def be back next time in area

After posting my review, Cory L. got in touch with me and wanted more information about my visit. She was very responsive and even asked my thoughts on things. This proves to me that I had a rare occurrence when I was there, as I thought may have been the case. Big thumbs up to customer service and Cory! Thank you for taking the time to respond. I look forward to my next visit there, I have been wanting more of that brisket and the bacon wrapped jalapenos!
The food was so great! Get the mac and cheese with BBQ on it! Great servers and staff as well! The night we went was really busy but service was timely!

Good food.  Bad service.  Dirty glasses, long wait for service with lacking follow-through.  When I told them that my ribs were cold they didn't offer to warm them, instead  they said that the air conditioner vent above me was the reason for the cold ribs!  Cocktail refills were hard to get.  They used standard lip service to talk away the conerns rather than taking action to cure.  The manager took our glass for a wine refill and literally 10 minutes later returned with a refill.  He offered it for free because he reolised the failure in proper service.  The food tasted great.  Their service left a bad taste.  We took the ribs to go.  Went elsewhere for dessert and drinks.

My wife and I went here during the week around 8:00 or so and it was still pretty busy, so that speaks for itself with how much folks like the place.  Atmosphere was nice and it was cool to see that former President Obama once even ate here as can be seen by a couple of pictures near the front door.  I thought that was pretty cool too. It was a laid back place and casual attire is acceptable.   As for the food, it was recommended by the waitress to get the brisket since she said it was her favorite things there.  Worked out well because that's actually what I came for and let me tell you, it was some great brisket; some of the best I think I have ever had. It had a perfect smoky taste to it and I enjoyed it without even using any sauce on it since it tasted so amazing on its own. We will definitely be returning and I highly recommend coming here if you are in the Plaza Midwood area and want some great BBQ.
One of the best rack of ribs in my life. High quality pulled pork, sides, and service.   If you are visiting Charlotte and staying downtown, a visit is worth an über or a short cab ride

We were visiting Charlotte on a business trip and sought out a good BBQ joint. This was the unanimous recommendation. The menu lists a good variety of smoked meat items. I ordered the burnt ends with a side of bacon wrapped jalapeños and an Oktoberfest from Olde Mecklenburg Brewery (they have a good rotating selection of craft beers, too). My wife ordered the sloppy joe sandwich with sweet potato fries. Both entrees were delicious and brought out hot. The beer was cold. We would definitely come back if we were in town again.
Great barbeque - pulled pork is good. Service was fab even though it was busy and our table was ready quicker than we had been told we would have to wait.

THE SERVICE WAS GREAT, THE FOOD WAS EVEN BETTER, BUT THEY'RE A BUNCH OF SCAM ARTISTS  We're visiting Charlotte for a concert and we wanted to go to get some BBQ. This place had a good rating so we went. Our server was really nice friendly and helpful. And he gave us the hard sell on their "lunch special" which was smoked short rib. The food came out and it was big and tasty. We both loved the food however we were both struck with awe as we saw our bill. The lunch "special" was 29 FUCKING dollars. When we saw that this place was not to expensive and saw the menu. We thought the lunch special would be similar to the affordable prices of the rest of the menu.   What we were given was a bait and switch that ended up fucking us over in the end. I'll go back here but I'm definitely not going to fall for this scumbag move by our waiter again.

Nothing like a little jaywalking and a mad dash across Central ave to stoke the appetite. While the parking is limited the food is great. The pulled pork platter is what I hope for when looking for BBQ. A mound of pork, creamy mac and cheese, hush puppies, along with sweet potato fries, and I'm in heaven. I'm hard pressed to think of a better BBQ place in Charlotte and look forward to trying their new location in Matthews.

Let's start with the good:  The bacon wrapped jalapenos were very delicious.  I think that they are cooked in a bit of brown sugar and some spices so they have a great sweet and spicy flavor.  Now the bad:  The BBQ, which is the most important part of  a BBQ place, was very mediocre.  I got the sampler plate with ribs, brisket, and pulled pork and I would describe all 3 as dry and a bit tough.  Basically, this is Chili's or Wendy's or some other fast-food-type place level BBQ trying to masquerade as real BBQ.  Even a mediocre hole in the wall type place will have better BBQ than this place.  I don't go to Charlotte that frequently and I was upset that I trusted the reviews on yelp and went to this place.  I wasted an opportunity to try a better BBQ joint.

Midwood Smokehouse FTW!!   My fiancé and I went out to dinner with a couple friends and when plans fell through at another establishment because of a storm (closed kitchen), Midwood Smokehouse pulled through! First off, I would like to compliment our waiter Cameron for his excellent customer service! He was very personable and provided us with great recommendations for both food and drinks. I got the pulled pork platter with macaroni and cheese and cole slaw and it was amazing! The burnt ends would be another fantastic choice (a little bit fatty, but good!) It was kind of loud when we were there, I think they turned the music up loud to offset the alarm that was going off because of the storm, but that was out of their control! I've dined at this particular location several times along with the Ballantyne location, but this will be my go to for BBQ! Awesome experience overall! Ask for Cam!!

Visited last Monday evening with a large group. Ordered the St. Louis ribs. Was informed 15 minutes after my order was taken that they had run out of ribs. Tried ordering the burnt tips only to be told they had ran out of them as well. Never would have happened in Texas!

This adventure of Excited about Eating takes us to the Midwood area of Charlotte to Midwood Smokehouse. This restaurant is tucked into the edge of a building, but it's bigger than it looks.  A Friday lunch was a 10 minute wait, but it probably took that long to snag a parking spot. Although the restaurant was jammed, service was attentive and prompt.  For starters we ordered the Fried Pickles, unique, in that they were sliced length-wise. They were coated in a spicy batter, crispy like I prefer, but I would've enjoyed them more with half the salt.  Since we expected to eat a hefty dinner that night, we shared the BBQ combo which included four meats: pork ribs, sausage, brisket (lean, fatty, combo), and chopped pork. We chose mac and cheese and creamed corn for the two sides.  The combo plate came with three dipping sauces: Midwood Signature (sweet, with just a hint of tang) for the ribs and brisket, Eastern NC Vinegar for the chopped pork, and South Carolina (spicy) Mustard for the sausage. The ribs had a wonderful smoky flavor and fall-off-the-bone meaty goodness, the star of the meats. Dora here, the ribs were finger-licking great, but Ernie's home-smoked ribs are still better. :)  The sausage ranked second, mild with just the right amount of kick. I especially liked the dark bark in both the chopped pork and brisket. Ditto for Dora. And the corn had a firm consistency, not soft or mushy. The spiral pasta had a deep cheesy flavor, but it could've been a tad warmer for my liking.  I would rate this establishment 5 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving outstanding food.

Excellent bbq in a really cute neighborhood!  The wait staff was really friendly and helpful.  Brisket and pork had tons of flavor and the portions were just right.  I was here on a business trip and so glad I made a stop at Midwood!  We went early because we had the kids with us and it was family friendly. Love the art work, really fun atmosphere .

Pimento cheese were awesome! Hush puppies were really delicious too with ketchup. I had the BBQ pork sandwich - it was very tasty but a little difficult to eat as the bread fell apart pretty quickly. My friends enjoyed the ribs, said the chicken was a tad dry. Overall great BBQ and good service.

4.5 stars rounded up for good service and a great atmosphere and THE AMAZING PECAN COBBLER.  I've heard much about Carolina BBQ and it's goodness, so I decided to pick what seemed like one of the best BBQ joints in Charlotte.  I'm not a BBQ snob by any means, but I've had my fair share of the stuff and am a Southern Belle originally, if you may - I know good BBQ when I taste it.  Service here was great - our waiter was helpful, extremely patient with us waiting for our 3rd person, and very friendly.  Great show of true Southern hospitality.  We opted out of ordering appetizers, since the one we were going to order (bacon wrapped jalapenos) was a choice for a side dish.  The 3 of us "pigged out" with the pig out combo platter and doubled (actually, paid extra and tripled) on the ribs and got double brisket.  The ribs were delicious and I loved it with the habanero BBQ - love the heat, which isn't too much.  The brisket, however, was lacking for me.  It wasn't the best brisket I've had and it wasn't as juicy as I've had other places.  They have choices of lean, fatty, or both.  As for the sides, the mac and cheese was heavenly.  Not way too cheesy and just the right amount.  The bacon-wrapped jalapenos reminded me of jalapeno poppers, but not frozen, and seems like they are made fresh.  A little too much bacon for me though (I know right, too much bacon said nobody ever).  The cole slaw (regular flavor) was refreshing.  Bottom line - get the mac and cheese!  Now the dessert was THE STAR OF THE SHOW.  The pecan cobbler, which is basically like a MASSIVE piece of pecan pie without the crust nobody likes to eat, is probably one of the pecan-pie-anythings I've ever had.  You MUST get the vanilla ice cream on top for an over-the-top overly-sweet indulgent dessert and you must NOT think about the calories.  My friend and I shared it and didn't think we would finish it, but after the first bite there was no stopping us.  I love love love loved the filling of the pie - perfect consistency.  I will definitely come back just for this.  Great choice for BBQ in an area close to Uptown.

Lots of good food, but avoid the beef brisket. I LOVE their pulled chicken, spicy sauce, mac & cheese, and collard greens. A "5" for those. But twice now, I have ordered food for a party, and both times the beef brisket was so fatty that guests barely ate it. NOT what you want to have happen when feeding 25 people. NOT worth $18/ pound, when it's 50% fat. The 1st time, I assumed it was a one time bad batch. But this 2nd time causes me to think that the restaurant willingly buys and serves very fatty beef brisket, at least for bulk/catering orders. Not cool.
Just HEAVEN!  I really wanted try the whole menu!  But this time I had the pulled pork and WOW was it good!  I can't wait to go back to try the brisket!
Delicious. My bff and I used to eat here as often as we could. Nomzz.

Our group from work had lunch at Midwood today. The place was packed but our group of 6 were seated fairly quickly for a Friday.  I ordered the Small Carolina BBQ plate and side of sweet potato fries. The BBQ was delicious, moist and flavorful. Fries fantastic.  Our server Amanda was amazing. Even though the restaurant was packed she kept refills coming, table clean and packaged up to-go items with fresh containers of sauce. All done with a smile.  Wish I had saved room for dessert - maybe next time!

I visited this comfortable restaurant today for lunch, and I'll definitely be coming back. A few of us split the queso, and the other side had the queso with brisket (which is a tad more delicious). I ordered the BBQ Chicken Sandwich, with the slaw on the side and a side of BBQ Baked Beans. Instead of getting the SC Mustard sauce that comes on the sandwich, I asked for a sweet sauce and they provided me with the Midwood House BBQ sauce. That was suuuch a great decision! The sandwich was wonderful; the pulled chicken was tender, and there was so much meat that I was able to take some home. The baked beans, which our server Kecia recommended, were delicious!! They had meat in them (for all the plant-based eaters) and they were sweet and soft. The cole slaw was also pretty delicious. I was at a table with 5 other ladies, and all of us got bags to go home. The sweet tea was just a tad bit strong, but good indeed. I'll be back soon to try the brisket.  Had to make a quick edit; I think the chicken messed with my stomach. It started hurting about 20 minutes after eating, and was sensitive for a good 2 days. I'd recommend the brisket and be careful with the chicken.

Decided to come by here after visiting the record shop nearby as I saw a lot of people dining here. Parking was an absolute hot mess but somehow found a spot in an alley. The place was really loud, had sort of a bar atmosphere. Could see this being a great place to catch a game. They had a happy hour special on shiner bock which was awesome. Service wasn't that slow considering how busy they were. I ended up getting the brisket and when it finally arrived I wasn't too impressed. It was a little overcooked for my taste.
