Such a disappointment. My date had the cheese fries and they were pretty good. Overall not a bad experience but not a place I foresee myself visiting anytime soon.

This place is AMAZING. We eat here more often than I'd like to admit.  Hits: PIMENTO CHEESE FRIES (Add pulled pork), Chopped Salad (Add pulled pork), Barnyard Burger (Burger + Bacon + BBQ + BBQ Sauce + Fried Onion rings = Perfection), Hush puppies, ALL OF THEIR SAUCES, homemade salad dressings, and any/all meat they offer  Misses: Mac N cheese wasn't impressive but that's about all I can think of...  This place knows meat. Best BBQ joint in Charlotte for SURE but that's not saying much really...it's some of the best (moist) BBQ and pimento cheese i've had anywhere!  Do yourself a favor & try this place! The service is always great too! Nothing but positive things to say :)
Dining at Midwood is always a pleasure. I had the Brisket Rueben and it was killer. Pair it with some bacon wrapped jalapeños and you can't go wrong. Definitely will keep coming back!

Get the Mac and cheese!!! So freakin good! Also had the pulled chicken, which was flavorful and hush puppies that came with my dinner were good also. Hubby had the ribs, which were pretty good, but not as good as the ribs we had at the Plaza Midwood location. We were being fat that day so we shared the pecan cobbler which was amazing!! Our server was also very attentive and friendly. We scarfed our food so quickly I wasn't able to take yelp pics!!
Make this a must stop on the way or while in Charlotte! So so so damn good! From the apps to the combo platter to the out of this world deserts! Stop here do not pass Go! Go directly to Midwood!!!

The wait time was a terrible start. We waited about 30 minutes to get seated. The moment we were assisted we were given time to look over and place our order. I had the bbq chicken, I wasn't really impressed with it. I've definitely tasted better. Our server never refilled our drinks since we arrived. Not really worth the price I paid for my meal.

Great BBQ. The gf and I sat at the bar in our usual fashion and ordered a few drinks before eating. The bartender (sorry, can't remember the name) was very friendly and gave us some recommendations for parts of the city to check out while we here.   BBQ was solid as were the hush puppies. None of that smother your meat in sugary BBQ sauce nonsense; all tender, juicy meat, and you add your sauce. You could not go wrong coming here, good atmosphere, good food, good company. Overall a memorable experience but wouldn't quite hit my top favorite BBQ places.
i had pulled pork, it was pretty good but the burnt ends were the best! i also really loved the baked beans with bits of pulled pork in them. i'd definitely come back.

Shared the combo plate with Mac and cheese and bacon wrapped jalapeños.  Brisket,  ribs, sausage, and pulled pork were all great.  Sauces excellent especially the spicy and eastern nc vinegar based.  Atmosphere is nice and service fine.

I have never eaten at a smokehouse before. Now I know what I have been missing.   Kaz was an excellent server.  Very friendly and fast. Love the music and the decor.   Will come back again soon.  Had the ribs. The burnt end brisket.  Excellent.   They also have tv s to watch sports and a nice bar.

Loved it. From the appetizers to the dessert, we had an excellent experience. Barbecue plates, salads, and sandwiches all got great reviews. The pecan pie cobbler with ice cream was a revelation. Will definitely be going back again.

This place has great barbecue. Meat is smoked to perfection with a variety of sauces to choose from. The wings are one of my favorite things to get. This place has a great atmosphere with friendly service to go along

I visited Midwood with my teammates to select a bbq place to cater our company picnic.  We were able to sample a lot of things from the menu.  All was very very good.  The service was great in the restaurant and we were did not hesitate to agree that we wanted Midwood to cater for us. And 2 weeks later....we were at Freedom park and Midwood provided great food and service for our event.  The greatest thing that also prompted this 5 star rating is....the service we received from the person that delivered the food...and helped with setup and service.  Simply amazing.  Will get back to Midwood for another great lunch or dinner!!

Go to for BBQ. I am from Charlotte and strangely not the biggest fan of BBQ but this is some of my favorite. Their brisket is the perfect balance of fatty and meaty and with great staples like mac and cheese and collards you will not leave hungry.   Also tried their kickin' mule (moscow mule with jalapeno) and it was great!

Some of the best Carolina-style BBQ I've had since moving to NC, and the collard greens were fantastic! Parking is a little scarce and Midwood is pretty popular, so be prepared for a bit of a wait, but it's well worth it. Service was fast and courteous, even with the crowd (thanks, Mallory!)  Dinner with appetizer and a soft drink came out to about $24, before tip.

I am a 60 year-old BBQ aficionado. When I travel the southern half of the U.S. (which is often), I am always in search of the best BBQ. I have had spectacular BBQ in Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Missouri, Kansas, and North Carolina... tiny mom & pop joints, chains, one-offs, the most famous, and unknowns. Midwood Smokehouse may be the best I've ever had, anywhere.   Though it's not my favorite, I do like good pulled pork. The pulled pork at Midwood is THE BEST I've ever eaten anywhere, hands-down. Doesn't even need sauce. Terrific smokey flavor, good char on the outside bits, just amazing.  The brisket is also maybe the best I've ever eaten. Tender, smokey... you can get it lean or juicy and more fatty... really incredible.  We tried their bacon-wrapped, deep-fried (!) rib appetizer and though a bit crispy and dry for my wife's taste (she's a Californian and I'm a southerner), I thought it was excellent.  Creamed corn was delicious... her grilled veggies were truly excellent. Servings were HUGE ("Are you SURE that's the 'small plate'?"  And big kudos to manager Natalie who went out of her way to welcome us, and even personally make some sandwiches (off menu) we could take on the plane for our flight back to CA. Every restaurant in America would do well to try to find someone like her!  Will definitely eat there any time we're in Charlotte. Have also eaten at the Ballantyne location... same excellent food.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Terrific lunch today with server Kim, backed up by a team that all works together to make sure you're really taken care of. Sizable portions and everything is tasty. Brisket and Carolina BBQ are tops and all sides tasty. Bonus - hushpuppies! and plentiful servings off beverages. Cool hostess/manager. We'll be back!

I really wanted to like Midwood Smokehouse.  It's right down the road, they have good beer specials & I'm a big fan of bbq.  But the quality is just not there.    I liked the cuban sandwich, it wasn't amazing but it was certainly tasty & the mac & cheese is pretty decent,  but everything else there I've had has been seriously lacking.  I ordered a BBQ plate the second time we went there & the bbq was completely dry & their sauce did nothing to help it.  The third time I had a bbq sandwich & ended up with food poisoning.    A word of warning, the bacon jalapenos are no joke, they are absurdly spicy, too spicy for me even.

The BBQ ( and all of their other food) is so good here!  I got St. Louis Style Pork Ribs with Hushpuppies, Mac & Cheese & Baked Beans. The ribs were full of flavor, and so moist, that they practically fell off the bone. The sauce I got was the Midwood Signature and they've got it goin' on. The hushpuppies were so good. They were perfectly fried and were little bites of yumminess. The mac & cheese and baked beans were good as well. We also got some Banana Pudding for dessert and it was really good. It was fresh, creamy, and full of banana-y flavor.  The service was good. Our waitress was very helpful and checked on us pretty often, even though we were sitting outside.  This place gets packed as the night goes on, and parking is bad since the lot is small. So yeah, if you don't want to wait long, or deal with parking, make sure to come here earlier.
This restaurant is amazing!  Worth the wait. We tried the pulled pork, chicken, ribs and burnt ends. Sides were excellent too!! Can't wait to go back and try dessert as we ran out of room. :)

Run of the Mill... Perhaps I have been spoiled by North Carolina BBQ.  This place does not meet the standards.  The sauce was ok, but the sauce did not make the BBQ good.  I was not excited about the pulled pork!

This is the real deal for barbeque.  Very nice beer selection as well.  I also thought our server did a great job and was very helpful, even though the place is very busy so it's not easy of the staff.

My wife and I were visiting Charlotte for the Elevation Church Live recording at Time Warner Arena and needed some late night grub after that event. This place hit.the.spot.! The service was fast and very friendly, atmosphere was what you'd expect at a non-chain BBQ spot. Parking was easy. And most importantly the food was amazing. Great Mac and cheese, beef brisket was out of this world and the pork burnt ends were packed full of great smokey flavor. Definitely check this place out!

I love this place. I've come here a few times and it never disappoints. The service is awesome too, they're all attentive and personable without being overly attentive. Good portions for the price and it's seriously the best BBQ I've ever had. The hush puppies are amazing as well and the vinegar house sauce is sooooooo good. Will definitely be back soon!
Is really nice. The service is fast and consistent. We went there because the reviews in yelp. And really they are very close to te reality. Really is good place to have a great meal or drink.

We have been to Midwood Smokehouse many times, but never on a Saturday night during the heart of the dinner rush. Wow! They were slammed! With that being said, we waited the 20-25 minutes they told us we would. We were seated, with our waitress showing up shortly thereafter. She wasn't rattled or rushed and got our drink order out quickly; she took our food order, and our meal came out fast, considering the crowd. Like with any other time we've been to Midwood, we thoroughly enjoyed our food- my husband got barbeque and I got chicken tacos. More than enough food and always consistent in taste. We spent $25 on 2 meals, not including tip. People were waiting outside and several deep when we left at 7:15. Worth the wait! Apparently they now take reservations, which we will remember next time.

Excellent barbecue, and a great place.  Had the pork, collards, baked beans, and hush puppies.  All of those were among the best I've had, and that comes from tasting great barbecue in Texas, St. Louis, Cincinnati, Memphis, and Kansas City.  Collards were exceptionally good, and pepper sauce added a little kick.  All by the recommendation of the server, Liz, who was as sweet as could be.  Atmosphere in the place was also notable, with all-American decor and classic and new rock hits playing over the speakers.  Overall, an outstanding place to spend a lunch or dinner.

First time come here and the food was good! I had the pulled chicken BBQ and they gave me a generous portion of chicken. The mac and cheese was good, nothing to write home about but good. Greens were surprisingly tasty. Overall the food was solid. Well earned 4 stars!

Very much enjoyed this place. I asked my Airbnb host where I could find some real Carolina BBQ and she pointed me to Midwood. We ordered the brisket (both fatty and lean portions), bbq baked beans, cole slaw and pecan cobbler. The brisket was tasty but a tad bit tough, but the baked beans, cole slaw and pecan cobbler more than made up for anything lacking with the brisket. The place was slammed busy all night so I knew we were in the right place.
Holy smokes this place is great (see what I did there). The service, food, bourbon and company could not have been better. Had the smoked wings won't ever be able to eat any other wings again!!!

This is on my list of Charlotte favorites.  Beef Brisket was awesome. Got the half and half (lean and fatty). While the fatty piece was truly fatty, it blended well with the lean to provide a very satisfying taste. Even though I love brisket and BBQ, the large 10oz serving was pretty hefty.  6oz serving of pork or brisket appeared to satisfy my entire party so keep in mind that the bigger platter comes with the extra side so that could also factor in your decision of 6oz versus 10oz or heck - possibly even share a 10oz platter with a friend.  Bacon wrapped jalapenos could easily make an appetizer menu at any bar or restaurant across the country. It truly was the hidden gem on my platter. It wasn't that spicy and bacon wrapped anything.... well, it's just plain cool and great!  Mac & cheese was enjoyable.  Staff was awesome with service & refills. She was quick to make recommendations and the manager came by to ask how we were doing and thanked us for stopping in.  Definitely felt the Southern hospitality at Midwood!

Endless possibilities of delicious filling BBQ options. Come with an appetite and Tums. Parking can be a challenge during busy times. I also used Midwood Smokehouse for catering my rehearsal dinner as well as a neighborhood picnic, and they did not disappoint. Great service and good food in a hip hood. The bar isn't bad either.

Found this gem thanks to Yelp it was amazing BBQ, all my colleagues were pleased.... Had a Bee Sting drink with sweet tea and it was amazing. The Collard Greens were some of the best I ever had. Must visit if your in the area looking for BBQ.

Pretty good! Needed to come here for good southern BBQ since I was in the area and I was very pleased.  Started with the smoked wings with sauce on the side (best thing they had here). Wings we're so flavorful and delicious it was unreal! For my plate I had the pig out portion of the meat combo and got mixed brisket with burnt ends and double ribs. They were all very good but not the best BBQ I've ever had and the portion seemed kinda small even though I ordered the larger one.  Brisket and burnt ends stole the show for the entrees.  My mom got the burger with brisket and it was fantastic, definitely recommend looking for a massive and delicious burger.  Desert was great, I didn't know pecan Cobbler was a thing but O man was it delicious! Apple pie was on special for the day and it melted my heart it was so good! Best BBQ I've had in the Carolina's and the service was very friendly.  Unfortunately they have a tiny bathroom and unneeded to go the entire time but it was in use from the moment I walked in to when we left so that kinda dampened the experience but I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for a great BBQ experience.
I've been twice now and all I can say is, WOW! Delicious food and tasty handcrafted cocktails. I highly recommend Nicki as server, she is funny and caring while providing exceptional service!

Midwood is delicious and very casual as bbq should be. The food is always hot and plentiful with plenty of options and variations both flavor and selections alike.  Great kid friendly options with a good price. All in all its my favorite neighborhood bbq joint!

Wow I wasn't expecting the brisket to be that great as I just moved from texas but I was horrified when the pork was even worse. I always bragged NC knows pork BBQ and Texas honestly is not that good at it. Sigh. I will never understand yelp reviewers. This is objectively not good bbq.

Great food! Their brisket is some of the best in town. And they've got great sides and specials. Good beer selection too! No, seriously...get the brisket. Lean, fatty, or mixed. I prefer mixed. I've always had awesome service too.

So, I rave on and on about good BBQ because it's probably one of my favorite things to eat. And I can rave on and on about Midwood! The problem is, that it's so affordable, we can get too many sides and then end up being full before our wonderful, juicy, fall-off-the-bone MAN-MEAT portions arrive. (Make sure you try the fatty brisket! Uh-oh! Mouth's a-waterin'!) And then we have to be abolutely miserable to try and stuff down dessert. I mean, we do try...  This place is excellent. Service is a tad bit on the wonky side sometimes, and parking can be an adventure (as if the lot's full, you'll have to park across the street and play Frogger with the crazy Plaza-Midwood drivers), but I implore you...nay, I dare you to find better BBQ in Charlotte! (And if you do, please tell me all about it!)
La atención excelente, probamos el full rack divino. Los hush pupies, los jalapeños con bacon , la crema de maíz . Los burnt ende de verdad que recomiendo este sitio.

Solid spot for authentic bbq. One combo platter is enough to share for most couples unless you ordinarily eat a lot.  The chopped pork is okay. The sauces weren't mind blowing but relatively standard.  The ribs were good but also nothing mind blowing.  Service was nice and price was reasonable. Food comes out fast.  Not near the best bbq I've ever had but thought it was a good showing.
Everything was really delicious!  Parking was a nightmare, but that's typical for Charlotte and Midwood.  I'd definitely go back!
Tasty mixed (fatty and lean) brisket with tangy sauce and PROPER IPAs on tap is all this humble Seattleite could hope for this far from home.
Love the Midwood Chopped salad! Tasty and it works for vegans who have meat-loving friends.

This place is quite good and worth traveling outside of uptwon Charlotte to locate (much better than the BBQ I tried in uptown).  They have a good menu selection of pulled pork, chicken and beef brisket, and a healthy choice of sides to choose from.  The problem I had was what to try, but my salvation was the taco plate.  Yeah, that seems like a strange offering in a BBQ place, but you could mix and match 2 or 3 tacos to try all meats (pork, chicken and brisket), and it comes with a choice of side too.  HINT:  The creamed corn, and bacon wrapped jalapenos are delicious.  The coleslaw comes on some of the tacos, so you got to try that too, and it was good.  We got fried pickles as an appetizer and a couple of local Carolina craft brews on draft made for an enjoyable meal.  Too full to try the cobbler for dessert, maybe next time.

Visiting from out of state, a state that is known for it's barbecue, and this place is delicious! We had the decadent pimento cheese fries with brisket, delish! I had the midwood chopped salad with brisket, a salad with lots of good stuff in it-highly recommend. My sons got wings as an appetizer that they raved about, St. Louis ribs they loved, and a grilled cheese with pulled pork sandwich which was amazing. Staff was nice, bar staff was great too.  Would come again if I'm ever back here in the area.

Dude, this place is awesome!!!!! I got the beef brisket which is insane. But even better I was able to get a side of the Fat Tire BBQ SAUCE!!!  The sauce comes with one of their specials, but the bartender guy let me order it with my brisket on the side.   The bacon wrapped jalapeños are crazy good-I ordered the collared greens and was so satisfied.   They are super flexible with the menu and let you mix and match. Highly recommend!!!
The flavors were not all there. The burnt ends were not as crusty and delicious as they should be. Brisket was ok, but nothing too special.  I miss Smoke Modern BBQ.

Best BBQ I've ever had! Got the beef brisket and it was perfectly fatty and tender. My sister got the burnt pork tips and they were good too, not as good as the brisket though! The cocktails were super yummy, I had something that tastes like lemonade and my friend had something that tastes like sweet tea (forget the names, sorry!) but both were tasty and didn't taste like alcohol. Would defs recommend coming here if you're visiting Charlotte!

I've heard so many good things about mid wood and have been a couple times recently. Each time I have gotten the pulled pork sandwich, and while good, it didn't live up to the hype. I found the fries to be really salty both times.   This is definitely a great place for bbq! I wouldn't be opposed to returning. I might be getting the wrong thing, it just wasn't the best I've had in town. But everyone was else I was with loved it! So if you like bbq definitely give it a try!

A ton of food for a super reasonable price! I had the BBQ pork with bacon wrapped jalapenos and sweet potato fries. It also came with coleslaw and hush puppies. The large plate filled my belly and left me enough meat to take home for another meal. I liked that they offered a couple different BBQ sauces in squeezable bottles so you could have as little or, (in my case) as much sauce as you wanted.  While I didn't have a drink that night, the beer/cocktail/liquor list looked extensive.  They work with the 'No Wait' app and it's busy every night of the week, so I'd take advantage of it!
Consistently delicious and perfectly cooked. Love the mac n cheese and brisket. Awesome!!

We have been coming to Midwood about once a week for 2 years. I never grow tired of their chopped salad, fresh Romaine lettuce tossed with black beans, corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, carrots and cheese. I LOVE this salad. The smoked wings are large and tender and oh so good. The ribs are fall off the bone delicious. Service is always friendly and prompt. Cannot say enough good things about this place.

Yes I love bacon, yes I love pork, and yes I love this place!  I ate until my stomach, mouth and soul could eat no more.  The ribs don't even need sauce they are perfectly smoked and seasoned. The meat clings, just barely to the bone, and waits for just a hint of your teeth to come cascading into your mouth.  It's heaven from a firey pit.    Parking is a bit dicey at times, but worth the wait.

Was pretty excited to try this place since I heard good things but unfortunately I wasn't too impressed. The waiter was kind of rude, as if he seemed annoyed to be there. I ordered the brisket sandwich as did my friend. I ordered mine with pimento cheese and my friend ordered cheddar, however we both received blue cheese. I really do not like blue cheese and this blue cheese completely over powered the sandwich. I would of complained but our server wasn't even the one to bring us our food and we didn't even see him again til the check came.   I don't know if I'll be returning to give it another try.

Best ribs ever, not counting Goode Company in Texas of course. Ribs are good but not that Goode. But I'm in Charlotte, so, I'll stop being so fussy. And Midwood has Banana pudding to die for. Go early, it gets very crowded. Sit at the bar for quicker service.

We LOVE Midwood Smokehouse and have been to 3 locations.  We have visited this location a couple times.  I stand by my 5 star reviews with the main location and this one had the potential to be 5 stars as well, as the food has been top notch each time.  This location just has issues with service.  One time we we missing a side with a large to go order but we didn't realize until we got home.  Didn't do anything about it as it was just a side. Just worth mentioning now since there are issues with this location.  Last Friday we came here to send my brother in law off with his last bbq before he went overseas for awhile.  Midwood was busy and had a wait, no issue, but when we were called in we were a table of 3 put in a booth meant for 6-8 people it looks like.  Made it incredibly hard to have a decent conversation with how wide we were spread out!  We ordered drinks from the bar.  Wrong drink came for me but it was fixed.  This was because the server wasn't paying attention, I even said my drink twice because I don't think he got it, clearly he didn't.   Food came and was prompt.  Was great as always.  Loved the pork and burnt ends!  Always consistent.   But after we got the food, it just seemed like they were trying to get us out as quickly as possible.  Asking if we were done.  Nope not yet.  My husband and I were finally done and had ours boxed up.  Server came back with the box and asked the two of us if we wanted anything else.  No.  Then he tries to take my BIL's plate when he was still eating.  Then he comes back with the bill.  Okay BIL is still eating and just got a new beer.  What is he wants something else?  He eventually finishes his plate and then he starts on his beer.  Waiter tries to take the bill but there is nothing in it, plus my BIL and husband are still working on beers.  One of the hostesses comes by and takes our water cups.  Okay, I guess we are done here then.  We just decide to pay and go on our way since they probably needed that large table for a different group.  Either way, we are still customers and should not be pushed.  Fix your service and you could be 5 stars too!

The previous review took the words out of my mouth. I've been in Charlotte for a long time and love BBQ. There are a number of great BBQ restaurants here. What I love about Midtown Smokehouse was not only the food, It is incredible, but the service in the midst of packed place was PERFECT. I love it when I the appetizers vs. the entrees are timed perfectly. Meaning, when apps are requested they don't come out at the same time as the entree's. I know that may sound trite, but it really does show attention to detail. My complements to the Chef, Staff and Management.   For those who are visiting, you may wait for a table, but it's well worth it.   Mac's Speedway and Queen City BBQ, I love you very much. Ya'll are awesome. But you have some competition. :-)  Mean that with respect.

Have eaten at both the plaza midwood and Ballantyne locations. Have had great service when dining in and taking out. Nice beer list. Have enjoyed their brisket and pulled pork sandwiches. Love the different sauce options and their mac and cheese was pretty good. Definitely recommend for someone looking for a good BBQ dinner

Midwood Smokehouse is a real smokehouse. With smoke.  The place isn't huge, I'd say it seats around 50 with the bar. But that's just perfect for me when it comes to BBQ. I stopped in for lunch on a Saturday and by 12:15, there were just six seats at the bar left open. I started off with a regional craft beer, MW serves a good amount of regional stuff along with 1.50 PBR drafts on Saturday. Be sure to look at the board behind the bar for drink and food specials and if anything is 86'd.  I went with the brisket sandwich special w/ bleu cheese and red onions. I got a side of mac n cheese with it for 8 bucks. The sandwich comes on texas toast and is loaded up rather nicely. While I've had better brisket in Kansas City, I'm tipping my hat to Midwood on what looks to be a winning combination for a long time to come.   I'll be back to visit the food and friendly bar staff again!

I guess I'm a snob, or spoiled, I'm not sure. Probably both. I don't understand what the fuss is about. First the BBQ pork my son has was good..not great, but good. I thought that mac and cheese was pasty and lacked flavor. It was warm, nit hot but tasted like glue. The hush puppy's were good, though. Now, the brisket... I'm not from Texas and love me some pork BBQ  (Lexington is the gold standard) but this brisket was weak... The "fall off the bone" tender actually was mushy. It tasted like it was boiled or steamed before it hit the smoker. It had NO smoke ring and the smoke flavor seemed to be artificial. I ordered mixed fatty and lean, as I know fatty is the way to go. It was actually greasy, not the luscious melted fat of a well smoked brisket. The "bark" was soggy and was overly salty. Again I think it had liquid smoke or smoked salt. or something. No spice or depth of flavor. Again the meat was "unnaturally" tender. steamed or boiled or maybe a "meat tenderizer" was added. A bright pink smoke ring should show on a brisket this thick, but none was apparent.  Needless to say, I was disappointed, especially at $10 for a small plate (1 side).  I'll give them another shot, but anyone how gives this place 3 stars or better doesn't know what they are talking about when it comes to Q! If it hadn't been or first visit I don't know if I would have given it 2 stars.  Oh, yea, service was good to excellent, no complaints there.

Tried the new location for Midwood tonight. It was opening night and the food was awesome! Lives up to the original Midwood standard and all the staff were very attentive. Brisket is great, collards are perfect, and mac n cheese is ridiculous. Management also gave us a piece of the pecan cobbler on the house. I'd never tried it before but I'm so glad they laid it on the table. My wife and I destroyed it. Thank you!

While I'm no BBQ aficionado...I loved this place.  Started with bacon wrapped jalapeno/cheese poppers what we smoked and delicious.  We sort of split tow plates: the Burnt Ends and the Pulled Pork.  With that had four sides: Fries (meh), coleslaw (just OK), baked beans (yum), and creamed corn (rich version).  I enjoyed the pork more than the ends - pork was moist, perfectly pulled and sauced (with more available on the side) and nicely smoked.  The burnt ends were hit and miss - some nice and moist, others pretty dry.  Nice beer list of local and non-local craft brews, great music and vibe with adequate service.  I'd definitely go back if ever back in town.  We were debating between this and Mac's Speed Shop (describe to us later by locals as having a "Hooter" feel...they affirmed we went to the right spot!)

The experience started out great with a queso with brisket. It was very good. The fried pickles were sliced very thin and they didn't have a lot of taste.  I would pass on them next time. I had the brisket sandwich. They added blue cheese and onions which over whelmed the brisket. I love brisket so it was disappointing to find that I had a blue cheese sandwich.  Overall I think they wanted to upscale the menu and lost sight of what makes a great brisket sandwich. Next time I'll try the sliced brisket to see how it tastes.

I'm ticked off at The owners of Midwood Smoke house.  After living in Plaza Midwood for over 10 years, you finally decide to open the most incredible barbecue joint there is in Charlotte and I don't live there anymore.    Let just start off by saying BURNT ENDS, BURNT ENDS, BURNT ENDS.  I don't care what you order, you have to at least try a side of burnt ends.   After traveling to Texas and Oklahoma this is the closest fatty brisket, I have found that even compares.  I would say it's even better, because it is a whole lot closer.   I cannot give a fair evaluation of all the food because the only thing that I've had is the fatty brisket, burnt ends and the bacon wrapped jalapeños.  Twice in the last week and will be going back in a few days with my co workers that have not been there yet.    I think as long as they stay true to the food that they are creating, they will have a long legacy in Charlotte.     Great job!!!!

Me and my lil family were visiting charlotte and this place was my favorite of alll the other bbq spots we tried !!!! The brisket and turkey and ribs were sooo yummmmmy the cranberry sauce for the turkey was a tasty also mac n cheese was ok and the jalapeño jus need to be cooked a lil more but by far the best

An understated outpost of 'cue on Central Ave., Midwood lacks many of the typical sign posts I look for when in search of great barbecue (i.e. storefront art featuring chef's hat and apron clad pigs gleefully cooking bacon).  If you look closely enough, you'll notice that the pig on the sign is smiling.  Once inside however, you instantly know you're on to something.  The bustling dining room offers tightly packed tables with plenty of seating, but I opted for a seat at the bar which offers a little more elbow room.  The stout bar stools offer support should you imbibe too much brew, or be overcome by "the itis."  I can only speak for the pulled pork, which is served up Eastern style, and the mac 'n cheese--both are delicious.  You'll need access to a roll of paper towels for this one. I've mentally booked a return trip intended to sample the beef brisket.  So deep in pork country?! I know, it sounds crazy, but it says a lot about how much these people know what they're doing with that namesake smoker.

We went here last night after seeing the reviews and not having success in finding a good local bbq restaurant - we have tried quite a few!  We arrived and it was packed.  We were told 30 minutes, but it ended up being 5 minutes to wait, we will take that! It doesn't look like there are many tables, I can see this place being very busy in the summer.  Because it is small, it gets loud easily.  When you walk in you immediately notice the smell - and start drooling! Good thing it was only a 5 minute wait.  Kevin and I had the platter, picked 4 meats: shredded chicken, pork, turkey, and ribs.  Sides were mac and cheese and stuffed jalapenos wrapped in bacon.  Turkey: just okay.  Would not go for this again though.  Shredded chicken: Good flavor, but did not stick out in my memory like the remaining meats.  Ribs: the meat fell off so easily and had an awesome smokey flavor! A++ ribs!  Pork: the smokey flavor and whatever seasoning they have on the pork is outstanding!!  I'm drooling just thinking about it again.  A+++++, the best pork ever!  They give you sauces to go with the pork.  They are just okay - they have mustard based, tomato based, and vinegar based sauces, the first two being my favorite.  I didn't really use them, not because they were okay, but because the pork was just so good, I didn't want to mess with the flavor!  Sides, both excellent.  Mac and cheese was a good homestyle kind and cheesy!  The jalapenos were something I've never had, so bad for you, but yet so good!  Service was outstanding.  We were greeted and welcomed by our server quickly.  He never let our drinks get low and was very helpful - said if we didn't like something he would find us something to like! Wanted us to have a great experience, and we did.  Love this place and will be back soon for more pork!

I am far from an expert in BBQ, and so I present my opinion as a lover of BBQ sauce and lifelong carnivore. This is indeed the place to be, and the Midwood combo is one of the best ways for 2-3 people to taste a broad selection of Southern BBQ. Out of the 5 meats to choose from, I give my stamp of approval to the oh-so-juicy brisket and the tender and succulent ribs packed full of flavor. For sides, go for perhaps the BEST BAKED BEANS I've ever eaten!! (It's gotta be that molasses...) The mac and cheese was A-OK.  Tip: Ask for sauces! The BBQ sauces come with varying levels of spice and some meats come with their own sauces too.

We were visiting Charlotte for the weekend and a friend from NC recommended that we tried their barbecue with vinegar sauce. We found Midwood Smokehouse on Yelp and decided to give it a try. And I'm glad we did! I got the Carolina BBQ with a side of hush puppies and collard greens. It was well-seasoned, perfectly cooked, and the hush puppies reminded me of corn bread, which I love. The portions are super generous and I'm sad that we had a plane to catch and I couldn't take leftovers :(

Midwood Smokehouse is the best BBQ I have ever had.  Where are these other bad reviews coming from----maybe jealousy....I've had BBQ all over NC, Memphis and Texas and this one beats them all.  The brisket is amazing and i often dream about the beans and Mac and cheese!  I recently ordered the pimento cheese fries with pulled pork and they are the perfect comfort food.
Great food and great service... the South Charlotte needed a good BBQ place!
I went to this place by accident, and wow, so happy for that detour! We had cheesesteak sandwiches (subbed mine for chicken) and both were melt-in-the-mouth amazing! Ya gotta go

It's no secret, Charlotte isn't know for the best BBQ in the South. Meanwhile, Midwood does a great job at raising the bar in the Queen City. It's the top BBQ joint in town, by a lot. Many will debate that. However, I'm sorry Mac's Speed Shop, while your portions are much larger than Midwood, the quality, sauces and flavor are a notch below Midwood. Midwood succeeds at providing more than just good BBQ. They dish out great service, in an upbeat atmosphere complete with TVs and a full bar. It's a great place to come for a work lunch, on a date, with friends or for a celebration. They have plenty of local beers on tap, too, which bodes well with good BBQ.  I travel for a living, eat out three times a day more than 300 days a year and have been to more than 300 BBQ restaurants in the country (it's probably more like 500) so I'm holding a high bar comparing Midwood to the country's best. It's very good. And, when we're in Charlotte it's where we take friends and family if the word "BBQ" is mentioned. Hands down, if you're from Charlotte and haven't eaten BBQ consistently elsewhere, you'll definitely be blown away here. Everything is done well. From the meats, to dessert and sides, there's nothing that disappoints. In fact, even the hush puppies impress, which is hard to do.   Nevertheless, to be a 5-star, it must be one of the best BBQ places in the US and while it's darn close, it's one notch away from reaching the amazing BBQ you'll get a the Pompous Pig in Anderson, Smokin Pig near Clemson, Melvin's in the Charleston area, Louella's in Asheville, etc. I believe it's slightly better than a known Southern chain such as Jim N Nicks and blows away places like Smokey Bones and Sticky Fingers. Don't even bring up Sonny's and Dickey's. Midwood owns those places. In short, you need to eat here. It'll become one of your favorite places in Charlotte.   Deciding what to order isn't a chore, as long as you choose a combo platter, where four meats wind up on your plate. I'm not a big rib guy, so we normally split the Well Fed (feeds 2) or the Pig Out (feeds 3) and opt for the brisket, Hickory Smoked Sausage, Carolina Chopped Pork and Chopped Chicken BBQ. Consider that you are splitting this with another or two others and it's a great deal. Don't be discouraged, the St Louis Style Pork Ribs are good. I took my friends on a BBQ tour through the Carolinas and they enjoyed these ribs almost as much as a few of the above mentioned places. Another thing to consider is they do daily specials, too, such as Pork Burnt Ends, yum.   The two sides can be a challenge to pick. All are good. But, we are partial to two: smoked veggies and bacon wrapped jalapenos. Damn, these are good! If you've been to the Smokin Pig, the sweet potato fries here aren't as good, but they are much better than any you'd order at a normal restaurant and the greens are top-notch.  Another thing I like about Midwood is the range of available sauces. Rather than solely vinegar, like many places in Carolina they offer an assortment, which keeps everyone happy. All their sauces, South Carolina Mustard, Eastern NC Vinegar, Midwood Signature & Spicy Habanero are tasty and done well.   As for dessert, we've only tried the banana pudding. If you can fit any in your stomach after the large portions you ate already, give it a try. While Alabama's Dreamland continues to serve the best banana pudding, theirs is memorable, too.

A bit of an anomaly that a neighborhood NC bbq joint is known for their Texas-style brisket. But this stuff is legit. Got the large platter with a mix of fatty and lean brisket. Sides were also amazing - beans and bacon-wrapped jalapeños. And apparently 20oz beers are pint prices on Wednesdays, too. The bbq gods smiled on me today and this place did not disappoint- great service as well. I'm just bummed that I probably had the best meal in town on my first night here.

Besides getting to visit with our son and his girlfriend, coming to Charlotte and finding new places is something my husband and I love to do.  My son and his girlfriend are savvy when it comes to finding which places we should tryout and see.   Midwood Smokehouse was definitely a winner.  It is located in behind Park Road Shopping Center in a very nice building with an outdoor dining area.   We chose to be seated on the patio.  Our server was welcoming and attentive.  They offer "small plate" that includes one side, hush puppies and pickled onions and "large plate" that gives 2 sides, as well as the hush puppies and pickled onions.   I chose the small plate split 1/2 chicken  Midwood style along with fries and hush puppies.  Husband can never pass up the chance to try ribs.  He said the ribs were very good and he would positively order them again.  The four of us enjoyed our food and the different beverages offered.  My first time here but hopefully not the last.

Decent cue but kinda pricey. The pimento cheese fries with pork is outstanding and the beer selection is good. I was disappointed that there are no bottles of sauce on the table. I guess you have to ask.

Smelled great walking up to the door. All the staff were super nice. Ordered pork  ribs dry. Found the rub average at best, sauces were excellent. Ribs were a bit too fatty and meat fell off the bone and portion size was very large. I mean the meat actually falls off the bones while trying to cut them apart, i prefer a little "tussell" , you know chew the meat right off the bone. I probably ordered the wrong thing based on everyone else's reviews.

If they had a 3.5 star this would be my review, I still think they're a lil' pricey/precious on their drinks, but MAN is the food good..even the salads are killer...and I thought MACS did the best beef brisket I'd ever had til I tried this brisket....seriously so tender you can cut w/some slight pressure with a fork....  oddly the meat i think is not great is their BBQ itself....it tastes like its been soaking in a bottle of Liquid Smoke, just WAY WAY too smokey/pungent...i know u want smokehouse flavor but this is overkill....but everything else is really really good
Travelled all the way from DC and worth every minute of the road trip....fantastic ribs and service top notch....definitely more road trips to Midwood are on the cards

Great food and nice atmosphere. My waiter tonight was very attentive and helped me select great items for dinner. I had the brisket plate and added the burnt ends .  Collard greens were fantastic too.

My husband and I don't eat Bar-b-q regularly.  We hold out until it is no longer possible. When we go for Bar-b-q it is only at Midwood Smokehouse. Great servers who know the food, the food is HOT as in temp., the prices are reasonable and everything we order is great.  Good job Midwood Smokehouse! keep up the great job.

I recently stopped at Midwood Smokehouse to grab lunch, right before my flight back to Chicago. I was looking forward to try some Carolina bbq and this place delivered far beyond my expectations! My friends and I split a couple of "pig out" platters with pulled pork, brisket, St Louis ribs, sausage, and burnt ends...everything was delicious. The sides were super tasty as well: hushpuppies, mac n' cheese, baked beans (yum!), creamed corn, and the best smoked veggies I've ever had. The hosts were friendly and accommodating and Taylor, our server, was knowledgeable, attentive, and provided awesome local beer and bourbon recommendations. Midwood Smokehouse has  become a must-visit everytime I'm in the Charlotte area.

Hands down my favorite BBQ place in Charlotte!  The brisket is the best I have ever had. Super juicy and just the right amount of fat! (Although you can ask for it lean if you don't like the fat.) My favorite side is the grilled vegetables but I think most people would go for the macaroni and cheese or bacon wrapped jalepenos. I also love the sloppy joe and grown up grilled cheese which have all the flavors of childhood with enough flavor for my adult tastebuds!  They always have great beer selections and unlike most every other restaurant in Charlotte they don't start blaring the music at seven at night.  Easily one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte.

Incredible meal The smoked wings might just be the best I ever had and I love all kinds of wings. Also bacon wrapped jalapeños were incredible We had a party of 8 and everyone loved it. The brisket was excellent. Great tap beers as well. Definitely coming g back when I am passing thru again

Great food hurt by less than stellar service.  It has been several months since our last visit to Midwood Smokehouse.  The food was as great as ever.  My lean brisket had a great smoke ring and the right amount of juice.  My bacon wrapped jalapeños were just amazing as I remember and a highlight for me.  The pickled onions were also very tasty.  My wife's salmon was cooked perfectly.  The kids' meals were very good as well.    The only downside was not particularly attentive service.  The best example was when she refilled my iced tea, she brought room temperature tea which melted all of the ice in my class.  This left me with a like warm overfilled glass...  Yes, overfilled in that she spilled it on the floor and table when refilling.  I am not a fan of hovering wait staff, but this was to the other extreme.  It was not particularly busy so maybe this was just a bad night.    In all, we are reminded of how much we love the food at Midwood and look forward to more visits soon.

Absolutely delicious!!!!  We sat at the bar while we waited for our table. The bartenders were attentive and knowledgeable about the specifics of each beer.   Our server was also knowledgeable. He was able to tell us about favorites, provide information about the company and explain the different sauces and flavors of the meat.   We had tacos with roasted vegetables and the build your own salad.  The prices were unbelievably low. Our meal total was under $30.

Went here once with my family, and everything came out cold and when a restaurant brings out cold food, I am sorry I can't really forgive it. They did take it back and give us new warm food again not hot and it was terrible. Save your money.

We were greeted by a very friendly hostess. Our waiter was great and gave us many recommendations since it was our first time there. I had the BBQ pork sandwich with the vinegar based slaw and a side of Mac and cheese. Everything was amazing!! I definitely recommend trying this place!

After all the reviews I was excited to go...but unfortunately let down. Went with the entire family but every sauce was too spicy for the children to be able eat anything. Meat was good but not great...I've had better BBQ for half the price...maybe I went on a bad night.

I went for dinner on a Saturday, it was busy but we were sat right away. Luckily had the lovely Ivy as my server for my first time here. She made excellent recommendations. She recommended the Pom Fire as a drink and it was absolutely amazing. I had the Hot Mess and it was also amazing. One of the best burgers I've ever had. I probably finished it in record time. Super cheesy southern style Mac n cheese as my side. I already can't wait to go back and try more. Ask for Ivy!
Great food, great service.. got there late so they were out of some items but everything they did have was exceptional

Took my crew to Midwood Smokehouse last night...1st time there. Food was great...had the St Louis Ribs, they were done to perfection with just right amount of smoke taste. When I first ordered them I was told they were out...I asked for the manager...my server came back and was able to fill out 2 rack order.  She handled the issue just right and was attentive through the whole meal.  My wife had the Brisket tacos and Loved them...shared a bit with me and It may be a real toss-up on what to order next time.  The side were good particularly the baked bean...has some spice to them and they were yummy.  Had a few Ice cold Triple-Cs which went perfect with the food.  Ambiance is nice and casual.  Job well done! We'll be back.

I know many that LOVE this restaurant - but I just don't get it. I've been twice for lunch and was way underwhelmed. I love good BBQ and have had plenty of it, this restaurant does not come anywhere near the great BBQ I have had. The pulled pork sandwich, a 6 out of 10 at best. Very dry, though they do have a nice selection of BBQ sauces that you can add. The mac and cheese, rather bland - though I did appreciate it not being dry as some mac and cheese can be. The hush puppies were hush puppies, nothing spectacular.

Love bbq and tacos at Midwood. I enjoyed the meal and the service here. The original location has more character but the food is equally delicious both places. The parking is definitely easier in Ballantyne.

Meh...  I was very disappointed based on other reviews, and maybe I went in at bad time but the food was average at best.  Our server had a bad attitude, with all the other barbecue options in the area you can definitely do better.
Best damned banana pudding I've ever had (and I'm kind of a connesieur at this stuff!)   Fast, friendly, and personalized service too . . . What's not to like?

Here's the big question.  Midwood or Sauceman's?  Oh that could prompt an endless debate.  So here's my take:  Midwood is the more pretentious, hipster-esque BBQ joint.  This is where I'd bring a friend who I'd like to impress with a cool BBQ spot and share a few local beers.  Whereas Sauceman's feels more casual and relaxed.  Almost like eating at a pit stop.  This is where I'd bring a friend who just likes eating BBQ.   Midwood is BBQ on a creative slant.  Burgers and tacos ... that's beyond the simplified offerings from the pit.  Bacon-wrapped jalapeño is delicious but ... that's just fixin's dolled up.  But don't get me wrong.  I can gnosh on these bacon jalapeño's all day.  Whereas Sauceman's is BBQ plain and simple.  The red slaw is a perfect digestive to the heaping amount of pulled pork you'd be served.  The hush puppies balances out the BBQ tray by offering you something mealy savor.    In a pure side-to-side comparison of solely the pulled pork (ignoring every other meat and side), I'd give the edge to Sauceman's.  Even when absolutely stuffed, I just couldn't put down the fork.  I just kept eating and eating.  Again, the red slaw helps tremendously.  But Midwood is legitimately good on its own right.  Briskets were above average.  Ribs about average.  Sides were above average.  Come on .... 508 reviews can't be wrong.  It's the most popular place in all of Charlotte.  Of course you'll come and you'll love it too.  If you took everything in consideration, Midwood and Sauceman's ends up being a tie in my book.  BBQ Hop 2015 #2 [March 2015]
Yum, Yum, Yum!!!  LOVE the food and never had bad service. Downside is parking and they get super busy. I just try to hit it on down times to avoid the parking issues and the wait.

Was in the South Park area and looked on yelp of a BBQ place to eat at. Saw this place was new and decided to try it.  And it was delicious! Staff greets you right away when you walk in. We got the queso brisket small dish and it came out and we thought it was a large dish. It was a very good choice to get that cause it was very delicious. My girlfriend got the brisket small plate  and it came with hush puppies and pickled onions with a side door of mac and cheese and they ask if you want fat, lean, or both for the brisket. The mac and cheese was very cheesy. I got the 1/2 chicken and it also came with hush puppies and the pickled onions and I received two sides with my plate. I ordered the BBQ baked beans and jalapeño wrapped bacon and they were very delicious. I could've ate a whole plate of them. The waitress we had was very friendly and asked a couple of times how we were doing. If it's a nice day make sure to ask to sit outside. They do run the ac a little low so it does get cold inside.  The patio is a very big area. The BBQ sauce was okay for me. There ice is the best! It's the little chunks that last long. It was to sweet for me but my girlfriend loved it. They have 2 other locations. If your around for BBQ this a place to go!

Midwood BBQ Bar was suggested to us as it is quickly becoming a BBQ institution in Charlotte. We had the pleasure of dining there at their Ballyntyne location on New Years Day for dinner.   North Carolina and Charlotte in general have a lot of BBQ restauarants. Most are very average. Some pulled chicken or pork smothered in copious amounts of some mysterious red sauce so you can't even tell if the meat was actually good ! That is NOT the case here at Midwood. For starters they only use hickory wood to smoke their meats in a one of a kind old school manual commercial smoker.  Someone has to feed the smoker constantly to keep the fire going and maintain a even temperature in the smoker at all times. That takes a lot of work . More art than science and it shows in their food.We started with some smoked wings. dry on the outside but moist and flavorful inside. My daughter chose the kids pulled pork sandwich w/sweet potato fries. She loved it ! They have a wonderful taco selection {yup, tacos at a BBQ spot !} You have a choice of 3 . All were fresh and yummy. The baked mac and cheese disappeared promptly also ! I had a new years special that is not normally on their menu. Pork shoulder , collards and black eyed peas. All for good luck to start 2017. Their extensive cocktail and bourbon/whisky list made a choice rather difficult. My hubby kept it classically simple with a Makers Mark 46 and Ginger Ale.   Service was prompt, informative and friendly. The manager demanded we try some brisket before we departed , so we managed to try a few bites. WOW ! tender, tasty and perfect mix of lean and fat.Midwood is now our "GO TO " spot when we are in Charlotte and craving REAL BBQ !

This place has some pretty good bbq. Thursday nights is the night to check this one out since they let you bring in 40 ounce mugs and get top offs for anywhere from 4$ to 8$ depending on the beer.   The service here is excellent and as I said the food is good but it tends to get a bit cramped inside. If you are sitting at a high top or the bar you are always getting jostled around but bring on the 40 ounce beers and all those minor concerns will fade away.

Great bbq, great local beers on tap, and great service. Went there on a Friday night and it was busy, but the wait was not bad at all. Just enough time to drink a beer outside on the patio. Cool atmosphere and a good neighborhood with plenty of places to grab some drinks after you eat. I'll be back again soon.

Love their bbq, whether pulled pork, chicken, or brisket they are outstanding at bbq meat! I also like the el fuego & chicken tacos when I am feeling not as hungry. The sweet potato fries are delicious. And I eat the roast veggies when I'm being healthy usually. They have a good take on the Moscow mule cocktail and their margaritas that have old bay on the glass with salt. Sort of a salty sweet smoky pairing for margaritas.

Best BBQ I've ever had!! I wish I lived in Charlotte because I would be eating here everyday!  The brisket, mac and cheese and bacon wrapped jalapeños were off the chains delish!  My husband had the chicken and ribs plate so of course I tried the ribs....sooooo damn good! Plus they give different bbq sauce options and my fav was the one with the hint of jalapeño or habanero(I can't remember which pepper hint it was)anyways that was good.  The customer service was amazing! Everyone was very friendly and welcoming. Our waiter was knowledgeable and very attentive.  He even surprised us with banana pudding dessert! That was to die for! I can't wait to visit Midwood again

A-Ok.... Let me just say, I LOVE THEIR CUBAN Sandwich!!! to die for... the only reason why they are getting 3 stars is because some of their staff SUCKS!!!!  I think I have called in about 8 times in the past for pick up orders, each time I say PLEASE put some napkins and silverware in because I like to eat out in the park or somewhere outdoors, therefor I cannot get my own fork!, all 6 times I've ordered, they don't ive me any napkins or silverware! it is becoming super annoying , there were few times that the waiter had a bad attitude and I was just about to call the manager because that was the same person who did not put napkins and silverware, the only thing you are supposed to do!!!

The bbq chicken was moist tender, and oh-so-smoky.  Got the sampling platter and split it with my husband and it was almost too much for us.  BBQ beans were out of this world, the burnt ends are fantastic.  Ambiance was just perfect, the wait staff were friendly, fun, and on their toes.   Love this place!

We were driving down Central Ave last night, looking for someplace to eat.  We figured we'd go to one of the places we've already been, when we spotted the Midwood Smokehouse.   It looked nice on the outside and there seemed to be people milling about, so we figured it must be good.    There was a 20-minute wait, so we sidled up to the bar for a drink.  During our stint at the bar, some stools opened up, so we sat down and were invited to dine there as well by the bartender.  Rather than wait longer and, since the restaurant was pretty much a bar atmosphere overall, we decided to go ahead and stay put.  I didn't really want an appetizer, but the bacon-wrapped jalapenos sounded delish!  That's when I noticed that they're available as a side item.  Woo hoo -- SOLD!    I ordered the small-sized version of the Carolina Pork plate (with vinegar-y BBQ sauce) and the jalapenos as my side.  Out came this big pile of shredded pork.  The sauce was served in a small ramekin on the side, which really isn't enough.  Be sure to request 2 or 3!   On the side were my jalapenos wrapped in bacon.  SO yummy!  And, actually, not very spicy.  The hush puppies that also came with the plate were delicious, too.    I really liked Midwood Smokehouse (possibly even more than -- dare I say it?)  Mac's Speed Shop.  They have great food, great prices (on food and drink), and a great atmosphere -- both indoors and out!  The bartender (sorry--I'm not good with names!) was super friendly and efficient, too.

I came in December for an interview and back now in April. I knew I can to make another stop here and they didn't disappoint. Had the Carolina Pork this time and it was amazing. 4 stars because the hush puppies need to be bigger

Sunday I ate at the newest Midwood Smokehouse which had just opened a few days prior behind Park Rd Shopping Center. I am no stranger to this restaurant usually eating at the Plaza Midwood location. I usually get a BBQ plate but opted for a sandwich and fries this time. First of all, this particular location is way nicer than the PM location but each fit the area and clientele they cater to. They weren't very crowded so we were seated right away. Service was excellent but the best part was the BBQ sandwich. Mouth watering delicious!! My only little issue is with the fries. I love the mini crinkle-cut fries but they don't brown them enough. They were limp. I noticed the PM location was the same with their fries too. This wasn't always the case. Back when they first opened, the fries were cooked to perfection. Then suddenly, they decided that crispy fries weren't as important. This won't keep me from returning but I will opt for a different side now instead of the limp fries.

This place is hit and miss. I know people who have eaten at the Johnston Rd location and vowed they would never go back it was so bad. One can like a restaurant for various reasons. Atmosphere & location come in second to the food I would think.   Haven't been here in 5-6 months but was looking forward to the BBQ chicken and those golden mini crinkle fries they cook to perfection.   Well, things have changed in those 5-6 months. The sauce for the chicken now comes on side, and those mini crinkle fries were not so golden. In fact, they were 1 step from disgusting. Way undercooked. The chicken was good but it was way better when the sauce was seared into the meat. I don't normally eat the hush puppies but they turned out to be the best thing on the plate.   On a brighter note, the service was excellent. Drew (man bun) has been there a while and is top notch. But I'm not sure when I will return. There are so many new restaurants opening in Charlotte and I continue to be on the prowl looking for the ones that make me go WOW! Midwood has been knocked way down on my list after today.

I always bring out-of-town guests here for great BBQ and a good selection of local craft brews, and this place never disappoints. I would rate Midwood Smokehouse as the 2nd best BBQ joint in town, behind Bill Spoon's BBQ, but I'm sure some Charlotteans would disagree. Besides the pork BBQ, I really like the collards and vinegar-based slaw, which is getting harder to find nowadays. If you're looking for a fun place to have a beer and some great BBQ, Midwood BBQ should be at the top of your list.
As family we eat here atleast once a month. Don't miss the their burnt ends!! Best BBQ in Charlotte.

Stopped in for a beer with the boys..We were on our way to Sir Edmund's, saw Midwood and decided to just go there..We sat at the small bar(bout  8 stools)  Would probably be better to sit at a table /booth in the future, bar is right at the entrance and all the to go orders are handled there..Small but very good tap selection. Split a brisket sandwich with my son, tasty but a bit greasy & salty(Brisket is chopped, not sliced) Side of mac N cheese was very good..Looking forward to them coming to my neck of the woods in Birkdale next month..

There are a lot of great places to get BBQ in Charlotte and this is one of my favorites! Whenever I have guests in town, or anyone asks me for a recommendation I always suggest it.   I love the Plaza Midwood location! It is a great atmosphere. Last time I went, I went with 2 girl friends and we split the BBQ platter. There was so much food. It was great!! Definitely a must visit in Charlotte

I went for lunch the first time and decided that I would go with the small Carolina pulled pork BBQ and a side of cole slaw.  If you are going to a smokehouse, I thought I should start there.   Delicious!  Finally, good BBQ in Charlotte.  Smoky and tender.  The slaw was good and homemade.  A few tiny hush puppies the size of Tater Tots that were also tasty.  Some pickled onions to set it off a bit.   I got a small platter, and while I wouldn't call the portion generous, it was certainly enough.  But no leftovers :(  Service was very good, quick and responsive.  Friendly and well tended on drinks and checking to see if we needed anything.  I liked the presentation on real plates, vintage retro diner type, a nice touch.    I didn't realize that this was another Frank Scibelli restaurant until I signed on to write a review.   I am a big fan of Mama Ricotta's, Cantina, and Bad Daddy's Burgers formerly Big Daddy's  (great breakfast, if you haven't tried them).  I have high expectations for anything he is associated with.  Midwood didn't disappoint me.   I expect that it will only improve as they settle in.  I can't wait to try the rest of the menu.    We were lucky not to have to wait to be seated, but as more folks discovered this place sometimes there is a wait.  We sat outside at the picnic tables under umbrellas, which was really nice.   Bravo..  Maybe I should give it 5 stars after all.  Just for getting the Q right.  Okay - changed.  I originally gave 4 out of 5 only because I hadn't tried more of of the menu and based it  on one meal.   Sometimes I am disappointed because I know the BBQ can be superb, and sometimes it is too salty.  I raised it to five because I realized that since it opened, it is one of my favorite places for casual and the only place I want to go for BBQ.    I say it is the best in the area for BBQ.
Fantastic beers and BBQ here with excellent service. Having come from Pasadena CA, we expected a lot and they delivered here.

Woo! I finally made it to Midwood!  I love massive amounts of protein and I love massive amounts of BBQ sauce so I really dont know how I put off going to Midwood for so many years.   Two of us split the Combo platter and at first glance, we were worried it wasn't enough for us but my gosh, it was enough and it was fantastic! The brisket is some of the best I've had in Charlotte at a BBQ place, the pulled pork was great, and the ribs were 'fall-off-the-bone-so-freaking-great' yum. We also got pork but it was covered in the mustard sauce that I don't like so I unfortunately didn't get to try it (I was a bit surprised that it came with sauce on it already and sad I missed out on it).   I really liked the hushpuppies and there are some things I am really looking forward to trying in the future, such as the BBQ Queso. That just sounds delicious.   I am happy I finally went and was very pleased. I can't wait to go back. Of my BBQ restaurants I've tried in Charlotte (and there's been a lot), this is top 3, maybe top 2!

Beautiful day to grab lunch and finally get to sit on the patio. Monday's are $3 NC drafts! Already off to a great start. We received outstanding service from our server Lorilee friendly, knowledgeable, and overall had a great vibe with us and other tables. I had the roadhouse burger which was outstanding the fries are enough to share with at least three people. My girlfriend enjoyed the bbq pork sandwich which didn't take long to finish. My first visit and it definitely won't be my last!

The belly was so happy after this grub! I love the Carolina style BBQ with the vinegar flavors.  I tried the sampler and split it with my husband.  We tried the beef brisket, the sausage, the pulled pork, and the chicken.  My favorite was the pulled pork.  The chicken had a mayo looking dressing which I was not feeling so I recommend doubling on the pulled pork because you get 4 meat options on the sampler.  the sampler also includes 2 side orders.  We selected the collard greens and the BBQ beans both excellent!  Seriously love me some Carolina BBQ!!!  Be prepared to wait in line here...it's worth it.

Finally made it here after several attempts( they are always very busy and often have a wait). We were rewarded with some of the best BBQ in Charlotte and some of the best I've ever had. We got wings for an app, one Crispy one Smoked. They serve a full pound, not 6-8 like so many places. The wings were smaller because they were from locally sourced, NATURAL birds not pumped full of hormones. So a pound was probably 15 wings, plenty for sharing. The smoked wings were good but the Crispy were off the hook! Seriously some of the best I've had and I am a Wing Guy.  I got the burnt ends entree with hushpuppies and Collards. Good Lord everything was just insanely good. The burnt ends were sticky, smoky, and sweet with delicious bits of crispy fat. The Collards were the best I've had in Charlotte and all 4 of us agreed. Loaded w hunks of pork perfectly seasoned I could eat a bowl of this by itself!  Local beers on tap I had a Hop Drop n Roll and the ladies had an excellent hard cider. Service was good and friendly and the food was fast considering how busy they were.  Midwood Smokehouse is my new favorite BBQ spot in Charlotte I can't wait to go back!

We are from Texas and came to this place to have dinner due to a long layout on airport. I am glad that we did because food was amazing. My husband and I decided to order the pig out with ribs, double brisket, and sausage everything was splendid.

Caution: know when your body is full. This place is delicious. The brisket made me feel like I was back in Austin. Also had some pulled pork with the mustard and vinegar sauces and it was to die for. The pimento cheese fries as an app are so delicious, but before you know it you have eaten waaayyy more than you intended to. I enjoyed my lunch visit here so much. So much, in fact, that i went home and celebrated with a three hour nap. Solid, cozy place.

Ordered a St. Louis 1/2 rack with creamed corn.  The ribs were wet with a mild red sauce, hush pups were included.  The creamed corn was peppery goodness and the ribs were cut from a slim pig (not thickly covered in meat, they serve you more though to compensate), the hush pups were,... Wait for it... Meh.   The wait staff was busy and forgot butter for the pups, silverware for the creamed corn and largely ignored me. It could improve.  The sweet tea was excellent. I am a big boy and overall the meal was well portioned.

The food was amazing. Being from Florida and traveling for a living I eat BBQ. A lot. This was by far a top 3 in the country. Burnt ends are the bomb. Brisket needs a fork only to slice.  Drew was a great server.  Will be back.

Order the brisket!  As a transplant from Texas, I can tell you that their Brisket, Sausage, and bacon-wrapped-jalapeños are just like home.  I had to ask for bread and pickles (which would have come standard in Texas) but other than that, I was very pleased with my dinner.  I ordered the brisket plate and added on some sausage.  My side was macaroni & cheese and it was ok.  Service was slow, but that was probably because of the server we had.

I've visited this chain at several of the locations and all are good for lunch or dinner. They menu has plenty of items for people that don't want to eat BBQ. Side are generous and all the food is fresh. I especially like the pickled onions that come with the pork plate.
Listen to your taste buds and.....                          Get the Brisket!!!  Best brisket in Charlotte. Bacon wrapped jalapeños pretty tasty as well and not too spicy.

Being from the Midwest I grew up on Memphis, KC and St Louis BBQ and have never really liked the vinegary style of NC/SC q that I've had before. Since I'm in Charlotte I felt like I needed to revisit it and hit up Macs my first night out, got a tip from a local yelper (thx Greg) and made our way up to Midwood.   So I order the sample platter with the choice of four meats, we get the ribs, pulled pork, beef brisket and chicken instead of the sausage. Wife and I got the same meal (almost) at Macs. Can I settle the score? Just like it takes an out of towner to decide between Genos/Pats (it's Pats) Midwood is the better of the two. Not a blowout, but enough to pick a winner, would have picked the sausage over the chicken as neither of us were crazy about it. As people have noted, get those bacon jalapenos as both of your sides. Yowza.  Why not 5 stars? Sorry pal that's reserved for Pappys in St Louis or Central BBQ in Memphis. Midwood is a solid pick and am glad we got to hit it up during our stay here.

I'm a foodie....hands down! Yes, I can be critical and discerning, but I like a great hot dog as well as a great steak.....so here we go.  Thumbs up: server Ev (short for Evan.....a young woman) was patient, pleasant and very helpful. Prices were in line with a BBQ joint.  Thumbs down: the food is mediocre so not sure where the high star reviews are coming from?? Perhaps, when you only have fast food to compare it to then this stuff seems like a night out on the town with the Mrs. Brisket lacked a defined smoke ring and flavor, pulled pork was bland, chicken dry and ribs were decent. All of the meats and rest of the food was salty. They have three sauces and only one was decent. The NC vinegar sauce and the mustard sauce were nasty. Sides were frozen crinkle cut french fries, small dry hush puppies, etc. The menu has too many off shoots from traditional BBQ, which should have been my first clue. Go to Little Miss BBQ in Phoenix, J Muellers or Franklins in Austin and you will see what real BBQ is. If you can't eat the meat without sauce and absolutely love it.....then it just sucks, plain and simple. Seems more like a bar than a real BBQ joint. Got sick from the food. Total waste of money taking a taxi to and from the airport during a layover for this!!! In fairness, I would say if you like bar food it is OK, but nothing special at all and certainly not worth a $40 round trip taxi fare.  Keep it simple and to the basics. If you can't make great BBQ then shut it down....please do not throw stuff on the menu like tacos, bacon wrapped jalapenos, etc. All you are doing is trying to mask your sub par meats (which should be the highlight. QUALITY ALWAYS WINS!!!!  And this ain't quality. It's BBQ Bar Food

Drew was our waiter! 5 stars for him too! The food was authentic BBQ, all from scratch! I even tried the Moonshine! Rated #1 for a reason. Ate here based on reviews. I have to tell you, I've lived all over the mid & southern states and this is delish!

Was visiting a friend in Charlotte who suggested this place. I had never had Carolina BBQ actually in NC, so I was eager to try it. I had a rather basic meal, but it was quite tasty. I had the Carolina BBQ Plate, the pork was so tender, and the vinegar-based sauce was savory and slightly spicy. The service is very friendly, just what comes to mind when thinking of southern hospitality. Good beer selection, especially a lot of NC craft beers that you can't find in MD. Meals are a bit pricey for the portions, though, I was expecting to get a bit more food.

I've never been a huge bbq fan but this place is amazing. I had the pork bbq sandwich and it literally melts in your mouth. The pimento cheese fries are a must for an appetizer. The bbq baked beans are so flavorful as well as the sweet potato fries. We had great service and the prices are not outrageous. Go there! You won't regret it.

Really good barbeque,  nice outdoor seating, and a decent beer selection.  We ordered plenty a ton of food, large combo platter, burnt ends, fried pickles, 5 sides,  and two desserts.  All of it was fantastic.  The burnt ends were the highlight followed up by the ribs. The meats had so much flavor,  which we were told was due to a wood burning smoker that ran 24 hrs a day.  We were told this was one of the few true wood burning smokers in town, which, if true is enough reason to eat here.  As for sides, all great with the stand outs being the super creamy mac & cheese and the bacon wrapped jalapenos.  They had roughly 10 local beers on the menu plus all your standard options. Desserts were good, but not the highlight.

Omg I just tried this place for the first time today and it was amazing! I only had a few small bites before coming to the conclusion that this is some great BBQ!! I am so glad I found this little treasure! I will most definitely be back again, again and again!!

Our go-to BBQ in Charlotte. Tender, flavorful meat and great options for side dishes. The pecan pie is beyond AMAZING! Love love love this place. Soon they'll have to expand the seating, but thankfully they're grab-n-go service is high quality too!
One of my fave places in Charlotte! The BBQ sammies, Mac and cheese, and pimento cheese fries? You can't go wrong!

Rarely do I give a place 5 stars. This place however, at 9:30 pm, still was serving amazing fresh food. I mean I deliberately asked for a salad and just to see how fresh everything was going to be, also asked for the beef brisket. Being that I have not eaten any red meat in about 6 months, this was breaking my own rules. But, I had to know. How was it you asked? Amazing! Simply succulent and as sweet as it could be. There are many places that give you this rushed and dried out barbecued meats... this place won't do that. They have somehow, perfected the art.

We stayed a night in Charlotte and naturally wanted some southern BBQ. This place showed up as highly rated so we went! The parking lot was packed but we found parking on the back side of the building. We decided to split the 'Well Fed' combo with ribs, pulled pork, pulled chicken, and brisket. It didn't look like much food at first but ended up being enough for 2. The ribs were definitely the winner of the day. So tender and tangy; bbq'ed to perfection! Next up was the brisket, a little fatty but good nonetheless. The pulled pork was next; very tender and flavorful. I didn't really care for the pulled chicken. It lacked tenderness and flavor in my opinion. The Mac n cheese was delicious! Very cheesy! The sweet potato fries were tasty and crunchy. I definitely recommend giving this place a try. Our waitress was great. The space was great and there looked to be a rooftop deck as well.
Very good. So much food! I had the brisket, burnt ends, bacon wrapped jalapeños, and Mac and cheese. It was all really good!

So good.   The 50/50 split of the beef brisket LITERALLY melts in your mouth.   My kids enjoyed everything as well.   The food is delicious and well prepared.  My wife loves their salads so she can get a green and a delicious lean.   Really good stuff.   The wait staff was friendly and attentive.  The manager checked in on us to make sure that we were satisfied.
Solid and consistent BBQ. I love the brisket grilled cheese with the Mac n cheese. Great staff and service is always attentive.

The bbq sauces are fantastic for sure! They'd make even great food taste better. And you absolutely *must* try the baked beans! (unless you're vegetarian)  There's been a line (20-30 min wait) the two times I've been here for dinner but I don't see what the hype is about. Both times, the food was as good as what comes out of my kitchen and I didn't have to cook it so I suppose that makes me happy. The service was ok; the waitress was friendly and got everything right but it was a long time between table visits even when bringing condiments; I think they must have been short-handed. Bacon wrapped jalapeños were quite tasty but some were waaaay hotter than others. It was like 3 were poblano and two were real jalapeños seeds included. (I like it hot!) The turkey (special of the day) was nothing to write home about but it was definitely something I'd put on a sandwich for lunch the next day.  All in all, if you're looking for a new place to eat, check it out. You won't be sorry you came.

If had the pleasure to dine at their locations in Ballantine and plaza midwood. Both have set the bar extraordinarily high in terms of BBQ. The brisket is made to perfection. Their brisket sandwich is a must. Also try their smoked ribs. This will always be my go to spot.

The food was amazing. The staff made every attempt to accommodate our large party (including our wheelchair using friend). A great atmosphere. Stunning BBQ that I'll never find the equal of back in NJ.

Called at 6:15 on a Friday night to order 2 lbs. of pulled pork and 1 lb. of lean brisket, and were told they were out of lean brisket, and to hold on to see if they had enough mixed brisket.  They came back to the phone and said they would not have any more pork for a few hours, and that they could not fill our order for brisket either.  We were not offered an alternative, and wound up driving across town to the always reliable Bill Spoon's BBQ.  How could a bbq place run out of two of their most popular items by 6:15 on a Friday night?!  Coincidentally, I just heard the other day that the cardinal rule of bbq is "Don't run out".....

What can I say? This place continues to deliver the best customer service experience in town. Amanda was on point with multiple items going on at once. The bacon wrapped jalepenos appetizer was nothing short of a mouth watering delight. Thanks for a great experience.

So being from out of town, I told myself that I definitely had to get BBQ before I left. Unfortunately, when you're participating in a wedding and staying about 35 minutes from the venue, time runs a bit short.
