Found this place on Yelp, and we were a little skeptical since it was out in the burbs, but being that we were so short on time, we figured burbs BBQ was better than nothing. Upon first walking in, it was a nice sized space, clean, and pretty modern in terms of decor. My first thought was, well, guess I'm at a chain. Boy could I not have been more wrong. We were seated quickly, and the service was fantastic. The server gave us a rundown on the history and the well known dishes (i.e. the brisket). We got a combination platter of ribs, burnt tips, brisket, and pulled pork. Sides of mac and cheese, beans, and greens. In terms of the sauces, they had a standard BBQ, Carolina vinegar based sauce, a Carolina mustard, and a habanero BBQ.   The brisket was all it was cracked up to be. There was a nice pink ring from the smoking. There was a nice juiciness to it from the fat. Great smoke flavor that did not need sauce at all. Adding the vinegar sauce to the pulled pork definitely enhanced its flavor. The pork was already so tender. The burnt ends though, wow. So tender, smoky, and filled with flavor. The ribs had a nice dry rub to them and were fall off the bone tender. The greens were tender but not completely fall apart, perfect for my liking. Mac and cheese wasn't mind blowing but good. The beans had some chunks of pork in them that enhanced the flavor. I was completely wrong with my assumptions. I would definitely visit again if down in Charlotte.

Best BBQ in Charlotte.....  Maybe.  4.5 star restaurant, not even close IMO.  I don't get the hype at all.  Better than Mac's and most of the well known competition in town, but that isn't saying much.  Charlotte is a desert for solid southern BBQ.  The jalapeno poppers are good.  I'm down whenever.  The wings are pretty good.  Although, I'd rather have McCoy's smoke house if that was the only reason I was going.  The combo options seem to be the best deal if you have more than 3 or so people.  Get the brisket, get the ribs and then whatever else suits your fancy.  Bottom line.  I'll be back.  But, it wouldn't be hard for another place to sway my vote for best BBQ in the queen city.

My favorite barbecue spot in Charlotte - and not because of the meat! If you anything like me, you love sides. Mid wood has the option to create a meal entirely comprised of their side dishes (aka my dream come true.) Their macaroni & cheese and baked beans alone keep me coming back for more.
Tied w/ Sauceman's for best bbq in Charlotte.

BBQ was good and the service was top notch.  We didn't like the brisket as much as the other meats.  The cole slaw was on the warm side which is never attractive to a southerner.  Baked beans were ok.  Definitely worth a second try if we're in the area.
The brisket was on point, I even used the word fantastic!! My wife was like wha??? Very hard to please me with brisket. Great atmosphere and great service.
Best Texas style beef brisket and ribs East of Texas besides Judge Roy Bean's in Brentwood,  Tennessee.  Great variety of beers , good bloody Mary's and Atmosphere

So... we bought the Party Pack for 8-10 people for our Father's Day brunch which totaled $81 after tax. The meal that we received will certainly not be enough to feed 8-10 people (more like 4 but certainly not 8 people and no where near 10 people) and was way overpriced. We are disappointed with this purchase and will think long and hard before we purchase any Party Pack from this restaurant again.

We were super excited to see the Midwood Smokehouse sign go up so close to where we leave, almost immediately after visiting the Central location. We really liked the food, but didn't like the layout of the Central location.   A few weeks after opening (and getting their liquor license) we stopped by on a Thursday afternoon to get dinner. The dining room had a wait so we sat at the bar. The bar staff works so hard to make all of the drinks and deliver food to the bar guests. We ordered the sampler platter which is 4 meats and 2 sides + hush puppies and pickled onions. In our experience we find that it is best to get the following: pulled pork, pulled pork (x2), ribs, and brisket (combo lean and fatty) along with another order of hush puppies, and macaroni and cheese. We would get another rib vs. another pulled pork however, it costs extra and we are cost efficient.   The ribs are so good, fall off the bone, doesn't need sauce kind of good. The brisket is so good, my husband, (who said he doesn't like brisked) ate his fair share. We got 2 orders of hush puppies because they are worth it. And the mac and cheese, which I am the queen of picky, was gone. Like poof, where did the macaroni go? Kind of gone.   This is also the perfect share with another meal. And they have OMB Copper. And they have BYOM (bring your own mug) night.   Go there. But don't take our seat at the bar.

I did the  Beef Brisket, Chicken BBQ, Smoked Veggies and Crinkle Cut Fries. Of the two, the chicken was by far the better as the brisket was way to fatty. I mean, I like to have some fat on the meat, but when the fat to meat ratio is more fat, it seems like a waste. The smoked veggies, maybe it was because it was the end of the day, but I did not bother to eat them, they just tasted gross. Of course the fries were good!  Overall, I would come here to eat the chicken again and maybe try the burnt ends or the pulled pork,
Best beef brisket sandwich I've ever had. Mac and cheese was pretty awesome. Great service and atmosphere.

Unreal. Food, service, ribs, Mac and cheese, atmosphere... 100%  Our server Kathy was nice and fun and playful, but always kept our drinks full and was great with my kids.  The food... wow... we had a Pig Out plate and it fed 4 of us. So so good! And the banana pudding was amazing!
Burnt ends weren't cooked to a high enough temp and didn't have a great bark. Way off the mark. The service was great and atmosphere is too. I'll have to give something else a try.

So I am definitely one that seeks out authentic bbq in any southern city I visit for work or play. I happened to be in Charlotte for work and knew I had to stop by one of the Midwood locations. They are a brisket house by far, meaning they are a Texas style bbq.  I ordered the four meat combination platter to try everything. I selected the brisket, chopped pork, pulled chicken, and the pork ribs. By far the brisket was the best of the bunch, even though everything was quite tasty. The brisket was melt in your mouth. I selected half lean and half fatty for the brisket. Paired with Mac n cheese and cole slaw, I enjoyed every bite! Come hungry! Definitely will make another trip here.

I feel sorry for anyone who thinks this is the best BBQ in Charlotte. We had a bad experience here a couple years ago, but family kept going back so we wanted to give it another chance. HORRIBLE MISTAKE. The BBQ queso was not good at all. Looked and tasted like microwaveable dip from a jar. The tortilla chips were somehow stale, oily and unsalted all at the same time. I got the grilled cheese with pork which subsequently turned into a BBQ sandwich with half a piece of cheese. If you're going to call it a grilled cheese - it should be ooey gooey - just saying. Also did not taste or see the grilled onions and creamy tomato sauce it was supposed to come with. My boyfriend got the brisket plate. It was dry, tough, and completely overcooked. That's the first time I've ever seen him leave brisket on a plate. Service was bottom five I've ever had. We live right around the corner, but would much rather drive to Mac's than come here ever again. Mac's has bigger portions, better food and wayyyy better service for the same price.
A fun place for BBQ. Nice southern style traditional food. Do not go here if you are watching your calories. Finding a healthy option is nearly impossible.

As I've said in other reviews, I almost never give 5 stars, not trying to sound like a snob, but this place deserves it. Great, real wood fired BBQ as well as the typical smokehouse fare. It's right off Central Avenue, the location is a bit odd in an older area of town, with some newer apartments across the tracks and some older cottages behind it. Be on the lookout if you're driving, it's tucked back so it can be easy to miss. Accessible by bus and hopefully streetcar soon, maybe 10 mins from uptown, so a good option if you're visiting without a car. Staff is polite, food is great, decent prices. The ONLY complaint I have, and that really has nothing to do with the establishment itself is that parking is very limited. I'm not one who feels entitled to a parking space everywhere I go, but you may have to circle the block a bit, the city doesn't tow this area though, so unless someone calls you should be alright.

My friends and I finally made it to Midwood and we were very pleased with our visit.   After a short wait we were seated and ordered some beers (they have excellent specials) while we checked out the menu. Everything sounded so delicious but I decided to go with the burnt ends and bacon wrapped jalapeños.  The burnt ends (chopped brisket) come doused in their signature home made fat tire sauce. They were delicious. The sauce was spicy and smokey! A truly great combination of flavors! And those damn Bacon Wrapped Jalapeños were outstanding. I mean any time you combine two of my personal faves it's got to be good, but the crispy bacon and stuffed jalapeños delighted my taste buds in so many ways! I only wish there were more on the plate!!!   There's so many things here I'm looking forward to try! The one downside is parking. It's just not enough here! But if you can find a parking spot, this place is definitely worth a visit! I know I'll be back!

Service makes or breaks a restaurant.  There was a healthy wait and we found a couple of spots at the bar. The bartender Pamela did what I consider best practices. She introduced herself along with everyone else behind the bar and said to please ask anyone if we'd like something. That's just good , smart service. We ordered drinks from the drink menu. I asked the bartender for a recommendation. Her favorite was a BeeSting. I thought I may have to wrestle my wife for it. I am happy to do that.  Really good! We ordered the sampler plate. (The smaller one) we both ate from it and have healthy portions to bring home. Highlights were the pork, brisket , ribs , mac & cheese & collard greens. Wait ... Thats everything. They had a vinegar soaking in peppers for the collard greens . Whoa! Almost forgot jalapeños with cheese wrapped in bacon.... Seriously!  Friendly service, great food. We will be back with friends.

Great food! The wait time was not a big problem. And the use of Yelp to track the wait time was perfect. My husband was able to drink his stout beer and we could enjoy the lovely evening. The atmosphere was nice.

Have been to midwood a few times now and have loved the food each time! The service is good and the staff is very friendly. Any place that serves great BBQ and keeps a cold beer in front of me is tops on my list!!

I've sampled my fair share of barbeque from many different styles up and down the east coast and out west as well and Midwood Smokehouse can definitely compete with these guys.   This place was already filling up 11:45 am on a Friday morning. It was a beautiful day so we snagged a spot on the outdoor patio and immediately start gawking at all the delicious-looking plates around us.  I decided on the blue cheese brisket sandwiched served between two pieces of Texas toast and the boyfriend ordered the half rack f rib special but substituted the BBQ spaghetti with mac n cheese.  The sauces same out way ahead of time from the food which is a bit of a pet peeve of mine especially when you are really anxious for your meal. Of course I sampled each one alone and new exactly which combination of each I like. The mustard-based sauce and then Midwood sauce were my favorites. We were surprised how long we had to wait for our meals as barbeque usually comes out pretty quick, but to be fair, they were pretty busy.  Everything was pretty darn good. The sweet potato fries were most impressive to me (I'm very picky about my fries) and the brisket sandwich was very good as well. The ribs were not necessarily "fall off the bone" but the smoky rub was outstanding. The mac n' cheese was nothing to swoon over.  Next time I come back I'll definitely need to try a traditional pulled pork BBQ sandwich along with the delicious sweet potato fries.

Placed a to-go order this evening at the Park Road location. We ordered a 1/2 rack of ribs, however mgr comes out to tell us all out so would we like a beef rib instead. He thanked us profusely- now we know why. Charged us $30, twice the price. Shame on us for not questioning the ole bait & switch

Hands down best food and best service in Charlotte! Every time I eat at this place my facial hair grows a little more every time, my voice gets deeper, and I suddenly get the urge to fight bears and eat brass. This place just makes a man out of you.

Enjoyed lunch with my family at this location. The service was great and the food very tasty.  Hubby and I ordered the well fed item to share which was enough for the two.  Kids had chicken tenders.  Impressed with the serving size of the kids portion.  Love best of all the hickory smoked sausage, baked beans which have been the best I ever had and the chopped Carolina pork.  We definitely will be visiting again soon.
Delicious BBQ. Great service. My two favorites were the burnt ends and smoked sausage with mustard.

Being from Arizona I am not qualified to rate NC BBQ. This was the only BBQ joint we tried while visiting. It was so good!   We had the brisket, burned bits, and the pulled pork. Everything tasted amazing. We did have to wait about an hour to get seated on a Saturday night, but since we were on vacation we didn't mind. I really wanted to try dessert but I was so full I couldn't eat anything else. I will return to Arizona and dream of returning to have more NC BBQ!!!

Awesomely delicious!  My husband and I visit Midwood at least once a week, it is SOOO good!  We have taken all of our out of town guests here and had them cater our Christmas Eve dinner last year.   They smoke everything onsite andy ou can smell the meat cooking as soon as you step out of your car.  The bbq and brisket are fantastic and they have the best pulled chicken I've ever had.  They have a few sauces onhand so you can have thick, mustard or vinegar sauce to accompany your meal.   I love getting the Midwood Chopped Salad and I usually add the pulled chicken to it.  The salad is filled with grilled corn, black beans, avocado, cucumbers and freshly grated cheddar cheese. Another favorite meal to order are the tacos- you can mix and match so you can try bbq, pulled chicken and/or brisket at the same time.  The mac and cheese and creamed corn are out of this world.   Plan your visit now, you can't go wrong!

The food was good. We started with smoked wings as an app. For entrees we had smoked brisket  (they give you the option of lean, fatty or mixed, I chose mixed) and the ribs and chicken combo. Everything was good. Loved the fries... yummy. My man had the beans he said they had alot of meat in them. We ate it all (lol). The service was fast and Gary was the best server. Try it...you won't be disappointed.

So glad we decided to do carry out! This was my first and only taste of North Carolina que and it was a solid choice. The place was completely packed, even for carry out! I'd recommend ordering online bc it's faster. Only thing is the combo platter wasn't an option so I waited until I got there to order mine and I had to wait a bit. Macaroni was to die for and I loved the spicy bbq. Combo platter was enough to feed 2-3 people so recommend sharing that one :)

Y'all.  I can make my own salad here with up to seven (7) toppings. S-E-V-E-N.  This is the spot that J and I can 100% agree on whenever we "don't know what we want/don't care/too lazy to cook/life is insane sometimes..."   I have to say I haven't really ventured far from my SEVEN-topping salad extravaganza. Poor J has to listen to me every time. He's always like, are you done yet?  Midwood is so solid. I absolutely love their smoked chicken on top and have also enjoyed the pork. Service is usually pretty good here, too, which I feel is always hit or miss at a BBQ place.  On the weekends, be prepared to wait. They offer a couple (literally, like 2) brunch options on the weekend, which sometimes I wish was expanded, but I have to remember its a BBQ spot first and foremost, not a breakfast place.  We have also ordered takeout from here for a small group and it was a hit. Word of advice: over-order on the wings...they will be the first to go!  Okay it's only 7:45 a.m. as I write this and I know I just wrote about how I wish they did breakfast, but now I am really just craving BBQ.
This place has the best barbecue in Charlotte or anywhere else I have personally visited.

Well I gave take out here another chance and all I can say is check your order thoroughly before you leave because they don't.  In addition, the smoked wings were  undercooked, rubbery and not fall off the bone tender as they usually are.

Omg. Great Q. Green goddess dressing was perfect. Brisket was cooked perfectly. Our server Jaime was attentive and friendly. Atmosphere was great for talking.  We went last year on our yearly visit and loved it enough to come back at our next visit. The bbq sauces had a lot flavor - made the whole meal. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Smoked salmon is super tasty!  I sided it with the veggies which were equally as good.  And the hush puppies?!?! YUMMY!!  The service was really good.  They get very busy around mealtime so plan on a little wait.  Well worth the wait!  Good selection of local beers too.
Though it's a BBQ joint this place has one of the best salads around! Must try the Midwood Chopped salad and selection of local beers is awesome.

The food and service is pretty good. I've been to this place a few times. The place is nicely decorated, clean blah blah blah, you get it, it's nice. However, the BBQ is GOOD but NOT GREAT. I've definitely have had better BBQ but this place is pretty good. We've always order the Big BBQ ( I think that's what it's called) because its for a larger party but its great because you can sample pretty much all the meats on the menu. I just think I'm a bit critical because I have had better BBQ.Its great for big or small groups and the location is ideal. This is one of those places where you can go out to dinner and then check out Plaza Midwood by foot, perhaps go bar hopping (like I  have in that area).

The food and the large portions were good and filling, except for the house salad already heavily laced with pepper when it arrived. If I want to spice my food, please allow me to it. The music was insanely loud and I had great difficulty hearing what my friends were saying right across the table from me. If the music level goes down, then people won't have to be constantly yelling at each other in order to be heard. Thank you.
We had a wonderful time! When you go in ask for Donny he is the best server!. The pork ribs are amazing.

BBQ and Hush puppies hush puppies.....Every combo comes with hush puppies and it was so good. We ordered the choose 4 combo that comes four meats we chose a double order of BBQ with brisket  and smoked sausage. Our sides were the mac and cheese and collard greens. I must say everything was outstanding and they have the best BBQ I have ever had. They give the restaurant 12-Bones a run for there money, I must say. I highly recommend this place if you love BBQ and comfort food.

So glad I chose Midwood as my one BBQ stop on my short trip to Charlotte. Cool vibe & real BBQ atmosphere; sat at the bar & had Matt as my server...he could not have been my gracious in helping with my selections & informing me of everything I needed to know about Midwood.  Had the 4 meats of ribs, burnt ends, pork & brisket. Though all were excellent, the brisket was incredible; perfect fatty/lean ratio, tender & the perfect char.    Sides were a unique option of bacon wrapped cheese stuffed jalapeños (very interesting & tasty) & quite honestly, one of the greatest things I've ever eaten in the baked beans. More like a chili, these beans were moan-worthy, seriously!  All four sauces were great; vinegar based Carolina style, my favorite was the traditional, watery base, followed by the mustard based.  For only a couple more bucks, Matt sold me on the banana pudding, which I ate after I got back to Atlanta for dessert...so creamy, light & yummy!  Thanks again to Matt & Preston at the bar, the assistant GM for checking in with me & the phenomenal pit master for a memorable BBQ experience in Charlotte.

The brisket is the best I've had anywhere. I've been to several well known BBQ spots, but this brisket has them all beat. You also have to try the Jack Daniels cocktails and the bacon wrapped jalapenos!

This is my first time at The Ballantyne location. I have to say it's so much easier to get in and out of then my usual location on Central Avenue. Parking is so much easier too. The size and seating here is much roomier and more accommodating for different size dining parties. A hostess greeted me immediately and the waitress appeared as soon as I sat down. I found my favorite chopped pork salad to be just as delicious here. I still think it's odd they don't have crackers or bread available with their salads.

This place is insanely good. This may be the best BBQ restaurant I've ever been to in my life. I have traveled around the nation and been to many. This place takes the top spot. I'm here for work and got the "well fed" you choose 4 meat and two sides. The ribs are tender and flavored to perfection. The burnt ends are a house favorite and they didn't disappoint. The sausage and the brisket were also incredible. Sometimes at other restaurants the brisket is dry or even too salty. This place does it very well. Lots of flavor without being too salty and it is not dry at all. The ribs were by far my favorite. For sides I got mac and cheese and jalapeño poppers. The mac and cheese is basic and didn't take my breath away but the jalapeño poppers were awesome! They take a huge one and wrap it with a full strip of bacon and I loved every bite! Come hungry for sure. The staff was incredible especially the lady at the bar. It was so good I came back again the next night. SOOOO GOOOD!!!!

Fantastic! Both in quality and quantity of the food. The waiter, I wish I remembered his name, was really nice and really helpful. Nice atmosphere, literally melt in your mouth brisket, and attentive staff mean this place earned all five stars in my book.

This is by far my favorite BBQ joint in Charlotte. I usually get the sampler (around $20)  that comes with your choice of 4 meats and 2 sides and split that with my wife. Easily enough food for two people ... depending on your appetite you may even come home with leftovers. The bacon-wrapped jalapeno poppers are an absolute must. Easily the highlight of my meal --- also their brisket is on pointttt. A great atmosphere and fun place to come with a small group of friends for dinner.

This was my first visit so can't compare it to the original location.  The place is nice, open and clean. The server was pleasant and attentive. Had the burnt ends and the sauce was really tasty.  Could have dealt with less fattiness. The macaroni and cheese was creamy, cheesy and browned cavatappi (corkscrew) deliciousness.  Was too full for dessert, but have to return and try the pecan cobbler.

Came here to get some chopped pork and collard greens. Sad to say the food is touch or go. Ordered the sampler which had ribs, pulled porked, pulled chicken and brisket. The ribs were really good seasoned to perfection. Didn't really care for the brisket as much but the pulled pork and chicken was good. They also have a unique mustard sauce that's out of this word. The Mac and cheese was half done and cold and the other sides were just okay. Five stars for the banana pudding very good!.
Excellent mac and cheese! Great sauces. But to be honest, Mac's speed shop has better pulled pork.

We walked in with a group of 10 -- on a Saturday night at 7:45, not the best strategy. But we were seated in only 20 minutes at two tables (6+4) -- probably as good as we could have hoped for. The staff was very accommodating and friendly from the moment we stepped in.  The beer selection was good, solid -- just fine for casual dinner. Our table had fried pickles for an appetizer and they were delicious -- crispy on the outside and cut on the diagonal to give lots of area for dipping.  The barbecue I had was incredible. Their brisket can stand up to anything I've had in a Texas restaurant. I had their signature sauce which was a smoky, sweet & tangy (more tang than sweet) mixture, on a combination of lean and fatty brisket. I was floored by how delicious it was. I also had the bacon-wrapped jalapenos as a side. Do be cautious with these -- they vary in terms of hotness (seeds, most likely). The first I had was mild and the second knocked me for a loop! But totally enjoyable. The collard greens were also solid -- not mind-blowing, but very good. The portions were very generous and there's no way to leave this place hungry after a platter.  A dining companion, in fact, ordered a platter and couldn't begin to finish his pulled pork. He offered me a taste. It was tossed in the spicy BBQ sauce already. I had a few mouthfuls, and they were exquisite. I wish I'd been able to taste with the vinegary NC sauce I love so much -- maybe next time!  The service was excellent and our waitress brought a smile to the table every time she came by to check on our progress and offer refills. I was so full of good cheer and barbecue that I was halfway planning already to come back the next night. Definitely worth a visit for a casual dinner with friends -- I would love to come back next time I'm in town.

Love this place.  I have been here plenty of times for take out, as well as with big friend groups and even two work lunches. This place is really good.   I am not a bbq expert like reviewers claiming they are super pro, I just like it frequently and I am really picky about how it tastes. Midwood serves just the right sauces with everything.  Sauce is basically my favorite part of the meal and these guys nail it. I love getting the hush puppies with the regular bbq sauce, or the thin vinegar nc style sauce with the pork.   And I don't see a lot of people mentioning this, but ... the bbq chicken with the SC style mustard sauce, is probably my #1 favorite. It's so tasty.  Also important: The staff have invariably been courteous and friendly to me, even when I show up 15 minutes before closing to please get a to go sandwitch. They never make me feel like it's the end of the night or anything, I get the same bright cheer I would at 7 pm.   And 1/2 price nc drafts on mondays is pretty much the best. basically this place is great.

Oh..... my.......dear..... lord.... This was..... amazing. This.... THIS is why I search out  good  Q it's just.... sublime. Ok let's see, I had the small platter... SMALL mind you and I couldn't finish it. It came with 4 meats. I got the pulled pork (really dang good, pour just a little of their vinegar based sauce on it to put it over the top) Brisket (they ask you how fatty you want it it was .... oh my god ... it was awesome) Sausage (it's sausage how could it be bad?) Ribs (OMG ribs they come with a dry rub DON'T YOU DARE POUR SAUCE ON THOSE RIBS ok you can put sauce of the ribs but try them without sauce the rub is really good) Sides I got the mac and cheese (if you're sensitive to salt you might think it's too salty I thought it was good) and the beans (they  were good with an interesting pork and peppery flavor). I've drug my poor mom to three BBQ places in as many days so she got a salad and was VERY happy with it (lots of different kinds of lettuce no iceberg, roasted corn etc etc). I tasted the shredded chicken on top and it was tasty and not at all dry.  We had some hushpuppies before the meal they were very good served with their signature tomato based sauce (which is GOOD I took a pint home with me). They have a great beer selections and they even have a few vegetarian options (something called a black bean burger?? and mom says they had three different salads. I dunnow I'm a carnivore) We asked because my sister is a vegetarian  and the waitress was right on top of what they had that was vegetarian so if you have a friend who prefers killing plants to animals and you can drag them in the door they won't starve. Service was fast and very friendly they totally kept on top of keeping me in drink. I'm going to try REAL hard to make it back before I leave town. So much more to try there. And guys.. (by that I mean men) use their bathroom.... just trust me on this.   If you're a local and you haven't been here  WHY ON EARTH HAVEN'T YOU BEEN HERE?   If you'e not a local and you're just passing through seriously give them a try.

I heard a lot about this place and Mac's as the place to go for BBQ and I have to say I was pretty impressed. The ribs especially were amazing. My friend and I got the sampler platter with ribs, pulled pork, pulled chicken and brisket. I think we also got sides of Mac and cheese, collard greens and hush puppies. The collard greens were gross but it's also the first time I've tried collard greens so maybe I just don't like them period. Hush puppies were good and Mac and cheese was okay, a little under flavored. But let's talk BBQ! The ribs were by far the best. Next time I come it will definitely be for those. They were well seasoned and very tender. Other BBQ was pretty good. I'd probably say the pulled pork was next best then brisket then chicken. If you've never been before sampler is a nice way to go but if you just want some good food get the ribs!

I am in love with Midwood Smokehouse! We just moved to Charlotte and after a day of moving furniture with my family and friends we were in some serious need of food. I did a quick yelp search and decided to head over and pick up food for all of the helpers!   Came in and placed a large to-go order consisting mostly of pulled pork sandwiches, which everyone enjoyed. The best part was all of the different sides! I think that we were able to try most of the options but the stars were the mac-n-cheese, the bacon wrapped jalapenos and the potato salad. It was even super delicious the following day when we reheated the leftovers!!  I do have to give a special thanks to the bartender who went through the bag to verify all of our food was included before we left. Had he not we would have been one sandwich short and that would not have been good! So, thanks for being so thorough!   Fast forward 2 weeks, the house is all unpacked and my husband and I are craving the BBQ again. This time we decided to actually eat in. The service was top notch and the food amazing. I stuck with the pulled pork and the husband went with the special which was a brisket taco with spicy slaw (SO GOOD!!!). We were both really happy with our choices and left full, with to go cups for our iced teas. I always think this is nice, especially after a big meal like BBQ!   I will def be returning and even as I'm writing this review, I'm wondering if I will be able to convince the hubs to go tonight!

Apparently, Obama and Hilary beat me to this place.  I got here though and when I did, I had the chopped salad topped with burnt brisket tips. I also tried the Bramble - which is a cocktail made with blackberry moonshine. Both were delicious! I went with a group so this was a table of 7 and service was pretty good - there were no long delays and our drinks were refilled as expected.   Would definitely return!

What a disappointment. Food was so so. Drinks were small and expensive. My lady had a Cuban sandwich. Very chewy mostly bread. I am part Cuban, this was nowhere near. I had the daily special, rib meat tacos and a side salad. Asked that the salad come out first. It didn't. All came out together. The soft taco shells were cold, meat had zero flavor although it was semi tender. Drinks were seven dollars a piece, very small and lacked the vodka for the seven bucks. Hush puppies were ok, mostly cold. Side salad with Tomato Vinaigrette was plenty full and tasty. When asked by server how meal was I told here a disappointment. She sent manager over. Nice lady who listened and made our complaint feel welcomed. When I mentioned the drink she said she was aware and was waiting for bigger glasses. Nice atmosphere inside, clean with a 95 score. With so many places to choose from in the Ballantyne area this will not get my repeat business.

I heard a lot of really great things about this place before I finally went. Needless to say I really wanted to like it and to finally find decent barbecue in Charlotte. Unfortunately my meal was just average. I got the brisket platter with mashed potatoes, stuffed jalapeños, and hush puppies. The BBQ sauce itself was okay. The brisket average quality average taste. The mashed potatoes were a special and it was weird they served them with turkey gravy. I wish they would've asked if I wanted gravy because I would've said no. Turkey gravy and brisket is a bad combo. Hush puppies were excellent. Jalapeños were okay... Not a huge fan. The pecan cobbler with ice cream was ridiculously good! Service was excellent. I still prefer a long drive to Lancasters.

I absolutely love the bbq salads here! This dish is unlike any found at other restaurants. Thankfully you can buy half portions because it would be a real shame to waste any of a full portion. The original restaurant on Central Avenue is closest to me but I'm looking forward to trying the new location at Ballantyne. It can be very discouraging to see a huge crowd waiting to get in but I've never had to wait longer than 15-20 minutes. Once seated the wait staff is quick and efficient. Excellent prices for delicious and ample meals.

Went to Midwood looking for the elusive eastern Carolina bbq.  Oh...  I found it.  And this was an experience I'll never forget.  This was the best bbq I've had since visiting a po dunk grandma bbq joint in wake forest.  I am in bbq nirvana.  The sauces are amazing. The had sweet,  spicy,  mustard and vinegar.  Just what I was looking for.   I can't wait to come back. Can we get one of these in California.?

Fair quality food, horrible wait staff, very stuck up waitresses and bartenders.  They bartenders at this location all act like they are better than you, and the same goes for the waitresses, it is a shame that they act like that when they are depending on tips as their income.  The food quality is ok, they do use the cheap ketchup though, and also charge extra money for such small things as ranch sauce.  If you can skip this place I would recommend doing that.  They do have multiple locations.

Midwood Smokehouse has excellent, 5 star fatty brisket and mostly good other items.   My family of 6 (5 adults + 1 kid) split a Pig Out combo platter, 2 tacos, and a few sides.   Pig Out Platter with...  - Brisket (fatty): Amazing! So flavorful, moist without being gross like I've had at other places. Probably the best I've had.  - St Louis Style Pork Ribs (dry): A lot of nice smoke flavor in the ribs. I liked them even better when I added sauce which is an option but my dad prefers dry.  - Carolina Chopped Pork: The weakest item in the platter. Texture was good, but the taste wasn't there.   - Hickory Smoked Sausage: Good, nice flavor and texture. The brisket and ribs were good enough that I wish we had just gotten 2x brisket and 2x ribs though!   Stockyard Tacos - Why order tacos at a BBQ place? I think the answer is, "Don't let kids order anything." Somehow the addition of all the taco toppings made the brisket less interesting, not more.   Sides - Hush Puppies: I really liked these hush puppies. Nice crunch on the outside, soft inside, and buttery corn flavor. The only downer was how few we got. The platter came with hush puppies, and we also ordered a side of them, but we still only got about 9.  - Mac & Cheese: Not great. Dry without any strong cheese taste.  - BBQ Baked Beans: Really good! Hearty and meaty.  - Creamed Corn: I've never had this before so I can't really compare it to any other versions, but I liked it. Very rich.  - Collard Greens: They were collards... not much else to say. As good as others I've had.  - Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos: They tasted mostly of bacon. No taste of the peppers themselves or the cheese that was inside.  - Sweet potato fries: A very generous amount of fries. I love sweet potato fries and this was no exception.   The only other weak point to mention is that for a BBQ place, they're surprisingly stingy with the sauce. My whole family had to split 4 small containers of sauce (like takeout ketchup sized). It was busy so it was hard to get more. Even after asking mid-meal, we didn't get any more until our server came by to pack up our leftovers. I've mostly been to places where the containers are just on the table. If you like sauces, ask for more at the start.   Overall: delicious brisket, generous portions, and friendly service with a few minor issues. I'll definitely be back again the next time I'm in Charlotte.
If it's good for the Prez and future Prez as well as Secret Service, 'nuff said.  I have enjoyed their entrees for the last couple of years.

The bacon wrapped jalapeños were exceptional as an appetizer. The brisket was also very good, tender and not over smoked. Creamed corn and smoked vegetables were yummy!! Jackie was a great waitress, friendly, and knowledgeable. I'll be back next time I'm in the area!!

I'm a native Carolinian and this is, hands down, the best BBQ I've had in my life. The brisket is tender and delish and the chopped pork is amazing. I love the Flat Tire Sauce and well as the vinegar based one. Our service was friendly and fast, even though they were slammed for Father's Day. Definitely a must try if you love your Cue!

Bit of a wait even with call ahead but the food was very good.  Build your own salad was fresh and full of the add ins we picked.  Smoked chicken was excellent - tender, juicy puled chicken.  We will be back again.

I ordered the brisket small plate with baked beans through postmates & wasn't quite sure what to expect. I did look through the Yelp pictures & saw the brisket. It looked amazing. When I received my order- it was mouthwatering deliciousness. The brisket melted in my mouth & the BBQ Baked beans were the best I've had this year. I also saw the banana pudding pictures & had to order it. It was very delicious but very rich so make sure you have someone to share it with. I can't wait to go in person to this spot to have more of its amazing food!!!

Best southern food I have had in charlotte to date! I ordered the small plate brisket which includes the hush puppies, pickled onions (yummm) and one side- I ordered the BBQ Baked Beans & I also had the banana pudding. I had it delivered via postmates - it said the wait would be about an hour to have it delivered but I got the food within 35-40 mins. When I received the food, it was heavenly. The entire meal felt like it just came out of the kitchen & was the perfect temp. The meal was superb & omg the desert! It's delicious but very rich so make sure to share it with someone! I can't wait to visit in person the next time I am in the mood for some good southern cooking!

This was rather hard to find and parking was limited, otherwise it would be 5 stars. Staff was friendly and all worked together to ensure you had what you needed. Sides were delish! As for BBQ, not bad but I have to say a wee bit dry for my likes. Try the crazy bacon wrapped jalapeño peppers, and amazing hush puppies. Creamed  corn was a favorite for our table.
Yep. Thank goodness this place replaced Smoke. Great barbecue, great ambiance, great beer selection.

Excellent food. The food was delicious. The servers could have been a bit more attentive in the beginning. After it was brought to their attention, things got better, including a complimentary appetizer.

The Pulled Chicken BBQ,  Mac-n-Cheese, and Midwood Chopped salad were delish!  The Sweet tea is good here too if you are a native southerner...otherwise you may want to cut it with unsweet tea.   Next time, I have to try the Habenaro sauce and remember to save room for banana pudding for dessert!  For your next big party or corporate event, you may want to check out their catering and bulk pick up options.
Good BBQ and variety of other foods. I had a salad and it was huge! Definitely get the bacon wrapped jalapeños! Does tend to get very busy and doesn't take reservations.
Decent food but not traditional bar b que.  They took some short cuts with the burnt ends.

Look, I am someone who actually knows what food is supposed to taste like.  I have read some of these reviews and wow, maybe they have been eating Mickey d's mcrib  for years to have thought this was good bbq.   Ribs came out with almost no meat, it was all like burnt and sauceless.  We sent them back and they came out  A LITTTTTLE bit better.  Sides were good (forget which ones we had since this was a couple months ago).  All in all, sucked and go to BOBBIE O'S on old statesville, it blows away this joke of a place as well as macs or lancasters.  it only seats like 8 people tho and is hot as hell inside so do takeout if u have a few people.

I was so disappointed with my meal at Midwood.  After all of the rave reviews and multiple recommendations from others in Charlotte, I was expecting really good BBQ.  I'd say the sides were better than the BBQ.  I got the pulled pork and brisket.  It was under flavored.  The BBQ sauce was decent, but it just wasn't good enough to season the underflavored meat.  The creamed corn and the pecan pie were the stars of the meal.  The hush puppies were dry and flavorless.  The baked beans were good too.  Overall, a very disappointing meal.

Combine queso cheese and pulled pork / brisket with chips for an appetizer and you're off to a great start, just hope you are still hungry for the main course! Brisket was so tender, it fell apart with a fork; I would however suggest the lean form brisket option as the *some fat* option was mostly that, fat. Would recommend overall.

The brisket was great. Ordered the fatty pieces. It was juicy and had great flavor.   Burnt ends on the other hand were subpar. Some of the pieces were quite dry (like turkey) and tough to eat.   I'd say it's a little better than the ny area bbq. But not as good as the Texas bbq I recently had...  not by far

I am no BBQ aficionado, but I absolutely loved this place. We went on a really busy Saturday afternoon when the place was absolutely packed by only had to wait about 5-10 mins for a table.  Midwood is pretty huge and they're efficient with service so I don't think you'd ever have to wait too long (unless you had a massive group).  Service was excellent - our server kindly explained everything to us. We ended up sharing the taster BBQ plate and everything was phenomenal but it was ALOT of food. We are big eaters, but it totally defeated us. Most of the meat was spot on- I think the pulled pork was just a bit dry. The burnt ends were really delicious and so was the brisket.   Price was very reasonable and the decor is so fun and eclectic. The whole place has an awesome buzz about it.  Definitely recommended.

Second time in town...and it was the first place we went to eat.  This time it was late night, we sat at the bar and the three of us enjoyed a sampler platter with Brisket, Ribs, pulled pork and pulled chicken...sides of fries and cole slaw.  Perfect for the three of us. Service was great too!

Absolutely delicious.  Friendly service and amazing food.  We had beef brisket, Mac and cheese, collard greens, BBQ baked beans, and a spicy Mary for dinner as well as banana pudding for dessert.  Everything was outstanding!

The food is great. It's consistent comfort food and that's hard to find these days.  If this review was only for food it would get 5 stars. But, there's a service component to this and it was awful.  From getting to the hostess, to being taken to an occupied table and back to wait again, to the server boxing our food up before we were finished. It was a disaster. Rude, rushed, and unprofessional.  I understand the need to turn tables, but if you're scooping full plates off of the table to move people along, you're missing the point of service.   I'll call for takeout next time.

My girlfriend and I absolutely love this place. All of the staff is extremely nice and the GM is a UK fan like us!! Unbelievable smoked meats, and great drinks. Reasonably priced plus a pretty cool bar and atmosphere. Definitely try out the baked beans and the ribs!! Make sure to ask for the habanero BBQ sauce if you like spicy sauces. Haven't had one thing we haven't loved. Highly recommend trying out a meal here.

We ordered a huge order from Midwood for a party.   It was all delicious.  The barbecue was tender, juicy, and tasty.  The side dishes were all outstanding.  The coleslaws were all outstanding.  Really is the best barbecue in Charlotte in my opinion.  I ate so much barbecue that it will be quite a while before I'll crave some.

read and seen many reviews and when a trip to see the brother in law in charlotte, it was a must try.  Bought, all in large plate option, 2x ribs, pulled pork, burnt ends and brisket.  Winner was the brisket by a landslide.  Moist tender flavorful and oh so delicious.  Burnt ends were a mixed bag of dry but flavorful and moist and flavorful.  Ribs were a little dry and tough but still good. then the pull pork, its ok, its pork strips with a vinegar dressing.  We had it as 'take out' so it wasn't all their fault.  The sides were smoked veggies (meh), sweet potato fries (crunchy and good even when cold), cream corn (good), bbq cole slaw (tasted like minces cabbage in watered down pull pork dressing), bbq beans (good and tasty), mac and cheese (good).  I would go here again but would try the famous one on Central Avenue.   i guess next time when we drive 700 miles again to see my bro in law.  by the way Charlotte, NC is beautiful.

Stopped here during an overnight stay in town on our way to atlanta. After almost a year up in New Jersey we were craving some real southern bbq. The place did the trick. Rib and chicken combo was great especially with the eastern Carolina bbq sauce(mustard based). Sides were ok. My sons brisket was off the charts though. Next time I come here that will definitely be the go item!!
Great baked beans, ribs and Texas toast. If you are a dessert person, eat it first because you won't have room at the end of your meal.

Finally had a chance to check this place out after hearing so much about it. And it always looks busy, so it must be good right? Right!  The place is very casual, but service with a smile and good BBQ!!! Better than Mac's Speed Shop, I thought. But, I'm not a BBQ snob... I just know good food :)  We tried the brisket tacos, sausage, chicken... sausage was YUM and a large is more than enough for 2 to share.  Sweet tea is VERY sweet, even with 1/2 and 1/2.  Overall, price, location and service was great.   Wear your baggy pants ;)

My 4th visit for the usually wonderful pulled pork plate. My first dining inside experience. The music choices are good but volume is too loud. I was there for lunch on Thursday and it sounded like Friday Happy Hour.  And the fan speed blows almost any paper off the tables.  My pulled pork was too mushy for me. I know they can do better.   The staff does a very good job.   I will go back based on my earlier visits.

I have traveled the Carolinas in search of the best BBQ.  After stopping here, my search was over.  The smokiest flavor and no fat or gristle.  The sausage is incredible as are the small crinkle cut fries.  GREAT JOB MIDWOOD!!!!! I eagerly await you opening in Huntersville.  Its kind of bittersweet that you are replacing the former SMOKE Restaurant.  I knew that wouldnt last!

What a great local resultant. Parking is a bit tricky, but otherwise everything else is spot on. Had the brisket and another night the rib and chicken combo. Both great. Service was on good as well. We do plan to return for sure.

I would give this place 4.5 stars, but for some reason I am only allowed to pick between 4 and 5.  The reason for the slight deduction is slight and rather meaningless.  While I like Midwood, this place is kind of on a busy street, so the scenery around it is just okay.  So if you are considering this place, you should know that my only issue is more of a non-issue.  Especially since the grounds and environment of the actual restaurant is fantastic.  There is both inside and outside seating.  As long as it's not too hot and dont mind a little sun on the face, outside is great.  Inside, literally, the first step you take in the place you are hit with the wonderful smells of delicious BBQ.  The food is wonderful, regardless of what kind of BBQ you like.  Fresh, juicy, lean, and just full of taste!  They have a great beer and drink selection (who doesnt like a 24oz PBR or a nice Jack Daniels-fueled drink??).  The decor is really great, I mean the men's room walls are full of sex symbols from the last 3 to 4 decades...and rumor has it the ladies room has the same style.  To me that is just a cool touch.  Great food, great atmosphere, and the staff are tremendously kind and attentative.  Go here, you will be happy you did.
THIS IS THE BEST BBQ IN CHARLOTTE.. I love this place and everything about it. can't go wrong with anything on the menu  Bubba

There are few times in life that a meal is so wonderfully crafted and inspired that it leaves you savoring each bite and longing to return.  This meal did neither.   As there really was not anything wonderfully crafted or inspired about the meal.   It did not leave me anticipating my next trip back.   Maybe it was a bad day, but the food was just average at best.

Only waited 10 minutes for table but food took a minute to come out. They were pretty busy. BUT I must say the food was great. I forgot the name of what we ordered. We had a platter were you can pick 4 meats, 2 side and mush puppies. We had Beef Brisket, Pulled Chicken, Pulled Pork and Ribs. All the meat was moist, fulfilling and delicious!! Try the collard green and mac n cheese. Man oh man the collard greens was so freaking GOOD! Mac n cheese were ok. My husband enjoyed the ribs, he ordered some to go lol.

I wouldn't have changed a thing here. We had the combo and couldn't finish it! The brisket was moist, the sausage was homemade, and the hushpuppies had a great flavor! Also had sweet potato fries and bacon wrapped jalapeños. If there was anything less than perfect it was the pulled pork. Atmosphere is awesome and beer was cold.

Maybe I went on a bad day, but the food was alright.  I ordered the wings and it was alright and we ordered the brisket, but it was absolutely dry.  We had to buy the lean one (which might be why it was dry), but the fatty one was out.  Until next time!

Very good BBQ joint. I had the Carolina BBQ a chopped smoked pork with east Carolina BBQ sauce. I had never had the vinegar based BBQ sauce before but it was very good. The creamed corn was the best I have had. The bacon wrapped jalapeños were excellent, a tad warm but good. Finally the pecan cobbler. My expectation was great but the actual cobbler was mediocre. It was almost like a jelly inside and I wasn't a fan of it. Overall dinner was very good, service was good. Our waiter Tobias was very knowledgeable about everything on their menu, down to the alcohol content in the beers in tap.

Sometimes hard to get in because the food is fabulous.  Wait staff are sharp and fast and won't steer you wrong.  Pork BBQ is better than most in the area and the BBQ chicken is perfect.  Get the Midwood sauce if you need sauce.

I went today 5-31-18 and I had the 1930 Cheesesteak sandwich and fries. The service was great, not a long wait for my food. The food was great but I was disappointed in the size of the Cheesesteak.  I had saw a pic of it on Facebook and that what made me go here today. Make sure you ask for the bbq sauce that's what took the sandwich over the top. I even had the banana pudding and that was delicious also. The only bad thing about this visit was the size of the sandwich and the water. I ordered water and it tasted like it came out of a rusty pipe. (The water was tap water)
Smoked chicken wings, Cuban sandwich, as good as it gets!  I could eat this everyday.

Again can't eave enough about how great this place is .... Great customer service on a busy Saturday night the owner stopped by to make sure we had everything we needed.... Food spectacular I will be spreading the word...Great BBQ has arrived in CLT.......

I had a good experience at Midwood I just wasn't all that crazy about the food. It was good just not great. The menu was enticing and I'd like to come back and try a few other items.  I liked the atmosphere and the service was good - I snagged a picnic table outside and really enjoyed my dollar beers.   The queso was ok a little heavy but comes in a large portion and could feed quite a few people.

This was my first time trying southern BBQ. And it was AMAZING. I got burnt ends, Mac and cheese & hushpuppies. Everything was delightful. I also sampled everyone else's BBQ at my table and none of it was disappointing. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for great BBQ!

Can't believe I'm just now reviewing Midwood Smokehouse. Having BBQ aplenty in Crown Town, you've got competing businesses who want that coveted, smoky place on your palate. I'm happy to say that Scibelli has done it yet again!  The locale on Central Ave is a bit tricky for parking. Pulling into the compact lot amongst other cars whizzing by on their way to Uptown can be a bit of a hassle, but it's all worth the struggle. Parking on the street is available, too. Be mindful of your space. Be sure you don't inhabit private spaces or any of the adjacent businesses lots as it my result in towing.   Venture in to the cozy dining room, patio or rooftop and treat yourself to the bacon-wrapped jalapenos. I can barely muster enough words to describe their culinary beauty. Smokey, cheesy, spicy, bacon-y glory. If you're sitting at a table amongst bacon lovers, more than one order will be required. They go fast.   If you're in the mood for a sandwich, the Superbird is wonderful. Smoked turkey, ham, bacon, avocado mayo, tomato on a texas toast. I'd get it again in a heartbeat.   The brisket is great. You can order a lean plate, if you're not wanting the fattier, yet more tasy, cut.   The sides are where it hits home. Creamed corn that is out of this world. Spot on mac n' cheese, greens like mama used to make and smoked veggies. You can even order 4 as a meal for $9!  Do yourself a favor and order hush puppies, too. Fantastic flavor and crunchy texture paired with their tangy BBQ sauce.   The service is splendid. Friendly, fast, and very knowledgeable of the menu. Great job to our server Ben!  Look forward to each visit. These guys are making a name for BBQ in Plaza! Cheers!

Sorry but nah. Everything I had was mediocre at best. If this is the best Carolina BBQ I don't care to try anymore. The brisket was ok but nothing special. Definitely get the fatty as lean is a no. The pulled pork was very dry and not that flavorful. Had to put both sauces on it. Came cause of the banana pudding comments but unfortunately that as well was just off. It seemed like just whip cream with wafers. I was really looking forward to it. But I like there to be a consistency difference between the pudding and whip cream. I seriously thought it was just whip cream. Taste was ok. Just left disappointed from start to finish. The only thing that was somewhat good was the bacon wrapped jalapeños but it could use a seed or two to give it a bite. The bartender was very polite and attentive though.

Hands-down the best barbecue in Charlotte. Nothing more needs to be said about this place except for pure perfection. Awesome food, great prices, excellent beer selection. The staff is well-trained, extremely attentive, and friendly.

Food coma abound!  I did not eat in the restaurant as it was packed when I had visited. But I got the combo platter and tried all the smoked meats minus the chicken. I got collard greens and fries as the sides. I didn't touch the fries since I had been too full.  The sausage, ribs, and briskets were delicious. I liked the carolina pulled pork, but slightly more salty for my taste.  I would love to return and try other things on the menu, but alas....this NYCer gotta eat as much BBQs as possible during his short time in Charlotte.
Good traditional BBQ. Plenty of beers on tap. Outdoor patio that's covered and heated. When I was there the smoke alarm kept going off but hey it's a smoke house after all right?!?

Stopped here based on reviews and I must say they exceeded my expectations! I'm a Midwestern BBQ guy and the brisket plate with smoked BBQ chicken is everything you could've asked for. I came on a Saturday night but used the pre check in system and that'll save you a wait. Luckily the wait wasn't too long for other people as well. If you're sceptical and looking to try something based on a review please stop buy, I know I'll frequent this spot as I'm new to the area. Good eats, friendly people, and a great environment.
Had a taste for some BBQ while visiting and was able walk in and get a table. The food was delicious. We ended up getting a platter to sample everything. W

1. Too much salt 2. The pulled pork saw more smoke than a Cheech & Chong film. It left the food just tasting like burnt wood...and salt, of course.  3. Great service. Everyone was attentive and very friendly.   Go here to make friends with the staff but not to eat.

I took my Dad here today on his first visit to see me since I moved here! He wanted really good BBQ and I think this place definitely nailed it!   I got the chicken and ribs plate with fried and Cole slaw. It was perfect! The fries were as salty as I love them to be and the ribs and chicken were fall of the bone delicious!    We also started with the jalapeños wrapped in bacon, oh my gosh I would buy those every day if I could, highly recommend them!   The staff was also super friendly, while we did wait a little bit to be seated it wasn't much of a bother.

The meat was pretty good but the portions were small for how expensive it is and the sauces were only OK. I want to like this place but I simply haven't cared for any of their meats or sauces compared to other restaurants within an hour's drive. I can see myself coming back, but if I want real BBQ I'll have to make a drive I suppose

Who has two thumbs and ate waaaaaaaaay too much barbeque?  This girl.  But that is because it was super delicious. You want ribs? They got 'em beef and pork, half and full racks. Pulled pork? Check. Half chicken? Check. Sausages? Check. Brisket? Technically not check tonight but its opening weekend, cut them some slack. And all of it comes with one (or more if you ask) of their 3 delicious sauces: the tomato-y Midwood house sauce, the vinegar based NC sauce or the mustard based SC sauce.  We split the BBQ Queso dip, which was out of this world. The smoked flavor of the meat went great with the ooey, gooey cheese. I got the small pulled pork plate which comes with NC sauce, one side, hushpuppies and pickled onions. The meat was great. I had to literally smoosh my napkin in my food to stop from picking once i was full. The collard greens I got as my side were cooked within an inch of their life, but thats not uncommon and I guess better than them being tough. They did have meat in them, but our server said they have a veggie friendly section of the menu in the works. The pickled onions were great to cut through the smoky meat flavor. As for the pups, I heartily recommend dipping them in some of the SC sauce.  They have a solid beer menu, on draft, in bottles and in cans.  All the better if you enjoy them outside at one of their picnic table or on the rooftop patio they are redoing.  Midwood Smokehouse is certainly a welcome addition to the Plaza Midwood restaurant scene (especially now that Rib Palace closed), not perfect but lip smacking none the less.

The food is good, actually very good.  And the service at this particular restaurant in this small chain was great from the hostess to the excellent waiter.  He even invited our table to join his family for chocolate cream pie on Christmas night.  The ribs were great.  The burnt ends were great. The sides were mediocre, however, luckily the portions were small and you only got one side (cole slaw, mediocre and mayonaisy, or undercooked tasteless fries).  In the south you got to do better,  two sides to say the least.  Better sides.  And rolls or Texas toast.  Overpriced compared to alternatives all over the Carolinas. I keep of wish I had taken the funny waiter up on his offer of chocolate cream pie.  Seemed more inviting than what the restaurant tried to entice me with.

Best brisket in charlotte. The bbq beans have chow chow in them. Pickled onions are the best as well as the hush puppies. Smoked salmon is great,  if you are into smoked fish.  Great sugar creek beer to drink with. Brisket is not as fatty as the pork. Love this place.

Food oustanding!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  It Could be best in Charlotte. Briscuit to die for Atmosphere = perfect. Service = waiter had a serious listening problem and multiple things were wrong.

I'm giving them a 5 star  for the one gentleman who had a very strange voice, caught me off guard from the hostess stand. Their customer service and hospitality skills were exceptional.  Food and atmosphere all were on que on cinco de mayo. First smokehouse experience and it was fantastic
Great food!! When busy parking is non-existent.
When you walk in to a Southern BBQ joint and see a review from Time Out New York, you know you're in for a treat. Be sure to get your soul food fix if you're in the Southern Charlotte area!

We checked out this place on a recent visit to Charlotte, based on Yelp reviews, and were very happy that we did.  I had the burnt ends with Mac & Cheese and greens, my daughter also had the burnt ends with Mac & Cheese and her boyfriend had the Carolina Pork (that he'd been craving, as he is from NC).  The food was excellent, the wait staff was very helpful.  If I'm back in Charlotte anytime soon, I will be back here checking out other menu options.

Great prices! I got a whole chicken dinner which was $10. The service was great and the food was good. Wish they had more of a variety of BBQ sauces but other than that, it was great! Great portions & tried a rib which was amazing!

Oh my god. A carnivore's heaven and true southern BBQ jackpot not to be missed. It's places like this that make me certain I can never become a vegetarian. And I have no regrets.   Highlights:  Smoked wings (dry with sauces on the side) - they're sized like nuggets but are so tender and packed with flavors. Possibly one of the best tasting wings I've ever had - would come back just for these apps.   Pig Out platter - the bigger version of the combo platter that gives you 6oz each of 4 different proteins plus 2 sides. We had the mixed brisket (MUST GET), sausages (good but paled in comparison), ribs (delicious), and substituted our 4th protein with the burnt tips (YUM). Our favorites were definitely the briskets, which were incredibly flavored and so juicy and tender. I recommend getting the fatty ones (more marbling and tender). The baked beans were surprisingly tasty as well. Would've loved some sort of carbs to soak up all the sauces.   It doesn't look much, but the pig out platter is pure meat and enough to share among 3-4. Needless to say, we had more than half of it boxed to go.   Service was prompt and representative of southern hospitality. All in all a shack-less but amazing BBQ joint without pretense - a must stop.  Tip: Work out before coming if you're looking to make gains. It wasn't until near the end of the meal did I realize I had not consumed a single piece of greens throughout the meal. And I'm perfectly fine with that.

Large family party went there the evening after Thanksgiving. Food ******   Briscuit as good as I have ever had.  Burnt ends excellent. Ambience ***** Menu  ****** Service *   Numerours items not delivered properly, some items wrong, bill all screwed up.  Two very nice young people, but NO profesionalism and clearly a listening problem.  Otherwise the place and the food are as good as anyplace in Charlotte.  You really need to supervise better and check with guests to insure that standards are as required. We had out of town guests who could not believe that everything be so near perfect then the standards seemed to be set by MacDonalds!

Everything we had was solid if not spectacular. I had the burnt ends, queso with brisket, fried pickles, and hush puppies. Cool building and location. Worth a visit definitely....as BBQs goodness is largely in the eye of the beholder.

I will start off by saying I really wanted to like this place.... My husband and I met up with some friends last night for a bday party at this location. First we were told it was going to be a 25 minute wait which turned into almost an hour. When we sat down we Ordered the queso and brisket dip. After about 30 mins the dip was brought out and it was cold. We waited 30 mins for cold queso? And it Tasted like can cheese.... I told the server about the cold dip and he was very nonchalant and did not offer much of an apology. The food came out one hour after we sat down and the only thing that was hot were the sides. The bbq which they specialize in was not even luke warm. I sent the plate back after informing the manager and she brought back the same plate that she went and microwaved for 30 seconds. There were 8 of us and we were very disappointed with the food... We will never come back to this restaurant... My husband's burger was pretty good but that was the only plus

Last night I had made up my mind to try one of the 3 tacos. Frank Scibelli owns both Paco's and MW so tacos at MW have to be as good right?  Oh my goodness, YES!  It was a surprise to walk in thinking it was pork burnt ends night (it's Wednesday) to learn TUESDAY is Chef featured TACO night!  Fate! The tacos were deliciousness!  I couldn't finish them. Joe our server rocked too.
Great Great food!!!! Had the 1/2 rack of ribs.. Meat just fell of the bone... I recommend this spot to everyone.

I came here once on a recommendation. Was told they had some of THE best bbq in town. I felt the mac and chz was lacking, the flavors were just not there. The bbq was bland...eh i am just not a fan. I will go to Macs any day before I go here.

If visiting Charlotte, it's a for sure place to eat. Awesome food!! Great service!!! Definitely try the jalapeño appetizer (not to spicy). The ribs with the red sauce and the baked beans were amazing!! I can't wait to go back!!!

I love BBQ and if I can get quality BBQ, at an affordable price and that too quickly, then dang, I'm sold. Midwood Smokehouse checks all those boxes and more. Super friendly staff, great portion sizes, flavorful sauces and tender pork - winner. Loved this place and hope to be going back soon next time I'm in CLT. All I can leave you with is that the BBQ Pulled Pork sandwich is my go to and you really can't go wrong getting it your first time there.

Quality meat and good BBG.  The food and service are good but I still have not found that one BBG place that just makes you want to eat some great pork BBG and a few cold beers every day; and possibly for every meal. Don't knock a cold beer in the morning until you have been there.

Ever since I moved to Charlotte I have been searching for amazing brisket and hadn't found it until I went to Smokehouse! I ordered the brisket plate and got sweet cream corn and baked beans as my sides. Being that I have been consistently disappointed with the brisket around here I didn't keep my expectations high when ordering but when I say I think I went to heaven within the first few bites, I am not exaggerating. It was AMAZING! It was so juicy and just fell apart. The flavor was on point and they do give you yummy dipping sauce, but I didn't even use it because the brisket was so good it didn't need it. I wish I could have had just a plate plied high with brisket upon brisket. The sides were just as good and did not disappoint. I am so happy I found this place as this will be my go to spot for now and always.  The service was just as good as the food and you can tell that Smokehouse must have a good rapport because it was packed early on a Wednesday night. The owners or managers, not sure which, come by often making sure your dinning experience is going well, which I always appreciate and find very professional and caring. The place itself has a good vibe with a mix of different kinds of people and ages.   I will most definitely be back often and can't wait to try everything on the menu! But most likely I will always incorporate brisket into my meal any way I can! Cheers!

We had a great meal at Midwood Smokehouse. For an appetizer we tried the pimento cheese fries with pulled pork. The pulled pork was delicious as well as the pimento cheese. I had the grilled cheese sandwich with brisket and creamed corn. Both were really good and I enjoy trying a different side like cream corn. I didn't like their vinegar sauce but their regular barbecue sauce is good. I tried my husband's pickled onions and baked beans both were good.

I moved from Texas, so I was on the search for brisket, because apparently beef bbq is a rare quantity in Charlotte.  I took the advice of some reviews and grabbed some brisket to go after calling in an order.  A little on the salty side (though that may have been me) and before I drove away I had a piece out (no sauce, let's not be insulting to the meat) and man oh man delicious.  It definitely sated my cravings for brisket that's for sure!
The food was very good and the service was great. The only negative I can think of was that my beer was a little bit warm. Great atmosphere, and I'll be back again for sure.

It's good but some reservations  on the Plus side: Awesome Greens and BBQ Beans, in fact all their sides seemed good; again maybe best beans I have ever eaten. Nice place - almost trendy inside, very unlike a normal BBQ joint Obviously fresh baked potato buns  on the Minus side: BBQ pork was average at best A bit expensive but I guess that pays for the nice accommodations the bun flavor was quite strong actually stronger than the BBQ pork flavor  Overall - good but wouldn't be my first choice.

Here we go...  Got a combo plate. Mixed brisket piece and it was sooooo good. The burnt ends were tasty and didn't feel dry as some others I've had felt. The chicken was nice and had the right amount of juiciness. The accompanying BBQ sauce had a good mix of tangy and a slight spice kick, but not burn your mouth levels. The ambience was nice and the wait wasn't bad, great service and quite accommodating.  The mac and cheese and greens were also stellar sides. This is a spot you cannot miss.  Got it? Good.
That yummy fatty brisket gets my vote every time. Customer service is good.  The greens and mac & cheese are a delicious compliment to the brisket.  Best brisket I have ever had.

I went with my brother on Christmas Eve close to the time they would close and that could have been the issue. All of the food was cold!  While I enjoyed the couple of bites that were lukewarm I will either try another location or not go close to closing time.  The smoked wings were blah at best.  For the entree we had a sampler plate with ribs, pulled chicken, brisket, burnt ends and pulled pork. My brother and I split the meal and ended up packing it up to go.  The pecan cobbler was tasty however just a pecan pie w less crust. I look forward to trying them again. The service was very pleasing. They were attentive at the bar area.

This is the BEST BBQ I've had since the BBQ I had in Lexington! The vinegar sauce is amazing! The pork platter, the brisket, everything is spot on. You can taste the smoke in the meat and its always so tender and juicy. The service is great too. Being a server, this place offers customer serviceman great food for a decent price. The decor is decent too. Old school. EAT HERE NOW! It's totally worth it!

It breaks my heart that I had to come to N C all the way from California for this bbq the burnt end were fantastic and ribs were fall off the bone sausage, brisket, mac and cheese were all the best . I'm going home soon so I'm trying to eat here everyday. Truly the best. I wish they were open for breakfast as I have a am flight soon. Goodbye midwood till I return

Burnt ends are amazing. The Fat Tire BBQ sauce tastes great and the greens and BBQ slaw are great pairings.  Big secret... Best time to go is Sunday afternoon. Very laid-back, great service, not crowded, football on the TV, beer is cold and food is hot! Love this place!

I've now been to Midwood Smokehouse three times, and the more I go, the more I like this place.  The first time I went here, it was during the middle of the week one day last summer, a little before noon.  I ordered the ribs and was not impressed.  They were full of smoky flavor, but they were tough and definitely NOT "fall off the bone".    The other two times I've had the chance to dine @ Midwood have been much more memorable and have both come within the past month.  In the two most recent times here, I ordered the half rack of the St. Louis style pork ribs ($13), the BBQ Pork Sandwich ($7.50), and the smoked wings ($8).  The ribs the second time around were much better and much more tender.  the BBQ pork sandwich, which I had Saturday, June 3rd, for lunch was nothing short of spectacular.  I asked for the slaw on the sandwich which added a nice, cool, crunchy texture.  The fries were above par as well.  On my most recent trip there, I ordered the wings as well.  The wings were awesome.  As a true wing lover and connoisseur, I have no hesitation in saying these are some of the tastiest, tender wings in Charlotte!  Every time I've been to Midwood the service has been great.  Every employee I've come in contact with while there, has been friendly, and polite.  I am not sure exactly where Midwood Smokehouse ranks in the pantheon of Charlotte BBQ establishments, but you have to put it somewhere in the top 5; behind Mac's, but waaay ahead of the likes of Old Hickory House.  Something tells me, this place is going to carve out a tradition of great BBQ and friendly service in the heart of the Plaza Midwood for years to come.  I am a growing fan of this spot and will definitely be back!

I went to get the brisket, which is beef instead of pork.  So hard to find non-pork BBQ in Charlotte.  I really enjoyed it, though all I got was the brisket.  I didn't use any BBQ sauce so I can't comment on that either, but the brisket was nice and tender, had a good flavor to it.
Oh my gosh! The food is to die for. Ribs and Brisket were fantastic. Staff was friendly and very knowledgeable. Our new favorite place to eat.

2 Words:  No Brisket :(  They literally ran out if brisket when we ordered it.  A) That means it's awesome.  B) I need to get here earlier next time.  Starters we had fried Mac n cheese with salsa and smoked sausage.  It was the happy hour special.  We also had the bacon wrapped jalapeños (amazing).  For my entree I had a half rack of ribs and more Mac n cheese.  (See photos) p.s.  Great beer selection.

Ok, I love this place! The staff is very engaging and friendly. The food is great. It's a different take on BBQ. Some things are so down-home good food that I don't know that it is country. Other things are a fusion of new and old.   The amount of beer they have is staggering! The bartender will do an excellent job of guiding you through the maze of wonderful ales and beers they have.  All in all this is a top notch restaurant.

Was in the mood for a burger last night, so I tried the 10 dollar burger that had chopped pork on it and bacon. Trouble is that the burger was way, way over cooked. Very dry sandwhich. It's the worst meal I've had there. I will go back cause everything else I've had there has been great

Moist brisket. Pulled pork. Both top notch. Homemade sauces. Hush puppies- 5 on the plate not too many not to few and Delish. Bacon wrapped jalapeños were a guilt inducing treat and the collards were as good as my dearly departed Mema's

There is simply nothing that is NOT amazing about Midwood Smokehouse. You want the best pulled pork in Charlotte? You go to Midwood. Best bacon wrapped jalapeños I've ever had. The pimento cheese fries are outstanding. Prices are excellent ($8-$12). Melissa Swain is an angel behind the bar. Today I had the Roadhouse Burger but the ultimate is the brisket grilled cheese.

My family and I dine here pretty often. Great bbq selection. Price is great and the portion sizes are good. I've have never had a bad  experience. The best server is WALTER. He is extremely knowledgeable about each item on the menu, he explains the sauces so well. He is timely and swift. He is to  attentive to every detail. He is managerial material for sure.

I love BBQ and get really excited over the idea of some delicious meats served in a unique way, especially in a place like Charlotte, that's known for their BBQ.   After reading a few Yelp reviews I ended up at this place and I was not disappointed. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with great customer service and a lovely atmosphere.   We opted for the Well-Fed combo platter between two of us and it was more than enough food. We got the ribs, brisket, pulled pork, sausage and sides of mac and collared greens. The brisket may have been the best I've ever had - literally unreal taste, melt in your mouth goodness. The ribs weren't far behind, as they were also delicious, smoky, with a dry rub and tasty without being greasy at all. The sausage and pulled pork however, were nothing to write home about. The mac and collared were top notch, but not the best I've ever had - the greens could have used more spice and the mac could have used a second cheese melted on top.   We also ordered two orders of texas toast, which came by the two slices, in huge portions for a dollar. Even though it was a ton of bread, with an already large meal, I'm not ashamed to say I ate it all - it was delicious and the kind of bread that does not make you regret the calories. We ended the meal with some sweet tea and key lime pie - which was good and served in an adorable way.   If you're looking for great BBQ in Charlotte look no further. I'd go back in a heartbeat, but this time just get the brisket and ribs.

I've been coming here since they opened and I'm not sure why I've never written a review. I was a die hard BBQ chicken sandwich fan. (With Mac 'n Cheese of course.) Then, on a whim I tried the Salmon Sammie. I've gone from a fan to an addict! At about 11:00 a.m. on Saturday I find myself craving my weekly fix! The salmon is always cooked perfectly w/ the right amount of seasoning and smoke and the tarter corn slaw puts it miles above any other salmon sandwich I've ever had.
