The combination of textures and flavors is fabulous! Plus, Melissa always greets us w/ a smile at the bar and even remembers what we drink!

One word: YUM.  Midwood Smokehouse has an atmosphere you'd expect from a smokehouse/steakhouse. It's casual, it's comfortable, it's pretty simple. There's a great bar, a large dining area, and every server we've ever had has been knowledgeable, helpful, attentive, and just the right amount of fun/playful.  Food, served on cute home-y dishes, is incredible. I alternate between the brisket and shredded BBQ. My husband will order nothing except for burnt ends because they're "the best meat candy you could ever have." The sides are just as delicious. Bacon-wrapped jalapeños (a signature Midwood dish), mac-and-cheese, fries, and hushpuppies are a few of our favorites. The banana pudding is KILLER as well. I've truly never been disappointed with anything I've ever had at Midwood. The meal can get a little pricy for BBQ, mostly because we tend to not be able to decide and order a lotta food. But, it's totally worth it! Midwood is one of our Charlotte favorites!

And this is why I am fat. For real. Pimento cheese fries topped with brisket? You have got to be kidding me.  Between the beer, fries, BBQ sampler and banana pudding (yes, dessert too) it didnt take long for me to start hating myself. The only redemption I had was that everything we ordered was shared- but still.  I really love pimento, its a little weird and I think you have to get used to it, but it was sooo good on the crinkle fries. The little char from the broil just made it better, and topping it with brisket put it way over the top to the gluttonous side. So obviously I liked it!  For our shared main we split the sampler, where we had a chance to try their smoked meats along with some sides. The smoked veggies were awesome- one of the more surprising flavors of what we ordered-and I would order double of those next time. I got the mac and cheese as our second side, but after those fries that was way too heavy and too much cheese. Out of the two, the fries win hands down.  Meat wise I preferred the pulled pork and the chicken, though everything was quite good! I've got a thing for banana pudding so if I see it I order it, and I am keeping a mental list of best ones around the country. This one comes in third place! Yum! (Magnolia's in NYC is still in first place, if you are curious).  Everything here was good, but not mindblowing. I was also a little underwhelmed by the service and the bar staff, they were not very attentive (no, it was not very busy). We also had to send two things back, one was incorrect and the other cold (the mac, which made it a bit gloppy and unappealing the first time around). Overall quite good, but not a "must go back asap", for me.

While visiting family in the area for the Holidays , my cousin wanted me to try this place after both had seen it on the TV. We stopped in on a Saturday about 10:15pm  knowing they closed at 1100pm  I had the burnt ends with added sausage and started off with Bacon wrap jalapeno's.   Thought I'd loose my mind - AMAZING and the great service only added to the " Hell yes I'll be back" experience. BUT BUT BUT!!!!!  The very next night while my cousin was working, his wife and I made a return visit....................................It was like we went to a completely different place. This time, we did take out.  To start.............. Way to many things went wrong to list---  1) Cold. 2) Order wrong.  3) Portions seemed smaller VS night before.  4) BIG TIME ATTITUDE AND ARGUMENTATIVE DEFENSIVE POSITION FROM ROBERT.when i tried to explain. He made me feel as though I was trying to scam or just lying.  Robert even commented how angry I was - So I had to explain the difference between anger VS stern clear communication.  It was the interaction with Robert and a female staff that I initially interacted with-both was so " That isn't possible." regarding my feedback.   When speaking to any owner/manager about my experience I try not to bring it up, but I trained in the culinary arts in LA and Italy; I know a little something about what I'm talking about.  Robert's attitude was less than warm and "I'll  fix it by" ..Didn't seem like an option for him. His comment to me was  "What do you want me to do?"  He was kind enough to take off the charge for a sandwich that had cheese on it WHEN IT WAS NO CHEESE request, the person eating it or suppose to eat it hates cheese.  I still have yet to see if that was done on my card.  Bottom line........... I hope the experience that Saturday night is the norm and Roberts accusative manner isn't.   I didn't come there for Robert.... But Robert is the reason I may not come back.  Take this as positive feedback, for that is the intent.   The food we got Sunday night was horrible - what should of happen was a total refund.  ( For me -- it wasn't about the money)

I am just writing about this restaurant from the perspective of someone from Western New York, where we don't have too many barbecue places, let alone good ones like this.  I tried the Cheddar chicken bacon sandwich, and it was just pure deliciousness, despite the fact that I'm a stickler for crispy, lean bacon, which this particular sandwich did not provide. The same can be said for the jalapeño bacon cheddar bites, but I just worked around it.  The pulled pork tasted very good, the idea of chopping barbecue in North Carolina is an interesting concept.  The whole place looked like something you would find in maybe D.C or downtown Atlanta or someplace. It was a pleasant experience.

Wow what a neat place! Being a BBQ junkie, the first thing you notice before you even walk in is the wonderful aroma of BBQ. We came over the lunch hour so there was a small wait to eat inside but they could've seated us outside right away.   Per other Yelp reviews, I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with the Mac'n'cheese. They were insanely good. The Mac was super cheesy!! And that's how I like it. We also ordered an appetizer of the hush puppies. They were perfect.   My mom is a big fan of pecan pie and HAD to try the pecan cobbler, with vanilla ice cream of course. She said she'd give Midwood a 10 based on the cobbler alone.   A+ to the wait staff as well. Very friendly and always checking in. It's a shame we're not from around here to visit more often!!

Finally tried this place and everything others say is true.  Awesome BBQ, exceptional friendly service, and great selection of sauces and, oh yeah, draft beer specials and bourbons.  Can't see how you can go wrong here. Kudos.  2nd visit: Brisket is so delicious that it seems like a waste to change the flavor with sauce!  Order mixed brisket, it isn't fatty at all.  Don't care for the hush puppies, however; perhaps you can substitute something better.

I'm a Lexington girl myself and thought I'd never find good barbecue in Charlotte. I was able to try the pulled pork and burnt ends. I would definitely order the brisket over the pork but they were both good and the barbecue sauce wasn't that bad either. I prefered the glaze on the brisket better both their sauces. They have a good selection and the staff was super helpful in making good choices. Although some of the sides were a miss, I can't wait to go back because overall barbecue is all about the meat.

I could not finish my meal. SALT my goodness, the salt content was absurd. Collard greens were so salty they were horrible. Ribs, salt, the only thing that I had that wasn't salty was cole slaw and water. Never again

After living in Charlotte for a while now, I have tried my share of BBQ. Midwood Smokehouse is the best I've tried. Last time I went, they had a special on South Carolina-style BBQ sandwiches. My favorite. It was delicious again. It gets crowded, so hope that you get there when it's slow. I've never had to wait, but I've seen it fill up. I'd still wait for this if you have your heart set on BBQ.

I love beef ribs and this place did not disappoint. They actually exceeded my expectations. The beef ribs were the MOST tender and flavorful beef ribs! The smoke ring was visible; everything was wonderful. The beef burnt ends, mac-n-cheese, sweet potato fries...The staff was friendly and we were seated rather quick. I'd gladly make this a stop while in Charlotte.

WORST BBQ/DINING EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE!! Ordered the bbq, was absolutely horrible. I could not even eat it. I tried my wife's food, also nasty. This place is so overrated and just plain SUCKS. Their macaroni was acceptable, but the bbq was purely unpleasant. Very soggy, oily and just a bad taste with nasty sauces. I have had way better bbq at Shane's Rib Shack, Sonny's and the Golden Corral. Midwood is thriving on the herd mentality of people for now. Those who assume that they must have good food if they are busy. There are too many options that are far better. I took my food home, reheated it and tried it with Sweet Baby Ray's. Still was plum nasty. Hopeless. I didn't even want to complain because I was done with that place.

I had my first Midwood lunch experience today. Service was a bit slow and the place was jam-packed. The food was just as good as it is at dinner, my only real complaint is that there were too few servers and there isn't a lunch menu.   I'll definitely be back, but Midwood is strictly a dinner place for me from now on.

Thanks to Charlotte Mag naming this the "Best BBQ" in town, this was my first stop once I moved down to Charlotte, and I was not disappointed.   The atmosphere is a bit more modern than some of the other BBQ spots I checked out in eastern NC, but the food was just as good.  For starters, we ordered the cheese fries topped with bits of brisket burnt ends, and those are currently the best appetizer I've tried anywhere in the country. I ate so many I wasn't sure I was going to be able to tackle my main course.  I ordered a full rack of ribs with beans & fries for a side. Since I had already sampled the Eastern NC style vinegar sauce, I went with the SC mustard based sauce, and I absolutely LOVED it! My friends weren't huge fans, but this is my Yelp review, not theirs.   The rack was MASSIVE, and not too tender, which made it great for dunking in the mustard sauce. My buddy also ordered a rack, but with the house special BBQ sauce, which was also really good. The portion sizes were exactly what I expected, and the sweet tea was extra sweet.  For dessert, I took home a pecan cobble and absolutely fell in love. I haven't been able to stop eating pecan pies & cobblers since!

This place is so good, I'm writing the review at the table. In a word: Legit. The table had burnt ends, jal poppers, Mac and cheese (zomg!), the St. Louis ribs special of the night. It was all amazing.   With food this good, the service hardly matters, but it's worth saying the staff is so friendly you won't want to leave. Our server was so nice, we wanted to buy him a present. (New baby on the way.)  We'll be back often.
Love their wings. Definitely try a bourbon flight with their pimento cheese fries. The staff is always friendly and well mannered.

Hearing how great this place was on yelp and the people who ate here, I was disappointed about this BBQ place. Me and my boyfriend are huge fans of BBQ and have tasted multiple places to get. The wait time wasn't long so that was pretty great. However, it took then a whole hour to take our food out. I was so disappointed because we had to eat so fast. In addition, the food wasn't my favorite. I honestly think the food was ok but not the best I have eaten. The waiter was sweet and ended up giving us a free dessert because of the wait that ended up being the best thing of the night. I wouldn't recommend coming here. Tried:  Pulled pork Cream corn Hush puppies Short ribs Fries Banana pudding

I got the Well Fed with double Carolina pork, ribs and brisket. All of it was super tender and delicious. Reasonably priced and awesome customer service. Shout out to our waiter Todd. Def come back here if back in NC.
The Mac and cheese is amazing! Awesome service and everything is always fresh!!!!

Yet another stop on my quest for amazing bbq since moving here and leaving my backyard and smoker behind.  I'm generally disappointed but Midwood was a pleasant surprise.  Of the dozen or so places I've tried in and around Charlotte, Midwood is probably the best but the ribs are still just ok, no char, no amazing dry rub and sauces that are moderate when it comes to flavor.  The vibe of the restaurant is laid back, has a nice neighborhood feel, the menu has all the bqq joint classics and a few surprises as well.  The staff are courteous and efficient which probably helps since Midwood obviously deals with a great deal of volume.  If I have guests who want bbq I'll likely take them here but I still dream of finding an old dude in a shack with ribs that make me weep.

This is hands down my favorite spot for BBQ in Charlotte. So glad that there is now a second location in south Charlotte to choose from. We own a smoker and dabble, but when that is too much trouble, this is where we go!

My family and I stopped in for lunch on our last day in Charlotte, all based on the reviews here on yelp. They did not disappoint.  The meat doesn't need any sauce, but the different types all tasted so delicious we used them anyway. My daughter is vegetarian, and she even enjoyed her hearty grilled cheese with broccoli in it. AND dessert was phenomenal. We had the Pecan Cobbler with ice cream. It was large enough for 4 of us to share. I literally closed my eyes and hugged myself when I took a bite!  Service is great. Food is amazing. Music is nice. Atmosphere is fun.  This place is a must!

Looked up somewhere to eat while visiting Charlotte and this place came up several times in my search. Very lively and fun atmosphere with indoor and outdoor seating. The food was AMAZING!!! We has the Pig Out Combo platter with the ribs, brisket, pulled chicken and sausage. No regrets on any of out decisions! The baked beans were also surprisingly delightful. The service was additionally fantastic! Our server, Melissa, was very helpful and definitely on top of her game, and everyone else who helped us was very sincere and friendly. I wish this place was closer to home because I would come back all the time, but I will definitely be recommending it to everyone!

Their brisket is hands down the juiciest and most flavorful I have ever had!!  Their appetizers are on point (hello cheese fries) and I always leave there satisfied!!  Good beer specials usually as well - this is a great Charlotte spot.

YESSSSSSSS SIR'EEEEE!  This place is fantastic. Our server, Doc, was great. He gave some really good recommendations and was chill but attentive.   There is a great selection of local brews that we enjoyed. He tried the smoked chicken wings with the fat tire sauce and ranch (such good sauces!) and it was sooo good. Meat was so tender, juicy and flavorful. We were about to get the queso with the pulled pork because it sounded also delicious, but the waiter recommended this because it was more of a speciality.   I got the pulled pork sandwich so I could try some genuine Carolina BBQ, and the waiter suggested the creamed corn saying it was the best he's ever had. Well of course I had to try it! It was definitely delicious. I will say it is more on the liquidy side as opposed to being creamy per say, but I don't want to say "watery" because that implies a lack of flavor, which it definitely not the case.    My husband got the cheeseburger that had the pulled pork on it, and it was also very delicious. Some SERIOUSLY GOOD EATS!!   Plus they have corn hole to play outside, neat decor, and awesome murals in the back of the restaurant building!

We've eaten at Midwood a few times now because we've been in the area.  It should do well because of its location in Birkdale but I find the menu and food lacking.  The food has been hit or miss, one time everything was too overcooked, another time it was only lukewarm.  Service has always been good but there are other bbq restaurants that I enjoy more.

A trip to North Carolina is incomplete without a visit to Midwood Smokehouse! We ordered the combo platter to share, and it was super reasonably priced!! You get to choose 4 different types of meats with 2 sides. We ordered the St Louis ribs, burnt ends, pulled pork and beef brisket. For sides, we got the mac n cheese and the bacon wrapped jalapenos. I loved everything!! The St Louis ribs were my absolutely favorite! It was so tender, juicy, and perfectly flavored with a dash of sweetness and a lot of savory-ness. The burnt ends and beef brisket are also a must-try. If you want really good pulled pork, you should definitely check out Mac's Speedshop!! The pulled pork at Midwood was good but the one at Mac's is GOOOOOD.

Super local barbecue joint. Great selection of local beers and bourbon. Food was out of this world. I had the burnt ends which were awesome. My friends had the brisket and smoked sausage and all raved about their meals. Service was relaxed but attentive. We even got a tour of the smokers. Not a white linen place but it was friendly and relaxed place to hangout, enjoy great food and a beer/bourbon or two!

We love the original Midwood location, so we were pumped when this location opened up. We finally made it in for dinner, and I was so pleasantly surprised that the new location was just as great as we were hoping for. My boyfriend always gets a dish called the "Pig Out" where you can select a variety of the barbeque and also get a few sides. I usually trust the creative genius and go with the special. Very rarely, I'll opt out of the special and go with a loaded grilled cheese sandwich. SOOOOO good.  A few tips: 1. If you're going in on a busy shift, try using the app called No Wait. It allows you to get in line without actually being at the restaurant and will wait for you. Our favorite restaurants use it, and it has saved us from the crowded and hungry waiting scenario that everyone dreads. 2. Get the mac and cheese, then dip it in the Carolina style sauce. One of the servers at the Midwood location recommended it to me once, and I've never looked back. The bacon wrapped jalapenos are also delicious. I respect Midwood for leaving the heat in the jalapeno. If you don't like spicy, opt for the creamed corn instead. 3. If you're on a diet, save up for a cheat day. The fatty brisket will make you so happy you did. If you never take a day off, however, you can get your brisket lean.  4. Get over there as fast as you can! It's so so good.

Midwood came highly suggested by our bartender at Birdsong, so we ventured here after a couple of beer flights!   I ordered the Dixie Chicken Salad, and holy moly was it a HUGE amount of food. It's crammed with greens, toppings, an avocado, pulled chicken that was a little dry, and delicious chipotle ranch dressing. The BF ordered burnt ends, which comes with complimentary pickled onions (white, not red, so they weren't my fave!) and hush puppies, as well as your choice of side! He choose bacon-wrapped jalapeños per our server's suggestion, and even though they were tasty, we were only served three small pieces and it left us wanting more. Banana pudding was decent, but I'm spoiled by my favorite in Chicago.   Overall, a total hot spot for Carolina BBQ. I'm not completely sold, but it was better than greasy food after a couple of flights.

A wide ranging menu from pulled meats, to "burnt ends" to ribs and chicken.  Overall, food was good and service was friendly and prompt; has a bit of a family feel to it from the vintage style dishes and the community atmosphere in the place.  Been here a few times and been pleased each time - the brisket is a favorite as it has the best flavor and texture; other cuts can be dry on occasion.

Every one of my friends loves Midwood Smokehouse. Full disclosure, their type of BBQ/BBQ sauce is not my favorite (vinegar based) Their mac and cheese is one of my favorites in Charlotte. I take everyone I know here, and most of then either order the brisket or the burnt ends. Personally, I think the chicken is one of the best values on the menu.

We stopped by for dinner on a Tuesday night. There wasn't a wait at all! There is also outside seating but they couldn't let us sit out there at that time. However, the outside seating looks like a place you could definitely bring your dog one day.   They have drink specials as well. They are:  Monday - $3 off signature drinks Tuesday - $3 NC drafts & $2 off cans over 12 oz Wednesday - 20 oz for the price of 16 oz Thursday - 1/2 price bottles of wine Friday - $2 off bourbon Flights  Sunday - $3 off bloody good choices   We ordered the Queso with chopped up brisket. The brisket was very tender but the cheese could use a little more flavor.                      We ordered a large plate which is more than enough food for two people! The Carolina Pork is what we ordered with a side of bacon wrapped jalapeño's and sweet potato fries. It comes with pickled onions and hush puppies which were excellent complements to the dish! This was such a great deal for only $13!   Overall the experience was delicious and had a homey vibe. *Side Note - bring a coat, it was chilly inside!

This was my second, and likely last, visit to this restaurant.  On my first visit last year, I ordered a half-chicken.  It was burnt on the outside, fairly dry on the inside, and really did not have much taste.  Tonight I tried to get my standard order when I visit a barbecue restaurant:  a sliced bbq sandwich with hush puppies.  Much to my surprise, the restaurant does not serve sliced bbq.  Really?  This is NC, the self-proclaimed bbq capital of the South.  I realize that most folks prefer their bbq chopped.  That said, this is the first bbq restaurant that I have EVER been to in NC that didn't have sliced bbq as an option.  What a disappointment! So, I ordered the chopped chicken bbq plate, which came with one side and hush-puppies.  Just like my last visit, the chicken was dry and had very little flavor.  Even the SC version of mustard-bbq sauce that came with it could not save the chicken.  The five miniature-sized hush-puppies that came with the meal were bland and basically tasteless.  The only redeeming feature of the meal was the macaroni and cheese that I ordered as my side dish.  It was quite good.  Also of note was my server who provided excellent service.  But despite the server and the macaroni and cheese, I will pass this restaurant by the next time I am in South Charlotte and get a hankering for bbq.

We a had good experience at this popular Charlotte restaurant. After finding a parking space (a challenge in this area), we were seated quickly with a reservation--key on busy nights. Our waitress and servers were attentive and efficient. They were terrific with the two small children in our group. The space is incredibly loud. You may want to sit outside if you want a quieter experience.  One member of party received a drink not to her liking and the staff made not only one but two attempts to get it right. They succeed in satisfying her requirements. The two appetizers we shared, jalapeños wrapped in bacon and barbecue chicken wings, were amazing. The combo platter of ribs, pulled pork, and beef was good, but not outstanding. Though the ribs were tasty. We thoroughly enjoyed the crispy sweet potato fries and crunchy hush puppies. I'd return when I visiting the area again.
Mother of God the burnt ends are gooder then heck! The baked beans and mac and cheese?! Make ya wanna smack yo momma!

Love those bacon wrapped jalapeños. Careful, there are some really hot ones in there! Thanks to our waiter for running out a glass of milk to me.  Burnt ends sound good in theory but I wish I would have stuck with the STL ribs. Mac & cheese was standard. There was mac. There was cheese.  Banana cream dessert was spot on.  Looking forward to going back again!

First time having BBQ since I left Texas a few months ago and everything was delicious. The bacon wrapped jalapeños were a great start. Nice heat and flavor. My boyfriend and I shared the "Pig Out" combo. Ribs were delicious with the sauce on the side for an occasional dunk. Brisket was tender and flavorful. The smoked sausage with pickled onions and the mustard they brought with it was a nice combo. I even enjoyed their Carolina Pork. The sauce had a nice balance to it that I didn't experience when I lived in the state 10 years ago. Collard greens and Mac&Cheese were both winners. Don't pass up the chocolate chip bread pudding a la mode. Even the tea was nice, not over brewed and bitter like some places. Although we specifically went for the rooftop seating on a perfect night and it wasn't open and the downstairs patio was full our table inside was pleasant and the service was attentive. We'll definitely be back!
What a fantastic feast I had. I enjoyed my meal completely and the service was so friendly. I will surely be back for my tasty meals.
The chicken BBQ sandwich is awesome.  There is a lot of flavor to the chicken and the SC Mustard sauce are a perfect combination.  As a side I had French Fries which were nice a crispy.

Really fast service. We were seated quickly and our waiter was very attentive.  I had the beef brisket dinner and my friend had the burnt ends dinner. We got our food in about 10 minutes.  The beef was tender, the smoked veggies were amazing, and the hush puppies were just the way they should be. They had a Carolina BBQ sauce and their house sauce-- both were delicious.

Decent BBQ spot off of Central that has gotten lots of buzz, it's evident from the crowd and the reviews they're very popular but I didn't find the food to be more than average.  I had the pulled chicken with hush puppies, creamed corn and Texas toast.  The chicken comes with a mustard sauce that was really good and you can't go wrong with Texas toast but other than that there was nothing memorable about Midwood for me.

I am a NY native so I am not into BBQ as much as people in the South are, however I love this place.  One of the reasons being you don't have to get something that is covered in BBQ sauce, because even the salads are good.  If you are going to go here, definitely get the burnt tips..  and the prices are great too.  I came here with two other people and I believe our bill was only $35, even though we left stuffed.  The only downside is that this place gets packed so be prepared for a wait.
We just got our doors blown off fro this place - all the proteins are smoked to perfection. I think this place should be in some barbecue hall of fame!Try the combo and Pig Out!

Stopped in here for a quick lunch and wasn't too impressed unfortunately. Ordered the brisket sandwich. I was disappointed in a few ways. The first was that it was chopped brisket. Would have definitely preferred it to have been sliced. Second was the blue cheese really overwhelmed the beef. The Mac n cheese wasn't bad, some bites were a little salty for some reason, but it didn't seem dried out and old or mushy like a lot of BBQ places do. It wasn't terrible, and service was good. I'd go back to try an actual BBQ plater when I have more time.

Food: Pulled pork, brisket, cheddar sausage, pork ribs, baked beans, smoked vegetables  Pros: Best ribs I've ever had, no contest. Incredible texture, excellent spice mix. Great sides, beans were great comfort food and the smoked vegetables tasted good. Pulled pork was good, but I wouldn't consider it exceptional.  Meh: Brisket cuts were too fatty, couldn't really taste the beef flavor. Sausage was alright, but nothing exceptional.   Cons: The sauces were not good. We were provided two sauces, presumably a spicy and a mild one. The mild sauce was alright, but too runny and the flavor was mediocre. The spicy sauce had little viscosity and wasn't really what you'd consider a sauce.  Overall: Get the ribs. The other meats you could likely pass on and not miss out too much. The sauces were pretty disappointing, but luckily the ribs are great without anything additional.

Not the way to start our experience here. Called from the parking lot right in front of the restaurant and asked if there was a wait. The gentleman said no not at all. Unload the kids and come in literally 2 minutes later and told it's a 15 minute wait. Nothing irritates me more than being told one thing but having another happen especially with kids in tow.

New to Charlotte & searching for good BBQ, natch! Been to Mac's a few times & really enjoyed it! Thought we'd check out Midwood Smokehouse just for variety, and we so wished we hadn't! Decided to go the take-out route, our first mistake. The call-in for the order went smoothly, or so we thought. Were told our order would take 20-30 minutes. Got there with a bit of time to spare. My husband continued to get updates on its progress....'it's coming,' they said, the kitchen is just a little backed up.'  In the end, an hour plus later & we're still waiting, they confess the order was never being worked on because the ticket was lost or mishandled somehow. Not certain where the drop in communication is, on the part of the kitchen or the order-taker, but there appeared to be much confusion. So after approx 1 1/2 hours, they really started to put together our order, and here we are waiting again. Finally, my husband starts walking to the car, take-out bag in hand, only to have some guy wildly running after him & calling out 'wait, we gave you the wrong bag!' All I can say is wow. How inept. We were so hoping our minds would be changed with some scrumptious BBQ! No such luck! The food was a huge letdown. Collard greens tasted like washed out grass, no flavor, just plain nasty. The chicken - well, let's just say, I make lots better. BBQ sauce, not our favorite. My husband thought the ribs were OK. I will admit the smoked veggies were pretty yummy. One small bright spot. After dropping $50, they offered to buy my husband a beer & our dogs some water. I believe we should have been comped this dinner, but that offer never came. Looks like the best revenge is simply throwing our business elsewhere. Mac's will continue to get our patronage. Just heard some good things said about Rock Store BBQ in Stallings. Both spots are supposed to have gotten the nod from The Travel Channel.

When we lived in Atlanta I was ob-SESSED with Fox Bros BBQ.  Those guys set the bar immeasurably high.  Now unfortunately at this point in my life I can no longer eat beef or pork without suffering for the following 24 hours.  That being said, I still love going to BBQ restaurants for everything else on the menu.  Midwood Smokehouse has me covered with their turkey plate, salmon sammie, grilled cheese, any of the side dishes...all so good!!  And to go with it they usually (always?) have a decent beer on special for $3/pint.  Midwood is quickly becoming my go-to BBQ in Charlotte.

As a North Carolina native and a lover for all things barbecue this place has to be my favorite in charlotte!  I am picky about my barbecue y'all but always willing to try somewhere new! This place did not disappoint!! First time I came I had the pulled pork platter with macaroni and cheese and the baked beans! It was perfect! Ya'll those beans are life, not some cheap stuff out of a can, it has pulled pork in it! Yes please. The barbecue didn't even need any sauce(though their selection of sauces were great!). Also, the plates come with a little bit of onions on the side...EAT THESE! I am not an onion girl, but these were made from a flavor God!  They have specials on certain days that might run out so be aware of that( we got the last dinosaur size rib one day and jumped for joy). Definitely a place a bring all my none NC family and friends when they come in town.

We are from Gastonia and actually love trying BBQ joint we haven't tried before.  I actually enlisted Yelp for us to pick our next one.  Midwood Smokehouse's reviews looked very interesting and promising so we went on a Monday for lunch since my husband was enjoying a long weekend.  The first thing that hits you is the smell of the meat smoking.  This is always a promising sign!  The waiter was very friendly and since I told him I was a newbie, he really tried to make our experience pleasurable.  We decided to just go for the entrée but I know I want to try the jalapenos wrapped in bacon as an appetizer next time!  We ordered the well-fed Pig.  You get to choose four meats and two sides.  We chose Chopped BBQ (you get 4 oz. so I asked if I could get double BBQ and count as two choices) and he said, yes, Beef brisket (1/2 lean and 1/2 fatty), and ribs (you get 4).  I found out with the Well fed pig you get 4 oz. of meat each and with the Pig Out (you get 6 oz. of each choice).  Our sides we chose were mac & cheese and coleslaw.    First, to comment on the meat,  I am an Eastern-style chopped bbq kind of girl.  I just loved it.  The meat is pulled, not minced, like I love!  Very smoky, it comes without sauce, has nice pink ring.  You have a choice of 4 different sauces, SC mustard style, vinegar Eastern style which I used, of course, spicy bbq tomato based, and their original.  I thought it was really good and ranks up there with some of the best bbq, I have had in a long time.  The ribs were good, and although I haven't had a lot of brisket in my day, it was very good.  I will definitely be getting some more of that next time!   For the sides, the mac & cheese, I thought was delicious.  I know everyone's experience is different and so are their taste. However, I have to disagree with one of the other comments that I have read. The writer thought it tasted like a cafeteria mac & cheese.  I really have to disagree.  I found out Midwood makes it homemade everyday and it was great!  Can't wait to have that again, for sure.  Now, for the coleslaw, it is mayo-based which is how I like mine.  It is very finely chopped and for me, it just isn't my preference but it was tasty.  I would probably order a different side next time but hey, the mac & cheese is definitely a keeper.  I will have to say, for me & my hubby, we are definitely going back and probably on the weekend, so we can experience a crowd.  They have a long bar some and some good local beer on tap. Oh, on Monday's 1/2 priced local NC drafts.  I got the Highland Gaelic Ale, yummy!  It went great with the bbq.  We would definitely recommend for people to try this place and hope you have a great experience like we did!

Maybe it was an off day, but I have seen others say good things about the burnt ends here............. I have to say, I didnt agree with them too much. Mine were kind of dry and lacked flavor. Sucks because I need to find a good burnt end place in the area (I am new here). Now, I will praise the wing appetizer that we ordered. That was the best thing my group ate. The other items were decent (mac & cheese, hush puppies, bacon wrapped jalapeno), but the crispy wings were the move for me.We also tried the ribs (pretty good) and the 1/2 chicken entree (also pretty good).   I will try another spot for my burnt ends craving, but the wings are awesome.

I had the Carolina Pork BBQ plate. The taste was bland and the BBQ sauce was just ok. The hushpuppies sucked. The bacon-wrapped jalapenos weren't bad. I don't understand all the high reviews. I've had better BBQ in Miami and that's sad.  Service was good and attentive, though.

I'm starting this review early because if you read some of my reviews I do things in advance. This time I needed a big order for my daughters first birthday party. I have a million things to do to ensure everything runs smoothly. I come here on Monday to ask about an order I need on Saturday (they require 24 hours notice). The manager said I can pay on Thursday if I want (I want to get that money out and have that order taken care of). She took down my name and that I need this by 12:30.   I'm not sure what sides I want so I place an order for several sides and the dude at the bar messed it up. My husband, baby and I are waiting.... Waiting... Waiting... I come to the bar to ask about my order. He's like "I'm sorry I thought that was for the order you want to place for this weekend. I thought that's why you wanted the manager." Huuuu... When I went to the Take Out side I told the guy I need 2 things: I want to place an order to go (he took down the sides that I wanted) and that I needed to discuss an order for Saturday. Smh.  Anyway, fast forward to the day of the party. I'm having it at the Gymboree (read my review for that) and I had 30 minutes to set up, so I'm scrambling, trying to get everything in order before the guests show up. My Godmother and Godsister show up early to help out. I ask my Godmother to pick up the food as it's already paid for. She calls me after getting to the place at around 12:45 saying that it's not ready. Ummmmm... I told them I needed my order by 12:30. Why isn't it ready???!!! Perhaps they should have taken my number down to update me that my order would be a little late. Actually, wait... they told me they didn't have my order. And I'm like "HUH???!!!" Uuuuuuhhhh... I paid $300 for that food. THEY BETTER HAVE MY ORDER!!!" She said they found (whatever they needed to find) and that they would have it out to my   Now to the food. Huuuu... Another disappointment. The mac and cheese was good when I ordered a side to go. But ordering this in bulk is clearly no bueno. Along with the chicken (which was dry as shit) and the tea. Everyone kept asking me if it was sweet tea. It was not sweet. It tasted like leftover tea from the bottom of a canister.   The only items that were good were the shredded pork (should have had 3 lbs of that), veggies and baked beans.   I made some rainbow fruit skewers and everyone tore that up! I mean literally those joints were gone in seconds. I got rave reviews about the skewers and the party in general but yea nada comments about the food. I feel like it was a waste. Should have ordered from Viva Chicken. I think I'm done with this place. The food is not good enough for me to order in bulk or even return for a sit down.

I have had barbecue from many restaurants but this by far has got to be one of the best barbecue I've had around the barbecue was nice and smoked the sides were nice and big I had the french fries and baked beans baked beans are really good had a green and red peppers and I will definitely come again

Love this place! Kick ass BBQ the way it's supposed to be!   Fried pickles awesome way to start. Thin sliced and not the chip version. Kudos! Main dinner. The all star is the brisket and ribs! Make sure to order the mixed version of brisket a little fat and some lean to balance the flavor. YUM! Ribs are fall off the bone good! I also had the pulled chicken and pulled pork both tasty and tender! Also along with the pick 4 are the sides you get to pick 2. Skip on the hush puppies as a side because you get some with this combo. I choose mac and cheese and the bacon jalapeños. Mac was thick and tasty and jalapeños....awesome. Bacon wrapped around a hot pepper! Genius! So dam good!  Also they give you three choices of sauce to join your meal. Try them all! There all good.  Killer food guys, killer. Friendly staff cool bbq joint, can't say enough good things about the place!

I was in Carolina so I had to get some Carolina BBQ.  Midwood Smokehouse had some high ratings and a bunch of reviews so I had to try them.  When I came in the parking lot was full, a good sign of they must be good. They have a nice indoor and outdoor dining areas and a rooftop dining area with an awesome view. Overall it was OK.  I went with two small plates of BBQ just to sample a variety of the menu. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/midwood-smokehouse-charlotte#H2NatZtWVPmD9ZZyAuwwRQ  The first plate I'll call it the South Carolina plate http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/midwood-smokehouse-charlotte#Sfxrntd0tSFhc9eIVqU-PA it was a plate of smoked pulled chicken, South Carolina mustard sauce, bacon wrapped jalapenos, and hush puppies.  The pulled chicken wasn't that bad for chicken pretty dry, the SC mustard sauce was tasty, and bacon wrapped jalapenos and hush puppies were MEH.  The second plate I'll call it the North Carolina plate http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/midwood-smokehouse-charlotte#GtO6lixO30zEUv7twrDXPA it was a plate of smoked pulled pork, Eastern NC vinegar sauce, BBQ slaw, and hush puppies.  The pulled pork was good but not amazing, the NC vinegar sauce OK, the BBQ slaw not my favorite.  So which BBQ wins this matchup SC or NC BBQ? Hard to say I wasn't wowed by either but NC wins just because the pulled pork tasted better.  I don't think it was a good representation of what SC and NC BBQ was. Not recommending any of those plates. Maybe try something else their ribs, wings, and fries look good. Since I can't try them I have to keep it neutral 3 rating, BARELY, for their food.     They have a nice atmosphere, friendly service, and a full bar. The outdoor patio has ceiling fans perfect for when dining outside on warm days.  They have random decorations; one that stood out was the Hawaii license plate that started with a 'K'.  If it starts a 'K' it usually means Kauai but it seems like whenever see a Hawaii license plate hanging on the wall it starts with a 'K' now. There's a cool mural on the wall of the building behind of Midwood Smokehouse.

Wow!! We asked several locals if they recommended any decent bbq places and no one had anything to say, found this place on yelp and will make sure to be back. Ordered the pig out with ribs, brisket, pulled pork and sausage. The pulled pork and sausage were amazing and everything was spot on!! The pimento cheese fries are love at first bite....seriously....LOVE this spot!!
Good portions. One of the best place for ribs in Charlotte. Good presentation. Fast and good service. Not too expensive

The best food and the best service. The staff was super friendly. A MUST if you ever visit Charlotte. Ordered the nachos, with beef. The beef brisket and the bbq chicken. Sides were fries, roasted veggies, creamed corn and coleslaw....each and every item was fresh, and packed with flavor. The sauces with the meat were flavorful. Tried sweet iced tea for the first time, am addicted to the stuff now. I wanted to try the peach cobbler but they were out of it (emphasizing on the freshness of the food). Instead I ordered the banana pudding(if I'm not wrong, it was a banana dessert though.) Loved it.  I left this place, utterly satisfied.

Yum!  I had the delicious and creative tacos with brisket and pulled pork, while my husband split a massive platter with my dad (fortunately, I got to sample theirs too). The coleslaw was great with sweet hunks of fresh corn cut from the husk.  All was fantastic!

Always packed and for good reason. You know a restaurant is awesome when they have bacon wrapped jalapeños as a side. Midwood shares the title of best BBQ in Charlotte along with Mac's Speed shop, although I can't say one is better than the other because they both do different things really well. Midwood could get a 5 star rating with their baked beans alone. The beer selection is great and food is even better. Prices are extremely fair for the portion sizes. Their meats are all outstanding. Mac n cheese could use a little makeover, but overall it's not bad. Both locations are fantastic. If heart disease and obesity were not legitimate concerns, I'd eat here everyday.

Solid as ever; solid as the others.   Excellent BBQ with delicious sides (highly recommend the beans), topped off with consistently great service...you can't lose at any of the Midwood locations. I love that the experience is consistent across all 3, but the original location in Plaza Midwood holds a special place in my heart, so I'm a little biased.   Beer and drink selection is also great at very reasonable prices. This location is of course still family friendly and very casual. Overall, close to the same atmosphere has been achieves across all 3 locations.   If you are new to the area or need a fix for some excellent Southern BBQ, don't pass up Midwood. You will find that it quickly becomes a go-to spot for you.

Didn't take them long to grab 5 stars from me.  I sat at the bar and was served perfectly.  I ordered a 1/2 rack with sauce on the side.   Both bartenders brought samplers of different sauces which varied in heat and complexity.  Gotta say that habenero sauce was the kicker . . . so good.  The ribs were spot on:  tender, just a slight tug to separate from the bone,  flavorful, and juicy.  Ditto on the collards.  Me like a lot!  Welcome to the neighborhood!
NC BBQ is one of my favorite foods and this place has the best BBQ in Charlotte by far. The smoked wings with dry rub are amazing and the bloody mary is a 10/10.
Really tasty bbq, friendly bartenders, and good drinks. Their house brand sauce is great!

One of us had a taste for some BBQ, so on my monthly lunch trip with my lunch buddies, it was decided this was the place.   I'd really like to give this place 5 stars but something was lacking. Don't get me wrong; food, service, ambiance, and drinks were on point. Maybe it was the portion size or the ratio of meat to bread, or the skinny crinkled cut fries.  I had the Grilled Cheese with brisket with crinkled cut fries and Kentucky Slush Puppy.  Kentucky Slush Puppy was on point. Not too sweet, refreshing, and not a lot of alcohol. (Amaretto Sour is my favorite drink if that tells you anything)  The Grilled Cheese w/ Brisket was good. I guess my one problem is there was more bread than anything. Also I was expecting meat, cheese, and onions to be pouring out of my sandwich. I like a mess when it comes to BBQ... and leftovers. I mean this is the south... Bring on the large sandwich and overwhelmingly large portion of fries. Let me decide when enough is enough.   All in all... It was good. Perhaps, I made the mistake of comparing this place to BBQ's. ill give it another try.

This is the best restaurant I've been to in charlotte. I kept seeing really high reviews and knew it had to be a stop for my weekend visit. I'm a HUGE Mac and Cheese fan (who isn't?) and it's the best I've had in my life. The grilled cheese with brisket is top notch! Great waiter and staff. The owner came by and talked to us & was a great guy. When I move her in July it will be a go-to. Thank you, Midwood Smokehouse!!

When I see a new restaurant open, I usually like to wait a few months to let them work out the kinks before I give it a try.  But pork bbq makes me all weak in the knees, so after driving by a few times I decided I had to give in to see if it was worth drooling all over my steering wheel all week long.  Holy crap.  It SO was.  I went on a Friday with a few friends.  I had the pulled pork sandwich with baked beans, and we got an order of hush puppies for the table.  I opted for the vinegar sauce.  The pork was tender and smoky, the vinegar sauce was just a little spicy, and the baked beans had bacon (!)  in them.   The hush puppies were just the right kind of fried - crispy but not greasy, and were perfectly balanced between sweet and savory.   For dessert I had banana pudding that made me lick the bowl and my hubby had some kind of cookie/peanut-butter cup concoction that was also fabulous.  Oh, and the service was warm and friendly and we never had to wait on drink refills.  We had such a good time that we went back.  The next night.  This is a little embarrassing for me, admitting that I gorged myself on bbq two nights in a row and didn't regret it for a second (until Sunday morning).  But I think it speaks to the deliciousness of the food.  Also, the next night someone ordered the brown-sugared bacon as their side, and I feel I should warn you not to eat it, ever, because if you do you won't want to stop.  If they diced that stuff up and mixed it into some vanilla ice cream I would leave my husband for it.  I'm not even kidding.  I would leave my husband and declare brown-sugared bacon ice cream my one true love.  (Do you hear me, Smokehouse?)  Midwood needed a place like this, and I'm so happy to welcome it to the neighborhood.  Anybody have any plans for dinner?  I have this sudden craving for bbq.

I decided to give this place a try since I love BBQ. Decor was nice, service was nice but the food was below average, I had the chopped BBQ plate which was dry and not much flavor. I am not in any hurry to rush back there.
The fiod was awesome. My first time going friendly staff good vibe. My and hubby went for date night. He had the chicken and ribs and I had burnt ends. We will definitely be back.

Can you say heaven wrapped in bacon? How about slap yourself warm pecan cobbler topped with ice cream? The pulled pork was no slouch either. The portions are large, so be willing to share. Despite being busy, the service was fast and efficient.   Even getting there right when they open, there are several of us waiting!

Stopped here based on yelp recommendations - it did not disappoint. We had the four meat sampler. Everything we tasted was excellent. The brisket and chicken stood out. The chopped pork was solid. The pork ribs were good, but I would not hesitate to choose something else next time.   Arguably the part of the meal was the pecan cobbler. Amazing.   Solid bbq joint, would not hesitate to drop by again when in town. Highly recommended.

Normally I only have positive things to say about Midwood. I usually order a brisket plate but this time ordered a brisket sandwich. What I got, instead of sliced brisket, was chopped brisket drowned in sauce. Smoke flavor is buried by the overdone sauce. Service was good but I would never order a sandwich there again.

On one visit (lunchtime) the ribs were like shoe leather - almost like jerky. I believe they were day old.  On the last visit (6 p.m. on a Thursday), we were informed that they ran out of ribs! Drinks are a joke - the oversized ice cube and 1 mouthful cocktail is getting old.

Everyone is saying it- and I agree- great BBQ! Whether it's sandwiches (their Cuban is bomb!) or a plate of meat; the selection, sauces and sides are delicious. You really can't make a bad choice. They are almost always busy but that doesn't seem to impact service or speed, so that's a big positive. We always bring guests here from out of town and while the ambiance of the one in Plaza Midwood is better, the burbs still love having their new location so close.   So why four stars instead of five? Seems silly, but they literally REFUSED to let me order from the kids menu. I'm not a big eater and was leaving town where leftovers would have been wasted, and the waitress told me no, it's against their policy. She "asked" the manager who also said no, something about the portions being the same size. I was with my husband and father in law, and if you serve children the size of portions they got, those are kids who probably don't order from the kids menu anyway.
Hands Down BEST BARBECUE in NORTH CAROLINA !! Definitely the best I've ever had . Amanda and her crew were awesome ! GREAT SERVICE !! Thank you from Naples, Florida :)
Awesome burnt ends,  collards and baked beans.  Sweet tea was great and that dessert......wow.

One of the better BBQ places in CLT.  One of the few that actually have turkey and sausages, and don't rely on pulled pork with gallons of sauce.    Service has always been average, but the food is consistent.
Had high expectations and it sort of met it. It is a hipster place and food quality suffers because of that. Service was quick and friendly. I'd go back again if it wasn't so crowded.
Food was amazing. Service was great and had a good amount of local draft beers on tap.

All I have to say is wow! I had family in town this weekend and my mom wanted real southern BBQ.  Found Midwood Smokehouse on yelp and so glad we went!  The good was delish!   I got the beef, my son had ribs, and my parents had a combo platter.  Everything we had was exceptional.  Our server Brian was fantastic!   He gave us recommendations on the food an

Much of Charlotte is divided into 2 BBQ camps - you're either a Mac's fan or a Midwood fan. While Mac's is definitely delicious, I am undoubtedly in the Midwood camp. Their BBQ gives Charlotte a reason to be famous for BBQ! Start with the pimento cheese fries topped with beef brisket and thank me later. I am a huge fan of the Midwood Chopped salad topped with chopped pork. It is an incredibly satisfying, flavorful, enormous salad full of veggies, avocado, and deliciously flavorful BBQ. Their BBQ chicken is delicious, but you can't go wrong with the pork or brisket. Both are flavored and cooked perfectly every time. Their smoked veggies side is absolutely delicious and a great pairing with any of their BBQ dishes (especially if you're looking to add at least a bit more nutritional value to your meal). And, if you're up for dessert, their banana pudding is among the best I've ever tasted. The small size is plenty big, and the large size is truly LARGE. Definitely enough to share - or not, if you don't feel like sharing! They also have plenty of beer, wine, and cocktails available.
The Burnt Tips had me sold.  Everything was really good and seems like a fun little joint but the burnt tips were to die for.
great time and wonderful food make this place a great regular spot. be prepared though, it can be quite busy

Giving this place two stars instead of one because I will give them the benefit of the doubt that I just got a bad dish. I got a plate of burnt ends with hush puppies and creamed corn. The burnt ends were burnt all right. They looked like lumps of coal on my plate and were nearly as inedible. They were rock hard and extremely dry and chewy. The hush puppies and creamed corn were nothing to get excited about either. I was looking forward to trying out this new Ballantyne location and they let me down :(

I am shocked this place has 4.5 stars, and forgive me if I just ate the wrong thing, but I am being generous with 3 starts.  I went to this spot expecting excellent southern barbecue, but was thoroughly disappointed. The reviews put the thought in my mind, but at the end of the day, it was just barbecue, nothing worth writing home about. It might be that my standards for barbecue are now sky high, but at least give me meat that isn't dry.   I try brisket anywhere south of the Mason Dixon line now, and hope for the best, and that might be a mistake in specific cities, like Nashville, where ribs or another type of meat is prevalent and the 'best'. I wonder if that were the case for Midwood Smokehouse and Charlotte.   Well, the sides, the meat was all average. I was not impressed, and found the flavors to be lacking. The hushpuppies were fine, the mac and cheese was fine, etc.   Anyway, maybe another place on my next Charlotte trip to satiate me barbecue hunger!
Ok. Not great. Ribs were not so meaty. Meal was warm not hot.  Great service. Wonderful service. Attentive manager.
Very good burnt ends. It's a little trendy yes and it is a bit pricey but the food is worth it. Try going on a weekday as the weekends can be a bit chaotic.

BBQ joints come in all sorts of technicolor glory, from the creaky houses of yore, where you leave smelling like you're wearing SIde of Beef cologne with a sprinkle of sauce for good measure, to the newer, more refined varieties, each with their own specialty, from which they dare not stray.   These are not issues for Midwood Smokehouse, which does a variety of items on it's menu very, very well (thankyouverymuch), and they're delighted if you'd like another, come to mention it. And more of the good stuff is the attitude you'd best enter with in this wonderland of juicy cuts. At this sitting, I swooped in after the South Carolina mustard sauce with some brown sugar bacon (natch) on the back end. And if you're after some stand-up brisket, these guys do that pretty well too.   They brought some slabs out that would stand up to the stoutest Texan brought up on beef BBQ. In all, they do a brisk biz here and I though I was a shade concerned by the corner strip center space, I needn't be. These guys had all the bases covered (except, oddly, for root beer, which may not mean much to locals but is sometimes a staple of BBQ joints I've hit. The waitress responded to its suggestion like it was a pleasant surprise).   In the end, there was so much good stuff going down here that I couldn't tackle all of it. But these are the fun challenges you best savor again and again, like I'm sure I will.
My companion says it's the best BBQ she has had.  The sauces comes warm.  That little touch makes a bid difference.  Amazing bread pudding.  No pic as we devour it.
Great bbq, brisket, and chicken wings, but the sides were underwhelming.

This place is amazing! I've lived in NC my whole life and while this isn't your mom and pop BBQ joints I am so fond of from my childhood, Midwood is a perfect blend of authenticity and creativity. The "secret" is that the folks here really care. They sincerely want you to have a great time, serve you some amazing food, and have you leave with a smile.   On my most recent trip, my girlfriend took me to Midwood for my birthday. Although there was a line, they quickly seated us and we were greeted by our waiter Jimmy who was attentive and friendly. I always get the BBQ sampler with double dry ribs, smoked sausage, and fatty brisket. I had been hesitant to try the bacon wrapped jalapenos because I saw some complaints on Yelp. But on Jimmy's recommendation, we got an order and they were to die for! Really, really delicious.   Their meats are perfectly smoked, full of flavor, consistently moist, and always memorable. If you're looking for a great, fun, foodie place - look no further than Midwood Smokehouse!  P.S. Their hushpuppies are the best I've ever had!

This place is the real deal as far as BBQ. I usually get the brisket because it is so good. It is tender and moist with an excellent smoke ring and amazing flavor. The pork is also very good and the sides are excellent. Good mac n cheese and I love the jalapeno poppers. To add to this I have only had it as take out because it is close to my wife's work. I am going to try to eat at the restaurant soon and update my review. I can only imagine it is better at the actual restaurant.

Awesome food and awesome service! Got the combo plate with ribs, chicken, brisket, and sausage with Mac and cheese and baked beans, along with the complimentary hush puppies. Everything was amazing and great prices.
Best  brisket east of Texas.   Have it wet with the habanero sauce and a side suasage sausage.  The burnt ends are hit or miss and the Cole slaw too finely chopped.
My waitress was so sweet and her laugh was adorable.  I felt like she really wanted to make our experience worth while.  Heart eyes for days for Cristie.

Looking for a new place to eat last Thursday, my team at work and I stumbled upon this new place on Central Avenue. First piece of advice: get there before Noon if you want to find a seat. This place is small and fills up quickly! Parking was a little tricky as well!  Second piece of advice: If there's a wait for a table, grab a bar stool and let Karen take care of you! If she makes cocktails half as good as she makes recommendations and serves food, then she's the best bartender in town! She was funny, accommodating and quick to help us make our choices from the very expansive menu of yummy southern barbeque menu items.  Enough about the atmosphere...let's talk food! We started with the queso. I think it's the first queso I've ever ordered with barbeque. You had your choice of beef or pork. We went with the beef. A great way to start the meal!   One of my friends got the Chicken Salad sandwich with sweet potato fries. The sandwich was so large, she took half home for a great dinner. My other friend got the beef brisket. She fancies herself a brisket expert and she gave this two greasy thumbs up! Her side of choice was the mac-n-cheese which she said tasted like a cheese dream!  Everything looked so good, I had to just close my eyes and point. I got the pork sandwich with a side of creamed corn. The corn was gone quickly because it was sweet and tasty with a bite of peppery that would slip up on you at the end of each bite. As I didn't want to make a total fool of myself by drinking the creamy goodness, my friend offered me one of her hushpuppies which I baptized in the creamed corn cup in the name of the Beef, and the Pork and the Chicken!   We got dessert to go and snuck into my office at 3 p.m. to delight in the Pecan Cobbler and Banana Pudding. The cobbler was yummy, a little like Derby Pie if you're familiar with that. I'm not that big of a fan of Banana Pudding, but this was probably the best I've ever eaten. A large dose of vanilla made this less on the banana side and more just yummy pudding, but I didn't complain and the three of us had enough dessert to taste test on two different occasions.   The only complaint I have about Midwood Smokehouse? That it's way too small and too far away from my house in South Charlotte! I hope they expand soon and in my direction!

Really good place second time I eat BBQ in Charlotte and. By far the best I had in long time everything was really tasty and full of flavor ribs chicken. Pulled pork. And the sides. Super good. We really enjoy it. Here nice hostess and. Our waiter it was amazing explaining about he sauces. Really good. Food. And atmosphere  really good guys. You are the best BBQ place in town

Just simply outstanding . Portions were huge and every smoked meat was better than the last on their sampler dinner ( forgot the name). I had a pretty far drive from downtown charlotte to find this place but was not disappointed. Beer was excellent as well.

Went again today. Had the Roadhouse Burger with smoked veggies (mushrooms, zucchini, yellow squash, onions and peppers). Really good! I ate the whole thing and I'm petite. Of course, we had to get the smoked wings as well, which were delicious. For dessert, we had the peach pie. It was good but not what I expected of a peach pie. It was more of a deconstructed cobbler. Was good, will keep returning!

I would never come to this location again. Don't get me wrong, the food was great; however, the hostess was completely inappropriate to my husband and I. We walked in for lunch one day with our baby and the hostess started to ask us all these questions about our child, which we were totally fine with. Then she proceeded to tell us 1. Our baby was way too young to be out in public, how dare we be out grabbing lunch 2. That we don't have him "bundled up enough" (it was 60 degrees) and 3. She even made an extremely rude comment about my husbands weight to him! We are new parents and we felt totally "parent shamed" by this complete stranger. This was in the span of 5 minutes where she sat us down and then wouldn't leave our table. She completely over stepped her boundaries. Her job was to simply take us to our table! The waiter was pretty great though probably trying to cover up her idiotic behavior. Horrible experience. We will never come back because of her extremely inappropriate behavior. Management- do yourself a favor and reprimand your hostess.

Let me start by saying that we normally love this place. The food is awesome and the service is generally good as well. We live in Chantilly and eat here often and have never had a bad experience until this week. That's why I'm not giving one star, which is what I feel like doing.   On Wednesday, my husband took our kids to eat. I was going to come from work to meet them. My husband texted me right after they got there that I might want to rethink meeting them because the server seemed very impaired ("like she's doing drugs in the bathroom" were his exact words) and didn't seem like she even heard his order. What followed next was just crazy. She came twice more to ask what they ordered, when she brought the drinks she had to open the kids' drinks at the table and look inside (I have TWO kids, two drinks only) to see which was the water and which was the milk, and when the food finally came out almost an hour later, 3 out of 4 orders were completely wrong. Another server came over and asked if everything was ok. My husband explained to him that everyone's food was wrong- like really wrong and that he had already put in his order 3 times. The other server got a manager who took the order again. The right food did finally come out. When the original server brought the check, we put our card in and she ran it and brought it back. My husband signed it, and then she came over AGAIN and said, "I'll run this for you and be right back." My husband then said, "you just ran it a minute ago, thanks" and left.   Nothing comped off the check.

Went here on a busy Saturday night on the recommendation of a friend. The beef brisket (lean) was the best I've eaten anywhere - and I've eaten plenty in my day.   The ribs were a bit dry. The highly touted creamed corn didn't do it for me. I didn't like creamed corn before and I don't like it now, so no deduction for that.   Another friend of mine had the smoked sausage and raved about it. The big surprise for me was the appetizer of smoked chicken wings! Meaty and delightful - not fried or swimming in sauce.  Extra credit points for the men's room decor!

(3.7/5) The brisket is a must. I don't care if you get it in a salad, between a grilled cheese, as a side, or on a plate like how I did. It's tender, delicious, and slow-cooked to perfection. I ordered the beef brisket plate (both lean and fatty) with hush puppies, pickled onions, and bacon-wrapped jalapenos as a side. Unfortunately, most of the accompaniments besides the pickled onions were mediocre, not amazing. Do not get the mac and cheese--my friend got it and I tasted it. It was grainy like dry finely grated cheese and not very saucy.   Service was great. He regularly checked up on us and had great energy. We didn't have a wait long for a large group dinner at 7pm on a weekday. Compared to Mac's Speed Shop, I definitely prefer Mac's for an overall dining experience (sides were better, servings were larger, wait was much longer too) but like I said, the brisket here definitely deserves a try.

How have I not reviewed this place?!?!?!  Well here its; Brfisket Burnt ends with jalapenos wrapped in bacon as your side.  This is a game changer.  As originally frequenting Mac's and Queen City Q I thought i would give this place a shot.  My god thank god I did,  This bbq is my favorite in all of Charlotte.  The burnt ends are seriously out of control.  The ribs are great and so is the pulled pork queso.  Their draft selection is pretty decent offering a bunch of local and national options.  If you want to show your out of town friends BBQ bring them here

I'm not really sure what the fuss is about this place... maybe I came on a bad day?  However I had heard this place was beyond amazing and when I left I really had no desire to ever go back. Well maybe I'll give it another try if only for the banana pudding which was REALLY good (almost like grandma made it but only almost lol).  The jalapeno poppers were not good. They had a weird texture, were soggy, and the bacon was not even close to being crispy. I was very disappointed!  The pulled pork was okay but I've had oh so much better in my life (anyone who has had Lexington BBQ can attest to that).  The macaroni and cheese reminded me of something you'd get in a cafeteria. Again I just wasn't impressed!!  Our waitress was nice but clueless. She just never seemed to have her act together, couldn't remember our orders (yes she wrote them down??) and asked us if we wanted to order desert before our dinner was even brought out. I'm sensing that some other reviewers may have had this same waitress lol.  All in all I have numerous friends who keep raving about this place so I'm going to try it one more time to see if maybe I just got them on a seriously off day. If it's still not good then I may need to question my friends taste levels haha  Oh one more thing, the beer selection was good in my opinion!!
Excellent service and food at a great price. We ordered the BBQ chicken and ribs, BBQ slaw, sweet potato fries , ice tea and some beers. Will def be back.
Service was spot on.  Came w/another couple & everything was scrumptious!  Fried pickles, hush puppies, mac & cheese, bbq platters w ribs - yummy :)
It was delicious we tried the combo platter and got it up sized and it was enough to feed two people plus left over for carryout.

Wow this place is phenomenal. Came here on a Saturday afternoon and was immediately seated. Chose to sit outside bc the weather was beautiful out. We ordered the smoked chicken wings for an appetizer which were awesome. So tender and full of flavor. I got the Carolina pulled pork with Mac and cheese, bf got the combo platter with ribs, brisket and bbq. Everything was amazing and fresh. Bbq was some of the best I've ever had and the sauce they give you (on the side) was awesome too. I put it all over my food. Mac and cheese was great too! Service was great, our waitress was very attentive and friendly. I can see why people rate this place so high, it deserves all of the great reviews and lived up to its hype. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in Charlotte.

Though touted as a barbecue joint, Midwood Smokehouse in Plaza Midwood has a Chopped Salad that is the dream of this vegetarian; Avocado, tomatoes, corn, lettuce... oh my! I love the fact that I have an option of a yummy salad when my man is in the mood for some pulled pork and bacon wrapped jalapenos.   When a solid salad is on my mind, Midwood is the place I am calling (their pick up window is convenient and parking is never really an issue).   Bravo!
Best BBQ in Charlotte! Best pulled pork I've ever tasted...try the banana pudding, awesome atmosphere, quick service and good people!
Great customer service! Waitress described the menu so well and told her honest opinion about the food. Would definitely recommend
The bbq itself is ok.  The 5 stars are for the Banana Pudding.  Pure heaven - I'd go out of my way to stop just to have the Banana Pudding.  The right mix of bananas, vanilla wafers & sweet!

This was my first BBQ experience, so I'm not an expert but... it was sooo gooooddddddd. Maybe it's not as authentic as like, a shack in the woods or something but since I have no experience to compare it to, I just have to say, it was great.  Hot, tasty, reasonably priced, and a fun atmosphere.  This is for the south Charlotte location. First, it was already super busy on a Saturday night and they let us book a reservation about 40 minutes before we got there. The table was waiting for us when we arrived. Our server was friendly, attentive, and happily answered 20 questions from a bbq newbie (me).  He brought us a bunch of extra sauces and always kept our drinks filled.  The (beef) burnt ends were amazing, and it seems like each entree is enough for two people.  Mac & cheese, the bomb.  The food came out fast, but not so fast that we couldn't finish our appetizer first. 100% will go again.
Great food definite must come back next time in town. Tried the pulled pork with Mac and cheese and smoked sausage.  The BBQ queso with beef brisket was great as well
This is a very good restaurant, not much to say except they brought out our food very quickly, not to expensive and they did not have any areas of problem for me.

It's hard to give this Charlotte BBQ stalwart less than 5 stars based on their Burnt Ends alone. Perfectly moist with just the right amount of fat these tips are the Mecca if Burnt Ends! They recently changed the finishing sauce to a cola type which brings the sweet flavor to the smokey taste. I have to rate these BE as one of my all time favs! Also had the ribs which were smoked just right and had the competition quality pull from the bone along with the great taste. Do not miss these two meats when you go. We ordered 2 sides - Baked MAC n Cheese which literally melted in my mouth, along with collard greens. Both southern side staples.  If you like BBQ and are in Charlotte Midwood Smokehouse is a must stop!  FYI - parking is tight in all of Plaza Midwood so plan ahead.

Stopped for lunch on a weekday. Busy, but there was still ample seating available. Asked the server for her recommendations and was suggested to try the burnt ends or the beef brisket. Husband and I tried 1 of each. We got the large serving and it left us stuffed. Sides of collard greens, Mac and cheese, hush puppies were all delicious with flavors that held their own along side the smoked meats. Last note on the service. Not only was our server on top of keeping our drinks filled but every server and manager who passed us were scanning the tables to take away plates or fill up drinks. Team work has the place running smoothly during an otherwise busy lunch hour.

It was my first time in Charlotte and I was starving - it was 3 PM and I hadn't ate anything the entire day due to an early flight at 6 AM. I was looking for food that represented the South - BBQ or Southern. I was choosing between a Southern restaurant and Midwood BBQ and I chose Midwood. And I am so glad I made that decision - you step inside and the delicious aroma of BBQ makes your mouth water. We were immediately seated and served and we started off the meal with some hushpuppies, and oh my- I don't know what hushpuppies are but they are delectable!!! For my entree I ordered the Chicken BBQ sandwich with a side of Mac and cheese. Let's just say my plate was licked clean - the meat was extremely tender and the BBQ sauce was perfect and the mac and cheese was creamy and not too heavy. We finished off the perfect meal with a perfect dessert - the pecan cobbler! It wasn't quite a religious experience, but it made me like pecans even though I usually don't! Let's just say we licked that plate clean too!   Overall the service was fast and the servers were very friendly and the food was unbelievable! I would recommend everybody and anybody to go here.
Went for lunch and food was excellent. Service was a B+. Parking was a little tough but not a problem walking off all that food. We will return for dinner.

Midwood has great food. The BBQ is the best in Charlotte, fried pickles are amazing and the sides are outstanding. They have some great salads also if you're trying to be healthy. The service is always warm and friendly. Overall it's a great place.
Best BBQ place in Charlotte! I like the brisket! Also the bacan wrapped with jelepeno side is the must to try.

Came here for lunch and it was great! Customer service was on point and timely and everyone enjoyed their food. I had the smoked salmon (medium) and it was DELICIOUS and cooked perfectly. My friend had a salad so big it looked like he barely put a dent in it ha! Ask for the other bbq sauces they have. Will like to go back and try some other items.
Great BBQ place. Everything we tried was delicious. The burnt tip, ribs, brisket, fried pickles quest dip was excellent. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a good BBQ place.

5 Stars for their Brisket and in comparison to all other BBQ joints in Charlotte (keeping it in perspective)  Having traveled and lived in so many places across our great country, I've had the forture (or misfortune, depending on the experience) of trying a lot of different types of BBQ....from Texas, to St. Louis, to Georgia, Mississippi, Memphis, Kansas City, and now the Carolinas. All are delicious yet all have differences as well.   I would say Midwood Smokehouse if BY FAR the BEST BBQ for quality in Charlotte. In my (humble) opinion, this to me isn't true Carolina BBQ.....when you try the Brisket, it reeks of TEXAS-style BBQ. BUT my friends, THAT is why is so darned good! That Brisket is some of the best I've had outside of Texas, and trust me, when it comes to Beef BBQ, Texas is KING! I'm pretty sure the owners will tell you that they tried to emulate a Texas style for flavor and texture. I've been here 4 times, and each time I always get at least one sampling of the Brisket, and each time it has been outrageously great! Perfect smoke, flavor, and melt-in-your-mouth goodness. I just cannot find that anywhere else here in Charlotte.  IF you know of any place here in Charlotte that serves better BBQ Brisket, PLEASE let me know! The closest I've found is Saucemans on West Blvd. They're pretty darned good too, but not as good as Midwood Smokehouse.  I've also tried their sausage, pork and chicken, and I thought all of them were pretty good. Not the best I've ever had, but pretty good. Certainly no where as good as the Brisket.  I do love their jalapeno poppers too! Wrapped in BACON. Come on, how could you NOT like that?  I haven't been here in a few months but wanted to provide my perspective on this restaurant given that I've seen some really negative postings here recently. I mean it's cool that we all have our own tastes and experiences. God knows I've ripped a few here lately myself. But overall, in comparision to what we have here in Charlotte, I still believe this place to be THE BEST in town.  I wish we could do a Bobby Flay BBQ Throw Down here!

Was here after Belly Dancing class Tuesday night. Who knew that belly dancing was such a work out? Famished and headed over Midwood Smokehouse. The place was pretty empty when were got there and it was late in the evening. Nice ambiance and atmosphere I would say. Feels like a bar with bar food. We were sitting by a bar.   Food review Sweet Fries- Yummy. Not greasy Brisket Sandwich- There was a small piece of bone, be careful chewing the meat. It was okay. Interesting mix with blue cheese. Have not acquired this combo taste yet- BBQ sauce with Blue Cheese. Mac and Cheese- Too salty for me Banana Pudding- Really good and tasty  Floor towards the bathroom was slippery. Bathroom was clean and pictures hung up like actors in black and white photos was it from the 70's, 80's or 90's?

I had the brisket with collard greens. The brisket was so good and tender and juicy. The greens were delicious. I felt the portion of brisket given was small. They offer a small plate and large plate, but that's based on increasing the number of sides from one or two versus the increasing the portion of the meat. They offer a combo plate but you have to choose at least four proteins, and I can't eat that much.
Have been there several times now and food is consistently good. Especially like the brisket - it is hard to find really good moist brisket.
This is a Plaza Midwood institution now. I've been 100 times and never been disappointed. Brisket and smoked jalapeños are must orders. Also Rachel Welch is in the bathroom. Can't be topped in CLT.
The service & the food was Amazing!!! It was Tater Tuesday & Tito's Tuesday food & drink specials!!! We loved everything especially the staff!!!

Im not certain which bbq joint people are reviewing here. I took my hubby her for fathers day dinner and we were sorely disappointed in the food. We ordered the chicken taco for my lil boy and didnt realize it was going to be smoked chicken which my the way is basically boiled chicken (not bbq smoked) the consistency was an issue. it was like one big piece of chicken and the worse part was it looked undercooked. So my lil boy wanted nothing to do with it. The ribs were overcooked and dry and salty.  We will def not be going back.
