One of the best bbq places in Charlotte and will satisfy your meat cravings for a week. I could eat my weight in bacon wrapped jalapenos. There is usually a wait so come prepared. (added) or Use the NoWait app. It really helps know your place in line and set expectations if you get there early, super useful for this restaurant.

Am pretty pleased with this place.  They have beef brisket...hard to find in the land of pork.  The pork is also very good.  It is always crowded so avoid prime times for coming here.  And it is loud and busy.  If you have a senior with a walker or wheelchair they can accommodate, but it really gets in their way and to their credit the staff work around it.  I like their appetizers which include jalapenos stuffed with cheese and fried.  We had an order and they just were not cooked well.  Told the wait person and very quickly the manager came to deliver a fresh, perfectly made order to our table.  THAT is excellent customer service and satisfaction.  You can order mixed portions of meats and can also select fatty or lean brisket.  Or a mix of the two.    They really do aim to please.    97 year old Dad likes their mac & cheese and we found the staff more than willing to customize portions and selections for him rather than just stick to what the menu dictates.  Parking is also crowded, but somehow the lot outside does accommodate.  This is a good BBQ joint.

Over the last three years, I've been to Charlotte four times. Everyone raves about the BBQ, but until my most recent trip I'd never had the pleasure of trying it. Luckily for me, a local took me to Midwood Smokehouse last month.  We walked in the door and the smells from the kitchen told me we were in the right place. The smokey sweetness of BBQ made it hard to look at the menu because I really just wanted to eat.  I ended up getting a pulled pork sandwich and some sides. Good, tasty stuff. Friendly service. Prices were amazing compared to what I would've paid for back home. And, the atmosphere was low-key and nice.  Go back? Sure, next time I'm in Charlotte I wouldn't mind at all. I'll suggest it.
3 star is pushing it. Cole slaw is not good at all. To much onion. Just ok on the other food we tried. Was fast service for being full.

This place is a great neighborhood gem! There is an upstairs, outdoor patio where you can sip on drinks while you wait for your table...the view is amaze-balls! They have something for everyone on their menu, from burnt-end brisket to chicken bbq salads. So yummy and they have lots of local draughts and drink specials.

This place is SO good. Mac's no longer is on my list.  For BBQ and an atmosphere, come here.    First, the prices are better than Mac's, WAY better.  And you get just as much food.  Plus, the food was actually better in my opinion.    Being raised on the NC Coast, GOOD eastern bbq is hard to find if at all in CLT,  but they have it and it's great.  The service was great and the food is really good. We went on a busy Saturday night and our plates came out quickly. Mac & Cheese, Brisket and the Banana Pudding were the top-hitters for me that night.

This place is the tits. Ive only grabbed to-go a few times so far but every time its been stellar. BBQ is awesome, mac n' cheese awesome, hush puppies awesome, bacon wrapped jalapenos almost awesome. Everyone in Charlotte is obsessed with Mac's (for some reason,i dont understand at all). but seriously, for food,  Midwood Smokehouse wins it hands down.

The food is good, but the service was so inconsistent.  We had a party of eight and the service started out fine.  Our waitress checked up on us periodically, but as soon as most of the food was delivered, she disappeared.  One person in our party did not get his food and it was 20 minutes before we could flag someone down (and that was not even our waitress; it was still another 10 minutes before we saw her).  You have a party of 8 and mandatory tipping is illegal now so you should be checking up on the table every few minutes, especially after the food is delivered.  The manager comped my friend's meal which was nice, but it was a bad experience overall.  The bacon-wrapped jalapenos and the brisket were just okay.  I am not in much of a hurry to return especially considering the hassle of getting in and out of the place.  They also need some blinds or tinted plastic on the patio.

I had the burnt ends tossed with cheer wine sauce which was unbelievably good!  Very moist tender and the sauce was perfection. Also had bacon wrapped jalapeños, my #1 reason for going.  They put pickled onions on the side that are delicious.  Always a good choice.
This restaurant is a local famous. They serve good BBQ food and beer.   You should order a large plate if hungry because the regular size is more for sampling (about half the size of the large plate)

First time here. Food is good but I didnt care for the pulled pork entree. It was really mushy and had way too much vinegar. It was definitely overcooked but still tasted good. However, I wouldnt order it again. It looked like the pork was put in a blender. Had this dish in other places and it was prepared much better. The sides, collards and fries, were good but the pork was just way overcooked. The service was good and the wait was only 10 minutes on a Saturday night.

Tasty BBQ in the heart of Plaza Midwood. This place will really be awesome when they open their top deck. I had the pulled pork which was very tasty. I liked their Midwood BBQ sauce. Next time I will try the ribs.

Your review helps others learComing from Kansas City, I KNOW what good BBQ is!  I was very impressed.  Nothing I tried was even mediocre in the slightest.  I highly recommend the ribs in Habanero BBQ sauce.  They don't even need extra sauce.  The brisket was amazing in its own right, particularly with the crust.  I completely enjoyed the beans, the corn and my God...  the sauces!!  The pork was decent and was exceptional with the variety of sauces to add on.  I would also say that the sausage is amazing.  Most of the reviews on here don't tout the sausage and I don't know why!  Dip it in their variety of mustards and you've got a real winner.  It was nice to have the hush puppies as an add on to dip with, etc.  Now, if this isn't enough to convince you, the people make it a spectacular experience indeed!  Both of my servers were absolute sweethearts and made me feel very welcome.  I would not have been surprised if I had been invited to go to a party afterwards.  Just incredibly warm people.  Richie Haddox the manager even stopped by several times to check on me and treated me to some great conversation as well as a little extra sauce.  ;-)  An awesome experience to be sure!  These people know good BBQ and exceptional customer service.  Its too easy to find average or even bad customer service these days.  Tragic commentary on where we've come to as a society.  Not at Midwood Smokehouse, however.  I'm definitely coming back the next time I'm in town, and to my buds back home... get ready!  I'm bringing home some killer sauce!n about great local businesses.  Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.
Best BBQ around!  I'm so glad there is a new location in Huntersville, closer to where I live. Great place and staff was very attentive and pleasant.

I've probably been to most of the BBQ places around charlotte that are worth going to.  I would say this place is probably my favorite.  Came here with my family to get an assortment of BBQ choices.   I recommend getting the large platter to share if you want a variety of meat.  I am a brisket kind of guy, so I say this brisket comes up to par with some of the best in Charlotte.  Although its no Texas brisket, i would say this comes just right under Texas' brisket.  Nonetheless, this place is worth trying out.    The larger patter comes with 2 sides and your choice of 4 meats.  I would suggest just trying all they have to offer.  The BBQ pulled pork and sausage is great.  The brisket is amazingly tender and soft.    If you're looking for an appetizer as you wait, i would get the wings.  These wings are pretty decently made with a unique flavor of BBQ.  It isn't your typical type of bbq wings, but its something you must try.  All together i probably spent $60 to feed a party of 6.  We came out stuffed.

When my husband and I moved to Charlotte in April 2014, this was one of the first places that we visited. In the last year, it has quickly become one of our favorite spots! The food and service is consistently good and it is the best BBQ that we have found in the Charlotte area. Try the burnt ends and the mac 'n cheese!  The parking and wait can sometimes but an issue but I can assure you that it is worth the wait. They offer a service that will text you when your table is ready so you can go across the street for a drink while you're waiting. Also, getting there early is definitely recommended in order to get decent parking.
Very good food, only compliant is the restaurant size is pretty small. You at times will feel like you're on top of other people.
Great place! Brisket is my favorite. Also the queso brisket dip is the bomb and so is the hogapeno dip YUM!

I may not be the biggest fan of barbecue, but Midwood was really something else. We came on a Sunday afternoon and sat out on the porch, thoroughly enjoying the laid back atmosphere and beautiful weather.  Our order included a Bloody Mary ($3 off that day), a Combo platter with the chopped pork, beef brisket, St. Louis ribs, and smoked sausage and sides of mac and cheese and bacon wrapped jalapeños. We also added a side of burnt ends. My favourite meat would have to be the beef brisket - it was the perfect balance of lean and fatty meat. Pair that with Midwood's signature bbq sauce and you're solid. The ribs were also very tender. Although the burnt ends were packed with flavour, the meat was a bit tough for me since it was fully cooked through.  Aside from enjoying all the meats, I thought the sides were alright. I would have preferred a runnier consistency for the mac and cheese, and I am just not too fond of bacon in general.  I would highly recommend this place!

I really wanted to rate this place higher, but I just couldn't do it. The food was good, not great. The server was better than good, I had expected slow service after reading other reviews, but our waitress was on the ball with water refills and taking our order.   We started with an order of hush puppies, which my Wife and Daughter enjoyed. My meal came with them, so I waited for those. Alex ordered a brisket sandwich, which was served stacked on a bun. She selected mac & cheese as her side. She loved the mac & cheese, and said that the brisket was OK, but not as good as I make. I think she was sucking up for something from her Daddy. Alina ordered the BBQ Chicken sandwich. She really enjoyed her choice, and had the yummy mac & cheese as well. I splurged, and order a large burnt ends plate, with sides of cole slaw and bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers. Let's start with the sides. The cole slaw was chopped, and a tasty mixture of white and purple cabbage. It was a little dry for my taste, but it was still good. I loved the pepper poppers. They were the highlight of the meal. The bacon was cooked just right, not crispy and not undercooked to be chewy. The peppers had just the right amount of heat, and the cheese blended nicely with the 2 flavors. I loved them (in case you missed that the first time). Lastly, the burnt ends. I have prepared burnt ends a couple of times, and I think mine turned out better. My issue with these are that they seemed more like chinks of meat, rather than the actual ends of the brisket. They were tasty, but mostly from the sauce they were tossed in. I liked the smoky flavor in each bite, but the meat itself was nothing special.   So 3 stars? Mostly because of the price. Our bill was $42, with only 1 soft drink on the tab. For what we got, it was an expensive lunch, with no to go boxes.
The brisket was very good! For my appetizer I had jalapeños wrapped in bacon and they were also very tasty. Great service and overall a really good experience. If you like beer try the copper!

I love barbeque so, I really tried to like this place and I live around the corner. The veggies are very good but, the pulled pork just doesn't do it for me. I gave it 4 tryouts and was not impressed.
Had a corporate dinner here, the Brisket was as good as I've ever has. The baked beans had meat in them and they were wonderful. Great beer selection.

It's hard to write a meaningful review that hasn't covered every facet of this popular bbq haven. I've had their pulled pork, and most people agree that it's very good. It's hard to get the right balance of smokiness in bbq, too little and it tastes bland, too much and it's overpowering. It's mouthwatering when it's done right, and they certainly have the skills at Midwood. I expected the pulled pork to be great, but their tacos were a pleasant surprise. Why eat brisket, slaw, and mac n cheese separately when you can have a perfect fusion of flavor all in the same bite!  Their creamed corn is great too, they add just enough salt and pepper to keep it from being pedestrian. The bacon wrapped jalapenos are fine too, but I wish they served more of them.   I can only speak for myself, but every time I've ate at Midwood I went home happy with a full belly. Sometimes the wait for a table can be a little long on a busy night, and their service can be a little sluggish because of it. But they're always friendly, and the food is always great. And isn't that all that really matters?

Texas hash is  all the food is amazing! Check to see if there is a wait before you go, if there is add yourself to the waitlist via Yelp - super clutch. Decor is awesome, beer selection is on point - all around 5 stars

I loved the burnt ends! And the sweet tea is just right with my favorite crushed ice. Will definitely be returning. The only complaint was that the hostess wasn't very organized and began seating others that arrived after us while we still waited.

with a hangover and no desire to make that ridiculous trek from NoDa all the way over to southend for BBQ, my buddy Ty geniusly brought up Midwood Smokehouse.  i cannot remember what the place was before this, but that was the last time i was there.  we bellied up to the bar and the quite capable barkeep, Chad, proceeded to help us.  he had just gotten done writing the special on the mirror behind the bar, and it was just what we needed.  8 oz. of brisket over mashed potatoes with a side.  i had originally said that i was down for the creamed corn, but then changed my mind after seeing bacon wrapped jalepenos with cheese inside.  oh my.  the brisket was succulent with fantastic flavor.  the mashed potatoes weren't too bad, but nothing crazy.  might have been a tinge of garlic to them.  the bacon wrapped jalepenos were awesome.  everything my mouth wanted and stomach needed  after a night of drinking.  about halfway done with my meal, one of the other servers said he forgot my creamed corn and brought me a cup of it.  good consistency with a tinge of cheese to it, which was a good spin i thought.  my only possible complaint about the place would be that their ceilings are high and they put the televisions as much out of the way and as high as possible.  sitting at the bar, this means you are craning your neck to watch the games.  being a stone's throw from the beaver and having ample outdoor seating, there will be a return trip with fairer weather coming.

Midwood Smokehouse is situated right in the heart of the Plaza-Midwood area surrounded by tons of great places to eat and yet it rises above the rest.  No easy feat.  For one, I had heard stories about this place prior to visiting, about how the food was so good that it was always crowded and you might have to wait to be seated.  Well the first time I went came here with a friend we did in fact end up having to wait about 15 minutes to be seated but I have to say those 15 minutes were very well worth it.  First off, the staff is amazing.  Always friendly and conversational, knowledgable of the menu, and happy to be there.    The shining star meal of the Midwood Smokehouse for me is the Burnt Ends BBQ plate.  These are little cubes of meat made with their in house Fat Tire sauce.  I was really blown away at how great these things tasted the first time I had them.  I ordered a small plate and regretted not getting a large.  Seriously they're that good.  On the side I also decided to try their bacon wrapped jalapeño side as a jalapeño wrapped in bacon was an odd combination that I had never heard of.  These were really good too.  I'll recommend grabbing a side of them with whatever meal you decide to get.  Overall I must say the food at Midwood Smokehouse is top-notch.  Midwood Smokehouse has a sizable menu of draft beers so we decided to have a few.  A good portion of their selection consists of local drafts from right here in NC so I went for the Mother Earth IPA out of my hometown and it was as good as expected.  I can't recommend Midwood Smokehouse enough. It's well worth the wait to get in and I see what all the fuss was about over this place.  Since first trying them in 2013 I've been back several times and it's always a great eating experience.  BBQ is big in the part of NC that I'm from and I have to say Midwood Smokehouse ranks among some of the best in the state.

Great BBQ here. My first visit I got the Burnt Ends special which used a Cheerwine based BBQ sauce. It was amazing!!! The next visit I tried and loved the bacon wrapped Jalapeños and had a really good pulled pork sandwich. Brisket topped queso is good as well and love the hush puppies!!! I will be back here for sure many more times!

We went after it had been open for about a month. As a reference the location in Plaza Midwood is my hands down favorite BBQ spot in Charlotte. I think this place is close but not the same. For some reason I thought flavor, moisture, etc of the pork BBQ and ribs were not the same as the original location.  Service was super efficient and friendly, I loved the beers on tap and drank many of them. The food was kind of just luke warm when we got it, but I definitely want to try again and see how they are doing now that they've been up and running for awhile. If they can replicate the entire Plaza Midwood location experience this close to my house I will have a belly full of BBQ way too often!

This is a must try for the Barbecue lovers in Charlotte.. I lived in Charlotte for only a few months and I came here at the recommendation of a friend. Definitely am glad that I came here.  I remember coming here very late, must have been 10:00PM  - surprised that it was a full house. I got a pulled pork sandwich with macaroni and cheese and it was divine.  If you are a true barbecue lover or just in the mood for something new, you must come here! You certainly won't regret it. Enjoy!

We came in from Orlando for the night and yelped the best BBQ in Charlotte. This place did not disappoint. The carolina pork was phenomenal and the large plate was more then filing. All the sides were awesome. Between my girlfriend and i we had mac n cheese, jalapenos, baked beans, and the smoked veggied. All were awesome. They also have a great beer and cocktail selection!

Fantastic staff incredible food and amazing customer service. I would encourage anyone to visit any Midwood location. I grew up in the Dilworth / Myers Park area and love that we have a location in the neighborhood!

Got stranded in Charlotte for the night and had to try some BBQ, made the cab ride out to experience it. There is a wide selection of local beers, guest beers, and bottled beers. The food was delicious and the atmosphere laid back. Worth the journey!
I've never had a chance before but after my gf got me take away I was surprised! Great Hamburger !!! I need to check this place ASAP
Best BBQ and sides in Charlotte. Hush puppies, Mac n cheese, bake beans. I had the pulled pork my girl had a delicious brisket sandwich

Midwood Smokehouse may be the best barbecue I have had in the Southeast.  This includes any place in Memphis, Fox Brothers in Atlanta and Martin's in Nashville.  Fantastic sauces and sides.  The ribs were perfectly cooked and the burnt ends were great.  This restaurant is essential to a trip to Charlotte if you love barbecue.

The address is actually 540 Brandywine Road.    Great service, great food, great atmosphere. We sat in the round booth right in the center of all the energy.  Started with the smoked wings. Very tender and tasty. Main course was the hickory salmon with a pico salsa. Again very delicious.  Earlier in the week we had the pecan cobbler with ice cream.  Decedent and delicious.  Highly recommend

Just tried this new (for me) place for dinner. Had a great time and the atmosphere was superb. My server was Cristie and she was a great help in deciding what would "go" with what! She helped me chose a great new beer that I hadn't tried before as well and it seemed to "pair" well with my BBQ. Thanks for such a good night!! Way to go Cristie!!
Love midwood smokehouse! The drink specials are great, family friendly yet bar atmosphere works. Try the queso dip with pulled pork.
The delicious smells of BBQ when you walk in make your mouth water! The service was very friendly and attentive. The food was awesome!!

First time having barbecue in North Carolina, and I loved it! I didn't have too much variety, but I do want to rave about what I ordered. I got the brisket plate, and boy was it delicious! My only regret is ordering a mix of lean and fatty, instead of just fatty brisket... the fatty stuff was far superior to the lean stuff! I loved that in every bite, I was getting all this delicious fat mixed in with the meat! The hushpuppies were pretty good, I'm always a fan of pickled onions, and the no frills coleslaw was really good!  If I'm ever back, I'll definitely try the other bbq, but at 10$ for my brisket plate, I'd always be OK ordering that

Just the mention of Midwood makes me JIZZ in my pants. I always have the brisket with mac and cheese and it's godlike. I could smell my dessert (apple crisp) coming and at that moment knew I no longer needed a girlfriend...for i have MIDWOOD.

Been open for about 5 weeks now and they area going to do well. Very Good BBQ  We originally tried to visit for lunch yesterday but someone had cut the power to part of Birkdale so they were not open when we were there.  Went back today after Church and got there just before they opened. Walked in and was immediately seated  I've dined at the original location on Central Ave in Plaza Midwood and have always enjoyed my meals here..  Was curious if the had been able to recreate that experience and in terms of cuisine the answer is a definite yes.. The Central Ave location has more of a homey feel to it while this restaurant is in what used to be Modern Smoke and the Neo-Industrial. Design is still present. In other words, very very modern with plenty of stainless, dark wood and glass.  Our server was great.  He was at out table almost from the time we sat down and continued to check in to make sure we were well taken care of  I ordered the Carolina Pork which is supposedly an Eastern Style with Pepper Vinegar but you have to add your own Pepper Vinegar at the table. The Pepper Vinegar they serve is a bit tame with not a lot of heat or acidity. Hush Puppies were very  good but they do have a bit too much sugar in the batter.  Fries which I chose for my side were very good but I'm tempted to try another of my favorites, the BBQ Slaw next time.  My wife ordered a built it yourself Salad where you start with Seven Components, add a meat, a crunch and your favorite dressing.  Very good. She chose the Brisket  for the meat. Only disappointment was one of the components she ordered was tomatoes and that was missed when they made the salad.  Still in the end a very good salad.  It's a keeper for the Huntersville/North Mecklenburg area and we will be back.
It was everything we'd hoped for. Moist chicken, tender ribs, friendly staff, full bar and beer selection. Even the fries and coleslaw made us happy.

This place scores a 3.5 out of 5 stars. Slightly above average but not great.  Decent but not amazing. Service friendly but not super attentive.  Again I hate asking for water and again I had to ask and for refills.  We started with fried pickles and bacon wrapped jalapeños. Fried pickles were great however a little greasy but solid 4.5/5 in my book.  Bacon wrapped jalapeños just average 3/5. It was missing spice and flavor. I mainly tasted bacon. My husband and I split a rack of ribs which included two sides.  More than enough to share. We didn't finish. Mac and cheese was good 3/5 but I prefer a different style.  Cole slaw was great full of flavor 5/5. We finished off the meal with the small banana pudding which was perfect for two to share.  Light and fluffy 5/5.  We had a decent time but nothing to pull me back to this place.  If you are in the area might be good to try but I wouldn't make a special trip.  Just another thing we were lucky we got seats at the bar otherwise party of two was at least a thirty minute wait at 9pm on a Friday night. Usually past my bedtime Update!!! 8/6/15 I love that midtown responded my review and it was NOT a generic response it was detailed to my review. That brought then up to four stars for sure!  It's nice to know they use fresh jalapeños therefore spice on the appetizer will very.  I look forward to going back and writing a five star review!
Best brisket in Charlotte hands down. Also loved the mustard sauce I prefer that on my pork. Sausage is good, sweet  corn is there best side. Wasn't impressed with the prime rib.

This is some of the best BBQ in town. So happy they opened a location in Ballantyne. The service is amazing (thanks Chris and Tyler) and they make you feel like you are at home.   We came on opening weekend and it happened to be Mothers Day weekend too, they were slammed but still accommodated our large party.   I had the brisket and was shocked to be asked if I preferred the lean cuts, fatty cuts or both (I picked both). I'm glad they offered b/c they both were delicious.   We can't wait to come back to have a beer or two with some good Carolina BBQ!!!!!

Took a day trip up to Charlotte from Myrtle Beach and stopped here. We ordered wings and the loaded fries with brisket for appetizers. We tried all the sauces loved the sweet habernero one. Then my friend ordered the rib/chicken combo with his puppies and macaroni and I ordered the brisket sandwich on Texas toast with collard greens. Oh lawwdd! When I say the food was delicious...we had our server bring the cook out! So good and I wrapped it up with banana pudding which was amazing! This is going to be my go to place when in North Carolina. I really was that awesome!

Coming to Charlotte on business and being a huge fan of BBQ, I read a number of good reviews of Midwood so wanted to check it out myself.  While Charlotte and the vinegar based sauce is not my favorite, I still enjoyed my lunch at Midwood.  I had the pork platter which was really good.  The meat is tender and the portion is very large.  The hush puppies are absolutely excellent and one of the favorite parts of the meal.  I also had the mac and cheese which I would rate as average but still enjoyable.  On top of that, as a midwesterner I also enjoyed a nice large sweet tea!  Really nice atmosphere and room to sit at the bar if you are eating alone such as myself.

Food: I think this is the best BBQ place in Charlotte. Definitely get the banana pudding.   Service: docked two stars. We ate here on Halloween - some of my friends are from out of town so I was excited to have them experience some Carolina BBQ. We were seated quickly and ordered drinks and food at the same time. Food came quickly. However our waitress made sporadic appearances with prolonged absences. She brought our food and left without asking if we needed anything else...and we did...she didn't bring any silverware. Our friend had to get up and go to the bar to ask for silverware. when she did appear we asked for a side of sauce. Fast forward 15 minutes...we already finished eating and she brought our sauce.  An unfortunate experience. I generally love this place and will come back for the food but don't expect the service that a five star worthy restaurant should have.

I was visiting Charlotte for a business trip and wanted to try some BBQ.  I am something of a BBQ aficionado, and Midwood had the best beans I ever tasted in my life.  Also, the ribs were awesomely delicious.  The day I was flying back, I checked out an hour early just so that I could have another meal there before I flew out.  Fantastic!
Love the BBQ. Friendly wait staff and the bartenders are not stingy with the liquor. Great place for lunch. Fast service and great food

Food was alright. If you know BBQ then visiting a chain isn't the best way to get your BBQ fix but we decided to try it.  Worst part was the service. Our waitress brought our drinks and both drinks were incorrect. Our appetizer was brought by another waitress and our meals were brought by a manager. Definitely won't be back because $71 can be well spent somewhere else.

Cool for what it is, but it ain't all that. I'll have to give this place another try and have the wings since I hear they're really good. I came here on a Saturday night to order take out and the place was PACKED. Like, no room to move packed. Ordered the food and I think it took about 30-35 minutes. $35 bucks for the "Pig Out" platter was enough to feed 4 ppl. The meats had decent flavor and were pretty good, the sides were just ok. The pickled onions were good!

My daughter and I visited this location on a Saturday in September. We had an amazing server, I forgot his name, I believe it was Drew. My daughter and I enjoyed the BBQ Queso with shredded beef brisket, Burnt Ends and a half rack of Saint Louis Style Pork Ribs. Yummy. This was my first time visiting the location, I decided to eat outside but the flies wanted to enjoy my meal too so I had to take it to go but I heated my food up later on and it was yummy :)!

First time giving these guys a try and I LOVED it! Shantel was our server for lunch today and she killed it. She was friendly, efficient and above all very knowledgeable about the products. She brought us out small sides of each of the sauces to try and, though I liked the mustard the best, they are all great.

My friends and I were in town to attend the Carolina Panthers verses the New Orleans Saints game.  When we asked for a good place to get some BBQ, this place was recommended.  The service was excellent and our food was delicious.  Our only complaint was that it was un comfortably cold, but the manager graciously adjusted the temperature.

I love this place! So much better than the old bbq place that was there. The manager Joe was so nice and helpful And Our waiter Mark was phenomenal! Great service overall. I ordered the brisket and it came out a little fattier than I expected, but the manager and waiter came over right away and replaced it for me no questions asked! And fast! The burnt ends were amazing too! I would def recommend this place to anyone who wants good bbq!
This is a nice place to try and don't skip dessert the pecan cobbler is great not too too sweet just right!

Small wait the later you go in the evening, but we'll worth the wait.  We got the bacon wrapped jalapeno peppers, pretty ok.  Not great.  They come 5 to an order with ranch dipping sauce.   We reached ordered ribs, I got the creamed creamed corn (can you say OMG!!!) The best I have ever had, my partner got sweet potato fries.   The plates came with ok hushpuppies, I have had way worse.   The ribs were fall of the bone tender, no knife or fork needed there.  They are  a dry rub, but the ribs are super moist.  You can get them sauced or sauce on the side.  A sweet habenaro (a little kick) sauce or a Smokey sweet sauce.  Both were really good.

Overall Midwood gets 5 stars! Good BBQ and a great place. We left a lot fatter than when we walked in.   We were staying in Charlotte downtown and found this place on our way in. Our visit was on the 21st of July of 2017.   Food - I'd give 4 stars! The food was really great, but I've had better BBQ.   What we ordered: We ended up getting the combo with ribs, brisket, and pulled pork. Our sides were cream corn and beans.   The ribs were dang good, cooked perfectly with a nice amount of smoke. Lacked the flavor that I've had in other places...but real close to being amazing. Same with the brisket.   The pork, however, was outstanding. Some of the best flavor I've ever had on pulled pork, and it was perfectly juicy.   The cream corn was also outstanding! The beans were a bit of a runnier mix, also good. The beans worked really was a dipping sauce!  We also got some hush puppies, which were about average for hush puppies.   NO CORN BREAD!!! WHAT THE FRANK??? Why no cornbread? What does the chef have against cornbread? Why did they deprive me of this tasty side dish?  The ambience - I'd give 5 stars!  The place feels inviting and comfortable. Big tables for all the food you're going to order, comfy seating, good bar, TVs, nice outdoor seating, and clean bathrooms.   An added touch was the plates and dishes! They aren't boring and plain...feels like something you'd find at grandma's house.   The staff - I'd give 5 stars! The host was really friendly and paid close attention to us. Even let us move when a booth opened up.   The waiter was very helpful and patient with all of our questions. He genuinely wanted us to have a great experience.   We had no problems with our food arriving quickly and everything was perfect.   Conclusion This place has a great reputation for a reason and we couldn't have been more pleased. Unless the had corn bread!!
What a great place to eat, a bbq place with fancy dishes, we loved it.  The service was excellent.  Will stop here the next time I'm in town

Went here for the first time last night (Tue).  They have 1/2 price martinis which was good because I needed me some vodka, and having it 1/2 price made it all the better!  Started with the queso with pulled pork.  I thought it was really good and the small was plentiful for 2 of us.  My other friend had the bruschetta and he seemed to enjoy it.  I went with brisket on the servers recommendation, and opted for lean with mac n cheese.  Brisket was good, but I wish I had gotten fatty, it seemed like it would have been a bit tastier.  The hushpuppies were awesome!!  I really loved them.  I liked the onions, they were nice and sweet.  Mac n cheese was okay, least favorite part of the meal.  Service was good, we were seated right away since it was early.  I really liked the interior of this place and they had a great 80s music station on which I loved!  I had no issue with saltiness with any of the food and I am someone who doesn't add salt to anything so I would have noticed right away.  All in all I liked it a lot and I would not hesitate to go back, its close to home too, so yay!!

Awesome. I've been spoiled by the brisket in Austin, but this is fabulous!   The cream corn was super, and the hushpuppies were perfectly done. Great location and decor, and Mindy explained everything and made recommendations which were impeccable!  Thanks Mindy!
got the burnt tips which were awesome and the bacon wrapped jalapenos and lets be honest, anything wrapped in bacon is delicious.

Well, they were out of sweet potato fries and potato salad before the dinner rush even started (we were there at 4:45pm on a Monday night) and the ribs took darn near forever, BUT the brisket sure made up for it. Best brisket I've ever had! It was worth the other issues. I do wish they'd have done something to make up for the fact that they were out of several choices on their menu.

Midwood Smokehouse, where do we begin?  Let's start with service, which, to my experience has always been great! Everyone's friendly and helpful, love it.  The sauce, well, the namesake BBQ sauce is pretty good! It's a little thinner than I'm used to, but I dig it.  The hush puppies, friggin amazing. Where I'm originally from, hush puppies aren't a thing. They should be ,though, as long as they're always as good as the ones you get here. Fantastic, best pups I've ever had!  Everything else is kind of average. I've had BBQ a lot of places (there is a pulled pork sandwich in my life that I get actually emotional about every time I have it). Most of the reviews would lead you to thinking the BBQ here is that good. Don't get me wrong, it's not bad, but I've had a lot better Q in my day.  This place gets insanely busy. Be prepared to have a backup plan if you're trying to come here at peak hours.  We've been a couple times now, if you're really craving BBQ this will do. I'm going to give some other places a shot for now.

Well worth the hour wait on a Friday evening: they've got burnt ends! We first tried burst ends in South Carolina and have been searching for them ever since. We put our names in at Midwood Smokehouse and loved that they texted us when our table was ready an hour later [we walked down the street to the Thirty Beaver, the sketchiest dive bar EVER, while we waited!] We'd heard great things about Midwood but were ecstatic upon examining the menu that they serve burnt ends!   We ordered a large burnt ends plate to split with BBQ baked beans, bacon wrapped jalapeños and hushpuppies for sides. I'd skip the baked beans next time, but everything else was stellar. Honestly, I wasn't super hungry, so it was easy to split the large plate, but if we hadn't been tasting as many things in Charlotte as we could, we would definitely have had to order two plates. Also, I was surprised that the large $18.00 plate wasn't bigger then it was. Again, we weren't at full hunger, but if we were, I would've been disappointed. Midwood is a little pricier then most BBQ joints, but it is dang tasty. I might recommend grabbing an appetizer at a local restaurant while you wait instead of going balls-to-the-wall here.

Salmon might be one of the best salmons I've ever had.  This separates them by doing something unique in my opinion.  Everything is very good, and I place them tied with mac's for the two best bbq spots in Charlotte.  If you want ribs go to Mac's, burnt ends come to midwood.  Brisket at both locations is excellent, but prepared differently.  You won't go wrong coming here for excellent BBQ  I went here again with family in town and had the Pulled Pork Plate.  Nice portion of food for $10, but more importantly it was probably the best pulled pork I've eaten.  Tender, flavorful, perfectly smoked.  Pulled pork just put Midwood ahead of Mac's in my opinion.

So I have heard the buzz and had friends already go, so I had to try it too.  This place is great - I love the smokey smell and the bar area was cool. I had the large Carolina BBQ plate and you could taste the smokey flavor - Yum! I also had the mac and cheese and bacon wrapped jalapenos - YUM!   This is my new favorite place, and on my way out, did I notice an upstairs deck for those nice summer nights? I think so!

A couple of weeks ago, I heard rumor of a new BBQ joint opening up in Charlotte.  As I read more and more about it, I started getting excited and determined that I just had to check this new place out soon.  Well that new place is Midwood Smokehouse, and I took the opportunity today to check it out before having to head in to the office.  Nestled in the Plaza-Midwood neighborhood of Charlotte, NC, Midwood Smokehouse is the newest restaurant opened by longtime Charlotte restauranteur Frank Scibelli.  Scibelli is the brain child behind several popular Charlotte restaurants such as Big Daddy's Burger Bar and Paco's Tacos and Tequila.  As noted in an interview with Charlotte Magazine, Scibelli's restaurant fully intends to produce serious, authentic wood-smoked BBQ.  To accomplish this goal, he traveled around North Carolina to research the state's well-known pork barbecue joints, and he also collaborated with James Beard award winner Robb Walsh on the intricacies of Texas barbecue (read: brisket).  My task for today was to see how close he came to meeting this goal.  While the location of the restaurant may be in a trendy part of the city, the interior decor was inviting.  A mirror behind the bar stated the daily specials as well as some rather interesting one-liners/  Since Midwood Smokehouse has been open for less than two weeks, the menu was a little limited.  However, plenty of options were still available, ranging from Eastern Carolina style pork to brisket to sausage made on the premises.  After perusing the menu, I ordered a half-rack of ribs (St. Louis style) with a side of BBQ baked beans.  I requested that the ribs be sauced.  In addition, I ordered an additional side of bacon-wrapped jalapenos stuffed with cheese (which I lovingly refer to as ABTs, or atomic buffalo turds).  The server was very pleasant, taking her time to go through several of the menu options and offer her personal recommendations.  After about 10 minutes, my order arrived.  The first thing I notice is that the ribs were served with sauce on the side instead of being glazed on the ribs (as I expected).  The food certainly looked appetizing, and I will get to my thoughts on the food shortly.  As I was taking pictures of my food, the general manager came over to my table.  I introduced myself to him as a BBQ blogger, and he immediately offered to bring me a sampling of their other menu items.  How could I possibly refuse?  As if I wasn't already starting to feel full enough, out comes a sampling of pork, brisket, prime rib, sausage, and other goodies.  In addition, I also got to sample all of the sauces that Midwood Smokehouse offers as well as a small sample of collard greens.  Now on to the verdict...  The ribs had an excellent flavor. The meat was not too smoky, and I could actually taste the pork rather than an overabundance of rub to mask the flavor of the meat.  However, there were two things I immediately noticed:  - The back membrane had been left on the rack when it was cooked. - The rib meat pulled right off the bone without any resistance, which signified that they were a bit overcooked.  The sausage was a very mild sausage.  It had a bit of a crumbly texture.  Since I'm not an expert on how authentic Texas-style sausage should taste, I won't give an opinion on that.  The brisket was good, with a nice texture and taste.    The pork was, in short, PERFECT!  It had a perfect savory flavor, and the texture was on point (and not mushy like a lot of Eastern Carolina style pork can be).  Honestly, the pork did not need any sauce, but I decided to try it with the vinegar-based sauce.  The sauce added an extra dimension to the pork.  Finally, the prime rib...  why didn't someone introduce me to smoked prime rib before?  Completely and totally droolworthy!  This one is definitely on my repeat list.  So would I recommend this BBQ joint?  Absolutely, with no reservations whatsoever!    This review is available with pictures at http://www.bigwaynerbbq.com/2011/05/15/review-midwood-smokehouse-charlotte-nc/.

Great smokey tasting pulled pork. Just landed in my top 5 in Charlotte for sure. The meat was flavorful and juicy versus one-note due to baking. The sides - creamed cord- decadent. The greens - though tasty- did not exceed my flavor development in a pot o' greens Our server, though slow, took his time to be cordial and kind so I didn't mind. Cool spot. Especially since our President et al stopped through. I'd come again and again... In a pair of cute flats though.  Gotta park across the street.
I was incredibly satisfied with how delicious the food was! To top it off, amazing service! Definitely a spot to return to!!
I dont like smoked neat but this was 5 stars!   Enough said!  They are professionals!
What can I say? Everything here is good! Seriously. Smoked wings, ribs, burnt ends, cuban sandwich, brisket. Never been disappointed. Good sides & good service. Highly recommend.

The meats were absolutely amazing. Tender hickory smoked meat you can smell the fire as you pull up. Asked the waiter for recommendations and got great beer recommendations. Wasn't crazy about the queso but my husband loved it. We got the "well fed" combo platter and all the meats were absolutely fantastic. I'll be back if I'm ever in Charlotte again.

Meat. Mac n cheese. Hush puppies. I died and went to BBQ heaven. This place is tried and true for their tender, juicy meat and savory sides. They have a nice wine, beer and cocktail menu and so much yummy food.  Hubs and I went here on a date night. Expect a wait, because it's a popular place. But you can join the wait list on yelp prior to going ;) We waited about 25 minutes for a first available table, which wasn't too bad. We got a table inside, which is spacious and nice. Patio seating is more intimate. Hubs got their new featured drink called the French Canadian, a whiskey-based cocktail, and he really enjoyed it.   For food, we decided to split the 4 proteins, 2 sides meal and ordered ribs, pulled pork, pulled chicken, and brisket with sweet tater fires and mac n cheese. This shared option was the smaller of the two, but it was plenty of food for us! We both left so stuffed. The meals also come with delicious hush puppies and a spicy BBQ sauce and a vinegar sauce. Everything was really, really good and we will definitely be back.

First time visitor to Charlotte and was brought here by some local friends. We ordered the Pimento Cheese Fries and Brisket Nachos to start and the Nachos were the table favorite. Then we had brisket, ribs, BBQ chicken and brisket burnt ends. My favorite meat was by far the ribs, although it was all delicious.  We also had the Mac & Cheese and the Jalapeño Creamed Corn. Both were very rich flavors, ya know not bland like some sides. Our server was very nice too!

Came here while I was in town for my cousin's wedding. I was super excited to try BBQ here because that's what this part of the US is known for!   It was time to splurge since I don't come here often.   My group ordered two Pig Out Platters for the four of us.  Pig out comes with 4 proteins, 2 sides, hushpuppies, and pickled onions.   What we got:  Proteins:  - lean beef brisket: skip out on this and indulge in the fatty beef brisket because it's so worth it  - fatty beef brisket: so juicy, tender, and fatty. It literally melted in my mouth. My favorite!  - St. Louis Style pork ribs x2: fell off the bones, and super yummy!  - chopped pork: don't recommend. It was kind of dry and too smoky.  - hickory smoked sausage x2: Just okay, nothing out of this world.  - chopped chicken: Same as the chopped pork.  If I come here again, I would order 2 fatty beef brisket, pork ribs, and hickory smoked sausage. I also got the sauce on the side which was a good move because I don't like my bbq drenched in sauce!    Sides:  - Collard Greens: didn't try  - Smoked Veggies: surprisingly very good. My favorite side! This is a must!  - Classic mac & cheese: wish it was more cheesy  - Crinkle cut fries: wish it was more crunchy!  - hushpuppies: wow, so crunchy on the outside! SO GOOD.  - pickled onions: didn't try this because I dont like pickled stuff  It was quite a lot for us and we went home with leftovers.   Our waitress was really friendly! Great customer service.   Definitely a must when in Charlotte! Even Hillary Clinton & Obama thought so!!!

I recently moved from Texas to North Carolina, and I have been on the hunt in Charlotte for a good barbecue spot. Midwood Smokehouse was almost unanimously recommended to me by everyone I asked. It took me awhile to visit, however, because my friend had a poor experience-- he had food poisoning following a visit to Midwood.    I finally decided to try it out when my parents came to visit last month, and we all loved it. Everything was great, and that is saying a lot because we are particular about our barbecue!   Great drinks, great food, fun atmosphere!   Needless to say, I was really looking forward to my second visit when my SO came into town. The second time around, Midwood was very packed. We waited an hour, and the meal ended up being very disappointing. The meat was dry and the service was lackluster. To top it off, the next day we were both sick!  So disappointing! Definitely won't be going out of my way to return.

Ummm, Yes.   That about concludes it.   The last time I visited here I had the brisket queso, and my goodness was it amazing. I'm not even a fan of brisket and I couldn't get enough. I also tried the smoked wings - which are offered naked or sauced. Next time I know to go with naked. The wings alone were amazing, but the sauce just didn't do anything for my personal taste. It didn't taste like much of anything to be honest. I couldn't pinpoint it as spicy, it wasn't barbecue, couldn't find any taste of ketchup. So I could definitely do without. But otherwise I'll be back soon.   Location wise, I had to turn around 3 time's because I kept missing it. It's easy to drive right past since its connected with a larger office building, and not to mention the parking on weekends is impossible. But none the less, delicious food.

(5/28/17) I felt like bbq tonight so my wife drove us over to Midwood. We got a trainee waitress Ally and her trainer who failed to introduce himself. I ordered bacon wrapped jalapenos. They had good flavor but no heat. The next course is nachos libre with brisket and an old Mecklenburg hornet's nest beer. My wife is getting chicken wings. The trainer, whose name was Trent but we found that out when we got the bill, had promised us BBQ sauce which was never given to us. He also recommended the excellent beer but had promised a glass of water as well that was never brought to the table. My wife asked me why I didn't remind them about the missing items. I told her that it wasn't up to me. The nachos were average at best. There was so little brisket that it was clumped in a thin strip down the center of the dish rather than spread throughout it. That was disappointing.  My wife had ordered the chicken wings on Trent's recommendation because he told her that they had switched suppliers and that the wings were larger than they had been previously. Apparently he didn't remember how small the previous wings were since my wife said that these wings looked like pigeon wings too. They were definitely the smallest wings I'd ever seen.   Well at least I have two less dishes that I will choose the next time that we eat here.

This place had a lot of hype coming in and was able to live up to it. I was really craving BBQ or tacos so I decided to combine the two. While these were good I should have stuck with just the BBQ. I had the brisket tacos and the meat was excellent. By the end I was just eating the meat. Beer selection, which is a must for anywhere I eat, was great. I would recommend this place.

Got the Carolina pork with spicy BBQ. Liked it to the point where i would eat it again, but not enough to land it on my short list of eating destinations. i was really looking forward to the bacon jalapenos but they turned out to be not as great as i imagined. Mine actually weren't spicy at all. i actually enjoyed the hush puppies more. The banana pudding was pretty darn good and very well priced so don't forget to order it.

The reviews for this place sounded so good and I did not realize where it was until the other night.  Right across the street from the Family Dollar Store where Bistro Le Bon is.  Today for lunch - (I did not eat it all).  The small Combo platter was: Chopped Pork, St. Louis Style Ribs, Sausage, Beef Brisket, Hush Puppies, Pickled Onions and two sides - I chose the Jalapenos stuffed with Cheese, wrapped with bacon and BBQ Slaw.  In addition I ordered: Fried Pickles, Sweet Potato Fries, Brown Sugar Bacon (only two slices) and for Dessert the Peanut Butter Cup (a minimum of 700 calories a meal in itself)!  One at a time:  Two very excellent BBQ sauces, One sweeter Tomato Based 4.5 yelp stars.  The second a vinegar based sauce 4.85 stars.  The Meats: NICE Smokey Flavor!!! The Beef Brisket (I needed a knife and not a sharp one and only barely - this brisket was Tender)! Good flavor on its own!  With the vinegar very good 4 stars.  St. Louis Cut Ribs 4.25 yelp stars.  The Sausage was better than many and better than most I've had lately 3.25 stars.  The Chopped Pork  Fantastic 5 stars.  The Brown Sugar Bacon 3.75 stars.  Extras:  The Fried Pickles are a Winner!!!  Thin sliced perfect batter (light and Thin) perfectly cooked an Easy 5 yelp stars and I ate these with no dressing!  They needed nothing the flavor was perfect!  Sweet Potato Fries another winner 5 yelp stars with ease.  The BBQ slaw was good, no mayo, very simple, I added the vinegar BBQ sauce to it so it rates a 3.95 stars.  Stuffed Jalapenos wrapped in Bacon 3.85 stars.  The Hush Puppies and Pickled Onions were throw away items (throw them away!) and NOT factored in to my review rating and that is a good thing for the restaurant!  The Dessert was good (I ate the whole thing) though I would not order it again because I'm very picky - This Dessert will not make my "Dessert" list at 3.6 stars!  Yes I took photos!  Happy Dinning!  The Roof Top dinning area looks real cool so I'll be back for the Cuban Sandwich and see how it stacks up with Carlos Cafe.

Food is good if not great,  but the price is right and the service is decent.   For the price point it is a hell of a lot nicer than Applebee's, although if you are shopping for high quality regardless of cost.... keep shopping.

My annual trip to Charlotte and Midwood did not disappoint as usual. We had the Pig out and the burnt ends. They were out of this world as usual. I'm am a little disappointed that there is no more fried pickles on the menu. I hope they bring them back.

Visited Charlotte on the spouse program (wife had a business meeting and I tag along.) I know Carolina BBQ means pork, but I opted for the brisket. It was the best brisket I have eaten. You can get lean, fatty, or mixed, mine was the mixed. It was very tender and had just the right amount of tasty fat!!! Mac and cheese as a side was baked, not just macaroni and cheese sauce. It was very good. There is a large beer list and many choices of bourbon if that's your thing. Definitely gets a return visit if I visit Charlotte again.

The meat-eaters had a jolly good time here, thanks to me and my Yelping prowess.  I had eaten a starkly contrasted raw vegan lasagna a half an hour prior in anticipation of this meat feast because as you can imagine, not the most vegetarian friendly place!  At least the sweet potato fries were good and service was on the better side.  So that pleased me well enough.    Given that Midwood Smokehouse is such a sought after lunch joint, do anticipate a bit of a wait.  I think we waited around twenty or thirty minutes - sufficient time to cram in a game of cornhole.  I killed it, that's what vegans kill . .. games?  Nice touch offering this distraction during the wait!  Anyway, the omnivores REALLY enjoyed their meaty selections - can't quite recall everything, but I think there were some leftovers, which a late flight arriver was more than happy about receiving.

I've been on a quest. It's been a long quest.  I do believe it just ended at Midwood Smokehouse in Charlotte, North Carolina.  I just tasted the best brisket of my life.  I don't know how Midwood's chefs took the meat and turned it into this perfect art that delectably melts in your mouth. You can also order a side of bacon-wrapped jalapenos, which are delicious and spicy!  Midwood also has a plethora of stuff on tap, including the local brews for those of you, like me, enjoy sampling the hometown fare.  The service and atmosphere was fantastic! Bright and warm to the point where you'll never want to leave.  You also have never tried pork until you've had their Carolina Pork. With locally made vinegar, that stuff is awesome!  Midwood is a BBQ must while you're in Charlotte!

Ok, so when the guys at the Westin, the Uber driver, AND the guys at the guitar store all agree a place is good you can generally take it to the bank. I was not disappointed.  I didn't have a reservation but just walked up at 6pm on Sat night which is risky but the host was very gracious to offer a spot at the bar where I could stash my bulky guitar case from my unexpected purchase (it happens) and still keep an eye on it.  Sat next to a guy who was from upstate NC who come to Midwood every time he's in town and he recommended the 1/2 chicken with SC mustard sauce. I got the fries and coleslaw as sides and it came with a generous portion of hush puppies. Very tasty!  Fries crisp and coleslaw had the delicious tang of North Carolina. The bartender was very attentive.  I got a good chance to just look around and enjoy the atmosphere being there by myself and I saw a lot of good times, good service and good food. Folks, this is a can't miss place if you are looking for good barbeque. I will be back!

I brought a group of ten people here for dinner.  Due to a severe rain storm and flash flooding the majority of my group arrived later then 2 other people.  My ONLY issue is that they refused to seat them until we arrived.  These people were my guests and I wanted them to have a drink before we got there.  I didn't like that policy at all.    We ordered the Hogapeno Dip, a Queso Dip with Meat, a Queso Dip without meat, Fries with pimento cheese and the Bacon wrapped jalapenos to start with.  WE LOVED EVERYTHING.  My personal favorites were the Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos and the Hogapeno Dip.  OMG!!!  So good.  We ate every appetizer and everyone raved about how much they liked it.  I had the Carolina Pulled Pork with Creamed Corn and Cole Slaw.  PERFECTION.  Then I ordered a pig out platter for everyone to try all the meats.  The ribs were a huge hit and the brisket was amazing.  But those who ordered the burnt ends were in heaven with their choice.  They LOVED IT.  Since we had pigged out on the starters, we all ended up taking our items to go.  The Pecan Cobbler was so decadent and everyone loved it.  I had the strawberries and cream pie and it was delightful.  Our server was awesome and so polite (that southern charm is always appreciated).  He even took a group photo for me as well as one of himself.  LOL  A great night was had by all and I can't wait to come back EVERY SINGLE TIME I'm in Charlotte!

Its part of the "Charlotte experience!" to me. On my first visit, we happened to find Midwood Smokehouse. While I do not go all the time now that Charlotte is my home. Anytime I have a visitor, I make a point to bring them to Midwood Smokehouse. I love the Carolina Pulled Pork. The sides are all delicious. Its great value for the money.

We ordered from this Restaurant using Door Dash. I was not impressed with the food. The food had a heavy smoke flavor like they used way too much liquid smoke in it, and it even seemed to be in the side dishes as well. It could have been that it was just so overwhelming that it permeated everything, not sure. The hush puppies were great. Also, for the price I was expecting much more food. I was very disappointed and will not be ordering/visiting again. Instead, I'll drive across town to Jim and Nicks.

We ordered the "Well Fed" meal in which we chose: double Brisket, pulled pork, sausage, collard greens, slaw and added a side "Burnt Ends" for 5 dollars.  Drank local beer Cowboy Betty.  I really enjoyed the Pork barbeque although it is not traditional North Carolina BBQ.  It had a delicious sweet & smoky flavor that was able to hold its own without adding any sauce.  Very tender and tasted as if basted in drippings from the cook.  We asked for a bun or roll but it was not available.  We were offered Texas Toast but did not try it. 4.75 Stars  The sausage was also very good. 4 Stars  My friend John really enjoyed the brisket but I did not.  The texture was right and passed the pull test but my piece did not have the smoky flavor I was looking for.  It didn't have much flavor at all.  I gave John the rest of my brisket and he said that his was better.  Not sure if I was just unlucky.  It tasted better with the Midwood Sauce on it. 2.5 Stars  We were really excited to try the Burnt Ends based on the waiters description.  They were a bit dry and texture was a little tougher than I had imagined.  2.5 Stars   Collard greens 3.5 Stars Cowboy Betty:  Really nice wheat beer. 4.5 Stars Slaw: 2.5 Stars  Service was nice and waiter was well informed about the menu but he didn't seem to be focused on the floor.  Once food got out, employees seemed focused on conversations with each other and did not look back at the tables for longer than normal periods of time.   All in all we really enjoyed our meal.  The pulled pork, sausage and collard greens were excellent and we would highly recommend the restaurant if in the Charlotte, NC area.

Had dinner at Midwood Smokehouse. Was seated promptly.  Jalapeño appetizer was excellent.  Between us, we had the BBQ chicken, ribs and brisket.  Everything was good but the ribs were the besr. Deliciously seasoned so sauce was not necessary.  I also loved the BBQ beans, my favorite side for sure. In my opinion,  they could have put less ice in the drinks.  The wait staff was attentive and friendly.

God Bless traveling with my best friend because one thing I know for sure is we are (Eating BBQ). This time we happen to be in Charlotte so we hit our trusty Yelp App and landed at this BBQ gem. Getting a 5 Star from me is extremely hard, but this spot hit all the marks. The Carolinas are suppose to be known for their bbq so I figure it was be solid, but this blew me away. Exploring the menu, they didn't have just your typical meats like Ribs, Pork, Chicken, and Brisket. They had all of them plus some BBQ pitmaster specialities sure as Burnt ends for Pork and Beef, along with some pulled chicken, but the thing was surprising was they had smoked salmon. That is something you just don't see at BBQ and let me tell you, it was cooked perfectly and tasted incredible. So between us ordered the Brisket which was cut from the Point, some pork burnt ends, Salmon, and Pulled Chicken. All were awesome. The sides were standard- they compliment the meat. The mustard bbq sauce was one of the best I have tried recently. I used the Carolina vinegar sauce for my Collard.   All in all a great experience.

Upon arriving I was a little skeptical because I've lived in Charlotte for 30 years and have never eaten there, or even heard of the place until recently. My daughter had an appt nearby, and asked if I could meet her for dinner there, along with her sister. It was a lot bigger inside than I first thought. The hostess was very friendly and smiled when she greeted me. That instantly made me feel welcome. It smelled so good, and the atmosphere was more like a diner. They do serve beer here and our waitress was very friendly and did a great job keeping our drinks filled and getting fresh beers when we were ready. Their pricing was very reasonable, and my chicken bacon sandwich and sweet potato fries were perfect! Generous helping too, and I couldn't even finish it all! My only recommendation is that I think they could do a little more to update the decor a little, however I will definitely visit again and next time bring my hubby!
My new favorite Charlotte BBQ spot... Amazing specials! Try the Brisket fo sho!
Great BBQ feast with tremendous sauce and great service.

Had chopped pork with vinegar plate for dinner. Loved it! And I know my pork because I'm an Eastern NC girl. They got the vinegar sauce just right. I had the baked beans and collards as sides. Delicious! Can't wait to return to Charlotte to enjoy Midwood again.

Some good old BBQ action.  This place has everything a BBQ place should, from the awesome menu options, to the decor, to the friendly staff.  I had the 4 meat plate with ribs, brisket, bbq chicken, pulled pork. Mac & Cheese for the side with collard greens. Yeah I was hungry, please don't judge me. All of the food was great and to my liking.    I also had me some sweet tea whiskey to wash it all down. A bit too sweet, but who cares, I was in the moment with the BBQ anyways.
Best bbq in Charlotte I enjoy it every time. Been here 4 times and they have never let me down!  Love this place, try the burnt tips you won't regret it!

Hubby and I had gotten a recommendation to check this place out, and so picked up some food to go while visiting Charlotte. We tried the pulled pork, burnt ends, and pork ribs (best dry rub I've ever tasted). For sides we loved the mac and cheese best. The hush puppies were phenomenal and knocked this review up to the 5th star. So tasty and with the perfect size and texture. Crispy on the outside and dense on the inside. Great meal.

1. The pimento cheese fries. I order pimento cheese fries PRETTY much every time I see them on the menu. These were really good. Very generous amount for an appetizer, 2 of us could not finish them. The cheese was good but it was on the more tame/bland side of pimento. I would order again! 2. I got the hot mess burger. This is a burger made with ground brisket and chuck I believe, and the waitress suggested I order it rare/medium-rare. While I will eat a steak that way, I am not as trusting when it comes to ground beef. I ordered the burger medium and it came well done. Luckily the delicious bacon-y  cheese-y condiment and the jalapeno poppers on the burger made it so tasty and juicy that the meat being a bit dry didn't bother me. If you are all about the meat, I would check the doneness before the waitress leaves. I ate the entire thing, and the collards were delicious.  3. Hubs got the large brisket plate, and he ordered the brisket "fatty". I will say, my husband is a barbeque snob. He smokes his own meats and spends ridiculous amounts of time researching barbeque. The brisket was dry for him...especially since he ordered it fatty. He said the sauce and the flavor were good, but it seemed to be rushed due to trying to serve customers. He also remarked that the mac and cheese was some of the best he has ever had.   So..all in all, we had some meat issues BUT we would definitely go back and try again. All the sides and the app were fantastic. The burger was still delicious even though it was well done.
This place is so great. As a native North Carolinian I am always on the hunt for great BBQ and this place has won my heart. They also have great sides my favorite is the baked Mac and cheese.

The new Midwood Smokehouse speaks for itself when compared to the previous BBQ joint that resided in this space.  I remember coming in before Midwood took over and having my pick of the tables at lunch - now you have to wait 5-10 minutes on most days.  Service is however still quite fast, and my colleagues and I are typically able to get in and out within the hour.    Have tried several different options and enjoyed them all.  The mac 'n cheese is a bit too cheesy for me, but the smoked veggies and collared greens are both delicious.  Had the Abilene Press today and enjoyed the brisket and melted Gouda.  Will definitely be coming back for more BBQ when back in the Ballantyne area!

I came here with a group of friends who are not natives to NC. We enjoyed the platter, chicken, wings, and all other sorts of barbeque. Second only to the great food was our service from our waitress Haja. She was personable, friendly, and did an outstanding job. Would absolutely come back.

Went there on a very very busy Saturday night.  I had no issue parking, but that was more luck of the draw, the parking is tight.  I guess you can park across the street, but that's not convenient and I think it costs to park over there (it's the Bistro Le Bon parking lot).  The night didn't start off too good.  We waited, and waited and waited.  One of my friends got thirsty and attempted to go in and get a drink....and that was also slow.  There were only two bartenders on duty and one was slinking drinks with a busted hand.  Like legit, he was taking off his slink to work the tap.  Anyways, we finally go table inside.  The hostess was very apologetic.  She said it took so long b/c we had wanted a table inside and out of the heat.  The night immediately turned around once we were seated.  Our waitress was fab, as was the hostess.  Drinks were plentiful and cold.  The food.  It was really good.   Honestly I got carried away w /conversation and didn't ask my dinning companions how theirs was, but no one complained.  I had the salmon sammie.  It was perfectly cooked and the corn coleslaw on top was perfection.  The hushpuppies were just OK.  I don't like them served w/ BBQ sauce.  The greens and mac and cheese were yummy, but nothing special.  The lemon chess pie was also very good.  There's a lot more on the menu I wanna try.  I'm giving solidly 4 stars.  Yeah that was a well-cooked piece of fish.  LOL

Just got take out from here and was very disappointed.  I ordered a large mixed brisket and once I got home I see that my brisket looked like scrap meat and fat cap. They literally served me 10 oz of fat.

BEST BBQ IN CHARLOTTE. After you experience the pleasure that is Midwoods smokehouse, you will not like bbq from anywhere else. I am only writing this post for the original location. Fatty brisket, bacon wrapped jalepenos, mac n cheese, and pork ribs are world class. Melt in your mouth meats and hefty portions. YOU CANNOT GO WRONG WORH ANYTHING HERE. TRUST ME AND GO.
One of the best places for BBQ in Charlotte.   The burnt ends are sauced and  tossed one more time to ensure greatness.

I love this place , but the only complaint I have is the restrestant is always cold. But there food is superior . And the staff is very friendly , I just hope that next time I go there hopefully it be warmer lol.

Overall we had a really positive experience here.  The food was pretty good, the prices were reasonable, and the service was outstanding.  My wife and I shared a full rack of ribs ($25) and a "Hot Mess" burger ($10).  Both were delicious.  Service really was the high point though.  My toddler was provided a high chair, a children's coloring menu, and crayons.  At the end of the meal, our friendly server even caught that I had left our child's food scissors on my plate.  (I'm sure that losing those would have been a headache down the road.)  I'd go again!  Food:  3.5 stars Value:  4 stars Service:  5 stars Overall:  4 stars

for the sake of Charlotte knowing whats out there...this is one of my top places.    Midwood Smokehouse will probably ruin all other BBQ in the city for you...not much compares.  If there is a wait, go for it anyways...they will take your number and text you so you can leave the area as long as you are back within 5 minutes of their call.  I personally love that.  The Pimento Cheese fries will ruin your dinner in the most glorious of ways, so good, so big!  (ADD PORK)  The burnt ends are delish - as is the creamed corn.  My go-to meal is the simple Pork BBQ sandwich, with coleslaw on the sandwich - how it should be done!  Get the vinegar sauce and pour it all on!....I do a side of hush-puppies and love to dip them in their spicy BBQ sauce.  Great dinner that always leaves me wanting to roll out the door.    Thursdays are Bring Your Own Mug night - they will fill anything up to 40oz.  Very fun time and you can get really creative!  And if you like spicy do check out their Bloody Mary's!  ($5 on Sundays!)  They are really great.  The last few sips will leave your mouth burning...in a "that was worth it" kinda way.  I have a small list of Charlotte spots I take out-of-towners when visiting.  MW-SH is the TOP spot on my list for great NC BBQ.

Finally a BBQ restaurant so good that it deserves five stars. Of course it has to be in Charlotte NC.  I say that because right now I live in Salt Lake City and they struggle when it comes to good BBQ.  Those in Salt Lake City trying to build a restaurant and try to sell BBQ need to get out and go to the BBQ regions this country has to offer before attempting to sell their version of BBQ. While visiting Charlotte, NC with my wife while she had a layover, the main thing I wanted to do was spend a nice day with my her and have authentic BBQ. I searched on Yelp and came across a number of BBQ joints and the one with the most ratings was Midwood Smokehouse. I asked a couple of locals and we were assured that we couldn't go wrong here. The Midwood on Brandywine is one of four restaurant that they own and closest to our hotel. I like that the restaurant didn't go for the BBQ dive look like most do and although it is a newer restaurant it was very clean. Our server was very nice and helpful. I want to try a local beer and she gave me a few samples to try and I went with the Sugar Creek Pale Ale. Slightly sweet and yeasty flavor but doesn't over power the taste of the food your inhaling.  As for the food we decided to share a platter where you pick four proteins. Now my wife isn't a big fan of BBQ but she does like brisket so she let me pick; we had chopped pork, brisket, St. Louis style ribs and my favorite.. burnt ends.  The platter arrived in a nice presentation with hush puppies, a dollop of coleslaw along with our sides of baked beans and Mac n' cheese. My wife tried a burnt in and asked me what it was so I explained the process of making a burnt end and she it was incredible. I have had many burnt ends over the years but these were incredible. I like how Midwood sauces them and caramelizes them at the end. I had no complaints with anything that that I ate. Hickory is one of my favorite woods to smoke with and I like that it gives such great color and if you do it like these guys you get a nice light smokiness to the meat. Our next favorite was the brisket and then ribs and chopped pork. When she came up for air my wife said it was so good the food didn't need BBQ sauce and she was right but the sauces are good too, just not necessary.  So when it comes to BBQ Midwood is the real deal. I'm looking forward to returning to Charlotte and go to their first restaurant.

If it wasn't so expensive, I'd hightail it back yonder. Great portions for just one person (for God's sake, it was big enough for you to be full for supper and have a reasonable lunch for the next day)!

Wow...that was some meal!  My family and I stopped into Midwood for dinner one night while I was in town for the Democratic Nat'l Convention and boy did this place blow my mind.  First, the ambience is perfect.  There are lots of TVs in the dining room allowing you to keep up on all of the games.  As for the food, I ordred a full slab of ribs...the BBQ was awesome.  On the side, I enjoyed the sweet potato fries and collard greens.   The back porch tea was really tasty (sweet tea, Jack Daniels and muddled lemon) C.J. was our waiter...he was very attentive and friendly.  The only downer is its location.  I was staying in a hotel downtown and it took about 10 minutes to get there.  Nevertheless, I would take a plane, train or automobile to get back to Midwood!

Best BBQ I've had east of Texas!    I was visiting from Southern California, and I am sure glad I stopped by. Everything that we ordered was amazing, and the large selection of local breweries was also a great plus.  When I visit Charlotte again, I will make sure to stop by!
Great BBQ and close to my Army Reserve unit. Food is alittle pricey and they have smaller portion sizes but the winning flavor is present.
Thanks for accommodating my family for my husband birthday celebration. Everyone enjoyed the great food and the waitress just made our meal enjoyable. Hats off
The staff was excellent as usual. The food is the best BBQ in the Charlotte area by far. Love this place!

I give Midwood Smokehouse a 4 star rating, up from a 3, because of the manager response to my previous review.  I was so impressed by their dedication to quality product and service that I think it deserves another chance.  I'll let you know in a couple of weeks!!!
Great food and service.  The hush puppies were the best and they had a ton of side options!

I yelped best barbecues in Charlotte and I think this came up as like number 7 (can't remember) and it was he best choice I made on a lazy Sunday afternoon. I got the dry ribs with the sauce on the side and the bacon wrapped jalapeños. The meat was so tender! The hush puppies were delicious! The wrapped jalapeños were amazing. The establishment looked quaint, but I wanted to sit in the park to enjoy the beautiful day. I will definitely be coming back
I had the Carolina pork with fries and bacon covered jalapeños. The pork was very good with the vinegar sauce. The jalapeños were very interesting, I recommend them if you like strange combinations.
My fav!! My big sister and I go just for apps!! Awsome.. love love love this place.. great service and amazing food!

Solid food - great service. I was here 7 or so years ago and found myself in Charlotte again so I decided to stop by. The food was delicious - I did ribs and brisket with sweet potato fries and jalapenos. The jalapenos were a little soggy so that was disappointing and the brisket was a bit on the dry side for my liking. The ribs did not fail and I devoured them happily. I did dessert last time and was not extremely impressed but maybe that has improved - however I did not revisit that tonight so I cannot comment. My server, Christopher, was awesome and super helpful. Great balance of social and helpful without being overwhelming. If you are craving BBQ this is a great option

We got so much food here. It's a good spot for bbq, and worth trying if you're in the area.  Bacon wrapped Jalapenos - So I'm probably not the target demographic for this since I hate cheese and bacon, but I think if I liked those two items, I probably would have liked this.  Smoked wings - I liked the smoked version better than the crispy version. Actually had a nice smokey flavor. Although I'd probably skip the wings in favor of some of the other bbq options.  Burnt Ends - I wasn't the biggest fans of these, but some others in my party loved them. I guess it just depends on if you like this kind of stuff. I was honestly expecting it to be more crispy, but I've never had burnt ends before, so no point of comparison. Also not a huge fan of BBQ sauce in general, which was the main flavor component for this dish.  St Louis Style Pork Ribs - THESE WERE SO GOOD. Very tender and flavorful. You have to get this.  Beef Brisket - I thought that this was okay, but not spectacular.   Carolina Pork - I really liked this too, very flavorful and tender.   Hickory Smoked Sausage - Not bad, although I feel like ribs are just always going to be better than sausage.   The hush puppies and pickled onions were also great accompaniments to the meat. We got a couple of side dishes, and I quite liked the smoked veggies (although they were a bit too oily for me). The banana pudding was also quite good, though very rich. All in all, enjoyed the meal here, and I think I prefer it to City Barbecue, solely on the strength of its ribs and Carolina Pork (although admittedly they are different styles).
