My fiance and I were in the process of deciding whether we wanted to leave our beloved Portland, Oregon and move across the country to Charlotte when we first visited the Midwood Smokehouse.  Being from Portland, food is a big deal to both my fiance and I...a dealbreaker when considering moving.  My close friends in town suggested this place and we all went.  My fiance is a big BBQ guy and he loved what he had.  It was flavorful, moist and just enough food.  I loved all of the sides too.  We had great service at the bar and then sat outside under the covered patio.  We only had to wait a few minutes for a table, even on what seemed to be a busy night.  This made the (very long) list of restaurants that convinced us that we'd be able to survive in Charlotte.  We'll see you in July Queen City!

For all of Charlotte, you cannot beat the barbeque at Midwood Smokehouse. The service can certainly leave something to be desired, but the fare is unmatched. Favorite is definitely the burnt pork ends with Cheerwine sauce with creamed corn and bacon-wrapped jalapenos as sides. Great local craft beer selection as well.

This was my first stop in Charlotte after being away for nearly 8 years. The food was extremely tasty, but even better than that, the service was first rate. Our waitress (whose name I wish I remembered) was extremely prompt & courteous with a great sense of humour. Our drinks never got below half empty because she was always just close enough nearby to provide excellent service, without hovering. I highly recommend the "burnt ends" which are not burnt at all, but perfectly cooked to be nice and crispy on the outside whole being tender & juicy on the inside. This will definitely become part of my regular rotation of great barbecue joints in Charlotte. The hush puppies were also fantastic; very well done with just the right amount of crunchy while bursting with flavour. They offer many different regional styles of barbecue, so you're almost guaranteed to find something you'll love. Excellent portion sizes, also. I tried my darnedest, but could not clean my plate.

I've heard all the raves... so I decided to check out Midwood Smokehouse for myself. And I'm now a convert! This place is, hands down, my favorite restaurant in Charlotte!  The bacon wrapped jalapenos are as awesome as others have said - FRESH jalapenos, stuffed with jack cheese, wrapped in bacon and smoked until absolutely, mouth wateringly delicious! I could eat my own body weight in them!  I had the pulled pork barbeque, which was also excellent. It was perfectly smoky, and texture-wise it was still "meaty" (a lot of places in Charlotte has "mushy" BBQ, which is a crime against humanity). The portion of barbeque was fine, although I wish I'd ordered the large plate... it was just SO GOOD!  And the rumors that Midwood Smokehouse has the best mac and cheese in town? True! It's decadent and delicious, without being pretentious (no "truffle oil" here!) It tastes like the mac and cheese you remember grandma making... only better! I even got dessert: pecan cobbler. It's like pecan pie, only served warm, with vanilla cream on top. It was HEAVENLY, and warmed the cockles of this Southern boy's heart! It was almost too big for one person, but was so yummy that I just couldn't stop!  My only complaints about this place are that it's just too crowded (not that that's Midwood Smokehouse's fault!) and that service seemed a bit slow. I mean, the table service is fine, it just seemed to take a while to get stuff from the kitchen to the table. But hell, the food's so good that it's worth the wait! And the beer selection (and specials!) are really good, too.  I cannot recommend this place enough!

First I have to admit that I often find the idea of eating ribs more exciting that the actual experience but that's me. I felt that I HAD to eat some ribs now that I live in NC, right?   This place was a drive but seeing the reviews it seemed like the best choice. Comfy hang out, good selection of beer, that's good. The bacon wrapped jalapenos were great, the smoked chicken and the mac and cheese were good but it was all downhill from there.   I had the $19 combo platter. The St Louis ribs tasted real good but they were dry. The pulled pork was dry too, which is unforgivable! Amend that even the cole slaw was dry, the worst slaw I ever had. The smoked sausage tasted funky to me and the Texas brisket was non descript and none too tender either.  Woopy-doo, if this is Charlotte's finest no more bbq for me
We have eaten here many times before and the food is always excellent and the waitstaff is pretty much always on point. We will continue to come and recommend them others.

One of the top 3 BBQ experiences I've ever had.  That's right... Not a BBQ meal, but an EXPERIENCE!  I've lived in both Kansas City and Austin, two cities famous the world over for their BBQ...Midwood Smokehouse is world class.  You HAVE to get the pimento cheese fries with brisket. Wow.  The burnt ends are the best thing the menu.  Huge chunks of perfectly cooked meat drowning in a great Fat Tire beer-based sauce.  Their Mac and cheese is great too. Excellent service and nice atmosphere.  I'll be back every time I'm in charlotte.

Amazing!  From VA driving into town found this place on yelp... The bacon wrapped jalapeños were amazing,  the pulled pork so good,  the brisket was incredibly tender, juicy and the smoke ring says it all!  The sauces were wonderful and the sides are Great,  the baked beans were the best I've ever had! Will come back the next time I'm in town

The second visit to Midwoods  confirmed that this is a great BBQ restaurant.  The combination of great food, beer,  service and atmosphere make it a fun place to  eat.  Between all of our party we managed to try all the meats in the menu and everything was perfect.  My personal favorite this time was the fatty brisket and the bacon wrapped Jalapeños.  Why have I never though of making this savory heat bombs before.  I will make sure that they become  a staple at all my home BBQ from now on.

Really good food. Same menu as the other Midwood Smokehouse at The Plaza but with better parking and a more open dining room. The servers are friendly and the prices are good.  Convenient location in Birkdale which has lots of shops and movie theater.

Girls lunch today was very good.   Interesting decor, very clean restaurant, food was really good (pork burnt ends, hush puppies, sweet potato fries--plentiful;brought half of it home), prices very reasonable, and received impeccable service from Skylar today!!!  She was awesome. Would definitely return and recommend to friends and family.
We came here while at a scentsy event. We were sat immediately. Food was good and the service was great.

Excited to try this place given all the reviews.  Got on the waitlist on Yelp.  My table was ready but I couldn't be seated without half my party there and my coworkers were late arriving.  The hostess was very accommodating and didn't give away my table.  Service was OK.  Our appetizers arrived before our drinks.  My drink was $3 off for the daily drink special and the contents reflected that... barely any alcohol, and pretty much a cup of crished ice water.  I ordered the burnt ends with Mac n cheese and collard greens.  The burnt ends were really good but the sides were just OK.  Some commented the collard greens needed to be drained as there was too much liquid.  The hush puppies had good flavor and were the perfect bite size.    A big disappointment at the table was that they ran out of ribs while we were ordering.  It was probably around 7:30 p.m. Apparently, they run out of ribs every night.  They smoke meat on a daily basis and sell what they have until they run out.  For those who ordered the combo plate that comes with ribs, they were asked what they wanted in place of the ribs.  My coworker picked burnt ends and then was up charged for it.  They were not told it would cost more and I think it's ridiculous since they were picking something else because what was part of the entree was not available by the restaurant.

Hands down, most kind, considerate, and genuinely compassionate restaurant experience I have had in a while. Being an Activities Director at a local skilled nursing facility, I employ a great amount of patience and excellence to make my residents' days happy and fulfilling. When I took 10 of them out to Midwood Smokehouse for lunch today, I was greeted with exceptional, highlight on EXCEPTIONAL service. From the servers to hostesses, each of my residents were treated with respect, consideration, and kindness. When employees go out of their way to show others the level of respect that the employees did at this restaurant today, it not only makes the dining experience memorable, but it shows that good people are in every corner of the world and are ready and able to serve others. Thank you to the staff of the Ballantyne Midwood Smokehouse for making our experience phenomenal and for showing our residents the respect they so rightfully deserve!

Hostess was extremely rude because we had originally requested for a party of 8 and only 6 showed up. We had no idea till the last minute and she was acting put out and ridiculous over something called life. Get a grip and hire people who treat your guests well. We are the people who make sure you keep getting a paycheck. Food was decent but will not be back due to her rudeness.

I'd give this place four stars+ but they seem to have portion issues. Food is consistent and delicious.  PROS: Best brisket in the city bar none. Midwood chopped salad is to die for and the dressings are pretty amazing. Honestly, with the exception of the smoked chicken, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. CONS: I have been shortchanged on portions so many times, it's become laughable. I went to buy(and paid for) 2 pounds of pork bbq to take to a friend in New Mexico but when I got home to portion it out in zip lock bags, it was 19 ounces. Had the same thing happen twice when I got a lage brisket plate to go. Supposed to be 10 ounces but both times it was 6 ounces. Called to complain and the manager was supposed to send me something in the mail but never took care of it or followed up. Bottom line, an awesome place to eat in but beware of take out. You pay for more than you are supposed to get.

Visiting from Atlanta & we knew we had to get barbecue from Charlotte! This restaurant had quick efficient service & SUPERB food. I ordered the Gingerjack drink & the St. Louis ribs with a side of mac & cheese & collard greens. It came with hush puppies as well. Everything was hot & delicious. Our server Matt was wonderful & had great suggestions & informed us newbies well! Next time we are in Charlotte, we are going again!
Go there. Locals say it is the best and I would agree.  We had the bacon wrapped jalapeños and the combo platter.  Banana pudding for desert was tops.

Okay, as far as BBQ goes... Midwood is one of the best that Charlotte has to offer. I've been here about 3 more times after 2012 and I have to say the improvement has been drastic. No wonder that Obama came here when he visited Charlotte.  This place was thought by my parents to try out, and well because of their dietary restriction/dietary preferences BBQ is always a sure winner. Something that serves fatty keto diet like options will always win them over. What won them over when it came to Midwood was the question: What type of cut would you like? Lean, Fatty, or medium?" Yep. That was it.   The past three times that I have been here, we've ordered the platter and just shared. We also got the jalapeño poppers which was always a treat, however be warned that the spiciness of the peppers can go either way. It could be a little spicy, or it could have a little more kick to it. I guess it just depends on whatever your tolerance is.  For the combo option, we ordered 2 briskets, ribs, and sausages with sides of jalapeño peppers and greens as those were always nice to have. And for a pig out feeding us all for $34, it's not a bad price and definitely should be looked at if you have multiple people with you or just two people eating. Service was pretty good, nothing to really say about that, we came during the afternoon so it wasn't horribly busy.  Check this place out, the BBQ is good, I would say stick to the briskets, ribs, and wings (if you're looking for chicken). I can't vouch for the pulled pork or the chopped chicken as I haven't had it in a while.
Really friendly, professional service. Check in with Yelp. Food excellent! Bathrooms have posters of hunks from days past. So fun & funny!

I've come to this new location twice so far as it is closer to my house. The first time was when they first opened the new location and the second time was last week. My friends and I all ordered the burger special, 2 cooked medium and 1 (medium rare). All of our burgers came out VERY well done. I was the only one who complained because I'm not paying that much for a hockey puck. They apologized and remade the burger,  but my poor friends had to drench their burgers in various sauces to make it somewhat palatable. The burger was alright, nothing special 7/10. Their customer service is top notch, but I'm not sure what is going on in the kitchen back there. My friends are now only willing to go back to the original location.

I had a craving for bbq and due to the strong yelp reviews I decided to give this place a try. I had the El Fuego tacos, hush puppies, mac and cheese, and the house slaw and it was a solid meal. The tacos are very original. I enjoyed to see a different take on a modern classic. The sides and pups were really good. I'll definitely be back to give the rest of the menu a try.

DELICIOUS! Stopped in here for our southern barbecue fix & we were not disappointed.  Everything we ate was fantastic & my husband claims this is the best barbecue he's ever eaten.  What a fantastic treat!
Enjoyed a great time with my coworkers! First time here, will definitely be back! I had the queso with brisket and pulled pork sandwich
The brisket was amazeballs!  So much flavor. And the service was spot on. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Charlotte.

I came here for dinner with family and we ordered the Queso with Pork, it was very delicious we ordered the small and it was plenty for the 6 of us. I ordered the well fed and had the ribs, chopped pork, pulled chicken and sausage. Everything was delicious! The Midwood original BBQ sauce was the best. The Mac and cheese was creamy, cheesy and sinful, the hush puppies were crunchy, savory and golden brown. My sister got the nachos and they had ample Amounts of smoked chicken, lots of Queso and plenty of fixins. We had the banana pudding for dessert and it was pleasantly sweet, creamy, perfect banana flavor and just enough for everyone. 4 stars only took one star off for the Cole slaw, it was not as sweet or Tangy as I would have liked.

Definitely my new favorite BBQ spot!! This was my first visit to Midwood & i joined a girlfriend for a night out! Our server Brian was just awesome! Being my first time he welcomed that & explained all the features & specials! He was so sweet , very attentive & always kept a smile on his face! We split an appetizer of the smoked wings & i will definitely be getting these again (along with the mustard base sauce)!!! We then split the carolina pork plate & had the bacon wrapped jalapeños as our side!! Sooooo good!!! Everything was just awesome! I'm looking forward to my next visit!!

We went here expecting greatness. In the end, there was a feeling of disappointment with the food being mediocre. Got the half rack of ribs with hush puppies. Hush puppies were small ball of floured cornmeal. Seemed to have a pretzel-like texture. Not really as soft and grainy as expected. The ribs were far below expectation. I make better ribs on my grill, with better flavor.  Rib tips were extra crispy and burnt.    I wouldn't come back here unless I needed to.  Service was excellent, by the way!    In addition, there was a creepy waitress who kept lingering around, standing way too close to me when taking orders and talking to us, and rushed us even though she said she wasn't.

So, I don't love bbq maybe as much as I should.  It's good, don't get me wrong...but that much meat at once just isn't my thing.  That being said, if you do love bbq this place is 5 stars for sure!  We went a few weeks ago and after a short wait were seated.  My husband and our friend each ordered a beer that was reasonably priced, I stuck to soda.  We then promptly ordered the pimento cheese fries as an appetizer because we're fat kids and they sounded delicious.  They arrived and bonus! were topped with delicious pulled pork.  I could have eaten just this as my dinner.  We chose some sort of meat and sides extravaganza that was more than enough for 3.  We chose the bacon wrapped jalapenos and mac and cheese as sides, both were excellent.  The meats were great too and the mustard based bbq sauce was by far my favorite.  If you're in plaza midwood and craving bbq, definitely make a stop here!

BBQ Pork Sandwich  Half Rack Ribs Sweet potato fries Hush puppies  ....order it. You literally can't go wrong with flavor like those. Each element was amazing and exciting to come back to. The BBQ sauce alone is amazing but so is literally everything else. You know the meat is prepared correctly when you can eat it on its own without a sauce but why not indulge if the sauce is there!? Call ahead seating is a dream, the reviews are real-we will definitely be going back.

Wow...this place is great! I found my new favorite bbq restaurant in Charlotte. Don't even know where to begin. Not only was all the food amazing, but so were their drinks. Awesome selection of whiskeys and craft beers. We ordered the pig out and added burnt ends. All the beats ere cooked perfectly with delicious sauces. I will be returning frequently.

Like the Midwood Smokehouse location in Plaza Midwood, this one in Ballantyne serves excellent BBQ with a diverse menu. Make no mistake, though, this is NOT authentic North Carolina BBQ.  FOOD: The menu is fairly diverse. I personally am not a fan of this at BBQ restaurants, but looking around at other tables, it seems like I'm in the minority. I have tried both the pulled pork and brisket (brisket is not real BBQ, but I digress...), and both are excellent. The burned ends are also very good. There is a decent selection of side dishes offered, and unlike many other BBQ places, Midwood Smokehouse does not upcharge for some. The dessert menu is fairly small (cobbler, banana pudding, and a dessert of the day), but the offerings are all excellent.  SERVICE: Not much to say here. The server was friendly, promptly refilled our drinks, and did not ask us 100 times how the food tastes. A+ for service.  PRICE: The pricing falls in line with 99% of other BBQ places. Expect to pay around $12 for a pork combo plate and $18 for a brisket combo plate. Considering that 80% of the plates are meat, I would say the prices are fair, especially since this is what almost all BBQ places in the Southeast charge.   Midwood Smokehouse is my favorite BBQ place in Charlotte. Is it authentic NC BBQ? Far from it, but the taste is great, and I will definitely return.

Whenever I eat BBQ, I always compare the place to Lexington BBQ (the restaurant). While Midwood Smokehouse does not top Lexington BBQ, it is (by far) the best in Charlotte. The problem with Charlotte BBQ is that most places are some weird hodgepodge of different BBQ styles that ends in some strange mess that does not even resemble real BBQ. Midwood Smokehouse certainly does a good job at executing BBQ with its own twist and fair prices to boot. I highly recommend.  EDIT: I highly recommend either coming early or getting takeout. Parking is VERY scarce and long lines form quickly.
Wonderful smoke house! The burnt brisket tips were amazing! Others in our party had smoked chicken, salmon, pork and sandwiches. Portions were good and don't forget the desserts!!

As depression set in that my favorite BBQ spot, Smoke Modern Barbecue had closed, I was just not going to visit Midtown.  Nope, not gonna do it.   It is not Midtown, it is Birkdale for crying out loud.  If I want Midtown, I go to Plaza-Midwood and hit up Midwood Smokehouse, I mean if its good   enough for Obama and her majesty Killary, it is good enough for this Yelpaholic.  That location always kills it.   Me likey!  So today, Friday afternoon, bored to tears and what sounds good, BBQ!   Wait, I am in Huntersville, traffic sucks - quick right into Birkdale.   So basically, as far as I can tell, it is the same setup, they moved the reception area, changed out the seating, but it is basically the same lay out.  Me likey!  Hey bartender, what, wait, your the same guy and chick from Smoke.  Sweet!   They can take care of a regular.    What they remember me, serve me up some fatty cut brisket and burnt ends.   Me likey!     Fatty cut brisket and burnt ends.  Fatty cut brisket and burnt ends. Fatty cut brisket and burnt ends. Fatty cut brisket and burnt ends. Fatty cut brisket and burnt ends. Fatty cut brisket and burnt ends. Fatty cut brisket and burnt ends.   Holy crap, I love this place, why o' god of Yelp did you keep me away so long.    Brisket with just enough fat to make it creamy delish.   Burnt ends with caramelized sauce on top of juicy fat morsels of delightfulness. Me likey!  Oh yeah, forgot.  The wife got the Midwood Chopped + pulled pork.  $11.   Folks, this is a large ass salad.   It is Yelp wife stamped of approval.   Score!  So good day in the Yelp solar system, the Yelp god's made the stars align into the perfect visit.    Did I say - Fatty cut brisket and burnt ends. Fatty cut brisket and burnt ends.   Yas please, bring more!
This is probably the best BBQ restaurant in Charlotte with great drinks!! Exceptional customer service.

Awful bar food.  I was hoping to get food made with love because this is a locally grown restaurant, but the food was on par with the last bowling alley bar I ate at.  I tried the fries topped with house made pimento cheese and brisket - the fries were frozen crinkle cut fries ala Orida grocery store style.  Brisket was dry and seemed to have been sitting under a heat lamp for a while.  This was one of those meals that I wish k had never eaten.

After my flight, I wanted some bbq because that is what the Carolina's is known for! Their beef brisket. So I came upon a few restaurants and I chose this one!   Located in a very cute area and with outdoor seating, midwood smokehouse was a cute little bbq place which serves a variety of BBQ items. We first ordered the fried pickles! Which comes with a dipping sauce of ranch dressing. The fried pickles had a distinct taste more salty than sour! But dipped in a side of ranch made it taste better!  I went for the beef brisket and a size (small) 6oz of meat, along with the Mac and cheese! While my bf chose the BBQ tips with two sides, grilled vegetables and the bacon wrapped jalapeño.   My beef brisket was juicy and good but the fan above our table just made my brisket cold immediately! So I had to eat quick! The Mac and cheese was good, came out bubbly and hot! I got to try some of my bf's BBQ beef tips and they were so dry! And hard to chew. It wasn't a good choice . The grilled vegetables quickly became cold and the only thing he liked on the plates were the bacon jalapeño!   Both our plates came with hush puppies too! And they were good, but I was so full from eating the brisket that I could only eat two of the hush puppies!

IMHO this is the best barbecue in Charlotte. Love the smoked turkey plate with smoked bacon wrapped jalapeños and creamed corn. Try the brisket they can do lean, fatty, or both, doesn't matter it's all awesome. Try the well fed combo if you're unsure what to get, its big enough to feed 3-4! The beer selection is great here!

Midwood Smokehouse seems to be the quintessential Urban Bro Restaurant.  Every big business town with lots of transplants has to have at least a few.    The large crowd on a nice Sunday evening was probably about 70 percent male, which sounds about right for a restaurant serving this much meat.  A sizeable minority of the clientele consisted of the following two Urban Bro subspecies:  (1) dudes wearing pressed khaki shorts with overly bright tucked-in polo shirts, loafers without socks, and snappy golf visors (looking like they just stepped off of a Southern college campus circa 1987), and (2) dudes wearing baggy athletic shorts, athletic sandals (with or without socks), and t-shirts with logos from athletic companies (looking like they'd just stepped off a college campus circa 2014).  There were also a small handful of heavily tatted-up goateed dudes with backward baseball caps and wife-beaters (looking like they were trying to channel Fred Durst circa 2001).    Everybody else looked pretty much like normal adults.  To pull in the Urban Bro demographic, Midwood Smokehouse has even more giant TVs than average--most tuned to tuned to sports, of course--than the average meat-centric restaurant.  (But to confirm that we were in a sophisticated urban environment, and not some exurban barnyard, the TVs tuned to all-news showed vanilla CNN rather than Fox News!)  There is also an unwritten Midwood Smokehouse rule that any dude having a beer and/or BBQ solo at the bar, or waiting for a take-out order, is required to have his attention glued to a smartphone at almost all times, with small breaks allowed to eat food or catch golf action on the nearest giant TV.  The music?  Classic rock.  (What else would be possible to balance the various Urban Bro demographic subgroups?)  Besides the social anthropological amusement, Midwood Smokehouse serves up good food, too.  Chopped pork was certainly better than average, although not in the same league as the whole-hog stuff you can get in some small towns in this state.  Frankly, it was a bit salty, and the pork flavor just wasn't all that bold.  (Before you blast somebody with an Ohio address for even daring to talk about NC BBQ, I present the following defense:  I was born in NC, my dad's family is still anchored in this state, and both sides of my wife's family hail from this state.  But at the same time, I don't pretend to be any kind of BBQ expert.  I only justify my right to opine.)  Before we left, I got the impression that the burnt ends are what you get here, but they were sold out when we got there.    More impressive were the sides, which are just an afterthought at too many BBQ places everywhere.  Smoked veggies are a nice idea, and the collard greens were just the way I like them:  leafy, not overcooked, and suffused with plenty of smoky meat flavor.  Because this is a big urban restaurant, serving only BBQ won't do:  The menu also features burgers, sandwiches, salads, tacos, and more.  Decent selection of draft beer, too.  A word to the wise:  The $13 large BBQ plate might sound expensive at first glance, but it is a very generous portion of food.  You probably don't need to go that way, unless you're very large and/or haven't eaten all day.

the ribs and the brisket were KILLER. my goodness, we had a variety plate and I wish I would have only ordered ribs. The sides were also flavorful, and I appreciated the variety in sauces available. The brisket fell apart en route from the platter to my plate...that is how tender it was. I was pleased with this stop and would come back again.
I'm not a beef fan but I tore up some brisket for the first time and would do it again happily

The best BBQ I have had hands down. We use to live in the University area and we ate here all the time, but we moved to the other side of town and don't get here as often as we would like. So I was over here this week doing Father's Day shopping for my husband when I realize exactly where I was. I called my husband to get his order and made a quick beeline to the restaurant. Place our order and within 10-15 mins I was out the door. Now the hard part was driving from central ave to ballentyne with that great smelling flavor playing with my nose was the hardest part and often wanted to sneak in the bag and grab something out, but I didn't want anything unless I had the entire thing, so I waited.   Once I got home I don't remember taking the keys out the car because I was so excited about mid wood BBQ. When I took my first bit I almost slapped my husband because it was so good (joking) but it was good. It was just how remembered. On this round my husband got the wings app with Mac and cheese and collard, all that were great, and I got the pulled pork with collards, with was great.  I have had everything here and I recommend everything. Smoked sausage, wings brisket, pull pork everything is phenomenal.

Just needed some good food so saw this had a lot of good reviews and was nearby.  Not a very large place and parking isn't plentiful in the immediate area, but don't let that detour you from stopping in.  You can start smelling the smoke doing its work before you even enter.  Walked in at 7:30 on a Wednesday and it was crowded but were able to get seated right away at a table but decided to sit at the bar instead.  Decent beer selection and heavy on the local breweries.  Split appetizer of the pimento cheese fries, no meat on it as we didn't want to fill up, but it was a lot and excellent.  Added a little hot sauce for a kick made these even better.  Split a 3 taco plate, one chicken and two pork BBQ, liked the pork but the chicken was outstanding.  Also shared a side of the smoked veggies and collards that were both very good.  They make their own pepper vinegar and it is good on everything, especially the greens.  Would recommend but it is a BBQ place, expect to walk out with a hint of that great smoke aroma with you so keep in mind what you are doing after.

I very rarely give out a 5 Star review. Coming from Colorado, our BBQ options are limited. As a NC native, I know what good BBQ is. On our recent trip back to NC, we had it in our plans to find a really good BBQ place and I think we did. While this restaurant may not be approved of by the purists who think good BBQ only comes from a busted old building with linoleum floors, plastic trays and a ceiling fan, it's approved of by me and my family. Nice decor and televisions to watch various sporting events are a bonus. The prices were very competitive. We tried the brisket, pulled pork, ribs, burnt ends and sausage along with sides of bacon wrapped jalapeños, collard greens and hushpuppies. Everything we had was excellent. The brisket and ribs were up there with the best I have ever had. The sausage had killer flavor. The side items were solid, with the collard greens being the best I've hand, bar none. If I lived locally, I'm afraid of how often I would go to Midwood. Thank you for fulfilling our family's goal of getting good, wood smoked BBQ on our trip.

Great BBQ with very good sides and sauces. We had the combo platter for two. I was a fan of the smoked chicken wings. I Love the ribs and sausage. The combo comes with 4 meats and 2 sides. We had brisket, pulled pork, sausage and ribs. Sides mac and cheese and really good beans ! Platter also comes with pickled onions and hush puppies. I ordered a side of slaw.  My daughter ordered the burnt ends (brisket) with collard greens. All the food was pretty damn good. The meats had great smoke flavor. I would go with the chicken and ribs. The pulled pork and brisket were good but not the best I have had. All the sauces, sides and fixings were awesome. I recomend this location.
In my opinion, best BBQ in Charlotte.  If you need some chow, go here.

The brisket is on point! Best ever. Make sure to ask for the spicy sauce (it's in the back) the general manager is customer focused always out walking around asking customers about their experience and helping the staff.

The burnt ends are legendary. I had never heard of anything like it and I've lived in the South my entire life, but it's sooo good. The hush puppies are also amazing. Definitely a restaurant that you have to eat at if you live in Charlotte.

Can't believe I've never reviewed this place because I've been here so many times in the two years I've lived in Charlotte.  Nothing too crazy here just great BBQ.  I want to say it's the best in Charlotte but I haven't been to that many BBQ spots in Charlotte. It's a lot better than Mac's no master what anyone tells you but I do wish they had a better selection of sauces.  The sauces they have are good but they are more about the meat and less about sauce here.  I've had the pulled pork, ribs, and burnt ends and all were fantastic. Can't wait to go back soon!
Yep. Real BBQ, solid beer selection and professional service. Best BBQ I have had in the Southeast. Their brisket is as good as any I've had in Texas and Oklahoma.

Expected more from this place, given the really high ratings. Service was good, but not great. When asking about cocktails, we got a lecture about which drinks a man could order, and which ones a woman could order. What? We got a platter to share with a variety of BBQ meat and tried a bit of everything. Everything was reasonably tasty, but nothing stood out. Head up to Lexington for MUCH better pulled/chopped pork, or find superior brisket/ribs in the Triangle or out in TN/Midwest. If this is the best Charlotte has to offer for BBQ, I'm left seriously unimpressed.
Can you say FOOD POISONING? OMG last Friday 04/18/2014 we decided to go there for the first time, the service, food and atmosphere was awful. Never would I suggest this place!

The meat was amazingly tender. I got the giant beef rib and my bf got the pig out platter. We got a lot of meat and it was all fall of fthe bone tender. Even the burnt tips were tender which was amazing and you could definitely taste the bourbon they used in the sauce for it. Even though it wasn't the most flavorful bbq I've ever had it still acquitted itself admirably. The pork brisket was also amazing. Total came out to be around $60, about $30-$25 for each dish + tax&tip.   There is parking in the back and this place is a pokestop haha. Be careful coming on weekend nights though because the line can get pretty long.

Went for lunch today. 1st time this location. The food was absolutely great. I had the large Brisket plate and I was quite pleased not only with the quality but also the quantity. "Almost" to much  My lunch date had a half rack ofnDry Rub ribs.  Again very good. Very good greens. The pepper vinegar has a bit of heat to it be careful. Glad the meat had such great taste because their sauces are OK.      Our only negative was the way the waitress seemed to serve us. She never seemed to slow down,  even to ask how things are,  she said it moving. But what was really off was that she put down the check long before we even saw the food. It made us feel like,  OK Pay,  Eat and Go.  Not very inviting. But the Brisket was really good.

In Charlotte for one night and decided to hit up this restaurant...  The service and atmosphere is awesome!  I'll be adding this place to one of my go to places whenever I'm in town.   The smokey chicken wings are some of the best around,  especially when combined with the in-house harbenero sauce!!!  The banana pudding was like eating whipped butter!
The best bbq in town. Our server drew was awesome. Carolina pork + mac + bacon wrapped jalapeños!!!!

We loved our meal here! My husband had the brisket with the bacon wrapped jalapeños on the side and said it was all fantastic. He also had the Hangary Bloody Mary to drink which he said was amazing. It comes with two smoked chicken wings and one bacon wrapped jalapeño on a stick in the drink. Very unusual but very cool! I had the pulled pork sandwich with the BBQ beans; the beans are amazingly yummy! The Hush Puppies are excellent here as well! Highly recommend!!

First time here and it was pretty great. The service was awesome and quick, place was clean and comfortable.  I'm not a BBQ aficionado so I can't really comment on how great the BBQ was in comparison to other people, but I did really enjoy it.

Midwood did not disappoint.  My buddy and I saddled up at the bar on a Wednesday evening and were immediately greeted by the bartender.  She promptly took our drink order and offered suggestions for dinner.  I opted for the "well-fed" combo platter - Carolina Chopped Pork, Beef Brisket, St. Louis style Pork Ribs, and Pulled Chicken with mac & cheese and smoked veggies on the side.  The portions were HUGE.  Everything was prepared to perfection and did not disappoint.  The meats were tender and flavorful.  Sides were more than satisfying.  Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

I have mixed feelings about this place. It has a cool vibe and the smoky smell as you walk in is exactly what you want in a barbecue place. Hubby is a true carnivore and was thrilled with the 4 meat combo plate, but...the service was not great and the sides left something to be desired. We started with the smoked wings as an appetizer. They were tasty but REALLY small. Hubby's 4 meat combo had ribs, pulled pork, sausage and brisket. His sides were fries and bacon wrapped jalapeños and he added an order of burnt ends. He loved all of the meats and the portion sizes are good. He's a big guy and almost went for the "pig out" portion, but opted for the "well fed" instead because of the appetizer and additional burnt ends, and wasn't able to finish all of it. He didn't even get to the sides, but he couldn't have cared less...it's all about the meat. I ordered the half chicken (all white meat) and for my sides, mac and cheese and collard greens. My chicken was good, but even though I asked, and the server repeated it to me, I did not get all white meat. I am a sides kinda girl, so I was disappointed in my mac and cheese and greens. I make them better at home. We also asked for an order of Texas toast when we ordered, which did not come out with the food. When we asked about it, they brought it, but it was unusual as it was sourdough bread and it wasn't buttered well. On top of not getting my chicken right and not getting the toast that we ordered with our food, my drink was empty when the server came to the table and she didn't notice. I had to ask for a refill. I will say she was very friendly and knowledgeable about the restaurant and the menu, but not very attentive to the details.

I ordered the "Well Fed" combo plate with brisket, sausage, pulled pork, and burn ends. (Which they substituted since they were out of ribs). I really enjoyed it.  The sides of Mac and cheese and beans were tasty as well.  The service was excellent. Plenty of TV playing a variety of programs. I thought the music was a bit loud, but that wasn't a big deal.  I plan on making a trip back before I head home to Texas.

Went there last night at the Ballantyne location for the first time--with out of town guest.  First the water tasted very funny--the waitress told us a number of other tables complained as well.  It is very unusual that a restaurant has bad tasting water!!  They had to bring the water to our table three times--not a good start!  We order the beef brisket and the tacos off the money.  All entrees were unmemorable.  Something we would not go back for.  At the end we all said we should have gone to the Hickory Tavern instead.  Place is crowded now, but I'm sure the crowds will drop off once the 'newness" wears off.

Probably the best BBQ in Charlotte. I know that is not really saying much seeings that BBQ in Charlotte is known for being mediocre at best, but if you are craving BBQ, and you are in charlotte, this is the best spot period.  Service is always great, food always comes out quick, and the beer is always ice cold.   I suggest getting the bacon wrapped jalapeños. Matter fact order yourself two orders of 'em and thank me later. As for the cheerwine burnt ends, I think they miss the mark, but I know people who love them. I also don't much care for the mac and cheese here, reminds me of grade school when you got the rubbery over cooked underseasoned mac and cheese with the skin on it from the lunch lady who looked like Chris Farley in a hair net, but hey, maybe that's just me. I will say if you dump some of the BBQ sauce into the mac and cheese, it defiantly churches it up a bit and makes it palatable.   This maybe the best BBQ in Charlotte, but I don't believe they have the best sauces in my personal opinion but they are a close 2nd. I'll take good BBQ with an average sauce over bad BBQ with great sauce any day.

Bacon        Wrapped.............. Jalapenos!  WOW  Besides loving the location of this place and the decor, the food is downright impressive!  I will never go to Mac's again.  Great drink specials and great prices on entrees.  This is as good as it gets in Charlotte.  The pulled pork was savory and moist-didn't even need sauce, and this is coming from the condiment queen!  I usually never order chicken because they are usually dried out, but I could really taste the smokey flavor come out-almost as much as the pulled pork.  This was my first visit and I will absolutely be returning!  My only complaint is that the mac and cheese could be more cheesy...just sayin...  still good though!

This is the best place for BBQ beef brisket...seriously, I have tried almost everyplace in Charlotte. Sooo juicy and tender, nice smoked taste. Every time I try another place Im disappointed because its never as good as this pllace
Great barbecue!!! Bacon wrapped jalapeno's are awesome! Great brisket! Lots of good beer too!

Great BBQ place in Charlotte. Very close to downtown, the location was convenient and in an up and coming area. I had the BBQ combo, chicken and St. Louis style ribs. Both were excellent. The ribs were done perfectly and had a great authentic smoked flavor. The mac and cheese was one of the best I've ever had, I would come back just for it.  There was a good beer selection, with several local options to try. Overall, great casual spot for BBQ.

This place smells good as ignites your taste buds as soon as you step out of the car. It's that heavenly smell that makes you want to order everything on the menu! Definitely get the fatty brisket and the pork ribs. Burnt ends sound better than they turned out. The combo is a good deal because you get to try 4 items. Easily shared between 2-3 people!  Stop by if you are in the Charlotte area for ANYTHING! They come out with a plate of sauces that are suggested for each of the meats that you order and most of them are DELICIOUS! Restaurant was very full and the tables were very close together.   We sat outside on the covered patio and it was perfect.
This is a great place for BBQ especially the burnt ends brisket. Also know to me as outside cut. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Ate here with a group of 8. Everything was very good, from the appetizers to the drinks and, of course, the bbq. They had some inventive creations as well, including the cheerwine rib tips. A little sweet for my liking, but nice to see a creative rib place. Nice selection of cocktails as well. Good ambiance and also has a large bar area for watching games

Let's be honest - I have only had the brisket and the burnt ends. But they keep me full, happy, and coming back for more.  This Ballantyne location has done very well. The staff is friendly, the food is hot and consistently good. The mac and cheese is amazing too - some days I could just get a whole plate of that and fade happily into a food coma.   The restaurant is set up with a bar towards the front, so you don't feel awkward buzzing past the host stand to get to the bar. There are tables and booths everywhere, and they even have a little patio outside. They've made this into a very comfortable, casual place to come and have dinner. You could come with the family, or grab drinks with a date. You could even take food to go - but I guess that depends on how the date is going - haha!  I had friends in town from PA, and we saw the burnt ends on the list of "50 things to eat in Charlotte before you die". They weren't kidding. These are incredibly good - and most of their food pairs beautifully with the NC craft beers that they have on draught. Eventually I think I'll branch out to the other food items on the menu, but for now these choices are plenty.

I have been blown away with the quick response of the management team at this location. After my mishap, I have had two people from this business contact me to apologize for the little situation. I admire that as a customer I am being taken care and felt they care for me.  I will definitely be back!
Great food, great service!!!  Gabby set us up perfectly. She even brought a water bowl for our sweet puppy Pi.  Just a happy Place to be. Thank you!!

The Good News: Authentic BBQ smell, tasty menu, prompt and friendly service.  The Bad News: Totally generic  atmosphere and the music is loud and the worst selection of 80s rock  I've ever heard. It felt more like a chain restaurant than a local joint.

BBQ doesn't get any better than this! I hit the jackpot when I found Midwood on Yelp during a work trip in Charlotte. I wanted some serious NC bbq eating and I got it here. I ordered the brisket platter and my colleague got the burnt ends. We ordered mac n cheese, collard greens, and hushpuppies. We went all out and ordered the chicken wings with midwood sauce. It was heavenly. These wings were cooked and smoked then covered with yummy sauce. I'm not sure why wings are always made this way. The main courses were perfect. So tender and the sauce was perfectly executed. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is really nice. Our waitress knew the menu front and back and was a real help.  I really need to go back to Charlotte just to eat at Midwood.

This place used to be my favorite barbecue place in Charlotte. The one off of Central is better than the one in Ballantyne. The sausage is great. The burnt ends are delicious I was suggest burnt ends over the sausage. The crinkle fries are wonderful and the greens are delicious. The vibes on the central restaurant are great.

So whether you plan on going to Midwood Smokehouse for the first time or fiftieth time, here's my take on a few things:  Parking - there's a larger lot in the back of Midwood. Hopefully, you luck up and are able to have ample spots to choose from. If not, street parking is available. Yup, parking sucks in this particular area of Plaza during peak hours, it is what is.  Food - you want to start off with some apps? Go for the pimento cheese fries (with brisket). Generally, I am not a fan of pimento cheese, but I will gobble these cheese fries right up. Also, order some bacon wrapped jalapenos simply because you must (personally, I'd ask for them to cook them just a little longer than normal).  -Midwood chopped salad (with pork or chicken). Yes, I go to a BBQ place and order a salad because it's really good. In fact, it's my favorite salad in all of Charlotte. The small portion is quite large enough for me.  -As for actual BBQ, go for the pulled pork and/or smoked wings. On a recent visit, I learned there's Midwood sauce so make sure you ask for some of that as well.  There are ample reasons why this place is consistently busy (I just listed a handful above) but they get right down to serving really good food in a friendly and fast manner.

Came here for dinner while visiting a friend- great place to grab some barbecue take-out. We chose to avoid a sit-down because it was crowded and loud. The Carolina pulled pork is great- light vinegary sauce packed on the side so you could put it on later. Hush puppies were good too. The Mac and cheese was thick and creamy and the noodles were cooked just right- not mushy like some places. Husband had the tacos and loved them! Our friends are regulars here and we know why!

I am eating lunch here right now and had to stop to write this review. The Cuban is phenomenal and it is on its way to become my new favorite sandwich in Charlotte. Paired with some nice golden fries makes it a truly delectable dish. Definitely coming back!!!

Lunch, 6/2/14, seated immediately, friendly and knowledgeable hostess. I am an Eastern Style NC aficionado, having eaten it all my life. Others at the table did not have this bias. [g]  Of the items I tried, I'll make comment. Ice tea rather bitter and watery, $2.00. Tasting the sauces -- 5 of them -- was great. I don't know if this is offered to every new customer but it should be. The one with the Habernero was my favorite and really well balanced. The Eastern style sauce was good, actually very good, but just a tiny bit on the sweet side (as Bob Garner said). But seriously, ask for the sauce tasting if you don't get it; they arrive steaming hot.  Stars of the show: The fatty brisket. You must request it well marbled, and it beats anything I ever had in two driving trips across Texas. Next in line would be the ribs. Request them without sauce and use the sauce tray you earlier requested. They were moist, tender, and not too much char. Third star was the sausage. It's a rather sophisticated blend with a natural casing; they don't grind it there but they smoke it there.  The hush puppies are fine, though probably started out as a mix. On this day, the macaroni and cheese was just too dry and one dimensional; I would not order it again. The collards were great, without as much grease as my grandma used.  I do not recommend the fine chopped pork. The flavor is not quite there and the chop is too fine for my taste, but I've met old barbeque masters who prefer it that way. The vinegar/pepper sauce wakes it up for sure. I asked about banana pudding and was told that they use the old time method with Nilla Vanilla Wafers; that's something to try next time.

This was my first visit to Norwood Smokehouse, and it will not be my last. Shantel was our server, and she was excellent. I decided to try a few new things: Burnt Ends (of bee brisket), Smoked Vegetables, and their Collard Greens. I can not properly describe how delicious the Burnt Ends are! I really could eat just them for the rest of my life and be eternally happy. The Smoked Vegetables did not disappoint -- yummy!  The Collard Greens were the way I like them as they did not contain too much vinegar; however, for those that enjoy more Shantel did offer me vinegar if I had wanted more. Everyone at the table was really pleased with their meals. Norwood Smokehouse is definitely on my local favorites list. Enjoy!
This is my favorite BBQ spot in Charlotte.   Being from SC I was happy that they offered a South Carolina mustard for their dishes as well.

Just want to start by saying that the service is excellent. Our waiter Matt was exceptional and knew what he was doing.  The food is great, the beef brisket being my favorite. The pork ribs are also tasty but the chicken is just okay. Jalapeño wrapped in bacon and the baked beans are the better sides.  Will be back for sure next time I'm in Charlotte.

How have I never been here before??  We went to Midwood on a Wednesday night at 8 p.m. and were greeted and seated immediately.  We were in a bit of wind tunnel because the overhead fans were on full blast.  I then  realized that was a good thing; since they actually smoke the meat, the fans help circulate the declicious smell.  We wanted to try everything, so we split a Well-Fed Combo Platter and got the pulled pork, beef brisket, ribs and hickory smoked sausage.  (I can't imagine how many people the Pig Out size would feed!)  It came with three sauces: mustard, vinegar and the tomato-based Midwood sauce.  The pork and sausage were great, but fairly standard; the brisket and ribs were phenomenal. The ribs fell off the bone, and the brisket was tender enough to cut with a fork.  We also got mac & cheese (great) and bacon-wrapped jalapenos (just ok).  Our server was very attentive and fun, and we rolled out of there miserably, happily full.

Bbq is everywhere in the Carolinas. However, what I tried at Midwood Smokehouse stood out! I recommend going with the sampler platter and trying it all with a partner. The best meats were the ribs and brisket. Normally ribs at restaurants are grey bland meat, but these ribs were full of flavor and very meaty. Good selection of beers and cocktails.

This place smells good as soon as you pull into the parking lot. I have always wanted to try real north Carolina BBQ on my many trips passing thru NC . This being my first time staying in Charlotte my girlfriend searched and found Midwood. We had a combo that was delicious and fried pickles for appetizer (you don't see that in NY). The staff was friendly and the prices were very reasonable.

Great find just off Route I77. It will be a regular stop on out travels. Such a friendly experience. Workers hustling all over the place. Fast service, awesome BBQ. The Burnt Ends were my favorite. Great Briquet, Mac n Cheese. We own 5 Big Green Eggs and do lots of BBQ  but learned something today about southern cooking.  Try the spicy Habanero sauce...it was the best.

We are big fans of Big Daddys burgers so when I heard that their owner opened a BBQ place, we were eager to try it.  In a nutshell, It was fantastic and reasonably priced.  Our kids loved the ribs, and sweet potato fries.  My wife thought her salad was amazing, and I loved the Half Chicken with the combination of sauces.  Finally, we have a great BBQ place in Charlotte!!
This is a great low key place to go and enjoy awesome BBQ. All of the food is great. The staff is friendly, and the food always comes out fast!
This place is amazing, best bbq in North Carolina!! Highly recommend! The Brisket is top notch!!

Violet - VIOlet - VIOLET was awesome! We have been in Charlotte 48 hours and everyone has been nice but Violet understands her customers, is very attentive, and made the perfect recommendations for our food! Wings (dip in Habernera BBQ sauce! Result = Great! We visited 6 Bars yesterday and had every intention on doing the same tonight but VIOLET! Not only her but the kitchen staff made great wings, Management frequently asked how we were, and the Locals have been fantastic! This place has AMBIANCE man!!
Every thing we are here was outstanding.  The brisket is the best I have ever had.  Friendly service, fun atmosphere.

Some of the best BBQ in the area.  I lived across the street and ate a whooole lot of BBQ during that time. I would recommend everything on the menu, particularly the bacon-wrapped jalapenos, baked beans and pork.
Consistently good food and service  Burnt ends are great.

This place is located about 2.0 miles from the heart of downtown Charlotte. I'm not a huge BBQ fan but was in the mood for some on this day. We waited for about 35-40min on a Saturday night. This place is a very busy place and loud on the inside. Our server told us that their popular dishes are the Carolina pulled pork and beef brisket. He emphasized that the burnt ends entree is one of their best sellers. With that being said, I opted to try it. I started out with their chopped salad as my appetizer. Easily one of the best salads I'd ever had. Very simple but loaded with flavor. Get the green goddess dressing on it. The salad has chopped cucumber, black beans, corn etc in it and it's topped with fresh avocado. My entree was ok. The burnt ends were salty to me and the flavor of "charred" ends was overwhelming. I would get their regular beef brisket next time, as I am sure it is delicious. My sides were wonderful. I had their smoked vegetables and collard greens! Their hush puppies were really good! Despite my experience with the burnt ends, I think this establishment offers wonderful BBQ food, if you want some good ole southern BBQ! I would definitely return.

Omg...everything was amazing.  Between two of us we had pulled pork, sweet potatoe fries, mac and cheese, brisket taco, and pulled chicken taco. Everything was amazing.  Even the sweet potato fries,  which are almost always good,  were perfection. Tacos were amazing with just the right amount of spice. Accompanying slaw was excellent and unusual.  Pulled pork was taken to new levels with their pickled onions and pepper vinegar.  Yum.

So me and KB the largest leprechaun were in Charlotte this week and we wanted to hit up an authentic barbecue joint to find out what this North Carolina barbecue was all about.  we decided on Midwood largely because to get four stars across 290 reviews with yelp is an accomplishment.  For me it's all about the food yeah the ambience is really nice and when I arrived I was pleased to find the corrugated sign out front with the flying pig I mean how bad can it be.  We started our meal with the stuffed jalapeno wrapped in bacon and as far as they were concerned definitely very spicy very moist very cheesy and the bacon was crispy so I'll put those at the top of the list is the best jalapeño I ever had.  Both KB The largest leprechaun and I ordered the combo plate.  I opted for the brisket smoked sausage chicken and St. Louis ribs.  I decided to order the ribs dry because if I wanted them wet i could always add sauce.   For my size I ordered the coleslaw and the mac & cheese.    I like to start with the good stuff so let's just say it was the best mac & cheese I've ever had. The brisket was moist and the ribs were above average.   The smoke sausage was sausage it's pretty much always going to be good.   I could tell KB liked cause he ate everything on his plate and it was Eyeing some of my plate as well.  My minor complaints where the pulled chicken I think they include too much of the white meat and/or if it happens to be yesterday's chicken.   I would just skip it.  And I'm not used to the way they serve cole slaw in the south it looked like it was put in a food processor just not my thing.    The beer selection is nice.  And the service was very good.  Only mix up with what type of dessert we wanted we ordered the bread pudding were served the banana pudding I think the waiter was hungry and really wanted the banana pudding. It was very good. The reason we don't get five stars because even though there was some serious highlights the jalapeno poppers and the mac & cheese the barbecue was very good but not the best ever.

We had never been here. Service was great and the food was excellent! Asked the waitress what was popular. She recommended the Abilene brisket sandwich. Not to mention the Classic Bloody Mary was delicious! Great choice! We will go again!

Couldn't visit the South without have some good southern BBQ!  BF and I visited here because of a recommendation from work.  We came here on a Tuesday night and were seated right away.  This place has a bar area and a restaurant area, and we were seated in the restaurant.  Looks like there is an upstairs and patio too which I guess they open on weekends.  The place was about 3/4 full the whole time we were there.   BF and I shared the "Pig Out" combo platter ($31) where you can choose 4 meats.  We chose ribs, brisket, chicken, and chopped pork.  It comes with their infamous hushpuppies, and we chose mac n cheese, bacon wrapped jalapenos, and Texas toast as our sides.  It also came with 4 different BBQ sauces: South Carolina Mustard, Vinegar, Midwood Signature & Spicy Habanero.  I liked the spicy a lot actually, but it's not even spicy; it has just the right amount of kick.  Signature is the runner up, followed by the vinegar, and finally the mustard, which i didn't care for much.  The food itself was delicious although the chicken was kind of dry.  The sauces went with the meats well, and the Texas Toast was the cherry on top.  I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone whose looking for good Southern BBQ.

This was my first time at Midwood Smokehouse and honestly I don't think there's anything special about the food. Our service on the other hand was outstanding. My boyfriend ordered the Carolina pork which he couldn't even eat because the after taste was terrible. The waitress then told us that the after taste was probably the vinegar that was in the pork. We hate to make any trouble but we just couldn't stand the taste of it. She nicely offered to take it back and get us something else. My boyfriend then ordered the burnt ends. He liked it much more than the Carolina pork but still it wasn't that great. As for me, I got the 1/2 chicken. The only pro was that the serving was huge but I was disappointed that the chicken barely had any flavor. I had to constantly put salt and black pepper on it just for it to taste ok. The cream corn had a weird taste to it and I just didn't care much for the collard greens. The only thing I probably enjoyed was the hush puppies. I didn't want to cause more trouble than we already have so I just tried to eat what I could.  Even though the food wasn't great, I'm giving this place a three star for their service. They took the food back with no trouble and constantly checked up on us. Everyone was very nice and our waitress was very understanding.   To conclude this, I probably won't be back just because the food was mediocre. But thank you to Midwood Smokehouse for the great customer service!

Ugh so disappointing. The other Midwood got such great reviews and I had my expectations set so high for this one, clearly too high. It's been open for a month or so now, but I haven't been since yesterday. I was really excited to get some good barbecue and went to Midwood with a friend on a Sunday afternoon.  The inside of the place looks great. Lots of wood colors that you'd expect at a barbecue place and a good amount of TVs. The bar even had power sockets which is a fantastic touch.   I got a half rack of ribs with the dry seasoning (per the waitress's advice, usually I go with wet ribs) and hushpuppies on the side. The food came out quickly, and the ribs looked delicious from the outside. The best ribs should be able to be eaten with a fork and no knife at all. These ribs did not pass the test. Lots of the meat was very tough and required heavy knife and mouth work to get it off. Not good. The taste was average. I didn't love the dry rub, but the sauce it came with was excellent. The hushpuppies were fantastic--not too heavy or buttery.  Our waitress was pleasant but really nothing more, maybe a little bit rushed. I wouldn't be running back to Midwood, but it would do in a pinch.

Stopped in Charlotte for a night on the way back from Georgia. My wife recommended this place based on it's Yelp rating and the fact she knew I was jonesing for BBQ while in the south. We ended-up splitting a BBQ platter that included ribs, Cheerwine (soda) burnt ends, pulled pork and brisket; sides included mac-n-cheese, collard greens, hush puppies and coleslaw. I also ordered banana pudding to-go because I can't pass it up when eating BBQ. While I only had one, the beer selection was great and very local, which was exactly what I was looking for.   They also have tacos. I didn't order them, but it seems strange and worth mentioning.  The ribs were amazing. They were a little saltier than I've ever had and I still can't discern wither that helps or hurts them. Everything else was really good, but not great. The coleslaw and hush puppies were almost tasteless. There was a lot of mediocrity here, but I'm giving 4 stars based on the ribs, banana pudding and beer selection.

Be ready to wait in line but the food is great. The bacon wrapped jalapeno's are so good and the Cuban sandwich is one of my favorite things on the menu.  I love the crispy ends brisket but they were about 2/3 fat when I ordered take out and was a bit disappointed. It is a fun restaurant with slightly challenging parking but that is to be expected in that area.

The reviews on yelp & confirmation from the hotel employees brought me here - and they didn't steer me wrong. This place is a gem!  So many items on the menu caught my eye, but I decided to get tacos to try 3 meat options & that were amazing. I ordered the brisket, pork & special taco of the day made from pulled ribs.  Service was great from the hostess to waitress (Mindy) & management staff. Mindy was so patient, attentive and gave great recommendations. I felt more like I visited my good friend's house than a restaurant.  Will definitely return on my next trip to Charlotte!

Good bbq! The burnt ends were delicious and the coleslaw and hushpuppies were great. The ribs were a bit over cooked and dried out but still had great flavor. The bacon wrapped jalepanos were good but the bacon could have been cooked a bit longer. Mac and cheese was good too. Skipped the smoked vegetables - those were no good.

OMG!!!! I can NOT believe what I just witnessed at this location. I was waiting for my take out order to be completed and I happened to look over and witness one of their server's take a shot of whiskey or tequila which ok none of my business but apparently that wasn't enough for her alcoholic ass  so she proceeds to open up a straw and stick it in her table's drink and pull it out to taste, now luckily she did not go back in for seconds, but nonetheless, she was blatantly stealing from the restaurant which btw ends up costing you and I because that loss has to be made up. But this was at their bar counter on the backside in plain site so my deepest concern is what is she doing in the back as she goes back there to grab our food. I'm going to go out on a limb and say she's taste tested some of our food along with our drinks. The most troublesome thing is not knowing whether she has hepatitis or herpes, or anything we as customers can contract from her nasty habits. It is of the upmost importance that we all done in a safe and clean establishment and are not put at risk because Erik the manager felt a warning would be sufficient with dealing with, theft since she didn't pay for the drink and if she did why is she drinking on the job? I'm sure ABC would like to know how they are working within the limits of the law when it comes to drinking on the job.
1. Bacon wrapped jalapenos 2. The little crunchy pieces of ice 3. Awesome local brews on tap  Do you really need to know more??

I love BBQ and am very critical of it.   I was in town for a short trip, and tried this place due to the reviews.   I have to concur, this is pretty good Q.  I tried the special that was written on the glass - stack of ribs - for 9$.   For that, I think I got 7 or 8 short meaty pork ribs with a honey glaze.  Not what I am used to as far as the sauce, but great flavor, cooked right,  and nicely presented (ribs were neatly stacked up).  Had collard greens and they were delicious.   The only negative, I wasn't hungry enough to try one of the combo plates (since there were plenty of warnings that it was a lot of food).   Nice place, nice atmosphere, and very good Q.  I rate 4 stars only because I wasn't able to sample enough of their foods.
Had CJ as a waiter. He was great and helpful. The BBQ was smoky with great bark. Sides and sauces were unreal. Will be back each time we come to Charlotte.

Food was ok. We started with fried pickles and the bacon wrapped peppers. Both were tasty. My table ordered everything from ribs to chicken to burnt ends. The meat was ok. It's not the most mouthwatering BBQ  I've ever had, but it was fine. I think everything could've use a dash more of seasoning. I'd eat here again, but will still be looking for excellent BBQ inside the city limits.

Delicious with good service and a great patio situation should it be busy inside. But the parking is not fun. Did I mention the food is delicious? There is only one other place in Charlotte that I have had BBQ that can compete with Midwood Smokehouse...and I will gladly keep comparing to see which is best lol

Just within a few hours of my arrival to Charlotte, I received a few strong recommendations to try out Midwood Smokehouse, so obviously I had to check it out.   Pimento Cheese Fries: Large dish of fries piled high with a generous amount of melted cheese on top with pork. How can you possibly go wrong with ordering this dish? It was absolutely delicious and addictive, a dangerous combination. Highly recommend this dish.  Burnt Ends with side of bacon wrapped jalapenos, hushpuppies and pickled onions: Brisket was on the dry side and a bit difficult to chew. Did not have enough bbq sauce on it. The texture of the jalapenos were too soft/soggy and nothing special--just literally jalapenos wrapped with bacon with no seasoning or flavors that I tasted. Hushpuppies were good and the pickled onions were a necessity to balance out the meat. Not my first choice to recommend.  Half Rack of ribs with sauce: Again, the pork was dry, but it did taste good though.  I'm no bbq specialist, but I think I had my fair share of very good bbq. Overall, I found this place alright. The service was excellent.

Our first time out for a dinner meeting. Won't be the last. Outstanding, friendly service and delicious BBQ. When I asked for a Pilsner or some kind of light beer option, the waitress was beer-savvy and gave great recommendations, too. Looking forward to returning and trying more of the wide variety of food options.
The pulled pork is amazing. The East Carolina sauce is the best. The Hush Puppies are perfect. I didn't eat here, I actually had the leftovers after a plane ride and it was still so good!

For a smokehouse, these prices are pretty good for what you get! We went around lunch time and our waiter was Tobias. He was super friendly and very knowledgeable on the menu. We had the pimento cheese fries as an app. If you love pimento cheese, this could be a dangerous new restaurant for you because they are soooo good. I ordered the brisket and my friend ordered the SC chciken plate. We both got large orders so we could try two of the sides. Neither of us could finish the portions we ordered so we had leftovers. The brisket was wonderful! Super tender and flavorful. The chicken was really good too! Both dishes came with pickled onion and hush puppies. (The hush puppies were really good) The jalapeño wrapped in bacon comes as a side and was the perfect amount of spicy. The coleslaw was a little underdressed and overchopped for our liking. The mac and cheese was pretty fair too. We will definitely be going back.

Beef Brisket - Recommended by a national-traveling-smokehouse/barbeque-self-proclaimed connoisseur and I will have to agree - best brisket I've had since West Texas! Mac & Cheese pretty close to Mama's too!
Here on tour. Pretty much perfect - get the combo platter, try all those great NC sauces. Baked beans were a nice surprise. Essential eating if you're in Charlotte

Had a hankering for BBQ and was not motivated to go through the trouble of cooking it myself. It is allot of work!  Decided to check out Midwood's based on reviews and how far the drive would be.   My kiddos had the chicken fingers. I had the chicken and rib combo with a side of coleslaw and beans.  Chicken was very tender. Ribs were meh. The meat was a bit tough and quite salty. The coleslaw was very good. Chopped finely and not too overbearing on the vinegar taste. Baked beans were meaty and the bbq was strong in it.  The chicken tenders are good but overly breaded- according to the kids.  Pecan cobbler was excellent.  Decent dining with bar atmosphere. Perfect place to hangout or for drinks. Attentive waitstaff.  Not sure if I will come back for the ribs. Maybe to try the salmon or have another warm slice of pecan cobbler.

A solid average.  Tried pork and brisket both dry, honestly my wife makes better pork BBQ with the crockpot.   The bar seating is a bit irritating.  The bar has elevated booths in which the hostess has to seat you.  However the footrests are set so far under they are effectively useless leaving your feet to just dangle.  Atmosphere is nice, good selection of beers.  As a BBQ joint that folks want to rave about can't say I will be in a rush to go back.
Yum!!  Clean, super friendly, food is delicious.  The Hot Mess burger is so good, even without the bun. Our server Brittany was awesome. We are from out of town but will definitely be back!

We've been here quite a few times but unfortunately this time wasn't  good. The garnish on the Bloody Mary was wilted, bones in the chicken sandwich, spoiled coleslaw, and hush puppies that were the size of a dime. Not many people on a Sunday early evening. Don't think they will make it if they don't improve what they serve. Definitely won't be back.

Came here with a few other Wounded Warriors for dinner and let me tell you it was delicious! Everything that was excellent! The waiters were extremely polite. The atmosphere was clean and friendly!  There is something about Southern BBQ food that I love, and this place has it going on.  I defiantly will be back to Midwood Smokehouse when I'm in the Charlotte area.

I normally don't like BBQ/brisket but I had a small plate of their beef brisket (with a mix of fat and lean) and it was DELICIOUS!!  It was so good I had to pack the rest to go as I flew back to NY, haha.  So YAY to that!!!!  As for sides, I had the hushpuppies, pickled onions and mac n cheese.  I did like the pickled onions but the mac 'n cheese was quite dry and tasteless.  Ah well-our server was really awesome, though!
The best beef brisket I ever had! Service was awesome! It was my first time there. It certainly won't be my last!!! Awesome!!!
Disappointed. A reputable BBQ house should not try to pass off cubed brisket put under a salamander as "burnt ends". They were dry and certainly not authentic.  Ribs were on the dry side as well.

Had lunch here last week, were able to sit outside with our group and puppy. The smoked wings were delicious, the chicken bbq platter also very tasty. The cream corn was a little heavy on the cream, light on the corn for me, but the collards were amazing and made up for it. All in all, great lunch, definitely recommend going back.

The wings. That's all I need to say. Came here with a large group, our waitress was awesome juggling all of our food and drink orders. We all ordered a variety of food and really the main thing that we ended up ordering more of was the wings! Perfectly cooked, little crisp, amazing seasoning. Definitely recommend!

Ok. Sorry, need to update my review.  We went to Midwood Smokehouse last weekend.  Got the ribs again.  They weren't nearly as good as the first time.  Not sure what happened.  The salad was very good though and so were the greens.  But, a little disappointed with the ribs this time :-(.  Probably the best ribs that I've ever tasted.  Soooo good.  Also had the make your own salad which was awesome.  My daughter ordered collard greens which she said were better than mine and she loves my greens.  I told her that she ought to be glad that she was sitting so far away from me.  But, I have to say that they were good.  Not vinegary like some places.  Personally, I don't like vinegar in my greens.  Can't wait to go back.
Amazing BBQ with lots of delicious sides to choose from. Great date spot in Plaza Midwood.

Pro: The customer service is good here most days.  Con: The food portions differ from other locations and it seems to be overpriced than the other locations.  The reason it grades three stars is the customer service.

Pro: big portions of food.  Con:  The location has the worst customer service inside and delivery. If I see one more worker at the bar eating while she is working. Really, that is unsanitary and bad customer service.

I went to mid wood smokehouse on a Saturday night. That was a mistake; the wait for a table wasn't too bad - only 20 minutes but then it took an additional hour to actually get our food. It was extremely noisy and I was seated in the corner facing the wall which didn't help the perception of how long we waited. Moving on... We ordered the brisket and the smoked chicken. My partner said the sauce was just ok and the beans were terrible. I tried them to see if she was overly critical and have to agree. I don't know what they were thinking when they paired the flavors for the beans. This taste was definite not Texas BBQ. The smoked chicken was also just ok. It tasted as if it had been boiled and then smoked for a very short time. The "smoked" veggeis were grilled not smoked. Service was mediocre at best. Again IT WAS NOISEY!!! Suggestion: Get rid of the multiple TV screens (or turn the off) and turn off the canned music, and have some good live music to keep people entertained if you make them wait. And pay the musicians! All in all food just OK, service mediocre, atmosphere thumbs down!

This is one of our favorites in the neighborhood! We have never had a bad meal here! I even ordered my thanksgiving dinner from here for my entire family last year! It was great! Better get here early for dinner! It fills up quickly!

While traveling threw North Carolina I was in the Charlotte area this place has some of the best authentic NC bbq around the decor inside is laid back and pays homage to the pig the staff was friendly we were traveling with a large group of over 10 people and we were seated in less then 10 minutes the menu is straight forward they stick to the basics but they do it right their beef brisket is fatty and juice it's so tender it falls apart in your mouth it has the perfect bark on the outside while tasting juicy and moist they have a pig out platter which gives you the option to pick and try 4 proteins along with 2 sides the pulled pork is juicy and their ribs are fall of the bone with just enough smoke in them they have a large selection of beers and drinks which makes this location perfect for coming to enjoy some authentic NC bbq their max and cheese is amazing cheesy deliciousness their nachos are so big yo will have left o era unless you share

I have eaten at Midwood many times and never wrote a review of it before. This past Friday night, I wanted to take my boyfriend to Midwood because it's his favorite place for BBQ. We had a modest wait for a table and were seated and served quickly by friendly staff. The food was excellent (save room for the banana pudding which is amazing) and the server was friendly and helpful. I really can't say anything bad about the food or the service.   The reason I decided to review it this time is because it is the LAST time I will be eating at this location. Friday night, there was no parking, at all, on the Midwood side of the street. We had to park in the lot across the street. This is where things got really dangerous.   We waited and crossed appropriately but a huge, white monstrosity of a truck decided to make a left turn and not yield to pedestrians! I was in the middle of the road and it came barreling toward me stopping INCHES from my body!!! I screamed and dropped my purse literally frozen in fear. I ran across the rest of the street as fast as I could and was barely able to enjoy my meal because of the scare crossing the street. The truck didn't even stop to see if I was okay.  If you plan to eat at this location, plan to Uber or Lyft and don't even think about crossing that damned road with or without a light. I gave this review four stars because the food was excellent but the nonexistent safe parking means I will not have the pleasure of eating here again... but I'm very thankful to be alive and unharmed. #pedestrianlivesmatter

Our first visit to Midwood ensured that it won't be our last! Guests from out-of-town wanted some "real Carolina BBQ". Since we wanted to show off our lovely city, we went to the Central Ave. location. We could smell how delicious dinner would be from the parking lot!
