Our server was helpful and friendly and attentive without hovering. Everything we ordered (and the table was groaning, I'm sure) was spot-on! Meats were tender and smoky, sides were all delicious, hush puppies were crunchy and delightful. We all left happily filled up and the one in our party who "was never really crazy about barbecue" is now absolutely converted and anxious to return. Definitely on our list of favorites now!

So glad I finally made it out to midwood smokehouse. Food is incredible; I took our server's recommendation of the brisket and could not have been more impressed! The sides held up to the brisket too. I went with the mac&cheese and bacon wrapped jalapenos. I can't wait for my next visit.  Service was great; friendly and attentive.   Parking can be difficult, but there is a decent number of spots down the street.

I think I'm finally ready to call this the best BBQ in Charlotte. After having been here a few times I have tired enough different menu items and they were all incredible. The smoked wings are ungodly good. I am not the type that normally orders an appetizer but I got these on chance because we were waiting for a friend to show up for dinner. They were so good that I make sure to get an order and opt for a smaller dinner to fit them in. Not that skipping dinner is any better. I did not see anything special in the pulled pork, though it is pretty good and not too dry. But the smoked veggies as a side are delicious and worth skipping the fries. The rack of ribs is also out of this world and I might start ordering that instead of the pulled pork. It is very flavorful. I'm seriously salivating like a Pavlovian dog just writing this review and looking at my calendar to see when I can next get over there.
Has got to be the best brisket I've ever had, bar none!  Smoked wigs are also delicious too!

One of my husband's all time favorite places to eat. Im a vegetarian who occasionally eats fish, so I get the "get hooked" salad or I make my own. The salmon is smoked perfectly and I love the smoked veggies. The service is always prompt and friendly, and you have to end the m eew all with the banana pudding.

Ate here with friends while visiting Charlotte. The restaurant is nice and gives a homey feeling, the food smelled and tasted like you were in your buddy's backyard relaxing and grilling. Great food, good service, no complaints at all. A combo platter is more than enough food for one person, you'll be fine and have leftovers.  Good: -Good informative servers, will answer BBQ questions and even make recommendations if you ask -FRIED PICKLES, do it.  -If you're not sure what to get, pick a Combo Platter below is what I chose- -Carolina Chopped Pork -Beef Brisket (get it with medium fat, it has more flavor than the lean cut) -Saint Louis Style Pork Ribs (THE TASTIEST OF THE SELECTIONS..BY FAR) -The sides: Mac & Cheese (a must) -Collard Greens (had a little spice to it) -BBQ Baked Beans -The Pecan Cobbler with a scoop of ice cream if you have room -The sweet tea was just sweet enough and not heavy/syrupy  Bad: -Being picky, but I don't think there were enough hush-puppies served with the combo platter -The Chopped Chicken BBQ did not blow me away with flavor, you're not missing anything special, you come for the Ribs and Brisket

SO so so so good. So good. Vinegar based bbq sauce is to die for, the one with a hint of sweetness is also pretty amazing. Delicious pulled pork, perfectly cooked sweet potato fries and a bowl of cold slaw I would have literally dove into if I could have.  Exactly the meal we were looking for  you won't be disappointed!

Midwood is my FAVORITE BBQ place in Charlotte. From the jalapeno poppers to the fried mac and cheese brick and the chopped BBQ salad everything here is FAB!!! I can't say enough good things about this place. If you like BBQ you have to try this place.

First time in North Carolina from California. Looked up what food I should eat local cuisine. Had the pork sandwich with barbecue beans and coleslaw. It was well worth it. I thought that I was stealing as the food was so good and the price was so little.

Honestly I'm a bbq snob having lived in Texas. I'm rather unimpressed with this BBQ that everybody is always raving about. I've had the brisket, pulled pork, and bbq sandwich. The Mac n cheese is very underwhelming. Service has never been a problem.

Get your BBQ fix at my overall favorite BBQ joint in Charlotte. I've only been to the Plaza Midwood location but it has brought me back multiple times. The restaurant vibe is less of your old-timey country kitchen and more of a casual-hip roadhouse feel with a touch of junkyard.  The bacon wrapped jalapenos appetizers are usually a fan favorite of my group. I always like to order from the classic BBQ plates section, with the mixed fatty and lean beef brisket leading the way. The more fun and recommended selection is to go with a combo platter to share with a friend(s)! You get to mix it up and find your own favorite taste.  Drinks are plentiful with many cold beers and crafty cocktail selections. There are multiple dining spaces to accommodate for different occasions. Importantly, the wait staff have always been friendly and fun, eager to give you popular recommendations.

Food: the food was good, but way too small for the cost. The restaurant had a large variety of options, yet everything I saw was too pricey for the size of the entrees. Whenever I think of a BBQ joint, I think large generous portions, not 4 strips of brisket and a side for $14. The food was good, but I had to go to ANOTHER restaurant afterwards to be full. I will not be coming back or recommending.  Atmosphere: the restaurant had a good feel to it, very relaxed.  Service: service was VERY slow at first but we were able to get food quickly after ordering.

I now understand why this place is so highly rated. By far, the BEST brisket I have ever had..melt in your mouth goodness. Was not a big fan of the burnt tips, but everything else, including the collard greens and Mac and cheese were delicious. Don't forget to also order the banana pudding, so yummy.
Cold beers, Fried pickles, burnt ends with hush puppies and smoked vegetables. Finished with banana pudding. Would do it again and again.

Can we say bacon wrapped jalapenos?????!!!! Delicious! I originally went here with my boss, of which he ordered these and I am now their biggest fan! The BBQ here is also delicious -- definitely one of the best, if not the best, that I have found in the Charlotte area!
Great food and great service! From Texas was told to try bbq down here not to bad! Not to big of a fan of the Mac and cheese but the meats were amazing!

The ribs were good, the sauce without a doubt add a nice kick to the juicy ribs. The service was certainly good, however there is room for improvement. The atmosphere was good and customers seemed happy with the food. There is plenty of parking in the area and location is relatively accessible. I'll be back!

Damn that was good! Just left the restaurant. We were passing thru Charlotte on the way home to Ohio. BBQ was the last item to check off our vacation to-do list. What a way to finish our vacay!  Under the category of Best-I-Ever-Had: Brisket Ribs Mac n cheese Ice tea  Two word review: Yum and Yum!

This is a mixed feeling 3 star review because I wanted to love this place so bad after hearing everything about it. I almost want to say a real 2/12 but I guess 3 will work.  First we got a warm welcome, interior is nice, cool looking bar, nice tables, overall good feel inside of the restaurant. Our server was cool, yet a bit awkward. He did his job well, but when asked questions about how some of the meat was prepped, he kinda seemed to be caught off guard.  One big thing I learned, which was a huge turnoff for me was that all pulled pork, no matter how you order it (platter, sandwich) is pulled and put right into their vinegar sauce.  Yes, they will give you other sauces with it, but the vinegar still bites right through, and that is a huge turnoff for me, and 3 out of 4 of the people at my table did not order pork because of that.  Otherwise, I got brisket (both lean and fatty) was excellent, sides were all good. My wife liked her mac & cheese. In laws loved their chicken sandwiches though thought they were a bit dry, alas with more sauce very good.  Would I come back? yes. Would I ask more questions about how the bbq is prepped and cooked? yes. It seemed our waiter was a bit confused. But our drinks were filled all the time, and food was delivered and check on is a reasonable amount of time. So he did his job well.

I met a friend here on a Friday night.  Table for two around 8pm.  No wait at all!  We sat inside in one of the big booths.  We were a bit undecided regarding what to order, so ended up getting the sampler.  We chose beef brisket, pulled pork, ribs, and the smoked turkey.  Sides were Carolina slaw and bacon wrapped jalepenos.  Everything was delish!  The jalepenos were AMAZING!!!  My favorite meat was probably the ribs, but the turkey was also great.  They also served the meat platter with 3 different sauce sides.  The classic BBQ was great.  Though my experience was great partly because of the excellent company, I have to say that the food was great, as well as the service.  We took awhile to actually order because we were chatty and our server was patient as can be.  I will be back!

This is a great location of a really cool restaurant concept. The location on Johnston is never crowded and much more mellow than the plaza location. We like to stop in here for lunch, especially when we have out of town guests. Their Bbq is great and they have excellent drink specials. We came on Easter Sunday and I ordered a Bloody Mary (3 dollars off on Sunday). I've had consistently good service here. I love to get the chopped salad and add BBQ salmon. There are choices on the menu for everyone. I LOVE their jalapeño mule, it's a must try!
The service here is excellent, had an awesome drink (jalapeno mule), and the beef tips are to die for. Definitely worth a small wait.
Incredible food. Got the burnt ends with bacon wrapped jalapeño and it was some of the best bbq I've ever had. My only regret is getting small instead of large.

5 stars go to Priscilla the Bar  person she was excellent pleasant and courteous and efficient I ordered the number one sandwich I forget the name of it that was brisket with Gouda which surprised me that it had Gouda in my opinion the brisket should've been  stand on its own and it was served as a Panini rather than the sandwich which again I was surprise  I will go back but I would not order that sandwich again I had brisket recently at a place down further on 521 the city barbecue brisket by itself was excellent

Let me start off by saying we normally love midwood smoke house, so I'm going to give it 3 stars. We decided to stop by here for a large banana pudding on the way home. When we got home and took it out of the bag we were very disappointed. It was half full. That definitely wasn't worth $5.50. Come on midwood! You're better than that!

My boyfriend and I went to midwood tonight and both got the Carolina pork with the NC sauce and midwood signature sauce. He got a side of Mac and cheese and I got the creamed corn. Everything was overly salty. When the manager came to inquire how our meal was, we politely let her know everything was overly seasoned. She switched my corn for the collard greens but they ended up being salty as well. She also brought out another plate of pork from another batch. Luckily this was not salty. The waitress also gave us complimentary desserts. I've been here before and thought everything was delicious. I don't know why everything was so salty but the service was decent except for the wait. Overall we were there for more than an hour.

Best barbecue in America and hands down my favorite restaurant in Charlotte! If I was on death row, I would want Midwood's pulled pork and mac n' cheese as my final meal. It's THAT good! I love their vinegar barbecue sauce and the mac n cheese is made with cavatappi noodles and is like no other macaroni I have ever tasted! When Obama and Hillary Clinton came to town to campaign, this is where they ate. It's simply THE BEST.

Cory from customer service contacted me and asked me to give this midwood location another try.  This is a follow up to my prior review...  Went in for lunch on a weekday and sat at the bar again.   Was greeted and served immediately.   Order was taken and food arrived promptly.   My wife ordered a pork sandwich and I had the pork plate.  The pork was great.  This time the fries came out hot but still not as crisp as I like them.  They were good just a little too limp for my taste.  Cole slaw was good.  Hush puppies were great.  And I loved the pickled onions.  Two complaints:  1) the music is too loud for lunch time.   2) again, why no self serve sauces?  But those are minor complaints. Overall great food and a much better experience than my last time here.

I left a 1 star review for the South Charlotte midwood location so I wasn't particularly looking forward to trying out this location.   But my wife and I were shopping in the central avenue area and since we parked behind the building and didn't want to walk far we decided to try midwood out for lunch.    Wow what a difference!  It was very busy so we sat at the bar.  I had the pork sandwich with cole slaw and fries.  My wife had the brisket with hush puppies.  Everything was great!  Fast service too.  We took a few hush puppies home and our dog loved them too.  My only complaint is they don't have a variety of sauces available in self service bottles.   I like to mix and match my BBQ sauces and try different combinations.  That's part of the fun of a BBQ place imho.  Nevertheless, the food here is delicious.   I'll try the other location again since it's much closer.

Eight of us went to the Midwood Smokehouse today for lunch.  It was a a great experience.  Two of us shared a four meat (pulled pork, ribs, brisket, and sausage).  We had sides of Mac and cheese, and bacon wrapped jalopenos.  The meat selections were excellent, very tasty!  Everyone enjoyed their lunch.  Service was excellent.
I love places like this. Mac's has always been my go to for bbq and because it's a cool atmosphere, but Midwood may have just taken the #1 spot. I will definitely be coming back here!

This has (embarrassingly?) been my staple since moving to the Plaza Midwood neighborhood a couple months ago.  Love so many things on the menu from the collards & baked beans to the sweet tea & beer menu to the burnt ends, chicken, & ribs.  Great staff.  Lots of seating options- patio, bar, high & short tables.

Best BBQ in Charlotte...maybe even in all of NC.  Fantastic food, great atmosphere.  I recommend the pulled or half chicken.  Try to get there early on weekends, as it gets crowded very very fast.  Came back in February 2017 and tried the craft cocktails.  Very Very Good!  I recommend the brambler drink.  Excellently made and a good amount of alcohol

Best BBQ in Charlotte...maybe even in all of NC.  Fantastic food, great atmosphere.  I recommend the pulled or half chicken.  Try to get there early on weekends, as it gets crowded very very fast.  Came back in February 2017 and tried the craft cocktails.  Very Very Good!  I recommend the brambler drink.  Excellently made and a good amount of alcohol.

This was my first time trying out Midwood Smokehouse.  I'm a huge fan of North Carolina BBQ with the eastern NC vinegar based sauce.  Service was great. I was seated quickly. The waitress asked if it was my first time visiting and went into detail about how they are known for their brisket, that they make all of their own sauces and dressings from scratch, and they have a special smoker.  It was a Tuesday night so they also had a $3 special on all NC beers.  I will say their drink menu was lacking and confusing.  Instead of naming the specific beers they were on tap, it just named the breweries that they had beers from. We all know there are lots of breweries in charlotte with a wide selection of choices.  It would have been beneficial to be able to see which specific beer they were serving from that brewery and a description. (Not everyone is super familiar with what each local beer brewed is) I ordered the brisket sandwich with a side of coleslaw. You had a choice of which type of cheese you could put on your sandwich and I chose the pimento. You couldn't even taste the pimento cheese on the sandwich.  It was my first time trying brisket and I won't be trying it again. It was served on a basic piece of toast.  I only ate half the sandwich because it really was disappointing.  The coleslaw was terrible. I really had high hopes for this restaurant and would like to go back and try something else but I just don't know if I will since there are other BBQ places I have already tried that I know are better. I will say the waitress was fantastic and the food was served promptly. If I go back and try something else I will update my review. Until then, I wouldn't recommend this place.

The food is exceptional, but do not come here for healthy food! My favorite things to order are pork burnt ends, ribs and the hot mess burger. It's honestly hard to limit my favorite items to 3 things off the menu! I wish I could remember the name of our server the last time we went, she was one of the best servers we've had (I will add her name if I figure it out)! Being in walking distance of Midwood Smokehouse is extremely dangerous!
Midwood Smokehouse features the best smoked brisket this side of Lockhart, TX.   Definitely my go-to BBQ restaurant in the Charlotte area.   If you haven't been, don't delay.   Go and enjoy!

I love Midwood Smokehouse! Although I'm a native Carolinian and think eastern NC Barbecue is the best food on earth, Midwood's beef brisket is outstanding. I also love Thursdays when smoked turkey is on the menu. And don't over look their smoked bacon wrapped Jalapeños, salmon and wings. Those might be the very best things on the menu. I haven't had a bad thing to eat there and I love the atmosphere. If you've never tried Midwood, I encourage you to do so. And don't forget dessert!

Always always always so good. I will completely go out of my way if I want good barbecue just to come here. You can't get good barbecue everywhere. I'm super picky. I don't even like most places because I'm so picky. ?? especially with good sauce. Their macaroni is perfect. Not too pricey either. They have a patio to sit on too.

Their salads are absolutely the best salads anywhere.  I would recommend that to anyone who's a salad lover or even if they aren't.  My boyfriend doesn't usually eat salads, but here, he would help me finish it if I get full before I can finish it.  He got the Philly cheesesteak and that's the best as well.  Their brisket is among the best in Charlotte.
Probably the best "modern" bbq in Charlotte.   I take clients here on a regular to get a real taste of southern bbq; the brisket, smoked veggies and burnt ends can't be beat.

There is an upstairs patio that you can order and go up there to eat if it gets too crowded downstairs   We had to order out but the ribs and the beef brisket were pretty good  Their spicy BBQ sauce was also pretty good

The brisket is the best we ever had.  Just the brisket itself would be 5 stars.  Parking: the parking lot is very small.  When we leave the parking lot, you have to drive to the back of the parking lot and exit onto the side street.  The side street has cars park on both sides and is only wide enough for one car to pass through.  When we were leaving, we nearly got hit by a car that was making a left turn onto the street.  Just be careful.  Service: great service. The hostess greeted us warmly.  Our waiter was very friendly and keep our drinks filled up.  Food: Other than the brisket, I only liked the sweet potato fries.  These were the other things we ordered: - Pimento cheese fries: Crinkle fries tasted like the frozen kind.  It was very cheesy.  My kids absolutely loved it.   - Smoked wings: too much smoke flavor for me - BBQ Pork Sandwich: It was pretty good.   - Combo platter (pig out): Three of us shared this platter and we still had left over.  We picked 2 portions of combined (fat + lean) brisket, sausage and ribs.  And the side items were mac n' cheese and sweet potato fries.  Everyone loved the brisket.  The sweet potato fries were one of the best ones I had.  I didn't like the hush puppies or the mac n' cheese at all.      Two days later, we stopped by and bought a pound of briskets (from the bulk order) to go.  The bulk order would need 24 hour advance notice.  We were lucky that they had enough for us to buy it that day.  By the time we got to our hotel, the brisket was cold.  It was still very good.  If we are in the area again, we will definitely stop by to get some brisket.

Hubby and I had a fantastic dinner at Midwood Smokehouse. Pulled pork, ribs, cole slaw, mac and cheese and hush puppies fulfilled our 'que cravings! Our waitress, Nickey, was a true pro and gave great recommendations on dishes. She took good care of us through the night, and we loved her sweet but a little sassy personality! :-)  The manager, Jen, stopped by to make sure we were doing OK and gave us some great recommendations on what to do while in the Charlotte area. We greatly appreciated her help. Classic smokehouse atmosphere with all the guests relaxed, talking, laughing, eating and having a great time. We will definitely be back!

We ate here 30 minutes before they closed, I was wondering if it was worth getting the mashed potatoes this close to them closing. Ended up getting the mashed potatoes and  they were very fresh, everything was fresh and very tasty.

As a certified Kansas City Barbeque Judge in the North East, I find I get weary of the molasses, maple, and tomato and brown sugar based sauces. Midwood does it right, and does it Carolina style. Mustard sauces and vinegars, all kept in a warming tray so they are served hot. Their enormous rotating smoker in the back can handle to quantities that they have to produce for how good their 'q' is. The pork is soft and pulls easily without being baby food. The brisket (the most difficult of BBQ meats) is juicy, smoky, and flavorful. The brightly colored wood interior of the dining room is festooned with old timey comic book and movie paraphernalia. Along with a welcoming staff, you cannot go wrong here.

Very nice restaurant. The burnt ends were very flavorful. The baked beans were the best I have ever eaten. The coleslaw was excellent.  My son also loved the beans and the Mac & Cheese.  They had a great selection of microbrewery beers.  The waitstaff was great.  I would definitely eat here again.

Midwood Smokehouse was pretty good, but I think it was definitely over hyped for me. We are here for a quick trip and decided to try it based on great reviews, but we're a little disappointed. We had the brisket and chopped pork, both of which tasted good, but it was all a little in the dry side and not very hot. The mac 'n cheese and bacon wrapped jalapeños were delicious though, and I could have eaten a full meal of those alone. All in all it's very good barbecue, but I have definitely had better before.

Ate dinner here on Friday night and was extremely disappointed in the BBQ. I'm a native Charlottean and have had many types of BBQ and this is not a good Carolina-style BBQ. The sauce was terrible and the pork had an odd flavor. The BBQ Half Chicken was good, but the pulled pork was terrible. The Banana Pudding was incredible though.

The best barbecue in Charlotte (and I eat a lot of barbecue). I take all of my Charlotte visitors here. Get there early if you want the ribs - they sell out most nights! I personally prefer the classic pulled pork but you can't go wrong. Order your meat plain and ask for all the sauces on the side to try.

Such a fun atmosphere upon entering this resturant. I'm pretty certain we tried just about everything on the menu between the four in our group! Everything was wonderful, from the meat selections to the sides on to dessert. Portion sizes are huge so be prepared to either share or have leftovers to take home. We were there on a Sunday mid to late afternoon, our server was excellent. Our friends had previously shared how great their dining experience at this location so we couldn't wait to give them a try. We certainly were not disappointed in the least. They have a full service bar as well as numerous draft beers on tap from local breweries. It's nearly impossible to pick our favorite menu choice as everything was so good. If you've not had the pleasure of enjoying Midwood Smokehouse you are missing out!!

Pepper is what's for dinner. So disappointed with the food after raving reviews. But most everything was so chock full of pepper it took away the taste of the dish.  We are also a family who loves heat and well seasoned food so this took us back to experience all this pepper.  The best thing we ate was the pork and beef burnt ends. Also, our server Heidi provided excellent service!  We first started with the nachos added beef brisket - it had way too much bbq sauce. Dinner consisted of - plate of 4 meats combo dinner for my husband and I (beef burnt ends, chopped pork, and double ribs) with 2 sides (mac-n-cheese and collard greens). Burnt ends amazing, chopped pork full of pepper, ribs not tender... the sides were nothing to talk about at all. Our teen boys chose Pork Burnt Ends with cream corn - Burnt ends were wonderful but the cream corn was full of black pepper which takes away the taste of the corn. The other meal was the TX Brisket sandwich - it was more bread than meat.  Maybe our BBQ standards are too high from having some of the best bbq in Kansas City but this was just average at best.

This is a difficult review to leave, because most things about Midwood (especially the food) deserve 5 stars. The quality of the barbecue vies for 1st place in all of Charlotte every time I eat there, the local beer list is long, and the service is generally solid too.  However, over time, portions have steadily decreased. The last two times, I didn't get anything near what would reasonably be expected for the price I paid. I can go to any competitor at this point and get more food for less money, and the quality will be just as good.   Needless to say, I won't be heading back to Midwood any time soon. The quality of flavor alone isn't worth another sparse combo plate that maybe has 3/4 the amount of 'cue that it should, and only leaves me disappointed.

Quality BBQ at a low price! Good variety of different types of bbq (burnt ends, brisket, pulled pork, etc.) but my favorite is definitely the burnt ends. Perfect bit of crunch and great flavor, plus it's hard to find burnt ends in Charlotte. It comes with a spicy bbq sauce that fits perfectly with the meat. They have recommended bbq sauces or a large variety that you can try with your meat as well.  The sides are definitely unique, as they have much more than the normal bbq sides, including the delicious bacon wrapped jalapenos! These were definitely a favorite (you can get it as an appetizer as well.)  They have a good beer list showcasing some of the best of Charlotte beers, but also some classics as well. I went on a Saturday night and there was a pretty big wait, but luckily there's a lot in the area so you can explore (they will text you when your table is ready.)  Overall, would highly recommend to get your bbq fix!
Excellent. A bit pricey when you look at the menu but portions were great and everything cooked well. The burnt ends were excellent and the full rack of ribs were a true full rack.
Amazing bbq and brisket. Great service. Fresh food and inviting atmosphere. Will be back!

Nice casual atmosphere. Meat & sauce were great- I especially loved the burnt ends. The sides don't live up. The bacon wrapped jalapeños were just okay, and the Mac & cheese wasn't worth it.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I couldn't ask for more from the service.

Atmosphere:    Great outdoor seating!  Price:   Very fare.  Food:   Excellent!  Full of flavor. Pork was yummy! - not fatty at all. Chicken was moist and tender.  Great sauces.  Hushpuppies were perfect size - and not greasy!  BEST baked beans I have EVER had! - extra flavor with the additional spices and peppers.  Portions:    Generous.  Location:   Convenient, yet parking can be tricky.  Service:     Friendly, fast and courteous.
love the pecan cobbler. in all its a pretty nice place!

Move over Mac's this is my new FAV spot for Q!  I love the location and trendy bar.  There are several huge TV's to watch the game.  There are booths, hightops and regular tables as well as a really long bar with comfy seats.  A must-get is the bacon-wrapped jalapenos!!  VERY spicy, order your beer first, but for those of us that LOVE spicy food - this is for you!  They come out tender and the bacon is crispy and the cheese is the perfect amount of 'melty'.   I had the BBQ platter which I ordered with the BBQ Baked Beans.  The Q was super-smokey.  Totally done right, with sauce on the side.  The BBQ Baked Beans were a meal in themselves!  Very rich and the addition of peppers gives it a very full savory flavor.    Next time I am definitely going to get the brisket.  My boyfriend got it and i had to pull a 'look over there!  its Pam Anderson!' to snag a bit from his plate.  YUM.  It was so tender and flavorful - not too fatty which I love.    Definitely will head back - so glad we found this spot!  We owe it all to Yelp!  Thanks guys!  :-D
I had the fried pickles, which were interesting.  The taco-trio with beef brisket, pulled pork, chicken and a bacon wrapped jalapeno.  Good, but not 4-star worthy.

A few must try's are: 1930 cheesesteak, pimento fries (I had them with chopped brisket) smoked wings crispy !! Oh I haaaaaaaatttte coleslaw but I got it by accident & fell in love the customer service, which everyone knows I'm a stickler for is awesome as well !!  God Bless the cooks

They have the best hush puppies. But the mains are faaaar too salty for me. And I'm not sensitive to salt or anything. Heck, I'm Filipino! I love salt! But the salt on the wings and the ribs were too much for me. Brisket is delicious though!

Went for lunch last week and ordered the salad with pulled pork. It was good, and the portions were generous. The salad itself wasn't very exciting, but the bbq was good. I was so so on the bbq sauce, but tend to like it pretty sweet. Ordered a diet coke and it came in a plastic bottle, wasn't as good of course vs fountain as I had anticipated.

Amazing. Amazing, Amazing. Brisket is ridiculous. My wife had the smoked salmon, it was also great. From California, so we had to try N Carolina BBQ and I'd say they make their state proud. Great BBQ sauces, and their mustard sauce is mouth watering good. They sell their rub and sauces, which I purchased, making this place a must. Our waitress, won't say her name for privacy, blonde curly hair is amazing. Love this place.

Really good southern food! They have a southern twist to Nachos (pimento cheese, sooooo good) and pork tacos! There Mac and cheese is my favorite! I don't think you should go there for chicken. It's not that good to me, i perder just BBQ, or pork items. But the staff is very sweet and upbeat!
Best barbecue, slaw, banana pudding, brisket in the Southeast! Why do you think President Obama ate there? He has good taste.

Still the best bbq in charlotte! The original location in plaza is the only one I go to. I call it...loyalty. Jk, I'm sure all the other locations now are legit too. It's awesome they have opened more...BECAUSE it's sooooo good. Yes that good!   I've liked everything I've tried there. But these are my go to favs that you must try:  Carolina pulled pork - their Midwood sauce is the. Best.  Baked Mac & cheese - yes please! Sweet potato fries! - I only share if I really love you.  AND. jalapeño bacon wrapped poppers. Yes.   I've also tried their creamed corn, prob the best around here for that, if you like corn. Like how is everything there this good?   They have a good selection of whisky. Com'on it's a bbq place! Also full bar. And lots of local brews. They got it all.

Great food! Try the beef brisket; it was awesome - great taste; they offer fatty, lean or both. The baked beans and hush puppies were also great; place was packed inside and outside. They also had a good selection of local beers

Honestly, probably the best BBQ I've ever had and that's saying something. Having been to the top places in Texas, Missouri, and elsewhere this place is ever bit as good and then some. Pimento cheese fries and the Combo Sampler platter are definitely must-try's.

We ordered take out so I can not comment on the service. But the restaurant was packed when I went inside to pick up the food. The first thing I noticed was the smell, oh what a heavenly smell. The food was equally good. Very moist meat with perfect balance of spices. My favorite was the yellow mustard sauce, it was amazing. I swear it had cardamon in it, there was something Indian in that. I could drink that sauce, SO GOOD. Whenever I get that rare BBQ hankering I sometimes get, I will return and dine in.

This place is amazing!!! This is my first time here and good lord! Nothing has disappointed me!! The brisket and Mac & cheese are soooooo good and the waitress has never let us see the bottom of our glass!! 10/10 would recommend!!

I'm not even going to try to piggy back on everything everyone has said... This place is da bomb. Come on Monday's for drink specials.   The best dish they have is their Sat/Sun Smoked Beef Rib. I'm going to say it's the best in Charlotte. Darn tasty.   (Drop Mic)

I am a huge barbeque fan. I've visited the location in Huntersville and Plaza Midwood. I didn't give 5 stars because sometimes their staff is hit or miss. Other than that, they have great food! Kinda pricey, but it's good.

I consider myself a BBQ aficionado I like good BBQ, and I smoke my own. Not a fan of how they mix a eastern style sauce in with the pulled pork to keep from drying out,hush puppies were very good Mac and Cheese would not order again.A good pork BBQ will stand on its own. Service was awesome,restaurant was clean and inviting.

I sat at the bar, and I received great service from the male bartender. He was courteous and professional. I also noticed that he checked to go orders for accuracy, prior to handing the food over to the customers. That is a commitment to excellent service.  Prices: Expensive. Figure on $25 per person without beer or cocktails. Yeah, I know that this is Charlotte, but I don't want to pay their rent.   Pulled Pork Barbecue Quality? Good, but slightly over-rated. Maybe the best in CLT though. I liked their burnt ends the best. B+  Décor: This is a cool restaurant, well laid out and inviting. I like the vibe and decor of this place.   Negatives: Parking in their minuscule parking lot is almost nonexistent. I guess that one could park across the road in the shopping center parking lot and dart across the busy traffic, but I'm too old to play "dodge ball with vehicles."  PS: A confused waitress brought out my bacon wrapped jalapeno appetizer - well AFTER I received my entrée, and she tried to give it to other customers....not good. Many of the seeds were left in the jalapenos, so they were hella spicy, almost too spicy to eat. I left one on the plate.   I classify Midwood Smokehouse's fare as "city" barbecue or barbecue for those who don't know any better. Hey Midwood, don't despair, B+ from me on BBQ is pretty darned good. See my BBQ list for traditional BBQ restaurants in NC at 1/3 the price.

Plain and Simple, You Must Eat Here!! Stopped in for a late dinner after traveling in from Buffalo NY. Just a short wait time, place was busy. Our waiter, the food, drinks and atmosphere were all top notch.

This was a place recommended to us by a friend who travels to the area frequently. We did not regret it one bit! Service was excellent- all the meat was really great- expertly smoked. Now my only "complaint" was the pimento cheese fries- I wish there was MORE brisket! I'm biased because I love it lol. I wasn't in love with the pimento cheese- I know it's a local delicacy but I guess I don't have the palate for it. I also got the pulled pork sandwich with hush puppies! All excellent ! So filling!

My first bbq in North Carolina and it didn't disappoint.  The brisket was a bit dry, which has been an unfortunate trend I've noticed, so I will stick to pulled pork and ribs from now on.  The pulled pork was fantastic and the sides (hush puppies and beans) were excellent.

Hey, I posted this on Google too, so hopefully I don't get dinged for that. Anyway, this is for the Johnston Rd. location --  Okay, so first and foremost the service was AMAZING. Our server, Melissa, outshined everything, even the food (which is darn near impossible in this spot.) She was so friendly, she brought us everything we didn't know we were gonna need and made spot on recommendations regarding the menu. Legit, even if the food wasn't great, I'd come back for her.  Luckily, the food is incredible and everything we ordered was unbelievable. Normally I would've driven to the Plaza Midwood location, but we were right around the corner and I am so glad we got a chance to check out this location because otherwise I wouldn't have gotten to meet Melissa!

Ribs are my favorite, I read the reviews and was so happy to try these. The truth is they were not eatable. I hated them and no one in my family would eat them. Do not waste your money here.  They were not cooked right and the seasoning was flat out nasty.

I grew up near KC and am a brisket lover. This place was phenomenal to say the least. I actually made a noise of joy when I tried the baked beans!!  (No joke). The brisket and meal is easily the best BBQ in Charlotte. Great job team!!

I love some good BBQ so I definitely had to stop here when I was passing by. We were seated immediately and the service was great. I ordered the pulled pork. The pork was good but their sauces were really the star here. Both were tasty. I'll be going back if I ever want some BBQ.

Midwood is my go to place in Charlotte for bbq. I've been to some of the other locations and this one was no different. I'm from Georgia where we do bbq slightly different than the Carolinas so I was happy to find a place that had great bbq here. We went on a busy Saturday night, but our wait was only around 10 minutes. This visit, I went with the brisket queso which was amazing. The brisket was tender and flavorful as always and the price is very reasonable. One big reason I also enjoy Midwood is their Mac n Cheese. Most places these days just give you noodles with some nasty cheese sauce on them, but Midwood actually provides baked mac n cheese the right way. There is also a large parking lot across the street which is nice so parking is a breeze. Midwood is always a good option.

Midwood Smokehouse offers a wide range of barbecued (would this translate to "cooked-out" in the South?) goodness. Don't be fooled by the neon pigs on the sign, they faithfully prepare chopped chicken, turkey, and the best darn beef brisket ever to have graced my gullet in addition to the classic pulled pork, ribs, and sausage. These are all topped perfectly with amazing sweet, vinegar, and mustard -based bbq sauces. The vibrant flavors of the vinegar and mustard sauces have converted me away from the sweet sauces of my childhood.  While the menu is filled with a surprising array of sandwiches, salads, and sides, I've just stuck to their combo massive platters that comes with choice of 4 meats, 2 sides, hush puppies, and pickled onions. Enough to gastronomically stuff 2-3 people for $19? Now that is some gastro-nomics right there!  But wait, there is more! Did I mention the respectable local draft beers from the likes of OMB, Big Boss, and Four Friends? Plus 1/2 price on Mondays--an OMC Copper for $2.50?! I tip my bbq-stained hat at you sir!  Taken together, when visiting friends and family want to experience some local flavor, this place is on the short list.

How happy am I that Midwood has opened in Birkdale.  All I can say that it so good.  Started off with the Bacon Wrapped Jalapeños.  Always watch out because there is always one really hot one.   We call it Jalapeño  Roulette.    For the mains had the Pork Plate and the Brisket plate.  The small portion comes with one side and hush puppies.   Had the mac-n-cheese and collards.   Both were really good.    This is a BBQ staple for me as they have other locations around Charlotte.  Good to have one a few minutes from my house.   Will be here a lot!!!!   Praise the lard (yes lard) that Midwood is in HUNTERSVILLE.

This is such a good place.  They smoke their meats on premise and do a great job.  Never had a bad meal.   Pulled Pork, Brisket and the Wings are all good choices.  The Bacon Wrapped Jalapeños are a great start.   Creamed Corn,  Collards and MacNCheese are all great sides.

I absolutely LOVE Midwood Smokehouse! I stumbled across this place when I couldn't decide what to eat, and I was not disappointed. It is rare to find juicy well seasoned brisket this side of Texas, but they knocked I think out of the park. The sausage...delicious. the smoked chicken...delicious. The smokey Jalepeno poppers...FREEKIN DELICIOUS   *I SERIOUSLY LIMIT MYSELF TO 3 MEALS THERE PER YEAR*

Ordered take out once again for me, my wife and her sister, it was great we got all of our food and plenty of it! The nice take out lady double checked our order and realized something was off, so when I was sent on my way everyone enjoyed all there food and the smoked flavor is ALWAYS so amazing and it's unlike any other smokehouse I have visited in Charlotte

The place is very clean and very cool.  Abigail served us and she was awesome.  Great server.  We had ribs which were good but would like just a little more tender.  Not falling off the bone tender.  That's too much.  I like my ribs to have a little bite.  Willing to try them again though.  Chicken was awesome.  Beans out of this world.  Red slaw pretty good.  Greens awesome.  Bacon wrapped jalapeño good but would like bacon crispier.  Hush puppies awesome.  Banana pudding really good.  Pecan cobbler.  Oh my.  Sooooo good.  Going back there try burnt ends and Mac and cheese.

I visited this place based on the yelp reviews  Y'ALL TRICKED ME highly disappointed after at 30 minute wait for a simple BBQ sandwich.  The bbq was more like smoked pork with no flavor. I felt as I'd they made my sandwich from left over meat from 3 Days ago.    I had to pour on the extra sauce to keep from choking off the thick dry bun.  Eeeewww

I am ruined for BBQ. I will never eat BBQ at another restaurant in this city. The pimento cheese fries are a must. Also be a fat kid and order a side of the baked beans and dump those bad boys on there. Do it. For real. I would start listing things that are good here but I would start at the planter near the door. I love it all. Eat here as soon as possible if you haven't already. Burnt ends are a must for first timers.

I just ordered their new salad with smoked chicken and it was amazing. My waitress kathy was awesome, very personable and knows customer service. I will definitely be back cause of her, if you go here you must request kathy krooz is her full name.   If i owned a restaurant she would come work for me.

I was traveling in Charlotte for work and decided to get some Carolina BBQ. I found this place and wow it was great. I had the burnt ends ( always my favorite) and the were fantastic. With Mac and cheese and greens . The service was great. Even the host who sat me was funny and friendly. My server was attentive but not overly. My drink was her suggestion and was wonderful. I took the pecan cobbler back to my hotel for a late night snack and it was the best I had ever had , my only complaint was that my to go cobbler didn't have utensils which made it challenging in the hotel . Eat here!!! I will be back!

Still love Midwood...might be my favorite place for brisket in Charlotte! Last trip we got the 4 meat platter - tried their smoked turkey, ribs and brisket times 2 (lean all the way). For sides we had the mac & cheese and smoked veggies.   Everything was DELISH! And our service was great too. I really like this place and definitely recommend it to someone looking for the best bbq in Charlotte!

I've been in a Barbecue mood lately, so when some co-workers wanted to grab a casual dinner, I suggested we try Midwood Smokehouse's latest location in Birkdale Village. It was perfect for our group. Awesome local beer selection and plenty of options for everyone to get as little or as much food as they liked. I went with the small Brisket (with lean cuts) which came with 1 side. I also added a smoked sausage because I find them to be amazing at barbecue spots and I was pretty hungry.   The brisket portion was PERFECT. So juicy and flavorful. The plate came with 5 hush puppies, some pickled onions, plus my side of smoked veggies. The sausage had a great snap and came with some house ground mustard, an excellent touch. I would order this again and again.   Service was fast and friendly. GREAT addition to Birkdale!

As far as barbecue places go in Charlotte, Midwood barbecue by far THE best brisket in town.  In no way is this place fancy. In fact, they might even let you in with your pajamas. Service is always great and every staff member I've interacted with there has been friendly. Even the person managing the takeout orders is nice!  But let's get down to business. The food here is fantastic. They do a great Texas style brisket, which I highly recommend. If I'm feeling in a light mood, I will get the chopped salad and add brisket on top. It's delicious. Sides are great, and I would recommend the Mac and cheese. I know this is kind of random, but the sausage is really good too. It's one of those meets that comes as an afterthought to a lot of people, but put this at the top of the order next you go!  All in all, a great BBQ joint. Patio is nice in the spring and they turn tables fairly quickly so you do t have to wait too long. If I could leave you with one piece of advice, get the bacon wrapped jalapeños. You won't regret the taste and you can just ignore the calories.
Food is really good! Very wide variety to choose from! Try the BBQ spaghetti!!! Delish!!!
Pros: Quality food and drinks.  Hefty portion sizes.  Excellent prices.  Great decor.  Cons: Waitstaff becomes pushy nearing closing time.

Got off the plane late and wandering around looking for dinner. Just happened on this. Wow! Amazing food. My son got burnt bits and I got the brisket - amazing food. Amazing service, friendly and helpful. Good collection of beer. And open late too.

We had heard a lot of great things about this place, and I am sorry to say that it did not live up to expectations.  The portions were small, the taste was okay but nothing exceptional. The service was lackluster at best. Too many other really good places to eat BBQ to make a special trip here again, at least for us.

I had a good salad and my husband had the brisket along with creamed corn. I liked the hush puppies! I also ordered the banana pudding. The picture of The SMALL salad shows that it's really not that small!

I spent two weeks in Charlotte and during that time, I visited four BBQ joints (well, three plus Boardwalk Billy's, which is BBQ in name only). Midwood was definitely the winner.  Midwood had an extensive BBQ selection, including burnt ends. Here's a tip: If you go to a BBQ joint that offers burnt ends, you know you're at a legit smoke shop. I ordered the full rack of ribs and added a side of burnt ends. My ribs also came with BBQ slaw and bacon-wrapped jalapenos. The ribs were amazing. Perfect amount of smoke. The meat came off the bone with almost no effort, but they weren't "fall off the bone" (which is great because really, who wants their rib meat to fall off into their lap or onto the plate?). This place also caters to the gluten-free crowd with a dedicated gluten-free menu. Even the bacon-wrapped jalapenos were gluten free as they were not breaded!  The burnt ends were delicious. I treated them as an extra appetizer. They easily could have been a meal.  I can't imagine any BBQ restaurant in Charlotte being better than Midwood. The wait staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our waitress also gladly did individual checks for all 8 of us without adding a gratuity. It probably worked out to her advantage that there wasn't a mandatory 18% gratuity, as I know my table far exceeded that.  Hands down, the best meal I had during my two weeks in Charlotte

DISCLAIMER: I'm from Texas, where BBQ is a religion. This heavily influences my review.    The BBQ here is actually quite good.  I ordered burnt ends, which I haven't found yet at any BBQ joint. They were quite good, but came six to an order, with a side and a few hush puppies for $12.50.  I'd estimate, you are getting 6 oz. of brisket for that price, which is insane.  I could buy 6 oz. of filet minion for less.   BBQ naturally uses cheaper cuts of meat..which is why they long cooking process. It should be cheap and quick and plentiful.  This was none of that.  I waited for nearly a half hour, which was made a bearable thanks to a large selection of draft beer.   Since many of the N. Carolina BBQ restaurants I've been to offer signature Mac-n-cheese, I ordered that as my side.  Just like every other N. Carolina BBQ restaurant whose Mac-n-cheese I've eaten, this is nothing special.   Hush puppies here are actually better than anywhere else I've had them in N. Carolina.  In Texas, you only get hush puppies with sea food, but here they are served with everything.  Generally, they are bland and frozen...but I think these are fresh.  I don't know why more places don't make their hush puppies fresh, since corn bread batter is probably the cheapest and easiest thing to fry.  Another big plus for offering one of my favorite things in the entire world, bacon-wrapped jalapeno.  Where I come from, these are a staple of any cookout, but rare to find in a restaurant.    I will go back to Midwood Smokehouse, but I doubt I become a regular.

Great bbq place! Everything we got was great- salmon, brisket, and brisket burnt ends. The brisket was especially good and I would recommend ordering extra hush puppies if you like them. Some come with the meal, but just a handful and they're small.

Coming from Central Texas, I miss Texas style BBQ and this comes close!  Sides are delicious, brisket is very good, nice smoky flavor, you can get either fatty or lean.  Sausage was good as well.  Not bad for NC take on Texas barbecue!
Fantastic BBQ place. Real smoking, true to form. Maybe the best ribs I have ever had. Perfect service. Jess is on top of it. Can't wait to return.

Excellent food, great staff!  Was disappointed with a meal at another area BBQ restaurant. Midtown more than made up for it!  Sausage was decent. Pulled pork was flavorful and moist. I enjoyed the collard greens, although being a Northerner, I'm never really sure what these should taste like.   Baked beans were fantastic. (I am a literal baked bean expert, so I do not say such things lightly.). Beans were cooked properly, not soft or mushy, and tasted great in the spicy sauce.   Ribs were excellent. Tender and sweetly sauced.   Brisket was melt in your mouth tender. Server even asked if I wanted the lean or marbled portion. I took the marbled, and it tasted great. Bark was very spicy, which suited me fine, but may be a bit much for some.   Doubt I'll ever be in Charlotte again, but if I am, I'll be coming back here!

This is by far the best BBQ experience I have had next to Franklin's brisket in ATX! And from top to bottom it may surpassed it with its sides. The burnt ends is phenomenal, the pulled pork and pulled chicken are smoked to perfection where it's dry because of the smoke but flavorful and not dried out. The St. Louis Ribs are literally fall off the bone and the dry rub is so good it needs no sauce. The brisket is actually Texas style brisket and is better than some place in Texas. Their sauces are really good as well and I didn't do the vinegar sauce because I'm not a vinegar guy, but their house BBQ sauce and the Habanero version is good. Their BBQ beans are legit and has meat in it. Their other sides were delicious according to my colleagues. And our server Wil was very hospitable and provided great real recommendations and great service. But if you are in Charlotte and you are going to eat... EAT here!
Great Father's Day Service. Christie is awesome. He truly enjoyed his Father's Day. Full rack of ribs for him with the Sunday special Bloody Mary. Brisket for me (not pictured)...always fatty.

My fiancé and I were from out of town and this place had the best reviews, so we thought why not. We had the queso and beef brisket, it was amazing. My fiancé had the Texas hash which is their Sunday special. The Texas hash had fried onions, pepper, fried eggs, Texas toast, brisket and avocado. The Texas hash was packed with flavor, the brisket itself was really flavorful in it. I had the half rack of ribs. The ribs were out of this world they offered two different sauces for the ribs, one was a  habanero bbq sauce and then a sweeter tomato bbq sauce it was hard to choose which one they were both really good. For sides we tried the coleslaw, Mac and cheese, and bbq baked beans. However, I would not recommend the Mac and cheese, very plain and didn't really have flavor the noodles were also tough. However, the baked beans were really good. Then we also tried the banana pudding, it was only 2.50. It was amazing, don't forget to try that.  I wish I remembered our waitresses name, but she was really friendly and went out of her way to explain everything to us considering it was our first time. Highly recommend this place. Will come back when we are back in town.

Damn. What a sweet place to get some BBQ. Today was my first visit. I ordered a chicken BBQ small plate with mustard sauce which comes with hushpups and one side, and I chose Bacon-wrapped Jalapeños, which r00led hard. Got myself the $3 beer of the month which was New Belgium Fat Tire. Yum. What a delicious meal.   My vegetarian lady friend got the Black bean burger and that tasted great plus creamed corn. Nom.   The meal was cooked extremely quickly so that was great.  Excellent food overall, I'll definitely be back to try something new.  Mac's has a run for its money.

This new location is a just a shadow of the original. It lacks a lot of the things that make the original location great. The character of the Plaza Midwood location is gone, and this location feels like any chain place in the area.   While the food was pretty good, my wife and I had a generally bad service experience. Our waitress was far from attentive, so ordering and getting refills was a tedious process. The worst thing came hidden in our chips and queso: random nasty, burned pieces of fryer garbage were strewn throughout our chips. Apparently general kitchen cleanliness is an issue at this location. Worse yet, when we brought the issue up to our waitress, she barely apologized and didn't comp it at all.   Overall, I won't be back to this location, even if I'm in the area. There are too many food choices in Charlotte to settle for mediocrity.

My hunt for the best barbecue in Charlotte has come to an end. I came to Midwood Smokehouse with my wife and the in-laws last weekend, and we were all wowed. We ordered   Right away, I was pleased by the drink and beer selection. There are a lot of local brews available, and there are more than just the usual suspects. As far as the food menu went, it was really, really hard to make a choice. Everything sounds and looks terrific. I went with the burnt ends with hush puppies and mac and cheese, which were all fantastic. My table also had a sampler platter, which included pulled pork, some sides, and some wings. My mother-in-law got a salad; I didn't try it, but she loved it.   I really don't think you can go wrong here. Now that I've tried the BBQ staples, I'm excited to try some of their more inventive options on the menu. There's a lot on the menu to explore, and I'm looking forward to the journey.

If you're wanting something close to Texas food (I said "close to it" because aint nothing like Texas! Lol), this is the place to go. My husband & I went & got the combo platter full-fed plate for both of us. It came with hush puppies, pickles onion, fries, cream corn, & 4 4-8 oz. of your protein ... we asked for 3 sides of lean brisket, & 1 of hickory smoked sausage.   Sausage has cheese inside so i personally didn't like it but my husband did.   The cream corn, the closest thing i can describe it to you is if you've ever been to Bill Millers Its Kinda the same as their sweet corn but it has a little twist to it because they put pieces of jalapeños here & the corn is also a little tooo soft. But still good.
Place was great, classy, and Mac and cheese was on point. Brisket is what you should obviously get

I fell in love with the place after my ex's parents took me there because they absolutely loved the peach cobbler there. I had the ribs and they were perfect, falling off the bone and excellent BBQ sauce. My ex had the chicken sandwich and I fell in love with their mustard BBQ sauce. The only thing I didn't really like was the Mac & Cheese, I didn't like the spiral noodles it seemed like they were not fully cooked, and it lacked flavor. But all in all I will definitely go back again.

I'm not big on BBQ but my boyfriend is and we both loved this place! Our server, Drew, was awesome.  He was incredibly helpful and friendly.   Agree with all of the other post that recommend the bacon wrapped jalapeños and also the brisket and ribs.  All of the meat we had was cooked perfectly and delicious. Highly suggest trying this place! Will definitely be back!

Wow.  Amazing BBQ place. Went for first time yesterday.  The burnt ends were the best. Bloody Mary's were watery IMO.  Brisket and coleslaw was great.  Not a huge fan of the collards.  Great place and we will be back soon!

Sunday night at 8:00 pm and place was packed.  Good sign.   Great vibe. Reminds me of great joints in Austin. Nothing in KC has this kind of vibe. Good rock music. 70s 80s. Classic Sammy Haggar.  Manager was an awesome guy.   Very limited parking.   Great beer selection.   Good service. Beers promptly refilled.   Fatty brisket was amazing. Could pull it apart with a fork. Not a lot of flavor from the bark. Definitely not a salt /pepper rub.   Sausage was fantastic.  Hard to explain vs traditional BBQ joint sausage.  Amazing with the brown mustard.   Pulled chicken was amazing. Loads of flavor and very juicy and tender.  Pulled and dressed with the vinegar-based sauce.   Pork didn't overwhelm me.  That was the one thing I was expecting to be good.   They were out of the St. Louis style BBQ ribs. :(  I'm giving the food 3 stars and the atmosphere takes it to 4 stars.

Some of the best barbecue I've ever had. The North Carolina vinegar sauce was perfect, and the smoke on the pork was so flavorful! The sweet potato fries and Mac and cheese and creamed corn were tops, but the hush puppies and cole slaw weren't great.  Good prices, nice atmosphere, cheap beer. Overpriced cocktails and my personal disappointment in my slaw kept me from rating this 5 stars, but I would definitely go back. Great place.

As a resident on Plaza-Midwood, this place must be in the top 3 of my favorites.  It gets crowded very quickly, especially on the weekends.  I am a huge BBQ fan and I have made the switch from my previous preference tomato based sauces to now a vinegar based sauce.  I do, however, from time to time get the habanero BBQ sauce which is awesome and has a nice kick!  The brisket is starting to become a favorite of mine but you definitely cannot go wrong with their pulled pork.  I am a sucker for the queso app with a little meat mixed in.  PBR is very cheap and I am all about it at this place.  Parking is scarce but you can definitely find a place across the street and across from the new apartments.  I usually get a sneaky take out when my wife works late but that is all screwed up since she will see this.  Midwood Smokehouse is a must go to spot if you are in the area and want some good BBQ.  Awesome!
This barbecue place is awesome! Great ribs that fall off the bone, great bourbon, atmosphere, and music. Can't be beat and highly recommend their bacon wrapped jalapeños.

I've been seeking a good spot for southern dishes and decided to give this place a go based on Yelp rating.  I got the Carolina pork platter with a side of mac n cheese and BBQ baked beans.  Very filling.  Probably would have tasted better if I ate right away.  The baked beans were my favorite.  Very flavorful although a tad salty.  Very much like a bushes baked beans but probably better.  The mustard bbq sauce reminded me so much of Maurice's BBQ Mustard that I grew up on when we had Sunday dinner but they have it spicy.  I may return but not floored.  Oh yeah pick up for orders are on the opposite side of the wall at the bar. How stupid to not even get acknowledged standing between the bar's doorway?...

Hey don't let the 3 stars get you wrong. This place was great. The service was attentive and helpful. The ambiance is amusing and the soundtrack was classic. I had the combo plater with brisket, smoked turkey, sausage and pulled pork with coleslaw and bacon wrapped poppers. Yes, I will be checking into the nearest hospital for the impending heart attack.  The sauces are served on the side in small dipping cups. I prefer squirt bottles to having to ask for more BBQ sauce (I like lots of BBQ). The turkey was great as well as the pork and sausage. Here is the 'but', the brisket was served with the grizzle still attached. Ok maybe that's just how they serve it here. The problem with this is the fat out weighed the beef. It broke away nicely but I barely was able to enjoy the tender meat before it was gone. Concluding, I had a good meal with only one gripe. Enjoy yourself here.

Swung by this place for a protein rich snack after church on Sunday. The place has that rustic feel to  it that you would expect at a BBQ joint, and there is a quaint little patio area outside for dining as well.   My fiancé suggested the smoked wings, and Midwood Smokehouse didn't disappoint! The wings were smokey and actually seasoned very well without the seasoning being overbearing. The sauce was great, but it honestly wasn't required.   Our waiter was Zach, and although we only ordered two sets of wings and a Bloody Mary, he treated us as though we had a $150 tab. We interacted with several over staff members during our stay that were extremely pleasant as well.   I would recommend this location if you had a choice !

This place is awesome! My wife and I had an hour or two to kill in Charlotte so we stopped in for lunch. Great beer selection and a simple menu. I had the pulled pork plate with bacon wrapped jalapeños and I couldn't have been more happy.  I lived in Charlotte for about a year and was always fond of the Thomas st area. There is a lot going on here. I would definitely recommend stopping in here if you are up for some great wood smoked BBQ!

This food is absolutely phenomenal!  I first visited this place a few years ago after reading an article in the NY Times ("36 Hours in Charlotte, NC -- http://www.nytimes.com/2014/08/31/travel/things-to-do-in-36-hours-in-charlotte-nc.html?_r=0) and have been back several times since.  My favorite things to order are... - BBQ Queso (app) - Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos (app or side) - Classic Mac & Cheese (side) - Dry Rubbed Ribs (entree) - Well Fed Combo Platter (entree for 2) - Stockyard taco (entree)  The restaurant itself can get a little crowded.  Go early to avoid a long wait.  Outdoor seating (on a covered and climate-controlled patio) is available and is what I prefer.  Parking can be a little cumbersome.  The original restaurant is in Plaza Midwood.  They have since expanded to Ballantyne and have plans to expand in Park Rd. Shopping Center.

I read an article that said this place had great BBQ before visiting Charlotte so I thought I would give it a try!   The place  This is their new location that opened not too long ago.  It was your average chain looking place plenty of parking and nice on the inside but nothing special.  Very clean which is a big plus with me.   The food  I ordered the ribs and they were good but nothing special.  I was really hoping for better but they were nothing to write home about.  I heard that the original place is better so maybe next time I will try their other location. My sides again were solid but nothing special.  The service We had a group of 10 and our waitress was great she was very kind and attentive.    The verdict  I really had high hopes since reading this place had great BBQ since it is my favorite type of food.  I was disappointed when it was nothing great.  I would come here again but don't except anything above the average chain.

Arrived into town 6/25 and didn't know where to go for lunch. We decided on BBQ and headed to Midwood Smokehouse and were seated outside. We had burnt ends and pulled chicken with very crispy sweet potato fries. It was delicious!!! The mustard sauce that came with the chicken was tasty and different. BBQ sauce that was brought to the table was perfection. Coleslaw was a nice way to cool some of the spicy food down. Our ice teas with firefly vodka were spot on! Our waiter, dark brown beard and hair, was very informative about the menu and town. Service was great! Definitely returning to eat here next time in town.
Got the combo platter. I'd rate: 1. Fatty brisket 2. Smoked sausage 3/4 pork or chicken depending on my mood.  Try the bacon wrapped jalapeños.

There is no questions about, THIS IS THE BEST BBQ IN CHARLOTTE!  We came over here for a family lunch and we have ordered the 4 meats plate with sides. Everything was absolutely fantastic! The ribs are probably the best ones I have ever had. I have ordered the hush puppies but they never came, so, I can't rate those.  Anyway, if this place wasn't too far from my home (I live at Lake Norman) I would come here a lot more often.

Oh Midwood, how I love thee. This was the first place my husband and I ate in Charlotte when we decided to move here a few months ago. We had sat at the bar, ordered way too much food, and left happy and stuffed. We ended up moving very close by, so now it's a place we've been visiting about once a week. The staff is so friendly here and the service is great. Whether you sit at the bar, in the dining room, or on the nice patio, it's a relaxing place to have a meal.   We love their nachos with brisket on top, and also the cheese fries with brisket on top. Really, just give me brisket on top of anything and I'm good to go. We often split the pork plate. The pork melts in your mouth and has great flavor, and they also have a lot of great BBQ sauces to put on it. I love their hushpuppies, which are always fresh, and we're also big fans of the mac and cheese, collard greens, and baked beans. The pork plate is so huge we often have leftovers that we heat up with breakfast the next morning, and it's just as good. In general their portions are very large for the price. We always have leftovers, even when we try not to order too much.   Midwood also does take out really well. We ordered their smoked wings, a brisket quesadilla, and pork plate to go, and it was all packed so nicely. The brisket quesadilla is so, so good, so I'd highly recommend that whether you want it as a meal or need a snack to share.   Their banana pudding is also delicious, and they have a lot of great beers on tap including a "big size" that my husband beelines for whenever we dine in. They also have great cocktails, which I really didn't expect. I recently had a bourbon/mint/thyme drink that was delicious. There's so many other delicious things on the menu that we have to come back for, especially the ribs. If you're looking for a casual but nice dining experience and great BBQ, check out Midwood.
Awesome barbecue, probably the best in Charlotte. Tons of beer on tap (17 i think) including Red Oak which is awesome. Staff was friendly and good even when they were clearly in the weeds.

Man oh man! Bit my fingers twice eating this loveliness! I went with a platter and was not disappointed. Everything was great, atmosphere, food, drinks and service.   I especially liked the non lean brisket and chicken wings. My daughter raved about the red neck tacos. I'd move from DC to Charlotte to sample this every week, 10 stars!!!
sometimes the service is THE WORST. but, I have dreams about the chopped salad with chicken. SO GOOD. take it from this Memphis girl, this is probably the only BBQ place in NC I will eat.
The food was amazing. Manager came by several times to check on us. Our server Gary was on point and super accommodating. Highly recommend this new location, it's good and friendly staff

Yep...that's it, this place makes it all the way up to my #1 spot for Q.  Finally had the pleasure of giving it a try the other night and dined on some absolutely delicious beef brisket.  Brisket is a pretty tricky thing because it can dry easily and become very chewy, etc.  This on the other hand was falling apart it was so juicy and tender.  Prior to stuffing my face with the brisket I enjoyed some jalapeño peppers wrapped in bacon...good lord!  The temperature will sneak up on you so be careful but the taste is oh so good.  Great beer selections and a cozy neighborhood restaurant feel really seal the deal for me.  I'll be back.....OFTEN :)
AMAZING FOOD. Try he burnt ends and fried jalapeños, but don't you dare miss their juicy, perfectly prepared burgers.   I have dreams about them!
This is where you wanna go for BBQ in the QC but go early though cause they run out fast. Just evidence of how good it is.
Midwood was awesome!! I had the beef brisket with smoked vegetables...I'm not a barbeque fan but I really enjoyed it. Service was great

Some of the menu items were definitely hit or miss. One of my biggest complaints when going to a restaurant (because I used to be a chef) is bringing out cold or just warm food. I would have given this restaurant a clean four stars for environment, food, and customer service. The bartenders were very friendly and attentive when it came to checking on us and meeting our needs and requests as customers. But the food (entire platter was lukewarm at best.)  Coming all the way from Baltimore to try charlotte's famous Carolina BBQ, serving warm meat at a BBQ spot is totally uncalled for. Regardless, neat location to dine grab a beer and watch football. It don't really have that BWW feel for a sports bar but it's a nice adjustment for decent BBQ.

This place is great, plan to wait, it's worth it! The pulled pork was tender, moist, and just enough bark for flavor. I recommend the house sauce, has an. Nice little smokey taste to it. BBQ beans were great too, another had the brisket, said it was great too. We left full and happy, it's a bit loud, but a great time had by all.
Good service and good basic BBQ but nothing out of this world.  I had burnt ends, which were good.  Good draft beer selection.

I'm in South Carolina and I wanted barbecue! So I looked around and came across this place. There's nothing fancy about this place, just straight up Western "looking" atmosphere with lots of wood everywhere and smug paintings on the wall. Thursdays are 1/2 off wine bottles so you know I got one of them! When I come to barbecue places or smokehouse restaurants I ALWAYS get the combo! So here I got the "Well Fed" portion of chopped pork, beef brisket, chopped chicken and hickory smoked sausage. I had macaroni & cheese and steamed vegetables as my sides. Everything was amazing. Fresh, tender, full of flavor, hot and just good. I will certainly come back here to feast!
Best ribs in Charlotte BAR NONE, their reputation speaks for themselves but it's no contest hands down best ribs in Charlotte.

We went to Midwood Smokehouse on a Monday which was excellent because they have North Carolina draft beers for 1/2 price!  We drank great beer for a super low price.  I had the chicken sandwich with mustard sauce which was great, and a side of mac & cheese, also great!  I tried a bite of my friends pork sandwich with the vinegar sauce and loved it.  I also asked for a side of the Midwood sauce to try and dip the crinkle cut french fries in and was very impressed!  The coleslaw was chopped up very fine and very flavorful.  Our waiter was very nice and helpful.  The prices are very reasonable.  A couple of downsides, unfortunately they didn't have any ribs yet available for us to try.  All the more reason to go back on a Monday and enjoy those $2.50 beers!  Also the hostess seemed very flustered and told us our table would take at least 15-20 minutes when in fact we waited for less than 5.  Luckily we didn't believe her first assessment since there was no one else waiting or we might have left....  Would be disappointing to lose customers because of this!

All I have to say is YUM!!! THE BURNT ENDS ARE AMAZING !! It is so tough to find BURNT ENDS that are done right and these guys know how to do it!! Thank you for awesome food and great customer service.
Live in Kansas City, and the Fat Tire BBQ sauce here is hands down my favorite!!! Casual, nice outside patio.

Everything on the menu is delicious. Recommended to come here by the hotel guest service manager. Pulled Pork is to good for it's own good. Portions are good all around. Get the baked beans and the smoked wings. Come ready to eat here. Great service on top of the amazing food!

Yum, glad I looked on Yelp.  Milwood Smokehouse was fantastic.  Ate the sampler and it was worth every bite.  Left no morsel behind.  Always looking for great BBQ and everything was spot on tonight.  Yes Mac and cheese and yes on the bacon wrapped jalapeño poppers.  Also great friendly service.  How many local beers?  Great selection just bring me one.   Will be returning.
Arrived just before the dinner rush apparently, although there were still quite a few people. Got sat, got our food in a very timely manner and the food was great. Great service and environment.

This place makes me proud to be an American...  Good manhattans, great IPAs.  BBQ so good you'll want to slap your Grandma...  Hight level cleanliness.  Encountered staff in the restroom that did three cycle hand wash.  I thought he was getting ready for surgery...  Wait staff was very helpful in determining how to set up My first order to best experience the offering.    Try the cuban, ribs and wings.  You wont be disappointed!  A true piece of Americana...  love it

Midwood Smokehouse claims to be Eastern NC Style Barbeque. I know not. I had their Barbeque Sandwich, this evening and was not impressed. Though it was my first visit, I was expecting, at least a mediocre sandwich, at best. What I first discovered, was a bread sandwich, with a small amount of pork barbeque, atop a 4" bun. The barbeque tasted less than mediocre.  True Eastern NC Barbeque is from the WHOLE HOG, not from butts and/or shoulders. I don't mind paying $8 for a great sandwich; but one that was so disappointing as this one was, I wouldn't pay $4 for it. Also, the crinkle-cut fries were cold. You'd think that for $8, they'd cut fresh taters and fry them. I suggest doing your homework about NC Style Barbeque. Seasoned Apple-Cider Vinegar is used and it's Chopped.

My favorite BBQ place in CLT!  I have eaten at the Ballantyne location a few times and it never disappoints.  I have eaten at the Plaza Midwood location many times and it is excellent as well  I have had the Burt ends as well as the pulled pork sandwich.  Both are great. I highly recommend the stuffed jalapeños - they are awesome.  If you are looking for great BBQ then try this place

Yelp helped us find this place and --whoooo boy, were we in for a treat!  Ordered the 4 meat + 2 side platter.  All the meats were great.  All the sauces, too.  But here's why I really appreciated Smokehouse and gave you 5 stars.  The coleslaw and hush puppies were fresh, delicious and had some thought behind them.  I feel like with lots of BBQ places they spend so much time on the meat that the sides and (god forbid!) the hush puppies are a ho-hum afterthought.  Not so here.  Bravo.  --Oh wait, but I didn't give you 5 stars and here's why...  The reason you don't get 5 stars from me is because of the kid's food.  We ordered chicken fingers and mac-n-cheese for our 3 year old.  My food philosophy with kids is that they are basically small adults and shouldn't be coddled to with garbage, dumbed-down, obviously-from-a-bag chicken fingers.  You guys clearly respect meat so how's about making something good for the kiddos? --Something less spicy and less seasoned than the grown up choices but still actual good food...not frozen junk.

Food was pretty tasty. From previous reviews and recent rank from "BOB" Barbecue in Charlotte, it didn't disappoint.  I ordered the Burnt Ends with Mac N Cheese, hubby got a Pulled Pork sandwich and fries, kids got Grilled Cheese and Apples. I also got a container of Sweet Potatoes fries (I can't turn those away.). Everything was above par for a BBQ joint. Burnt Ends had a lot of sauce on them which made it a little underwhelming.  However,  the Mac n Cheese and Sweet Potatoes Fries made up for it. Grilled Cheese and regular fries were average. Hubby's Pulled Pork sandwich looked amazing. I didn't try it but it looked really tasty.   Only bummer was there's no drink specials on Saturdays. But a bottle of Johnny Appleseed was only $4! We would definitely go back at least for additional drink specials during the week. Plus I need to try the Pulled Pork Sandwich.

The food used to be great when they first opened their Ballantyne location. I thought I would not miss Sticky Fingers.  But now?? OMG! I ordered their $24 combo platter (because that is the most cost effective way to have two types of meats, they make you order FOUR and spend $24!). I only ate less than half of the food. It wasn't great tasting. THEN an hour later - let's just say I got SICK and spent the next hour in the bathroom. I'll NEVER be back!!!

This was our first visit to this location. Service is the main issue. I ordered the small chopped salad & a brisket sandwich. My wife had the pork sandwich. The salad came out with my sandwich & had the wrong dressing with it. I sent the salad back because of the timing. My wife liked her sandwich. The waitress asked if she was finished before she was finished. She then presented the check & had to take it back because my wife wanted the banana pudding. She described the BP as cake, banana & whipped cream:(  P.S. What's with the blaring hard rock music...country would be so much more appropriate.

Doesn't matter where in the country you are from, and that's including all of those proclaimed bbq capitals of the world, this is as good as it gets!!  Midwood knows smoked meats and absolutely slams side dishes!  Having visited more than this location, I can attest to the fact that they're consistent at any location.  Their smoked wings are just incredible, and without a doubt, are just the best I've ever had anywhere!
