The smoked pulled pork and beef brisket or just as tender as can be and so full of flavor that I personally do not even have to add their house made sauce! The beef brisket salad is out of this world, and when combined with their avocado cream dressing, is just heavenly! From their Mack and cheese, to their barbecue baked beans, and their bacon wrapped jalapeños, their sides are a winner no matter what you decide to choose! I have to also add that the staff at this location was just as friendly and helpful as it's been at other locations!  Midwood is the place for smoked meats!

What have you been smoking if you haven't given Midwood Smokehouse a minimum of four, but perhaps even a five star rating? I knew the Charlotte area had some great BBQ places, even had a couple of go-to's myself. Well, I thought I did! Until today, March 25th, I realized that I hadn't experienced the area's best BBQ! Midwood does it all and does it well! From the start you notice every server with a upbeat, charming, and eager to get you anything kinda attitude! Mine, Lorilee, was incredibly prompt, charming, and personable! From the time the Smoked Wings hit the table I knew this was special! Ordered dry with sauce on the side, these wings were smokey, plump, juicy, and the best wings in Charlotte hands down! To not feel too guilty, I ordered the Brisket Salad which made me feel ridiculously guilty! Full of tender brisket, smokey corn, real bacon, black beans, avocado, fresh lettuce, and fresh tomatoes! Incredibly good it was indeed! Then came the small Pulled Pork platter which had more meat than I'd first thought. Tender, juicy, flavorful, and though tossed in Eastern sauce it didn't disappoint. The side of Baked Beans had some pulled pork, possible bacon, and perhaps burnt ends in it which made it the highlight of the meal. Yes a side item stole the show which should tell you that they aren't just concentrating on the meats! I regret that I'll never step foot in my two favorites in Charlotte again, but hey, step up to Midwood's game!

Great experience! I had the Carolina pork, bacon wrapped jalapeños, and smoked veggies. I didn't care for the veggies because they were a little bland, so I got the collard greens instead and they were amazing. We also had the BBQ queso which I added brisket, jalapeños, and barbecue sauce to and it was awesome. The food was delicious and our server Jessica took great care of us. I told her I like sauces and she brought me every single sauce the place has to offer and packed them all to go. I'll definitely be back!

There was no wait on a Wednesday night.  The staff was friendly and attentive.  Ribs, Smoked Chicken, collards and Mac & cheese.  The meats were all tender, ribs were the star, everything else was decent.

Had an (unusual) craving for BBQ and decided to try Midwood Smokehouse. Parking lot was full at 12:30, as were the bar and restaurant. Did a ToGo order of a half rack of ribs w.crispy fries as my side. Got in my car, opened the fries to have a few, but they were so good I ate a little more than a few! Tawny golden, thinner then usual crinkle cuts which actually came as a full side, in it's own separate container (yay!). The hefty Texas style ribs were smokey, very moist, topped with a smear of a tomato-based, sweet & savory sauce and fell-off-the bone! Look at how much meat was on them! I only ate 2! Hush puppies, a side of BBQ sauce and slivers of sweet onion also come with the meal. This is the best BBQ I have ever eaten! This gem is somewhat hidden so I forget it's there, but not anymore! I'll go back to try other food, bc the dishes coming out of the kitchen looked scrumptious! Even better, the staff was courteous, friendly and very well trained. $15 well spent!
the food is good no excellent. But what is more remarkable is that they have gluten free options. No I can't eat everything but what I can eat is worth the wait.
I came here for dinner one Sunday the atmosphere was very nice and enjoyable the food was good as well I just wish the barbecue sauce was thicker
Subpar food but the service is the worst. Waited a hour and 10 on food I know it's a busy Friday night but they don't have it together at all

I crave these smoked wings all the time. They are juicy and delicious! Fantastic people watching very fun atmosphere and good drink specials! My husband had the bbq pot roast once ( I normally do not like pot roast) and it was absolutely amazing so much flavor and just yum!

So I had high hopes for this place. My experience was absolutely atrocious.   First my waiter Brian wasn't the best. He was friendly but he seemed complacent in the fact that he didn't need to really need to deal with us.   Second, when I received my order. I ordered lean brisket. It was more than 1/2 fat. They take it back and bring it back within a minute telling me yes this is lean brisket... well I had another waitress come over (who she was a doll. I wish I caught her name but she did great) and check up on us. Well I asked her and she didn't seem to sure that it was the lean brisket. In fact both waiters had said it wasn't lean when they looked at it.   So the manager comes over. He is very dismissive. Explaining lean has a sliver of fat. Well yes I understand that, so why is my brisket more than half fat on each piece? Explain this.   He takes my plate back, only cuts off the fat. Doesn't even give me new pieces, bother fixing up my plate nothing. So two times my plate was taken to the back and brought back as if they didn't give a shit.  And to top it off we also ordered brisket queso... yes you guessed it, most of the "brisket" was fat.   No I will not be coming back to this place, modern smoke was better and we all have read their reviews.

Tonight was my first time visiting this establishment. I was there with a group of friends. The seating was fast even though our first table was in a bad spot and the waiter was rude. I requested to be moved. From then to the end of the night, service was PERFECT. Our waiter was Erik. He was fast with delivering drinks as well as taking our orders. He was funny and had a smile on his face all night. I ordered the pulled pork with the mac and cheese. Other friends ordered the brisket, ribs, and half chicken. ALL was delicious! Dessert was awesome as well. It was a peaches and cream cobbler! Can you say yum!? I will definitely be going back! Thanks Erik for saving us from the first rude waiter!

Awesome North Carolina BBQ!  My family and I are down here from Iowa at our nieces wedding and I wanted to experience some traditional NC BBQ as opposed to the traditional sweet and saucy Kansas City BBQ we are used to in the Midwest (which is also awesome by the way).  We did not leave disappointed or hungry.  The service was outstanding and friendly.  The outside seating was great.  The fried pickles left my fried pickle fan daughter impressed.   My vegetarian daughter even crossed over to the "dark side" for an evening with the moist pulled pork dinner.  I must say I am a fan of the spicy/tangy North Carolina vinegar based sauce and the baked beans were the best I've ever had.  Spicy and meaty.  A definite winner!
Solid bbq. Good beer selection. Convenient location right in the heart of Plaza Midwood.

After car searching for abt 3hrs, my son and I were hungry and wanted something different. Leaving Independence Blvd. we ventured down Central Ave. surveiling the various restaurants situated along this immensely busy hipster enclave. "No, I don't want pizza," No, I don't want fish tacos," No I don't want a burger or ramen,!!!  My son spotted Midwood Smokehouse and took an immediate right. Oh my gosh, never knew I was missing this!!! Have seen Midwood profiled on various local morning shows and I'm a sparerib officianato!!!  I ordered the burnt ends w/Mac & cheese. Son ordered the BBQ plate w/creamed corn. We shared a large chopped salad(delicious) as appetizer. Oh, I also had crinkle cut fries, my fav, as 2nd side. I love into those hot, crispy fries 1st thing. OMG, even the ketchup was good!!! Needless to say, most of our food was bagged up to take home. The burnt ends, phenomenal!!! The BBQ chopped pork, delicious!!! U rarely find a restaurant where everything on ur plate is outstanding. Midwood Smokehouse has managed to accomplish this. Cheers!!!!

Midwood gets better every time we try it.  Lately we've been ordering to go. Which I realized has become quite popular. People seem to order their smoked meat by the pound. Recently I've been ordering the wings and sweet potato fries. The wings are smoked and I choose to have them dipped in their sauce. This is my favorite kind of wing!!! I love them grilled or smoked versus fried or baked. My husband gets the chopped salad once with chicken and another with salmon. He said it was amazing.
Family Pulled Pork Sandwich and BBQ BEANS. Best BBQ EAST of Salt Lick and Sonny Bryan's so far

I hate being "that table" but some times its just unavoidable. Going to dinner with a large group, majority being kids can be challenging. Add in alcohol and the adults can be equally just as much of pains. Thankfully our kickass server (Dylan) was able to maintain control. Although I do apologize again for our repeated spillings (by the adults).  I came in wanting to try everything. The only meat I didn't include in my order was the burnt ends. It'll have to wait till my next visit. As for everything else, we loved it. Jalapeno's wrapped in bacon were great. Also tried some fries with pork or brisket on them.. The ribs were delicious and fell right off the bone. Pulled pork was exactly how I like. The chicken was my least favorite but even that was good. Sides were what you would normally expect from a place like this.   If you haven't been to Midwood and you live in Charlotte, you are missing out.
Fantastic BBQ.  Legit NC style.  I know.  I'm a big man who eats BBQ all over this great land.  The service is fast and friendly.  Molly is the best of them all!!  Come show these people some love!

I love the fun atmosphere of Midwood Smokehouse. The service has been good at the bar. This last time I ordered the roasted chicken, collards and vinegar slaw. I thought that the chicken was a bit dryer than I would like. The first time I ordered the chicken it was just right so maybe this was an anomaly. The collards and slaw were very fine. The take out packaging was good and the bartender checked everything before I left. The biggest negative is their wine offerings. Their beer selection is great but if you are not a beer drinker and prefer wine, it's pretty slim and just "OK" even though they serve the wine in very cool cafeteria milk glasses from my youth... Lets put forth a bit more effort on wine please.

The portions were alright. I wouldn't say it's the best, everything has this tangy flavor that I didn't really appreciate. The large sizes are pretty pricey when you get just about the same size as the small. It's alright in general. Nothing major.

My husband and I had been anxiously awaiting the opening of Midwood Smokehouse in Ballantyne.  We went opening weekend and loved it!  Attentive service, friendly staff, hot and fresh food - overall a great experience.  We have been talking about going back and we're looking forward to making it a regular dining out spot.    Fast forward to today - 4th of July.  From the moment outer server came to the table, it was obvious she didn't want to be there.  Same went for management, food runners, etc.  By the time the meal came my husband and I felt like we didn't want to be there either.  Then the food... It was gross.  So apprentice the cooks didn't want to be there either.  We got a plate with 4 meats... The brisket was dry and lukewarm.  The pulled pork was also dry and cold.  The ribs were the only thing that came out hot besides the macaroni and cheese.  Our server didn't come to check on us, we flagged down a food runner to ask for some hot fries, the second set of fries also came back cold!    It's unfortunate that no one wanted to work today.  It has potential, as we loved our first visit.  But went downhill quickly.  Maybe a hot or miss depending on the day.

Usually when you are in walking distance from your hotel that equals poor food options - NOT the case here. Instant classic. Amazing staff/service - out of this world NC b'que - mac n' cheese/hush puppies....hold me. Went twice in one day. If you are near their locations and want legit NC Barbecue, do yourself a favor and stop in.

Fantastic barbecue in Ballantyne!  (I haven't been to the Plaza-Midwood location so I can't compare the two.)    The burnt ends are delicious; the beef brisket is amazing; the chopped pork is awesome.  I have always gotten excellent, friendly service here.  I brought some foodies from Chicago here- they admitted they were skeptical at first due to the squeaky clean strip mall location (which is, of course, how we roll in South Charlotte)- but they totally freaked out about how legit the food is.  I love this place.

Doesn't compare to Mac's Speed Shop.  My first visit went well, a lazy Sunday afternoon with a couple buddies when they weren't too busy.  The menu looks really good but the pulled pork I ordered didn't stand up to Mac's.  My buddy liked it better than Mac's, but I think he's biased since he lives 2 miles from Midwood Smokehouse (to be honest, I live 2 miles away from Mac's).  My second visit was a complete disaster.  Originally planned to go to Mac's this past Friday (Jun 24) with 5 out-of-town buddies plus 2 others, and got talked into changing to Midwood Smokehouse (same buddy as above).    While their menu states they may run out of bbq from time to time (never seen a restaurant advertise running out of food before, but whatever), they were out of pulled pork bbq on Friday night at 8:00, and also out of bacon wrapped jalepenos (gotta love the south, they wrap everything in bacon).  I ordered a rack of ribs to compare to Mac's and they tasted like they were cooked in the oven as they had zero smoke flavor.  The bbq sauce didn't help at all, too bland.  The waiter hooked us up with wings since they were out of pork bbq and the wings were supposedly smoked but had zero flavor.  No rub, no sauce, no nothin.  The mac & cheese however was very good (close to Mac's).  I tried my buddy's sausage and it was dry and tasted like cardboard.  Midwood Smokehouse has been open for only 2 months, hopefully they step up their game!

From the moment we walked in to the last drink....awesome experience! Michael crushed it! He shared the favorites, spoke to the changes on the menu and the adult beverage variety is fantastic...the BURNT ENDS were monstrous and packed full of flavor!!!  I'll fly back again!
I loved this place! I got the brisket which was perfect and the mac n cheese was so good! Probably my favorite bbq place in Charlotte. The atmosphere was very warm and our waitress was friendly!
Very good spot for bbq and smoked wings. Good local beer and bourbon selection. Very casual setting but the service was above average.

I ordered the bacon wrapped jalapeños, beef brisket and Mac and cheese. EVERYTHING was excellent! This is definitely a place that will stay on my go to list. They provide a good quantity of food for the cost. I'm looking forward to my leftovers for lunch tomorrow.
Some of the best food we have ever had, the sides are amazing and the bbq and brisket are wonderful.
Bigger fan of the Midwood - Central Ave - not a big fan of the Ballantyne location - loved the brisket - mac and cheese - just okay - love the dessert - great service

I visited Midwood to help settle a bet between friends on what is better... Macs or Midwood. I will start this review by saying that I tend to prefer NC vinegar-based BBQ. However, arguably my favorite part of BBQ is the delicious sides, yum! This is were Midwood let me down. While the beans were very good, the mac and cheese was dry and congealed (not very appetizing at all). We also tried the bacon wrapped stuffed jalapeno peppers. These were good, but nothing too special. We tried the Carolina Pork and the Burnt Ends. I was not a fan of the sauce on the Burnt Ends. The pork was good, we tried all the sauces and they were decent, but they were a little stingy on them. I love sauce and am use to having a squirt bottle full of sauce. Overall it was ok, but I definitely prefer Macs or 521.

Whatever you do, get the pulled pork on SOMETHING.  ANYTHING.  You can buy the meat by the pound, so consider taking some home with you.  The pulled pork makes for one AMAZING omelet.  Trust me, my friends.  There's a lot to love at Midwood, and some of my favorites are the pulled pork sandwich, pull pork Cuban sandwich, brisket sloppy joes, queso with pulled pork, and the Midwood chop salad with pulled pork and avocado goddess dressing.  You get your choice of BBQ sauce, and my favorite is the Eastern NC.  The mac and cheese and hushpuppies are great as well.

My sister and I were visiting from NJ and wanted to get some good barbeque while down south. We split the combo platter and it blew our taste buds (in a good way)! The brisket, ribs, and pulled pork were just melt-in-your flavorful, even without the sauces. Which, by the way, THE SAUCES: some sort of magical mustard, a sweetly vinegar-y NC style sauce, and the best classic BBQ sauce I've ever had. Add to that some delicious hushpuppies & great service (thanks Mindy!), and I'd say it was a meal I'll dream about!

On the never ending search for good BBQ, I stopped in at Midwood last night.  Me and my entourage of 7 were greeted promptly by a friendly server who was in the beginning stages of laryngitis, poor guy.    A few members of my party were from out of town and we wanted to try a bit of everything.  We got the pulled pork and smoked turkey plates with a sample of all of their sauces.  The pulled pork was good, and their sauces were decent.  My party preferred the Fat Tire BBQ Sauce which was a bit too peppery and thick IMO but it did in a pinch.  Smoked turkey was a bit lacking and was a little dry.    The service was great and accommodating.  We were there on a mission and they accommodated all of our special requests without a roll of the eyes.  I passed by the "smokehouse" on my way in from the parking lot, but didn't taste the smoke int he food which was disappointing.  Their mayo slaw was overly chopped but had good flavor.  BBQ Slaw is never my thing but there's was ok.  Midwood has decent cue, don't get me wrong and if I Was on that side of town again and in the mood for BBQ I'd go again.

I tried this place last night, at the request of some friends visiting for the holidays. For one of them, it was their first NC BBQ experience and that makes me sad because this place leaves a lot to be desired.   First, they were out of three of the menu items we tried to order, one of which was ribs. How does that happen!? It was pretty busy, and this place seems to have a following, so maaaayyyyybe that's why. Still, it's a bummer to have your heart set on ribs when going to a smokehouse, only to find out they have none.  Second, since they were out of ribs, they offered to sub an item in their "well-fed" menu option FOR AN UP CHARGE. If you run out of an advertised item, and offer to substitute, don't follow that offer with a price tag.   Third, the food we ordered was bad. Plain and simple. The pulled pork and chicken were dry; the baked beans were more shredded meat than beans; the smoked veggies were flavorless and cold; and the coleslaw... well, that was actually pretty good. Our food also came with a side of hush puppies and "pickled" onions, both of which aren't even worth mentioning, really.   Fourth, the service was mixed. The hostess was super friendly, and we were seated fairly quick, despite a crowd. Or waiter wasn't exactly rude, but he also wasn't very good at his job. A few questions about their drink menu were answered with a very blunt "I have no idea" with absolutely zero effort to find an answer that was actually helpful. He checked in frequently enough, and was friendly-ish, so I guess that counts for something.   I walked out of this place feeling so confused. How can it be rated so high!? Did I catch them on an off night? Is it resting on its laurels vs it's actual abilities? Has no one who has eaten here ever eaten BBQ anywhere else, and therefore has no idea that this place is mediocre, at best? I really hate to give such a bad review to a Charlotte eatery, especially when I'm clearly in the minority by doing so. But I can't, in good-Yelping-faith, say otherwise.

I really enjoy their mac & cheese, I could eat it all day. I had the fatty brisket and it is very fatty and a bit salty. I think next time I will shift to the less fatty choice. Otherwise, I enjoyed the place. I've been there about three or four times now and I will return again.

Yes indeed, this joint was on point!! From the young, fun and courteous hostess, to the bar keep, this establishment knows how to take care of it's patrons.  I must admit that their smoked bacon wrapped jalapenos were tasty, but lacking any type of heat. Our waitress (Sheena/Sherra) said that too many customers complained that they were too hot, so they now remove all the seeds...booo!  Moving on, our meal was "SLAP YOUR MOMMA" delicious. Their grilled veggies were perfect, the chopped salad with green goddess dressing was heavenly and the rack of ribs was tasty as all get out! They offer up 3 types of sauce, house, mustard and a fiery jalapeno, I   tried each and all had their own goodness, but the jalapeno was my favorite.  Finished out this great meal with an amazingly delicious pecan cobbler ala mode that sent my taste buds into the stratosphere!

Excellent service. Fast food delivery. Everything tasted great. We shared the sampler plate with all the meats. My cocktail was superb. Creamed corn and mac and cheese were amazing. Palmetto cheese fries were just so so.
Great food, great atmosphere, reasonable lunch prices, lots of great local beers on tap.  Service was excellent and burnt ends were amazing

Food and service awesome. From the time we walked in and were seated we waited for nothing. Staff and management very attentive and food can I just say it my waist line is gone yummy we will continue to go back. Love everything affordable for my size family and barbecue like no other.
Crispy wings. Bacon wrapped jalapeños.  Whiskey.   I hope these items are mentioned in my eulogy and my funeral is catered by this place.   Stop what you're doing. This. Is. The. Place.

I come to midwood fairly often, and have spoken highly of them to others. Their food had always been great to me, but the last couple times I've been less than impressed.   The food was still okay - I love their sauces, but the jalapeño poppers were over cooked and mushy, the meat portions seem to have gotten smaller, and the service has become spotty.   My last visit was the worst service I've had here. Our food came out, and our server dropped our check off before I'd even taken a bite of my sandwich. He seemed to want us to leave, and I immediately felt in a rush to do so. He refilled my cup but neglected to refill my partners. And we definitely weren't hanging around to try to get anything else from Paul and inconvenience him. So instead of ordering desert (our check was already on the table remember), and getting another drink... we ate our food in less than 20 minutes and left. We went somewhere else for desert and received better service.   I hope that Midwood returns to how it used to be, for now they've lost a fan.

this was my third time at this location. First visit was within a month of the opening and everything was great, food, service and atmosphere. my second visit was a month later was considerably different. Dined in, poor  service and received the wrong food order twice.not really a major problem because we were in no hurry and the waitress was new. But this third and last visit was today. Take-out order for myself and my brother who had never been there before  that take-out order was incomplete not once but twice.  Thank goodness we checked the order before we left. The manager was very responsive and tried to give us partial credit for our food order. We said no thanks just needed a complete order. The barbecue pork was greasy and very salty this time   macaroni cheese was delicious and the smoked chicken was tender  it is quite apparent that this location has a higher turnover of staffing based on my observation and service   Unfortunately this will be our last visit at this location. The other location is excellent food and wonderful service

Amazing BBQ!! We split a combination platter and got to try their pulled chicken, pulled pork, brisket, and the best ribs I've ever had with sides of creamed corn and delicious Mac and cheese and hush puppies. We tried all four of their BBQ sauces and they were all fantastic, and we topped off our meal with delicious banana pudding. We also had a great waitress while we were there for lunch. This is hands down our favorite barbecue restaurant in Charlotte and we will definitely be going back!

First, let me start this review with saying I am a MEAT man.  Walking through the front door my senses perked up with the very delicious smokehouse smell.  We arrived on a Friday around 11:15 AM to beat the lunch crowd and there were only a few tables seated.  Our waitress was great and helped us through the menu and local beer options (we told her that we were newbies).  Items that we ordered:  1) Bacon wrapped jalapenos - YUM and very spicy, nice kick and goes along with beer.  2) Pig Out - 4 meats - Turkey, Brisket, Ribs and Pulled Pork - WOW.  Simply amazing!  So much food we split it and brought the rest home for dinner.  One note the baked beans were probably the best ever (laced with meat).  Please check this place out if you have not tried it.  I found this restaurant on Yelp and appreciated the other reviews from the Yelp community.  You will not be disappointed and I look forward to going again!
Best, tender smokey biscuit I've ever had. The bacon wrapped jalapeños were tasty, and the chopped pork was excellent.

Having tried Mac's, Sauceman, The Q, and Midwood - I'm ready to call this contest for Midwood.  Everything I've eaten there has been beyond belief.  The other places seem to have some issue - too fatty, lack of flavor, too much sauce.  Midwood strikes a perfect balance with the bbq. The sides are also amazing. The only knock is the beer selection - Mac's and The Q have them beat.

The food is awesome.  I have been there 2 times and both times had issues with overcharging!  That is a turn off.  First time, the grilled cheese sandwich was marked up by $5.00 the menu had one price and the ticket was $5.00 more (when we asked the server the manager came over and said that was what the computer was ringing up)  and at that same time we did a 2 person dinner and switched out one of the items unaware that the switch would cost us $5.00.  Just be upfront!  Second visit, the server suggested switching out something and never mentioned an up charge, when the check came they charged me $5.00 more for mixing beef burnt ends with pork.  I don't care but if it is your suggestion just tell me upfront that it will cost me more and let me decide.    Be aware and check your check!

I travel to Charlotte occasionally for work, and it had been about a year and a half since my visit last week. Every time I visit, I'm reminded of two things (1) Authentic southern food is incredibly underrated, and (2) the service in the south blows service I've had anywhere else out of the water. The place to remind me of both of those things on this visit was Midwood. I left borderline uncomfortably full but wondering whether I could have eaten even more without serious discomfort. The food here is that good.  I've had some tasty brisket in my life. However, my brisket evaluation scale is now irreversibly warped, with Midwood being a "10" and the next best maybe approaching a 6. The pulled pork, too, was so much better than any I'd ever had, including that from Revival (an acclaimed Southern-style restaurant in Minneapolis) that I consider to be top-notch. Both the brisket and pork are the perfect combination of tender, juicy, and flavorful. This place obviously takes a tremendous amount of pride in cooking and preparing pulled meats. Perhaps I'm just awestruck due to my lack of experience with delicious southern cuisine, but needless to say, I highly recommend it.  I was too distracted by the awesomeness of the brisket and the pulled pork that I really didn't pay much attention to the mac and cheese and baked beans I had as sides, but I remember them being excellent. Especially the baked beans.  As for service, the food did take a while, but our server was pleasant, charming, and checked back on us at the perfect frequency. She appeared to genuinely enjoy her job and made it her goal to ensure that we left with smiles on our faces. I really, really wish she could teach servers in Minneapolis how to treat patrons. I will be back the next time I'm in the CLT!

Amazing. Burnt tips are like nothing I've ever had. Also sampled my wife's grilled cheese  (with pork), which was awesome.   Good local craft beer selection as well, and our waiter was really helpful and attentive.   Terrific lunch experience!

As big fans of the original Midwood Smokehouse on Central Avenue, we couldn't WAIT to visit the new Ballanyne location, just 15 minutes from our house. And despite waiting nearly 40 minutes for a table, we were not disappointed. The brisket and pulled pork were both cooked to perfection, the mac & cheese was delicious, and the hush puppies completely irresistible. As at the original location, the beer selection was outstanding, with a wide variety of local crafts on tap and an extensive menu of bottles.   My only real complaint was the lack of seating in the hostess area, which made the long wait for a table more unpleasant than it needed to be -- especially with the kids in tow. But otherwise, the Ballantyne location is another fantastic addition to the Queen City's 'Q' scene!

Charlotte's best BBQ joint serves up outstanding brisket, tasty pulled pork and one of the best beer selections in the city. The Mac & Cheese is second to none, and the fries crisp and delicious. The family-friendly atmosphere is wonderful, with spacious tables and booths, and service is always prompt and efficient.   There's a small patio for outdoor dining, ample parking in a private lot (or curbside), and a spacious bar for those dining alone. There's also a Ballantyne location for those prefer to stay in the friendly confines of South Charlotte, but for my money, nothing beats the original.

Had the brisket with hush puppies and bacon wrapped jalapeño peppers. The brisket was tender and pulled apart with just a fork. Sat outside and really enjoyed the atmosphere. The music playing in the background was good and just the right level.

Super busy parking lot behind Park Road Plaza!  Party of 8 and and we got the large private room. They placed Cartoons on the TV for the kiddo and you can upgrade your beer for $1!  This place was amazing.  Awesome customer service!   Brisket 1/2 lean 1/2 fatty- and it was glistening! I did not want to switch or share it with my husband. Next time I want all lean but my husbands prefers it 50/50. ( this is also his goto dish)   Burnt tips cooked with cheerwine- it Friday's special and it was good too. Not as fatty as I expected and its better then I believed.   Kiddos- ordered cheese dip and chips. No one enjoyed the dip but the chips were enjoyed by the kids.    Mac and cheese- kids did not like it but husband enjoyed it.   Grilled veggie- cup size for a size order and I wished there were more vegetables available.   Sweet potatoes- were typical   Hushpuppies- crispy on the outside and nice and fluffy on the inside. I had to push them away they were so good!   Pickled onions- came with the meal and I had to order a cup full. I loved these and I can't believe I forgot the onions!

To preface, I don't like southern food that much to begin with so my ratings may be biased. The food was fine.I had the pulled north carolina pork which was good but just a lot of meat. It had good flavor and the sauce was tasty. Highly recommend the bacon wrapped jalapeno's stuffed with cheese. They were definitely the best part of the meal!

When President Obama and Hillary Clinton made a a pit stop at Midwood Smokehouse, then it must be the one spot everyone may agree on. So when I had the chance to be in Charlotte, BBQ is what was for dinner. Who would want to miss out on this.   I sat at the bar and ordered the large Beef Brisket plate with two sides (Classic Mac & Cheese and Smoked Veggies) with hushpuppies & pickled onions.  Oh my Goodness. Very delicious and generous North Carolina barbecue for for under $20.   A meal at Midwood will never fill you with regret.  Five Yelps

Food:  Delicious without a doubt  Waitress service:  Impecable.  Laura was very tentative and friendly  Host/hostess:  Whoever was working the lunch shift needs to quit.  As my buddy and I walked into the restaurant, they just looked at us and didn't seem too friendly.  After finishing our meal, we walked towards the front doors, passing the host/hostess.  They didn't say a word to us as we walked by.  Talk about douchebags with no customer service skills.  Won't be going back to this "overhyped" place.

WINNER!  Situated in the Plaza/Midwood neighborhood with a diverse staff and clientele. My husband got the smaller, 4-item combo platter (BBQ chicken, Carolina pork BBQ, brisket & ribs) with creamed corn & BBQ slaw. I got the Carolina BBQ with bacon-wrapped jalapeño poppers. For dessert, we got the banana pudding (oh my yummy) & chocolate-chip bread pudding. The desserts were slow coming out & when the manager realized it, he comped both of them. The place was busy, people constantly arriving & leaving, but nobody waited more than a few minutes (we were sitting near the front door) and ample (& friendly) wait staff helped everything flow smoothly. They get 5 stars for sure. We'll be back for sure!!

Rainy Sunday lunch. Beer selection is good, adequate and cold enough.  Food was very good. Wife had tacos and preferred the Stockyard as it had a great unique flavor while the Red Neck was equally good but had that expected in a southern pull pork BBQ joint.  I had the pull pork sandwich was pretty dog gone good with the BBQ slaw on it. The vinegar based "sauce" was unique which should have pushed the ranking to 5 stars, but ... The "beef" I have with the place is the price. $7.50 for a sandwich and $10 for 2 tacos is steep which for those prices should have included a couple hush puppies - a staple of all southern BBQ joints.

Love this place! The crew got bbq nachos which were fab. I got wings with homemade dressing. The rest of the crew got burnt ends and brisket. Def do sliced brisket, not the burnt ends.....you'll see why. I was very surprised how good it all was. Going back.

I was super excited about this place finally opening. I saw it in the works on my drive home every single day. We tried it out only a few days after it had opened. It wasn't packed by it was definitely a good kind of busy for a Monday night. I was really really excited about the cheese stuffed jalapenos wrapped with bacon (which were EXCELLENT) but what topped the cake for our meal were the pimento cheese fries with bbq brisket on top. SOOOOO gooooood. I've been craving some ever since I left! Between the two of us we got sloppy joes, a simple bbq sandwich and creamed corn. Everything was so tasty. The only reason I give it four stars was because it was a little pricy for the BBQ plates but our sandwiches and apps were decently priced. And I can't wait till they open up their balcony on top!  The service was excellent as well. Our server really knew what she was talking about and she was very quick and helpful.

So excited to have this location open. My go to is  the Texas Style brisket sandwich with blue cheese with a side of mac and cheese. I love their brisket!  After my sister in law raved about the 1930 cheese steak (made with their brisket) I had to branch out. It was really good. The american cheesy was melted goodness. But the Texas Style brisket sandwich with blue cheese still remains my favorite. There is just something about the blue cheese with their bbq sauce and the red smoked onions that is just amazing.

I first went to Midwood when it first open and all I can remember is the mac and cheese. I'm a huge mac and cheese lover so it doesn't necessarily say anything about the entree that I ordered but I was never really motivated to go back.  Well this past weekend we were in the area so we stopped by. My boyfriend pointed out the brisket sandwich and I knew that is what I had to get. Tender brisket on Texas toast with red onions and the best part  . . . blue cheese. It not only lived up to expectations it exceeded it. The flavor was great. And yes, I did get the mac and cheese again and it was as great as I remembered it.  Another must try is the bacon wrapped stuffed jalapenos.  They are great.  Wish they had been a little spicier but that can be hard to gage when it comes to jalapenos.  I am already ready to head back to have that sandwich again.
The food is delicious. If you're not big on vinegar based BBQ sauce, try their house made sauce. The greens, Mac and cheese and hush puppies are delicious!!
I love this place. The foods great! Especially the smoked wings and the pulled chicken-

When I pulled up outside, the scent wafting through the air convinced me that nothing that smells THAT good can possibly be that boy.  And I wasn't wrong!  Overall, this I'd rate this a strong 4.5.  This place is uber-fantastic!  The first night, I ordered the beef brisket and my partner ordered the pulled pork.  Each came with a different barbecue sauce.  The brisket was so tender that I barely needed the butter knife that accompanied my fork.  Both the pork and beef had a great smoky flavor that was good even without the sauce (although it was better with just a little bit of sauce on it).  I had the macaroni and cheese, which was DIVINE!  It also had a hint of smoky cheddar flavor.  I also had the privilege of eating the brown sugar bacon.  OMG, it blew my mind!  My partner remarked that it was like "eating a pecan pie from a cooked pork belly."  It was a perfect combination of sweet and salty bacon-y goodness.  For dessert, we tried the pecan cobbler, which was so, so good - like eating a warm pecan pie.  My second trip I went at lunch and had the barbecue chicken and the bacon-wrapped jalapeno bites.  They were very good and not terribly spicy, but a little more cheese stuffed inside would have been perfect.  The chicken came with a mustard sauce, which I didn't try (not a mustard fan), but I was able to get a different sauce with it on the side.  Chicken was tender and flavorful, and less smoky-tasting than their other barbecued meats.  For dessert we had the cream cheese brownie, which was large and tasty, but very light on the cream cheese.    I have to agree with others that the picked onions and hush puppies were just ok (although I'm admittedly not a fan of raw onions).  Tables are a little close together in there, but they do have some outdoor seating available.  Service was good both times, even when they started to get pretty busy.  Prices are pretty reasonable - about $10 to $15 average per dinner.  Portion sizes are quite large; I had plenty to eat, but still had a lot of leftovers.  They offer some less-unhealthy options, such as a couple of different salads, steam veggies, and smoked veggies.  You can also get three side items for $7, in case you want to go that route.  This is my new go-to barbecue place.  I want to try nearly everything on their menu.  If you're coming here, come hungry!

Not bad.  If you crave a slightly greasy, chain BBQ taste with a pre-fab interior you may like it.  Me - I would HIGHLY recommend you venture further south to Rock Store in Waxhaw.  You'll be glad you did...

Best BBQ I've had outside of Austin Texas!  I was in Charlotte for business and was eager to experience their BBQ scene.  I was told that I had to try either Midwood or Mac's first.  I chose Midwood which was a good call.  Decor is Texas shabby-chic.  The place was packed from when I entered to when I left about 2 hours later.  Expect a wait unless you choose to sit at the bar, which I did.  But lets move on to the food.  Food is insane.  When I'm in a restaurant that clearly knows their stuff I'll just turn the keys over to my server/bartender and tell them to bring me the drink and meal of their choice.  This was a good call.  Melissa, the bartender took great care of me.  Everything from picking the best IPA in town to letting me sample their burnt ends.  Uniquely great service at an already great restaurant makes this the best BBQ place in CLT.  Brisket was incredible.  It doesn't come served with a slice of white bread like many BBQ buffs might be used to, but I can forgive that slight difference.  Sides were also amazing:  Bacon Wrapped Jalapeno's and Hush Puppies.  Geez... why am I not there right now?  I'm wasting my life...  Small disclaimer, milage may vary with different locations and different meals.  I went to the Ballantyne Midwood a few weeks later for lunch and ordered a pork sandwich and didn't find the meal that impressive.  I chalk this us largely to most BBQ is really about the pure meat, plain and simple and most attempts to dress them up never have the desired effect.  Go there, right now.
Delicious meal.  I went small plate combo with probably the best baked beans I ever had.  The bartender was super nice and fun to talk to.
Been here twice now, both times food was great. I had burnt ends each time, and wasn't disappointed. Beer selection is solid, and their sides are good as well. Highly recommend if you're in the area.

Best Brisket in Charlotte in my humble opinion. Melt in your mouth brisket that as writing this review my mouth is salivating.  I have been a few times and to both the original location, ballantyne, and now so excited to have this location in my back yard.   I burnt ends are amazing and will certainly get them again but my go to item here is the TexasStyleBrisket Sandwich. This sandwich is loaded with smoked shredded brisket, smoked red onions, and your choice of of cheese. I get the blue cheese and that to me my friends completes it. Well almost completes it because you need the mid wood sauce ( that of a spicy varietal is my choice) but will also use multiple sauces to  get a different flavor each bite.   Sides you can go with a few different options and yep you know I went with the mac and cheese which is a solid choice for sure.  Another side I would recommend is the hickory smoked bacon wrapped jalapeños with jack cheese. Dip these in ranch and  can you say out of bounds:

Its been years since I've had quality BBQ and on my whirlwind business trip through North Carolina, was able to stop at Midwood for lunch.  Best stop I made on my trip.    Found parking on the street outside and stepped inside to a casual restaurant with friendly service.    Started off with the bacon wrapped jalapenos.  Was on a phone call, chatting away and next thing I knew, they were gone.    And then the BBQ arrived...  Carolina Pork-Smoked, tender, flavorful and exactly what I've been missing.  I'd like to consider myself  a memphis bbq connoisseur; however, this pork was excellent in its own right.  And that vinegar sauce?  I'm not a fan of sweet sauces and their sauce's blend of vinegar and spices was a perfect pairing.  I didn't need anything else, but the goodness didn't stop there.  Creamed Corn-creamy & buttery perfection. Hush Puppies-WHAT?!  I haven't had Hush Puppies this good since 1987 in the bootheel of Missouri.  Excellent BBQ and sides and Highly Recommend.

Good North Carolina-style BBQ sauces!  Thumbs up from this Midwesterner!  Everything on the sampler was great, but the beef brisket was by far the best of the bunch.  They have mastered searing a thin layer of charcoal-crisp-goodness that brings the dish into another category.

Heard so much about this place, but first time visiting. Absolutely loved it! good flavor, nice ambience, and DELICIOUS!! Was packed when I went (not surprised..) and it was late so had to eat small..but looking forward to going again to grub big!

First time I've been here on Friday the 13th of all days. Well the bad luck ended at the door. Child it smelled good as soon as I walked through. It's my birthday so our waitress was overjoyed she got to serve us. I ordered a platter of ribs, brisket, pulled pork and hickory smoked sausage. My cousins ordered whatever they ate I forgot as my belly was blocking my view. I ate and ate. They have cheerwine sauce which when eaten with any meat is like a shot of sodie in yer mouf. 'Twas a great experience y'all need to come here order a plate and eat.

My boyfriend and I came on a Wednesday and their special for the day was the burnt ends with cheerwine sauce. I explained to my waitress that it was my boyfriend's first time trying Carolina bbq and I wanted him to taste the vinegar based sauce. She said "No problem!" and brought out the Carolina bbq sauce along with the cheerwine sauce. The burnt ends were delicious, the baked beans were probably the best I've ever had at a restaurant, and the hush puppies were...okay :).  They have a nice selection of beer from North Carolina breweries.  Warm service, good food. Will definitely come back.

Very happy with this BBQ. Highly recommend getting the Brisket, Hushpuppies and BBQ Beans.   Service is exceptional and prices are some of the best.   Definitely coming back here next time I'm in North Carolina!!!

This was my first time in NC. Midwood Smokehouse didn't disappoint for a quick meal after arriving in Charlotte. Compared to NY, the portions are huge.   I had the Beef Brisket that I topped with the Eastern NC Vinegar Sauce. It was perfection. My boyfriend had the   1/2 Chicken and 1/3 Rack Ribs. Everything was packed with flavor and the service was so fast. We were literally in and out in an hour.   I really suggest this place for a great evening meal if you are visiting Charlotte.

5 stars for the Brisket 5 stars for the ICE chips. Small and SOFFTTTTTT  5 stars for their hours. 11pm makes for some decent times to eat brisket.  2 stars for those bacon wrapped jalapenos. I would not recommend.  4 stars for the greens. YES!!!! I'd recommend. Flavored right but wish they added Mustard or Turnips to them. And offer more.  3.9 stars for the hush puppies with every meal. Good crisp but I'm not certain it's always fresh.   5 stars for our burger. The kid highly recommends.  0 stars for the price upgrades on Double ribs, Bone-in Chicken, et al on the $26 Well Fed Platter.  2 stars for not having more BBQ sauces to try. I guess Famous Dave's spoils me.  Mac & Cheese = ok. NO hand cut fries.  Texas Toast is extra.  Daily specials worth returning for! They sell out fast.   Oh! 1st visit was Thursday, 9/28/17 & they were sold out of ribs @ 9pm, EST.  I wasn't bothered but made me return. I left with Brisket to go and got the mixture of lean and fatty + jalapenos and I can say... I understand why everyone talks about the brisket here.   :* :*   Next time, I'll shoot for chicken (bone-in) and smoked wings and some more brisket.  Oh! Their sausage isn't bad. It's not beef but not bad.   P.P.S. That cheese dip with brisket - bleh. That cheese dip isn't even Sam's Club in the metal can. It's just tasteless and I would never recommend.   Why the 5 stars? P.P.P.S = Great service + BEST ICE away from Tijuana Flat + BRISKKKKEEETTTT. And the greens~  Muah. :* Parking is available.  Outdoor seating and it fills up quickly after church but decent space regardless of the hour.  I'm shocked there's not more locations.

Great place for meat person like me!!! Highly recommend Bacon wrapped jalapenos and smoke wing for appetizer and combo for two!! Be there early if it's weekend night I went there saturday night and waited for half an hour.
Good service. Food was tasty but nothing extraordinary. Wait staff was friendly and timely. Not a bad place to eat in Ballantyne.
I enjoyed a great plate of 1/2 a rack of pork ribs. Great sauces to enjoy on the side with hush puppies, however the sweet potato fries weren't all consistently cooked all the way through.

We sat at the bar on an empty Sunday rainy night. Had 2 craft brews and Started with the beef brisket queso dip & chips. Decent probably would pass next time. Heavy cheese topped with beef brisket. It was definitely good but would try another appetizer next timeS Entree - Pulled chicken with 2 sides- creamed corn (it has tiny jalapeños , but the spice is mild) , & roasted veggie! Amazing! Huge portions brought half home!  Hubby got the Texas beef brisket sandwich - on Texas toast stacked with cheese & beef brisket. Again, bringing half home.  Ending the night with a small banana pudding! (I could of licked the bowl, it was that good!)  For all that food, it was less than 50! Including 2 brews. Customer service and attentiveness on point plus amazing food!!

A really good experience.   Great service and really good food.  Server offered  and brought a sample of brisket to the table.   We are in town for a week and after the meal we were trying to figure out when we could come back.   Nice draft selection with good smoked meats equals winner.

Outdoor patio, great service and fantastic bbq!!! Loved this place and their food. We ordered the pimento cheese fries with brisket on top to start. It was incredible, so much flavor. For our meal, we shared 4 proteins and 2 sides; ribs, shredded pork, brisket and we upgraded to burnt ends (great decision, highly recommend). Our sides were bacon wrapped jalapenos and smoked veggies which I would order again. Excited there is a location in columbia which is closer to us. We will be back!

Service was quick and friendly.  The food came out fast!   A friend, who was not hungry, ordered fries with pulled pork that was in the appetizer menu and love it! She had lunch and still took half of the dish home. It was huge!!!  I was expecting a bit more for my ribs. They were well seasoned but not fall of the bone as I would have liked them to be.   The pork burned ends on the other hand..... I could eat a family size portion of it and would ask for more!!!! The fatty bits were perfectly balanced with the meaty soft bits. The sauce it was tossed in was sweet, salty and tangy. Amazing!!!   For sides - sweet potatoes fries, can't go wrong with anything fried and baked beans.

I am visiting from D.C. and thought I would visit the place. The BBQ was excellent and the customer service was very good. Very nice selection of draught beers. Must try! Parking is the only drawback, but not really a problem.

As it is right down the street I frequent this place quite often. I have never sat down and ate so can't comment on the service but for $20 I get a pound of BBQ and a large side of Mac N Cheese. I have always been impressed and the food is consistently great. They offer 2 different BBQ sauces and typical Eastern NC Vinegar and a more sweet and tangy sauce. My favorite is the sweet and tangy. Mac N Cheese is also delicious as well. I am very particular about restaurant Mac but you won't be disappointed.   As I said earlier I have never sat down inside the restaurant and ate but they are always packed when I go to pick up and it's in the Plaza/Midwood area which is quite trendy. I would recommend this place to all BBQ connoisseurs and those looking for a fun night out.

Stopped here while traveling because we were in the mood for BBQ and we checked Yelp. Fantastic!!! Tried burnt ends and pulled pork and they were terrific. Tried several sides and they were great also. Recommend especially the collard greens, Mac & cheese, bacon wrapped jalapeños.
Food was great, loved the ambiance-- great music! Cameron took great care of us- his service was awesome. My family and I will definitely be back.

Really disappointed. I've been eating at Frank's restaurants since he went into business. This by far is the worst run! I called and inquired as to the wait time and they said that there wasn't one. We get there 10 minutes later and they said it would be at least 45 minutes . Hostess seemed totally indifferent. Too bad. Too good a restaurant to fall victim to poor staffing.

Yelpers seem to love this place, so in planning a trip to Charlotte I decided it was a must do. We walked in on a busy Sunday and were advised that a seat at the bar would be the fastest way to food. We were warmly greeted and ordered sweet tea as we browsed the menu. The tea was perfectly syrupy sweet and we received our meals shortly after ordering. I ordered the Carolina pork plate with bacon wrapped jalapeños, fries, and hush puppies. My boyfriend had the Cuban and the BBQ slaw. After we received our meal a refill was hard to find, which as I ate jalapeños was annoying. The food was good, I found I am just not a fan of "dressed" pulled pork. I prefer to add my level of sauce. Overall it was tasty and very reasonably priced. We'd visit again.
Great BBQ and Service.  The mustard and vinegar BBQ sauce was great.  The waiters were very friendly and talkative.  Had a great time.

Hands down my favorite restaurant I've eaten at in Charlotte, so far. I came here on the 4th of July and had a great experience. Service was fast and extremely friendly.   Food was AMAZING (the queso cheese is utterly life-changing; I've had dreams about it for the past couple of weeks, I kid you not). Everything was absolutely delicious and the atmosphere of the place is spot-on, too.   Warning for anyone who comes to visit me in Charlotte from now on - we will share at least one meal here, so come prepared.

The food was amazing. This was my first time there. Even though my girlfriend doubted the creamed corn (she's from Cali) she absolutely loved it and ate the whole bowl by herself. How shellfish!!! But no, please go eat here, the best food that we have had in the past 2 weeks of being in NC!! Get the ribs, highly suggested!!

We are big fans of Midwood Smokehouse, but a while back they phased out our favorite menu item, the creamed corn.  We were in the restaurant a few months back and expressed our disappointment to the manager, Kristin.  She was extremely nice, and took our feedback.  She also took our number and promised to let us know if the creamed corn was to be released again, even if only for a limited time.  Fast forward to today, months later, and imagine our surprise when we received a text message from Kristin letting us know that Midwood Smokehouse has added creamed corn back to the menu!!!  Regardless of the menu item being back, we were SHOCKED that this manager went out of her way to follow up with us and make sure we were happy, even months later.  You DO NOT see this kind of service anywhere and I can't believe she even remembered this encounter.  We immediately changed our plans for the evening and went in to Midwood for dinner.  Our food and service was great as usual, but the creamed corn was AMAZING.  It is back on the menu with a jalapeno twist and it was out of this world.  We will continue to go visit Midwood Smokehouse and I can't shout loud enough how cool it was to get that text message today... not only because I love the creamed corn, but because I appreciated her taking the time to do that so much.  Kristin deserves a RAISE!!  :)  Thanks so much!
Amazing fatty brisket and baked beans. Skip the burnt ends. Service was phenomenal.  If I could go back, I would:  Uber, drink a cocktail, get to go containers of fatty brisket, and some t-shirts.
Amazing every time! We love this place. By far the best BBQ in Charlotte. Try the brisket and the bacon wrapped jalapeños. Also, they have great beer selections!

The food is really good and really reasonable.  I prefer the brisket sand which with blue cheese.  I also think their baked beans and collard greens are their best side items.    Mac and cheese was just mediocre.  Beer prices seem normal and service is always good.  I haven't had to wait for a table many times either.  Parking absolutely sucks though.

My friends know that I WANT to like BBQ. It always looks and smells so good, then I have a bite and I'm over it...so as kind of a joke, I was taken to Midwood Smokehouse. Everything smelt so wonderful, and looked so tasty. Afraid of my past BBQ experiences, I played it safe and went for the smoked turkey plate: hickory smoked and dressed wtth cranberry apple relish, and a side of that creamy mac n cheese! It was AMAZING. The atmosphere was relaxed, the beer selection is fine, and the staff is friendly.  Since my first visit I have been back twice, and have tried variations of the BBQ. I found that I love the vinger style sauce on anything! The only reason I do not go back more often is the wait to be seated can be lengthy, and the wait to get your food and drink refills can also be lengthy. The last time we were there we saw our waitress three times, once to take our drink order, once to take our food order, and once to bring us our check. A food runner brought us our food and passerby employees who saw our drinks were empty would bring us more drinks. Every visit I have had, has been a long one. But when I leave my face is still smiling because my belly is happy.

Fried mac & cheese, hush puppies, gigantic beef rib special and Carolina pork plate.  Yes that is a ton of food, but it was all so delicious.  I was especially enamored with the Eastern NC vinegar sauce.  If it wasn't for the liquid restriction on carry-on items, I would've tried to bring a bottle home.  Maybe I should've tried to portion it out to 3oz bottles.  The mustard sauce that came with the Chicken BBQ was also awesome.  I felt like it would be great to have with a soft pretzel too.  Sadly, those aren't on the menu.  Prices are extremely reasonable for the portion sizes.  I wish I had gone all out and tried the combo platter just to get more options in.  Next time.
Great BBQ, mac n cheese. Big portions and great service. Parking was kind of annoying though

The best BBQ, so far!  I've had BBQ in  Memphis, Texas, Georgia...but, this by far is the best I've had.  Rendezvous in Memphis do not even come close...this place is wonderful! I tried the plate w/a mixture of Pulled pork, ribs, burnt ends, briquet w/hush puppies (best hush puppies I've had) and the cheesiest, macaroni and cheese.  The baked beans had the right amount of sweet and tangy to it...perfect. Our waitress was very friendly, sweet and on top of her game. This whole experience was so fun and positive, will definitely come back, again. Highly recommend this place.

After a long morning at the office I needed a break but I'm really trying to eat more healthy, but that always seems to go out the window after a hard morning work. I was struggling because the mac and cheese apparently is awesome. I stuck with my new found healthy eating habits and grabbed a salad. After much deliberation I decided on the chopped salad with pulled pork. Great recommendation by my server! I added jalapeños because i like it spicy and my pickled onions on the side (which come with every meal, unless you get a salad). It was a quick lunch and well deserved but I had to get back to the office, but I will definitely be coming back here again.

UPDATE: The next day, Jim called me back and left a message saying that he wanted to talk and that he saw my review on yelp. Then the next day, one of the owners also called me to discuss the bad experience. When I returned her call, she was incredibly considerate and very apologetic for the way things went. I really appreciated the extra effort she made and will absolutely give Midwood Smokehouse another shot. After all, the food WAS really great.

Out of all the places I've eaten in Charlotte, I've been here the most. So I think it's time I give Midwood Smokehouse its very well-deserved five stars. I'd give it six stars, but Yelp won't let me, so we'll just have to settle for a "Fuck yeah this place is awesome!"  In two words, burnt ends.   In many more words, the prices are very reasonable, the service is always fast and polite, there are awesome drink specials, and the vibe is casual, friendly and more than a little bit southern hipster.  As for the food, there is nothing here not to like. The only thing I'm a bit "meh" on is the smoked vegetables, but they're still pretty tasty. The chicken is so good, you can eat it "dry" (it's plenty moist) or with your choice of outstanding barbecue sauces. The brisket is incredibly delectable - as a friend of mine says, "Best brisket outside of Texas" - the fatty brisket especially deserves a freakin' medal. The sausage is a well-thought-out mix of savory and sweet, with a nice pop in the skin when you bite into it. But, the creme de la creme is the burnt ends. So sweet, so chewy, and with a caramelized flavor that is not of this earth.  Every meal comes with your choice of side(s). The bacon-wrapped jalapenos are sinfully masterful. The mac and cheese is delightfully cheesy. The collards are down-home. Everybody also gets some hush puppies and pickled onions - both are amazeballs (literally, in the case of the puppies).  Great local beer selection and some very tasty looking desserts, although I'm always too full to try them.

Amazing menu with great assortment. Good "southern" sides and pickled   onions are really, really good.  Hubby had brisket and it was spoon tender. I had burnt ends. Fabulous. Small size platters were really not so small. Great assortment of beers and various wines and the hard stuff.  Nice atmosphere, very friendly staff and quick service.  Very relaxed atmosphere with lots of TV.
Just opened but great food as always at Midwood. Nice atmosphere and very attentive wait staff. Lots of parking as they are "behind" Blackhawk Hardware. Do give them a try. You will enjoy I'm sure.

The food was good, I had the steak tips, very tasty with a nice caramelized finish.  I also had the pulled pork. I  wasn't a fan of the vinegar on the pulled pork though.  Service at the bar was definitely lacking.  I constantly had to flag her down to get service for even basic things like silverware and napkin. She kept her back to the bar for about 20 minutes just cutting fruit also.  I would have to yell to her to get her attention when I needed another drink.  I even set my credit card out and timed how long it took for her to pick it up, but after a solid 15 minutes I called out again to just ask her to take it so I could leave.  Not a huge deal but it's frustrating, especially when it was not at all busy.

The best BBQ I've ever had. The pulled chicken was a little salty but nothing unbearable or bad. The pork was delicious. We also ordered baked beans, mac and cheese, and fries for our sides and those were all amazing. I'm from SC and the bbq down here doesn't even come close to this place. Highly recommend to all. You have to stop here and eat! The service is pretty awesome too. We went during a non busy time so we probably spent an hour tops here. The parking lot isn't very big so I imagine parking might be a pain during busy hours but it's totally worth it! They also have a lot of local brews on tap
Burnt ends are the best. This place was one of my favorites when I was in Charlotte

Wow! thats all I can say...I've been to BBQ places up & down the east coast, and this ranks right up there with the best in terms of quality, value, and customer service.  I had the BBQ Chicken and chopped salad...both off the charts good!!  If you're reading this to decide whether to order here or not...don't deny yourself and TRY IT!!  100% amazeballs!!

Literally the best BBQ I have ever had. I had the burnt ends (delicious) and another person in my party had the brisket (also delicious). I recommend the fatty brisket, it was truly melt in your mouth. Service was also great! Need to go back and try the banana pudding.

Food was good to great, good beer selection.  Service was great.  had the brisket because they sold out of ribs and burnt ends.  then went back for the ribs.  both were good. I can't give them 5 stars though because the ribs.... something not quite there for me.  good place to go sit outside and just enjoy some good food though.
One of the best BBQ places in Charlotte! Ordered the nachos with BBQ chicken and the pulled pork BBQ sandwich. BBQ is nice and juicy, not dry. Great patio seating and service was wonderful.

Midwood Smokehouse is absolutely amazing! My boyfriend and I have been here twice and we are hooked! Both times we came on a Saturday afternoon and were seated immediately. There's a smoker in the back of the restaurant so there's always this nice smokey scent inside. Bryan was our waiter both times and he was great. I ordered the smoked chicken with baked beans & macaroni and cheese. It came with a side of hushpuppies. Everything was delicious and the portions are huge. Prices are reasonable also. I love this place & will definitely be coming back soon.

I was at first pleased with this place until I got sick from the food. I had the Briskit, which is supposed to be their best item. I am not one to get sick easily from food and when I do it is from very bad food. I know this place is popular and a lot of people seem to love it but to each his own. On top of the food being bad, I felt the service was horrible. It took 10 minutes for our server to acknowledge us and take a drink order. I mentioned that the soda was flat. My server looked at me with an annoyed facial expression like I was wrong. She asked if I wanted anything else and I said no and asked if it could just be changed. Apparently it was too much work to change the soda.  I noticed a girl was getting sick at her table so now I'm wondering if she got sick from the food too. I did call the restaurant tonight and the lady I spoke to was nice but didn't seem to acknowledge the seriousness of the food causing a customer to get sick. She said I may have gotten a bug from somewhere else. The sickness I am feeling is definitely from their food. I don't think anything will be done about this and that really bothers me because this is a serious issue.  I unfortunately will not be returning there and again, I won't be surprised if nothing is done about this
Great Food, service and best music. Wings are awesome. We will be back. It's been a long time for BBQ and they are spot on.
Absolutely loved this place. The bacon wrapped jalepenos were amazing! The pulled pork was excellent and the banana pudding was the perfect ending to a great meal. Service was quick and friendly.
Very good , and smokey pork , cole slaw and hush pups were kind of average . Baco wrapped stuffed Jalapeños were crazy good with the special Bloody Mary !
Awesome BBQ, The really know how to smoke a brisket!!!  One of my favorite places to eat!!!!

One of the best bbq's I have had. We had ribs and they were fall-off-the-bone delicious. The brisket was also really good. The meat is tender, juicy, and the sauces are oh-so-good. The sides are also very good. I thoroughly enjoyed the greens.  To top it off, our server was friendly and great!

Another Scibelli restaurant where the food is good but mediocre to poor service is the norm. Most of the servers and staff act as if they are doing you a favor. Ugh. Also, their smokehouse is too small and they are almost always out of at least 2 items by 6pm every night. I have only tried the original location and my review is of the original. I have been coming here since the beginning and it has gotten worse not better with time. It would also be great if they took reservations.  Perhaps they could better plan ahead to accommodate the crowd. I enjoy the food but not the dining experience. I will likely continue to enjoy via takeout.
Still the best.  Love the brisket and collards.  Love the pickled onions.  Always a great place for lunch or dinner.

Stupid good bbq.  I have tried many barbecue joints in NC and was really searching for a place I could take my friends that visit from Kansas City and Texas.  I found my spot.  Unassuming outside, but very cool on the inside.  The local beers on tap were awesome.  The menu offered more than the lexington style pulled pork with slaw.  There was so much I wanted to try on the menu I can't wait to go back.  I had the brisket and mac and cheese.  Both were excellent.  The dry rub/crust on the brisket was smokey and delicious.  I also enjoyed the pickled onions... who knew I liked pickled onions.  When I go back I want to try the burnt ends, greens and bacon wrapped jalapenos.

Honestly not as good as the stars say. The atmosphere is okay. Loud and a long wait. I got the brisket with both fatty and lean pieces but I swear there wasn't much meat, mostly fat. Mac and cheese was thick and nothing special. Its safe to say the hush puppies were my favorite part of the meal.

We finally tried this place last Friday and it was AMAZING!!  The brisket was so tender and yummy.  The hush puppies we delicious too.  The service was outstanding.  The pecan cobbler was so good.  We will def be back.. and the prices were reasonable.

I've been to the Midwood Smokehouse's original location in Plaza Midwood but with the help of my dinner group, we met at this new location because parking is easier.   They took over an old Sticky Fingers location so it has the feel of a family style restaurant rather than the funkiness of the original location.  Our server indicated she was new and she did well despite some challenges. She knew the rotating beer selections which was plus. She told us at first they were out of ribs but then asked how many of us wanted ribs and went back into the kitchen to see how many were available and we were in luck. So a big plus for that.   But parts of the service fell flat. The first part goes to the bar staff.  3 of us ordered the same beer, NoDa's Ramble on Red. Another person arrived later and ordered a Stella and her beer arrived almost immediately.  We waiting close to 30 minutes for the NoDa beers. It was almost like they had to drive up to NoDa and pick up another keg. Thanks to our server for at least following up with them a few times.   Another flaw came with the ordering. One person at our table ordered their meal with cole slaw and sweet potato fries as their sides and they brought out two sides of the fries. After notifying two servers, there were then almost duplicates of cole slaw. So the wait staff seems a bit frazzled here. Is everyone new??  As for food, I had the ribs and they were tender and sauced just right with additional sauce for dipping.  The mac n cheese was amazing! The hush puppies were a bit dry and hard.  So I'd come here for the food but you might want to stick with soft drinks until the bar staff gets their act together.

I came with some friends on a weekend for dinner, and even at around 5 PM, the place was already starting to fill up.  Thankfully, we got a table for the 8 of us.    I ordered the burnt tips, since the description on the menu sounded so promising.  I ordered it with bacon wrapped jalepenos and baked beans as sides.  I got the large portion, but was a little disappointed at how small of an amount of meat it seemed to be.  But even placing that issue aside, the quality of the meat was disappointing.  I mean, burnt tips are my favorite part of brisket - I love the smokiness and depth of flavor the burnt-ness adds to the meat.  Therefore, I thought a whole plate of it would be heaven for me.  Maybe it's the fact that too much of a good thing can be a bad thing - Joey needs Monica just like awesome burnt tips need regular brisket.  They balance each other out.  Or maybe it's that my tips were chewy, dry, and at times hard to eat.  Regardless, I wasn't a fan of burnt tips on their own, and I wouldn't recommend getting it.  Joey just couldn't sustain his own show, right?  Oh, and there were only 3 bacon wrapped jalepenos (which tasted good) and the baked beans were just ok.   My wife got the pulled pork barbecue with a side of smoked veggies.  The barbecue was dry and so-so in flavoring.  It definitely needed the sauce to make it taste better.  And the veggies were not bad.  Our service was pretty friendly and fast, and they did a good job accommodating our table of 6 adults and 2 children.  I was just a bit underwhelmed by the food that we got.  It seemed like the friends we ate with enjoyed their ribs, though.  So maybe next time, that's what I'll try.

Oh my! I'm so impressive with this place. BF and I got a combo platter and a burnt end dish, we were beyond full and satisfied.   For the combo platter we got to ribs, brisket, and pulled pork. The ribs and brisket were delicious and tender. The pulled pork was decent but was out shadowed by the ribs and briskets. The sweet potato fries were so crisp, definitely the better side between that and the mac and cheese. Our other dish was the burnt ends with mac and cheese. The hype on the Burnt ends is real! It was the star of our meal! It was flavorful and tender. The two dishes were more than enough for us so don't order with your eyes.   Service was great, our server small talked with us and helped explaining the different meats.

When you're in the mood for bbq, this place is IT! great service, our waitress was fantastic and the food was good. My favorite was the wide selection of the diff bbq sauces, ask for all of them. The pulled pork was a bit too salty but everything else was cooked really well (ribs, chicken, sausage, etc- i feel like we tried it all).

I was in Charlotte for business and decided to check out some Carolina BBQ. I selected Midwood based on the reviews. The restaurant was busy, but I was seated in about 15 minutes. The hostesses were nice, waitstaff was good. The actual BBQ, however... I tried the Carolina chopped pork. I don't know if it was a good dish done bad, or a bad dish done good, but I found it quite unappealing. I guess I've been spoiled on KC, StL and Texas BBQ all these years. However, the baked beans were a wonder, and almost deserving of an additional star themselves. The neighborhood seems quite trendy. I'm sure I can find some better eats in the area next time.

Having been to the Plaza Midwood location numerous times we are excited they opened closer to where we live. I am surprised by some of the reviews bc we came with a big group and had an excellent meal. The BBQ was just as good as any of our previous meals at the central location. The ribs we had were insanely good along with the burnt ends, pulled pork and brisket. Midwood did not disappoint.

This place was awesome! After reading about it online four of us went and we tried the burnt ends, pulled pork, bacon wrapped jalapenos, sausage, brisket and ribs. Everything was really good, not one thing to complain about. We also got an apple cobbler and banana pudding which were delicious. We would definitely go back. Side note the service was fantastic. Super friendly and helpful with suggestions on what to order.
Very very very good barbeque.  Smoky and tasty.  Side salad is shockingly good for a bbq joint.

OK- we have been going here for years now.   I think the quality might be slipping. Or maybe it is just inconsistent. Sometimes we LOVE THIS PLACE and other times it is "meh".  I highly recommend the salad with BBQ and avocado dressing.  My husband recommends the ribs.

Went to this place BECAUSE of all the yelp reviews, so had to come share our experience. First off our waiter, John V was amazing! Knowledgable, personable and on point! He recommended the bacon wrapped jalapeños for an appetizer, they were awesome! I don't do spicy and I truly enjoyed these. He then explained the different meats and how everything was prepared, so we ended up ordering the pig out ( I think that's what it was called - 4 meats, 2 sides ) we got the pork, chicken, ribs and brisket, along with the Mac and cheese and creamed corn John recommended. The sides were phenomenal!! The chicken was beyond fabulous, second I'd say pork, then ribs and finally the brisket - all was great, but not being a big meat eater I'm a bad judge on the harder ones. Also not a fan of NC BBQ "sauce" - but it was good here, very mellow. Sadly Sunday early afternoon became VERY busy so our pecan cobbler never came out, so after waiting so long we canceled the order. Love this place!

I cannot believe almost 6 months later and I am just now writing this review!  When I was on vacation in June and visiting my sister, she wanted me to try out a 'cue place she told me was pretty solid.  I am indeed a huge fan of Carolina style cue, so I was excited to see how this place would fare against Memphis.  Hidden away in hipsterville, this place is nestled on the bottom left of a I think 2 story strip mall.  There was some construction behind the place, so with that being said, parking was real tight- but I managed to find a spot on the street (and didn't get towed!).  The weather was perfect to eat on the patio, but we decided to eat inside.  Inside, it looked like there were 2 rooms, separated by the bar.  We sat in the bar area- which was cool, because our server was hot as hell- hell yea!  When we got the menus, I was torn about what to get, but I was hungry as hell too- so I got enough food for 3 people- the whole rack of ribs an order of some bacon wrapped jalapenos, and some other stuff.  My sis got a plate of pork with some sweet potato fries.  It looked like they had a pretty solid beer and mixed menu- but the Kentucky slush won me over.  I think I only got 1 (didn't want to get shwasted by 2, even though it was vacay).  It was pretty tasty, but I found it funny they served it in a Shiner (a TX beer) mason jar.  Hell yea!  When the food came out, my eyes opened up wide.  It looked as good as the place smelled.  I tell you what- I will say it again, this is the kind of shit I live for- and those were good enough to be in the top 5 racks of ribs to ever touch these lips.  And It left me full as hell.  I have no idea how I did it, but I dommed the whole plate!  Believe it or not, I didn't get sick either!  However, I did take a nap after the meal :)  A lot of eye candy, solid food and drinks are always a plus in my book.  The place seemed clean as well and they had tvs to keep you entertained if you didn't feel like conversing with your sister.  If parking wasn't such a pain, I would push the 4.5 up to 5 stars!  Cheers!

Nothing that blew our minds away, but good BBQ all the way around.  My wife and I dropped in on a Tuesday at about 9pm and the restaurant still had quite a few customers, but there were also plenty of empty tables. We were immediately seated by the hostess and waited on.  As tourists of the area, Midwood was actually our backup choice for BBQ in the city as we were hoping to try Lexington Barbecue, which was about 40 minutes north, since we had read about its authenticity to the region, but it was closed. On top of it, we had read that Midwood was Texas-style BBQ and not Carolina-style, so we were really hoping for Lexington to be open. With all that said, we saw all of the rave reviews for Midwood (4.5 stars from 1100+ Yelp reviews) and the fact that Barack Obama and Hilary Clinton had dropped in, so we thought it had to be somewhat good, even if it wasn't representative of North Carolina.
