After a review of the menu, we went with a combo platter of Carolina chopped pork, beef brisket, chopped chicken BBQ and hickory smoked sausage, and a classic BBQ plate of burnt ends. For our sides, we had the hushpuppies, classic mac & cheese, coleslaw and BBQ baked beans.   Like I said earlier, everything was good, but nothing was interstellar ridiculously great. The real standouts to us were definitely the brisket, burnt ends and sides. The brisket was very tender and juicy. The burnt ends were fatty on one end and meaty on the other, just the way we like them. We loved all of the sides, not much to complain about there. The sausage was also good, but nothing to write home about. As for the chopped (pulled) pork and the chopped chicken, they were a bit dry, but that was to be expected considering what type of meat they were, so make sure to douse them in lots of the house BBQ sauce.   In closing, we liked the down to the Earth atmosphere inside and the modern BBQ restaurant setting. Our waitress wasn't extremely friendly, but she wasn't rude either. They just did their job as expected. Also, other waiters who were wrapping up for the evening passed by during our meal and made small talk so that was appreciated. We just wish we were a bit more enthusiastic about the food after our visit.

Was in Charlotte for the coke 600 and what would a weekend there be without BBQ. A hotel employee recommend this restaurant to us and I can tell you we are glad they did. 6 of us enjoyed a lot of meat that evenings the brisket was juicy and rich , burnt ends saucy and  flavourful and smoked chicken and ribs amazing.  We didn't have one complaint about this place.  So if your in Charlotte and want smoked meat check this place out , I don't think you'll be disappointed.

I was in Charlotte for work and being in NC, wanted to get some local BBQ. I was staying downtown and found this place on Yelp. Based off the reviews I checked it out (I had a rental car, you would definitely need to drive if you are staying in downtown). I got carry out as I was by myself but it looked like they had a lot of good local beers on tap I would have liked to try. I got the Carolina Pork and it was really good. The pork was tender and the sauce was just right - the vinegar wasn't too strong at all. The hushpuppies that came with it were REALLY yummy. The pork and those alone would have been enough for me I realized after I started eating but the small came with one side. I got the sweet potato fries and they gave me what seemed like a pound of them. They were good but I barely made a dent in them because the pork and hushpuppies were way too yummy. They have a place at the bar to order specifically for carry out but then didn't really have an area to sit and wait. The bar was full of patrons so I had to stand and wait for my food. I didn't have to wait too horribly long but it was still odd that they didn't have a  waiting spot.

The food is great but the atmosphere is lacking. The bar and the patio is appealing but the room to the right has cheesy decorations, no windows, and dark navy carpet. A redesign would benefit them well. The food is delicious and the service is great. However, on half price wine Thursday they do not have chillers to keep the white wine cold- but we drank it quick enough to not notice.

hmmmm....  Sweetie & I were super excited to check out this restaurant for lunch recently.  We both love barbeque.  I got the small smoked turkey plate with mac & cheese & sweetie got the chicken with south carolina style mustard sauce.  He got the creamed corn.  The sides were really good & we enjoyed them.  Maybe we picked the wrong things (?!), but for a place that smokes their own meats I'm sad to say we were disappointed.  The smoked turkey looked beautiful, but it was dry & mostly tasteless.  Not very smoky at all!  I doused it with barbecue sauce, but it didn't help much.  Sweetie's chicken was o.k., but that mustard sauce was weird... not a true SC sauce at all!  It tasted like it had cumin in it & we both agreed that if you put it over rice with some naan bread on the side, you'd be eating Indian.  It has a fun atmosphere.  Drew was our server & he was super friendly and helpful with the menu & explained the restaurant and set up since it was our first time there and always kept our drinks filled.  There is an upstairs area with a great view of uptown, but for some odd legal reason they can't serve up there.  People will just get a to-go order & go upstairs & seat themselves.  We might try it again & check out the brisket or pork. Maybe.

This place has a good selection of BBQ meats and types of dishes.  I have eaten several. My favorites so far are the Burnt Ends, beef brisket ends, with great smoked flavor.  Also the St Louis baby back ribs Just melt in your mouth.  The sides provide option depending on whether you feel like southern cuisine or not.    The service is outstanding. Attentive and responsive. Great recommendations. Whether you sit at the bar or in a booth.    They stock great beers and bourbons. What more could you ask?  Friendly patrons. Comfortable atmosphere.   Cheers!

This place met my southern expectations! I had the bbq pork sandwich with slaw and bacon wrapped jalapeños, my girlfriend had the roadhouse burger and fries! Plenty of fries to share for the both of us. Lorilee was our outstanding server, she was very attentive! Will definitely come back!
Service, decor, value, presentation, and taste are all 5 stars. My only regret is that I can't find bbq like this on the west coast.

Food is usually really good, but service isn't fantastic, especially if you're doing takeout. The hostesses here always seem to lack customer service skills, and will stand idly and chat after hastily pointing you in the direction of the bar if you have a takeout order. Then you have to stand at the crowded bar hoping to eventually get noticed so you can get your food, which usually takes around 10 minutes. The bartenders are too busy to be managing takeout orders on top of everything else, and it seems especially absurd when you keep looking back at two hostesses who aren't doing anything and aren't even paying attention to what's going on around them. Portions here also tend to be small for the price. All in, it's good BBQ, but I don't know if I'll keep going out of my way to come here - between the service and the portion sizes, you can probably find better value elsewhere in CLT.  PS: parking is generally a nightmare, just be prepared.

Let me just start by saying it's really hard for me to place a 1 star yelp! I also believe you call and talk to the manager and hopefully they will correct issue before it has to go to this....now with that being said I placed an order and the food quality on one of the items was really bad! All the other items were great and other times the order was on point. When I called an talked to the manager I was hung up on once and then I called back. Christine got in the phone and I was told that it was my fault and postmates fault for not being specific about the order. I wasn't aware that you have to ask for postmates to tell the vendor to give quality food. The manager was defensive immediately and didn't listen. She just needs some help with management 101 that's all. I won't judge this company based on this interaction and will try again but Christine needs some coaching and I hope she gets it from this yelp. It's sounded busy and I'm sure that got to her but once again she just needs coaching on how to handle difficult situations.
This is the best BBQ I have had in my entire life.  I will be a regular customer from this day forward.

Visiting NC just for a night. Was lucky this place was highly recommended. The food was great as well a s the service. We had ribs and burnt tips. Everything was delicious. Server and staff were attentive and very friendly. Although I don't condone this... My sister got caught trying to make off with a souvenir beer glass (not cool) nonetheless one of the staff. Handed her a clean one. I've been around the world a thousand times. I love good bbq when stateside and this place surely impressed me enough to give a shout out on yelp.

This was my first stop in Charlotte .. The food was extremely tasty, but even better than that, the service was first rate. Our waitress (whose name I wish I remembered) was extremely prompt & courteous with a great sense of humour. Our drinks never got below half empty because she was always just close enough nearby to provide excellent service, without hovering. I highly recommend the "burnt ends" which are not burnt at all, but perfectly cooked to be nice and crispy on the outside whole being tender & juicy on the inside. This will definitely become part of my regular rotation of great barbecue joints in Charlotte. The hush puppies were also fantastic; very well done with just the right amount of crunchy while bursting with flavour. They offer many different regional styles of barbecue, so you're almost guaranteed to find something you'll love. Excellent portion sizes, also. I tried my darnedest, but could not clean my plate.

My husband and I totally love this place and crave it constantly. I feel like it's a sin when ribs are dried out and Midwood has never committed this sin when I visited. Always tender ribs. And there are some Seriously fabulous combination platters.
Absolutely delicious! Some of the best BBQ I've had in Charlotte. You have to try the loaded fries with pork appetizer. Also great beer specials!
This place is the absolute best place! Definitely recommend it as one of the best places in Charlotte.

What can I say about Mildwood Smokehouse other than it is the best BBQ I have ever had. Period. Seriously, we had ribs and brisket... best ribs... best brisket. If you like BBQ and happen to be in NC, come here now. That's all.  PS: The pecan dessert was also amazing and I don't even care for pecans.

Another great barbecue joint in Charlotte.  We started off with the fried pickles and bacon wrapped jalepeno's.  The jalepeno's were excellent, full of smokey flavor and cooked just right.  The fried pickles were ok, nothing special though.  I personally like when the pickles are cut thick and these are pretty thin and greasy.  I shared the combo plate and it was good that I did as the portions are crazy big.  I tried the pulled pork, brisket, ribs, and chopped chicken.  All were really good, my favorite was probably the pulled pork.  The brisket isn't quite as good as Sauceman's but it definitely holds its own.  As for the sides, we had macaroni, collards, and hush puppies.  All were great as well.  If you're looking for a great barbecue spot, look no further.

Great smoke house dishes such as ribs, brisket tips, and chicken. Sides such as bacon wrapped jalepenos and hush puppies are filled with flavor. Desserts are large and delicious such as pecan cobbler with ice cream. Noisy family style, no pretense, just great food.

The Banana pudding was so good I had to get two additional ones To go to give my sister. We tried the brisket, pulled PORK, ribs, beef ends I forgot what they were called and Mac n cheese with sweet potato fries.

My first time here and it was outstanding. First of all, no country music which is a huge plus! Rock n roll music that was excellent. Next the food: our server, Iimane, suggested the well-fed combo platter which includes your choice of 4 meats and 2 sides for $24. We chose the burnt ends ($2 extra), the brisket, pulled pork and chicken. For sides, the mac n cheese and the bacon-wrapped jalapeño poppers. So, the burnt ends were delicious chunks of brisket bathed in BBQ sauce and they were tasty. The pork was lightly covered in vinegar sauce, white meat chicken comes plain so you can choose any of their 4-5 sauces. The mac n cheese is homemade and the poppers are hot and spicy, so good.  Service, food, music and atmosphere was all excellent so I highly recommend.
We wanted some southern BBQ, this place delivered and then some.  Gotta be the best in the area.
Had a few dates here a few years ago.  Food was ALWAYS good and wait staff as well.

Sadly this restaurant did not live up to the expectation set by the original.   We went last weekend with a couple of out of town friends and everything started off well. I had called ahead to make sure if there was a wait it was reasonable and when we showed up we were taken straight to a table. Great since we were starving! Almost immediately we put an order in for the cheese fries with brisket. The fries came out after we had ordered our mains and several of the fries were burnt.   Moving on to our mains I had ordered the big plate of lean brisket and a friend had ordered the half lean half fatty. When the waiter was handing me my plate I asked to verify that he was handing me the lean and not the mix (since my friend and I had the same sides). He said it looked like the mix so my friend and I swapped plates. Halfway through the meal we realized it was right the first time so we traded strips of lean and fatty. However I wasn't super invested in getting any more brisket since the strips I already had were dry and unimpressive. The brisket at the original location is one of my favorite meals in Charlotte.   Overall it was a fine experience but as other reviewers have mentioned it felt more like a chain than a delicious and authentic NC BBQ joint.

Good service, pretty good BBQ.  Really enjoyed the crowd during a Panthers game.  If you're in the area, give it a try but it's not distinguishable enough from other smokehouses around Charlotte to travel out of your way here.

One of my favorite go to spots. Service is always great and friendly, the food and barbecue is delicious. I love the salmon salad. The location and atmosphere is pretty great too. Must try for charlotte BBQ

My family and I ate here and for the most part we had an excellent experience mostly due to CJ, our outstanding waiter.  We started with the bacon-wrapped jalapeños which I thought were very tasty but not as hot as I had expected. I had the small Chicken BBQ plate which was outstanding, and a side of the collard greens which were very good. My girlfriend had the half-rack of ribs and said they were perfect and falling off the bone and a side of mac & cheese. My 3yr old got the sloppy joe this time but only ate the fries. I ate his bun and have to say it was much improved over the last time I ate here. My mom had the Carolina pulled pork sandwich and my dad had the classic pulled pork and they both said their dishes were delicious. The pink lemonade was great and the pecan cobbler we shared was out of this world.  We arrived a bit later than expected and couldn't eat in a booth do we ate in the heated outdoor area. It was nice and warm and almost empty but became the spillover area for the bar which is what caused it to loose a star. Other than that it was great. I would definitely eat here again but I would shoot to arrive an hour earlier before the bar crowd arrives.

Having reintroduced pork into my diet, I couldn't wait to try out Midwood Smokehouse. A couple of friends and I went over there on a Saturday night, and due to the lovely weather which allowed the patios (yes, there are two - one upstairs and one downstairs) to be open, we only had a 15 minute wait. We sat at the bar and discussed the food options with the bar tender. By the time we sat down we were all ready to order.  We started with a basket of hush puppies because this is a BBQ joint - you have to start with hush puppies. And they did not disappoint. Dipped in the delicious BBQ sauce with a nice outside crunch and soft interior. Delish.   I ordered the small pork platter with mac-and-cheese (once again because it's a BBQ joint and you've got to have some mac-and-cheese). Good thing I ordered the small! There was enough food on my plate to feed at least two, possibly three, people. And more hush puppies on the side. The pork was so delicious with the spicy BBQ sauce that I barely tapped into the mac-and-cheese and didn't even touch the extra hush puppies.   Service was quick and efficient, and we never got to the bottom of our drink glasses. Parking can be a bit tricky as the lot is small and the place seems to always be hopping, but that will not deter me. I will definitely be back for more, Midwood. And soon.

If you are looking for BBQ with a nice staff, good atmosphere and a chain kind of feel this is the place. Let me explain- I'm used to BBQ places that are a bit less clean, styrofoam cups, white bread, etc... This place had great BBQ with a Longhorn steakhouse kind of feel. Was very clean, manager stopped by twice to make sure we were ok and our server was awesome.  Get the Pimento Cheese Fries- you won't be sorry...   Really good stop for me and the family. We will be back next time we are in Charlotte!

I was very surprised today when I stumbled upon this place.  My mother and I ordered his 2 sandwiches I had the Carolina styled and my mother ordered the brisket with cheese and she enjoyed it as well. The service however wasn't the best it was slow however the food was the selling point. I will go back soon

We ate here for my fiance's birthday dinner. He loves barbeque and I wanted to come to this location instead of the original in Plaza Midwood so that our family and friends joining us wouldn't have such a dreadful parking experience. The parking lot was actually pretty busy, but it was restaurant week so I'm sure that contributed to it.   The service we received when I called to make our reservation was absolutely above and beyond. Normally you call a restaurant they ask for how many people are attending and what time and that's it. Midwood Smokehouse asked if we would like to use their private dining room for the birthday gathering, if we had any and all accommodations for elders, babies,  allergies, and if we would be bringing a birthday cake.   The services we received when we arrived matched the host to a T. They were so attentive with every question we asked and the services that we needed.   Of course, I cannot leave out the best part, the FOOD! I ordered the brisket and when the waiter put my food down in front of me I asked if I could have a knife and different waitress said "Oh you shouldn't need a knife and if you do our kitchen staff will be fired." SHE WAS RIGHT! The brisket was so tender and beyond delicious. I had the hush puppies and baked beans, they were both absolutely perfect.   We will definitely be back for both the lovely staff and great food.

Midwood Smokehouse is a welcome addition to the Charlotte BBQ scene. Located in the ever burgeoning Plaza-Midwood neighborhood, Midwood delivers on the 'Q while at the same time adding modern flair with dishes like smoked vegetable bruschetta, smoked turkey and sausage and a Cuban sandwich. The pork BBQ was smoky and delicious and I love that they have 4 sauce options to choose from. The mac & cheese was a standout side and the hush puppies were tasty too. I look forward to going back to try the ribs, the pimento cheese fries and the desserts.

What can I start of with but one the best meals I have ever had! They give out high portions. For an appetizer I got the smoke wings. Let me say this I love them. Amazing literally smoked wings. I could not have asked for a better app. I am so used to Buffalo wings since I am the city over from the original chicken wing; that I figured I try. Yup best choice ever. For the meal I got pulled pork and Mac and cheese (small). That was the most delicious meal ever. The place is pretty cool and they have TVs all over the place. Definitely come here for some BBQ. You won't be sorry!

Walked from the stadium for this place. So worth it!!!! Everything is so delicious. Found it on here. We are avid Yelpers when we go out of town anywhere. We are never disappointed. Service  was also great!

This is the best barbecue I've ever had, easily, in my entire life. The pulled pork was my favorite ever, and everything else I tried was on point, especially the burnt ends, which you can get any day of the week. I also tried a bbq salad with green goddess dressing, that was wonderful--hard to accomplish at an amazing bbq joint. We actually ordered take out and the service was great. Everything was packaged well (but sadly, they forgot my ranch) and the woman who helped me over the phone was someone I feel I should try to meet in person so we can be friends. As for the prices, I felt they were priced very fair, especially for the quantity and quality of what we received. Great experience at Midwood and I know we will be back again and again.
My favorite meal in Charlotte. Definitely try the combo platter with bacon wrapped jalapeños. The bar has really fantastic choices and $1.50 PBR.

Really average. I was really excited about this place being I live in LA and don't have many chances to eat bbq. I must say it was pretty disappointing. The service was ok and the food was...ok. We tried to order the beef ribs;however, they ran out. I ordered the coleslaw and it was pretty sour. My mom ordered the chicken and it was really dry. I must say the salmon was actually pretty good and my niece and nephews ate all of their food. It is a family friendly restaurant. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

I have never been to North Carolina before and when the opportunity presented itself to visit one of the barbeque staples in America, I could not resist. After speaking with a few locals on where the best barbeque was, Midwood Smokehouse was always mentioned. On a peaceful Labor Day afternoon, I called an Uber and directed my driver to this location.  After entering the premises, I was quickly greeted and offered the choice of indoor or outdoor seating. I chose indoor seating given that it was going to rain. My waitress came up to me within a few minutes and asked what I wanted to drink. I settled on the sweet tea, one of the most sought after beverages in the South. I large cup of ice cold sweet tea was brought to my table, and I told. the waitress that I decided on the Well-Fed Combination plate, complete with beef brisket, hickory sausage, ribs, hushpuppies , Carolina chopped pork, and bacon wrapped jalepenos. Unfortunately, they did not have ribs today, so they gave me the option of chicken or doubling up on another meat entrée. Figuring that I should try all the meats, I opted for chopped chicken bbq.   I was dining alone so I spent a few minutes on my phone enjoying sips of the sweet, sugary iced tea. However, within a good seven minutes, my large whopping order presented itself in front of me. The waitress asked if it was my first time and proceeded to explain the different sauces. I was barely listening as I was salivating over the piles of meat. I dug in and fell in love with the brisket. They gave me a mix of both lean and fatty brisket and the combination of both, literally melting in my mouth, was enough for me to keep eating more. No sauces were required for the brisket. The hickory smoked sausage was perfectly grilled with that snap you would expect with any perfectly smoked sausage casing. The pork and chicken were equally tender, but the beef brisket was the star of the meal. All the meats were a wonderful pair to the collard greens, bacon wrapped jalepenos, and hush puppies.  I'm said to say that I am only in North Carolina for a month, but I will definitely be back for brisket!

The winner here was the pulled pork for me.  I liked the vinegar sauce very much.  The pork was juicy and a little smokey and perfect with their sauce.  The smoked veggies and greens were excellent as were the hush puppies that came with my meal.  The ribs were pretty good.  I ordered them dry, not wet.  I liked the rub.  The ribs were a little overcooked and tough on one end and just short of dry.  Their house red sauce was good and was almost a little much when combined with the ribs.  They're ok.  I didn't like the beans.  They're in tomato or something and a little pasty.  Not my taste.  I liked the place and the service was excellent.

Finally got to try it a couple of weeks ago.  They had a special, with burnt ends brisket and rib combo, with cheer wine sauce.  Wasn't a fan of that sauce, but my wife had the standard midwood sauce, and I was able to dip the burnt ends in that and it was a lot better.  The macaroni and cheese was the highlight.  That was really enjoyable.  The beer was ice cold and the server was friendly.  Food came out quick.  I like to eat, but I'll tell you, they give a lot of food in the large portion.  Couldn't finish it.  I'll go back again.  Either way it's worth a visit.

This place was really nice bigger than I expected. They have an outside seating area a nice bar. The service was good and helpful appetizers really good. I would definitely come back its good bbq in a nice setting in uptown area can't go wrong.
Great place! So glad they brought one to Birkdale. Frequent there often, because it's great, and the food comes out super fast. Go to spot when I want to sit down and eat quickly. Highly recommended.
Brought my family here because Of the good reviews, the food was amazing, I had the burnt ends, everyone's food was really good, the staff is super nice. This place is a must try!
Decent pork, good beans, crappy hush puppies. Not a bad place if you live in the neighborhood but I wouldn't tell people to travel here.

Went again this past weekend and I have to recommend their salad of all things. It was packed with delicious fresh veggies (avocado, corn shaved off the cob, tomatoes, cucumber, red bell pepper etc)  and served with amazing dressing and shredded sharp cheddar...just perfect! I also had the grilled cheese with pulled pork which was pretty much delicious too! All of this was graciously served to us without a hitch during late night hours (10:30 ) making us happy and thankful! Our server was super polite and kept the drinks coming (plus they have slushy ice for their drinks woohoo!)

Fantastic BBQ and fantastic service! Would definitely come back for the food (burnt ends, brisket, etc.) and the cocktails (try the tequila jalapeno one). The portions are huge, especially if you get the sampler.

I had a great meal and experience at Midwood--the food was tasty and came out quickly, the service was great, and the beer list was excellent. We had the bacon wrapped jalapenos, burnt ends plate with collard greens, and the special burger (brisket & chuck patty topped with pulled pork and onion straws). Everything we had was great, cooked as ordered, fresh and flavorful. They had a great special on 20 oz draft beers and a well-curated list of local and national beers. I'll definitely be back!

Holy cheese filled bacon wrapped jalapeño DELICIOUSNESS!   I feel sorry for everyone whose tastebuds haven't danced to the sweet, creamy, smokey, spicy tongue love fest that I have witnessed in this side dish. Yes the hush puppies are crunchy, sweet and nicely spiced.. And yes the brisket is nicely smokes and juicy. But those bacon wrapped jalapeños... Sigh.  #bbq #foodie #baconisbetter #jalapenopopperking

Best BBQ spot in Charlotte! The pork is unbelievably moist and flavorful and the sauces compliment it well. I've been to most of the spots around Charlotte and although there are other good ones, this is definitely my favorite and the one I take friends and family to when they're in town.

We had a good experience here. Our waitress was fantastic and the food was tasty. My only gripe was that I ordered the half slab of ribs with sweet potato fries and mac & Cheese, and the ribs were a little dry. Still good but I wanted them a little more tender. The mac & cheese noodles were a little under done, I would've liked them a little softer. Great beer menu and the sweet potato fries were delicious, fresh out the fryer like I like them. My husband had the burnt ends, he liked them. We would go back, next time I will try the brisket.

This was our first time and we absolutely loved it. I just had a salad that I was able to make myself and it was delicious. I would highly recommend it and I can't wait to go again. I didn't care for the hush puppies but u don't really need them because everything else is so good

My son and I flew in from the West Coast for a weekend workout and we wanted some great BBQ--we found the perfect place in this gem!  The food was AWESOME and Rachel and Matt took great care of us. They walked us through the menu, made some great suggestions and pointed out some don't miss items, including the bacon wrapped jalapeños and fried pickles.

This is a great Midwood Smokehouse location. (But shouldn't it officially be called Ballantyne Smokehouse if it's here?) They have all the same offerings that the other location does except in a larger and less densely packed layout. Also seems to not get hit quite as hard as the original Plaza Midwood location. And for out of towners, it makes for the best southern BBQ.  The menu offers everything they've got at the original. Pulled pork and chicken, burnt ends of beef or pork, ribs, brisket and so on. These days I take it easy on the meats and they make that an option with some salads on the menu. Still, their claim to fame is clear. You can get the Well-Fed with 4 different meats chosen from a list of 5 or 6 including beef, pork and chicken. This also includes two sizable sides (collard greens, mayo OR vinegar based slaw, mac and cheese, and the to-die-for bacon wrapped jalapenos, among others) meaning you will end up quite well fed. If you leave hungry or without a to-go box, you messed up somewhere...  The prices aren't bad, especially when you consider the volume and quality of food here. The service I experienced was excellent, especially since I was visiting with a colleague from out of town.

food is better than macs but the space isnt as cool, its actually a little tight in there.  im sure when its cooler and peeps can sit outside its better but it was hot and rainy last night and we were packed in that place like sardines.  their mac'n'cheese is better than macs, AND SO IS THEIR BRISKET, the ribs are better than most in town...  they have a very good beer selection.  GREAT hushpuppies.  great sauces and the chicken was very good as well.  dont bother ordering the wings as they are nothing special, not bad but save your stomach space for other things.  we sat right down and had a very nice server.  i will def be back frequently to try some other stuff and wanted to try the cream cheese brownie but couldnt put another thing in my mouth.  very reasonably priced as well i got the combo "well-fed" the smaller one and when they brought it out to me i thought it was the big one that i had seen on other peoples tables, for $16 it was a heck of a deal.  im still going to hit macs up as its good and right down the street from me but this place may have the edge on the bbq hotspots in town...for now

I was in town for work earlier this week and went here with a friend who lives in town. I really enjoyed it. The burnt ends were tender on the inside and a little crunchy on the outside, covered in a BBQ sauce with a kick. I ordered the small portion and it was more than enough. The hush puppies were light and airy. The mac and cheese was the only thing that didn't really stand out. The pecan cobbler was a home run. Do not attempt to eat it on your own. I did, and I failed miserably. It is sweet, warm with a maple syrupy type sauce that leaves you yearning for fall to get here already! The vanilla ice cream on top is an absolute must!

We are barbecue lovers but only eat it occasionally out of respect for healthy choices. The reviews on this restaurant looked inspiring, so with no other recommendations than Yelp and on a whim, here we come! It was very crowded, which is always a good sign, we check in and are told it is a 15-30 min wait. Not bad for a weekend in Charlotte. We are asked for a phone number so they can text when our table is ready. We wait, and we wait, and we wait. Parties come and are seated and after a reasonable time, we approach the hostess... OH she says, somehow the communication with our phone number didn't work but we can be seated immediately! In honor of the World Series, Strike One! Server eventually gets to us, we communicate the mixup about being seated and how ravenous we are, and order everything (drinks and food) immediately. She put a rush on it - it all comes out within 5 minutes. That's a Double Hit! Barbecue flavor is good, I will return, but probably to a different location in Charlotte -- Single Hit. Cost of the meal -- here's the problem .....  Its a crying shame when a restaurant feels like their food is SO good they can charge OUTRAGEOUS prices, seat you at a table when you needle them to, impress you with how quickly they can serve you, and NEVER attempt to make it up to you any other way. Friends, that is an OUT! Hence, two stars and I may return --- one day.
Sat at bar at 6pm on a wet Monday and ate a wonderful, massive, caveman like  full slab. Barman was great. Does exactly what you want it to do.

We used to live near the Midwood Smokehouse off Central.  They had good food but we didn't frequent this location too much.  We decided to check out the new Midwood in the Backlot of Park Road shopping center.  Man this place is a Gem.  We ordered a bottle of wine (I know weird for a BBQ place) and the bacon wrapped jalapeños and brisket pimento cheese fries.  The food came out quick and was incredible.  The highlight was our server JP.  He always checked up on us and made us feel welcome.  This guy is a professional and gives you service expected from high end restaurants.  Ask for him when you visit.  We will be back.    Ps.  The drink specials are on point (see photos)

Before you get mad at me for leaving only two stars, hear me out.  I'm grading on the one experience.  I'm a firm believer in 2nd and even 3rd chances for neighborhood foodie spots.  We live in Elizabeth so this was a nice walk and very convenient.  I was impressed with the resume of restaurants from the owners and have some favorite menu items at Paco's and Cantina... so I was eager to try this one.  Service gets an A.  Kimberly was tending bar and was on top of her game.  Bubbly personality and very attentive to all of the patrons at the bar.  My wife immediately was impressed and she had the wow factor that a good bartender needs.  Remembered names, what we were drinking and above all, extremely friendly.  The other gentleman at the bar was less on his game and seemed stressed by the job and was forgetful with requests from patrons on our half of the bar.  Draft beers were upwards of $5-$6 per pint and the liquor drinks were $7-$10 per drink.  A bit high but trending standard fare for the neighborhood bars these days.  We ordered the smoked wings which were okay... Not very meaty for wings but had good smokey flavor.  Sauce options were sides which was different but still good.  We had the South Carolina style BBQ sauce which was actually more like a honey mustard.    We each had two drinks and shared the wing app at the bar.  Total bill w/ 20% tip was right at $40.    I'm hoping the other reviews on right on the pork.  Our next round we will go with an entree.  We would tend to head to Mac's for this but we want to support the local Plaza Midwood area.

Not gonna lie, was not that impressed with the BBQ. Maybe I'm picky about it growing up eating Lexington BBQ.  My boyfriend and I shared the well fed platter where we got pulled pork, smoked chicken, ribs and brisket. Our two sides were mac and cheese and collard greens. The BBQ was a little too smoky flavored for me and the chicken was very bland. I did like their sauces though. The mac and cheese and collard greens were both great. I will say if you're going with someone else, the platter is the way to go. That way you get to try a little of everything. We also started with the hogapeno dip and bbq queso. Neither were anything exceptional.   They were slammed on a Sunday night so we had to wait for a little bit. Rachel took great care of us, and kept checking back to see when more burnt ends would be done since they were out when we arrived. The manager on duty was very active on the floor and visited our table almost as much as our server. You could tell she was constantly helping the servers out and checking on tables.   They had some sandwiches and burgers that looked really good, and I would go that route next time. They also have a great beer list although I didn't partake on this particular visit.   I thought overall the price of everything was high. One small portion of meat and a side for upwards of $11? There are many places you can get a lot more for your money and its just as good if not better.

I like Midwood, so I took my visiting Parentals. It ended up being a marginal visit. The good food saved a rather 'meh' experience.  The waiter started off very knowledgeable about the beer selection and then the service sort of dropped off from there... Having to ask several times for ice water and a specifically requested sauce is frustrating.  My parents definitely enjoyed their meals. I'm pretty sure they would return, just with hopes of better service.

This was fantastic. I had the burnt tips with mac n cheese as my choice side and my fiancé had the pulled pork sandwich with bacon wrapped jalapeños. A few pieces of brisket were more like large chunks of your usual brisket, though most were exactly what I expected - caramelized flavors, chewy textured awesomeness. Mac and cheese was good but not amazing. The plate came wish hush puppies too. Those were small, but yummy. My fiancé liked his sandwich but I wasn't as much of a fan. His jalapeños were good...but not amazing. Great craft beer selection. Definitely coming back! They had smoked salmon on the menu that sounded delish.

A good barbeque spot in Charlotte located just outside the downtown. I had one of their salads with brisket which was pretty good. I also had tastes of the ribs and pork which were also pretty good. The place wont blow you away but overall worth checking out if your looking for good barbeque at a good price.

I will definitely say that I am a fan of the place, but a lot of that has to do with the fact that they are close by - certainly much closer than Bill Spoon's or McKoy's, and definitely closer than Bubba's.  But does that mean that they are the best?  I am not going to go that far at this point.  The crowd can be a bit nuts.  Even outside of your normal dining "rush hour".  The good news is that it moves pretty quickly.  We waited 10-15 minutes for a table for four.  What really causes issues is that the service is a bit slow.  If that would pick up, it would probably move a bit faster still (even though it is not really that bad).  When you talk about the food, you naturally talk about the meat, since that is their specialty, right?  While it is good, it is not great.  There are some interesting dishes here, like the queso with barbecue.  Unfortunately, it is a plate of melted cheese and some small flecks of meat thrown on top.  Very disappointing.  Would have been so much better if it was all mixed together.  When you get to your entree, things look up - but ultimately it is again not stellar.  Looks like I will be making a drive after all.
Best smokehouse I have ever been to. The spicy BBQ sauce is so good on their smoked pulled pork sandwich and the Mac n cheese is amazing. Will definitely be back here!

Delicious, but not the best BBQ I've ever had. They definitely have some of the best brisket in Charlotte, but that's not saying too much. Their portions are adequate and the price is decent. Their sauces are pretty good. I like their North Carolina BBQ sauce.   It's no Texas BBQ joint, but it's decent.

Brisket, brisket, brisket! And bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers!! Honestly, this place isn't really my first preference (I think twice about eating here even if I'm right across from this place) because I'm not a fan of barbecue and almost everything I eat here makes me feel guilty about introducing my body to so much grease and fat. But my boyfriend is crazy about this place and so I eat here more often than I otherwise would. In fact if it wasn't for him, I probably would have never been here. But when I do eat, I enjoy my meal.  Their brisket (as I chanted before) is really good. You can get it lean or fatty. Of course I pick lean. And my meal is never complete without the fried mac-n-cheese and bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers on the side. The hushpuppies are pretty good too. My boyfriend also loved the burnt ends (I haven't tried those, but I trust his opinion) and pulled pork. I'm not a big fan of their seating. I don't know what it is, but I'm always uncomfortable here. The metal chairs and tables aren't the most comfortable, and patio seating is a little tight.

Got the half rack of ribs in the spicy BBQ sauce and they were good. Not dry at all. Pickled onions are great with it too. Got the macaroni as a side item. Overall, food was pretty good. Service was a little slow but we did go there the first month they were open.

Came here on a Sunday. My fiancé said they had the best bloody marys! I got beef brisket. I love how you can choose fatty or lean. I got fatty and it was so tender and juicy. Macaroni was also good. I would definitely come here again. Staff was friendly too.

This is how brisket is supposed to be. Tender, flavorful, everything just right. I've had some great BBQ in my life but the brisket here puts them all to shame.  I enjoyed just about everything I tried from the mac & cheese to the hush puppies.  About the only thing I wasn't crazy about was the sausage. It was good, but not great.  Excellent service, decent prices. I'll definitely be back.

In town for the night so stoped here for som BBQ.  The special was the pork belly burnt ends.  They were melt in your mouth good.  We choose the Mac and cheese side, and it was very rich. The hush puppies were just okay.    The brisket salad had lots of veggies.  I wish I had room for desert, but I was so full from everything else.

BBQ was ok, sides good, service fantastic!    Started with the queso app with pork.  Queso was good but pork was unnecessary.  The pork made the dish tougher to eat.  Then had the full Carolina pork with collard greens and mac and cheese. The portion of pork was substantial. It wasn't dried out but there was minimal amount of bark/smoke in it. The east Carolina vinegar sauce was really mild, not nearly as strong as others. Collard greens were best dish of the meal.  Mac and cheese was typical baked southern style.  Service was fantastic. Sat at the bar and was promptly served. Food came out as fast as possible.  Refilled drink regularly.  Overall not bad.

Went to Midwood Smokehouse with the family on Friday afternoon. The place was busy before 5:00; good sign. Full disclosure, I'm vegetarian, so the meat reviews are second hand from my meatetarian husband.  He had a three-meat combo plater of ribs, brisket, and turkey. He said it was the best brisket he'd had in his life...and that's a long time. LOL. I had a three sides combo of mac and cheese, coleslaw, and smoked veggies. All very yummy. We started with hush puppies and the surprisingly tasty, but artery clogging, pimiento cheese fries. Our server was helpful and friendly, too. We'll definitely go back to Midwood Smokehouse!

Now this is real southern bbq.   I'm here visiting from NY, and wanted to find that genuine bbq experience.  I don't need to look any further than this place.    When you walk in, you'll be amazed at how big this place is.  Super clean, lots of seating and a large bar.  The decor is pretty neat- bbq themed stuff (check out the ladies room- you will crack up!) also, according to my husband, slave leia from Star Wars is hanging in the men's room which is AWESOME.    Now let's get to the most important part- THE FOOD.  We ended up getting the combo platter and selected the largest portion they offer which is called "pig out".   You get to chose 4 proteins so we did the Carolina chopped pork, beef brisket, pulled chicken bbq, and the saint Louis style pork ribs.  You also get a side of hush puppies with it and a It choice of two sides.   We obviously picked the mac n cheese because who doesn't love that?  The other side was the bacon wrapped jalapeños.  I also ordered the smoked vegetables on the side because those sounded interesting.   (Try the tangy mustard sauce, I put that on the chicken and was not disappointed at all).  EVERYTHING we ate was fantastic.    The manager came over to us to say hello and also explained that the hickory wood is locally sourced, they don't use a gas smoker- This is the real thing here.   We initially planned on wrapping half of our food for leftovers but we cleared our plates.    I would be doing this place an injustice if I didn't brag about the whiskey and bourbon menu.  What's bbq without a good whisky on the side?   It is pretty expansive with plenty of options to chose from.  You can also pick your own flight!    Our waitress Erin was a doll.  She went over the entire menu with us and was very knowledgeable and kind.  Overall we were extremely impressed.  We will be coming back when we are back in town.

This BBQ was great their special was a Bbq french dip WOW it was a beef brisket smoked perfectly . The cheese an au jus mouth watering. Only thing I was disappointed on was their Mac n cheese an im finding this a lot lately. It was that power mix cheese an than they just mix it with the noddles an bake it YUCK!! I'm a southern girl I know my Mac n cheese of its on the menu it needs to be real or just add a side that you do know how to make.  I'm surely goin back one friend didn't care for it but didn't try the brisket she said she wants to try it again. Check it out minus the Mac n cheese
The burnt ends, brisket, hush puppies, and banana pudding are all really good. The pork, mac-n-cheese, and their sauces are just good.  Probably deserves 4.5 stars.  I will definitely come back.

I'm glad I gave Midwood another try! I prefer this location to the one on Central Ave. The restaurant was busy for a weeknight and our food was served quickly. We shared the queso with brisket and each ordered a pulled pork dinner. I also ordered the macncheese and creamed corn because I can't help myself at BBQ places. Shh, this is a secret but it's about the sides. The pork was smoky and flavorful even without sauce. We were given several sauces so we were able to decide if we wanted our BBQ with sauce or without. I wouldn't recommend the creamed corn; it was more creamed sauce than corn. Not my favorite. The fries and coleslaw were good, though. I mean how can you go wrong with crinkle fries? I would gladly eat here again. The portions are generous and I took enough home to eat lunch the next day. Give them a go!

I've got mixed feelings about Midwood. It's a cool place and I was looking forward to it based on reviews. I was given a gift card which I wanted to use but I didn't know Bad Daddy's and Midwood were no longer connected. So beware. It ended up being more expensive than I would've like to pay. $50+ tax for one plate of BBQ, one salmon, wings and a drink. The wings were good; I'd recommend those. All flats is extra. I ordered the brisket ends with fries and coleslaw plus a side of pulled pork. They don't do combo platters but sides of meat for $3-4 extra. My plate ended up being $22.50. Yikes. The brisket ends were kind of fatty, the pulled pork comes without sauce, crinkle fries were ok, hush puppies were good and coleslaw was plentiful. I ordered the honey/moonshine/tea cocktail. It was good; something I'd recreate at home. I'm not sure why other reviewers are so in love with Midwood. Maybe I just miss the sauce.
Great barbeque, sides are ok, A little pricey

I am used to the Midwood Smokehouse location in Plaza Midwood. I had always been so happy with the meals there. So maybe my expectations were too high going into this park road location. Speaking of location- it's a great location! We had a fantastic server and kind hostess. Good beer. Bad news is... the food was just not good. We did go around 8pm. I just loved their chicken and i was so disappointed because it was very dry. The ribs were not a hot temperature but more Luke warm. The bacon wrapped jalepenos were soggy and the corn pudding needed some salt. Perhaps this was an off night... but I'm willing to try again based off of what I know the plaza Midwood location to be!

We had Midwood Smokehouose cater a work event for 25 visitors coming in from Japan and also the office staff. We wanted to give the visitors some real Southern American food. First of all, they all loved the food and thanked us incessantly.   We purchased the grilled chicken, roasted summer vegetables, potato salad, and banana pudding. Everythinng was excellent! The chicken was really moist and had a rich smoky flavor. The veggies were fresh and crunchy. The potato salad was creamy and tasted like they had just made it. The banana pudding may have been the best one I have ever tried. I am guessing they make it with condensed milk and cream cheese and fold in the whipped cream to give it that airy feeling.   We also ordered regular and sweet tea. They brought us sliced lemons which was a lovely touch. They also provided serving utensils and flatware.   I will definitely be visiting in person. I also want to comment on the wonderful presentation that the caterer gave us. It looked very nice for a professional event. Also, the ease of the ordering was appreciated as well as the reasonable prices. Thanks Midwood!
This is is best CAROLINA pulled pork barbq in Charlotte! Their baked beans have barbq in them. Sooo good! Great location.
The pork barbq plate with Midwood sauce was outstanding. Hub said the jalapeño bacon wrap side was excellent. Banana pudding was very good.
Drove by and decided to have dinner there.  Ordered the regular size sampler and it was enough of meal for me and two ladies.  Excellent food!

Food is not bad in The Smokehouse overpriced that's for sure the taste is good some days are not so hot on the taste that is sometimes the spare ribs is not good but sandwich that is cool brisket is delicious I have had a bad one but most of the time they're good not worth the price for a sandwich over $10 is a little expensive however they did have a sale for $8 and some change that was better I mean meet sampler platter they charging you against by the pound for sausage a piece of chicken and some brisket the price is ridiculously high do you think that you eating Prime cutting meat that came and poured it I would never spend $24.99 for a sample platter there's not nothing much enough for two but if you like to eat it's not enough for two one and a half person just saying that's just starting price $24.99 and up

Good quality meat and great service.  Our group had the brisket, salmon, st Louis style ribs, and burnt ends.  I was hoping for the burnt ends to be a bit more tender and juicy, but overall still a great meal. I loved the ribs and wish I got the full rack.

For openers, if you believe the best barbecue is usually found in a bad part of town in a place with bars on the windows and just enough grease on the table to write your intials, then this isn't it.  If, on the other hand, you think good barbecue can be found in a funky part of town, with tons of other places to eat in every direction, then Midwood BBQ may be for you.  Actually, I suggest calling it Midwood BBBBQ... this is another of those places that has grown to the point that it's a Big Bucks BBQ place complete with a real people bar and more televisions than needed, much less appreciated.  Parking is yet another issue and don't be surprised if there's a wait.  For someone who has spent a lifetime in search of the perfect barbecue, Midtown has several things going for it, but, in reality it's a big sports bar that has some decent barbecue.  Let's start with the service and the décor: folks are there to greet and seat you when you come through the door, a smiling face to who quickly takes your drink order, clean tables with the now-it's-almost required rolls of paper towel, a beer signs from brews gone by, photos from Charlotte's earlier days and at least one television per wall in the bar and in the main dining room. There's also some sidewalk tables.  We opted for a couple of their better known appetizers, fried pickles and bacon wrapped jalapenos, a half dozen bucks. And that's the first rub...   the bacon wrapped Jalapenos were at the highlight of the entire meal, followed by the Hush Puppies and then a tie between the souped up baked beans and the Mac n Cheese - and when the sides outshine the protein offerings there's a problem.  That's not the way it's supposed to be.  The situation is reversed at most barbecue joints: the meats get all the attention and the sides, all too often, come out of a can or the freezer. Not so at Midwood's Smokehouse... and for the real barbecue zealot there for low and slow cooked meats, too many TVs, beer choices and sides can be a distraction.  The ribs, as a for instance, literally fell off the bone. Why?  Were they parboiled, or baked, and then tossed on the grill?  Steamed (to tenderize) before they were served? If any of the aforementioned, that's not low and slow over a bed of smoldering wood.  That's cheating.     To give credit where due, the brisket was exceptional... just enough fat left to provide real good (and moist) flavor. And the pulled pork was almost as good and served in the same generous portion.  The chicken was on the dry side.  For the Brown Shoe Gourmet's taste, their homemade sauce (smoky and sweet) worked best. An alien at the table preferred the vinegar based which brings up another point: this is a North Carolina barbecue joint that shows more of a leaning to Texas 'cue than Carolina style... the brisket, the jalapenos being good examples.  For a guy who has spent a lifetime in pursuit of the perfect barbecue (read more than 70 other barbecue reviews), this certainly isn't it... but it's fairly good with some exceptional sides, friendly folks and exceptional service.  Worth the effort if you can find parking, worth the effort if there's a game you want to see, a specific beer you've a thirst for, and are up for some fair to middlin' 'cue.

Finally got a chance to try this place out after passing by it so many times on the way to Plaza shopping and bars.  We split a large pulled pork plate and a small chopped salad.  The pulled pork comes with the vinegar based sauce, but we were lucky they forgot to pour it on top so they put it on the side, and since it was my first time there, I asked to try out their other sauces.  I preferred their Midwood signature, which was sweet and smokey, over the NC vinegar, but to each their own.  The pork itself was just ok, as I've had better and I've had worse.    Now to the sides.  We tried the bacon wrapped jalapenos and the bbq baked beans.  The jalapenos were good with cheese inside, but the bacon was just too fatty as it was all baked together and didn't cook enough.  I was also wary of the baked beans since I know many places who just open up a can and serve.  Theirs were cooked right with some pieces of meat in it, making it very tasty.  I would definitely recommend the beans to any barbecue fan.  Overall, the service was pretty good, as our server was keen to help us with the menu and seemed knowledgeable.  We came at an off-hour during the week, so I can't speak to the crowds here, but I can see an issue if the cramped parking lot that writhes around the building gets packed.  Will come back to try their other entrees and sandwiches!

Huffington Post wrote an article of 15 reasons why Charlotte is the weirdest and #13 was the city's reaction to Michelle Obama's compliment to their BBQ. Charlotte said, "Our BBQ is just okay". And that's exactly how I felt about my pulled pork. Not much flavor, it just existed. I didn't see any big deal for the hush puppies either, are they supposed to be dry? The winners of the night were definitely the collard greens and bacon wrapped jalapeños. Our server was friendly and the ambience was chill, we sat outside in their covered space.
great BBQ shack, good beer.. and CHEERWINE!!!! so good, highly recommend

Still consistently the best BBQ I've tasted.  Whenever someone comes to visit, we always take them here, it's a hit everytime. The takeout option is always the best option when it's busy.  We ordered from here on a busy Saturday night recently and it was 20 minutes from the time we ordered the food until it was time for pickup.  I waltzed in, bypassed all the folks waiting for talbes, went to the Take-Out area on the right of bar,  paid, and walked out with my food.  It took longer for me to park than it did to get the food.  This is a staple in the "list of restaurants to take guests to".  Keep up the good work.
This place is wonderful. Tasty BBQ, great service, good for large groups, good beer selection.
Great BBQ -smokehouse. Lots of choices and combos. Moderately priced.  Great service too. Several locations around Charlotte.

Ton of food. ..All delicious!  I went with the tacos. I liked the tacos but could have easily been satisfied with just the side dishes.  Mac and cheese & creamed corn were awesome. Large place. Kid friendly. Outdoor seating available.

Midwood was good for the most part. I absolutely loved the mac and cheese, baked beans and brisket. If I go back, those are likely the items I would order. They were really good! I ordered a four meat choice sampler, but was told that they were out of ribs. One star docked for that. BBQ places cannot run out of ribs!!

Best barbecue in Charlotte, by far! The Carolina barbecue is to die for. They have wonderful sides also, the bacon wrapped jalapeños dipped in ranch are unbelievable. The service here is pretty good, nothing to rant about, but not much to compliment either. My sister does not eat pork and their are always chicken options available. Overall a good place, it is is the barbecue that make it worthy of five stars.

Was finally able to stop in at Midwood today for lunch, and I was very impressed. Definitely the best BBQ I've found in Charlotte so far. I ordered the large plate of pulled chicken in mustard sauce with bacon wrapped jalapenos and pimiento cheese fries as my sides. The pulled chicken was very tender, and the mustard sauce was decent. I also got some of Midwood's habanero BBQ sauce on the side, and this put the chicken over the top to amazing! That sauce is the bomb! Not too spicy, not too vinegary, and not too sweet- just a perfect balance.  The bacon wrapped jalapenos were amazing. Extremely smoky, great bacon flavor, a little cheese to balance everything out, and spice from the jalapeno. I was able to have pimiento cheese fries as my other side for a $1 upcharge and they were good as well but not great. My girlfriend ordered sweet potato fries, and they were awesome! I would honestly rather have the plain sweet potato fries than the pimiento cheese fries (but I love sweet potato fries so I am biased). She also had the Cuban sandwich which was good but not amazing in my opinion. The hush puppies that came with the BBQ plate weren't bad but just average.  Our server was friendly, the atmosphere of the restaurant was pretty nice (although there is a slight smoky smell inside as any good BBQ place should have so keep that in mind), and the prices were great for the amount of food.

Well, color me impressed. Midwood Smokehouse was really, really good! It's sitting at a 4.5 stars for me right now, but I imagine it will jump to 5 in no time.   Not that I'm surprised, frankly...because Frank Scibelli seems to have the magical touch when it comes to delicious and well-formulated restos in Charlotte. It's a great location (parking can be tricky) with wonderful, friendly service and tons of tasty items on the menu. Here are just a few things I tasted...  1) Pork platter: 4.5/5: Succulent, tender and delightful. This pork platter rivals Mac's, in my opinion. The meat is very smokey - due to the fabulous smoker they purchased for this establishment. But it's a good kind of smoke, no Liquid Smoke here.   2) Hush puppies: 4/5: Crispy outside, soft inside and damn good.   3) Sweet potato fries: 3/5: Good fries but paled in comparison to the other decadence on the table.   4) Bacon wrapped jalapenos: 4/5: Not nearly as hot as you'd think but a really flavorful starter. Make sure you eat one that has the bacon all crisped up. No one wants sad, soggy bacon.  5) Queso with barbecue: 4/5: Um, I love queso. I also love pork barbecue. Put them both together and voila! Instant amazing app.   6) Banana pudding: 5/5: Hell to the yeah. Homemade deliciousness. With vanilla wafers. This is the real deal and you must order it. I don't care how full you are.   I have a big ole smokey crush on Midwood Smokehouse. Looking forward to going back and checking out the patio!
Minus 2 stars for the new menu. No more Redneck tacos? No more smoke sausage plate? 2 of the best things on the menu, gone.

Being a native New Englander with not a ton of exposure to authentic southern style barbecue, this place is a hands down 5 star. I love everything about it from it's simple, traditional menu to the hip ambience. My only regret is not getting the burnt ends, as I thought these were superior to the brisket and pulled pork that I ordered. The hush puppies were amazing.

Holy f-ing sh*t this place is amazing.  Right from walking in I was in heaven with how good it smelled, then when we got our food. Everything was perfect. Our server Tom was a wonderful super friendly and attentive. Everything on the menu looked fantastic. We got the combo plate with everything but the ribs (it was an hour before closing and they're super popular) the sausage was perfect, chopped pork was heavenly, pulled chicken fantastic and the brisket was phenomenal. Mac and cheese is bombdiggity and their hush puppies are 100% my favorite hush puppies ever.  The pecan cobbler WITH ice cream is definitely not to be missed either.  We just moved to the area and this is hands down our favorite place that will be a regular spot for us :)

Bacon wrapped jalapenos. That's all you need to know. Carry on. I'll wait while you go order them.  By now you should know my rule of thumb when it comes to Charlotte: if Frank Scibelli's name is attached, it's going to be damn good. I love their smoked wings. Usually, I'll get those and a bunch of sides. We already addressed the BWJ. I'm also a huge fan of the smoked veggies and creamed corn. True story: they took the creamed corn off the menu for a hot second and so many people got upset that they had to bring it back. I don't ever order pulled pork anywhere I go, so for me my go to proteins are the ribs and brisket. I just had burnt ends for the first time last week and they were fabulous. This is going to sound random, but the grilled cheese is great here as well.   Pretty good beer selection. You can also order online for pickup. Parking is not great, but there is a lot behind the building as well. Just pay attention to the signs.

nothing here is going to blow your mind, but there is nothing disappointing. This is always my go-to for quick and easy bbq to-go. There are some other places in town that are probably better on the yum-yum-scale, but this is in the neighborhood and it is so solid, love taking friends visiting from outta town here for good carolina barbeque.

Great barbaque, local beers, what else could you ask for.  I met up with a buddy at this place who lives in Charlotte.  Let's jump right to the action kids:  Cool decor, laid back and we sat in the bar area.  It was pretty packed so the food must be good, right?  I started with a Tito's kicking mule.  Great take on an old favorite.  I followed with an Unknown IPA.  Great local beer that starts with a good hoppy bite and a mellow malt finish.  Dinner was bacon wrapped jalepenos, burned ends and cole slaw.  Great smokey flavor tender bits of meat.  Solid service, great food, it's a winner!

Visited this location yesterday 7/9/17 for my moms bday lunch. We were a group of 6 and though they were busy (1:30) we were seated within 5 minutes. Our server Michael was absolutely the best, he was very polite and also made a few recommendations since it was our 1st time there. Everyone ordered different foods and EVERYTHING was cooked to perfection..the smoked wings were juicy and of good size, the ribs were fall off the bone tender, the chicken that came with the rib combo was moist but the skin was good and crispy. Even the burger was juicy..our sides included collard greens, sweet potato fries, Cole slaw, creamed corn and fries everything was great! They give good portion sizes so you will not leave hungry. I will be back very soon and I hope I'm sitting in Michaels section.

My wife and I were so excited Midwood Smokehouse moved into Birkdale Village. We have already been a handful of times and the food/atmosphere are always good. I love the burnt ends, greens and Mac and cheese. The hush puppies and pulled pork are also delicious.

Good BBQ but I can get better BBQ in LA.  That's embarrassing.  They were out of ribs but the employees were super nice and friendly.  Just sucks that the BBQ food here is mediocre and reminds me of a fast food chain.  Won't be back except for the collard greens maybe.

I'm a brisket condaseur and I have never had brisket like I just did right now at this place. A shout out to our great waiter, Barry. I can't wait to come back and try their philly with brisket meat. My husband had the Cuba and he loved it. We will be returning until they close down (that's if we don't eat all their supply first). Highly, highly, highly recommend this place!!!!

Visited here Sunday Night. Parking, as everyone says, is a challenge, but not that bad.   We had just come from spending the whole weekend hiking in Great Smokey Mountains NP, so we were HUNGRY.   Got seated right away, which was a pleasant surprise as they seemed to be very busy.   I got the sampler plate, small version, my wife got a large chicken. And let me just say the meat was excellent. The brisket was one of the best I have had, melting on the tongue, great spice without being too salty, Next time I come I will order like three plates of that. Not to say the pork wasn't excellent as well, I really liked the vinegar heavy NC style on the pork. The ribs, also quite nice. The sausage, well, a little salty, but the mustard dip made up for that in spades. I give this place A+ for food.  I would have liked to see a little more of the vinegar heavy NC style in the dishes. We had been out in Oklahoma for three years, and while the brisket was excellent, in NC I'd like to see it done NC style not Texas Style, and the ribs, were great St Louis style ribs, again, I'd like to see what they'd look like with the awesome NC vinegar marinate the pork used.  My wife's chicken was great as well. Again food fantastic.  Our service was brisk, and why I am not giving five stars. I've worked restaurants before and am pretty sure they were short staffed (despite getting seated right away it is clear they were turning and burning), and our server was a bartender that got a demotion to waitress for the night, and was a little unhappy about it. Service was crisp and efficient, but we got our check dropped before we had a chance to order desert. As we both ordered a lot of meat, I can understand that the server thought we wouldn't have room, but we had been hiking all weekend. The proper forms of service were performed, but it was a bit brisk, and we definitely got the impression that they wanted to turn the table.   Nothing wrong with that on a busy Sunday night, and I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone that asked. That brisket was worth coming back for. Though I just can't help but wonder what it would be like with the pork preparation or similar. It is a nine hour drive from Allentown PA, I'll drive down if you make a NC style brisket. JUST TO EAT THAT.  Great restaurant. Was a nice treat after a weekend of hiking. I figured we smelled like campfire smoke anyway, so a smokehouse was the place to go.

We will never go to this racist place again. My husband along with my son waited for over 10  minutes for someone to serve us, no one ever stopped by to even greet us. They weren't even busy, I watched a few tables get sat after us and the servers didn't waste any time going to greet them and taking their drink order. One server walked by us twice and looked at us without saying a word and she wasn't busy bc she was standing around talking to other servers who were waiting for tables. I'm sure if we weren't black they would have greeted us with a smile, but we decided to get up and leave and spend our money elsewhere. I just moved to Charlotte and clearly I don't know the rules about the white and black sides of town and clearly this is for the white people!

The aroma, music and vibe were excellent, during this very busy lunch time visit.  The food and beer all came out within a reasonable amount of time, and the wait staff were friendly, even those rushed and being trained.  The pulled-pork with super tasty and warm - pink coloured, with a smokey undertone and NOT at all dry. The coleslaw and hush-puppies were a little too sweet for my liking, but each had a good crunch and good texture. Unfortunately I did not get enough BBQ source, (a bigger dish please) nor were they any to taste test on the tables.  The OMB Copper was ably poured by the bar staff and tasted wonderfully fresh and crisp. It could have done with being a fuller pint!  I am looking forward to returning. Easily the best BBQ in south Charlotte.

My husband and myself stumbled upon Midwood Smokehouse when we were on our way to our favorite barbque restaurant, He was reluctant to forgo getting to eat at his favorite place but he gave in to me and man alive was we both glad he did. I had the brisket with the Best mac and cheese and he had barbque. Everything was so delicious right down to the tea. We definitely will be returning and bringing our friends. This was one time that him taking the scenic route paid off.  Beth & Kevin Chapman
This is the best place to eat BBQ in Charlotte hands down.  Bring your blind friend, and have them pick out your food by throwing darts at the menu--you cannot go wrong here.

Best barbecue I've ever had. Absolutely awesome. We ordered burnt ends and brisket fries. Highly recommended. I also prefer the regular coleslaw over the bbq slaw....lastly, bbq sauces are great!!!!!!

You'll find great BBQ here. I would definitely go back. My favorite was the Smoked Chicken Wings. I ordered them dry and then was able to try the 3 different sauces. These wings still make my mouth water.   I also ordered the Well-Fed Combo and that was more than enough food. I ordered the Brisket, pulled pork, pulled chicken and Pork Ribs. The Pulled Pork and Ribs are not to be missed, full of flavor and moist. The pulled chicken and brisket were both a little dry.   The sauces were also very good, especially the honey-mustard. I ordered the coleslaw and bacon-wrapped jalapenos, both were really good.   I'm a big fan!
Best BBQ in Charlotte hands down. Very busy on nights and weekends so expect a wait. Pulled pork platter is my go to. But the best thing on the menu is the brisket queso...a must try for everyone.

I had higher hopes for Midwood after searching far and wide on Yelp for bbq in Charlotte while driving down to Atlanta. The menu is large and boasts several dishes and sides. My friends ordered ribs, pulled pork sandwich, hush puppies and I ordered the pimento fries with pulled pork on to[. Skip the pimento fries because they're basically crinkle fries with toppings. Head dive into any bbq on the menu and wash it down with a whiskey flight or a beer from the beer list. Serving sizes are no joke here so order responsibly.

Midwood has an incredible amount of hype to live up to. Most people that aren't from charlotte are usually heading here for their first bbq fix. I have come here on several occasions and am thoroughly pleased more often than not. Was let down by the brisket on one visit and they could do some work on their mac and cheese. Other than that the place is great. Decent service. Burnt ends are always my go to so I strongly recommend them. Bacon wrapped jalapenos are great as well as pimento cheese fries with pulled pork. Beer selection is full of local craft. And whiskey selection is good too.
Brisket is the best. Stuffed jalapeños great. My favorite BBQ joint in town. Mom loves half rack ribs. Dad really liked philly steak sandwich.  Just try it,  I'd be shocked if you were disappointed.

HOLY HELL was this place good!   Now, I'm a guy born and raised in the deep South and I know my BBQ.   Midwood Smokehouse was RIGHT ON!    For my first visit to this place, I had to try the pulled pork plate.  I got a little of all 4 sauces to see which was my favorite.   All of 'em were good.  Mac and Chz and Collards were excellent too.  Lots and lots of Flavor.  Service was quick and efficient (although we went on a Monday...so things were at a little slower pace).    I most definitely recommend this restaurant for people who love BBQ.  I'm so glad they set up shop in my hood.  I'll be back....of that you can be sure!

The food here was very good but the service I received during my time here was pretty terrible. Our waitress was very rude to us and made multiple smart comments. I didn't catch her name but she was a loud blonde. Yes I appreciate someone who is friendly and joking a bit but you are also suppose to have a level of professionalism. She also took forever to bring us drinks and refills. A wait is understandable but when I see you joking around at other tables and taking your sweet time, I get impatient.  The poor service here was unfortunate because this place is worthy of 5 stars. The drink selection was pretty good and included some local beers. I went with Wooden Robot's overachiever which was a nice fruity pale ale. For food we got the brisket queso dip which was yummy and I got the pulled pork with bacon wrapped jalepenos and hush puppiesbfor my entree. The pork was fresh and flavorful, just the way I like it. The sides were a nice compliment to the pork as well. My friends did complain that the ribs were dry and to me they did look pretty dry, which is a no go.  Again the food here was good but our server really hurt the experience.

This was the first time we visited here and it was great.  We checked in ahead of time with skip the line thru yelp and it went perfectly  .  The food was great and staff great too.  The queso appetizer was awesome with pulled pork  and brisket was so tender.  In my opinion the creamed corn and Mac and cheese  sides were clean the plate good.  Not a crumb left!

Nothing really special to report here. The BBQ was ok. The beers on draft were plenty. The service was hit and miss. I have been to much better BBQ joints in Charlotte. Unless you don't have any other choice, and in this town you do, I would pass.

We are new to NC BBQ.  This was a fabulous introduction!   The Brisket was amazing and the burnt ends (brisket) were also just as one would imagine them.  Perfect. Great service and beer. Whats not to love.  We will be back!

I had some business to close in south Charlotte a couple weeks back and had a later than desired evening meal.  The first thing that I thought was that it might not be that great because its in a retail shopping plaza. The atmosphere for having bbq should be one step removed from a tin shack, with a ceiling fan stuck on high speed and a dog barking in the background. Well, Midwood is nothing like that, but the interior decor suggests that they are serious about their food.   I ordered a pulled pork sandwich, slaw on top (natch) with crinkle cut fries. Absolutely delicious! I had a couple of beers and a nice chat with some locals across the bar from me. Normally, I write longer reviews, but I only had time to visit once so here are my impressions based on just one visit.  I liked the atmosphere and decor very much. My sandwich was very good, and a good value considering how big it was. The bartender was friendly. And, one of my biggest concerns about any restaurant is cleanliness. Midwood is clean and so is the restroom! That is a good sign that management is on top of things. Based on my one visit, I would recommend Midwood to anyone, and if I am in this part of Charlotte again, I will be sure to stop by.

for memorial day i realized i did not have any barbecues or anything to go to, so i figured i would go to this place with the boyfriend who hates most places that we eat at in charlotte. but he didnt hate this place. this is why:  1. bacon wrapped jalapenos. you can get them as an appetizer or as a side.  2. dollar beer, or two dollar beer. he likes beer. i dont drink alcohol, im also not mormon, but i mean, that sounds super cheap so thats a good thing. apparently other drinks are expensive but what the hell do i know about drink prices?   3. the super awesome food! which we both agree on. the special was a brisket sandwich and it was extremely good.   other reasons why you should eat here: good service, nice people, they have coke and not pepsi (this is crucial people), it is relatively cheap and there are large portions. there is an outdoor area and on a really hot day the inside was nice and cool. the mac and cheese was very delicious as well!   eat here. my boyfriend ate here and said he liked it and so in regular people terms that must mean its phenomenal.

If you want barbeque, make your way to Midwood Smokehouse. Oh goodness, their draft selection is good, and their custom mixed drinks are great. You must try the Back Porch Tea -- it was superb! A true Southern mixed drink that combined sweet tea (that isn't overly sweet) and Jack Daniels Tennessee whiskey (and muddled lemon).  We (2 of us) ordered the cheese fries topped with brisket and the combo platter of 4 meats and 2 sides (collard greens and bacon wrapped stuffed jalapeños) and that was plenty of food, enough for leftovers that we made into breakfast the next morning.   Absolutely delicious. Oh I can't wait to make my way back here....

First time to be at this restaurant. Started with the bacon wrapped jalapeños. Fantastic.I did have the brisket with coleslaw small plate. I choose the habanero BBQ sauce to go with  the brisket which turned out to be perfect choice For dessert we had the bourbon apple pie. Wow  Be back soon

This place insists in disappointing us with their terrible service. It so Saturday at 8.30 PM. The waitress has the gall to tell us that it is "late" in a Saturday so they don't have either the drink I want (because they ran out of "one of the ingredients") or the food we all want. This place keeps tempting us with good food but pushes us away with consistently bad servers, consistent mismanagement of food inventory and a general feeling of carelessness.

Just love the food. Great service and great food!  Often take guests to dine here and everyone loves their pulled pork sandwiches and sweet potato fries. Will definitely continue to eat here. Take out is always wonderful too!

Everytime I visit the Charlotte area, I have to stop by Midwood for BBQ. Best North Carolina pulled pork that I've ever had. Had the pleasure of having Rachel as our waitress last night.
