There isn't a better waitress out there!! She was not only very helpful with recommending certain dishes but she also has the best attitude ever! She really made the dining experience so much fun!!

HANDS DOWN the BEST BBQ I have EVER HAD.  Been to Georgia, Tennessee, Texas, Florida and had BBQ in all of them. None of those can touch this place.   Even the sides, MAC N CHEESE, BBQ BEANS etc were amazing. I don't understand how anyone can rate this place less than 5 stars. It has RUINED BBQ for me now!   Even our server was quite a jokester. VERY entertaining!   Don't miss this one.

BBQ is an acquired taste and everyone has an opinion. Personally I don't care if it comes from the Carolinas, Memphis, Kansas City, Texas or wherever. It just has to taste good. Charlotte has had it's share of BBQ places over the years - some local joints and others where chains. None have really wowed me like Midwood Smokehouse. Out of the dozen or so times I have eaten there it has been consistently delicious. I go there specifically for the beef brisket. It is quite literally the best brisket I have ever had and the kind you think about long after you have finished your meal. I usually get the half and half (half lean, half fat). The flavor of the bark from whatever magical rub they are using should be deemed a national treasure and samples of it should be put in the Smithsonian to celebrate its greatness. The word is out and this place is quickly becoming the hot spot for BBQ in the Charlotte region. So much so that seating has been a problem. But not anymore. They just expanded and opened a new section of the restaurant to seat more people. In a way that makes me sad because I wanted this place all to myself.

Got to do the 3star review and i was so looking forward to it. Found the place ok. Bbq didn't remind me of the q i get in SC , it was dry. Everything just seemed greasy and overdone. The fiance got sick about an hour later. I'll try again because i know so many peeps have liked this place but it was too overdone for me.
One of the better bbq joints in the Charlotte area. And there are many. Try the Abiline Brisket sandwich. The whole menus has great stuff. Definitely try a few of the sides.

Well well well. Being impressed by a bbq joint is though to pull off in Carolina. But Midwood is impressive. I must say their Abiline brisket sandwich is one of the best sandwiches I have ever had. Wow. Good beer selection and great sides. I have been twice so far and plan to make it a regular. Go try it out.

Had an excellent meal here.  Went there for my Graduation from CPCC with family and all of the food choices we had were delicious.  My favorite would be the Bar-b-que queso.  We choose  to go with the pulled pork, but I am sure the brisket would have been good also.  My smoked turkey was moist and very thick sliced.  Friendly staff made for a great dining experience with our four year old.  I would recommend for both couples out for a drink and families with children also.   If there was one complaint is was that their small parking lot is full most of the time, but that doesn't seem like a problem at all now does it?
Just had the Carolina pork with greens and was not disappointed. Look forward to our next visit

I went here with my cousin and it was to die for. The wings were amazing, and my half chicken with cole slaw and Mac and cheese was literally melt in your mouth, bursting with flavor. I am drooling just thinking about it. I love how they give you the sauces  on the side and you can try each of them to find the one you like best. I am in love with the mustard one. Best BBQ sauce ever. You have to check this place out if you are in Charlotte.

Down home Carolina BBQ!  Carolina BBQ means pork. Pulled pork with a vinegar based sauce.  I'm a Texan, and I appreciate good BBQ. I seek it out. That's why I was so pleased to try Midwood Smokehouse. I was fairly clueless about Carolina style BBQ, and was excited when the waitress knew exactly what I should have when I said I wanted local style BBQ. They served me up two heaping spoonfuls of pulled pork, topped with onions, a side of hushpuppies, and bacon-wrapped jalapenos.  The bbq sauce was vinegar based, with spices and peppers sloshing around the bottom of the mix. I've never quite understood vinegar based sauces, but enjoyed the pickled pepper flavors  when mixed with the pork. Parts of the pulled pork had that char on it, or bark, which gave some pieces a smoky, crunchy quality.  The hushpuppies seemed like deep fried pieces of cornbread. They had a slight sweetness to the cornbread. Decent.  I wasn't wild about the bacon wrapped jalapenos. Being from San Antonio, we know our jalapenos, and these weren't the most primo peppers. On the small side, and overcooked so that they squish when you bite 'em. I was blown away by the beer list. They had a rare cask aged beer, and lots of local options for fine beer.  Unfortunately, they were out of a lot of items, so our selections were somewhat hampered.  The service was very friendly, and they made lots of great recommendations and carefully explained a little about everything we were eating. You could tell that they take pride in the BBQ here.

Probably one of the best barbecue we have had in Charlotte since moving here. The staff was so nice and was able to give recommendations. Any awesome environment. If you want to stay close to the city but want barbecue this is the place to go. I had the brisket (AMAZING) with the twiced baked potatoes and hush puppies! My family had the pork burnt ends and pulled chicken! Couldn't be happier with this choice and will be back again!

Quite possibly the best BBQ in Charlotte. It's done right and everything is always tasty. If you get there late, they may be out of the more popular menu items...so try to get there as early as possible.  If they ever have the fried mac & cheese with pimento cheese....GET IT! Don't even consider NOT getting it!

Excellent service, very friendly staff welcoming & attentive. Consistent recipes, resulting in delicious meals.  Well balanced flavors in the rub & the smoking of the meat.  Impressive beef brisket & Mac & cheesr

Delicious BBQ! Would definitely go back and recommend to others.  I had the pulled pork, baked beans, and mac and cheese. Hush puppies are also served with the entrees. Also, it was very affordable - ~$12 per person.   The restaurant was very crowded during lunch on a weekend, so I would recommend calling in advance.

We were a party of 8 for 11am on a Saturday. Nice to know they now take reservations. Service was very good and so was the food. Everyone had some type of brisket with all dishes looking different. Portions were hearty, food was hot and tasted very good We all want to return. Just wish they would turn down the music. Can't stand yelling to be heard.

The pimento fries are very filling and a good starter. The combo sampler is a nice way to try most everything. The brisket was awesome. I like it fattier but we got the mixed to share. The fatty ends just completely melted. They have not overly-sweet sweet tea. I liked both their bbq sauces. The tomato based on was nice with a little bite at the end. Not so spicy that the kids couldn't eat it either so probably just the right amount.
We were a party of five for dinner on a Saturday night.  Everyone was very happy with the food.  We were seated right away and service was very friendly and attentive.  We would definitely go back.

BAAMMM, The second you walk in the hickory smoke hits you right in the face.. No worries get cold beer and a bacon wrap jalapeño to help you settle you in.  Service : 4 stars Food: 4 Stars Restroom : 4 stars Price vs quantity : 5 stars  If you leave this place hungry, you should put a apple in your mouth and jump in the smoker pig..

So I've been going to Midwood Smokehouse for a few months now. One night I decided to get some smoked wings to go. I get home and my wings are undercooked. Called the manager who have me a chemistry lesson on wings instead of saying "I'm sorry about that. Let's just get you some more wings." I literally live around the corner from this restaurant and would spend a pretty good amount there. Will never go back again.

Hands down, the best bar-b-que I've eaten in Charlotte. I'm originally from Texas, so I love some good BBQ. However, I'd been relatively disappointed in the BBQ I've had in Charlotte until I came to Midwood. We ordered the pulled pork, chicken, brisket, and burnt ends, collard greens, bacon wrapped jalapeños, and creamed corn. Everything was delicious! I'm a connoisseur of good brisket, and this did not disappoint. I'm excited to go back and try the ribs! Carry on Midwood; I'll be back soon!

We enjoyed a wonderful dinner at the Midwood Smokehouse behind Park Road Shopping Center tonight. Even though we had to wait for a table, the service was very good and food was great. We split the 4 meat combo "well-fed" and still had to get a to go box.  The management and staff were attentive. They made sure everything was right. We will definitely return to this location. In my opinion, the best of the 3 Midwood locations I have eaten at.
Wait staff is on point. Food is delicious  Obama ate here and he had my vote so that's two thumbs up for this place  meat is good but the Mac and cheese so damn good!

I have to admit.... We went in on a Saturday (first thing) and we were expecting great things! Unfortunately, our waitress was clearly pre-occupied or simply untrained - the place was NOT busy and almost immediate after taking our first bites, she placed the check on the table. What?!? We actually wanted dessert! But ok, fair enough, we'll pass on dessert..... She saw we still had food on our plates about 10 mins in and she asked if we wanted boxes. I thought for sure that I was on a hidden camera show... Are you kidding me? She tried to offer a box for our toddler and almost took his half eaten food away to clear the table. How bizarre!!! The place wasn't packed with tables waiting either - it wasn't even noon. We were so put off that we were rushed out that we can guarantee we won't be back for quite sometime. Waiting tables is NOT about rushing customers out the door. I was disappointed and can only hope this young woman gets coached - tips and "regulars" come from good service AND good food. Not one OR the other.
Great food. The cheese fries app was very good and so was the brisket. Get the sausage as an add, very flavorful. I'm not a fan of mustard based sauce but theirs was really good.
My favorite bbq spot in town.   If they are offering the burnt ends you have to get them.

Must go. Must eat everything you can.  The midwood chopped salad is fabulous. Get it tossed with the green goddess.  Go for the pimento cheese fries and you might as well throw some bbq on them :)  I always get the same thing...bbq pork plate with bbq slaw (vinegary and delicious) and bacon wrapped jalapeños.   They have platters too...which usually feeds me and my hubby and leaves us with plenty to take home.   Service is always great...although sometimes the servers are a bit aloof. I prefer to sit at the bar.
Outstanding bbq and food. Thst could easily beat Bobby Flay in a throw down. This must for bbq lovers.

Came in for some late lunch on a Saturday at 2:00 and was sat immediately and offered something to drink by the server.   We got a half rack of St. Louis ribs with the dry rub and the Texas hash that was on special. Everything was good. The hush puppies were really little and you only get a few of them. The smoked veggies side was very oily and was nothing special. The ribs were cooked really well, falling off the bone.   The hash came with 2 slices of sourdough toast buttered and was topped with two fried eggs and a half of an avocado sliced. It had great flavor but the brisket was really fatty. The hash is a good greasy breakfast/brunch meal for sure.

When I visited my cousin in Charlotte, I couldn't wait to have some real BBQ.  I'm down south for goodness sakes! How could I go wrong? I was told about the rave reviews received by this restaurant and was excited to eat here. I cannot explain how disappointed I was with this place.  The portions were tiny and the food had no flavor.   I ordered the pulled chicken. I received a scoop of meat that appeared to be barely the amount of a chicken thigh. It was pale and dry.   After I tried it, I told the waiter it was flavorless.  He said since the skin is pulled off, the flavor leaves with it.   First of all, you can season under the skin, as I do at home.   Secondly, if you let the chicken sit overnight after you've seasoned it, the meat picks up more flavor. Lastly, if you smoke it or BBQ it, the flavor permeates the meat.  Give me a break! What kind of BBQ spot is this? Dinosaur BBQ runs circles around this place! I will never, ever eat here again. Terrible!
Yum, yum, YUMMMMMM!!! Favorite BBQ place in Charlotte. Our waiter was awesome too. Super nice and enthusiastic about the restaurant.

I found this on Yelp. I've pasted this several times but never stopped until today. I ordered take-out. Based on the bartender recommendations, I ordered pulled pork plate with baked beans and collard greens. The pulled pork and baked beans were good. The collards were a little tougher than I like. However they were seasoned pretty good. The serving size is large. I could not eat it all in one sitting.
Fast service, the guy at the bar was on his game at lunch and served up a well poured beer after taking my order. Food was fast and delicious all in all a great time. 10/10 will munch here again.

Fantastic! I got the blackened salmon sandwich with roasted corn, red onions, tomato and coleslaw on top. Delicious! The French Fries were so so...  My husband got the lean brisket plate with coleslaw and hush puppies! He thought it was all mouth watering. Great place, pretty cheap; the only thing I really didn't like was the seating. It is very snug. You can almost touch the person at the next table.  *Stephanie K-I can't figure out how to message you back. Because your food is SO outstandingly good I think the restaurant is packed all the time. I'm a small woman, but even I felt way too close to people. We were seated in the back of the restaurant...the very far back wall area near an exit door. It was a row of two seater type tables against the far back wall. But...that said, the food is worth it! I have raved to quite a few friends, and my mother in law flew in from California and was absolutely delighted with the sampler platter!
Best brisket in town!!! My boyfriend and I go here every Sunday for brisket! They ALWAYS have great food, great service, and great drinks!

This is one of our go-to restaurants. In fact, we eat out A LOT, and we come here more than anywhere else. All the BBQ is good. Maybe it's great. We love this place. Tall Tom is the kindest, best waiter in the world. If you're fortunate enough to get him you'll be spoiled. In fact, you should request Tom when you go. Then you'll enjoy some of the best BBQ in Charlotte (or maybe anywhere?) plus you'll have the best server around. May as well make the whole evening great, right??  Believe it or not, in spite of the fact that the BBQ is great, and we love BBQ, maybe our favorite thing on the menu is the Midwood chopped salad. We usually get it with grilled salmon and balsamic dressing, but seriously, it's so good without the protein that I almost always get it that way now. Go and enjoy!  And don't forget to ask for Tom!  (He's super tall---just so you know you've got the right guy) ;))

This is one of the few places that we never squabble about going to eat. The staff is exceptional always!  We were seated outside and "forgotten" apparently (we don't think/feel that we were), the manager apologized profusely about the mix-up.  She took care of us personally!  We are always full after the entree and never have space for dessert, so we made a special just to do so without a meal once.  Drew is the man and we seek him out whenever we go!

Why can't half stars be implemented? This place seriously deserve 4.5 stars but I can't give it a 5. Here's why. I've been a big fan of Mac's speed shop and I heard this place rivals Mac's and so I had to try it out. Luckily, Midwood opened a location right next to my house (yes!) so it makes commuting so much easier.  Once we walked in, we noticed how the whole restaurant is decked out with televisions. It seems like a nice place to watch the game and grab some grub. But for a Sunday night, the joint seems pretty dead. The place was only about a quarter full but I attributed that to it being a newer location. Now onward to the food:  We ordered the pimento cheese fries loaded with beef brisket and smoked wings as starters. The wings were ok but the cheese fries? Oh man, it was really good. It had the right amount of melted cheese and a generous amount of smokey brisket bits on top. The serving portion was also a lot bigger than we thought and so we already started to get a bit full before our entrees arrived. For our entrees we ordered the burnt ends with smoked veggies and a combo platter. Let me break it down for you:  The goodies: Burnt ends: the star of the night. Not many places do burnt ends (or in this case make it right) and it had the right amount of crispness on the outside and tenderness in the inside. It even got my Chinese family of 6 (that are not fans of American barbecue) fighting for that last piece.  Carolina chopped pork: moister and more tender than most BBQ joints Mac & cheese: well it's hard to mess up Mac & cheese and they definitely did not. The flavors were spot on but I wished it was a bit hotter. Bacon wrapped jalapeños: hot and spicy. Just the way I like it.  The not so goodies: Beef brisket: it was just alright but could be more tender, juicer than even a bit fattier. I thought their brisket was too lean to get that smokey flavor that brisket tends to have. St. Louis pork ribs: I've been spoiled with some good ribs and these were just alright. With the right dipping sauce they became enjoyable. Chopped chicken BBQ: too dried for my taste. I wish they offered a whole piece of chicken on the combo plate instead of shredded.  We also ordered the banana pudding and it was really good. I liked how they used actual cake bits instead of just wafers. However, the star of the show was definitely the burnt ends and that by itself made my night. I would definitely return just to order a whole large plate of burnt ends for myself alongside their vast amount of draft beers on tap.
Best BBQ in Charlotte.  Didn't think I would like anywhere better than Mac's but this place.  Must have the bacon wrapped jalapenos as a side!

Wow, Excellent barbecue!  I had the sampler platter.  The meats were very nicely smoked.   I have had smoked barbeque all over the US, and there can be a wide variety among restaurants.  Midwood did an excellent job balancing the wood flavors in the preparation of their meat.  Carolina style barbecue is typically served in a vinegar sauce.  They chose to provide the vinegar sauce on the side, so I could choose to regulate the amount of vinegar flavor in my barbecue.  They also provided a slightly sweetened vinegar sauce, So I was not dipping my meat into pure vinegar.  I have been to many backwoods Carolina barbecue restaurants that just soak their meat in pure vinegar.  Terrible stuff.  Thankfully, Midwood does not do this.  They let the meat and the smoking process provide the flavor.  The vinegar sauce is not acidic and mild enough to enhance the flavor.  It is one of the best barbecue restaurants that I have visited in the US.
Fantastic food every time I come here! Very friendly staff and great service. I am a pescatarian, and the smoked salmon is the bomb.com . The food is always fresh and delicious.

I wanted to give 3 1/2 stars.. my son advised i should have at least tasted the ribs... well, by the time we got there , they were all gone .. This place was just ok to me... I had the mayo based coleslaw, it was just ok, as were the beans .

Wow...this place is amazing. It was so good in fact that my wife suggested that we change our travel plans and stay another night in Charlotte just to eat here tomorrow for lunch. Undoubtedly the best pork ribs I've ever had and hands-down the best baked beans  on the planet.

I think my Ribs and BBQ beans deserved a 4 and a half. Service a Four. The ribs were moist and tender and had a great flavor. The beans were just full of character and enjoyable to eat. My Chicken and Mac and cheese deserve a 3 !  Let me explain why: the chicken breast was like rubber to cut and chew! The manager did inquire and offer another piece (which is why I am giving a 4 star instead of three) I declined as I had eaten most of it, just disappointed . The Mac and cheese had no soul! It was cold and bland, like it had been sitting in a giant pan waiting to end its life :)  Love having this place in the hood and will walk over again and try other dishes. Warning they are new and run out of Ribs early so go early and order right away :)
Cristie was an amazing server. The experience and the food combined were untouchable. I will definitely be back to see the restaurant along with cristie.
Great service and good salad options w/ and w/out meat (try the smoked salmon- it's delicious!). Definitely a long wait on the weekends so join the wait list online before you arrive.

Visiting, i had to come here....reading the reviews i was not let down.  i got the sampler.....GET THE SAMPLER  I was so full, i couldnt finish, but i wish i could go back just for this place...  i have had BBQ everywhere, this place is bomb diggity! Try it!

I am embarrassed to say that the only time my mister and I get barbecue is when we have visitors from out-of-town. Well, Midwood Smokehouse is our go-to choice for meeting any barbecue hankerings. Plus, you get some of the local flavor from the surrounding Plaza Midwood neighborhood. Kill two family visit birds with one stone!  In terms of food, I've sampled a little bit of everything from the menu at this point, but the Cuban sandwich is usually what ends up calling my name. It's a solid choice with some of the chopped smoked pork for that barbecue taste .The local beer selection is on point, and has just enough offerings without overwhelming. I also appreciate that they do have regular drink specials.

This is going to be a fairly short review because simply put: my favorite BBQ in the city.   I regular here a few times a month and it's easily one of the most consistently delicious restaurants I've ever been to. The BBQ burnt tips are one of the best BBQ dishes I think I've ever had (including the infamous Rendezvous in Memphis!) and their sandwiches are always tender and hot.   Once and a while they'll have a Garlic Wing special. If you go and they have them you hit the lottery; they're incredible. The wait staff is always on point, fast but not quick to rush you out. It's always incredibly clean and the drink specials are usually pretty decent. I don't have a single negative thing to say about this place and I've eaten here literally dozens of times.

friends took us here when we were visiting and it was legit. Unfortunately they were out of ribs (it was a holiday weekend in the evening) but the rest was really good so it didn't really matter. Got the pig out and got extra brisket and substituted burnt ends (which hands down are the best thing on the menu). They actually missed our extra brisket order and before we even talked to the manager..she brought like extra extra brisket so we got more than we had originally ordered! Now that's customer service! Creamed corn is amazing, Mac and cheese was good, not great ( didn't stop me from eating it all). Overall, really great food!

I had their cheesesteak and it was made with brisket, carmelized onion, and white American cheese on a homemade roll. It was the BEST I've ever had! The sweet potato fries were great too! Just yummmm.

Midwood Smokehouse opened its second location on May 7, 2015 in the Ballantyne neighborhood of Charlotte. It's in the old Sticky Fingers Smokehouse space at Toringdon Circle (shopping center). I visited this restaurant a couple weeks after it opened with a group of friends, two of whom make up two-thirds of the Barbecue Bros (http://barbecuebros.co/). We ordered a nice sampling of BBQ and enjoyed the experience. The food and service were good.  At 5:45pm on a Friday, the restaurant was already very busy. We were told by the hostess that our wait would be about 30 minutes. We were seated in about 20. There wasn't much space at the bar so we waited outside with others. By the time we left around 7:15pm, the number of folks waiting had grown quite large. There must've been at least a half-dozen groups/families waiting.  The inside of the restaurant resembles an American restaurant chain such as Applebee's or Ruby Tuesday. The clean, open space features both a bar and dining room with a mixture of booths and tables. Our group of six sat in one of the circular bench-style booths by the windows. The interior sports several large TVs (great for watching sports), vintage North Carolina artwork and memorabilia, and artistic metal cutouts with a BBQ, farm, and kitchen theme.  I haven't been to Midwood Smokehouse's original location in Plaza Midwood, but I was told by my tablemates that that location is different in look and feel. This location in Ballantyne is designed for the suburbs. There's plenty of parking too.  The BBQ served here is influenced from various styles from the Carolinas to Texas. Aside from the standard sandwiches and plates, Midwood Smokehouse also serves salads, tacos, and appetizers like Pimento Cheese Fries, Fried Pickles, and Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos. Expect to spend about $8-10 each for most sandwiches (includes a side) and about $10-18 each for most plates. Plates come in both small and large sizes.  We went with the following:  BBQ: * Burnt Ends (small, $13.50) - crispy caramelized cubes of brisket tossed in a housemade Fat Tire BBQ sauce * Combo Platter ("Well-Fed," $22), which came with: * Carolina Chopped Pork - hickory-smoked chopped pork lightly dressed in Eastern NC vinegar sauce * Beef Brisket (both fatty and lean) - Texas-style sliced beef brisket served in natural juices * Smoked Sausage - combination of beef, pork, and garlic * Saint Louis Style Pork Ribs (dry) - smoked  Apps & Sides: * Hushpuppies (whole basket, $5) - scratch-made, slightly sweet and warm, served with BBQ sauce * Collard Greens * Classic Mac & Cheese * BBQ Slaw  I liked everything. The food had simple presentation and was served in old-fashioned plates and bowls with floral decorations akin to something you'd expect to find at your grandma's house.  The Burnt Ends were rather tender and flavorful. They were more tender than I was expecting. A good bit of sauce, flavor (sweetness), and caramelization. These were probably my favorite of the BBQ meats. The Carolina Chopped Pork was on par with other chopped pork I've had around the state. Moist and tasty, the meat was smoked with hickory logs from North Carolina.  You have the option of ordering the Beef Brisket fatty, lean, or both. We got both and the brisket was delectable. Smoky with an appetizing chew and consistency. The Smoked Sausage was A-OK. Plump and glistening, it was charred on one side and had firm texture and bite. The Saint Louis Style Pork Ribs were excellent. Near "fall off the bone," the somewhat fatty meat and rub were packed with delicious flavor. Note the ribs are available with sauce as well.  BBQ sauces at the table included South Carolina Mustard, Eastern NC Vinegar, Midwood Signature, and Habanero. My favorite was the subtly sweet Midwood Signature, but really, none of the BBQ needed any sauce. The meats tasted fine without it.  The Hushpuppies were small and soft, almost squishy. They weren't crispy nor crunchy, but had comparatively smooth centers. The Collards, with bits of pork, were alright as was the BBQ Slaw. When it comes to slaw, you can order both mayo-based "Coleslaw" or the NC traditional vinegar-based "BBQ Slaw" (a.k.a. red slaw), finely chopped. The Mac & Cheese was great. Made with elbow macaroni, it was nice and cheesy with small, chewy bits of hardened, charred cheese. It was moderately oily, but lots of good mac 'n cheese are greasy.  Service was terrific. Our orders came out in a reasonable amount of time and I was impressed with how our server remembered our food and drink orders after we'd changed our minds and switched them up on her. Kudos. Founder/owner Frank Scibelli personally checked on our table. Midwood Smokehouse plans to open more locations including one in Columbia, SC.  If you like BBQ, these guys are worth checking out.

When we want bbque we go to the mid wood smokehouse.  Great ribs, brisket and sausage.  They smoke their own meat have great beer on tap.  Great meal and the desserts are excellent to with their pecan pie.  They opened another smokehouse in Ballantyne, but it is not as good as the Midwood original location.

Great quality BBQ with a classic American vibe.  Whenever I have family visiting from the west coast I will always bring them here.  Bacon wrapped jalapeños, smoked veggies, baked beans, creamed corn and a big 4 meat combo plater is my go to selection and feeds four people easily.
I'm not a HUGE BBQ fan but this place was great!! With moving to the south from Chicago, I knew that I needed to find some good BBQ places and this is definitely one of them!

This is my favorite place to get BBQ in Charlotte. The meat has a great flavor, the sides are always delicious (bacon wrapped jalapenos, mac n' cheese, pickled onions, hushpuppies) and they always have a good selection of local beer on draft. My husband and I recently ordered a salad from here as to have a lighter meal and WOW! I had no idea a salad could be that tasty. The waiters are always very friendly and helpful. I've probably been here more than 10 times and have never had a bad experience. The food is always on point and consistent.

More like 2.5 stars for me.    I'm not a BBQ fan but came here to help celebrate a birthday.  What's cool about this place is the outside area where you can play corn hole while you wait for your table.  Establishment was full of hungry patrons so I was starting to think that maybe this BBQ was going to be different.  Staff is friendly, bartender was really nice and I even saw a coworker.  Location is perfect and I was ready to nibble on my Hubs' food (since I don't do BBQ I didn't order anything)   Hubs ordered I think the brisket sandwich.  O.M.Google.  Salty.  Greasy and what's with the blue cheese???  Fries were good though. Hubs had to scrape off the blue cheese as he hated it too.  The bread also looked like Texas Toast.  Just not a fan....so sorry.    Upside were the beer specials and also the banana pudding.  THAT was good.  yum.

I have eaten here twice and food was really great. This place gets busy on the weekend so expect a little wait but the service was nice and very quick. We got a few appetizers and they were all good but the pimento cheese fries are awesome and highly recommend!! I got pulled pork and mac & cheese and both were awesome. Their bbq slaw is also different but good, has a sweet but tangy flavor to it.  I plan to go back again!
I didn't really like this place. The BBQ was cold, servers were not friendly. I wouldn't come back.

We started our Saturday on a leisurely, lazy pace. We hit Starbucks to start off our day right with various beverages. I parked as we tried to figure out where we wanted to go. One of my friends needed to use the washroom.  After about forty minutes being undecided, I suggested that we have lunch. I had no problem taking a recommendation from my friend's friend. We headed to Midwood Smokehouse.  Getting there was a bit tricky. I missed the odd turn and had to reroute. It's in a plaza that is ridiculously busy. However, when I was closer to the smokehouse, parking was a breeze.  We were immediately seated in a booth. One of my friends had no hesitation in ordering the well-fed combo platter with me. It consists of Carolina chopped pork, beef brisket, St. Louis style pork ribs, hickory smoked sausage, hushpuppies, and mac and cheese.  My other friend does not eat pork. She ordered the barbequed chicken, with onions, hushpuppies, coleslaw, and veggies.  I also got a Diet Coke. You get unlimited refills. I got three drinks in total and got down to 2.5 glasses.  As far as barbeque goes, this place is amazing! The smoked sausage has cheese with some kick to it. It was awesome! The ribs fell off the bone and were so flavourful. My friend and I were nodding in agreement that they were the best ribs that we have ever had. The beef brisket was equally as tender and flavourful.   My friend knew that I have a weakness for mac and cheese. I got more of it. She was so generous. It was perfect.  Before coming to North Carolina, I was doing research on what foods are local to the state. I didn't get much information on it. I learned far more at this restaurant. It offers two types of barbeque sauce: a tomato-based one and a Carolina vinegar-based one. I loved the latter more. It was delicious.  This place also serves hushpuppies. They are deep-fried cornmeal goodness that is a Carolina thing. It tends to accompany barbeque. As a cornmeal lover, the huspuppies were so good and highly addictive!  Even though we were all pretty stuffed, we kicked it up a notch on the food coma scale and shared the chocolate cake. It was incredible! The crunchy chocolate crumble on top was unexpected and worked nicely with the moist, rich chocolate cake. Such a wonderful surprise!  Our server was wonderful. He moved to the States from Spain and was wonderful to chat with. He was attentive to our needs. This place is lucky to have him as an employee.  If you want delicious barbeque with great service, come here. You will not be disappointed.  (133)

I really love midwood, they have great food. One thing I would recommend surprisingly enough is their salad topped with BBQ. It has tons of yummy toppings and its a really good price for the size and quality.

Well, you know I have to try BBQ places wherever I go to see who has the best. First time in Charlotte and I must say this place is up there with the best BBQ places in the US.  I had the ribs and the brisket and they were delish. Very tasty and smoky and very tender.  The Mac n cheese was not bad and the greens were pretty good too.  Hush puppies were good. The service was excellent n the price was about what I expected.  Way to go.

So I thought I had good BBQ before but now I really really know I had good BBQ. A short wait for our party of six, we ordered the nachos with chicken for an appetizer. They had a little kick to them! Very tasty!   I took the bartender's advice and got the "burnt ends" which are amazing nuggets of carmelized brisket with BBQ sauce. I am not a huge beef fan but I could be if I had this meal choice available to me all the time. So incredibly tender and delicious. And oh my goodness those BBQ beans! A must have. I also got to try some of my dinner mates collard greens. A first for me. They kind of tasted like spinach with a thicker texture. Not bad! Oh and those hush puppies. I never really had a hush puppy that I thought tasted good. I didn't realize why people even ate those until now!!   The ginger lemon jack drink was so yummy! Great food and great service!  I'm so full and happy right now.
This is one of the best barbecue places I've ever been. The burnt ends were to die for, and the ribs were delicious and perfectly cooked. Great relaxed atmosphere, too.
Excellent bbq place even for someone who knows a bbq place in s Lake Tahoe. Good job y'all.
Delicious food.  Server very nice.  Bacon wrapped jalapeno a definite must of you like spicy.  Burnt ends ends tasty.

The food is delicious and plentiful well thought out seating for large groups or small. Music is a little loud (and country) wait staff is hit or miss especially around 9pm (restaurant is open till 11pm) The several times we have been staff sometimes gets caught up doing side work and forgets to check back timely. The food makes up for it.

It was a great day to sit outside and have lunch at Midwood Smokehouse. We began with the BBQ Queso with Pork. It was quite tasty and as we finished our app the food arrived promptly. I dined on the Brisket (they give you an option for lean, fatty, or mixed; I had the lean brisket with the Midwood BBQ sauce. The beef was fine and the sauce was a good compliment. The mac and cheese was A+ and worth every calorie. The plates come with hushpuppies, which were fried crisp. We didn't get dessert but it sure was tempting. The indoor atmosphere looked very appealing, the staff was present, and the food was tasty. It definitely worth the stop if you are in the Park Road Shopping Center and looking for some good ole Southern BBQ.

Great BBQ! The atmosphere is not my favorite but the food is always good. Their side salad for $5 is fantastic with the avocado goddess dressing! I eat here more than I care to admit and order it at least once a month to go. Great place to eat or order out and eat at home.

Worst experience here EVER!! If you're ever in a rush or expect to get your food at a reasonable time, definitely don't come here. We were told our food would be ready in 15 mins and we waited well over 40mins. The manager eventually came out and said they ran out of chicken and that's why they had to restart our whole order. Worst experience ever and I'd highly suggest to not come here

I came in here with some rolling papers and a lighter but quickly found out it was NOT that kind of smokehouse. After I got over my brief disappointment I discovered it was my second favorite kind of smokehouse... the barbecue kind!   The set up is really nice and spacious. We went for lunch and were sat immediately and got our food pretty quickly. We tried these bacon wrapped stuff jalapeno peppers that were to die for.   Midwood believes that those who stay ready don't have to get ready. They keep the BBQ sauces on deck on each table and they have wet naps on hand. You'd be surprised how many restaurants serve sticky food items and no wet naps.   The manager came over and checked on our table a couple of time as well. That was pretty dope. Not the kind of dope I expected in a place called Smokehouse but still dope. At least it wasn't named Midwood Traphouse. Although I guess they do move a lot of birds.   While we're here... Lebron James should win the NBA MVP every single year he's in the league. I mean what else does this guy have to do. I think he could take a pick up team from the local YMCA to the NBA finals. We really don't appreciate the greats while they are playing.   He never gets injured, he is an outspoken social critic and he doesn't cheat on his wife. We can't say that about Jordan, Kobe or anyone else you'd consider to be the king of the NBA.  The biggest knock on him is that he moved from Cleveland to Miami when he was 20 something years old. Yeah like YOU wouldn't do that if you could. It's time for people to let the Lebron James hate go and give him his flowers while he can still smell him.

So sad to see this place going downhill.  Been going there since first opened few years ago, usually take out but often dine in.  I live 5 minutes away and order would be ready on arrival or very soon, even when busy.  Best BBQ in town by far.  Knew me by name. But as got busier they cared less.  Now new policy is  call-in orders go to bottom of priority list.  Took 50 minutes to prepare and serve my one dish I called in from road.  Meanwhile I watched guests arrive, wait for table, get seated, order and eat appetizers, get 2d round of drinks, order and get dinner.  Bar maid proud of anti-takeout policy.  Bragged been that way forever, but she seemed new.  Not ever going again.  Poor service and strange (greedy?) policy.

I am into this place! I am not typically huge on BBQ, but I really enjoyed both the ambiance and the staff!  First off, you can claim a place on line via Yelp. What a god send on a cold night! Loved it!!  Second, Gary was an AMAZING server who clearly knows the business and what they have to offer.  My husband and I pretty much stuffed ourselves silly but the food was great! I had the Philly Cheese steak with creamed corn and my husband ate the "burnt ends" brisket meal with yummy sides as well! The queso app was delish and they have Bourbon  flights... how fun is that? We will be back!

One of the best smokehouses I have visited. The meat was cooked to perfection and the sides were delectable. Our server was very attentive and the management checked to see how we were doing. The environment was great, with seating indoors and out. Also not to bad on the pricing for what you get. We loved it!

MEAT all the way.   Had the best rack of ribs. Service was awesome. The "burnt beef ends" was another delicacy.  Must try also includes the "pecan cobbler with vanilla scoop" from the dessert section.

I have had carry-out only from this restaurant.  It was decent.  A little on the pricey side.  I am not a big fan of southern BBQ, so maybe I am the wrong person to ask.  There was definitely nothing wrong with my order.  It was made promptly to order.  The staff answering the phone and who greeted me upon arrival was very pleasant and efficient.

Let me start by saying that our waiter was great. He was very attentive and accommodating. The food however was another story. I had the beef tips which were actually ok. That's where it ended. The mac and cheese was absolutely gross, the ribs and chicken were not good at all. My husband and I even ordered drinks and those left something to be desired. I was told afterwards that we should've gone to the original smokehouse in plaza midwood.
Good service, good sauces, and good Carolina BBQ for a very reasonable price! Brisket covered fries with pimento cheese  Pulled pork sandwich and hush puppies  Homemade Mac and Cheese
Good service. Burnt ends didn't live up to description. Ribs were juicy and flavorful but overall they had an overwhelming black pepper taste. Macaroni and cheese was a disappointment.

Head the half rack with baked beans and hush puppies. Man, this place was awesome! The ribs were so tender and the beans had brisket throughout. I definitely plan to come back and highly recommend you gone them a try. Really good bbq and the staff wad super friendly as well.

This place is a must for barbecue novices and enthusiasts! My husband and I ate here on Friday night for the first time but not the last! I am a very picky eater & enjoyed everything I ate. The Brisket was very good! They even ask if you want fat, lean, or both, which, I now know,means they know what they are doing! Richard & his staff made us feel welcomed and appreciated as customers! Be sure to save room for dessert-the Pecan Cobbler is amazing!
Best beef brisket in town! The sides are also VERY tasty - my fave are the smoked veggies!

I recently relocated from Texas, and have been searching for some decent brisket. I was so thrilled that MS not only knew what wet brisket was, but produced some of the best I've had in a loooong time!  I am so excited that I now have an authentic bbq place to eat in Charlotte!  The service was fast and friendly, atmosphere great, and I also loved the side item of smoked veggies.  Delicious!  We are going back today!
Food was quite good. Burnt ends and Smoked Mac n cheese where outstanding Service was not great but I would return

As a server myself, I'm particularly critical of service at restaurants but Midwood Smokehouse did not disappoint! Our server, Sheena was friendly, attentive, and efficient. Everyone loved the food as well...we'll definitely be back!

I love good BBQ so I'm definitely loving Midwood Smokehouse. I've been trying to find a good brisket lately and I think the search is finally over. They actually let you choose what type of brisket you like (fatty or lean) and their BBQ sauce is spot on. My brisket was really tender and was cooked to perfection. It wasn't rubbery at all... The bacon wrapped jalepeno's are an awesome idea (of course wrap anything in bacon and I'll love it!). Their baked beans were delicious too... If you're craving some BBQ this is some of the best in the Charlotte area.
This place is so consistently good, you have to try it. My favorite is the briquette and burnt ends.

Good portions of food even on the small plates. My fiancé loved his brisket with the habanero BBQ sauce and the pork BBQ was so good with the classic NC style vinegar sauce. Bacon wrapped jalapeños were awesome! Service was real attentive and food came out fast, will definitely go back when I visit Charlotte again!

While not my favorite style of BBQ, I can still recognize how good this place is. I lived in Houston for a couple of years and after tasting Midwood's brisket, I was immediately suspicious their might be a Texan in the kitchen - and I was right. Texas is not known for pulled pork and ribs - nope... it's all about the brisket and sausage. This place nails both and I love that they have an option of lean or fatty brisket.  This place might have the best 'cue in Charlotte, although my pallet is better suited for Mac's....
Best BBQ I've had in Charlotte so far. Great service and staff. Got the BBQ platter to share.

When you want BBQ, Midwood Smokehouse is the place to go! Any time we have out of town visitors that want southern BBQ, we don't hesitate to take them here. The service, the ambience, the food, it's everything you want in a BBQ joint.   Personally, all the meats are delicious, but what I care about are the sides. In my humble opinion, they have the best collard greens in all of Charlotte. Don't forget to ask for their homemade pepper vinegar, because that just takes it over the top delicious. Midwood was actually the place that turned me into a collard eater, and I thank them for it. My husband swears by their Mac and cheese and will always get it as his side. It's the kind of Mac and cheese that you dig your fork in and the gooey strings of cheese follow the noodles all the way out of the bowl.   We had friends visiting that also do competition BBQ back in the northeast and they were able to see the whole smoker operation in the back, which I thought was a nice touch!
Excellent food and service. The brisket is awesome , full of flavor . Can't go wrong with anything in the menu .

I have been going to Midwood for years.  I am very picky when it comes to BBQ and I love the pulled pork that Midwood has.   All of their sides are also amazing, you really can't go wrong with any of them.    I have been there when they have been slow and when they have been super busy.  Overall their service is consistently good and their servers are friendly.   We love Midwood so much, this was the location of choice for our wedding rehearsal dinner.  All of our out of town guest LOVED the food and still rave about it to this day.

Came in for my birthday and had Audrey as our server, she was so aware and perky and attentitive. No matter what we asked for it seemed like it was no problem for her to get for us. highly recommend!!!

Oh yummy! I went here with a friend recently, and not only was the service SPECTACULAR, but the food was incredible. I really enjoyed the bacon wrapped jalapenos and the brisket sandwich! Hooray! The meat was tender, juicy, and super flavorful. There are many items on the menu that I want to try...but alas...my calorie counter won't let me try everything at once. So, I guess I'll just have to go back ;)

After a poor experience in another Charlotte BBQ place earlier this week we tried Midwood Smokehouse. The sun was shining and we were seated at a table outside at our request.  Mary was a fantastic server and I had the ribs (dry), mac & cheese and bacon-wrapped jalapeños. Tried all of there sauces and preferred the house mix and the habanero mix. My only mistake was in ordering the full rack as I had no room for desert.  After the meal Mary arranged for the manager to give us a tour of their hickory-fired smoker.  All in all a great meal and a very nice time.

My wife and I shared an order of smoked wings, I had a plate of burnt-ends, and she a chopped salad with brisket.  Wings? Brisket? No, this is not traditional Carolina BBQ. They have a fairly good selection of beers and food was good. The atmosphere has a touch of a corporate feel to it, but the service was absolutely fantastic.   Did I feel like I had died and gone to BBQ-heaven? No, but definitely not a bad place to go if you have a hankering for it. Overall, I would recommend it.

Outstanding!  The pulled chicken is AMAZING!!!!   They have numerous sides to choose from, but you can't go wrong with the Mac & Cheese.  My fiancé loved the pulled pork and ribs.  The best option is to get the choose four platter so that you can get a little taste of all their meats.  Make sure you save some room for dessert....the banana pudding was one of the best I have ever tasted, I literally ate it all with 2-3 minutes.  Reasonably priced and I will definitely be back soon.
Burned Ends were yummy, with just the right amount of fat and sauce on them. Service was a little slow. Parking can be difficult because of the small parking lot.

Midwood Smokehouse is great every single time I go. It's so consistent. It's the best BBQ in Charlotte. Their sauces are delish, their beer list is great, they always have great specials. Yum! This is my go to place for out of town guests.  Pro tip: They make everything fresh so they sell out quickly. Keep this in mind when ordering.
The waitress gave us a very comfortable ordering experience. The Midwood signature sauce is perfect! The apple cider dressing with their wonderful salad is my favorite!!

Ok, I'm going to admit that I dont know this kind of BBQ, so I have a hard time reviewing it because I'm use to barbequing on a grill. All that smoked and saucy shit sucks. I love the true flavor of grilled meat, without all the sauce and seasonings. My bro in law makes the best ribs, so juicy and succulent and real, no smoky flavor. With that being said, we ordered the Smoked Jalapeno popper wrapped in bacon. They were inedible, thats how hot they were. Yeah, yeah, yeah. I know jalapenos are hot and I love heat, but these were horrificly hot and the smoke "flavoring" was so overbearing, I had to send them back. They were very understanding about that. We split the combo of ribs with coleslaw and hushpuppies. The ribs were tender and meaty and tasted good, but Not succulent and juicy and unctuous like my bro in law's. The coleslaw was a little dry, need some mayo. The hushpuppies were delicious!! They were really small tho. They were not hot, but they were crispy and oh so flavorful. We ordered dessert. I ordered Keylime pie and he ordered Banana pudding. He loved it, I didnt taste it. Mine was ok, but too cold and hard. I'll try again and the looks of the pics posted here, I'm going with the Brisket. You southerners might love this place, but its just not what I'm used to.

This is the best BBQ in Charlotte.  Now, there's not a lot of great BBQ in Charlotte and I have no idea why, but this is the best.  I love their side options, like the stuffed jalapenos.  Their brisket is also pretty good.  I love their smoked chicken.  I recommend Midwood for BBQ in Charlotte.

Excellent service again. Great atmosphere (high energy but not too high). Food Ratings (5 being highest):   Smoked Wings: 5 Crispy Wings: 3 Smoked Half-Chicken: 5 French Fries: 4 Mac & Cheese: 3 (I know most people love it, but not for me).  Overall: 4.   Recommended. Might hit the bar just for some wings and Blue Moon in the future.

We came here for July 4th and couldn't have picked a better place for good American barbecue! Hands down the best ribs I've ever had in my life. Great Mac and cheese too! Ask for a tour of the smoker. The manager took us back to show us how everything works, and it was pretty awesome. We will definitely be back.

We love it here!! We have been here a handful of times and really enjoy the food! It's a bit more on the pricier side but the food is really delicious! The Mac and cheese and brisket is absolutely mouth watering! Don't skip out on ordering the bacon wrapped jalepenos they are a staple every time we go in! The service has always been excellent and very attentive. They are great with large orders and accommodating to their clients. All the meat is very well cooked and they have amazing ribs! Honestly you can't really go wrong with what you order here. There is consistency here and they never disappoint.

Carolina ribs in North Carolina? Woohoo! That was my thought when Grant L brought me to Midwood Smokehouse.   Instead of Carolina, I ended up getting their special Saint Louis Style Pork Ribs with Midwood signature sauce on the side. I'm sure someone can tell me the difference with Carolina ribs. My favorite ribs are Memphis style dry rub but this wasn't it. Still, it was pretty close and the Saint Louis half rack was pretty darn good.  The hushpuppies were delicious and the collard greens surprisingly tasty and not overcooked or overly salty like 75% of Southern restaurants.   Our order took awhile to get to our table but our waitress was friendly. NoDa local brew while waiting was a big plus. Watching the World Series Champion San Francisco Giants beating the Kansas City Royals on TV was an even bigger plus!
Visited based on prior reviews.   There is no doubt the other 1000 people were correct.  Pork, ribs, chix and all sides were great.   Will visit again when here in the future

Talk about delicious food, this place has it! Midwood catered a work event I attended and man was the food good! They brought out the bbq, hot wings & the chipotle sauce, mac & cheese, bbq beans, grilled veggies & the banana pudding! Everyone was raving about it. A big shout out to Lisa! This girl knows how to promote a business. I tried everything, twice! Yes, it was that good. I heard that I needed to get over to their actual location to try a few other items. I look forward to that & will update my review!
The food here was surprising very very good. I've eaten here a few times and I enjoy every visit.
This place has awesome food! You always get a generous portion. Try the brisket. It is the best!

Great place for BBQ and beers.  We received quick and friendly service both times we visited.  Our first time we got the combo plate to try all the meats.  Everything was great and we like the brisket and sausage the most.  The smoked wing appetizer is also highly recommended.

The beef is great. Their Eastern NC sauce is good. The only gripe I had is that the people working here claim that their portions are big...they are not. So as a result it's slightly overpriced. The banana pudding is the best I've ever tasted, truly amazing.

Amazing brisket, definitely a must try if you are here. Hands down the best waiter I have had in a long time, Joe knows his stuff and made our first experience so much better than an average waiter would have! Great selection of bourbon that will bring us back here often!

Pork was very tasty, but way too salty.  I hate it when food is over-salted, because there is nothing you can do.  If it's under-salted, you can always add more at your discretion.  In general though, food quality was pretty good.  Cole slaw was not good though.

I can't believe I haven't already reviewed Midwood Smokehouse! Simply put, it stays in constant rotation for a dinner option for us. My fiancé sticks with the brisket and loves the baked beans and mac and cheese as sides. I will typically get a brisket sandwich or a chopped salad with brisket and green goddess dressing. Occasionally we get the platter with different types of meat and share that and we always have left overs. Anytime anyone comes to visit from out of town, we take them there and they always ask to come back on return visits.   Overall, amazing!

It has been a long time since I have been here, but they are remembered fondly.  We could not finish our meal so we got a to go box.  We forgot the box on the table and when we went back 5-10 minutes later they has tossed it.  They took the time to make us new food to take home.  That kind of service is not forgotten.
Everything on the menu looked good! The brisket tacos were delicious. My mom ordered the burnt ends and brisket... both were outstanding! The pomegranate and knob creek drink was a wonderful finish!
This was just ok.  We really travel to authentic BBQ places and this fell short.  Burnt ends were not really burnt ends and the ribs although moist were just ok.  I had high hopes

Great gluten free options (thanks other reviewers), including a separate gluten free menu. Delicious ribs. Mediocre bacon jalapeno side. Great beer and cocktail selection and overall a really pleasant experience. We came around 1:30pm and didn't have to wait at all.  We hoped to walk back to Charlotte from the restaurant but there was a lot of construction in early fall 2017. So we wound up cabbing, which was worth it since everyone needed a nap after all the amazing food!

Wow.... had no idea this place existed. Was over visiting some friends in Plaza Midwood, and they said we just had to Try this place. Ended up ordering the Chicken BBQ Plate with hushpuppies and Mac n Cheese. OMG the South Carolina Mustard Sauce they use is like freaking CRACK.... it was amazing. The hushpuppies were just okay, but the Mac n Cheese was awesome!!! I ordered the small plate but it was a perfect meal. I am huge Jim n Nicks and Mac's Fan, but this place sorta has them beat in my mind at the moment. The prices were also Great!!! Definitely recommend checking them out if you haven't yet!!!

Since midwood was more convenient to my house I decided to give it a try. I'm glad I did the food was really good and wasn't as expensive as I thought. I got the bbq sandwich with bbq slaw and collard greens and added on a side of ribs which came up to 21.50! Not bad. The waiter was very helpful and nice and the atmosphere was pretty chill. The sandwich was good the bread was toasted and buttery just right! The collards were good The ribs were good but I've had better. The bbq sauce was really good. Overall I enjoyed and will definitely be back to try more things off the menu. You should try it.
Not a lot to choose when you vegan it but god was good service was ok little tension was in the air but would come again for last min eat of grilled cheese

We ordered via Door Dash. Was our first time trying Midwood. Meals were prepared very fast (delivered fast op) but ah! such wonderful bbq!!! Husband was very pleased with the brisket (and the fact that you could choose lean or fatty meat!) and he really liked the bbq sauce that came with. I had a bbq sandwich with slaw, sandwich was amazing but the slaw was a little bland - but still good. Will definitely go again!

It was my guy's and I first time traveling through Charlotte, N.C. and Yelp helped us choose the barbecue joint we were going to patronize on our first night in town. I am really glad we chose Midwood Smokehouse.   We walked in and were seated immediately at one of the high-top tables. Our server greeted us right away and recommended a couple of North Carolina brews to try and both of us enjoyed the beer we received, which scores points for the place right off the bat.   After asking the server a few questions (which she politely and knowledgeably answered) we decided on the beef brisket and the smoked half-chicken. I thoroughly enjoyed the brisket which I felt had so much flavor that it did not need any additional sauce. The chicken was slightly dry but when paired with the sauces, both my partner and I thought was absolutely delicious. We did ask our server to bring a side of every sauce so we may try them. (I loved the spicy habanero.)  For side items I ordered for myself the bite-sized bacon-wrapped jalapeños which were rich and spicy all at once. We also shared the mac 'n' cheese and the BBQ baked beans. My bf fell in love with the mac 'n' cheese while I swooned over the beans which contained pieces of pulled-pork, adding a lot of flavor to that particular side dish.   All-in-all, Midwood's was the best BBQ place we had traveling through both North Carolina and Tennessee. I would definitely revisit if I'm ever back in the area. I'm still thinking about it a week later.   I recommend walking upstairs and enjoying a sweet view of the city after dinner.

My entire experience was awesome!  The food was delicious and the service was on point! I kept saying I wanted to try the place and today was the day!  My coworker and I both had the midwood chopped except hers was with BBQ chicken and I had chopped pork.  We both ordered a small and it was more than enough!  For an appetizer we had the BBQ queso and it was yummy! We nibbled on that while we were eating our salads because it was so good!  Our server Amanda was awesome and really pulled together our experience.  She educated us on the menu and top sellers.  I will definitely tell others in my office and go back soon!
The BBQ was phenomenal! The only downside was that my husband and one of the other friends we were with got sick from the cole slaw. I feel pretty confident that it was just a bad batch.
The midwood chopped salad is the best salad and best deal in town!

So... I really wanted to like this location, but it's just not as good as the Central Ave location. For starters, the food isn't consistent each time I come.  I've had good Mac and cheese here and then I've had horrible Mac and cheese here. The staff is definitely friendly but it doesn't make up for the inconsistent food being sold here.  Also, this location doesn't have the fried Mac and cheese which the Central Ave location does.  There are two main perks with this location.... 1. I haven't had them run out of food, like the central Ave location. 2. The place is definitely more spacious.  All in all.... I would visit again since it's close to my job, but when it's the weekend, I would rather go all the way to Central Ave than to go to the location that's 10 minutes away from my house

Mehhhhh. So many Charlotte natives love Midwood Smokehouse, but unfortunately I'm not one of them. I ordered the BBQ with a side of baked beans. The hushpuppies were the only thing on the plate that I enjoyed. The BBQ was super dry, and the baked beans were cold. Maybe I caught them on a bad night.   My fiancé had the beef rib for $40. It was expensive but he enjoyed it, and this is why I'm awarding 3 stars (based on his experience rather than mine).   Overall, I would give this restaurant another try because so many of my friends like it.

I brought my parents here from out of town on my first visit.  Everyone seemed to enjoy it.  The menu was large and included a gluten-free menu (although the waiter couldn't locate it) for those who request it.  It was very busy on a Saturday night, so expect to wait for a table.  I did not have the BBQ meat but everyone said it was delicious.  I believe they had a decent drink menu/ liquor selection too!

I usually go to the uptown location. This location is closer to home so we decided to try it. Don't like it. Uptown is more of a bar with less children. This location is a family restaurant. Totally different. I'll be driving uptown from now on.

The back of the house deserves a better front of the house representing them. I've visited multiple times and it seems to be the same routine....great food/angry servers. I'm not sure why. Maybe I'm just unlucky

I was hesitant to stop by Midwood Smokehouse because the map showed that it was in the middle of an outdoor mall; however, the hubby and I were super hungry and craving bbq. Boy, I am glad we stopped. The service was great. The drinks were really good, especially the spicy mule drink....sorry I have no idea what the name is. The food was excellent. We sampled the beef, chicken and pork. I would say that the beef and pork were our favorites. We got our check before being asked about the dessert menu, but we were so full we most likely would have passed. Anyhow, if you are looking for a delicious, solid meal be sure to check this place out.
Wow! Great brisket and the mac and cheese is to die for! You got to check this place out! Service was fabulous and I will sooo be conming back for more brisket!

The bacon-wrapped jalopenos are UH-mazing. My life is now complete.  Seriously though, this place is awesome if you're looking for BBQ. My husband and I went there with our church one Sunday after service. We had a large party and would have had to wait quite a bit to be seated if we sat inside, so they took us out to the heated patio and sat us there instead. The weather wasn't bad, so it worked out well.   My husband was on a no-sugar diet at the time, so it was a bit difficult to find food that he could eat, but they were very accommodating, and our server made sure to double check that what he ordered was okay for him to eat. We did end up cheating a bit with the jalopenos but it was definitely worth it.   Whenever he can eat like a normal person again, we'll definitely revisit. Since going there, we've made our own version of bacon-wrapped jalopenos at home - but using goat cheese since he can't do cow's milk dairy - and they were pretty good. Nothing beats the app at Midwood though.

My initial visit to Midwood Smokehouse was shortly after they opened.  We were extremely excited to have a legit BBQ place open in the neighborhood and were eager to try it.  We loved the smoked meat and were not pleased with the sides.  I have since been back recently and they have not been stagnant, instead they have improved a lot of things.  The smoked meet is still great and the sides have vastly improved.  Being a Mac n Cheese fan, their's is definitely up there.  The most recent visit I had one of the most delicious sandwiches ever.  It was a burger made from ground smoked brisket, topped with pepper jack cheese and a healthy serving of pulled pork.  I actually can't stop thinking about how good it was.
This joint is located in Plaza Midwood and I think is very good! I've gotten the brisket, pulled pork, and mac and cheese which were all excellent.

Ate there for the first time today. Out of ribs at 4pm but it was Father's Day, so it's understandable. On the waitresses recommendation, I ordered the supposedly one pound beef rib. When it arrived me and my wife both looked at each other saying that's one pound of meat. It was cooked right with good flavor but no where near a pound of beef. I made mention to the waitress and she kind of agreed with me. She said she mentioned it to the manager but nothing was taken off the bill. Oh, the meal price was $28.00 which if it was a full pound of meat would be worth it. My wife could not get ribs, so she ordered a burger which she said was good. I guess I should have ordered the burnt ends which I originally wanted. Not saying I will not return but you would think that first time customers with an issue would be comped in some way.....anyway, my dog is happy, he's currently chewing on the rib bone which probably made up close to 1/2 of the one pound weight.....

Maybe it's the location but I did not enjoy this go around at the Johnston location. We had to ask for each sauce, rather than all coming out at the same time... And the $30 rib was mostly fat. Don't think I'll be coming back.
Kristen gave such amazing service that in itself is worth 5 stars. Best bbq in Charlotte

After two visits, Midwood Smokehouse BBQ and Bar has become my current favorite BBQ place in Charlotte.  I say current, as things can happen to take that status (and it's an important one) away.  One only needs to ask me about Mac's Speedshop where starting back in 2006 I would frequent at least once a month.  After too many instances of stale sandwich buns, so-so service, and so-so 'Cue...I haven't been back in probably 2 years.     A few weeks ago on a bright and warm Saturday, some of my friends came in from out-of -town to visit the CLT and they were looking for some tasty BBQ.  In the past this would have been a quick drive over to Mac's in the Southend.  However, this time I was searching my Yelp app for a new king of 'Cue.  This search took me to my first visit to the, Plaza Midwood located, Midwood Smokehouse BBQ/ Bar and my new number one.  Atmosphere - Crowded, lively, and happening, a darkly lit and noisy bar area, a bright and a little calmer dining room, and a packed with patrons patio space.  Service - Despite our server seeming crushed from the craziness that a nice day brings to a place with a patio, he kept it together and provided prompt service.  The server was quick and thoughtful in offering suggestions, though I knew what I wanted to have...the Carolina Pork BBQ Plate.  Food - Great!  As mentioned above I ordered the Carolina Pork BBQ Plate.  I opted for the small portion, which comes with hushpuppies, pickled onions, and one side (I ordered sweet potato fries).  Despite being busy, the food arrived quickly and hot.  I tasted some of the pulled pork immediately before dressing it with the table placed sauces...it was excellent!  While Midwood Smokehouse does lightly dress the pulled pork in their Eastern NC vinegar sauce prior to serving, all I could taste was smoky goodness.  The pork was lean, flavorful, and juicy.  The sweet potato fries were good and the hushpuppies on this visit were awesome, with a light crunch and a soft, cake donut like center.  Everything was perfect!    Being a bar too, Midwood Smokehouse has a nice selection of beers, including the local offerings from OMB, Triple C Brewing, and NODA.       Overall - While you may have read this review and expected to see a 5 Star rating...I gave 4 Stars.  Why 4 Stars??  Well, as stated in the beginning of my review it was the result of two visits that made Midwood Smokehouse my king of 'Cue.  The absence of a star comes down to consistency.  I was so enamored on my first visit, as described above, my second visit occurred a mere four days later.  It was a Wednesday; the shine had come off on my new trophy winner.  While the pulled pork on this visit was just as good the portion seemed a little smaller and the hushpuppies I received to me seemed dry and old tasting.  Despite a little downturn on my second visit, I think the solid nature of their pulled pork makes Midwood Smokehouse some of the best BBQ Charlotte has to offer.  With that I will be back again with friends!

This is top three barbeque spot in all of Charlotte. I have been here a few times and honestly the quality and quantity of food are always good here.  They actual have really good tasting drafts if you are into beer with daily specials too. We ordered the pimento cheese fries as this is how pimento cheese should taste ! I have had it with brisket before and that is good enough for a meal. I had the brisket sandwich and it is really good of course as you can tell they take time to prepare their meat.   My favorite along with just about everyone's are the burnt ends. Must try! If you need to google burnt ends please do... but you must try them here!  Be warned that the parking it limited here and you will probably wait to get into this place.   This BBQ is well worth the wait and maybe  possible do a uber or lyft here because you can walk to Workman's friend , Legion, Whiskey Warehouse , or wherever afterwards.
Wow! Best BBQ I've ever had. Excellent smoked wings. Amazing sausage. Great pulled pork. And the brisket was good. They sold out of the ribs so I'll have to try those next time.

Who can go to North Carolina and not get some BBQ? Unfortunately, Charlotte is not one of the main BBQ hubs in the state. Midwest Smokehouse, however, serves up some delicious BBQ.  The Smoked Wings ($8) is a pound of chicken wings that are smoked then finished on the grill. They were meaty, but still tender and had the right amount of smoke. My mouth is watering just thinking about them they were so good.  The Combo Platter (Well Fed $24) comes with your choice of 4 proteins. We chose pulled pork which was smoky and delicious; beef brisket which was tender and full of flavor with just the right amount of fat; burnt ends which had a nice char and a juicy fat cap; and some St. Louis style pork ribs which were fall off the bone tender. The platter comes with pickled onions and hush puppies, which were tender with a nice corn flavor. You also get 2 sides, in our case we got the mac & cheese which was rich and creamy, and the bacon wrapped jalapenos which didn't pack too much of a punch but had a great crispy bacon coating.  We got the bread pudding, which was soggy (I like it this way) studded with raisins. The ice cream helped to added another layer of richness and creaminess to the dish. Would get this again.  The Banana Pudding ($5.50) was a very large portion of vanilla pudding with loads of bananas and vanilla wafers. I think they folded in some whipped cream as the dish was actually somewhat light. Between the two desserts, this was the bigger hit.  Midwest Smokehouse puts out some good food which explains the lines and packed house. This is a solid choice to get your BBQ fix in Charlotte.

This place deserves 6 stars but that's not an option. Even the ice cubes are amazing!! They have the ball ice cubes.  We got the pimento fries with brisket which was probably the best thing I've ever eaten.  Then we got the combo plate with chicken, pork, brisket, and sausage. My favorite meat was the chicken, it comes in a great sauce. Our sides were the bacon wrapped jalepenos and Mac and cheese. To top it all off the service was probably the best service in a restaurant I've had in a long time. Everyone was so charming, especially our waitress Nickey.

One word comes to mind: miserable. As in "I am miserably full cause I couldn't stop eating!" First time eater and fully impressed. Tacos were excellent. Burnt ends were fairly insane. Bacon wrapped jalapeño gave me a new reason to live. And the pimento cheese fries were a delight. Service was attentive. Beer selection was ample. Not sure what else I can say. We are driving home complaining about how much our tummies hurt. Will be back.

While Memphis style barbecue will always be first in my heart, Midwood serves up great BBQ NC style. Brisket was dope, the Nacho Libres was the perfect balance of queso, jalapeños, and BBQ, the only thing that was wanting was their collard greens. Need more vinegar/flavor please. Other than that, this place is solid.

I am very disappointed in this place. I have been a long time customer and my experience this evening was so poor, that I will not be returning. If I was the owner of Midwood, I would honestly be embarrassed by the service I received tonight. I waited for a pick up order for over 30 minutes past my pick up time. When the order finally came out, it was wrong! When I asked to speak to the manager, he wasn't even apologetic. It was as if it was a chore to deal with a customer who had every right to be frustrated. He did not offer to right their wrong, in fact he offered me nothing! I got my money back and left. You can do better than this Midwood. Hope it was worth losing a long time customer.

Stopped in based on reviews on Yelp. We shared a combo platter with 2 adults and a child with an additional order of hush puppies. It was 6oz of 4 different smoked meats plus 2 sides. Was more than enough for all of us. The ribs were my favorite.
Always take family and friends visiting from out of town here. Try the Carolina Pork, so good!

I'm a little bias having lived in Texas for a year.. I feel like I have had my share of excellent and renowned  bbq. I came to midwood via yelp recommendation for some good bbq in the area. It was easy enough to get a table for 2 at lunch time on a Sunday. The menu is pretty big.. it's a restaurant as well as a bbq joint.. so you can get salads and sandwiches too. My friend and I split the combo platter- chopped chicken, chopped pork, brisket, and pork ribs, Mac n cheese, and beans. I enjoyed about half the plate- the brisket, ribs, and Mac m cheese were good-- not better than Texas.. but still tasty enough.   The chicken and chopped pork were so forgettable. In fact it was hard to tell the difference between the 2 chopped meats. This is definitely a rib joint! They have a limited number of beef ribs too.. but at $29/each I am skeptical! They weren't even that much in Texas.   Plenty of seating.. indoors and outdoors. Very casual place. Service was good and there appeared to be daily drink specials.

This place is really good. Way better than the previous Sticky Fingers. This location is definitely better than the NoDa and the service is way more friendly. We ordered some brisket in our combo plate and when they had sold out they let us do double ribs for free (normally a decent size up charge to do double ribs). Their collard greens are definitely my favorite side.
Best. BBQ. In. Charlotte. Get the sampler platter and as many bacon wrapped, cheese stuffed smoked jalapeños as possible and enjoy!

Absolutely delicious food with huge servings! I split the four meats plate and we got brisket, BBQ, chicken, and ribs with mac and cheese and fries. K honestly don't know what my favorite part was! The atmosphere is really neat and so welcoming. I would absolutely recommend eating here!

When a line for BBQ is out the door, you know its good. The brisket was the perfect blend of lean and fatty meat and smoked to perfection. It was served with a side of hush puppies, and I chose the BBQ cole slaw as my side of choice. I didn't quite get the BBQ flavor from the slaw, but it so pretty tasty none the less. It was a busy night, but our server did a great job of keeping our beverages topped off and bellies full.

I saw that a new BBQ place had opened up and had to go try it.  I ate lunch there on a Saturday just a little before noon.  The restaurant was nice, with an industrial feel to it, but very well done.  It had your standard decorations.  The place is kind of narrow, but the arrangement worked well for the space with a mixture of booths & high top tables.  The do have a deck outside with seats.  There were maybe one or two tables when I got there, so I could pretty much sit anywhere.  My server took my drink order and when she came back I asked if they had any sort of combo platter where I could try a little of each meat.  She said they might and went to check for me.  After a couple of minutes a different server came back and said they don't currently have a combo platter, but he showed me a new menu with it.  It was a choice of 4 meats & two sides.  I chose chicken, ribs, pork & brisket with baked beans and coleslaw for my sides.  It took a while for my food to come out.  When Peter, my server brought it out, the plate was enormous.  It had a  chicken, breast & wing, 5 ribs, a pile of chopped pork & a couple of slices of brisket.  There were also some hush puppies and pickled onions on the plate.  The sides where served in soup cups and there was also a plate with three different sauces.  Peter went over everything explaining the different types of sauces.  There was a vinegar based, mustard based, and a tomato based sauce.  The brisket was sliced thick with a bit of fat in it.  The pork was chopped fine and mixed with a little of the mustard based sauce.  The ribs were served dry and the chicken had some of the mustard based sauce on it.
