The brisket was tender and juicy with a nice dark bark on it.  When I first tried the bark I thought it might have been a little over smoked, but with more of the meat it was had a very nice balance.  My only complaint on the brisket was that it was sliced with the grain instead of across it.  The brisket was cooked long enough that it was still tender, but cut correctly it would have been better.    The pork was awesome!  Very tender and moist with a nice flavor.  The mustard sauce was a nice compliment to the pork.  I tried some of the vinegar based sauce, but didn't care for it as much as the mustard based.  The ribs were a little undercooked, but still tender enough with a nice flavor.  The ribs would have been much better with about another hour or two of cooking.  The chicken was tender and moist with a good flavor.  Nothing too special about it, but it was still good.  The baked beans had a nice flavor and had pieces of meat mixed in with them.  They also had chunks of onion and pepper.  There was a seasoning, like oregano or coriander, but I couldn't put my finger on it.  It was a different and I couldn't quite decide if it worked on not, but it must have since I ate most of them.  The coleslaw was meh, but you don't go to BBQ places just for the coleslaw.  The service was awesome here, Peter noticed when he brought my food out that the brisket had some fat on it so he brought a plate with some lean brisket, a little more pork and a slice of sausage for me to try.   I've tried a lot of the BBQ places in Charlotte since I've been here and Midwood Smokehouse is at the top of the list if not the best.  The price was very good for the amount of food as well, $16 for the combo plate.  With the extra meat Peter brought I couldn't finish it all, which is saying something.  With great service and reasonable prices I will be back.

I've been to the NoDa version of this place twice and while it was good I have to say the 521 location is better. Our waitress was spot on and she took care of us the whole way. I almost let go of the steering wheel she was so good.   Just as a preface...I smoke bbq at my house often and have eaten it all over the country, just look at my profile pic. I've actually stopped eating bbq unless it's a special occasion because so many places are let downs. This place isn't a let down so start driving now if you're considering.   We started with the bacon wrapped stuffed jalapeno's which are money. I don't order straight up bbq anymore so I had the taco's. Well thought out and executed as I would do them. I had to do the hushpuppies and they were worth cheating with fried foods. My son did the brisket sammich, I tasted it and they did a good job on it.   It was lunch time so I didn't order beer but they have a cool bar with tons of different beers. I may have to come back after 5 for some beers.   I will go back when in the area and so should you...always good to have a legit bbq joint in the hood near me. Just an FYI my dad went here three days ago on my advice and did order the straight up ribs, pulled pork and brisket. He's into bbq too and said it was spot on.

Enjoying a lazy Sunday before Sunday night prime time football between Packers & Steelers (28-31). Being a Packer fan i frequent Angry Ale's so decided to try some restaurants in the area.   Original idea was to visit another spot but how can you see BBQ and not want some.  The service was great, food was great and everyone was very personable and attentive. We were talked into trying the Massive Beef Ribs and when i say it's Massive that is an understatement. The beef basically melted right off the bone and cooked to perfection. Also had the lean Beef Brisket with Mac & Cheese which was also excellent. I'll definitely be getting this again but as a sandwich something about bread and Brisket that just sounds right .   Overall, excellent visit and we'll come back again. Just hopping this wasn't a fluke and the service is 5 Star next time. We arrived around noon so I would be interested to see how it is during the evening hours.

Oh yea! BBQ at its finest! The burnt ends are worth the wait. I have been coming here long before Hilary and Obama came and I can honestly say they got it right every time! The wings, the salads, the sandwiches, and the sides make this a BBQ standard. Go, you won't be disappointed.

I can't compliment this place enough! Casual but classy atmosphere with friendly staff and amazing food, what more could someone ask for? Came in on a Saturday afternoon, pretty busy for 3 o'clock. Our waitress was out of this world. So often you get a waitperson who is either lacksidasical in their service or smothering in their concern, but not Rachel. She was friendly and conversational, funny and witty really enjoyed her making us feel at home. Being from NC, BBQ means one thing...Pork, but their burnt ends are to die for. If I could eat it everyday I would, seriously at good.   PUMPKIN LOVERS- get the Gordgeous beer from NoDa Brewing Co....probably one of the best pumpkin beers I've had in a long time!

Service is extremely kind here.  This was my first time trying NC bbq; I do live in KC, but don't have a marked preference for a certain kind of American BBQ.  I ordered the small plate of burnt ends + a side of pulled pork (I know, I know... a side of meat, but it's only 3 oz., and I really wanted to try it since pulled pork is one of my faves.  Good thing I ordered it because the burnt ends were not where it was at; burnt ends came out cold and chewy -- not fork tender and delicious.  Apparently the burnt ends were a weekly special (or something like that), and they were so popular they became a permanent staple on the menu.  They came with a fat tire bbq sauce that I didn't really care for.  The pulled pork, on the other hand was much, much better, and I also enjoyed the sharp vinegar-y flavors of the sauce.  I also tried the bacon-wrapped jalapenos (nice heat, and the bacon adds so much incredible flavor) which were the best things I ate at this spot.  The hush puppies were alright; they did come out hot, but not being from the south -- maybe I don't get hush puppies / don't know how they're supposed to taste; these particular ones were dense and chewy.  Not my favorite.   It feels kind of dirty in here... not the kind of dirty you'd notice immediately, but there are a lot of flies here and the place feels a little grimy... but this is a bar, after all.    All that being said, I want to circle back to how great the service was.  My server asked how the food was tasting, and when it comes to how tasty the food is, I don't mess around :), and I (gently) let her know that the burnt ends weren't up to par.  She offered to replace it with another type of meat, but I wasn't too eager to try anything else, so she actually just comped part of my meal, and I ended up paying for my iced tea and a couple of bucks for my pulled pork side.  After all of that, I'm just ambivalent about this place... if you do go, don't get the burnt ends, though.

I have previously reviewed this place, but I returned again and I tried the Pecan Cobbler.    It was a religious experience... the Pecan Cobbler is the kind of thing that wars could be fought over.   It was perhaps the BEST dessert that I have EVER had in my life.  I don't want to over play it, but it was served warm with a scoop of really good ice cream.     GET THE PECAN COBBLER!   What helps is that you eat all of this salty BBQ food and then finish it with a sweet cobbler.   Epic experience.

I am definitely a fan of the Mid Wood Smokehouse. I regularly go to the Plaza Midwood location but this location is closer to my house and I was overjoyed to get some smokehouse a little closer to home.   A good friend of mine told me the Smokehouse had opened and I sprinted over... I am not sure if this location has recently opened or if they're smoker just wasn't up to par completely yet... but something was definitely different about this experience.   Don't get me wrong- the service was amazing as usual, the decor was local and lively... everything was basically great... except the Beef Brisket... now I am a beef girl and I like my beef brisket to have some fat and some char on it. But these particular slices of brisket were so smoky in flavor - my mouth literally tasted like I had ash inside my mouth. Again - don't get me wrong... the meat was tender and even juicy in spaces.. but the overwhelming char, fire, smoke taste over powered my ability to enjoy this meal.   I'm convinced this experience was some type of insane weird flawed evening - so I will return and update my review with hopefully better news about the smokehouse brisket.   Now - as for the other sides.... awesome and amazing... per my usual - mach and cheese and the hush puppies that created my love for hush puppies were amazing.

This is literally where I go everytime I'm thinking about BBQ.... I have a true Charlottean village of family surrounding me and they usually laugh at me when I suggest BBQ places to go but Midwood saves my Hyde everytime.  Beef brisket!!
Great bbq food with a variety of bbq sauces. Definitely would recommend it to others in the area. Their fried pickles are excellent.
Every seems to agree this is the place to go if you only have one nigh in Charlotte. 44 and 45ish seem to agree, and I can see why. Don't skip the bacon wrapped jalapeños.
I prefer the plaza mid wood location. This location doesn't seem as warm. The food seems a little different as well. Just a lil.

Fantastic lunch experience!!  Our server was outstanding too (wish I remembered her name so I could give her a shout out)!  The meal was scrumptious from the apps to dessert!  I think I may have found my go to BBQ spot and that's saying a LOT!  Brought leftovers home to my hubby and he was impressed as well.  Will return and soon!
I picked up a large catering order yesterday before noon. The service was over the top and the food the same. I highly recommend Midwood Smokehouse.

I'm from Texas and thought the brisket was really good. Moist, not dry. Sauce with it was good. Mac and cheese was also good. Wasn't a fan of the hush puppies but i don't have anything to compare them too, so maybe i just don't like hush puppies. I got my food to-go from the bar.

I stopped in for lunch at Midwood Smokehouse and was delighted to grab a table outside. A beautiful day and a much-hyped BBQ shop had the makings of a great meal. I've been searching for a great BBQ shop. I went into the meal hoping I had found a great local BBQ shop.  I ordered a Small Pulled Pork Plate and was delighted when the meal came out in no more than 3 minutes. Love that.  The very friendly and attentive waitress claimed that the meal was 8oz of meat and the menu also claimed that the pork was PULLED. I must have done a poor job of hiding my confusion when the meal was delivered because the waitress asked if everything was ok. I pointed out the obvious fact that the pork was chopped and not pulled. Apparently, they pull the pork apart...and then chop it. In my book, that's called chopped. Chopped and Pulled are two different meals. I won't be convinced otherwise and I won't be fooled.   I suspect that there wasn't quite 8oz of meat, but forgot my digital scale.  Putting the texture discrepancy aside, the BBQ was seasoned very well. I'm a fan of a sweeter BBQ and tend to shy away from vinegar-based sauces. The BBQ was seasoned so well that the side of vinegar sauce was unnecessary. The side of baked beans had great texture and were seasoned to perfection(sweet), but was a small side. Mixing the BBQ and the beans together, I found my sweet flavorful BBQ.   I was unimpressed with the hush-puppies but my four-legged companion liked them. I'm sure she would give them two-paws up. She likes hush-puppies but I've never had one I really liked.   Overall, the food was pretty good but I have to admit I was disappointed at the prices. The portions were small for the amount of money. The small plate was in the range of $9 and only came with one side. I couldn't justify to my self spending $3 to get an extra side. After seeing the size of the sides, I made the right choice.   Midwood Smokehouse is a good concept and has the makings of a great BBQ joint, but they've really missed it on portion size.

I love that they open d one up here in Birkdale. Everytime we come here, the food is always so good. Yesterday my husbands chicken for his salad was a bit dry.  Other than that, this place has been fairly consistent: good bbq.

What a great new local restaurant for the Midwood hood. The server explained that the menu will be enlarged soon to offer more vegetarian and healthy meals. But even the way the menu is now is great.   The Saint Louis style ribs were absolutely perfect--very meaty, smoked to perfection, and very tender. The special Plaza Midwood bbq sauce is a perfect compliment. The baked beans were very flavorful. The outdoor seating is very nice, though the indoor seating seems a little cramped. Overall, this was a great experience, and I will be going back tonight for more!

BBQ at its finest! It's always amazing to me when I can eat bbq That I don't have to put sauce on! This place was phenomenal! Portions are huge...this place is serious! I had the pimento fries with brisket, smoked wings, and brisket sandwich on Texas toast and my wife ordered a sampler that had 4 meats ( ribs, brisket, chicken ,pork) . The sides were up to par with the main dishes, the Mac and cheese, collard, the cream corn....crazy flavor! Whenever I go back to Charlotte, going back! Now I need to find comparable in my city

Such wonderful service here. The food however was just fine. The wings I got were VERY pink inside and I only ate a few because I wasn't sure if they were supposed to look like that. The hush puppies were ok. The BBQ was very dry. Wasn't a fan of the sauces. Everyone seems to love this place so maybe we just got an unlucky meal. Good sized portions for kids meals though.   Oh just a tip----the heated patio feels like you're being microwaved. Was nice and quiet out there but under the heat lamp my scalp felt like it was burning and I had to move seats.   Cool place but there's better BBQ around.
Really great BBQ...my only wish is that they would add a fish entree. Other than my little quirky wish they give you all you want in a BBQ joint.
Smells amazing when you walk in...tons of food, and very friendly staff!  I left completely stuffed, and content.  Staff is awesome!

Great food, great service and great selection of Bourbon. The service was quick warm and very helpful as this is my first time here. The recommendation of the Beef Brisket with Mac N Cheese was amazing. Every bite I was in heaven. Business is taken me west but I'll be back on Thursday to enjoy one last me before flying home to Oregon. This place is awesome!

Very good Q. Generous portion. Collards are worth getting. Service was super. Asked for outside cut and they said they could not accomodate that request but it came about half and half which was perfect anyway. Have to go back and try the ribs. They looked great. Worth the drive. Parking can be a challenge at lunch rush hour, so arrive before or after the peak.

Always go to the same place for BBQ, deciding to change things up and went to Midwood.  Flying solo so sat at the bar.  The service at the bar was excellent-my server was quick to pour me a beer and get me a menu-very friendly and attentive! To compare to my favorite place, I ordered similar items--beef brisket, collard greens and baked beans.  The plate also came with hush puppies. The portion was excellent, and don't leave hungry-good value for the food.  The brisket had a little fat, which made it moist, and good smoke.  They offer the BBQ sauces on the side - a vinegar base and tomato base sauce, I stayed with the tomato based sauce. Overall, the food was good, and the service was excellent! I've had their burnt ends before and thought they were excellent.  Some BBQ joints only offer the burnt ends as an appetizer, this place it's a meal with sides.  I will definitely be back, as the server also told me they do a burnt ends with Pork!

This is my first time to the area and this restaurant was my first meal here. The server was very very friendly and gave us tons of recommendations (to be honest it was almost not helpful because there were too many). I had a beef brisket sandwich and Mac n cheese on the side. My colleague had brisket with bacon wrapped jalapeños. Everything was delicious!

I found this place via my trusty YELP app. Me and my buddy decide to come here after the Nascar race got rained out. We get there and the host told us that they are out of ribs and pulled pork. But thats what we came here for? But from what it looks like one of the owners said that those two items would be ready within 30 minutes. My buddy said lets just stay here only because it will probably take us that long to decide on where to go instead, then drive there, then sit, then order. SO we just said, lets just eat here.  We put our name down and asked for a booth, and they said there might be a wait, I said no problem because we had 30minutes to wait for the stuff we wanted anyways.  Our server, i forgot his name was really nice. We browse the menu and pretty much know what we wanted.  I ordered that plate that had a little bit of everything and my buddy just had the pulled pork.   We get our food fairly fast, it didn't even feel like we waited that long for anything. When I get my plate, everything looked amazing! The bacon wrapped jalepeno's was awesome. The baked beans was home made. the hush puppies i couldn't stop eating.  As for my meats. The thing i loved the most was the brisket. It was hands down the best brisket I have ever tried. My next favorite was the pulled pork, and the Ribs and sausage I did not care for. The ribs looked amazing but it fell flat for me in terms of flavor. The sausage was nothing really to write home about. Oh i forgot to mention i LOVED the pickled onions. Wish I got more on my plate.  But other then that, this place gets a solid 4 star in my book. I'll most defiantly be back when I'm in town again.

two words: brisket tacos. I ordered the two taco plate with one pork one brisket... the brisket was ah-maz-ing... I wanted to trade in my pork taco for another it was that good. I ended up saving the pork taco for the next day, it was really good left over and tasty in its own right but the brisket blew it out of the water. BF had the pork plate w/mac n cheese, he said the pork was too smoky for his liking (we eat Mac's a lot)... I didnt think he tasted overly smokey but to each their own. The food here is good, staff is super nice and they have a lot of options (no burgers thou!).

Ate there on Mothers Day and NO WAIT for seating or food this time! YEA! I got the Cuban sandwich (I AM Cuban, from Miami) which was a fair sandwich for being done in NC, but NOT a true Cuban sandwich. Still, it WAS tasty and huge and the bread (which waiter told me is flown in daily from Tampa) was the best! I got the coleslaw as my side...decent slaw, not vinegar, not milky type. My son got the pork plate with mac n cheese and slaw sides. He is a strapping young man, hungry...and the portions filled him well. We got one of the bacon wrapped jalapeno appetizers and they are decent, too. Ours were cold when served, but tasty and I will go by and get them 'as a meal' from now on. Their margarita is tasty...enough alcohol and good tasting mix. Son got two different beers, one the Blue Moon, the other I didn't sample as I was driving. We'd sat on the patio in the evening before it got dark...nice! We'd go back again. I did notice that you can get a plate of sides, differing amounts, and I often eat strange like that (gastric bypass past). That way I'd have several meals of several healthy foods, but I'll be a regular bacon wrapped jalapenos peep IF they'll cook them to order so I get them HOT.

We are very happy that Midwood decided to make our neighborhood their next home.  Food was excellent as always, but the service was even better.  We were blessed with Jocelyn (unsure of spelling) and she was impressive, super attentive, friendly, and warm.  The manager checked in on all the tables and we gave him great feedback.  I had the chopped pork, my husband had the ribs, and our son had the chicken tenders; no complaints, everything was great.  We did start with the BBQ queso with brisket and it was average at best, not a do-over.  The banana pudding was also not a do-over, all whipped cream and no pudding.  Overall, an excellent place for dinner and we'll be back!!

I'm not a barbecue fan, so I'll start off by giving that disclaimer. That said, I usually don't mind when friends want to go to a barbecue place because they always have really great sides. Not the case here. I wanted to like it so badly; I have been two or three times in an attempt to appease the friends I'm with ... and I'm just not happy with it. I wish they would focus a little more on their sides ... then I would be all about it!
Never fails with the Midwood chopped salad! Open late so always our go-to for takeout!! The large makes two meals for me so I always get extra green goddess dressing! So delicious!

I like Midwood Smokehouse usually go to Plaza Midwood. The service at this location was really poor. The food came first asked the waitress for water and never got it. In fact never came at all for a drink order. We ate our dinner without a beverage other than leftover from the bar.   She finally came to our table after dinner was complete. I asked why we never got a drink period and she said she'd get a manager. Just a real "BITCH"!  We had an angry exchange. The manager was trying to be helpful but the damage was done. If she worked for me I would have fired her on the spot! Absolutely awful. My grandson knows the owner and I will write to him to make him aware. Really bad experience!

Although not strictly a "Carolina-style" Barbecue restaurant this is a great BBQ place with something for everyone and excellent food and drinks overall. While the pulled pork is good, the ribs, brisket and sausage here is also excellent and if you are going as a group you should order a "Pig Out" platter where you can choose 4 different meats. Beverage program includes cocktails made with local moonshine and as well as a comprehensive wine list. Be sure to try the banana pudding, the pecan cobbler (served warm) and the chocolate mousse pie.

First and last time eating at Midwood. Restaurant has a 95 inspection score from health department. Nacho appetizer came out with something that had "legs" on it . No one ate any and we notified staff. Waitress picked it up, said it was burnt onions, and took off with it. What ever! There were no onions on the nacho. We did not eat any of the appetizer and left it to the side. A man came by and asked if we wanted Nacho's boxed and we told him that something weird was on the nacho's and we did not want them . We ended up being credited for the nacho's but it ruined the meal. I assume what ever it was fell from the hood in the kitchen. Either way it was really gross!

Dan enjoyed his pulled pork BBQ player with the mac and cheese and hush puppies. He asked me to give this a 4-star.   I just had a grilled cheese with broccoli. Two of my favorite things. It was okay. I'm not into smoked meats but veg options were available. The old fashioned was okay.   We are at the bar and service was good. That's about it (it was election day so we were preoccupied)  Parking. Let's just get this out of the way. It can't be good anywhere in this area.
Simply amazing! Great smoke on all the meats. Service was outstanding and will be back.

BBQ time!  The great: sauces were very tasty, especially that vinegar sauce on the pork! Mac and cheese was bomb. A baked mac topped with cheddar combined with a cheese sauce to resist dryout: the way it's supposed to be. (If you're thinking "obviously," I agree but somehow a lot of places still serve casserole mac sans cheese sauce and it just doesn't work.)   The good: pork was slightly too dry, relying completely on the vinegar sauce. I would have liked it to be more moist on its own, but with plenty of sauce, it still worked. The bacon wrapped jalapenos had wonderful flavor but the bacon was somewhat undercooked. These mugs should be crispy outside, not chewy.  The okay: the chicken! way too dry! No amount of mustard sauce could moisten it up. Here's a tip from a real actual one-time barbecuer at a restaurant that, (no dis, it's just the truth) made better BBQ than y'all: If you're hot-holding your meats with the lid off, you need to periodically add stock to keep the moisture up. If not, toss it on your flat top and give it a squirt of stock (or water if you're out of stock), cook it for literally 20 seconds. The boiling stock (or water) will heat it in no time and it will be nice and moist!  I did this with my leftovers and it allowed the smokiness of the chicken to take center stage. DO IT!!  The bad: nothing!  Good job guys! A well-deserved 4 out of 5!
Was awesome, pork was perfectly cooked, tasty, loved the wings nice and smoked and the chicken was perfect inside. Great beers on tap , classic !

This place is a nice walk from our house.  We sat outside, and, although it was a little warm, we cooled down nicely. My husband ordered the salmon platter.  I requested the grilled cheese with smoked vegetables as a side.  The server asked, "are you sure you don't want meat with that?  We are known for our meat."  To which I replied, "I am known for not liking meat."  I guess he was supposed to push the meat.  And also,  he mam'd me to death.  I don't enjoy being called ma'am, but it's everywhere.  Call me babe or hottie instead. The food took a while to arrive.  My husband thought that maybe his food sat for a while.  My vegetables needed salted and peppered, which was an easy fix.  The sandwich was a bit thin on the cheese, but I was so happy to have bread.  I never eat bread, and Texas Toast was a treat. We enjoyed the 80's playlist and had fun trying to guess the artists. It was a nice, ordinary evening.

Great BBQ!!!!! Perfect burnt ends and loved the bacon wrapped jalapeños.  We also had BBQ sandwich and brisket tacos, all of which were awesome.  On top of great entrees were amazing sides which separates the best from great.

I was so excited to hear that Midwood Smokehouse just opened in Birkdale which is very close to where I live. The location gives inviting and relaxing vibes. Plenty of tables and seats, nice looking bar, TVs, fun decors, nice outdoor seating, and clean bathrooms.   Food: BBQ here is one of the best BBQ places I have ever been. We always order the Well-fed combo platter between two of us and it was more than enough food. It comes with 2 sides. Our favorite sides are Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos, BBQ Slaw, and Collard Greens. My mom loves their collard greens so much that she really wants to know their secret recipe. My husband said their brisket is maybe the best he has ever eaten. The brisket was not dry and carried a mild smoke flavored. The brisket had a nice smoked ring on the meat. Tender, smokey and you can get it lean or juicy and more fatty... really incredible.   Service was exceptional. The waiter was very attentive and knowledgeable.   I can't compliment this place enough! Casual but classy atmosphere with friendly staff and amazing food at great prices.

We'd wanted to try North Carolina style BBQ for a long time since we moved to the area. I knew this place from my co-worker and finally made it on Saturday lunch. It was packed, but we were seated right away since just two of us. First time here I could say that I was impressed with their food and services.  When you walk in, it is very cool and clean atmosphere. Good for family and friends. Staffs were super friendly and attentive. They kept checking on us.   Their menu is on point. You can also find that they have a lot of selection of beer. My fiance ordered the combo platter: the Pig out! You can choose 4 out of 5 kind of meat you want and 2 sides. It came out with a huge portion and good for 2-4 people! They have 2 different BBQ sauces; tomato based and vinegar based. Since we are from Texas, we never liked vinegar based. But at this place, we said yes!!I ordered salmon sammie. It was good but not the best. We loved their bacon wrapped jalapeno! The best we've ever had. Not too much cream cheese it's what we like. For the sides, we loved sweet potato fries and hush puppies. They were just delicious.   There are plenty of parking spots in the back of the restaurant. We'd love to come back again!!!

Ease up on the salt!  Collard green, inedible due to salt.   Ribs, dried out and salty, inedible. Fried Pickles, overly salty and inedible.  Talked to the manager, they knew they were inedible because of a bad batch of pickles but served them anyway. Beans, soaked in fat and overcooked, inedible. Pulled Pork, okay Brisket, okay. Service, very good.  Over all extremely dissatisfied with the food.  Hope to find some real BBQ where I don't have to double up on my blood pressure medicine because of the salt content. Dismayed as to why people recommend this place.

Now I can't believe I haven't left a review here... this place is one of the better smokehouses around there are a lot of things that I've tried here but I went for lunch this past week and tried their, I think it was "pitmaster's choice", burger and holy moly it was to die for. Shaved beef brisket with a patty (medium well for me), gouda cheese, some type of Chipotle sauce I can't remember, banana peppers, and a lot more. Right when it was put in front of me you could just smell it and it tasted even better than it smelled. I've also had some of their meats, sausage, ribs, just about all of them and I can't complain about any of them. Hush puppies are amazing, Mac and cheese is amazing, baked beans amazing. Oh and did I mention the BBQ sauces? Those are... amazing!

Best bbq we've had in North Carolina yet, just what we were hoping for in southern bbq! Everything had that perfect authentic wood-smoked flavor and the sauces weren't even necessary, but took it to the next level of flavor. The brisket was as good as the reviews amped up, moist and smoky more than meaty flavor. Pork and ribs incredible as well. Collards perfectly cooked and not bitter at all. All so worth it, I could go back everyday. Price reasonable for the quantity of food. Service great. Cool mural outside.  Can't recommend enough! All rubs and sauces gf too.

The BEST brisket for sure. I stopped by for dinner on a Sunday night with three of my friends, we opted to share two combo platters. Tried the Carolina Chopped Pork, Beef Brisket, St. Louis Style Pork RIbs, and the Pulled Chicken BBQ. My favorites were the Beef Brisket and Ribs for sure. The brisket was so tender and had great flavor and the ribs were fall off the bone delicious! For the sides we went with Collard Greens, Mac and Cheese, Baked Beans, and Bacon Wrapped Jalapenos - all of them were great! Loved the bacon wrapped jalapenos and the collard greens the most. They also have a nice selection of local draft beers. Service was great, a little on the slower side at first, but I think that's because we lagged and took a while to decide on our order. Overall we had a great experience and I would love to come back again if I'm ever in Charlotte.

BBQ for everyone...beginners and experts.  All types of BBQ--chicken, pig, cow, etc and plenty of sauces to complete the whole deal.  I'm not a BBQ expert but I truly feel this place accomplished the goal and it impressed my out of town guests so that is the most important thing!  Like others have stated, the atmosphere is "down home,"  the service is friendly, the prices are reasonable, etc.  Between the 7 of us we literally sampled the whole menu...pork bbq, chicken bbq, burnt ends, smoked turkey, ribs, etc.  We also tried the pimento cheese fries for an appetizer and they were nothing short of amazing!!!  The baked beans are a must for your side choice.  They are full of flavor and even have some bbq mixed in.  They are awesome.   Again, I'm not a huge BBQ person so is this the best place Charlotte has to offer?  No clue.  Does it showcase some pretty authentic Caroline BBQ?  I think so!  Good variety, good prices, good side orders, nice sized portions--yes, I'm a fan!

I always stumbled a bit when someone would ask me about my favorite place to go for BBQ in town, but I have to say Midwood unexpectedly has given me an answer.  The brisket is amazing (definitely for Charlotte, but even compared to all the Texas brisket I've consumed in my life), the mac n cheese is delish, and you can't go wrong with bacon wrapped jalaps and crispy hushpuppies. The staff steered me away from the pulled pork both times - so I went with the ribs on my second trip - pretty darn good. (I'm trying it next time, though) Lots of side options, but I remember them being a little light on the veg entree options. The Midwood bbq sauce is my current fave, but their mustard sauce is tasty as well. (I still have not come to love carolina vinegarness, so I didn't even try theirs)  Decent beers on tap, lots of whiskey options, and great patio space. The staff is super friendly, though the bartenders may have asked if we were okay a handful too many times. (A little hard to eat if every 30 seconds I have to respond to the question) Pretty speedy service at lunch, looking forward to returning.

Love, love, love this place!! Their Cuban sandwich is my favorite. The hostesses are rude and not too friendly but with the amount of traffic they get I let it slide. Make sure you come early because the waiting time for a table it's usually 20 min.

I'm cutting back, way back, on meat but I have to have a little pork every now and then!  The smell of smoke, the good kind, hits you when you open your car door. You know you're in for a treat.   We were seated quickly, especially for prime time Sunday dinner and having a party of seven.   You HAVE to ask for Walter to be your server. He is THE best! And if you close your eyes, you'll swear you're listening to the radio. He has that kind of voice!  The food is amazing. I opted for chopped barbecue with creamed corn and greens. Food arrived super quickly and was hot...and delicious. We love Eastern NC style barbecue and they have "our" vinegar-based sauce to top your meat choice.   I wanted dessert but they didn't have wheelchairs. They have something called pecan cobbler that I will have to try on my next visit!
Best bbq in the city, love the burnt ends
Brisket is awesome great atmosphere super friendly staff

Having never been to Midwood, I was really looking forward to my dinner group meet up. We had reservations and I arrived last, of course. I placed my drink order and received it before the others, who then waited another 20 minutes for theirs to arrive. That should have told us what kind of night it was going to be. After looking over the menu, which I will say is a lot, I decided to go with the small pulled pork plate. Others ordered the Cuban sandwich, ribs and pulled pork as well. My platter came with one side, I chose cole slaw and ordered a side of sweet potato fries.  Service was a little off, but we did receive our dinners and unfortunately I received fries as my side, not cole slaw, plus another plate of fries. Okay, too many fries going on. After catching multiple waitresses I finally received my slaw. And, not really sure it was worth it. The pulled pork was great, the fries were crisp and cooked too perfection, but the slaw...very blah in my mind. Definitely missing something.  Overall the others enjoyed their food, but not sure I would rush back to this location.

Midwood Smokehouse is one of the newest additions to the Backlot of the Park Road Shopping Center and that is a yippee for me, as I live in the area.  Having been to other Midwood locations I was definitely looking forward to checking out their newest spot.  The weather was nice so we opted for waiting for a table on the outside patio, which was less than 10 minutes.  While we waited we ordered some drinks at the bar, and eyed every dish that went by, as well as smelled the amazing goodness. After arriving to our table we were greeted by our waitress who was great! She had a smile on her face and definitely gave us and every table around us the attention customers deserve. We decided to order a Combination Platter, which comes with 4 meats and two sides, and added a few additional sides. From the platter selections we chose the Chopped Pork, Brisket, St. Louis Style Pork Ribs and the Hickory Smoked Sausage with Macaroni & Cheese, Smoked Veggies, Crinkle Fries and an extra side of Hushpuppies. The food arrived and boy did it look good. By far the chopped pork and brisket were the winners, with the hushpuppies and fries shining for the sides.   Dinner did not disappoint and overall I think Midwood will be a definite hit in this location. With the service, atmosphere and food as good as it is anyone should check it.  And, go hungry, it's a lot of food!
Absolutely loved this place ! Great service and amazing food. Bacon wrapped Jalepeños are crazy good, never had em like this, and fell in love !

Good BBQ! I tried the salmon with creamed corn and also got a salad. All three of the items were great, and I would highly recommend any of those options. My boyfriend got the rib meal, and it was definitely a hearty portion and looked good. I am looking forward to trying the grilled cheese next time!

Always my favorite......went last night.....the bartender w dark hair and dark black rimmed glasses ....I think. She was new bc another girl was telling how to do inventory.....was amazing, very attentive but down to business! Always amazing, maybe not perfect but that's real life people! My fav! Keep it up!

Had the burnt ends with Mac n cheese, hush puppies and Texas toast. The small meal was more than enough for 2 meals. The BBQ sauce that's mixed with fat tire has a bit of spiciness to it but not overpowering. I also had the devils cut bourbon with pineapple and ginger soda, for a non bourbon drinker it was pretty good. I want to come back and try the sandwiches and other sides. The area is a bit small but the decor is pretty neat.
Protein plate of brisket, chicken, ribs, burnt ends with greens and cream corn.  All good, favorite would be brisket and ribs.  Good sauces; spices and mustard. No room for desert!

While visiting some friends in Charlotte, we requested a Southern lunch so they took us to Midwood Smokehouse.  That Southern lunch was definitely delivered!  We sat at a large picnic table outside of the restaurant.  Since we were a larger group, that table was the only area outside that a group of our size could fit.  The other outdoor seating was for 2-4 people.  Midwood Smokehouse has a great local, craft beer list.  We all found something to suit our fancy, from IPA's to wheat beers, and we all enjoyed them thoroughly!  My friend and I decided to share the Combo-Platter, Well-fed.  We had the Carolina Chopped Pork, Beef Brisket, Chopped Chicken BBQ.  Instead of picking a forth meat, we opted for a double order of the brisket.  Our sides were the Mac & Cheese, Smoked Veggies and Hushpuppies.  All of the meat was extremely tender and delicious!  I also thought that the smoke veggies were pretty fabulous!   The mac & cheese and hushpuppies were average, nothing to write home about.  The "well-fed" portion was more than enough for the two of us, we weren't able to finish all of it!  Our other friend had the chicken tacos, and said they were delicious (though it is hard to disappoint her with tacos!)  This is a great find, just outside of Uptown Charlotte!
Wow! Being a Texas gal, it really hard to impress me in North Carolina. Let me tell you,  best barbeque I've ever had! Don't pass this place up if you want perfect barbecue!

Just had the worst experience ever with take out and management at Midwood. We placed an order and they gave us someone else's order. We had to drive back and they accused us of taking the wrong order.   Our food was then cold when they handed to us and they said nothing. I asked them if they were going to discount the order. He (Walter) said he would only give us banana pudding.   When he came back with the pudding I asked again would he discount the food. He then asked 'what, do you want free food'. He came back with a gift certificate. Like I would ever go back.

Staff is super friendly. You walk in here and instantly feel welcome. Great draft selection. The menu is completely "on point" with a great selection of appetizers and main courses. You'll probably be like me and want a little of everything. Guess what? They have a combo platter for that. 2 sizes, as well.   Because I am about to go to a festival, I limited my selection to the bacon wrapped jalapeños (to die for) and the pulled pork sandwich. These were everything great I could expect from a bbq joint. Great music and atmosphere and the food is truly superior to most bbq I've had. Sauces are completely on point.   I'll definitely be back. Time and time again.
Best brisket in Charlotte.  Enough said.  Also, get the jalapeno poppers.  They are amazing!  Baked beans are out of this world too!

Good BBQ with a bunch of different cuts. Sides are good too.  This is more of a casual dining spot rather than a real authentic, paper plate BBQ place. The inside is really nice the staff is great. In a really neat part of town (Plaza Midwood) so you can walk around to some shops after/before your meal. Combine the food and the environment together and you have a really nice dining experience.

Visited for lunch with a friend. Never been to this location. NOT disappointed. Just a great place and experience. Had a house salad first - lots of veggies and variety for a house salad. Then I got the special for an entree: Hawaiian burger (burger with BBQ and pineapple-infused salsa). HOLY HELL - it was so good. A bit messy but my goodness it was filling and delicious. I can't wait to back. Never a bad meal and service is tops.

My family checked out this place this past weekend and for the most part enjoyed our meal.  Our waiter was friendly, and quickly took our orders.  Just a few notes:  The BBQ Queso was so-so - there was nothing special about a bowl of tortilla chips and a bowl of melted cheese with a clump of BBQ in the middle of it.  I guess I wasn't sure what the expect, but it still seemed very basic.  As for the main meals, my son got a burger and wanted American cheese, but the waiter said they did not have any.  As in, ever.  And yet the menu clearly stated American cheese was used.  Despite this, my son just got a plain hamburger and ate the whole thing, so he had no complaints.  My daughter got Carolina BBQ with a side of baked beans.  She liked the BBQ but not the beans - she didn't really say why.  My husband got burnt ends and loved them, but said the mac & cheese was pretty pedestrian.  I got a sauced half-rack of Memphis ribs with sweet potato fries.  The fries were good, but the ribs were VERY salty.  It was almost as if they brined the ribs before they put them on the fire. They were that salty.  I ended up drinking 3-4 huge cups of water (their cups are about 26-28 fl oz) to compensate.  Would we go here again?  Probably not.  The prices were reasonable, and the space was decent (GREAT music playing over the speakers), but the food wasn't very "wow" for us.

Pretty good barbecue though I'm from the eastern side of the state so nothing around here seems to compare for me... but for Charlotte it's a pretty strong showing and better than Macs but the atmosphere is t as good so still 4 stars like Macs...

Yummy! Had the beef brisket. It was amazing. The smoked veggies and the pecan cobbler were also delish. Service was good and the prices were reasonable. Only in Charlotte for a couple of days but we will likely reyurn to try some other things.

The central location has always been good so decided to try this one.  Smoked salmon is usually good at smoke houses...  just ok, nothing special.  Stuffed bacon wrapped jalapeños - 2 out of 3 not stuffed.  Told by server that side salad could be substituted for a side.  Was unexpectedly up charged.  Also side salad had corn and black beans tossed into salad, no option to remove because of staff tossing salad for you..  top it off with having told the server that I didn't care for the salad and receiving an "oh".  Later questioned up charge and received a "would you like a refill to go?"  It was as if I hadn't said anything.  Only refill given was the one to go...   at central location managers come by to ask how your meal was, the two men who appeared to be managers stood over by bar talking.  May have ruined my support for Millwood in future...

This is my favorite BBQ spot in Charlotte. Ive been to both locations and both be swinging. I always order their smoked wings and their platter which comes with your choice of meat and sides. Their beer selection is good too as I always rock out with a apple beer.
The food is amazing. The one time something came out improper (lean instead of fatty brisket) they took care of it within minutes. Great beer and drink selection for a food focused restaurant.

Succulent Southern goodness!!  I came here with some friends on Saturday. After scouring Yelp, driving around town, and ruling out some places that have been featured on various TV shows (but had terrible ratings), we agreed on this place.   We decided to sample a little of everything: The fried pickles were pretty good, if you're into that sort of thing. (I heard that they're a Southern thing, so I decided to give them a try.) The pimento cheese fries were cheesy and yummy and otherwise delicious! The hushpuppies... well, I could eat those by the pound. Fried just right, not at all greasy. Just a little bit sweet and perfect one-bite sized. Careful though; you can eat a whole order without realizing it (and then you would have no room for BBQ, and nobody wants that!)  I got the brisket "burnt ends" for my entrée. To be 'ends', they were surprisingly tender with just the right amount of sweet, smoky sauce. The mac and cheese was the real deal, with the slightly charred cheese on top... just like mama used to make (none of that Easy Mac crap that some of these places try to give you)! The creamed corn was not too sweet, a little peppery... not what I expected, but not bad. My friends got a half slab of ribs and smoked salmon respectively and the only complaint at the table was that there was more food on the table than belly to put it all in.  Stuffed though we were, we HAD to make room for dessert. Our server (Drew?) talked us into some of their homemade banana pudding. After interrogating him thoroughly about the legitimacy of the pudding (Is it banana "flavored" instant pudding? Are there real Nilla wafers in it? Are there any actual bananas in the pudding?), we were informed that it is made fresh by a baker that the restaurant 'stole' from a local bakery nearby.  (And in case you're wondering...No, it's not instant pudding. Yes, there are lots of Nilla wafers inside [and no, they are not soggy! That's a pet peeve of mine], as well as fresh, not browned, bananas).  The pudding was a bit too sweet for my taste (to be fair, I'm VERY picky 'bout my pudding!), but my friends gobbled it right on up.  The cocktails were ok. My friend got a drink with smoked ice (yes, smoked ice) in it that she thoroughly enjoyed. I got something with Jim Beam Devil's Cut, but to be fair, the drinks were in waaaay over their head competing with all the succulent flavors coming from the numerous plates surrounding them. All in all, we had a blast! The service was as good as the food and if I'm ever in Charlotte again, I'll be back!

Love Midwood Smokehouse on Central, this place is not like the Central Ave location. Food good, service good, just not the same feel. Almost felt like a chain restaurant like the Sticky Fingers before it. Would have been four stars if I felt at home, just didn't.

My wife took me on my birthday for dinner. Much better than our last visit. Great service, food is always great. Had fatty brisket and my wife had tacos. Food never disappoints. We always ask to sit in booths near door, best seats in the house.

I know the entire world LOVES this place. I promise you this is not a "bangwagon" review. I personally find myself not easily impressed by any of the "OMG it's the best blah blah blah" places people typically raved about.   Honestly I have no beef with Midwood Smokehouse, and I frequent enough to be "a fan." I should disclose the fact that I'm not a big BBQ person, thus this rarely is my 1st choice to dine at. With that being said, I suppose their foods are consistent and reasonably priced. I have my fav item here, which is their (not so) small salad with smoked salmon added. It's the most food you can get for $8, and semi healthy. Their Avocado Green Goddess is my dressing choice.   I do have to say service is hit & miss. Brian was great this last time, which was a welcomed change. One time we sat at the bar, and the bartender refused my request to leave my salmon whole (I am not a cat, I don't like shredded fish). I thought that was rude and un-restaurant of them to refuse my otherwise reasonable request. PLUS parking is a pain, especially with all the new housing built nearby.   If I can offer half star, this would be a solid 3.5-star place in my world. It's hump day, and I'll be nice and throw in the other half and made it a 4-star review.

This place has great BBQ and atmosphere. The staff is friendly and fast. I've also been to the Central Ave location several times and was pleased when they opened a closer location. It can get very busy but that is because they have great food!

Great ribs! I snuck in an hour before they closed and was warned that they were out of some things and almost out of the pork ribs. I wanted to try the ribs as they are my litmus test for bbq joints. I got one of the last half racks and they were superb, despite being one of the last ones. They surely sat in a warmer for a long time and were still moist and tender and very good. The spicy chipotle sauce was delicious and the collards were great too. Thumbs up for this place, I'll definitely be back.

Not sure what's up with all the terrific reviews.  I have been twice and both times by meat was dry and we had less than "great" service.  I might try one more time, but after that, I'm heading back to Mac's for always great sandwiches and the best smoked chicken wings in town!

Overrated!  Had a burger.....Sounded delicious on menu but it was lousy.....Chewy!!!!!    Gross......I managed to eat about a third and left there hungry.   Fries were mediocre at best....What a disappointment this place was!!!!!!!

On the night that I went,they were very busy. They asked me if I wanted to carry out or dine in. I told them take out because she said that the wait time would be 30 mins. For dining in. The wait was worth it!!! I had a brisket plate the sauce was married to the meat and it was very tender and savory!!!! The customer service was awesome as well!!

My husband and I had the pleasure of dining here on Sunday and we both were extremely pleased! First, our server, Matt, was exceptional! He was without a doubt the most informative server that I have ever come across in my nearly 50 years of dining out. Matt explained to us about the smoker, the whiskey, the brisket, the different sauces, just everything! He was awesome! He even brought us out a sample of brisket and the sauces to try out to help us decide on what to order. The brisket was phenomenal and my husband went with ordering the fatty style brisket and added on the burnt ends. He shared, of course, and OMG! Heaven in your mouth! Best brisket I have ever eaten! Definitely order the fatty brisket as it will literally melt in your mouth! I ordered a rack of ribs and they were the best ribs that I have had since moving to NC three years ago, and we have tried many, many ribs down here! I shared as well and STILL brought home enough for us to have lunch the next day! The ribs were soooo good that you do not even need any sauce but I did still dip a few in because their sauces are delish too! I couldn't decide which sauce I liked better so Matt brought me all 4 on the side! How cool is that!!! For dessert we split a banana pudding and it was fantastic! The texture was more like a fluffy mousse and it was so creamy and yummy! Just thinking about it is making my mouth water! This please was off the hook fantastic and we will definitely make this our go-to barbecue place!
Immediate seating outside and a short wait for indoors.  Burnt ends were great and small portion is perfect size. Suggest to add a sausage for a few bucks more.
Always fabulous.   Best burnt ends. Best staff  always friendly and wonderful.        Can not recommend them enough
Great BBQ (pork and chicken) friendly staff, great service. Get there early if you want a table, they stay packed during lunch!!!

This Kansas city native and recent Austin Texas transplant has high hopes when it comes to BBQ.....and man, Midwood delivered! Best brisket I've ever had. Great beer selection. Good collard greens. My fiancé got the ribs and said they were great.  I got the grilled cheese sandwich and added pulled pork on it and was loving every bite. Can't wait to go back!

The food is amazing.  The staff at the bar today acted as if it was a burden to serve anyone.  It made me feel bad about being here.  I had a to go order and I ordered two glasses of wine, two meal and cheese dip.  I started eating my cheese dip at the bar while I waited to finish my wine.  Some of the chips were stale.  I advised the bartender, she said they are made fresh to order and walked off.  WHAT?  That maybe the case but some of the ones in my box are stale.  Just RUDE! I felt like me or my business was not wanted.  That is a bad feeling.
Great service and pretty good BBQ.

I'm a fan of Texas bbq, but when you're in North Carolina, you have to try a local favorite, especially when a local friend insists on you going there.   Midwood is different from a lot of the local Texas options.  For one thing, Midwood offers table service and serves their meat on a plate instead of butcher paper.    But the important thing is the food.  The brisket is excellent and would compete well in Texas.  The sauce is tasty and they offer a variety of sauces.  I also liked my fries and hush puppies.  If I had one gripe at all, it would be that the St. Louis style ribs would've benefited from a bit more time in the smoker.   On a final note, our service was excellent and truly embodied southern hospitality.    If you're going to eat bbq outside of Texas, Midwood is the place to eat it.  And I am now a convert to the cause of serving hush puppies with bbq.

Disappointed! I love Midwood and usually eat the location on Central Ave. which has never EVER disappointed me in my 6 years of living in charlotte and eating there. Went to the Ballantyne location and my Mac and Cheese was dry, my pull pork sandwich barely had any meat on it, the burnt ends were not as tasty! I give it 2 stars only because the baked beans were great! The Ballantyne location is nice and pleasant however if you want EXCELLENT food the real Midwood way go to the location on Central for the real smoked, southern, good taste of food! Ughh! So upset!

The best Midwood in Charlotte ! Always good food and great service even when you have a wait !!! Had a bad experience at the Ballantyne location but didn't stop me from going to my fav central location !!!!

WOW, WOW and WOW.  This is serious BBQ and one of my favorite places in the last couple of years.  First, to roll in at 930p and still find the food appearing and tasting as fresh as when it likely opened was a welcome surprise.  I got a platter with chopped pork, chopped chicken, ribs and brisket.  The serving was the smaller platter but it was all I could manage.  The meat was perfectly smoked with intense smoke, but not too much.  Moist, delicious and even better when dipped in the three sauces brought with the platter.  Pickled onions and hushpuppies along with the bbq slaw and bacon wrapped jalepenos rounded out my dinner.  Pretty reasonable price for a great meal in a nice, upscale environment.

Midwood is still the go to place for bringing your out-of-town guests to show them the great Queen City barbecue. And so I met my Minneapolis buddy here! Great service from our waitress, who kept the conversation going and kept the beers filled.  We split a plate of the pimento cheese fries. Plenty here for three, but we put a good dent in it. Lots of great cheese, good grilling that toasted the fries and melted the cheese all the way down.  For barbecue, my friend had the four meat sampler and enjoyed it. He said that the sausage was particularly tasty. I had the pulled pork, with mac & cheese. It did not need any extra sauce. The pork was chopped fine, which made it a little mushy. Next time, I'll go for the sliced brisket perhaps.  Overall, still great to visit and still great to bring your visitors.

I got well fed which consisted of 4 proteins and 2 sides. I chose the ribs, chopped pork, chopped chicken, and pork burnt ends. The ribs were pretty good. They could have been more tender but not bad. The chopped pork and chopped chicken were awesome. The pork burnt ends were really good... For my 2 sides I chose the collard greens and bacon wrapped jalapeños.. The collard greens were ok. The jalapeños were good. My server Parker was amazing! He was on top of everything even though he had a larger party and other tables.

I've been hearing a lot about this joint and managed to make it out for lunch on a Sunday afternoon.  I arrived just a little after noon and was able to park in the lot directly in front of the restaurant.  While there were a bunch of open tables outside, there was only two tables open inside.  I was able to snag an inside table (it's much easier reading a newspaper at a table as opposed to the bar) and began perusing the menu.  Jennifer came out to take my drink order and when she returned, I peppered her with questions about the menu.  Among other things, I discovered that there is more meat on the small plate, than there is on the sandwich.  I decided to go with the small plate with mac and cheese and the creamed corn as the sides.   Food was out in less than ten minutes.  The pork was wonderfully smokey and came with a small side of sauce (eastern-style).  On appearance, the hushpuppies looked more like tater tots.  Not that there's anything wrong with that, but.....it gave the impression that they were pre-fab.  They were almost too perfect.  And I have to admit that I wasn't a big fan of the mac and cheese.  It was not creamy enough for my liking.  With all that said, the creamed corn was outta sight!  There was a strong black pepper taste which I loved.  Service was fantastic.  When Jennifer found out that I didn't like the mac and cheese, she offered something else.  She was apologetic and returned within a minute with a side of the red slaw (which was terrific, by the way).  She was quick to refill my beverage and was very helpful answering my questions.  As has been mentioned earler, the cost is a little on the high side, but it was a lot of food, and I think it's worth it.  I will definitely be back for more!

I will forever love this place for what they did for me and my family.  I had probably about 40-50 people with me celebrating and Midwood got on the job and found sitting for us in 30min probably less, the manager was  serving us.  That happened last year 4/8/2016 and my family still till this day, no lie, not even joking like 4-5 people mentioned it again today,   awesome sauce, get the burnt ends!     Thanks,  C.

Great BBQ! Went twice, first time I had the brisket, second time burnt ends. Made sure to order a large portion, so I could have some for lunch the day after as well. Definitely a place to go if you're visiting Charlotte.

As far as I'm concerned this is the best bbq in Charlotte. The service is great and the food is impeccable!! They also have a great beer selection. Whenever we have friends in town this is one of our go to places.
Always delicious, always great service. Love the hushpuppies. Be sure to try the chopped salad and green goddess dressing. Yummm

The pulled pork grilled cheese is flat out AMAZING. The wings are also very VERY good. I cannot talk about anything else because I cannot NOT order these every time I go. lol. They have small crinkle cut french fries which is a surprising treat.  Parking isn't the great

Midwood Smokehouse has by far the best BBQ in Charlotte. My favorite is the small Carolina Pork Plate with a side of creamed corn. I will say that the cream corn recipe has changed recently and I don't like it as much as the old one. The old one had a really good pepper flavor and the new recipe is a little bland.   I went for a friend's birthday recently - we had a large group and some mild issues getting seated. The hostess seemed a little agitated when she took us outside to sit in the enclosed patio and we asked to be moved inside (I used to be a hostess and would have asked the party if they were okay with going outside before taking them out there and then turning around... but anyway).  Our server was really upbeat and attentive to our needs. He was great! I look forward to going back to Midwood.
Good but not e best. Ribs were my favorite even though everyone said to get the brisket. Service is excellent and supper friendly.  By all means go here, but not in my atop 3 list.
Love their smoked wings and brisket. Parking can be tricky during peak hours.

I know they JUST opened like yesterday, and I know they just literally got their liquor license today before they opened, but this was a meh experience. I ordered a Moscow Mule and there's no way there was any alcohol in it. I watched the bartender search for a pour spout, not find one, leave the unopened bottle at the end of the bar, pull down two more brand new unopened bottles of vodka and just leave them. I didn't watch the actual preparation of my drink but I definitely didn't taste the alcohol and all three bottles of vodka remained unopened, without pour spouts, and were clearly full bottles. I was also half way done with my entree before the second half of my companion's meal appeared. Guess the kitchen forgot? Pros though are that it's spacious and has a good layout, my food and half of my companion's appeared quickly, food was good, and their SC mustard sauce is pretty good, coming from a SC girl. I realize new openings and probably new staff come with hiccups, and this is right by me so of course I'll be back, next time I'll say something about my $9 cocktail though.
I love this place, I can't get brisket anywhere else and be happy.  The wings are amazing as well, and the cheese fries --- oh lawd!  Love Love Love

I'm an official regular, someone help me I'm addicted to Midwood Smokehouse.   I'm a HUGE Fan of the brisket . I love the option of  a lean plate, fatty, or both. (Both is great!)  Give me some bacon wrapped jalapenos as a side and I'm good to go! Or try the greens that will make you wanna slap yo momma.  Look for your drink and food specials when you walk in, written on the large glass mirror behind the bar. They have mug nights here where you can bring in a 40oz and get it filled for $4-6!  Great service as always, fast, friendly and knowledgeable. I look forward to coming back very very very soon!
Generous portions and flavorful well cooked meats. I had the chicken barbeque sandwich and it was overflowing! The slaws were nice as well and the sauces were delicious.
delicious but a bit pricy for bbq...im sure thats only because they have to keep up with the plaza midwood rent... great drinks great food great atmosphere! nom nom nom!!!

If I don't count the food truck I visited one day for lunch, then this is probably the best BBQ I had in a week of being in South Carolina (plus this one evening in Charlotte). I am sustained by eastern North Carolina BBQ (it's at the bottom of my personal Maslow's hierarchy, just below wifi)  so I had to try even though I know this isn't that part of the country.  We started with pimento cheese fries, because, well, pimento cheese fries. These were broiled before being served, and they were totally delicious. Zero complaints here - nice browned cheese (and plenty of it) and nice crisp fries. Good stuff.  Then we split the burnt ends and the chopped pork. Burnt ends were almost like...ham cubes, I've never had burnt ends in this kind of a regular shape. But they were in a good sauce, even if my normal preference isn't sweet BBQ sauce, and they were tender and tasty. So I'm not going to complain about those. And the chopped pork was decent - reasonable amount of smoke if not a bit dry, but I fixed the dry problem with their vinegar sauce, which I liked. For sides, we went with collards and cole slaw, both of which were fine. Greens were trending a bit sweet, but that's OK, without a ton of garlic. Slaw was fairly basic, nothing really to write home about.  So, tons of good reviews here, I feel like I am bucking the trend. It's not bad, it's just not exceptional. Our service was good, the price was totally reasonable, and the food was fine...I just have to believe there are better options. Alas, it was a Sunday night and several of the more hole in the wall places with photos of food that made my mouth water were closed.

Just had the Q at the Midwood. Outstanding. As it was my first time I went with the combo platter to sample various meats. Ribs, pork, brisket, and sausage were my choices. All were terrific. Sauces were good but nothing special. The pickled onions were unusual but the perfect change up between the meats. Mac and cheese was exceptional.  I'm stuffed.   I went early, 5:00 PM on a Saturday after reading how packed it gets. Glad I did.  By the time I left a hour and change later it was jammed.   Sat at the bar and had terrific service from Chad the bartender. Thanks Chad.   Bottom line:  I'll be back.  As often as I can.

We ordered takeout from here a while back, ordered a large BBQ chicken plate for $12 with mac and cheese and BBQ baked beans as out 2 sides. Ordering was easy, we actually ordered about 30 minutes before closing but whoever answered the phone was extremely understanding and polite. He said the plate would take about 20 minutes to make. We ended up picking up our food 10 minutes after close, they were still very pleasant about it. We brought our boxes home to find a crazy amount of BBQ chicken, score! It was delicious too, the South Carolina Mustard sauce it is tossed it is delish! There was so much, that we used the left overs to make BBQ chicken sandwiches the next day. I wasn't a huge fan of the mac and cheese, it was kinda dry, but I blame myself for ordering so late. I assume it was the last batch of the day. Will have to try it fresh, I'm sure it won't disappoint. The hush puppies were also good as well, love the jalapeno addition, I wish we were given more lol. The large BBQ chicken plate really was a large, the two of us couldn't even finish it in one sitting.   Although, they really need to make it clear that there is red meat in the bbq beans. I was a little disappointed I couldn't eat them. But, we will be back for a sit down because the rest of the food was soo damn good! The salmon entree sounds soooo good. Cheers!

This is my go-to spot in Charlotte. Constantly in here for dinner or take/out. I am a big fan of their chicken and beef, never been crazy about their pork. Highly recommend the Dixie Chicken Salad with the chipotle ranch and also the Burnt ends with BBQ baked beans and mac and cheese.

WOW WOW WOW.  We travel a lot and we are huge fans of BBQ.  We frequently visit our local BBQ place in New York and I think we found one that takes the mark.  This place is a wonderful local place with excellent food and great service.  We went on a Sunday during church hours so we had no wait (go before 1pm for lunch).    I ordered the brisket plate which came with your choice of lean, fat, or both types of brisket.  Me being the meat lover, I went for both types.  The dish also included typical southern sides, and hush puppies.  The atmosphere was wonderful and the kitchen was pumping the smell into the dining room making you hungrier.  When the food came, I could not wait to sink my teeth into it.  The fat on the brisket melted in your mouth.  I used the back end of the knife and fell apart so beautifully.  Very attentive staff and wonderful food and prices definitely puts this place on the top of our list.  Only one caveat (they had no control over) was that parking was EXTREMLY limited.  They share a 30 car parking lot with 2 other businesses.  They also had street parking which was hard to find.

recommended by a true bbq lover, we stopped in for dinner recently on a tuesday night. they were so nice, offered us a tour of their smoker when we finished dining, clearly realizing that we werent from the area. we came and had the brisket, burnt ends, sausage, ribs, chicken, avocado salad - and were not disappointed. they were so hospitable the entire time, checking in on us occassioally. we opted to dine out right by the entrance since it was a really nice evening. started to regret it as the meal ended as we all started to feel like we were being attacked by mosquitoes, although we didnt actually see any. definitely glad we chose to come here versus the bbq near our hotel.

First dinner in Charlotte, NC and boy was it filling! Ordered the small burnt ends and the large beef brisket. Loved the burnt ends a bit more... please see my amazing photos ;)  Dessert: banana pudding (5/5)  The photo composition though.

Yummy bbq with yummy sides. Straight forward and simple. They have been so successful they expanded not long after opening, doubling the size of their space. Wait staff is good about checking the table and I've never had any real issues with my food, it never takes long! My whole family enjoys midwood!

The service was very friendly but the food was just at par. I won't rush back to this place but it was a good bbq fix with all the different styles of sauce at the ready. The beer list is overwhelming but the staff is really knowledgeable about the full list. My boyfriend and I split the sharing size of the pick 4 meats and 2 sides (bacon wrapped jalapenos were delicious) and we're both big eaters and we had leftovers, the portion size was huge. Ribs were great, chopped pork was also pretty good but the brisket and sausage could use a bit of work. Worth another try when we're really craving BBQ.

Gotta say, Midwood Smokehouse was pretty tasty--coming from a girl raised on Memphis style BBQ.  Everything was delicious.  I had the pulled pork plate, an utterly huge portion for a reasonable price (choice of meat, two sides, and hush puppies). The fries were lightly spicy and cut very thin, fried to a perfect crisp.  I enjoyed my one hush puppy.  It had a slight kick and was nice and crunchy with a rich cornmeal flavor.  The best part was definitely the Mac and cheese.  The noodles were soft and cooked perfectly and the cheese struck the perfect balance between gooey parts and semi-solid parts.  The BBQ itself almost paled in comparison to the sides, but it was quite good with a nice smoky flavor.  I will say that I preferred the more southern style sweet sauce than the vinegar based sauce, and I wish the pork had been a little more moist without having to add sauce.  The only disappointment at Midwood was the banana pudding, which I felt had too much whipped cream and not enough bananas, vanilla wafers, or, well, pudding.   The decor is super cute--we now sometimes play trivia at home with the name "Praise the Lard"--and the service was good.  Midwood is worth a visit for sure!

Some of the best BBQ you can find in Charlotte. I always get the Beef Brisket, the small plate, with sweet potato fries and almost am never able to finish it with all the food. The jalapeño bacon appetizer is incredible and is also a must try. The restaurant also has a great selection of craft beers on tap from the area.  Atmosphere is great and not too loud for large groups. If it's nice out, try and find a spot on their outside patio.

The best bbq in Charlotte! The platters and stock yard tacos are my favorite! It gets pretty crowded so come early. The service is  pretty good, every time I've been there I've seen the manager walk around and ask people how the service was.

This is my most favorite BBQ place in the world.  Their ribs are amazing and you must order the Burnt Ends. One of the last places that actually smoke their own meats on premise.   And the chicken and smoked sausage is among my favorites too!
Great BBQ place. Service was fast and food was delicious. I had the pork burnt ends and my husband had a philly cheese sandwich that he loved. Craft beer was yummy as well.

This location used to be a Smoke Modern BBQ, but has now reopened to be Midwood.   I never noticed how dark and dreary Smoke used to be. When we walked in to try out Midwood, our first thoughts were"wow it's so bright and spacious in here!"   The service was just wonderful. Our waitress was so friendly and explained the new features of this place compared to before. A man (manager?) came by and asked if we were enjoying everything.   The meat was fresh, smoky, but clean, and flavorful. The sauces were delicious, and so were the sides.  I'm not a huge bbq fan, nor do I ever crave it, but if it happens, I'll be sure to come back here!

We ordered 5 items on the menu tonight.  The Midwood Chopped salad was as you'd expect.  Nice mixture of veggies.... All good.  We also got the Hogapeño dip which was surprisingly not hot at all... But good.  Loved the pickled veggies!  They had some kick.  Our favorite were two tacos... The brisket and chicken.  Both very flavorful and unique.  Cameron was our rockstar server.... Great, great guy.  We finished up with the cookie pie.  YUM!!  Great place.  Service was awesome.  Food was delicious and reasonable.  Loved Midwood BBQ.

A. was my waitress, she was menu-intellegent, friendly, responsive, and customer conscious. I had the small tossed salad (big and yummy) BBQ Chicken with smoked veggies (very yummy). I will definitely be back next visit, and would recommend.

I ate here a few weeks ago. After moving back South, I've been looking for a good BBQ spot and was not disappointed. I had the Carolina Pork BBQ plate with bacon wrapped jalapeños and mac & cheese. Everything was delicious and the service was great.

So last night I volunteered for the CF Foundation at the Brewer's Ball and was fortunate enough to meet some of the staff from Midwood Steakhouse  and indulge in delectable tastings.   The brisket was butter -- and that was the word floating about all night at the Brewer's Ball. So finally when I took a break I b-lined it over to their table.   The brisket was amazing, falling off your fork amazing.  The juices ran clear and the outside was perfectly seasoned. They also paired the brisket with a sweet vinegar and sweet onion mixture - wow that was truly amazing as well. Being on a carb free diet I left the bun behind and opted for a beer -- my carb cheat!   I'm truly excited to get my family into this establishment so that I can try their other offerings. And hopefully to see the staff again!   Hey Amy -- it was a pleasure meeting you last night!

I feel bad having to give Midwood a 1 Star, but they definitely earned it for my dinner on Friday. They're doing a baby back ribs special and it was horrendous. The meat smelled foul and was gray (over cooked?)... it tasted like it may have been microwaved at one point, but I'm not sure. I have no idea what would explain the smell and taste of the meat, but I just know it was gross. I tried two ribs (I hoped the first was a fluke, but it wasn't) and ate the side of cornbread.   Service was great, but hard to make up for the gross meat. Our waitress asked if we wanted to box it up, and was probably confused as to why the plate was relatively full.   I will say that my wife did enjoy her dinner, but was likewise grossed out by mine.  It'll be a while until we go back... at least until this special is over.

Holy cow. Burnt ends and BBQ baked beans will absolutely set you free. Only giving 4 stars because some of the meat was a little dry. But overall, this is some DELICIOUS food. I'm here on business, and will absolutely come here again the next time in town. Keisha was my server, and she was the bomb! So friendly and helpful.  Go here y'all!

Delicious!  We had the pimento fries with beef brisket and jalapeños with bacon n cheese as appetizers.  Everything was perfect and flavorful.  Had the combo with mac n cheese and greens.  Taste homemade as if grandma was in the kitchen cooking it herself.  Manager was very personable and meeting guests.  Waitress was as sweet as pie, answered all our questions and very patient as we were first time guests.  Great recommendations.  Will definitely be back.

Wow! Had the Carolina Pork with a side of the smoked sausage and Mac n cheese. It was amazing! Tender and oh so flavorful! Had the hot BBQ Sauce on Iran's had the perfect balance of heat and bbq sweetness. Highly highly recommend, a must if your in Carolina!

Heard a lot about this place. When.you walk in the smell is heavenly. The brisket is good try the moist or the burnt ends. The sides collards and Mac n cheese very good. Hush puppies were great! The beer tap was not working out of CO2  that night.  But they carry several local beers to chose from. Good food overall.

This is one of the best BBQ spots in Charlotte that I've found so far! The wings are out of this world, they don't even need sauce. We tried almost everything--the wings, half chicken, ribs, and burnt ends. The burnt ends were my favorite, I definitely recommend. Everything was cooked perfectly.  The hushpuppies are a great addition to every plate, and for sides we loved the creamed corn and mac and cheese.   Huge drink selection from the bar--and sitting at the bar to eat is a great option when it's super busy.
Just WOW!!!!  Lots of flavors. Great Que, Brew, and Bourbon. Service was excellent too. We'll be back.

I am from the North, so I never really had good BBQ until moving down to NC. I tried a few BBQ places down here and they were all great, but somehow Midwood Smokehouse managed to separate itself.  Here is why: Fatty Brisket.....It sounds odd (or maybe it doesn't if you are from the South), but it was awesome.  It melted in your mouth. Everything else was good, but this was the All-Star.  Service was great, too.  Only downside is that the restaurant is a little bit cramped, so it fills up quickly.
Great brisket.  If you're a transplant you're probably like the pork, but if you're a Carolina boy like me, drive to Lexington.

There is probably nothing I can say that hasn't already been said about Midwood Smokehouse. Either I've been out of Texas too long, or this truly is good southern BBQ! Brisket, burnt ends, BBQ queso, bacon wrapped jalapeños, pimento cheese - everything I've tried is fantastic! Be prepared to wait because this place is always crowded.
