Excellent value for money in this friendly BBQ joint. It was packed out for our weekday lunch, which is always a good sign. The food took a while to come out but with orders for eight people that's totally forgivable.  The pulled chicken had decent texture but not a great deal of smoke flavor to it - the SC-style mustard sauce had a real acidic hit to it that worked nicely with the meat. BBQ beans were on the sweet side but well-made and packed with flavor. Hush puppies and pickled onions on the side were fine. $8 for this.  I will happily go back and sample more of their meats and sauce styles - they also have 'traditional' BBQ sauce, East NC vinegar-based sauce, and some habanero effort.  This place came highly recommended by locals and I can understand why. Very impressive at a low price point.

Never had even a mediocre item here.  Everything is amazing, I order far too much because it is even better heated up the next day.  Fall off the bone ribs, great brisket, tons of excellent sides. Lovely.   The expansion makes it a lot easier to get in though doesn't have as much charm as the original section. Could use a few more taps but I am nit-picking.  I eat here just about every other week and take every out of town visitor here and they love it.
Just open, truly spectacular barbecue, I can't wait to come back, try on Thursday night that is half-price bottles of wine yahoo!

Sitting outside. With our dog eating a "pig out" platter. Life can't get any better! Excellent BBQ! Bacon wrapped jalapeños are phenomenal! Sweet potato fries crisped to perfection. Brisket melting in mouth...

Best ribs I've ever had. Friendliest waitress I've ever had. My group received free brisket queso because they accidentally made too much or the wrong thing for another customer and they handed it to us the second we sat down. There was some forgetfulness from the waitress, but she was so bloody thoughtful and nice that a simple reminder was enough to get the beer and sauce we ordered. One of the best meals I've had.

This place is okay. As two people that grew up in the Texas Panhandle, my husband and I definitely know our barbecue.  I started off with a Bloody Mary, which was actually one of the best ones I've had! Like a classy lady, I licked off the entire glass's rim which was dipped in a delicious BBQ rub. We also shared the queso with pork - which was very good but we quickly ran out of chips. I'm a total brat when it comes to queso and chips when they don't give you enough chips to finish the appetizer.  The waitress was MIA for quite awhile, so we still had 3/4 left without chips and it went cold. That's a big no no in Texas.   I got the Carolina pork and Mac n cheese - which I would give 4 stars. It wasn't the best I had, but it was very good. My husband got the fatty brisket, which seemed "wet" versus moist - we both were NOT impressed. His potato fries weren't great either.
The salads, brisket, sides, and cue are outstanding! Two out of three rib orders very dry. Recommend other menu items instead of the ribs.

My husband and his work peeps always went to downtown Charlotte..well, now that I've shown them Midwood Smokehouse...they won't be going downtown for a while! Love the atmosphere, decor and ambiance of the place; the owner came by to check on us. Entire staff was so friendly! Every bite we had was great, thanks Yelpers! The waitress improvised a "little bit of everything" platter for the 3 of us, and I have to say I loved the mac n chz, coleslaw and all of the meats. The brisket was a bit more fatty than I am used to here in Texas, but the flavor was wonderful. I am not a sausage person, but those bacon wrapped jalapenos stuffed with "conglomerate meat", as I call it..were very good! Fried pickles hot and crispy; perfect partner for a drink! The men had beer, but I had a special "Tea" they made (its on the drink menu), and loved it.  We will Definitely be back to Midwood Smokehouse and enjoyed sitting outdoors.  This entire neighborhood is full of cool bars and places to eat.!

Cute, friendly atmosphere with AWESOME food. I had the Carolina BBQ chicken sand which with the stuffed jalapenos wrapped in bacon. Can't go wrong! I will go back and utilize the patio and corn hole games next time!

I'm not a carnivore who likes to eat in mass quantities btw but this place isn't half bad. I ordered the sausage plate and picked from my man's beef brisket -- good stuff. We finished the plate with no problems. The small plate was perfect . . . scared to see what the large is. The collard greens were not bad either. The little tater tott things were tastey.

Pretty decent barbeque!  I had a great pear cider with my meal.  My husband and kids started with the bacon wrapped jalepano peppers and they were gone pretty quickly so I am guessing they were pretty good.  We got a combo platter to split at our table so we could try a little of everything.  The brisket was awesome and the pork was pretty decent too.  The pulled chicken tasted a little dry and I didn't really love the ribs...but am not generally a fan of Saint Louis style ribs.  The sides we got (fries and creamed corn) were good too.  We shared a peach cobbler to end the meal with which was okay.  Service was great.  They have outdoor seating as well...if only I could get my hisband to enjoy sitting outside as well...that would be perfect.

One of the best places in Charlotte to get BBQ.  Love the hush puppies.  Because it's so popular, there is usually a wait, and parking is a beast.  However, those are minor issues for the awesome food!

Just visited this gem last night with my family and there's a 150% chance that we'll be back! My mom heard about Midwood on one of those cooking shows that she watches so she wanted to check it out. Needless to say, 2 years passed and we still hadn't even looked the place up yet. We finally committed to coming yesterday and were met with the most unimaginable aroma of woodchips and spices- we were outside waiting and I just couldn't wait to get my hand on some of this food!  We had the smoked wings for an appetizer and I have to say that those were the best wings I've had in Charlotte. We ordered our sauces on the side and I'm not very sure what all of them were but my favorite was the habanero. I had the Carolina pork plate with smoked vegetables and I honestly kicked myself for not ordering the large plate. The pork was so moist and seasoned to freaking perfection. The pickled onions paired with the meat perfectly and the hush puppies were fresh.  My mom ordered the rib special that's going on this week and she said that she wished she had ordered the whole rack instead of half! My father had the brisket and had no complaints (which is a VERY good thing).  My husband had the Cuban and he said it was really good. It was his first time having a Cuban so he didn't really have anything to gauge it on but it was really good from what I tasted. It's pretty safe to say that from a first experience this tasty, Midwood is definitely going to become a family staple for us.

I would say over all our lunch experience was just was okay.  Midwood Smokehouse smells great, but you leave smelling like smoked meat all day.  Service was outstanding--and that is a big plus for us.   The food was pretty good/okay, certainly not what I expected.  I had the  BBQ sandwich, it was nothing special.  you can certainly find better BBQ in Charlotte -- no matter your "style" preference.   As a side, I had the bacon wrapped jalapenos,  definitely the highlight of my Midwood Smokehouse experience.  My husband had the fried bologna sandwich with the smoked veggies.  The smoked veggies had no taste of veggies and only tasted of smoke.  He was not a fan of his sandwich, because the cheese overtook the bologna.    The Midwood Smokehouse has fixed alot of the problems the former tenant had in regards to usage of space. The bar is no longer awkward and the set up is very spacious.   I would go back, but will wait a while for them to come into their own.  Maybe with a little time this place can be another great eatery in Plaza-Midwood.
Great food, had the pulled pork and "the Texas special". My 6 year old daughter loved both, as did my wife and I. Service needs a little work.

Jeanette was an awesome waitress. So attentive and you could tell she was a hard worker! On top of that, you could tell the team that worked Friday night on 3/23 worked well together and helped each other out. As someone that has worked in the food service industry for a while, this speaks a lot about how well a restaurant is functioning. The food was good and the portions were excellent- but the service is what made our visit outstanding.

A while back my wife went to Kansas City to visit relatives, and while she was out of town, I decided to try the Midwood Smokehouse for dinner, based on what I've seen in reviews.  This was the new location behind the Park Road Shopping Center.  I'm a big fan of burnt ends, and when I'm in Kansas City I always get them from one of the many excellent BBQ joints in Missouri.  As I've eaten so much BBQ pork over the years brisket is nice change of pace. (BTW the best chopped pork is at Wilbur's in Goldsboro).  The brisket had so much salt it was almost inedible.  I'd take a bite then drink some water.  After every bite I would have to drink some water.  The manager came by and asked me how everything was, and even though I don't usually complain, I did state it was over salted.  He offered banana pudding but I declined.  He then offered to reduce the price by half, which I accepted.  He did go on to say, that this being a new location, that the kitchen may not be up to speed on cooking.  North Carolina is not known for brisket or burnt ends, and this was an understatement.  The Smoke Pit in Concord does a fairly decent job on burnt ends but I'll have to pass on the Midwood Smokehouse version if I should ever return.  Somehow I've not been chomping at the bit to return.

Pros: Good music on radio.They played Todd Rundgren during dinner  Lots of server attention  Decent selection of draft beer  Pulled pork was good  Corn side was good  Portions were large  Cons,  Hush puppies were unbeatable.Awful  Beef brisket was waaaay too salty  Mac and cheese was a fried puck with cheese sauce   Tiny serving of vinegar sauce  Expensive$24 for two meat platter with one beer.NYC prices

Why do BBQ joints think that salty and spicy equals flavor.  Let the wood do the work.  We ordered the sample platter and it was disappointing to say the least. The rub used on the ribs was too spicy and had the consistency of sawdust. The fatty Brisket was just fat. The pulled pork was sautéed in cayenne pepper and habanero as well as some kind of mystery spice. (It may have been hippie strength pepper spray). The management seemed very defensive when we tried to ask questions.  The servers seemed ok. All in all we won't be going back since there are many truly good BBQ places around and we don't have to lower our standards by going to Midwood Smokehouse.

I've been reading yelp reviews saying this was the best BBQ in Charlotte. I can say they didn't disappoint. We went during a relatively off time I thought, but it was still packed out. We had to wait about 15 minutes to get a table (not bad). I got the pulled port plate which was probably the best I've ever had. Sometimes you get this and it has a lot of fat in it. Not this one. Very lean, very tasty. My wife got the brisket, which was excellent also. We also grabbed the bacon wrapped jalepeno's as a appetizer. These things are amazing. We had fried pickles also, which were good, but those Jalapeno's went first. I would say, at this point, the new standard for BBQ has been set.
Really good food here!  Well worth the wait on a weekend.  I enjoy the outdoor area where it's a little quieter.  The service has always been attentive.

No place can beat this place when it comes to BBQ and ribs. When I come, I usually get the Well Fed combo platter (sometimes Pig Out when really hungry) and the 4 proteins I choose are Carolina chopped pork, Saint Louis style pork ribs, beef brisket, and pulled chicken BBQ. It comes with hushpuppies and two sides (I absolutely love their cream corn hands down). The BBQ sauce there is absolutely delicious and I can't get enough of it. Service is great and efficient. It doesn't take us long to order because we get the same thing and the wait is relatively short. I definitely recommend everyone to download their reservation app to reserve a table rather than driving there and waiting till your table is ready. Parking is very limited that sometimes you might have to park at the shopping village lot across the street if it's filled. Servers are very friendly and helpful. This place gets a lot of business, especially since it's not that far from uptown and everyone enjoys walking around the Plaza Midwood location.

First time ate here I had the chicken and did not like it. But the 2nd time I had the brisket and my opinion went up 3-4 points! Omg, it is the best! Lean, flavor packed, not too salty or spicy, all around perfect! The best stomach-full up meal is that with mac & cheese, which is almost as delicious. Good hush puppies too, they give you just enough so you don't get full on them. Their sauces are pretty spicy, but I personally did not need them for my food. The restaurant is big and gets crowded and there can be a wait. But they're never long. And the food is worth it!

I can't believe I never tried this place when I lived in Charlotte! I'm so glad I bookmared Midwood to try out on a recent return visit to Queen City. My friend and I were visiting and I was showing her a true southern time.,, Meaning lots of BBQ of course. I thought this place would be a great fit to see the funky/cool plaza scene and eat some great food! Dannngggg (in true southern fashion)- this place is awesome!  We sat outside and enjoyed the afternoon, ordered some sweet tea. It's insanely sweet, I recommend getting half & half. (sweet and unsweetened). Our waiter was helpful and made some good recommendations. The pulled pork sandwich was southern goodness at it's finest. We also ordered the works- sweet potato fries, hush puppies, mac and cheese and grilled veggies! Everything was so delicious! The mac & cheese was out of this world. To make it even better, our meal averaged 10 bucks a person. Doesn't get better than that.... parking can be tough just fyi.

The 1930 Cheesesteak is not your ordinary cheesesteak. It was so much more, using brisket as the meat and white cheddar. I might have to come back just for that! The sweet potato fries were on point, as well. The house sauce was a pleasant surprise, as well - I'm not usually a sweet sauce person, but it had just enough tang to win me over. Fun atmosphere, too, and way bigger than it looks from the outside. Might have to chill at the bar, next time.

I went around 1:30 near the end of the Lunch Rush. I was greeted with a smile and immediately seated. I admit I was a bit rude as I was on my cell phone. However, the waitress handled it nicely and checked on me until I was ready. She made recommendations & answered any questions that I had. I ordered the Small plate of Chicken BBQ with Mac & Cheese. It came with Hush Puppies & Pickled Onions. I also ordered a side of Texas Toast. The chicken was really good. It was Tender & Flavorful without too much sauce. The Mac & Cheese was also surprisingly good for a restaurant. It was creamy and the top was layered with real cheese and they used seasoning/salt lol. A lot of restaurant Mac & Cheese is bland so I appreciate that. Hush Puppies were good, your average hush puppy. I also enjoyed the pickled onions. I can't really explain them but they were good. I ended up mixing them into my chicken. The Texas Toast was OK. I ordered it thinking I would need something to put my chicken on but I could have went without. It was buttered and toasted to a crisp (Not hard). I prefer my Texas toast to be a bit more soft. But it still wasn't bad. Decor wise it was ok. I'm not one to really notice the decor unless something about it bothers me. The only complaint I have is the booths are high with no foot rest. I felt like all the blood in my legs was rushing to my feet and got uncomfortable so I boxed most of my food to eat later. They do have a few tables but not many. I will be giving this place another try. I'd like to try the ribs, they looked delicious!

It has been quite some time since I've found a place for BBQ - of course I haven't really been craving it in a while either.  I had driven by this place countless times (usually on my way to the other great restaurants in the area) but I am glad I finally made a stop in to experience it.  I was super early to meet my friend, so I just hung out at the bar and took advantage of their drink specials.  The bartender(s) were super nice and quick and the bar did fill up rather quickly around dinner time.  Take out orders are also handled/processed at the bar so they got super super busy.  It was nice to see that the bar can multi-task without losing any composure.  When my friend did finally arrive, we ended up sitting at a bar instead of getting a table so I didn't have to close out or anything, but it seems like a lot of people have a drink at the bar and then go have their meal in the dinning room when their party arrives.  We ended up getting a smattering of BBQ... the "Pig Out" plate that included:  Pulled Pork, BBQ Chicken, Ribs, and their brisket (Oh! and two sides) - went with the mac and cheese and bacon wrapped jalapenos.  The brisket was melt-in-your-mouth and the bbq was super tasty and everything I had dreamed it should be.  This is my new go-to BBQ place based on my first visit.  Judging my the constant stream of patrons coming through the doors... looks like I may have joined everyone else as well (just a bit late).

Three words alone makes this place worth a 4-star review:  Bacon wrapped Jalapenos.   These are the best appetizer and side ever known to man.  Just the right amount of heat and then what isn't good with bacon?  Aside from that, I came here for the ribs which came recommended and they did not disappoint.  They were tender and sauced.  You could get them dry as well but I prefer mine wet.  Everything else on the sampler platter was ok.  The pork was decent but not one of my favorites around town and the chicken was a little dry.  The mac n cheese is one of the better ones around town.  They have local beer specials on Mondays and other specials the rest of the week.  Service wise, they are decent although nothing really stands out with the service.
Good food very good service. . The restaurant was busy but we were able to take are time and injoy are meal with out being rushed
I mean, this is really REALLY good BBQ. I don't know what else to say about that.  I had a lunch special here once with a cheerwine-based sauce on wings. WHO DOES THAT? ugh. So good.

Beef brisket is on point, opted for both (fatty & lean), very tender and has the smokey taste to it. 8oz plate portion with one side is more than enough including the hushpuppies to fill you up.  Sweet potato fries were the best I've had in Charlotte, on the crispy side with sea salt on top were great! The beer list is diverse and the prices are very fair

Got the combo platter and the ribs were the best I've tasted in the six years we have lived in the Charlotte area!  Sausage and brisket were pretty good, but coming from Texas it was not quite up to that five star level.  Will absolutely go back again for sure!

Definitely some of my favorite BBQ in the Queen City.  As others have said, this is definitely a place that you would want to bring out of towners to.  Food I love:  *Brisket - combo of lean and fatty. Not too smokey, seasoned perfectly, tender and delicious. *Bacon wrapped jalapenos - these are the business and a must for me every time I eat here. The saltiness and smokiness from the bacon is a perfect combination with these jalapenos. Not fried and cooked to perfection. *Collards - seasoned very nice, tender and made in house.  *Smoked Wings - I read another review where it says they are pink in the middle but these are smoked wings and will be pinkish due to the cooking process. Do not let this deter you from their deliciousness. *Salmon - just as good as the brisket, ask for at least medium.  *Mac and cheese - won't make you slap your momma but don't sleep on it. It is quite cheesy and tasty.  I won't go anywhere else for brisket. Midwood has converted me.

Top spot for Barbecue in the Queen City.  Hands down probably one of the best barbecue in the area. Let's just jump into the food since it is well deserving of the 5 stars.   I ordered the beef brisket that was cooked to near perfection. It was all the juices and literally melted in your mouth. The brisket was not dry and carried a mild smoke flavored. The brisket had a nice smoked ring on the meat. My sides included baked beans and smoked veggies which were nicely prepared. The bake beans were prepared with a nice balance of spice, sweetness and smokiness. The veggies had a nice smokey flavor but still were crunchy and fresh.   My wife ordered the half of chicken and ribs (large portion)!! The chicken was tender and carried a nice smoked flavor (well balance). The ribs seemed to be amazing since she left no visible signs of the once ribs.   The server did a great job being on top of everything and made up for our food being late (free hushpuppies).   But there is one small suggestion that we would like to make; change of ambiance. This involves a lighter dinning room area (more light to dark) and patio area that can provide some shade (yes I know its the south and get over it, but it would have been nice for shade.)   However, the food was overall to epic to give a rating lower than a 4 star.   Will be back.
Our service was top notch!!! Beers were delicious as was the nachos and the pig out!!! Couldn't eat it all so we ordered desserts to go also..definitely will be back!! Damn good bbq for date night!!!
Visited Charlotte back in June, my favorite meal of the weekend and I had some pretty good ones. The brisket entree I had was fantastic

Went to midwood last night.  Very busy.  I had the beef brisket, beans and BBQ slaw.  Brisket and slaw was good but the beans let a lot to be desired.  My wife had the BBQ pork and greens.  She liked the greens a lot but the pork was way overlooked, dry and way to salty.  They could do a lot better job.  She wishes she had got a vegetable plate instead.

Midwood Smokehouse is one of my favorite places to eat barbecue and I personally think it's one of the best in the Charlotte area. Not only are the meats and sauces very flavorful, but the portions are very good, the prices reasonable and the service staff has always been attentive. Of course, there are many other things to eat besides barbecue, but let's face it, that's what everyone comes here for. The other dishes are great as well, sandwiches, salads etc but the barbecue is awesome and that's what's going to bring you back.

My wife and I gave this place a try way back when it first opened and we thought it was terrible and haven't been back since.  Last night we were in Plaza Midwood with family who wanted BBQ so we decided to give it another shot. WOW, you've come a long way Midwood Smoke House!!  There were 4 of us and everyone was very pleased with their dinners which included shredded chicken, salad with pulled pork, smoked wings and the burnt ends plate.   The shredded chicken was good but this was the least impressive meal of the bunch. It lacked smoke flavor and almost had a 'watered down' taste. The burnt ends dinner was excellent. The meat has a good smoke flavor, it was moist and tender to the point you could cut it with a fork. I did however think that for an $18.50 dinner the meat portion was a little on the small side. The smoked wings were very good, cooked perfect.  The salad with pulled pork was large and although I didn't try it I was told it was excellent as well.   The sides, I was able to try the mac and cheese, greens and BBQ beans. Mac and cheese is on point. It is moist and has a great flavor unlike at some places were it dries out and has a bland taste. The collard greens were really good, not to salty as they can be from time to time and had a nice amount of meat mixed in. The BBQ beans were a hit as well.   If you're like us and tried this place a while ago and weren't happy it is definitely worth a second try, they seem to have come into their own and it's pretty dam good now.

If you just came for the sausage it'll be totally worth it. A small plate comes out to about $19 for one meat and the sausage and hush puppies and one side. Kind of pricey imo but the service was great and quick. I sat at the bar and watched the constant flow of to go orders.  Let's go back to the sausage though- when you bite into that warm weenie the cheese exploded out ! I don't know if they change the flavors of their sausage but A+. Server said burnt ends and brisket was the most popular stuff. Brisket came lean, mixed and fatty. I got mixed- very tasty. I think it'll be more worth it if I got a plate with more meats. There seems to be a decent amount of street parking.

This place is a solid 4. I have eaten here many times when in Charlotte for business.  The sides are OK, the beans are my favorite.  Mac n cheese is mediocre and the smoked vegetables are not that great.  Best meat here is the ribs, which can come with either dry rub or wet sauce.  I usually get the dry rubbed ribs and dip them in BBQ sauce separately.  The burnt ends were average.  The pulled pork was OK, nothing special.    I did come here once on a Tuesday at ~7PM and they were out of ribs, but that has only happened once.  Beer selection is decent and prices are good.  Overall a good eat and you know what you are going to get. I'll be back.

For the longest time, my wife and I would trek to the original Midwood in Plaza-Midwood and on every visit, make the case to the manager on duty for a Lake Norman location.  Well, they've been open for a while now in Birkdale Village and all I can say is Hooray!  Near as we can tell, same great cue, same great service, whiskey collection, cocktails, etc, etc.  Having them so close has also helped me expand my ordering to things beyond the barbecue since I know I can get that without the previous commute.  I've used that to try things like the Cuban sandwich, both burgers on the menu, the cheese steak, the tacos and the chopped salad (Hint, the small chopped salad is PLENTY for one) and all that I have tried has been really good.  They are also an excellent takeout option with easy online ordering and pick up at the bar. Finally, if you're really feeling like a sloth or maybe want cue but realized it's Friday night and you may have already had one too many as you try to erase the pain of the ole 9 to 5... Door Dash delivery can hook you up!

Second visit and it was every bit as good as the first.  Went with my wife and our neighbor and had another meal of excellent barbecue, cold drinks and on point service.  This time I opted for a combo platter which I believe was a new option on the menu.  Four meats and two sides served in either a "Well Fed" or "Pig Out" portion.  Trust me, the well fed version is PLENTY!  Got pulled pork, St. Louis style ribs and double beef brisket since they were out of the smoked sausage.  It was all wonderful.  Smokey, moist with nice bark on the pork and the brisket.  The ribs were fall off the bone and just delicious.  It really is a lot of food.  Ended up taking some of all of it home so, I can't imagine what the pig out portion is like.  My wife and friend split the large pulled chicken plate and again, way more than they could eat.  The chicken is moist and served mixed up with the Smokehouse's slightly sweet mustard sauce.  For sides we shared fries, coleslaw and creamed corn and they were all delish as well.  I had a couple $1.50 PBR drafts and the girls had margaritas which they dubbed, "best I've had in a long while".  It will be doubtful I will get my wife to any other barbecue place after this experience as she dubbed it, best barbecue she's had since we moved to Charlotte in 2002.

The food - you just want you be rolled out of there. Meat meat and more meat. Comfort comfort and more comfort. Greens, Mac and cheese and tender meat. Workout and skip a meal before going. However they will run out of things like ribs... so go early. That can be frustrating but it is fresh and from local suppliers.  I was so full I cant recall having cocktails but BBQ is best with beer anyway!

Delicious delicious delicious!! Cool diverse spot we decided to checkout since the reviews were so good. We ordered the 4 meat sharable platter which had brisket, pulled pork, ribs and brisket pieces? I forget what they were called but they were the ends of the brisket with extra yumminess. The sides! OMG. The mac n cheese, the baked beans and the hush puppies were out of this world! Whenever I visit NC again, I will definitely be back!
Great brisket, excellent service!!! Went as family celebration.  Food was the best!  Service was excellent wish we had a restaurant near home.  Loved it!

We started out with the pulled pork queso which was friggin delicious. My wife had the pulled pork with baked beans and cream corn and I had the brisket and pimento cheese melt and mac n cheese. Kinda made me wanna move to NC. Monica the bartender was awesome. Couldn't be more blown away with the whole experience.
